Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little dog named Max. Max loved to chew on things. He would chew on toys, shoes, and even sticks. One day, Max found a razor in the bathroom. He didn't know what it was, but he thought it looked fun to chew on.Max started to chew on the razor, but it hurt his mouth. He yelped and dropped it on the floor. His owner, a kind little girl named Lily, heard the noise and came running into the bathroom. She saw Max and the razor on the floor, and she knew he had made a mistake.Lily felt sad that Max had hurt himself. Max felt ashamed for chewing on something he shouldn't have. He looked at Lily with his big, sad eyes. Lily hugged Max and told him it was okay. She knew Max didn't mean to do anything wrong. From that day on, Max promised to only chew on his toys, and he never went near the razor again.

Once upon a time, there was a man named Tim. Tim liked to drive his big car. One day, he put on his nice suit and went for a drive.As Tim drove, he saw a small, fragile bird on the side of the road. The bird looked sad. Tim stopped his car and got out. He walked over to the bird and said, "Hello, little bird. Why are you sad?"The bird looked up at Tim and said, "I am lost. Can you help me find my way home?" Tim smiled and said, "Of course, little bird. Hop in my car and we will find your home together."So, the bird got into Tim's car and they drove around, looking for the bird's home. After a while, they found it. The bird was so happy and thanked Tim for his help. Tim waved goodbye to the bird and drove back home, feeling happy that he could help a friend in need.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big red ball that she loved to play with. One day, the big red ball rolled away and got stuck in a tree. Lily was very sad.A kind man named Tom saw Lily and wanted to help. He had a long chain that he thought could get the ball down. He threw the chain up and it pulled the ball out of the tree. The ball fell down and Lily was so happy.Lily received her ball back and was very grateful to Tom. She gave him a big hug to say thank you. Now, Lily and Tom are good friends and they play with the big red ball together.

One day, a little girl named Sue woke up in her room. She saw something funny on the floor. It was a big, red ball. Sue did not know how the ball got there, but she wanted to play with it.Sue kicked the ball and it went out of her room. She followed the ball and saw it roll into the kitchen. But something unexpected happened. The ball turned into a big, red cat! Sue was so surprised that she laughed.The big, red cat was funny and nice. Sue played with the cat all day. They had so much fun together. At night, the cat turned back into a ball. Sue took the ball to her room and went to sleep. She could not wait to wake up and play with her new friend again.

Once upon a time, there was an adorable frog. The frog lived in a swamp. The frog had a job to deliver things to his friends.One day, the frog had to deliver a big box. He did not know what was inside. He hopped and hopped to his friend's house. On the way, the box opened, and out came a big, scary monster!But the monster was not mean. He was nice! The monster and the frog became friends. They went to the swamp together and played. The frog and the monster had fun. They were happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, went for a walk. They saw a big pipe with water coming out. It was a leak! Tim said, "Oh no, we need to stop the leak!"Tim and Spot ran to find help. They saw a big, dangerous lion. The lion roared, "Why are you here?" Tim was scared, but he said, "There is a leak, and we need to stop it. Can you help us?" The lion nodded and followed Tim and Spot.When they got to the leak, the lion used his big paw to stop the water. The leak was fixed! But then, the lion smiled and said, "Thank you for letting me help. I am not dangerous, I just wanted to be friends." Tim and Spot were happy, and they all became good friends.

One day, a curious cat named Lily saw a big box. The box had a pretty wrap on it. Lily wanted to know what was inside the box. She tried to open it, but she could not. She saw a spike near the box. Lily thought the spike could help her open the box.Lily called her friend, a dog named Max. "Max, can you help me open the box?" she asked. Max came and tried to use the spike to open the box. But the spike was stuck! Max and Lily pulled and pulled, but they could not get the spike out.Then, a wise old owl named Oliver saw them. "Why are you fighting with the spike?" he asked. Max and Lily told him about the box. Oliver said, "You do not need the spike. Just use your paws!" Max and Lily tried to open the box with their paws. With a little help from Oliver, they opened the box. Inside, they found a big, soft blanket. They were so happy and shared the blanket with their friends.

Once upon a time there was a small boy named Tom. Tom was feeling very sad, so his mom hugged him and comforted him. Tom soon felt a bit better and began to explore his garden.In the corner of the garden, Tom noticed a very rare flower. It was a beautiful flower and was releasing steam! Tom was so excited to see the steam.Tom watched the steam float up into the sky and as it did, he felt a warm and comforting feeling inside him. It was like the steam was giving him a message!The next day, Tom went back to the garden and the steam was still there and so was the rare flower. Tom realized that when he watches the steam, he feels happy! From then on, every time Tom was feeling sad, he would go to the garden and watch the steam. The steam would comfort him and he would feel happy again.

One day, a boy named Tim saw a big cloud in the sky. He went to his mom and said, "Look, mom! Big cloud!" His mom looked and saw it too. She knew a tornado might come, so she got ready.Tim and his mom went to find a safe place. They looked for an available room in their house. They found a small room with no windows. Tim's mom said, "We will stay here until the tornado goes away."They waited in the small room. Tim played with his toys and his mom read a book. Soon, the tornado was gone. They went outside and saw that everything was okay. Tim's mom said, "Good job, Tim! You helped us stay safe!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pretty blouse with flowers on it. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. The park was big and had many trees.While playing, Lily saw a little bird in a cage. The bird looked sad and wanted to escape. Lily said, "I will help you, little bird!" She opened the cage and the bird flew away. The bird was so happy to be free.The bird said, "Thank you, Lily! You are very kind." Lily smiled and felt happy too. She looked at her blouse and saw that the pocket was empty. She said, "That's okay, I'm glad I could help the bird." And they all played together in the park until it was time to go home.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was a loyal dog who loved to play. He had a favorite toy, a red ball with a top that would spin when Max pushed it.One day, Max and his best friend, a little girl named Lily, went to the park to play. They ran and played with the red ball, and Max would spin the top with his nose. They laughed and had so much fun.As the sun began to settle, Max and Lily knew it was time to go home. Max carried the red ball in his mouth, and Lily held his leash. They walked back home, happy and tired from their day at the park. Max and Lily were best friends, and they knew they would always be loyal to each other.

Once upon a time, in a cheerful little town, there was a girl named Sue. Sue loved to make things with her hands. She would stitch and sew all day long. One day, she decided to make a special gift for her friend Tom.Sue worked very hard to make a beautiful toy for Tom. She stitched and sewed with bright colors. As she worked, she said to herself, "Tom will be so happy when he sees this toy. I can't wait to give it to him!"The next day, Sue met Tom at the park. She hid the toy behind her back and said, "Tom, I have a surprise for you!" Tom was excited and curious. He knew Sue had been working on something special.Sue showed Tom the toy she had made. Tom's eyes lit up, and he said, "Wow, Sue! This is the best gift ever! Thank you so much!" Sue was so happy that she had made her friend smile.From that day on, Sue and Tom played with the toy every day. They had lots of fun together, and their friendship grew stronger. The toy that Sue had made brought them closer, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big ship. The ship had an open door. Inside the ship, there were many animals. They all liked to play and have fun.One day, the animals decided to have a dance party. They invited all their friends to come and dance on the ship. The music was loud and happy. The animals danced and danced. They jumped and clapped their hands.As the sun went down, the animals were tired but happy. They said goodbye to their friends and went to sleep in the open ship. They all had sweet dreams about their fun dance party. The end.

It was a fair sunny day, and three year old Emma was ready for her jog. She tied her sneakers tightly and started running. After going around the block twice, she felt tired and decided to take a quick break. Her friend Tom had arrived at the park and asked her to play tag with him.Emma wanted to join, but she knew she had to stay focused on her jog. She gently said no; she couldn't accept his invitation, but she wanted to. However, Tom kept asking and Emma felt annoyed. She wanted to have some fun, but her jog was important too.Tom kept insisting, so Emma decided to compromise. She said she would play tag with him, but only after she finished jogging. They agreed, and Tom waited. Finally, when Emma was done with her jog, they began playing tag.They had a lot of fun, and they both felt happy afterwards. Emma was glad she accepted Tom's invitation; she was proud that she had been fair with herself and stuck to her goal first.

One day, a clever cat named Kitty went to a lecture. The lecture was about how to fold paper. Kitty sat and listened carefully.Kitty said, "I want to fold paper too!" So, she tried to fold a paper boat. She folded and folded, but it was not easy. Her friend, Doggy, came to help her. Doggy said, "Let me try!" Together, they folded the paper boat.In the end, Kitty and Doggy were very happy with their paper boat. They put it in a small pond and watched it float. Their friends saw the boat and clapped. Kitty and Doggy were proud of their clever work.

Lila and Ben are friends who like to play with blocks. They build towers and houses and cars with the blocks. One day, they decide to make a big tower with all the blocks they have. They work hard and stack the blocks high and wide. They are very proud of their tower."Look at our tower!" Lila says. "It is so big and original. No one has a tower like ours.""Yes, it is amazing!" Ben says. "We are the best builders ever. Do you think we can mail our tower to someone?"Lila thinks for a moment. She likes the idea of sharing their tower with someone else. But she also likes their tower and does not want to lose it."Who do you want to mail it to?" she asks.Ben thinks too. He remembers his grandma, who lives far away and sends him letters and stickers sometimes. He loves his grandma and misses her."Maybe we can mail it to my grandma," he says. "She would like our tower. She likes colorful things and she always says we are creative."Lila nods. She likes Ben's grandma too. She is very nice and tells funny stories. She thinks she would like their tower too."Okay, let's mail it to your grandma," she says. "But how do we do that?"Ben looks around. He sees a big cardboard box in the corner. He has an idea."Maybe we can put our tower in that box," he says. "And then we can write a letter and draw a picture and put them in the box too. And then we can ask mom or dad to take the box to the mail place."Lila likes Ben's idea. She thinks it is clever and kind."Let's do that," she says. "But first, let's take a photo of our tower. So we can remember it and show it to our friends."Ben agrees. He finds his mom's

One day, a small leaf was in a big tree. The leaf was not fit. It was sad because it could not play with the other leaves. The wind came and said, "Do you want to escape and see the world?""Yes, please," said the small leaf. The wind helped the leaf escape from the tree. They went on a fun trip. They saw a big hill, a small dog, and a pretty flower. The small leaf was happy.At the end of the day, the small leaf said, "Thank you, wind, for helping me escape. I learned that even if I am not fit, I can still have fun and see the world." The wind smiled and took the leaf back to the tree. The other leaves saw the small leaf was happy and they all played together. The moral of the story is that everyone is special and can have fun, even if they are not fit.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely fish in a big pond. The fish was sad because he had no friends. One day, he saw a long rod in the water. The rod was alone too, so the fish swam close to it.Then, the fish saw a little boy holding the rod. The boy looked sad and lonely too. The fish wanted to be friends with the boy. So, the fish decided to teach the boy how to play with him. The fish jumped out of the water and the boy laughed.The boy and the fish became friends. They played together every day. The fish was not lonely anymore. But one day, the boy did not come. The fish waited and waited, but the boy never came back. The fish felt lonely again. But then, something unexpected happened. Many new fish friends came to the pond to play with the lonely fish. They all lived happily together, and the lonely fish was not lonely anymore.

Tim and Mia are friends. They like to play outside. Tim has a cool scooter. It is red and shiny. Mia wants to try it."Can I get your scooter, Tim?" Mia asks."OK, but be careful. It is fast and fun," Tim says.Mia gets on the scooter. She pushes with her foot. The scooter goes zoom! Mia feels happy. She likes the wind in her hair."Wow, this is cool!" Mia says.Tim smiles. He is glad Mia likes his scooter. He runs after her."Wait for me, Mia!" Tim says.They play with the scooter until it is time to go home. They share the scooter and take turns. They are good friends. They have fun.

One day, a little girl named Sally went for a walk. She saw an open mailbox on the street. She looked inside and found a small bottle. The bottle had a note that said, "Drink me, and you will shrink."Sally was curious, so she drank from the bottle. She started to feel funny, and then she began to shrink! Soon, she was as small as a bug. Sally said, "Oh no! I'm so tiny! How will I get big again?"Sally remembered that the note said she would shrink, but it didn't say how to get big again. She decided to go back to the open mailbox to see if there was another note. When she got there, she found a new note that said, "Eat the cookie, and you will grow." Sally ate the cookie and started to grow back to her normal size.Sally was so happy to be big again. She learned that it's important to be careful and not to use things she doesn't know about. From that day on, she never touched anything in an open mailbox again.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a notebook. She was very hungry, so she thought maybe the notebook could help her find food. Mia opened the notebook and saw words she did not know. She asked her mom to explain the words."Mom, can you explain these words to me?" Mia said. Her mom looked at the notebook and said, "These words tell us how to make a yummy cake. We can make it together!"But, Mia's brother Max was not happy. He wanted to play with the notebook. Max tried to take the notebook from Mia. "No, Max!" Mia said, "We need it to make a cake!"Mia's mom helped them solve the problem. She said, "Max, you can help us make the cake too! And after we eat, you can play with the notebook." Max agreed, and they all made the cake together. They were not hungry anymore, and Max got to play with the notebook.

Once upon a time, there was a big, blue armchair. The armchair was sad because no one would sit on it. It wanted to make friends and have someone to settle on it. The armchair was in a room with many toys, but the toys never played with it.One day, a little boy came into the room. The armchair was very happy and hoped the boy would sit on it. The boy looked at the armchair and smiled. The armchair thought, "Maybe he will settle on me and we can be friends."But then, the boy saw a ball and started to play with it. He did not sit on the armchair. The armchair was very sad again. It thought, "Why doesn't anyone want to sit on me?" The armchair stayed sad and alone, waiting for someone to be its friend. But no one ever did.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sally. She had a big print of a sweet cake. She wanted to sell the print to buy a real sweet cake for herself. Sally went to the park to find someone to buy her print.At the park, Sally saw a boy named Tom. She asked him, "Do you want to buy my sweet cake print? I want to sell it!" Tom looked at the print and said, "Yes, I will buy it!" Sally was very happy.Sally gave the print to Tom and took the money. She ran to the shop to buy a sweet cake. But when she got there, the shop was closed. Sally was very sad. She could not buy the sweet cake she wanted.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved to play with her toys. One day, Mia saw a light, pretty butterfly in her room. It was on top of her toy box. Mia wanted to catch the butterfly, but she could not reach it."Mom, help me!" Mia said. "I want the butterfly, but I can't reach it." Mom came into the room and saw the butterfly. She gave Mia a wink and said, "Let's think of a way to reach it together."Mom and Mia put a chair near the toy box. Mia stood on the chair and reached up. Now, Mia could reach the butterfly. Mia was so happy, she said, "Thank you, Mom!" They both smiled and played with the butterfly. The butterfly flew around the room, making Mia and Mom laugh.

Once upon a time, there was a lively little boy named Jack.Jack was always eager to explore and one day he followed a number to a mysterious place.It lead him to a meadow full of bright colors and animals. He smiled when he saw them.When he got closer, one of the animals said to him in a sweet voice, "What brings you here to this meadow, Jack?"Jack was surprised to hear the animal today, but he replyed confidently, "This number lead me here!"The animal nodded knowingly and said, "Ah, the number! Follow it, stay lively and look closely. You may find something special".Jack thought this strange but he agreed. As Jack followed the number, he saw more colors and animals. Then, eventually, he came to a sparkly pond. When he looked at it closely, he was amazed to find colorful frogs jumping up and down in the water. Jack's eyes lit up with wonder.He was so happy the number had lead him there!

Once upon a time, there was a big, heavy cat named Max. Max loved to eat. One day, Max smelled something good coming from the oven. Max's mom was baking a cake. Max wanted to eat the cake, but he knew he had to wait.Max tried to be patient, but the cake smelled so good. Max couldn't wait any longer. He jumped up and opened the oven. The cake was still hot, but Max didn't care. He took a big bite. Max's mom saw him eating the cake and was sad.Max felt bad for eating the cake. He said, "I'm sorry, Mom." Max's mom forgave him and said, "It's okay, Max. Just remember to wait next time." Max promised to wait and they both shared the rest of the cake.

Once upon a time, there was a big elephant named Elly. Elly loved to play with her trumpet. She would blow it loud and strong. It made a fun sound that made her friends dance.One day, Elly went to the park to play. She saw a rough tree and decided to rub her back on it. As she was rubbing, her trumpet fell out of her bag. A little mouse saw the trumpet and picked it up. The mouse tried to blow the trumpet, but the sound was too low.Elly heard the sound and went to see who was playing her trumpet. She saw the little mouse and said, "Please, give me back my trumpet!" The mouse looked sad and said, "I just want to play like you." Elly thought for a moment and had an idea. She asked the mouse to repeat what she did.Elly blew her trumpet, and the mouse copied her. They played together, and the sound was perfect. The mouse and Elly became best friends, and they played music every day. And that's how Elly learned that even the smallest friend can make a big sound.

Once upon a time there was a cute, little rabbit named Ralph. He lived all alone in the woods and here he searched for food every day.One day, Ralph heard a strange noise coming from a bush nearby. He peeped in and saw a tiny kitten struggling to get out. "Miaow!" said the kitten. Ralph hopped up to the kitten and said, "Don't worry, I'll help!" He grabbed the kitten's soft paw with his own, and pulled. The rabbit pulled with all his might, struggling to free the kitten.Ralph must have done something right because seconds later the kitten was free. The kitten was so thankful, and she licked Ralph on the chin as a sign of thanks. The rabbit and the kitten shared a few more seconds of joy until the kitten ran away.Ralph looked back one last time at the kitten and smiled. That was one of the best days he had ever had, and the rabbit had a warm, fuzzy feeling inside!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play outside in the snow. He would raise his arms high and let the snowflakes fall on his face. Tim thought the snow was delicious when he tasted it on his tongue.One day, Tim saw a big snow hill. He wanted to climb it, but his friend, Sam, said he was too small. Tim felt sad, but he did not give up. He tried to climb the hill, but he slipped and fell. He tried again, and this time, he made it to the top. Sam was surprised and said sorry to Tim. They played together on the snow hill.The moral of the story is to never give up, even when others say you can't do something. Just like Tim, you can do anything if you try hard enough. And always be kind to your friends, even if they make mistakes.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a brown dog named Buddy. Buddy loved to play with his toys and run around the house. The house had lots of furniture for Buddy to jump on and hide under.One day, Buddy's family had a big party. Lots of people came to the house to watch Buddy perform tricks. Buddy could sit, stay, and roll over. Everyone clapped and cheered when Buddy performed his tricks.After the party, Buddy was tired. He went to his favorite brown chair and lay down. Buddy's family was so proud of him for performing his tricks. They gave him a big hug and a special treat. Buddy fell asleep, happy and loved.

One day, a boy named Tim went to play with his toy train. He liked the train a lot. It was wide and could go very fast. Tim played with the train all day by himself.The next day, Tim saw a girl named Sue. Sue wanted to play with the train too. Tim thought about it and said, "We can share my train and play together." Sue was very happy.Tim and Sue played with the train. But then, something unexpected happened. The train started to move by itself! It went very fast and took Tim and Sue on a fun ride. They laughed and said, "This is the best train ever!"

Once upon a time, there was a quiet fireman named Bob. Bob was very good at his job. He loved to help people and put out fires. One day, Bob was walking to work when he saw a big red balloon."Wow! Look at that big balloon!" said a little girl named Sue. She was standing next to Bob. "I wish I could soar up to the sky like that balloon."Just then, something unexpected happened. A gust of wind blew the balloon right into Bob's hands! Bob looked at Sue and smiled. "Would you like to soar with me?" he asked.Sue nodded her head, and they both held onto the balloon. It lifted them up into the sky, and they soared above the town. Everyone looked up and waved at Bob and Sue. They had a great time flying high and seeing the world from above. When they were done, Bob and Sue landed safely on the ground, and they both knew it was a day they would never forget.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a new veil that her mom gave her. Lily loved her new veil so much. She wore it every day.One day, while playing in the park, Lily met a boy named Tim. Tim saw the new veil and said, "Lily, your veil is pretty!" Lily was happy, but she ignored Tim because she wanted to play alone.Later, Lily saw Tim playing with other kids. She felt sad and wanted to join them. She went to Tim and said, "Can I play with you?" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, Lily! Let's play together!"From that day on, Lily and Tim became good friends. They played together every day. Lily learned that it's important not to ignore others and to share her happiness with friends.The moral of the story is: Don't ignore others; we should be kind and share our happiness with everyone.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot was a very obedient dog. He always did what his owner, a kind man named Tom, told him to do. Tom and Spot loved to play together and go for walks in the park.One day, while they were walking, Spot saw a ball. He recognized the ball as his own, and he ran after it. The ball rolled into the woods, and Spot followed it. Tom called out, "Spot, come back!" But Spot did not hear him.After some time, Spot found the ball and picked it up. He heard Tom calling for him, so he ran back to where Tom was waiting. Tom was happy to see Spot and said, "Good boy, Spot! Thank you for finding your ball and coming back to me." Spot wagged his tail, proud of his work. From that day on, Spot always stayed close to Tom during their walks.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a polite cat named Tim. Tim liked to help everyone. One day, Tim saw a little boy who was lost. Tim wanted to help the boy find his mom.Tim took the boy to the police. The police help people who are lost. The police officer was happy to see Tim and the boy. The officer said, "Thank you, Tim, for bringing the boy to us." Tim felt good for helping the boy.The police officer warned Tim and the boy to be careful when they walk in the town. He told them to hold hands so they don't get lost again. Tim and the boy listened to the officer and walked home safely.

One day, a little insect was in the garden. He liked to listen to the birds sing. The insect had a friend, a bossy ant. The bossy ant always told the insect what to do.One sunny day, the bossy ant told the insect, "You must help me carry food." The insect did not want to help, but he did it anyway. They walked and walked, carrying food together. They were very tired.Then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and took the food away. The bossy ant was sad, but the insect was happy. He said, "Now we can listen to the birds again!" The bossy ant smiled and they both listened to the birds sing. The bossy ant learned to have fun and not be so bossy anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a favorite toy, a rock. She loved to play with her rock. She would throw it, roll it, and even sleep with it.One day, Sue found a big cup in the kitchen. She had an idea. She took her rock and put it in the cup. Sue shook the cup, and the rock made a fun sound. She danced around the room, happy and alert.Sue showed her mom the rock in the cup. Her mom smiled and danced with her. They both had lots of fun with the rock and the cup. Sue knew she would always remember this special day.

Once upon a time, there was a big, wide lake. On one side of the lake lived a family of ducks.They liked to swim in the lake and play in the sunshine. But one day, they noticed something strange. A big, wide skull was floating in the lake. The ducks were scared, so they decided to find out what it was. They asked their friend, the fish, and a wise old frog. What could it be?The fish said it could be the skull of a monster. The wise old frog imagined it was the skull of a witch. The ducks didn't know what to do.So, they asked a brave little bird. She looked at the skull and said it was nothing to worry about. It was just the old skull of a huge, wide turtle.The ducks were relieved. From that day on, they asked the brave bird for help when they didn't know what to do. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little, red bird. The bird lived in a big tree near a house. The house had a bathroom with a big window. The bird liked to look inside the bathroom through the window.One day, the bird saw the water in the bathroom increase. The water was going up and up! The bird knew this was not good. The bird flew to the house to tell the people inside.When the bird got to the door, it saw a big, red button. The bird pushed the button with its beak. Suddenly, the water stopped going up in the bathroom. The bird had saved the day! The people inside the house were so happy and thanked the little, red bird.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a dead bug. She felt sad for the bug. Lily wanted to do something nice for it. She thought, "I will write a poem for the bug!"Lily sat under a tree and started to write her poem. She thought about how the bug would spring and play when it was alive. Lily smiled and finished her poem. She read it out loud, "Little bug, you used to spring, now you rest with a wing. I hope you fly high, up in the sky."Lily's friend, Tim, heard her poem and came over. He said, "That's a nice poem, Lily. I like how you talked about the bug springing and playing." Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, Tim. I wanted to do something nice for the bug." They both looked at the dead bug and felt happy that they could remember it with a beautiful poem.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had an adorable cat named Mittens. They were best friends and played together all the time.One day, Lucy found a dirty rag on the ground. She picked it up and started to play with it. Mittens didn't like the dirty rag and wanted to play with her clean toys. So, Mittens tried to slap the rag out of Lucy's hand. Lucy didn't understand why Mittens didn't want to play with the rag.Lucy's mom saw them playing and came to help. She explained to Lucy that the rag was dirty and not good to play with. She showed Lucy how to clean the rag and make it nice again. Lucy and Mittens learned that it's important to keep things clean and to take care of their toys.

One day, a bossy car named Red was driving down the road. Red liked to go very fast. He used a lot of fuel when he drove. He did not like to share the road with other cars. Red would honk and say, "Get out of my way! I am the fastest car!"One day, Red met a small, slow car named Blue. Blue was very kind and always shared the road. Red was so bossy and said to Blue, "You are too slow! You should not be on the road!" Blue felt sad but did not want to fight with Red. Blue said, "We can both use the road. It is for everyone."As days went by, Red kept using a lot of fuel and driving too fast. One day, Red was going so fast that he could not stop. He crashed into a big wall and destroyed his engine. Blue saw what happened and went to help Red. Blue shared his fuel and helped Red fix his engine.Red learned that being bossy and using too much fuel was not good. He also learned that sharing and being kind was important. From that day on, Red and Blue became good friends and shared the road with everyone. The moral of the story is that it is better to be kind and share than to be bossy and selfish.

Once upon a time, there was a man named Tom. Tom liked to work hard. He had a big yellow helmet. He wore it every day when he went to work. Tom's job was to build tall houses.One sunny day, Tom went to work. He put on his yellow helmet. He saw that his friends were there too. They all had their own helmets. They all worked hard together. They had fun and laughed while they built the tall houses.After a long day, Tom and his friends were tired. They had worked very hard. But they were happy because they had built a beautiful tall house. They took off their helmets and went home to rest. The next day, they would put on their helmets again and work hard to build more tall houses.

One day, a big cat and a little dog went to the store. They wanted to buy a ball to play with. The big cat said, "I will pay for the ball." The little dog was very happy and gave the big cat a wink.They played with the ball in the park. The big cat was very alert. He saw a big tree and said, "Let's throw the ball and see who can catch it first." The little dog was excited and agreed.The big cat threw the ball very high. The little dog ran as fast as he could. He remembered the big cat's wink and was alert. The ball went behind the big tree. The little dog caught the ball and won. The big cat smiled and said, "Good job, little dog! You were very alert and fast!" The little dog was very proud and happy.

One day, a girl named Sue went for a walk. She walked to the west. The sun was warm and the sky was blue. Sue saw a big tree. Under the tree, she found a tidy little house.Sue knocked on the door. A small, friendly mouse opened the door. "Hi! I am Momo the mouse," said the mouse. "Do you want to come in?""Yes, please," said Sue. Inside the house, she saw a small pot on the stove. Momo was stirring the pot. "I am making soup. Do you want some?" asked Momo.Sue said, "Yes, it smells good!" They sat down and ate the soup. Sue helped Momo stir the soup. They had fun and became good friends. Sue and Momo played together until the sun went down. Then, Sue went home and told her mom all about her new friend Momo.

Once upon a time, there was a hungry cat named Max. Max liked to run fast. He had a lot of speed. One day, Max saw a little bird stuck in a tree. The bird was scared.Max said to the bird, "Don't worry, I will save you!" Max climbed the tree very fast. He used his speed to get to the bird quickly.Max helped the bird get out of the tree. The bird said, "Thank you for saving me, Max!" Max was happy he could help. They became good friends and played together all day.

One day, a hungry comet was flying in the sky. It was very big and very bright. It saw a little girl named Lily. Lily was playing in her yard with her toys. She looked up and saw the comet."Hi, comet!" Lily said. "Do you want to play with me?" The comet did not say anything, but it came closer to Lily. Lily was very happy. She thought the comet was her new friend.But the comet was still hungry. It wanted to eat something. It saw Lily's toys and ate them. Lily was sad. "Why did you eat my toys?" she asked the comet. The comet did not say anything. It just flew away, leaving Lily without her toys.

Once upon a time, there were two babies who were very good friends. But one day, they decided to race. They raced faster and faster, but Baby A was much thinner than Baby B, so Baby B won the race. When Baby A saw how thin he was compared to Baby B, he started to feel sad.Just then, an old lady walking by told them a wise story. She said, “All of God’s babies are special and unique. It doesn’t matter if one is thin and one is not, because we are all different. What matters most is having a kind heart.”Baby A smiled and he and Baby B hugged each other. Then, the two babies went off to play, instead of racing. They had learned an important lesson, that it’s better to be kind than it is to win a race.

Once upon a time, there was a bossy lawyer who lived in a small town. He liked to tell everyone what to do. He had a big dog named Spot. Spot was a very good dog, but sometimes he did not listen to the bossy lawyer.One day, the bossy lawyer took Spot to the park. There were many kids playing and having fun. The lawyer wanted Spot to show off a new trick. He told Spot to kneel. But Spot did not want to kneel. He wanted to play with the kids.The kids saw Spot and laughed. They came over to play with him. Spot was so happy. The bossy lawyer was not happy. But then, he saw how much fun Spot and the kids were having. The lawyer decided to be less bossy and join in the fun. They all played together and had a great day at the park.

Once upon a time, in a humble little forest, there lived a squirrel named Sam. Sam loved to find nuts and hide them in his tree. One day, while Sam was out looking for nuts, he met a rabbit named Rosie."Hi, Rosie!" said Sam. "Do you want to help me find nuts?"Rosie smiled and said, "Yes, Sam! I would love to help you!"Sam and Rosie looked under leaves, on top of rocks, and inside small holes. They found lots of nuts! Sam was very happy. He showed Rosie how to fold the leaves around the nuts to keep them safe.Sam and Rosie became very good friends. They played together every day and shared their nuts with each other. And they always remembered to fold the leaves and keep their nuts safe in their humble little homes.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim had a task. His task was to wipe the table after lunch. Tim was a good boy, so he wanted to do his task well. He took a cloth and started to wipe the table. The table was big, but Tim was happy to make it clear and clean.As he wiped, he saw a small box on the table. Tim was curious and opened the box. Inside, he found a magic wand. Tim waved the wand and said, "I wish my task was done." Suddenly, the table was clear and clean. Tim was very surprised.Tim thought about the magic wand and had an idea. He waved the wand again and said, "I wish for a big party with all my friends." Just like that, his friends appeared and they all had a fun party. Tim learned that the magic wand could make his tasks easy, but he also knew that sometimes it was fun to do tasks by himself.

Once upon a time, there was a fearful dog named Spot. Spot had an owner named Tim. Tim and Spot were best friends. They played outside every day.One day, a big cat came to their yard. Spot was scared. He said, "Tim, I am scared of the cat." Tim said, "Don't worry, Spot. I will help you." Tim picked up a stick and waved it at the cat. The cat ran away. Spot was happy.Spot learned to value Tim even more. They were a great team. Spot was not scared anymore because he knew Tim would always help him. They lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a patient cat named Tom. Tom liked to sit by the window and watch the rain. One day, it rained very hard. Tom saw a small ashtray outside the window. The ashtray was getting wet from the rain.Tom wanted to help the ashtray, so he went outside. He tried to move the ashtray to a dry place. But the rain was too strong. Tom and the ashtray got very wet. They started to soak in the rain.Tom tried to be strong, but he could not help the ashtray. The rain did not stop. Tom and the ashtray got very cold and sad. In the end, they could not get dry and warm. The rain did not stop, and Tom and the ashtray stayed wet and sad.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the park. She saw a big tree with pretty leaves. Under the tree, there was a small cat. The cat was sad because it was lost. Amy wanted to help the cat feel better.Amy thought it was not fair for the cat to be lost and sad. So, she decided to help the cat find its home. She picked up the cat and walked around the park. She asked people if they knew the cat. But no one could recognize the cat.Finally, Amy saw a lady looking for something. The lady was the cat's owner! She was very happy to see her cat again. The lady thanked Amy for helping her find her cat. The cat was happy to be back with its owner. Amy felt good for being helpful and making the cat's day fair again.

One day, a boy named Tom and his mom went to a cold museum. They wanted to see big dinosaur bones. Tom was very excited. He held his mom's hand as they walked inside.In the museum, they saw many big bones. Tom's mom said, "Look, Tom! This is where dinosaurs lived a long time ago." Tom looked around and said, "Wow! I like dinosaurs, mom!" They walked and looked at all the bones.Suddenly, a real dinosaur came out from behind a big bone! Everyone was scared, but the dinosaur said, "Don't be scared! I am a nice dinosaur. I just want to settle and live with my bones." Tom and his mom were surprised, but they were happy to meet a real dinosaur.

Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Tim. He lived in a small house with his mom and dad. Tim had a big, gloomy room. He did not like it because it was dark and scary.One day, Tim's mom said, "Do you remember the time we painted the kitchen? We can paint your room too!" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, I remember! Can we paint my room a happy color?" His mom said, "Of course! What color do you want?" Tim thought for a moment and said, "I want my room to be bright yellow!"Tim and his mom went to the store and bought yellow paint. They spent the whole day painting Tim's room. When they were done, Tim's room was not gloomy anymore. It was a bright and happy place. Tim was very happy and said, "Thank you, mom! I love my new room!"

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a toy he loved very much. One day, Tim was playing with his toy near a big glass. He was very happy.Tim's mom saw him and said, "Be careful, Tim! Don't play near the glass." But Tim did not listen. He kept playing and hit the glass. The glass fell and broke. Tim began to panic.Tim felt upset because he did not listen to his mom. He cried and said, "I'm sorry, Mom." But the glass was broken and could not be fixed. Tim learned to listen to his mom from that day on.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with bubbles. One day, she went outside to blow big bubbles with her bubble wand.As Lily played, a tiny bug got trapped in one of her bubbles. The bug was scared and needed help. Lily saw the bug and was very alert. She knew she had to rescue the bug from the bubble.Lily gently popped the bubble with her finger. The bug was free and happy. It flew away, and Lily waved goodbye. She felt proud that she had saved the bug. From that day on, Lily was always alert when playing with bubbles, making sure no more bugs got trapped.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely cricket named Tim. Tim lived in a big green garden. He liked to jump and play all day long. But Tim had no friends to play with, so he felt sad.One sunny day, Tim met a small bug named Sam. Sam said, "Hi, I'm Sam! Do you want to play with me?" Tim was very happy and said, "Yes! I would love to play with you!"Tim and Sam played together every day. They liked to chase each other and hide in the tall grass. But one day, Tim forgot where they were playing. He looked everywhere for Sam, but could not find him. Tim felt very lonely again.Then, he heard Sam's voice, "Tim, I'm here! I was hiding under the big rock!" Tim found Sam and they were both happy. They promised to always play together and never forget their special friendship. And they were never lonely again.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Tom. Tom loved to sleep all day and did not like to play. One day, Tom saw a big red wrap on the floor. The wrap looked very soft and warm. Tom thought it would be nice to sleep on the wrap.The next day, Tom's friend, a dog named Max, came to visit. Max saw the big red wrap and had an idea. Max told Tom that they could use the wrap to put on a show. Tom was not sure, but Max said it would be fun. So, they set up the wrap as a stage for their show.Tom and Max invited all their friends to watch the show. Max danced and Tom sang a funny song. All their friends loved the show and started to applaud. Tom felt very happy and proud. From that day on, Tom was not so lazy anymore. He now loved to play and have fun with Max and his other friends.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a girl named Lily. Lily loved to take photos with her camera. Her camera was very good and always worked well. She called her camera "reliable."One day, Lily saw a beautiful bird in her yard. She wanted to take a photo of the bird with her reliable camera. But she could not find her camera. She asked her mom, "Mom, can you help me find my camera, please?" Mom said, "Of course, I will help you."They started to look for the camera. Lily looked in her room, and Mom looked in the living room. They could not find it. Lily felt sad. Then, her little brother came into the room with the camera in his hand. He said, "Here is your camera, Lily!" Lily was so happy. She thanked her brother and went outside.Lily took a photo of the beautiful bird with her reliable camera. She showed the photo to her family, and they all loved it. From that day on, Lily always knew where her camera was and took many more beautiful photos.

Once upon a time, there was a big blue ball. The big blue ball wanted to play with its friends, the red square and the yellow triangle. They all lived in a toy box in a little girl's room.One day, the big blue ball wanted to go to the park. There was a bridge they had to cross to get to the park. The big blue ball, the red square, and the yellow triangle walked to the bridge. The bridge was made of wood and it was very pretty.When they got to the bridge, they saw that it was split in the middle. They were sad because they could not get to the park. The big blue ball had an idea. It asked the red square and the yellow triangle to help fix the bridge. They all worked together and fixed the bridge. Now they could go to the park and play. They were very happy and had a fun day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a pink cat. The cat liked to change things. One day, the cat went to a museum.In the museum, the cat saw many things. The cat saw a big, old chair. The chair was not pink. The cat thought, "I want to change the chair to pink."The cat went home and got a pink paint. The next day, the cat went back to the museum. The cat changed the chair to pink. Everyone was happy to see the pink chair. The pink cat smiled and went home.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a fancy cat named Lily. Lily loved to play with her soft ball. One day, she saw a big tree with a tip high up in the sky. Lily thought it would be fun to squeeze her ball and try to throw it to the tip of the tree.Lily squeezed her ball and threw it as high as she could. The ball went up and up, but it did not come back down. Lily was sad. She wanted her ball back, but she could not climb the tree. She asked her friend, a big dog named Max, to help her.Max tried to climb the tree, but he was too big. Then, a little bird saw Lily and Max looking sad. The bird asked what was wrong. Lily told the bird about her ball. The bird flew up to the tip of the tree and got the ball for Lily. Lily and Max were so happy!The bird, Max, and Lily became good friends. They played together every day. The moral of the story is: when you need help, sometimes a new friend can be just what you need. And it's always good to help others when they need it, too.

Once upon a time, there was a strong little boy. He was so curious and always asking questions. One day, he saw a big package on the porch. He wondered, what was inside? He wanted to know. So he asked his parents, can I open the package? But his parents said no. The little boy got frustrated. He didn't understand why he couldn't open the package. So he grabbed a chair and climbed up to the package. He pulled and pulled until finally, the package opened. What he found inside was a surprise. It was a big, mean bear! The bear was so mad that the little boy opened the package. The bear roared and slapped him in the face. The little boy was so scared he ran away and never came back. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a mosquito. The mosquito was very bitter. It did not like to play with other bugs. One day, it saw a toy car. The toy car was broken. The mosquito wanted to fix the toy car.The mosquito tried very hard to fix the toy car. It pushed and pulled, but the toy car was still broken. The mosquito asked other bugs for help. But they did not want to help the bitter mosquito. The mosquito was sad.In the end, the mosquito could not fix the toy car. The mosquito stayed bitter and alone. The other bugs did not like the mosquito. The mosquito never learned to be nice. It was a bad ending for the bitter mosquito.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely cat named Inky. Inky was very sad because he had no friends. He would walk around the town and question why he was all alone. He wanted to find a friend to play with.One day, Inky found a bottle of ink. He had an idea. He dipped his paw in the ink and made pretty pictures on the ground. The pictures made Inky feel happy, but he still wanted a friend.A little girl saw Inky's pictures and liked them a lot. She asked Inky if he made them. Inky nodded his head. The little girl smiled and said, "I want to be your friend!" Inky was so happy that he wasn't lonely anymore. They played together every day and made more pretty pictures with the ink.

Once there was a fisherman named Tom. Tom was a silly man. One day, he went to the river to catch fish. He saw a big fish in the water and tried to catch it.Tom said, "Oh, big fish, please come to me!" But the fish did not listen. Tom felt sad and started to tremble. He did not know what to do.Then, a little boy came to Tom. The boy said, "Fisherman, do not be silly. You need to use a net to catch fish." Tom listened to the boy and used a net. He caught many fish and was happy. Tom thanked the boy and they both went home.

One day, a little girl named Lily wanted to bake a cake. She saw her mom bake many times, so she thought she could do it too. Lily went into the kitchen and found a big bowl to mix her cake. But, she didn't know what to put in the bowl. She looked around and saw some soil from a plant. Lily thought, "Maybe I can use that!"Lily put the soil in the bowl and mixed it with water. It looked like the cake mix her mom used. She was so happy! Lily asked her mom, "Can I put this in the oven to bake?"Her mom looked at the bowl and said, "Oh no, Lily, that's not cake mix. That's spoiled soil! It won't make a good cake." Lily felt sad, but her mom smiled and said, "Let's bake a real cake together."Lily and her mom baked a yummy cake with the right ingredients. They had so much fun! From that day on, Lily learned that soil was not for baking, and she always asked her mom for help when she wanted to bake a cake.

One day, a little reindeer named Remy was playing in the soft snow. He liked to jump and run with his friends. They laughed and had fun all day long.Remy saw something in the snow. He did not know what it was. He asked his friends, "Can you guess what this is?" They all looked but they did not know.They dug in the snow and found a big, soft blanket. They were so happy! Now they could be warm and play in the snow all day. Remy and his friends guessed it was a gift from someone who loved them.

Tim and Sue are friends. They like to play with toys and books. One day, they find a big map in the library. The map shows many nations. Nations are places where people live and have different names."Look, this is our nation. It is called Canada. It is big and cold and has many trees," Tim says."And this is my nation. It is called China. It is far and big and has many people," Sue says.They point to other nations and learn their names. They have fun with the map.But then, Tim sees a nation he does not like. It is called France. It is small and has a funny shape. Tim thinks it is silly."I do not like this nation. It is bad and ugly. I will bite it," Tim says.He opens his mouth and tries to bite the map. Sue is shocked and angry."No, Tim, no! You cannot bite the map. That is rude and mean. You will hurt the map and the people in the nation. You have to be nice and respectful," Sue says.She pulls the map away from Tim and scolds him. Tim feels ashamed and sorry. He realizes he was wrong."I am sorry, Sue. I was silly and mean. I will not bite the map again. I will be nice and respectful. I want to learn more about the nations and the people. Can you teach me?" Tim says.Sue smiles and forgives him. She is happy that Tim learned his lesson. She teaches him more about the nations and the people. They share their stories and cultures. They become better friends.The moral of the story is: Do not bite what you do not like. Be nice and respectful to others. Learn from your mistakes and grow.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a kind and compassionate mom. She loved her little boy and girl very much. They were always happy and loved to play together.One day, the mom wanted to make pasta for lunch. She asked the little boy and girl to help her. They were excited and stood next to her in the kitchen. They watched as she put the pasta in a big pot with water. The little boy and girl clapped their hands and laughed.When the pasta was ready, they all sat down to eat. The little boy and girl loved the pasta. They knew their compassionate mom made it with love. They hugged her and said, "Thank you, Mom!" They all felt happy and full.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow duck. The duck lived in a small pond with his friends. They liked to play and swim all day.One day, the duck found a bottle of lotion. He didn't know what it was, but he thought it was special. He showed it to his friends, and they all wanted to try it.The duck and his friends decided to decorate their pond with the lotion. They put it on the rocks and the plants. It made everything look shiny and pretty. They were all very happy with their beautiful pond.

Once upon a time there was a big band. They wanted to play music, so they decided to go for a jog.The drummer ran ahead and shouted back, "Are you all keeping up?"The girl with the tambourine laughed and replied, "I'm trying, but I can't jog as fast as you!"The big band jogged together through the meadow and over the hills, playing music as they went. They ran until they were tired, then stopped to rest beneath a tree. Everyone was panting but they all had huge smiles on their faces. The trumpeter looked around at the band and smiled. "We're so big and so full of happy music," he said.The big band agreed, happy to be together and making music. They laughed, hugged each other and then started jogging home. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a bright sun in the sky. It was a happy day. In the jungle, there was a big leopard. The leopard liked to play with his friends.One day, the leopard saw a little bird. The bird liked to tease the leopard. The bird would fly close to the leopard and then fly away fast. The leopard would try to catch the bird, but the bird was too fast.The leopard and the bird played this game every day. They became good friends. The bright sun would shine down on them as they played. They were very happy in the jungle. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little farm. On this farm, there was a big tree. The tree was not straight. It would lean to one side. Many animals lived on the farm. They all loved the tree.One day, a small bird came to the farm. The bird saw the big tree and wanted to live in it. The bird tried to build a nest in the tree, but it was too tight. The bird was sad and did not know what to do.The other animals saw the bird was sad. They had an idea. They all worked together to help the bird. They pushed the tree and made it straight. Now, the bird could build a nest in the tree. The bird was very happy. The animals on the farm were happy too, because they had a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a nurse named Jane. Jane was very kind and liked to help people. One day, she saw a man with a big truck. The man was trying to load his truck with heavy boxes. Jane decided to help him."Hello, can I help you load the truck?" Jane asked. The man looked at her and said, "Yes, please. Thank you, nurse!" They worked together to load the truck. The man was very happy because Jane was so helpful.As they were loading the truck, they found a disgusting, dirty box. The man wanted to throw it away, but Jane said, "Let's clean it and see what's inside." They cleaned the box and found toys inside. Jane and the man gave the toys to children who didn't have any. The children were very happy.The moral of the story is that sometimes, even when things look disgusting, they can still be useful and make others happy. It's important to help others and work together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boat that wanted to sail. So, it set off on an adventure to find a special place. After a long time, it spotted a volcano. It looked so big! The volcano was very clean and bright.The boat was excited to explore this amazing place. So, it sailed up to the volcano. When it got there, it saw lots of beautiful flowers. They were in all different colors. The boat was so happy!It sailed around the volcano many times. It looked so happy and shiny in the sunshine. Then it sailed away. It had a feeling that it would come back one day. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a funny little dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play all day. He would wag his tail in a fast motion, and his friends would laugh.One day, Spot saw a big red ball. He wanted to play with it, but it was stuck in a tree. Spot tried to jump, but he was too small. So, he asked his friend, the tall giraffe, for help. The giraffe said, "I can help you, Spot. Let's work together!"The giraffe stretched his long neck up high and got the big red ball out of the tree. Spot was so happy! He and the giraffe played with the ball all day, laughing and having fun. Spot's tail wagged in a funny motion as they played. And from that day on, Spot and the giraffe were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim got a new ball. He loved to play with it in his backyard. One day, his friend, Sue, came over to play with him. They were having so much fun with the new ball.Tim threw the ball to Sue and said, "Pass it back to me, please!" Sue passed the ball back to Tim, but it went too far. The ball went over the fence into the neighbor's backyard. Tim and Sue were very sad.Tim's mom saw them and said, "Why don't you go ask the neighbor if you can get the ball back?" Tim and Sue went to the neighbor's house and asked nicely. The neighbor gave them the ball back with a smile. Tim and Sue learned that it is good to ask for help and to always be kind to others.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a doll that she loved very much. Her doll had fair hair, just like Lily. They did everything together.One day, Lily and her doll went to the park. They played on the swings and the slide. Lily was very happy. But she did not know that something was going to happen soon.Later, when it was time to go home, Lily could not find her doll. She looked under the slide and behind the swings. Then, she saw her doll near a big tree. The doll's fair hair was shining in the sun. Lily was so happy to find her doll, and they went home together.

Once upon a time, there was a thin little girl named Daisy. Daisy had a notebook full of secrets that she never shared with anyone. One day she went to the park by herself and she liked to sit by the lake and look into the water. She liked to imagine what the water was hiding under the surface.While Daisy was sitting and looking into the lake, she noticed something sparkling. She went closer and saw that it was a thin notebook at the bottom of the water. She carefully reached in and grabbed it. When she opened the notebook, she was surprised to see that it was filled with secrets!"These must be someone's happy secrets," Daisy thought and smiled.When Daisy got home, she was so excited to share her new secret notebook but when she took it out of her pocket, the notebook suddenly vanished and disappeared! Daisy was so sad, she wanted to know what secrets were in the notebook so badly.She went back to the lake the next day and searched for the notebook but it was nowhere to be found.Just then, a wise old man appeared and he said: "Remember Daisy, true secrets should remain secrets. If you want to keep them safe and happy, don't share them with anyone!"Daisy thought carefully and realised that the notebook had vanished to protect someone's happy secrets. She smiled and vowed to never share the secrets she held inside her own heart. She'd keep them

Lily and Tom were playing in the garden. They liked to dig holes and find bugs and worms. They also liked to eat snacks that Mom gave them. Today, Mom gave them some crackers and cream. Cream was white and soft and yummy."Look, I found a big worm!" Tom said, holding a long, brown thing in his hand."Let me see!" Lily said, running to him. She saw the worm and made a face. "That's not a worm, Tom. That's a snake!""A snake?" Tom said, dropping it. "But it's not scary. It's not moving.""That's because it's dead, Tom. It's rotting. That means it's old and bad and smelly. You don't want to touch it. It can make you sick.""Yuck!" Tom said, wiping his hand on his shirt. "I don't like rotting things. They're gross.""Me neither," Lily said. "Let's go eat our snacks. They're fresh and good and tasty."They ran to the picnic blanket where Mom had left their snacks. They picked up their crackers and cream and took big bites. They smiled and chewed.But they didn't notice that the cream had been in the sun for too long. It had turned sour and lumpy. It was rotting too.Soon, they felt sick in their tummies. They spit out the cream and cried."Mom! Mom!" they called. "The cream is bad! It's rotting!"Mom heard them and came running. She saw the cream and smelled it. She made a face too."Oh, no!" she said. "I'm sorry, kids. I forgot to put the cream in the cooler. It went bad in the heat. You shouldn't eat it. It can make you sick."She hugged them and gave them some water to drink. She threw away the cream and the crackers."Are you okay?" she asked.Lily and Tom nodded. They felt better after drinking the water

One day, a small cat named Tim went for a walk. Tim saw a big cone in the park. He was scared, but he wanted to play with it. He thought it was a new toy.Tim went to his house to get a measure. He wanted to see how big the cone was. He went back to the park and measured the cone. It was very big!A big dog came to the park. The dog saw the cone and wanted to play too. The dog ran fast and jumped on the cone. The cone fell on Tim. Tim was very scared and hurt. The cone was not a fun toy after all.

One day, Tom was playing in the park. He was having lots of fun. Suddenly, he saw something bright in the sky. Tom said, "What is that?"It was a bright port. It was scattering in the sky. Tom was curious and wanted to catch it.He looked up and jumped. He tried to reach the port but it was too high.Tom started to cry. His friend, Joe, came over and tried to comfort him. Joe said, "Don't worry, we can get that port!"Tom and Joe tried to catch the port by jumping and stretching. They even rolled around. Finally, they were able to catch the port and hold it in their hands.Tom was so happy. He thanked Joe for helping him get the bright port. From then on, Tom and Joe were good friends. They would play together all the time and scatter in the park.

Anna liked to play with her toys in her room. She had dolls, cars, books and a clock. The clock was big and round and had two hands that moved. It also made a loud sound when it was time to wake up.One day, Anna was playing with her clock. She wanted to see what would happen if she moved the hands. She turned them to different numbers and watched them spin. She did not know that she was changing the time on the clock.She lay the clock on her bed and went to play with her dolls. She forgot about the clock. She did not hear her mom call her for dinner. She did not hear her dad read her a story. She did not hear her brother say good night.She only heard the clock when it made a very noisy sound. It was very dark and very late. The clock said it was time to wake up, but Anna was very sleepy. She jumped out of her bed and ran to the door. She was scared and confused.She opened the door and saw her mom and dad in the hall. They were surprised and worried. They asked her what was wrong. Anna pointed to the clock and said, "Clock is noisy! Clock is wrong! Clock is bad!"Her mom and dad hugged her and calmed her down. They explained that she had changed the time on the clock and that it was not time to wake up. They took the clock and put it away. They told her to go back to bed and sleep. They said they would fix the clock in the morning.Anna nodded and went back to her bed. She cuddled with her dolls and closed her eyes. She did not want to play with the clock anymore. She wanted to sleep and dream. She hoped the clock would be quiet and right tomorrow.

Lila liked to play with pins. She had a big box of pins in different colors and shapes. She put pins on her clothes, on her dolls, on her books, and on anything she could find. She thought pins made everything look pretty and fun.But Lila was ignorant. She did not know that pins could hurt. She did not know that pins could poke her skin, or make her bleed, or get stuck in her eyes. She did not know that pins could make her sick, or make her friends angry, or make her mom sad.One day, Lila found a new pin. It was shiny and round and had a star on it. She loved it so much that she wanted to put it on her nose. She thought it would make her look like a fairy. She did not listen to her mom, who told her to be careful and not to put pins on her face. She did not listen to her dad, who told her to put the pin away and play with something else. She did not listen to her brother, who told her to stop being silly and ignorant.She put the pin on her nose and smiled. She felt like a fairy. She ran to the mirror to see how she looked. But when she got there, she saw something terrible. The pin had poked her nose and made it bleed. The blood was red and wet and dripped on her shirt. She felt a sharp pain and a big fear. She screamed and cried and wished she had not put the pin on her nose.Her mom and dad and brother heard her scream and ran to her. They saw the pin and the blood and the tears. They felt sorry and angry and scared. They took the pin off her nose and cleaned the wound. They hugged her and kissed her and told her to be brave. They told her to never play with pins again. They told her to l

Once upon a time, there was a yellow bird named Sunny. Sunny lived in a big tree with his family. They loved to fly and play together. One day, Sunny's mom told him to stay close to the tree while she went to find food.Sunny was a good bird and tried to stay close, but he saw a pretty butterfly and wanted to play. He forgot what his mom said and flew far from the tree. Suddenly, he saw a big cat! Sunny was in shock. He was scared and didn't know how to get back home.Sunny closed his eyes and remembered his mom's words to stay close. He tried to find his way back and finally saw the big tree. When he got home, his mom hugged him tight. Sunny learned that it is important to listen and stay close to his family to stay safe.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy rat named Tom. Tom lived in a small hole in a big house. He did not like to play with other rats. He always said, "I want to be alone."One day, a happy rat named Sue came to Tom's hole. Sue said, "Hi, Tom! Do you want to play with me?" Tom was grumpy and said, "No! I want to be alone."Sue was sad, but she had an idea. She found a big, yummy cheese and brought it to Tom. She said, "Look, Tom! I have cheese. Let's share and be friends." Tom saw the cheese and his eyes got big. He smiled and said, "Okay, Sue. I will share the cheese and be your friend."From that day on, Tom was not grumpy anymore. He and Sue played together, shared food, and had fun. They were the best of friends, and everyone was happy. And that is the story of Tom the grumpy rat, who learned to be happy and make friends.

Once upon a time there lived a friendly match. Every day it hang in the sunshine with its friends.One day, the match decided to try exploring. It looked around and saw a tree with lots of different friendly creatures.“Hello!” said the match, “Do you want to be friends?”The friendly creatures smiled and welcomed the match. “We’re all here to have fun,” they said.The match was so excited, it decided to hang from the tree and swing around with the other creatures. Everyone had a great time and soon the match was making lots of new friends.At the end of the day, the match was sad but happy. It had enjoyed its time spent with the friendly creatures and promised to come back soon.

Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play in the park. They see many birds and flowers and trees. They are happy and healthy.One day, they find a big bag of bread. They want to feed the birds. They open the bag and take some bread. They run to the pond where the birds are."Look, Lily, there are ducks and geese and swans!" Tom says."Yes, Tom, they are beautiful and hungry!" Lily says.They throw some bread to the water. The birds come and eat the bread. They make loud noises. Tom and Lily laugh and clap.But then, a big person comes. He is angry and scary. He shouts at Tom and Lily."Hey, you kids, stop that! You are not supposed to feed the birds! You are making a mess and hurting the birds! Go away!"Tom and Lily are scared and sad. They drop the bag of bread and run away. The big person takes the bag and throws it in the trash. The birds scatter and fly away.Tom and Lily hide behind a tree. They hug each other and cry."Why is he so mean?" Tom asks."I don't know, Tom. Maybe he doesn't like birds. Or kids. Or fun." Lily says.They wish they could feed the birds again. They wish the big person would go away. They wish they could be happy and healthy.

Once upon a time, there was a big swan named Sam. Sam was very obedient. He lived in a pond with many friends. Sam had a plan. He wanted to find a new pond to play in with his friends.One day, Sam told his friend, the little duck, about his plan. "I want to find a new pond to play in," said Sam. The little duck was scared. He did not want to leave their pond. But Sam was sure it would be fun.The next day, Sam and his friends went to look for a new pond. They saw a big pond far away. But there was a big dog near the pond! The dog looked mean. Sam's friends were scared, but Sam was brave. He remembered his plan and knew what to do.Sam talked to the dog. "We just want to play in the pond," said Sam. The dog thought for a moment. Then the dog said, "Okay, you can play in the pond. But you must be obedient and not make too much noise."Sam and his friends were so happy! They played in the new pond all day. They were obedient and did not make too much noise. The dog let them stay and play. Sam's plan had worked, and everyone was happy.

Lily and Max were hungry. They wanted to eat dinner. Mom said she was cooking steak for them. Steak was their favorite food. It was big and juicy and yummy."Is it ready yet, Mom?" Lily asked. She was not patient. She wanted to eat now."Not yet, sweetie. It needs a few more minutes. Why don't you and Max play with your toys?" Mom said. She was patient. She wanted to make the steak good.Lily and Max went to their room. They looked for their toys. They had many toys. They had dolls and cars and blocks and books. But they could not find their favorite toy. It was a red ball. They liked to bounce it and throw it and catch it."Where is our ball?" Max asked. He was not patient. He wanted to play now."I don't know. Maybe it is under the bed. Or in the closet. Or behind the sofa. Let's look for it." Lily said. She was not patient. She wanted to play now.They looked for their ball. They looked under the bed. They looked in the closet. They looked behind the sofa. But they could not find their ball. They were sad and mad."Where is our ball?" Lily and Max said together. They were not patient. They wanted to play now."Guess what, kids? Dinner is ready. Come and get your steak." Mom said. She was patient. She wanted to feed them.Lily and Max ran to the kitchen. They smelled the steak. It smelled big and juicy and yummy. They forgot about their ball. They wanted to eat now."Yay, steak!" Lily and Max said together. They were not patient. They wanted to eat now.They ate their steak. They ate it fast. They ate it all. They were happy and full."Did you like your steak, kids?" Mom asked. She was patient. She

One day, a little bunny named Sam went for a walk. It was a nice spring day. The sun was out, and the flowers were pretty. Sam saw a fancy hat on the ground. He thought it would be fun to wear the hat.Sam put the hat on his head and hopped along. He met a bird named Sue. Sue said, "Wow, Sam! You look fancy in that hat!" Sam was happy and thanked Sue. They played together for a while.As they played, a big wind came and blew the fancy hat off Sam's head. The hat flew up into a tree. Sam and Sue were sad. But then, a kind squirrel came and helped them get the hat back. They all became friends and played together on that nice spring day.

One day, a little dog named Buddy was walking down the street. He saw a big truck that was filthy. Buddy did not recognize the truck. He went closer to see what it was.Buddy saw a man near the truck. The man was doing a job. He was picking up trash and putting it in the truck. Buddy said, "Hi! What are you doing?" The man smiled and said, "Hi, Buddy! I am doing my job. I pick up the trash and put it in my truck."Buddy liked the man and his job. He wanted to help. Buddy picked up a small piece of trash and gave it to the man. The man laughed and said, "Thank you, Buddy! You are a good helper." Buddy felt happy and proud. He had a fun day helping the man with his job.

Sara and Tom were twins. They liked to play in the park with their mom. One day, mom said, "I have a surprise for you. I will show you something very pretty and fun."The twins were excited. They followed mom to a big fountain. The fountain had water that went up and down, and made a nice sound. Sara and Tom clapped their hands and laughed."Can we go closer, mom?" Sara asked."Sure, but be careful. Don't get wet," mom said.Sara and Tom ran to the fountain. They saw many colors in the water. They were like rainbows. The twins tried to touch them, but they were too fast."Look, mom, look!" Tom shouted. "The colors are so pretty!"Mom smiled and took a picture of them. She was happy to see them enjoy the fountain.But then, the sky became dark. The sun went away. The wind blew hard. The fountain stopped. The colors were gone.Sara and Tom were scared. They ran back to mom. They hugged her tight."What happened, mom?" Sara asked."It's okay, sweeties. It's just a storm. It will go away soon. Let's go home and have some hot chocolate," mom said.She took their hands and walked to the car. She hoped the storm would not be too bad. She was glad she showed them the fountain before it was dark.

Once upon a time, there was a small bird named Billy. Billy lived in a big tree with many branches. One day, it rained a lot, and the tree became very wet.Billy wanted to rise up and fly to the top branch of the tree. He flapped his wings and rose higher and higher. He saw his friends playing on the wet branches too.At the top branch, Billy looked down and saw the wet ground below. He was so happy that he could rise and play with his friends on the wet tree branches. They all had a fun day together.

Lily liked to play in the garden with her friends. They liked to look at the flowers and smell them. Lily liked the yellow ones best. They were bright and happy.One day, a big boy came to the garden. He was mean and rude. He said the flowers were his and he wanted them all. He started to pull them out of the ground. He wanted to steal them.Lily and her friends were scared and sad. They did not want the big boy to take their flowers. They liked the flowers in the garden. They tried to stop him, but he pushed them away.Then, an elderly lady came to the garden. She lived in the house next to the garden. She saw the big boy stealing the flowers. She was angry and brave. She walked up to him and said, "Stop that! Those are not your flowers. They are for everyone to enjoy. You are being very naughty and selfish."The big boy was surprised and scared. He saw the elderly lady had a big stick in her hand. He thought she might hit him with it. He dropped the flowers and ran away.Lily and her friends were happy and grateful. They thanked the elderly lady for saving their flowers. They helped her put them back in the ground. They gave her a hug and a smile.The elderly lady smiled back. She said, "You are very welcome, my dears. I like the flowers too. They make me happy. Especially the yellow ones. They remind me of the sun."She pointed to a yellow flower that had a round and shiny center. She said, "Do you know what this is called? It is a bulb. It has a seed inside that can grow into a new flower. Maybe you can plant some in your own garden and watch them grow."Lily and her friends liked that idea. T

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls. One day, she found a beautiful veil in her mom's room. She wanted to use it for her doll's wedding.Lily asked her mom if she could deliver the veil to her doll. Her mom said, "This veil is very special, but I have a fake one you can use." Lily was happy and took the fake veil to play with her doll.Lily's doll had a beautiful wedding with the fake veil. Lily learned that it's okay to use fake things for playtime. She also learned to ask before taking something. This made her mom very happy, and Lily felt good too.

One day, a little boy named Tim went on a trip with his mom and dad. They went to a big park with lots of trees and a mysterious, big lake. Tim loved to play near the water, but his mom always warned him to be careful.While playing near the lake, Tim saw a small, green frog. The frog said, "Hello, Tim! I have a secret to tell you." Tim was very surprised that the frog could talk. He sat down and listened to the frog's secret.The frog told Tim about a hidden treasure under the big tree near the lake. Tim ran to the tree and started to dig. After a while, he found a box. Inside the box, there were lots of toys and candy! Tim was so happy and shared the treasure with his new frog friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little baby named Sam. Sam had a crib where he slept every night. The crib was in Sam's room, close to his mommy and daddy's room.One day, Sam found a hidden toy under his crib. It was a small, green ball. Sam was very happy to find this toy. He picked it up and started to play with it.Sam liked to chew on things, like many babies do. So, he put the green ball in his mouth and chewed on it. It felt good on his teeth. Sam played with the ball all day long. When it was time for bed, Sam put the ball next to his crib. He couldn't wait to play with it again the next day.

Once upon a time, there was an ordinary boy. He was very happy and loved to applaud. Every day, he would find something to cheer and clap his hands.One day, he was playing near a sink. Suddenly, the sink started to sing a beautiful tune. The boy was amazed.He applauded with joy and clapped his hands. He laughed and smiled.
