Tim saw the fireworks and wanted to take a closer look.Tim picked up a firework and accidentally lit it. It shot up into the sky and made a big boom! Everyone was scared, but Tim was safe. His dad came running and said, "Tim, you need to be careful with fireworks!" Tim learned his lesson and promised to be more careful next time. He returned the firework to the man and enjoyed the rest of the show with his dad.

Once upon a time, there was a big, expensive store. In the store, there was a long pole. The pole was very tall and shiny. Many people came to see the pole and the store.One day, a little boy named Timmy came to the store with his mom. Timmy saw the pole and wanted to touch it. He asked his mom, "Can I touch the pole, please?" His mom said, "Yes, but be careful."Timmy touched the pole and it started to move! It made a loud noise. Everyone in the store looked at Timmy and the moving pole. Timmy's mom said, "Oh no, we need to shut the store!" She ran to the door and shut it.The people in the store helped Timmy's mom to stop the pole from moving. They all laughed and clapped when the pole stopped. Timmy's mom opened the door again and said, "Thank you, everyone!" Timmy and his mom went home, and the store was open again.

Once upon a time, there was a little baby named Tim. Tim was very persistent. He did not like to sleep in his crib. Every night, Tim would cry and cry. He wanted to sleep with Mom and Dad.One day, Mom and Dad had an idea. They said, "Let's play a game, Tim! If you sleep in your crib all night, you will win a big toy!" Tim liked toys. He thought, "I will try to sleep in my crib tonight."That night, Tim went to his crib. He closed his eyes and tried to sleep. It was hard, but he was persistent. He did not cry. In the morning, Mom and Dad were happy. They said, "You win, Tim! You slept in your crib all night!" They gave Tim a big toy. Tim was happy. From then on, he slept in his crib every night.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Amy. Amy was a regular girl who loved to play with her toys. One day, while playing with her toy animals, she decided they should have a big party.Amy said, "Let's have a party for Mr. Cow and Mrs. Horse. They will marry today!" All the toy animals were very happy. They put on their best clothes and got ready for the big day.At the party, Mr. Cow and Mrs. Horse stood together. Amy said, "Do you, Mr. Cow, want to marry Mrs. Horse?" Mr. Cow said, "Yes, I do!" Then Amy asked Mrs. Horse, "Do you want to marry Mr. Cow?" Mrs. Horse said, "Yes, I do!"After the marry, all the animals sat down to eat. They had a big, yummy steak for dinner. Everyone was very happy, and they all danced and played together. And they lived happily ever after.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the snow. They make a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They give him a carrot nose and two buttons for eyes."Hello, Mr. Snowman!" Lily says. "We are happy to meet you.""Yes, we are!" Ben says. "You are our new friend."But then the sun comes out. It is very bright and warm. The snow starts to melt. Lily and Ben see that Mr. Snowman is getting smaller and smaller."Oh no!" Lily cries. "Mr. Snowman is going away!""Stop, sun, stop!" Ben shouts. "You are hurting Mr. Snowman!"They run to Mr. Snowman and try to hug him. But he is too wet and cold. They feel sad."Mr. Snowman, we love you!" Lily says. "Please don't leave us!"But Mr. Snowman cannot talk. He only smiles with his carrot nose. He wants to teach Lily and Ben something."Look, Lily, look, Ben," he says in his head. "I am not going away. I am changing. I am becoming water. Water is good. Water helps plants grow. Water makes rainbows. Water can be ice again. Maybe we can meet again. Don't be sad. Be happy."Lily and Ben do not hear Mr. Snowman. But they feel something in their hearts. They feel a warm and happy feeling. They look at each other and smile."Maybe Mr. Snowman is right," Lily says. "Maybe he is not gone. Maybe he is just different.""Yes, maybe he is," Ben says. "And maybe we can make him again. When it snows again."They hold hands and walk away. They say goodbye to Mr. Snowman. They hope to see him again. They are happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a group of people doing yoga on the grass. Tim asked his mom, "What are they doing?" His mom said, "They are doing yoga. It's a way to stretch and feel good."Tim wanted to try too. But there was a big, disgusting bug on the grass. Tim did not like bugs. He tried to resist looking at the bug, but he just couldn't. He said, "Mom, I want to do yoga, but the bug is yucky."His mom smiled and said, "It's okay, Tim. We can do yoga at home, away from the bugs." So they went home and did yoga together. Tim was happy, and he didn't have to worry about the disgusting bug anymore.

Tom loves jets. He has a toy jet that he plays with every day. He makes it fly in the air and zoom around the room. He pretends he is the pilot and goes on adventures.One day, Tom's mom says they are going to the airport. Tom is very excited. He wants to see the real jets and hear them roar. He puts on his jacket and hat and grabs his toy jet. He is ready to go.At the airport, Tom sees many jets. They are big and shiny and have wings and wheels. He watches them take off and land. He hears them make loud noises. He thinks they are perfect.Tom's mom says they have to wait for their jet. She gives him a snack and a juice. Tom is hungry. He eats his snack and drinks his juice. He also feeds his toy jet. He says his jet is hungry too. He shares his snack and juice with his toy jet. He thinks his jet is happy.Tom's mom says their jet is here. She takes him to the gate. They board the jet and find their seats. Tom sits by the window. He holds his toy jet in his lap. He looks out the window and sees the other jets. He waves to them. He thinks they are his friends.Tom's mom says they are going to fly soon. She buckles his seat belt and tells him to be safe. Tom buckles his toy jet's seat belt too. He tells his jet to be safe. He thinks his jet is brave.The jet starts to move. It goes faster and faster. Then it lifts off the ground. Tom feels a thrill. He sees the sky and the clouds. He thinks they are beautiful.Tom smiles. He hugs his toy jet. He thinks he is lucky. He thinks he is having the perfect day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat broccoli. One day, she saw a perfect, big broccoli in her garden. It was green and tall. Lily was so happy.Lily ran to her mom and said, "Mom, look! I found a perfect broccoli in our garden!" Her mom smiled and said, "That's great, Lily! Let's cook it for dinner tonight."At dinner time, Lily and her mom were ready to eat the broccoli. But when they tried to cut it, the broccoli leaned to one side. They tried to cut it again, but it leaned to the other side. Lily and her mom were surprised.Then, the broccoli said, "Please don't eat me! I am a magic broccoli!" Lily and her mom couldn't believe it. They decided not to eat the broccoli.From that day on, Lily and the magic broccoli became best friends. They played together every day, and the magic broccoli made sure that Lily always had fun.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely boy named Tim. He wanted to play a sport and make friends. Tim tried to play soccer, but he did not succeed. He felt sad.One day, Tim saw kids playing basketball. He wanted to try this sport too. So, he practiced and practiced. But he did not succeed again. Tim felt even more lonely and sad.Then, Tim tried to play baseball. He thought this sport would be easy. But he did not succeed in this sport either. Tim stayed lonely and sad. He never found a sport he could play well.

Once upon a time, there was a cheerful kitten named Kitty. Kitty liked to play outside in the sun. One day, it started to rain. Kitty did not like the rain.Kitty ran to her friend, the big tree. "Please cover me, tree," Kitty said. The tree heard Kitty and spread its branches to cover her. Now, Kitty was safe and dry under the tree.Soon, the rain stopped, and the sun came out again. Kitty and the tree were very happy. They played together all day long, and Kitty stayed cheerful and dry.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She liked to skip and play with her friends. One day, she found a bow on the ground. It was a pretty bow with many colors. Lily thought it was original and special.Lily put the bow in her hair and went to show her friends. They all liked the bow and wanted one too. They played and skipped all day. But then, something unexpected happened.As they skipped, the bow in Lily's hair began to grow bigger and bigger. It became so big that it turned into a big rainbow! Lily and her friends were so surprised. Now, they could all play and skip under the rainbow together.

Once upon a time, there was a little white cat named Fluffy. Fluffy had delicate fur that was soft and smooth. Fluffy liked to play and learn new things every day.One day, Fluffy wanted to learn how to catch a ball. Fluffy's friend, a big brown dog named Buddy, was very good at catching balls. Buddy showed Fluffy how to jump and catch the ball in the air.Fluffy tried to jump and catch the ball, but it was hard at first. Fluffy did not give up. Fluffy practiced and practiced. Soon, Fluffy learned how to catch the ball just like Buddy. They played and had fun together all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear named Ben. Ben had an enormous toy box. He had so many toys that he did not use all of them. Ben was happy, but he knew that other animals did not have toys like him.One day, Ben saw a little bird named Tim. Tim was sad because he did not have any toys to play with. Ben thought for a moment. He knew it was time to do something good. Ben decided to give some of his toys to Tim. Tim was so happy that he could finally play and have fun.Ben saw how happy Tim was and realized that sharing his toys was a good thing to do. From that time on, Ben shared his toys with all his friends. They all played together and had lots of fun. The moral of the story is that sharing with others makes everyone happy.

Once there was a greedy man who was very ignorant. He wanted more than he had. One day, the man found a magical box in the dust. Inside the box, there was a giant pile of golden coins. Greedy and ignorant, the man took the coins and ran away.The man didn't realize, however, that the coins were cursed. Every day, the coins would rot and disappear. No matter what the man did, the coins kept rotting away.Soon, the man was left with nothing but dust. No matter how much he looked, the coins were gone forever. The greedy and ignorant man had used up all his riches. All that remained was the dust.

One day, a thin man went to a barber. The barber was very nice. The thin man wanted a haircut. The barber used scissors to cut the thin man's hair.The thin man saw a big cake on the table. He had an urge to eat the cake. The barber said, "No, don't eat that cake. It is not good for you." But the thin man did not listen.The thin man ate the cake very fast. He started to feel sick. The barber was sad. The thin man had a bad day because he did not listen to the barber.

Tom is a restless boy. He likes to run and jump and play. He does not like to sit still and listen. One day, he goes to the farm with his mom and dad. He sees many animals there. He sees cows and pigs and chickens and horses.He runs to the horses and wants to touch them. His mom says, "Be careful, Tom. Horses are big and strong. You have to be gentle and quiet with them." Tom nods, but he does not listen. He tries to pull the horse's tail and mane. The horse does not like that. It neighs and kicks and shakes its head.Tom gets scared and runs away. He sees a goat with a big horn. He thinks the horn is funny and shiny. He wants to touch it. He runs to the goat and reaches for its horn. The goat does not like that. It bleats and butts and lowers its head.Tom gets scared and runs away. He sees a duck with a big beak. He thinks the beak is cute and yellow. He wants to touch it. He runs to the duck and grabs its beak. The duck does not like that. It quacks and bites and flaps its wings.Tom gets scared and runs away. He cries and looks for his mom and dad. He sees them by the fence. They are talking to a farmer. The farmer has a dog with him. The dog is brown and furry. It has a long tongue and a wagging tail. It sees Tom and runs to him. It licks his face and wags its tail. It offers him a ball to play with.Tom stops crying and smiles. He likes the dog. He takes the ball and throws it. The dog runs after it and brings it back. They play together for a long time. Tom is happy and calm. He forgets about the horses and the goat and the duck. He listens to his mom and dad and the farmer. He learns a

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to ride his red bike. Every day, he would ride up and down the street. He would laugh and smile as he rode.One day, Tim saw an old man sitting on a bench. The old man looked sad. Tim wanted to help. He walked up to the old man and said, "Do you want to learn to ride a bike?" The old man smiled and said, "Yes, please teach me."Tim helped the old man get on the bike. They started to ride together. The old man was happy. Tim felt good that he could teach the old man to ride. They became good friends and rode bikes together every day.

Tom and Sam were best friends. They liked to play in the park and look for treasure. One day, they found a big box under a tree. It was shiny and had a lock on it."Wow, maybe this is treasure!" Tom said. "Let's open it and see what's inside."Sam nodded. He saw a rock nearby and picked it up. He wanted to smash the lock with the rock. But Tom stopped him."Wait, Sam. Maybe this is not our box. Maybe someone else left it here. Maybe they will be sad if we break it. We should be kind and leave it alone."Sam did not listen. He was too curious and excited. He said, "No, Tom. This is our box. We found it first. I want to see the treasure. Move away or I will hit you with the rock."Tom was scared and sad. He did not want to fight with Sam. He did not want to hurt him or the box. He tried to talk to Sam, but Sam did not listen. He raised the rock and swung it at the lock.But he missed. The rock hit the box and made a loud noise. The noise was like a beep. The box was not a box. It was a bomb. It was a bad bomb that someone left in the park. The bomb was ready to explode.Tom and Sam did not know. They did not have time to run or hide. They did not have time to say sorry or hug. The bomb went off and made a big boom. The boom was very loud and very hot. It hurt Tom and Sam and the tree and the park. It was a very bad ending.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his red ball. One day, he threw the ball very far, and it went into the woods.Tim went into the woods to find his ball. He saw a small, spicy pepper on the ground. Tim picked up the pepper and put it in his pocket. He kept looking for his ball. Soon, he found a piece of paper with a map on it. The map showed where his ball was.Tim followed the map and found his ball under a big tree. He was so happy to have his ball back. Tim returned home with his ball, the spicy pepper, and the piece of paper. He showed his mom and dad, and they were very proud of him.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went for a walk. She saw a big hill and wanted to climb it. The hill was dry and had no grass. Lucy started to walk up the hill.As she went up, she saw a small bug. The bug was in a panic. It was lost and could not find its home. Lucy wanted to help the bug. She picked it up and looked around.She saw a green tree near the hill. Lucy thought the bug might live there. She took the bug to the tree and it was happy. The bug found its home and Lucy felt good. She went back down the hill and went home.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big sack. He liked to put things in his sack and carry it around. One day, he found a broken toy car. He put the toy car in his sack.Tim walked to his friend, Sue's house. Sue had a big wrap. She liked to put things in her wrap and tie it up. Tim showed Sue the broken toy car in his sack. Sue wanted to help fix the car.Sue found some tape. She put the tape on the broken toy car. Now, the toy car was not broken anymore! Tim and Sue played with the toy car all day. They put the toy car in the sack and the wrap, and they had so much fun.

Once, there was a boy named Tim. He had a big ball. He loved to play with it. One day, he went to the park with his mom. Tim saw a big hill. He wanted to roll the ball down the hill. Tim tried and tried, but he could not do it. Then, he thought hard and managed to push the ball up the hill.At the top of the hill, Tim saw a girl named Sue. She was sad. She lost her toy. Tim wanted to help. He looked around and saw a pass. He thought the toy might be there. Tim and Sue walked through the pass, holding hands. They looked for the toy.At last, they found the toy. It was on a high rock. Sue was very happy. She said, "Thank you, Tim!" Tim felt good. He helped his new friend. They played with the ball and the toy. Tim's mom saw them and smiled. She knew Tim was a good boy. She gave Tim an expensive treat for being kind. Tim and Sue enjoyed the treat and played together all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Kate. Everyday she went to the pool to swim. This day, when she arrived at the pool, she jumped in the water but it was too deep! She started to get scared and tried to find a way to escape."Help! I'm stuck," she yelled for help.Suddenly, a big fish swam next to her. He said in a soft voice, "Hey little one. Don't be scared, I'll help you. Just stay calm and I'll take you back to the surface." Kate was relieved and nodded nervously. The fish took hold of Kate's hand and they swam away. In no time they reached the surface, and Kate was saved!Kate thanked the fish for helping her and smiled. The fish said goodbye and swam off into the blue. From that day on, Kate was never as scared of the pool again.

Once upon a time, there was a big octopus. He was very foolish. He lived in the deep blue sea. One day, he saw a shiny rock. He wanted to step on it."Be careful!" said a small fish. "It's not a rock. It's a big whale!" But the foolish octopus did not listen. He wanted to step on the shiny rock.The octopus took a big step on the shiny rock. Suddenly, the rock moved! It was a big whale. The whale opened its mouth and said, "Why did you step on me?"The octopus was scared. He said, "I'm sorry, I thought you were a rock." The whale laughed and said, "It's okay, but be careful next time." The octopus learned his lesson and became friends with the whale.

Once upon a time there was a little boy who wanted to go for a ride on a bike. He put the bike in his garden, and he could not wait to hop onto it and go for a ride.The little boy wanted to make sure that the bike was safe. He looked at the bike and saw that there was a lock on it. He tried to figure out how to unlock it but it was too hard.Just then, his dad walked into the garden. The little boy asked his dad: "Dad, how can I unlock this bike?"His dad smiled and said: "It's easy. All you need to do is turn this gear right here and it will unlock the bike."The little boy was so excited to go for a ride that he quickly turned the gear. He was so happy to finally be able to go on a bike ride that he was not even sleepy. He jumped on the bike and rode around the garden, with a big smile on his face.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy iron. He loved to play with his iron all day long. He would pretend to iron his clothes just like his mom.One day, Tim saw a door that was open. He thought it was a little crazy to leave a door open. He wanted to be helpful and shut the door. So, Tim went to the door and tried to shut it.But the door was too big for Tim. He tried and tried, but he could not shut the door. Then, his mom saw him and helped him. Together, they shut the door. Tim was so happy that he could help his mom. He went back to play with his toy iron and smiled all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a broken toy. She wanted to fix it but she did not know how. Sue was sad.One day, Sue found a map in her room. The map showed her where to find a magic man who could fix her broken toy. Sue was happy and wanted to go find the magic man. She put on her shoes and went outside.Sue followed the map until she found the magic man. The magic man fixed her broken toy with a wave of his hand. Sue was very happy. She thanked the magic man and went back home. Now, Sue could own her new fixed toy and play with it all day.

Once upon a time, in a peaceful town, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her friends, but sometimes she would tease them. One day, her mom gave her a pretty ornament to hang on their tree.Lily wanted to show her friends the ornament. She took it outside and started teasing her friends. She said, "Look at my pretty ornament! You don't have one!" Her friends felt sad and went away.Suddenly, a bird flew by and took the ornament from Lily's hand. Lily was sad and cried. She learned that teasing others was not nice. She said sorry to her friends and they all played together. The bird brought back the ornament and Lily shared it with her friends. From that day on, Lily never teased her friends again.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow bicycle. It was a very special bicycle, because it could fly. The bicycle had a friend, a little girl named Lily. Lily loved her yellow bicycle very much.One day, Lily and the yellow bicycle decided to fly in the sky. They flew up, up, up, and saw the big, blue sky all around them. They saw birds, and the birds said "Hello!" to Lily and the yellow bicycle. Lily and the bicycle were very happy.After flying for a while, Lily and the yellow bicycle came back down to the ground. They were tired but had so much fun. They played with their friends and told them all about their adventure in the sky. Everyone wanted to fly on the yellow bicycle, and they all had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a cat named Sam. Sam liked to serve food to his friends. One day, Sam had a big party at his house. He invited all his friends. Sam was very happy.But, there was a hidden trouble. A big dog named Max came to the party too. Max was not invited. Max wanted to eat all the food. Sam's friends were scared of Max. They did not know what to do.Then, something unexpected happened. Max did not eat the food. Max wanted to help Sam serve the food to his friends. Max was a good dog. Sam and Max became friends. They all had a fun party.

Once upon a time, there was a huge zebra. He lived in a big forest with many friends. They liked to play and have fun together. One day, the zebra wanted to act in a play with his friends.The zebra and his friends made a stage with trees and rocks. They all dressed up and began to act. The zebra was very good at acting. His friends were happy and clapped their hands. They all had a big smile on their faces.Then, something unexpected happened. A little mouse came to the stage and started to act too. The mouse was very good at acting, even better than the huge zebra. The zebra was surprised and did not know what to do. But then, the zebra and the mouse became friends and acted together. They made everyone laugh and have fun. The huge zebra learned that even a small mouse can be a big star.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big storm coming. The storm was called a hurricane. Everyone was scared. They knew they had to get ready for the hurricane. They put up strong walls to keep their houses safe.One day, before the hurricane came, a little boy named Tim found a magic spray bottle. The spray bottle was very impressive. It had bright colors and shiny stars on it. Tim did not know what the spray bottle could do, but he kept it with him.The hurricane came to the town. It was very strong and loud. The wind blew and the rain fell hard. Tim was scared too. Then, he remembered the magic spray bottle. He took it out and sprayed the air. The hurricane stopped. The town was safe again. Everyone was so happy and thanked Tim for saving them.

Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play with dolls and cars. One day, Sara has a big idea. She wants to have a tea party with Ben and their toys.She makes invitations for Ben and her dolls. She writes their names and draws a cup and a cake. She puts the invitations in envelopes and gives them to Ben and her dolls. She says, "You are invited to my tea party. Come to my house at three o'clock."Ben is happy. He likes tea and cake. He says, "Thank you, Sara. I will come to your tea party. Can I bring my cars?"Sara says, "Yes, you can. We can share our toys."Sara and Ben go to their homes and get ready for the tea party. Sara puts on a pretty dress and a hat. She sets the table with plates, cups, spoons and napkins. She displays her cakes and cookies on a tray. She puts her dolls on chairs and gives them hats and cups.Ben puts on a shirt and a tie. He brings his cars and a teddy bear. He knocks on Sara's door at three o'clock. Sara opens the door and says, "Welcome, Ben. Come in. The tea party is ready."Ben and Sara have a lot of fun at the tea party. They eat cake and cookies and drink tea. They talk to their dolls and cars and teddy bear. They laugh and play and say, "Cheers!"

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a strong boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat soup. Every day, his mom made him a big bowl of soup for lunch.One day, while eating his soup, Tim heard a shout from outside. He ran out to see what was happening. There, he saw a little bird with a hurt wing. "Help me," cried the bird. Tim wanted to help the bird, so he picked it up gently and took it inside.Tim's mom saw the bird and said, "Oh no! Let's make the bird some soup to help it feel better." They made a little bowl of soup for the bird. The bird ate the soup and, to their surprise, it started to grow! It grew so big that it filled the whole room."Thank you for the soup," said the big bird. "Now I can fly high and strong again!" The bird flew away, and Tim and his mom waved goodbye. They were happy they could help the bird, and they knew that soup had a special magic to make things strong.

One day, a boy named Tim found a zip. He did not know what it was for, but he liked it. He said, "This zip is mine." He put the zip in his pocket and went to play outside.In the park, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue saw the zip and wanted it. "Can I have the zip?" she asked. Tim said, "No, it is mine." Sue was sad, but she had an idea. She showed Tim her toy car. "If you give me the zip, I will give you my toy car," she said. Tim thought about it and said, "Okay."Tim and Sue traded. Tim got the toy car and Sue got the zip. But the car was dirty. Tim did not like the dirty car. He wanted his zip back. He asked Sue, "Can I have my zip back?" Sue said, "No, the zip is mine now."Tim was very sad. He went home with the dirty car. He lost his zip and had a bad day. The next time, Tim will think more before trading his things.

Once upon a time, in a big garden, there was a hungry little bee. The bee saw a big sunflower and went to it. The sunflower smiled at the bee and said, "Hello, little bee! Are you hungry?"The bee said, "Yes, I am very hungry. Can I eat from you?" The sunflower agreed and let the bee eat from it. The bee was happy and ate a lot. But the bee was not nice. It ate too much and did not stop. The sunflower became sad and weak.One day, a big wind appeared. The sunflower was too weak to stand. It fell down and could not get up. The bee was sad because it had no more food. The sunflower and the bee were both sad.The moral of the story is to not be greedy and to always be kind to others.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a toy magnet that he loved to play with. One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came over to play. Sam saw Tim's magnet and felt jealous. He wanted a magnet too."Tim, where did you get your magnet?" Sam asked. "I want one too!" Tim told Sam that his dad had delivered the magnet as a gift. Sam asked his mom if she could deliver a magnet for him too. His mom said she would try.The next day, Sam's mom delivered a big box to him. Sam was so excited! He thought it was the magnet he asked for. But when he opened the box, he found a big, bouncy ball instead. Sam was surprised but happy. He and Tim played with the ball and the magnet together, and they were both very happy.

Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They saw a big pipe that came out of the wall. They wondered what was inside the pipe."Let's look inside the pipe," Ben said. He climbed on a chair and put his eye near the hole."Be careful, Ben," Lily said. "Maybe there is something bad in there."Ben did not listen. He wanted to see what was inside the pipe. He put his hand in the hole and felt something wet and cold. He pulled it out and saw a dead mouse."Yuck!" Ben screamed. He dropped the mouse and jumped off the chair.Lily was scared. She ran to the hose and turned it on. She wanted to spray the mouse away. She pointed the hose at the pipe and pressed the button.But the hose was not working well. It did not spray water. It sprayed air. The air went into the pipe and made a loud noise.The pipe shook and burst. Water came out of the pipe and splashed Lily and Ben. They were wet and cold.They ran to the house and told their mom what happened. She was not happy. She said they should not play with the pipe. She said they should play with their toys instead.She gave them towels and cookies and told them to stay inside. Lily and Ben were sorry. They did not want to play with the pipe anymore. They wanted to play with their toys and eat cookies.

Once upon a time, there lived a kind giant. He built a comfy house for himself in a lush, green forest. Every day, he went out from the forest and shared his kindness with neighbors.One day, while the giant was away, a thief snuck into his house. The thief created a plan to steal all the giant's treasures. Just then, the giant returned home and he could hear the thief trying to break in.The giant quickly created a trap with his hands. He then shouted at the thief, "This house is mine! You must leave now!" The thief was surprised and quickly ran away.The giant was very comforted that he had protected his home. He realized that he had done a very good job creating the trap. From then on, he never missed a chance to create something new and powerful.

One day, in a small, boring town, a boy named Tim set out to play. He walked and walked until he found a big park. The park had a slide, swings, and a sandbox. Tim was very happy and excited to play.As he played, a girl named Sue came to the park. She asked, "Can I play with you?" Tim said, "Yes, let's play together!" They played on the slide and swings, and then they went to the sandbox.While they played in the sandbox, they found a small, shiny box. Tim and Sue opened the box and saw a magic wand inside. They waved the wand, and suddenly, the boring town changed. The park grew bigger, and there were new games to play. The town was not boring anymore. Tim and Sue played all day and had lots of fun in their new, exciting town.

Tommy liked to do magic tricks. He had a hat, a wand, and a rabbit. He wanted to show his magic to his friends at school. He thought they would like him more and think he was cool.But Tommy did not know how to do magic well. He only copied what he saw on TV. He did not practice or learn the rules. He did not listen to his mom, who told him to be careful with magic.One day, he brought his hat, his wand, and his rabbit to school. He told his friends he would do a big magic show for them. They all gathered around him and waited. Tommy put his hat on the ground and waved his wand. He said some words he made up.He reached into his hat and pulled out his rabbit. But it was not his rabbit. It was a skunk. The skunk was angry and scared. It sprayed Tommy and his friends with a bad smell. Everyone screamed and ran away. Tommy was left alone, covered in stink.Tommy was very embarrassed. He cried and wished he never did magic. He learned that magic is not a game. He learned that he should not try to impress others with things he does not know. He learned that he should be happy with who he is, and not pretend to be someone else. He learned that being ordinary is not so bad.

Once upon a time there was a boy named John. John was an adventurous boy and he loved exploring the world. Every spring, he would borrow his father’s bike and go on a journey to discover new things. One spring morning, John was ready to leave on his adventure. But just as he was taking off, his father stopped him. “John, before you go, I have to borrow your bike”. said his father.John was very surprised and a little sad. He wanted to go on his journey but he couldn’t without a bike. He plead with his father but his father just said no. John was feeling very frustrated and he went to the garden for a walk. There he found a magic bike. A magical voice said, “John borrow this bike to go on your adventure?” John smiled and said yes! He was so excited and took the magical bike and set off on his journey. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Spot. Spot loved to spend his days running and playing with his friends. They were a happy group.One sunny day, Spot and his group went to the park. They played with a big, red ball. They ran, jumped, and laughed. The sun was shining, and they were having so much fun.As the day went on, Spot and his friends got tired. They lay down on the soft, green grass. They looked up at the sky and saw fluffy, white clouds. Spot and his group were happy and sleepy. They went home, ready to play again another day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Yesterday, Tim played in the mud with his dog, Spot. They both got very filthy. Tim's mom saw them and said, "Oh no! You both need to clean up."Tim didn't want to clean up, but his mom said, "You can't come inside until you wipe off the mud." Tim and Spot were sad. They wanted to go inside and eat snacks. So, Tim and Spot found a big towel and started to wipe off the mud.After they wiped off the mud, they went inside. Tim's mom said, "Good job! Now you can have your snacks." Tim and Spot were happy. They ate their snacks and played more, but this time they stayed clean.

Once, there was a boy named Tim. He had a nice bathrobe. Tim was selfish. He did not like to share his bathrobe with his sister, Ann. Tim always said, "This is mine. I will not let you use it."One day, Tim's mom told him to value things more. She said, "You must learn to share." Tim did not listen. He still did not share his bathrobe with Ann. One night, something strange happened. Tim's bathrobe came to life! It was mad at Tim for being selfish. The bathrobe said, "You do not value me, so I will go away." The bathrobe left Tim's room and was never seen again. Tim was sad, but he learned to share and value things more.

Once, there was a happy dog named Spot. Spot loved to run on the track near his home. Every day, he would ask his mom, "Can I go to the track?" His mom would say, "Yes, I permit you to go."One day, a big cat came to the track. The cat said, "This is my track now. You can't run here." Spot was sad. He wanted to run on the track, but the big cat would not permit it.Spot went home and told his mom about the big cat. His mom said, "Don't worry, Spot. I will talk to the cat." She went to the track and talked to the big cat. The big cat said he was sorry and that Spot could run on the track too. Now, Spot and the big cat both run on the track, and they are happy friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy lived in an ordinary house with her mom, dad, and her dog, Spot. One day, Amy and her family went to the park to have a fun day.At the park, Amy saw a big tree with lots of red cherries on it. She decided she wanted to pick some cherries to take home. So, Amy asked her dad to help her pick the cherries. Together, they picked the cherries and put them in a basket.After they picked the cherries, Amy and her family had a picnic in the park. They ate sandwiches, apples, and some of the cherries they picked. Spot played with a ball and everyone had a great day. When it was time to go home, Amy decided she wanted to come back to the park again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Anna. She was a curious three year old who always asked questions. One day, when her father was taking Anna for a walk in the park, she noticed a woman wearing a veil on her head. Anna asked her father why the woman was wearing a veil. Her father explained that it was part of her religion. Anna smiled and kept on walking. Soon they came across an old man who was sitting on the park bench. Anna said to the old man, "Hello." But the old man frowned. He did not reply. Anna looked at her father, confused. Her father explained that the old man was rude and shouldn't be spoken to. Anna understood and the family moved on.The lesson that Anna learned on that day was to always be kind to everyone, regardless of how others might be acting. Kindness is always appreciated.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty dog named Max. Max was a big, strong dog who liked to help people. One day, Max saw a little cat who was stuck in a tree. The cat was very sad and scared.Max wanted to help the cat. He found a big cross made of wood. Max used the cross to make a bridge so the cat could climb down from the tree. The cat was very happy and thanked Max for being so kind.Everyone saw what Max did and they all clapped their hands. They all said "Yay!" and "Good job, Max!" Max felt very proud and happy. He knew he had done a good thing by helping the cat. And from that day on, Max and the cat became best friends.

Sara liked to do yoga with her mom. Yoga was fun and made her feel good. She liked to stretch and bend and breathe. She had a pink mat and a fancy water bottle.But one day, Sara saw her brother Max playing with his cars. He had a big track and a lot of cars that made noises and lights. Sara wanted to play with them too. She asked Max if she could join him."No, go away!" Max said. "These are my cars. You are too little and you will break them. Go do your boring yoga."Sara felt sad and angry. She did not like Max being mean to her. She did not want to do yoga anymore. She wanted to play with the cars. She decided to quit yoga and take Max's cars.She waited until Max went to the bathroom. Then she ran to his room and grabbed some of his cars. She tried to make them go on the track, but they did not work. She pushed harder and harder, but they only got stuck and fell off.Max came back and saw what Sara was doing. He yelled at her and tried to take his cars back. Sara did not want to give them up. They started to fight and pull and tug.Mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. She saw Sara and Max fighting over the cars. She saw the track broken and the cars scattered. She saw Sara's pink mat and fancy water bottle on the floor.She was not happy. She told Sara and Max to stop fighting and to apologize to each other. She told Sara that she should not quit yoga and take Max's cars. She told Max that he should not be mean to Sara and share his cars. She told them that they should both try to do something they both liked.Sara and Max felt sorry for what they did. They said they were sorry

Once upon a time, there was a delicate cat named Luna. She loved to play in the backyard. One sunny day, she saw a big red ball there.Luna said, "I want to play with the ball!" She ran to the ball and tried to push it. But the ball was very big, and Luna was very small. It did not move. Luna tried again and again, but the ball would not roll.Then, Luna had an idea. She climbed a tree and jumped onto the ball. But, she did not know the ball was wet. Luna slipped and fell off the ball! She landed softly on the grass.Just then, a kind dog named Max came to the backyard. He saw Luna and the big red ball. Max said, "Let's play together!" Max pushed the ball, and it rolled. Luna chased it and they both laughed. They played all day and became best friends.

Lily and Tom were playing hide and seek in the park. Lily was the seeker and Tom was the hider. Lily counted to ten and then looked for Tom. She saw a big bush with a feather sticking out of it. She thought Tom was hiding there.She ran to the bush and peeked behind it. But it was not Tom. It was a big, angry bird with sharp claws and a long beak. The bird did not like Lily peeking at it. It screeched and flew at Lily. It scratched her face and pulled her hair. Lily screamed and cried.Tom heard Lily's scream and came out of his hiding spot. He saw the bird attacking Lily. He was scared and did not know what to do. He wanted to help Lily, but he was too small and weak. He wished he had a stick or a stone to throw at the bird.The bird did not stop hurting Lily. It was not an ordinary bird. It was a mean and hungry bird. It wanted to eat Lily. It bit her neck and dragged her into the bush. Lily stopped screaming and crying. She was gone.Tom was alone and sad. He wished he had never played hide and seek. He wished he had never seen the feather. He wished Lily was still with him. He ran to find his mom and dad. He hoped they could save Lily. But it was too late. The end.

One day, a little bear and his mama went to look for honey in the forest. The little bear loved honey very much and wanted to eat it all the time. His mama told him to listen carefully and follow her, because there were many dangers in the forest."Listen, little bear, we have to be quiet and sneaky. There are big bees that guard the honey, and they can sting us if they see us. There are also other animals that like honey, and they can be mean and scary. Do you understand?" his mama said."Yes, mama, I understand. I will listen and follow you. I want to eat honey, but I don't want to get hurt or scared," the little bear said.They walked and walked until they found a big tree with a hole in it. The little bear smelled honey and got very excited. He ran towards the tree, forgetting to listen and follow his mama. He stuck his head inside the hole and saw a lot of honey. He licked his lips and reached his paw inside.But then he heard a terrible buzz. The big bees had seen him and were angry. They flew out of the hole and started to sting the little bear. The little bear cried out in pain and fear. He pulled his head and paw out of the hole, but it was too late. He was covered in stings and bumps.His mama heard his cry and ran to help him. She scared away the bees and hugged the little bear. She licked his wounds and comforted him."I'm sorry, mama, I didn't listen and follow you. I was too greedy and foolish. The honey was not worth it. The bees were terrible and hurt me a lot," the little bear said."It's okay, little bear, I forgive you. You made a mistake, but you learned a lesson. Next time, y

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max lived in a small house with his family. Max loved to bite things. He would bite toys, shoes, and even the bookcase. Max's family did not like when he bit the bookcase.One day, Max's friend, a little girl named Lily, came to visit. She saw Max bite the bookcase and said, "Max, don't bite the bookcase! We can play with toys instead." Max was eager to play with Lily, so he stopped biting the bookcase.Max and Lily played with toys all day. They had a lot of fun. Max did not bite the bookcase anymore. Max's family was happy that he stopped biting the bookcase. From that day on, Max only bit his toys and played with his friend Lily.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sue. Sue loved to create things. One day, she had a big idea. She wanted to make a special television. This television would only show healthy things. Sue was very excited.Sue told her friend, Tom, about her idea. "I want to create a healthy television," she said. Tom thought it was a great idea too. They decided to work together. They knew it would not be easy, but they were ready to try.Day after day, Sue and Tom worked hard. They drew pictures and talked about what the healthy television would show. One day, they finally finished. They turned on the television and saw happy people eating fruits and vegetables, playing outside, and being kind to each other. Sue and Tom smiled, knowing they had created something special.

One day, a little caterpillar went to play with his friends. He was very excited to see them. They all played together in the sun, and had a lot of fun.But then, the caterpillar and his friend, the butterfly, started to quarrel. They both wanted to play on the same leaf. The caterpillar was sad, and the butterfly was mad.Soon, they stopped fighting and said sorry to each other. They learned to share the leaf and play together. The caterpillar and the butterfly were happy again, and they all had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a famous dog named Spot. Spot was very good at finding things. One day, Spot found a pretty crystal. The crystal was shiny and made Spot very happy.Spot wanted to show his friends the crystal, so he went to the park. When he got to the park, he saw his friends playing. Spot wanted to play too, but he did not want to lose the crystal. So, he put the crystal in his mouth and tried to play. While playing, Spot tried to bark, but the crystal fell out of his mouth. All his friends saw the crystal fall and laughed. Spot felt embarrass. But his friends said, "Don't worry, Spot. We all make mistakes." They helped him find the crystal, and they all played together. Spot was happy to have such good friends.

Once there was a small turkey. He lived in a barn on a farm with lots of other animals. Each day he would gobble and flutter his wings. One day, the farmer wanted to raise him. He carefully picked up the small turkey and took him to a cozy pen. The turkey was happy there. He was safe and had plenty of yummy food to eat. He also started to get bigger, but still stayed small. The farmer checked in on him every day. Soon the turkey was ready to be raised. The farmer took him to a big, noisy market. There were lots of other turkeys there, but none of them were as small as he was. A customer saw the small turkey and knew he would make a good dinner.The farmer's heart was heavy as he sold the turkey. But he was happy, too. He knew the small turkey was going to a good home to be loved. The little turkey will never be forgotten.

Once upon a time, there was a hero. The hero was very strong and fast. He liked to sort things. One day, the hero found a cheap toy. The toy was very small and cute. The hero wanted to give the toy to a child.The hero met a little boy. The boy said, "I want the toy, please." The hero gave the toy to the boy. The boy was very happy. The hero felt good for helping the boy.But then, something unexpected happened. The cheap toy broke into pieces. The boy was very sad. The hero tried to fix the toy, but he couldn't. The hero was sad too. They both learned that cheap toys can break easily.

Once upon a time, an elderly man and his son gathered around the garden table. The son said to his father, "I want to be a veterinarian when I grow up!" His father, who had worked closely with animals his entire life, smiled and said, "That's a wonderful idea!"The next day, they went on a special trip to visit the local veterinarian. The elderly man introduced the son to the vet, and the vet showed them his office. He explained how he helped all kinds of animals, from puppies and kittens to horses and bunnies. The son's eyes widened in amazement as he listened. The son thanked the veterinarian for teaching him about animals and said, "Now I'm sure I'd like to be a veterinarian when I grow up." The elderly man smiled, proud of his son's ambition. They gathered up their things and said goodbye to the vet. The son waved as they drove away, eager to help animals just like the veterinarian.

One hot day, a cat and a dog were playing outside. They liked to jump and run. This was their exercise. They were very happy.A bird saw them and wanted to play too. The bird flew down and said, "I want to do exercise with you!" The cat and the dog were surprised but happy. They all played together, running and jumping.Then, the bird had an idea. "I can offer you something fun!" The bird took the cat and dog to a big tree. The bird showed them how to climb the tree. The cat and the dog did not know they could do this. They were so excited! Now, they had a new way to play and exercise together.

Once upon a time, there was a big cat named Tom. Tom was very hungry. He went to a small food shop to eat. Tom saw a menu on the table. The menu had many yummy things to eat. He was happy.Tom wanted to eat a thick sandwich. The sandwich was very big and had lots of things inside. Tom was so excited to eat the sandwich. He started to eat it very fast. It was so good!A little girl named Sue came to the food shop. She saw Tom eating the sandwich. Sue wanted to pet Tom. She came close and kneeled down. Tom liked Sue and let her pet him. They became good friends. Tom and Sue were happy together.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot had a modern dog house. It was blue and had a soft bed inside. Spot loved to play with his ball and run around the yard. One day, Spot hurt his heel while playing. He started to cry because it hurt a lot.Spot's friend, a little girl named Sue, heard him cry. She ran to him and said, "Spot, why do you cry?" Spot showed her his hurt heel. Sue felt sad for Spot and wanted to help him.Sue got a bandage and put it on Spot's heel. She said, "Spot, this will make your heel feel better." Spot stopped crying and wagged his tail. He was happy that Sue helped him. From that day on, Spot and Sue were the best of friends and played together every day.

Lily and her mom were going to the zoo. They waited for a taxi on the street. Lily saw a green taxi coming. She liked green. It was her favorite color."Look, mom, a green taxi!" Lily said."Yes, that's our taxi, Lily. Let's get in," her mom said.They got in the green taxi. The driver was nice. He smiled at Lily and asked her where she wanted to go."To the zoo, please. I want to see the animals," Lily said.The driver nodded and drove to the zoo. He told Lily some funny stories about the animals he had seen. Lily laughed and listened.They arrived at the zoo. Lily and her mom got out of the green taxi. Lily's mom paid the driver."Thank you for the ride and the stories, sir," Lily's mom said."You're welcome, ma'am. Have a nice day at the zoo," the driver said.Lily also wanted to say something. She looked at the driver and said:"Thank you, too, sir. I like your green taxi. It's very pretty."The driver smiled and thanked Lily. He waved goodbye and drove away.Lily and her mom walked to the zoo entrance. They were happy and excited. They were going to see the animals.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. Her name was Jessie and she loved wearing a beautiful pink skirt. Every day she would twirl around in her skirt and feel so happy.One day, Jessie went for a walk with her mom. As they walked, they noticed a mysterious door. Curiosity got the best of Jessie, so she asked her mom if she could open the door. "Yes," said her mom, "just be careful."Jessie eagerly opened the door and found a magical room. She stepped inside and twirled around, enjoying the feeling of the room. Everything seemed so mysterious! Suddenly, a kind voice spoke to Jessie. "Welcome to my magical kingdom. Would you like to play a game?" Jessie was so excited, she jumped up and said, "Yes!"She had the best day playing games with the magical creatures. At the end of the day, Jessie thanked the magical creatures and waved goodbye. She felt so happy that she had enjoyed such a mysterious adventure.

The sun was shining brightly and it was a wild morning. Sally was in her backyard and wanted to see the animals in the wild. She was patient and waited for a long time. Suddenly, she saw a squirrel! She was so excited and ran to get a better look. But, the squirrel ran away and got too far for Sally to see.Sally was sad, but she was patient and kept watching for animals. Soon, a rabbit hopped by. She slowly tiptoed closer and tried to get the rabbit's attention. But the rabbit didn't see her and hopped away.Sally tried her best to be patient, but she was very sad. She decided to go back inside, but before she did, she looked up at the sky. She saw a beautiful rainbow shining in the sky. She smiled and said to herself "I don't need to see animals in the wild, this rainbow is enough!"

Once upon a time, there was a peaceful town. In this town, there was a man named Tom. Tom loved to make wine from grapes. He worked hard to make the best wine. Everyone in the town liked Tom and his wine. They were happy and had fun together.One day, Tom wanted to increase the amount of wine he made. He thought if he made more wine, everyone would be even happier. So, he worked harder and made more wine. He gave the wine to everyone in the town. They drank the wine and had fun.But soon, the people in the town started to get tired and not feel good. They did not want to play or have fun anymore. Tom was sad and did not understand why. Then, he learned that too much wine was not good for them. Tom decided to make less wine and the people in the town became happy and healthy again. The moral of the story is that too much of a good thing can sometimes be bad.

Lily liked to watch the aeroplanes in the sky. She wanted to fly in one and see the clouds and the birds. But her brother Tom said she was too little and he was bigger and smarter. He said he would fly in an aeroplane one day and Lily would stay on the ground.Lily was envious of Tom. She wished she was bigger and smarter too. She was angry at Tom for being mean to her. One day, she saw Tom's toy aeroplane on his bed. She decided to take it and play with it. She thought Tom would not notice.But Tom did notice. He came into his room and saw Lily with his toy aeroplane. He was very angry. He shouted at Lily and snatched the toy from her. He said she was a bad sister and he would tell Mom. Lily was scared. She knew Mom would punish her for taking Tom's toy.She started to cry and said she was sorry. She said she just wanted to fly in an aeroplane like Tom. She said she loved Tom and did not want to make him angry. Tom saw Lily's tears and felt sorry for her. He remembered that he loved Lily too and did not want to make her sad.He hugged Lily and said he was sorry too. He said he would share his toy aeroplane with her and they could play together. He said he would teach her about the sky and the clouds and the birds. He said he would take her to fly in an aeroplane one day when she was bigger. Lily smiled and hugged Tom back. She said thank you and said he was a good brother. They played with the toy aeroplane and forgot about Mom. Mom saw them and smiled. She was happy that they were friends again. She did not punish them. She gave them a cookie and a kiss.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big building. It has many windows and doors. They want to see what is inside.They go to the building and find a door that is open. They go in. They see many things. They see books, toys, clothes, and food. They think the building is a store."Look, Tom, food!" Lily says. She sees a cake on a table. It is big and round and has pink frosting. She likes cake. She wants to eat it."Wait, Lily, we can't take it!" Tom says. He sees a sign on the wall. It says: "Do not touch. This is for the party." He knows it is wrong to take things that are not theirs. He knows it is called stealing.But Lily does not listen. She is hungry. She takes the cake and runs out of the door. Tom follows her. He is scared.They do not see the fat man who comes out of another door. He is the owner of the building. He sees the cake is gone. He is angry. He runs after Lily and Tom."Stop! Stop! You stole my cake!" he shouts. He is faster than Lily and Tom. He catches them. He takes the cake back. He scolds them."Why did you steal my cake? That is very bad. You should say sorry. You should go home and tell your parents what you did." he says.Lily and Tom are sorry. They cry. They say sorry to the fat man. They go home and tell their parents what they did. Their parents are not happy. They punish them. They make them stay in their rooms. They do not get any cake.Lily and Tom learn a lesson. They learn that stealing is wrong. They learn that they should not go into buildings that are not theirs. They learn that they should listen to Tom. They promise to

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a little girl named Mia. Mia had a big heart and always helped her friends. One cold day, a lost kitten came to her house. Mia took the kitten inside to keep it warm.Mia wondered who the kitten belonged to. She asked her friends and neighbors, but no one knew. Mia decided to take care of the kitten until she found its home. She fed the kitten, played with it, and made sure it was never cold.Days went by, and Mia and the kitten became best friends. One day, a lady came to Mia's house and said the kitten was hers. Mia was sad but knew she had to give the kitten back. The lady saw Mia's kind heart and said they could share the kitten. Mia learned that when you do good things for others, good things happen to you too.

One day, a girl named Sue went for a walk. It was a hot day, and she was very tired. She found a seat under a big tree. The seat was in the shade, so it was not hot. Sue sat down and took a deep breath.Sue saw a boy named Tim walking by. Tim had a book in his hand. Sue asked, "What do you have?" Tim said, "I have a book to read." Sue asked, "Can I read with you?" Tim said, "Yes, let's read together."They sat on the seat under the tree and read the book. The book was about a cat and a dog who were friends. They laughed and had fun reading the book. After they finished, they said goodbye and went home. They were happy they read the book together on the hot day.

Tim and Jen are friends. They like to play in the park. They have a big ball and a small car. They share and have fun.One day, they hear a loud noise. They see a big plane in the sky. The plane drops a big bomb. The bomb makes a big fire and a big smoke. Tim and Jen are scared. They run to their moms."Mom, what is that?" Tim asks."That is a war, Tim. A war is when people fight and hurt each other. It is very bad," Tim's mom says."Why do people fight, mom?" Jen asks."Sometimes people fight because they are angry or greedy or afraid. They do not know how to be kind and share and have fun. They do not have great friends like you and Tim," Jen's mom says.Tim and Jen hug their moms. They worry about the war. They worry about the people who are hurt. They worry about the park and the ball and the car."Mom, can we do something to stop the war?" Tim asks."Well, we can pray and hope and love. We can be great friends to each other and to everyone. We can show people how to be kind and share and have fun. Maybe then they will stop fighting and start playing," Tim's mom says.Tim and Jen smile. They like that idea. They pray and hope and love. They are great friends. They want to play. They want peace.

Once upon a time there was a box. It was a special box that could measure things. Every day the box went on adventures.One day the box found itself in a strange place. It was a dark room filled with odd treasures. The box felt a little guilty snooping around, but it kept exploring. Suddenly, it bumped into something. It was a giant ruler! The box was so excited! It couldn’t believe how perfect it was. The box quickly measured the ruler and recorded the numbers. The box went back home feeling happy. Then it realized that everyone was looking at it funny. Its family had been secretly measuring things! The box felt guilty for not understanding what was going on earlier.But everyone was smiling now. The ruler was a special gift for the box! Now the box could measure things wherever it goes and make sure that everything is fair and right.

Lily and Ben were friends. They liked to play in the garden. One day, they saw a large strawberry plant. It had many red and juicy strawberries."Look, Ben, look!" Lily said. "Strawberries! Let's pick some and eat them!""OK, Lily, OK!" Ben said. "But we have to be quick. Mom said not to go near the plant. She said it belongs to Mr. Fox, the mean old man who lives next door."Lily and Ben did not listen to Mom. They ran to the plant and picked some strawberries. They put them in a basket and hid behind a bush. They talked and laughed and ate the strawberries. They did not see Mr. Fox watching them from his window.Mr. Fox was angry. He did not like children. He did not like sharing his strawberries. He grabbed his cane and went outside. He walked to the bush where Lily and Ben were hiding. He shouted and waved his cane."Hey, you little thieves! Get away from my plant! Give me back my strawberries! Or I will hit you with my cane!"Lily and Ben were scared. They dropped the basket and ran away. But Mr. Fox was faster. He caught Ben by his shirt and pulled him back. He raised his cane and hit Ben on his head. Ben cried and fell to the ground.Lily saw what happened. She screamed and ran to Ben. She tried to help him. But it was too late. Ben was not moving. He was not talking. He was not breathing. He was dead.Lily was sad. She was alone. She wished she had listened to Mom. She wished she had never seen the large strawberry plant. She wished she had never met Mr. Fox.

Ben liked to play with his toy soldiers. He had many of them, and he gave them names and voices. He made them march and fight and hide in his room. He was very adventurous and liked to pretend he was a soldier too.One day, he found a new soldier in his toy box. He was shiny and red, and he had a big hat and a sword. Ben was curious and picked him up. He said, "Hello, soldier. What is your name?"The soldier did not reply. He was very still and quiet. Ben shook him and tapped him, but he did not make a sound. Ben was puzzled and sad. He wanted to play with the new soldier, but he did not talk.He put the soldier on his bed and went to look for his mom. He found her in the kitchen and said, "Mom, I have a new soldier, but he does not reply. Why is he so quiet?"Mom smiled and hugged Ben. She said, "That is a special soldier, Ben. He is not a toy, he is a decoration. He is made of metal and he does not have a voice. He is very pretty, but he is not for playing."Ben was disappointed and confused. He said, "But I want to play with him. He looks so adventurous and brave. Can I not make him talk?"Mom shook her head and said, "No, Ben, you cannot. He is not like your other soldiers. He is for looking, not for touching. He might break or scratch if you play with him. Why don't you leave him on your shelf and play with your other soldiers? They are more fun and they reply to you."Ben nodded and said, "Okay, Mom. I will do that. But can I still look at him sometimes?"Mom said, "Of course, Ben. You can look at him as much as you want. He is very handsome and he is yours. But remember, he is a decoration,

Tommy was a popular kid in his nursery. He loved playing with his friends, but sometimes he got into trouble.One day Tommy was zipping his toy car around. He was going so fast that it was difficult for his friends to keep up with him."Hey Tommy," one of his friends called. "Slow down! You're going too fast!"Tommy slowed down, but didn't stop completely. He kept zipping around, but more slowly this time.His friends laughed and joined in with the game. They kept zipping around the garden until his teacher called them inside.Tommy knew he was in trouble, but he couldn't help but smile. Even when he was in trouble he was still always popular!

Once upon a time, there was a large river that went through a village. Every morning, the villagers would stand on the side of the river and stretch their arms towards the sky while they watched the sun rise.One day, the villagers saw a creature stretching across the river and they were amazed! It was a big, scaly dragon stretching its wings. The dragon spoke in a deep, kind voice and said, "Good morning villagers! I'm here to stretch my wings and fly across the sky."The villagers were so excited to have the dragon visit them. They asked, "Can we join you and stretch our arms too?"The dragon replied, "Of course! Let's stretch together. Together, we can feel the sun on our faces and let our arms reach further than ever before!"So all the villagers and the dragon stretched their arms together and saw how far they could reach. It was so much fun! They all felt so happy!The dragon thanked them for joining and then said goodbye as it flew away. The villagers waved and watched it fly until it was out of sight. Since then, the villagers still stand at the river, stretching together, watching the sun rise.

Once upon a time, there was an old snake. He loved to roll around in the sunshine. He would roll up and down the hills, and up and down the valleys. He was always looking for something fun to do.One day he found a big pile of leaves. He rolled in and around them, trying to find the crunchiest ones. After he finished rolling, he noticed something strange. Underneath the leaves was an old stick. He unrolled himself and peeked under the stick.When he looked, he was surprised to find another old snake. The two of them stared at each other for a while and then the first snake said, "Let's roll together!" The second snake smiled and they started rolling and bumping into each other. They were having so much fun rolling around together, they lost track of time. When the sun went down and it started getting dark, they had to say goodbye. But they promised to roll together again soon. And they did.

Ben and Lily love to play in the park. They like to slide, swing and run. But their favorite thing is to climb. They climb on the rocks, the trees and the monkey bars.One day, they see a big jet in the sky. It makes a loud noise and leaves a white trail behind. Ben and Lily are amazed. They want to see it closer."Let's climb on the hill!" Ben says. "Maybe we can touch the jet!""OK!" Lily agrees. They run to the hill and start to climb. They use their hands and feet and help each other. They are very brave and strong.They reach the top of the hill and look at the sky. The jet is still there, but it is very far away. They cannot touch it, but they can wave at it."Hello, jet!" Ben shouts. "You are very fast and shiny!""Hello, jet!" Lily echoes. "You are very charming and cool!"The jet seems to hear them. It winks at them with its lights and makes a funny sound. Ben and Lily laugh and clap. They are very happy.They stay on the hill for a while and watch the jet fly away. Then they climb down and go back to the park. They have more fun with their friends. They tell them about the jet and the hill. They are very proud of their adventure. They are the best climbers in the world.

One day, a lonely cat named Tom went for a walk. He was sad because he had no friends to play with. Tom saw a big tree and decided to climb it. When he got to the top, he found a big bird's nest. In the nest, there was a print of a bird's family.Tom felt happy to see the print and thought that maybe he could find friends too. He climbed down the tree and started to walk again. Soon, he saw a little dog named Max. Max was also lonely and looking for a friend.Tom and Max decided to be friends and play together. They played all day long and had so much fun. When they were tired, they found a nice spot under the tree to relax. Tom and Max were not lonely anymore. They were happy to have each other as friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toy cars. He had many cars, but his favorite one was a big, red car. He played with it every day.One hot day, Tim went to the park to play. He saw his friend, Sue. Sue had a blue ball, but she did not have a car. Tim wanted to lend his red car to Sue so they could play together. Sue was very happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!"They played with the red car and the blue ball all day. They had so much fun in the hot sun. When it was time to go home, Sue gave the red car back to Tim. They said goodbye and went home with a big smile. Tim was happy that he could lend his car and make a friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was adventurous and loved to play outside. She had a pretty vase that she liked a lot. One day, she wanted to know how heavy her vase was, so she asked her dad to help her weigh it."Can you help me weigh my vase, Dad?" Sue asked her dad. "Of course, Sue," he said. They put the vase on a scale and found out it was not very heavy.Sue took her vase outside to play. She was having so much fun, but then something unexpected happened. A little bird flew down and tried to sit on the vase. The bird was too heavy and the vase fell over and broke. Sue was very sad.Her dad came outside and saw the broken vase. He hugged Sue and said, "Don't be sad, Sue. We can get a new vase and this time, we will get a stronger one that can hold a bird." Sue smiled and felt better. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a very brave girl named Sam. She lived in a small village and had plenty of friends. One day, the village was in trouble. A ghost had hidden all the things that were expensive.Sam decided she would help her village and find the things the ghost had hidden.In the village, Sam met an old man called Bobby. He said to her, "Sam, you can help us find the expensive things. But, you must complete the task by the end of the night."Sam was scared but she knew she had to help her friends.So, she set off on her adventure to find the expensive things the ghost had hidden. She was scared but determined to finish.At the end of the night, Sam was so proud to announce that she had completed her mission. Everyone in the village gave her a big hug as a sign of appreciation.Sam was happy and relieved to have completed the task. She had done it!

Once upon a time there was a camp in the woods. The camp was full of happy people, but there was one little boy who was different. He was deaf. He liked playing by himself in the woods. He could not hear the birds singing and the breeze rustling the leaves.One day, he was playing in the woods when he suddenly heard a sound. It was a loud crack and it made him jump. When he looked around, he saw the ground had split in two! He was so scared, but then he noticed a little mouse had come out of the crack. The mouse was walking away, so the little boy followed it. The mouse hopped right into a camp fire and split into two. It was so funny! The little boy was amazed, he had never seen anything like it before. The little boy watched in amazement as the two mice ran off in different directions. He was so excited to have seen this strange thing happen in the woods. He smiled and went back to his camp, happy to have been able to experience something so new and wonderful.

Once upon a time, there lived a mummy and her little girl, Daisy. Daisy was a very thoughtful girl and she always looked for ways to make her mummy smile. One day, Daisy decided to do something special for her mummy so she ordered a big box of soap. When the box arrived, Daisy rushed to open it and inside she found the most beautiful and most smelly soaps. Daisy showed her mummy the box and her mummy could not believe her eyes! She was so delighted with Daisy's thoughtful gift. Mummy gave Daisy a big hug and said to her, "Thank you so much my darling, I love it! I get to use this soap for a very long time." Daisy was so happy to make her mummy feel so special. She said, "Mummy, I love you so much!" Mummy replied, "I love you too Daisy." Daisy and mummy hugged each other and Daisy thought to herself, "I really must be a very thoughtful girl!"

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a toy named Mr. Bunny. Mr. Bunny was very reliable. Mia took him everywhere she went.One day, Mia and Mr. Bunny went to the kitchen. They saw a small flame on the stove. Mia's mom was cooking. Mia said, "Mom, can I help you cook?" Her mom said, "Yes, but be careful of the flame."Mia and Mr. Bunny helped her mom cook. When they were done, Mia's mom said, "Now we must shut the stove." Mia and Mr. Bunny watched as her mom shut the stove. The flame went away. They all sat down and enjoyed their meal together.

Anna and Ben are twins. They like to play with their new toys. They have a lot of cars, dolls, blocks and books. They also have a big box of cards with pictures on them.One day, they decide to play a game with the cards. They spread them on the floor, face down. They take turns to flip two cards and see if they match. If they match, they keep them. If they don't, they put them back."Look, I found two cats!" Anna says, showing her cards to Ben. "They are both black and white. They match!""Good job, Anna!" Ben says. "Now it's my turn. I hope I find two dogs. I like dogs."He flips two cards and sees a dog and a bird. They don't match. He makes a sad face and puts them back."Try again, Ben!" Anna says. "You can do it!"They keep playing until there are no more cards left. They count how many pairs they have. Anna has six pairs and Ben has five pairs."Anna, you win!" Ben says. "You have more matches than me. You are good at this game.""Thank you, Ben!" Anna says. "But you are good too. You have a lot of matches. And you are a good brother. Do you want to play again?""Yes, please!" Ben says. "But first, let's put the cards back in the box. And then, let's open a new book and read a story. I like stories.""Me too!" Anna says. "Let's go!"They put the cards in the box and run to their bookshelf. They pick a new book with colorful pictures and sit on the couch. They open the book and read the story together. They are happy. They love to play and learn with each other. They are twins. They match.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to laugh and play with her friends. One day, she found a box with a label on it. The label said "fine toys". Amy was very happy and wanted to play with the toys.Amy took the box to her friends, and they all started to play with the fine toys. They laughed and had lots of fun. They played all day long, not knowing that the toys were not theirs. The toys belonged to another child in the town.As the sun went down, the child who owned the toys found Amy and her friends playing with them. He was very sad and asked them to give his toys back. Amy and her friends felt bad for taking the toys without asking. They gave the toys back, but the child was still sad. They all learned that it is not good to take things that do not belong to them. The day ended with everyone feeling sorry for what they had done.

Once upon a time, there was a rainy day. Little Tommy had wanted to go out and play, but the rain was drenching everything. So he hopped, skipped and jumped around the house, instead. Suddenly, there was a knock on the door. It was Grandpa! He had a big, black cane and a large umbrella in his hand. Grandpa said, "Let's go out and have some fun, even though it is wet!"Tommy giggled, "But how can we do that?"Grandpa winked and said, "I will provide!" He opened the umbrella and they went outside.It was wet, but together they began to splash in the puddles. The cold water splashed onto their faces, and it felt so amusing! They laughed with delight, and before long the sun was shining and it was dry again. Grandpa had provided lots of fun for little Tommy, on a very wet and rainy day.

Once there was a young girl named Anna who was about to turn three. She was so excited for her birthday, especially when her mom told her she was getting a big surprise.When the special day came, Anna was so happy and so excited to find out what her gift was. Her mom took out a big box and said, "Anna, this is your birthday gift!"Anna opened the box and inside was a toy puppy. She was so glad she had her own puppy! She scooped it up and hugged it tightly. Then, a loud noise scared Anna and she started to panic.Anna's mom said, "Oh sweetheart, it's just the wind. It's okay, there's nothing to be scared of. Your puppy is safe with you."Anna hugged her new gift and was so relieved it was safe. She knew nothing was going to hurt her puppy, and she was happy to have it.

One day, a little boy named Tim was very worry. He had to make dinner for his family. He did not know how to cook. He thought dinner would be tough. Tim was sad.Tim went to the kitchen. He saw a big pot. He put some food in the pot. He turned on the heat. Then, something unexpected happened. The food started to cook all by itself! Tim was happy.Tim's family came home. They saw the dinner Tim made. They were so proud of him. The dinner was not tough. It was yummy! Tim was not worry anymore. They all ate dinner and had a good time.

Ben and Mia like to pretend they are racing drivers. They have two old bikes that they pedal very fast around the yard. They make loud noises with their mouths, like vroom and beep.One day, they see a new bike in the street. It is big and shiny, with a red frame and a silver bell. It has a sticker that says "Speedy". Ben and Mia think it is impressive."Wow, look at that bike!" Ben says. "It must be very fast.""I want to try it," Mia says. "Maybe the owner will let us."They run to the bike and knock on the door of the house. A boy opens the door. He is older than Ben and Mia, and he has a helmet on his head."Hi, we like your bike," Ben says. "Can we ride it?"The boy looks at them and shakes his head. "No, you can't. This is my bike, and it is not for little kids. You have to be big and strong to pedal it. You should stick to your old bikes. They are more suitable for you."Ben and Mia feel sad and angry. They think the boy is mean and rude. They go back to their bikes and pedal away."Who cares about his bike?" Mia says. "Our bikes are better. We can pretend they are anything we want. We can pretend they are rockets, or horses, or dragons.""Yeah, you're right," Ben says. "Our bikes are more fun. And we are more impressive, because we have imagination."They smile and pedal faster, making more noises. They pretend they are racing drivers, and they have the best bikes in the world.

One day, a little fish lived in a big pond. The fish liked to move all day. The fish had many friends in the pond. They played games and swam together. The fish was very happy.One day, the fish saw a big bird. The bird looked hungry and the fish felt helpless. The fish was scared and did not want the bird to eat it. So, the fish tried to hide under a rock in the pond.But then, something unexpected happened. The bird did not want to eat the fish. The bird wanted to be friends with the fish. The bird said, "I will not hurt you. Let's play together!" The fish was happy again and they played in the pond. The fish and the bird became best friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a cop named Sam. Sam was big and strong. He loved to eat tasty food.
