Mia got angry when Jake wouldn’t let her play. “Leave it Mia,” Jake said in a serious tone, “It’s my rail now.” Mia crossed her arms, grumpy, and stomped back to her train. Jakes said “Sorry Mia!”, but she didn’t respond. Jake then noticed her lip trembling and said “let’s build something together, Mia!” Mia looked up, her eyes brightened and said “Really?!”. Jake nodded and they went to work, building a big track with their toy trains. They spread some rocks around the track and added many different details. Mia and Jake had so much fun together, and the rail was forgotten. Together, they created something magical.

Mama was angry at Sally for making a mess in the kitchen. She told Sally she would have to punish her. Sally was scared. She asked Mama what her punishment would be.Mama said, “You have to stay in your room for an hour without any cocoa.”Sally was sad. She loved to drink cocoa, but Mama said no.Mama said, “But then I will play a lively game with you. How does that sound?” Sally brightened up. She smiled and said yes. Mama hugged Sally and they headed off to Sally's room.And just like that, Sally had her punishment and her reward!

One day, a little boy named Tim wanted to attach a big red balloon to his toy car. He thought it would make his car look original and fun. So, he asked his mom for help."Mom, can you help me attach this balloon to my car?" Tim asked. His mom smiled and said, "Of course, Tim! Let's do it together."They worked together to attach the balloon to the toy car. Once it was done, Tim was very happy. He played with his car and balloon all day long. Later, Tim's big sister came home from school. She had an exam that day and was tired."Look at my car, sis!" Tim said, showing off his original toy car with the big red balloon. His sister smiled and said, "That's really cool, Tim! I wish I could play with you, but I need to rest after my exam."Tim understood and let his sister rest. He continued to play with his car and balloon, feeling proud of his original idea.

Tina was feeling very guilty. She had done something wrong and she knew it. She wanted to tell her mom, but she was too scared.Tina walked into her mom's room, tears streaming down her face. "What's wrong?" asked Tina's mom. "I did something bad," replied Tina. Her mom put her arms around Tina. "It's ok, let's talk about it," said her mom.Tina took a deep breath and told her mom what she had done. Her mom listened carefully and then gave her a big hug. "It's alright, everybody makes mistakes," said her mom and gave her a sign. The sign was so special because it meant everything was going to be ok. Tina smiled and wiped away her tears. She knew she wasn't guilty anymore.

One day, a big, heavy bear went for a walk in the woods. He was very tired and his back hurt. He saw a small rabbit hopping by and asked, "Can you help me? My back hurts a lot."The rabbit said, "Yes, I can give you a massage to make it feel better." So the rabbit climbed on the bear's back and started to massage him. The bear felt very good and happy.As the rabbit was massaging the bear, they heard a loud "snap" sound. It was a big branch that fell from a tree. The rabbit and the bear were scared, but they saw that no one was hurt. They were happy that they were safe and continued with the massage. The bear felt much better after the massage, and they both became good friends.

Sam and Mia liked to play pirates. They had a big box full of treasure. They had coins, jewels, rings, and necklaces. They pretended to sail on a ship and find new islands. They hid their treasure under a tree and made a map.One day, they saw a new boy in the park. His name was Ben. He asked if he could play with them. Sam and Mia said yes, but they did not show him their treasure. They thought he might want to take it. They played with him for a while, but then they got hungry. They said they had to go home for lunch.Ben said he wanted to stay and play some more. Sam and Mia said okay, but they told him not to touch their treasure. They said they would return soon. They left their map with him, but they folded it so he could not see where the treasure was. They thought they were clever.But Ben was curious. He unfolded the map and looked at it. He saw a big X under a tree. He thought it was a game. He ran to the tree and dug under it. He found the treasure. He was amazed. He wanted to keep it for himself. He put it in his backpack and ran away.Sam and Mia came back after lunch. They looked for Ben, but they could not find him. They looked for their map, but they could not find it. They looked for their treasure, but they could not find it. They saw a big hole under the tree. They realized what had happened. They felt sad and angry. They had lost their friend and their treasure. They wished they had never met Ben. They learned a difficult lesson.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Bob and Martha. Both were very thoughtful and liked to do things together. One day Bob and Martha were looking for something to do. Suddenly, Bob had a good idea.He pointed to a tree in the distance and said, "Let's go snap it down!". Martha thought for a moment and shook her head. She said, "No, that won't be a good idea. We should be more thoughtful."Bob looked at Martha in surprise, but then he saw the wisdom in her words. He nodded and said, "You're right. Let's walk around the tree instead." So they did, and as they circled the tree, they talked about what a nice tree it was, and the kindness of being thoughtful to all the creatures that made their home in the tree.The moral of the story is that being thoughtful is important. Next time you have an idea, think it through and consider how it might affect other living things before you act.

One day, a girl named Lucy wanted to decorate her room. She loved to listen to her radio while she worked. The radio played fun songs that made her happy. She had a big bag of pretty things to put on her walls.Lucy's mom said, "Be careful with the radio. If you turn it up too loud, it will have a harsh sound." Lucy nodded and promised to be careful. She was excited to make her room look nice.As Lucy decorated her room, she accidentally turned the radio up too loud. The sound was harsh, just like her mom said. Lucy quickly turned the volume down and finished decorating her room. When her mom saw the room, she was very proud of Lucy for making it look so pretty.

Once upon a time, there was a peaceful park. In the park, there was a lot of fun equipment to play with. Kids loved to go to the park and play on the swings, slides, and see-saws.One day, a new boy came to the park. He did not behave well. He pushed other kids and took their toys. The kids in the park were sad and did not want to play anymore.A big girl saw what was happening. She went to the new boy and said, "You need to behave and be nice to others." The new boy listened and started to play nice. Soon, the park was peaceful again, and all the kids were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a lively dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play all day long. He would jump and wag his tail, always happy to see his friends.One day, Spot saw a big red ball. He wanted to perform a trick for his friends. So, he ran very fast and jumped high in the air to catch the ball. His friends clapped and cheered as Spot caught the ball in his mouth.But then, a big car went zoom on the street. Spot did not see the car and ran after the ball. The car hit Spot, and he fell down. Spot's friends were sad, and they cried. Spot did not get up, and they all missed their lively friend.

Once upon a time, there was a witch. The witch lived in a small house. The house was disgusting. It was dirty and smelly. The witch did not like to clean.One day, a little girl walked by the witch's house. The witch saw the little girl and wanted to pinch her. The little girl did not want to be pinched. She was scared and ran away.The witch chased the little girl. The little girl ran very fast. But the witch was faster. The witch pinched the little girl. It hurt. The little girl cried. The witch laughed and went back to her disgusting house. The little girl was sad and went home.

Once upon a time, there was a small dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play in the big country. He liked to find new things and see where they fit. One day, Spot found a big ball. He tried to fit the ball in his mouth, but it was too big. Spot was very persistent. He wanted to play with the ball, so he tried and tried.One day, Spot saw a big hole in the ground. He thought, "Maybe the ball will fit in the hole." Spot rolled the ball to the hole and tried to fit it in. It was too big for the hole too! Spot was sad, but he did not give up. He knew there had to be a place where the ball would fit.Finally, Spot found a big box. He tried to fit the ball in the box, and it worked! The ball fit just right. Spot was so happy. He had been persistent and found the perfect place for his big ball. Now Spot could play with the ball all day long in the big country.

One day, a funny dog named Spot went to the beach with his friend, a little boy named Tim. They loved to play in the sand and swim in the water. Tim brought a big red ball to play with.As they played, Spot saw something shiny in the sand. "What's that?" Tim asked. "I don't know," said Spot, "let's guess!" Tim guessed it was a toy, but Spot guessed it was a treasure.They dug in the sand and found a small box. They opened it and inside was a magic shell! The shell said, "I can give you one wish. What do you want?" Tim and Spot looked at each other and smiled.Tim wished for a big ice cream cone for him and Spot to share. The magic shell made their wish come true! They laughed and enjoyed their ice cream on the beach. They knew it was a day they would never forget.

One day, a girl named Sue went for a walk with her dog, Max. They walked down the street and saw a big park. The park had many turns and paths. Sue and Max ran and played in the park. The sun was high in the sky, and the day was bright and warm.Sue saw her friend, Tom, by a tree. Tom said, "Hi Sue! Can you show me how to get to the swings?" Sue smiled and said, "Of course, Tom! Let's go!" They walked together with Max, taking turns and following the path.As they walked, the sky began to get dark. Sue, Tom, and Max made it to the swings just as the sun was going down. They played on the swings for a little while. Then, they said goodbye and went back home. Sue, Max, and Tom were happy they had a fun day at the park before it got too dark.

Once upon a time, there was a small, slow turtle named Tim. Tim liked to take turns walking with his friends in the woods. One day, Tim saw a big hole in a tree. He thought it would be fun to play in the hole.Tim tried to fit into the hole, but it was a tight turn. He pushed and pushed, but he was too slow. Tim's friends saw him and tried to help. They all pushed together, but Tim was still stuck in the hole.As the sun went down, Tim's friends had to go home. They were sad to leave Tim stuck in the hole. Tim was sad too. He stayed in the hole all night, and he could not get out. The next day, Tim's friends came back to try to help him again, but Tim was still stuck.

Once upon a time, there was a good seal named Sam. Sam lived in the sea with his family. They loved to play in the water and have fun together. One day, Sam saw a ball floating in the water. He wanted to play with it, but he did not know where it came from.Sam decided to find who lost the ball. He swam around and asked his friends if they knew who it belonged to. No one knew, but they all said that if Sam kept looking, he would find the owner. Sam swam far away from his home, but he knew he would return when he found the ball's owner.Finally, Sam found a little girl on the beach, crying. She had lost her ball in the water. Sam gave her the ball, and she was very happy. The girl thanked Sam, and he returned to his family in the sea. Sam felt good for helping the girl. The moral of the story is that it is good to help others, even if it takes some time and effort.

Lila was a modest girl who liked to play with her dolls and draw pictures. She did not have many toys or clothes, but she was happy with what she had. She lived with her mama and papa in a small house that had a ceiling with cracks and stains.One night, Lila had a bad dream. She dreamed that a big monster came out of the ceiling and tried to take her away. She screamed and cried, but no one heard her. She felt very scared and alone.She woke up and saw that it was still dark. She looked at the ceiling and saw no monster, only shadows. She felt a little better, but still shaky. She hugged her doll and whispered, "I hope the monster does not come back. I hope mama and papa are safe. I hope the sun comes soon."She closed her eyes and tried to think of happy things. She thought of her birthday, when mama made a cake and papa gave her a new dress. She thought of her friend, Ben, who shared his crayons and made her laugh. She thought of her teacher, who praised her drawings and taught her new words.She felt a warm hand on her shoulder. It was mama, who had heard her cry. She smiled and said, "Don't worry, my sweet. There is no monster. It was only a dream. Mama and papa are here. The sun will come soon. You are safe and loved."She kissed Lila and tucked her in. Lila felt a wave of relief and gratitude. She said, "Thank you, mama. I love you. You are the best."She snuggled with her doll and fell asleep. She dreamed of happy things. She hoped the monster would never come back. She hoped the ceiling would be fixed. She hoped to have a good day.

Once upon a time there was an adventurous boy named Bob. He loved to explore the world around him. One day Bob decided to go exploring and he set off on an adventure.Suddenly, something happened and Bob got very sick. His parents took him to the hospital so he could get better. Bob stayed at the hospital for a few days and he missed his family and friends.The hospital doctors and nurses were very kind and helped Bob get better. After a few days, Bob was feeling much better. He was ready to go home.At home everyone welcomed Bob back, and they were all so happy to have him home. Bob missed his adventure, but he was happy to be with all his family and friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big blackboard in a small room. The blackboard was lonely because no one came to draw or write on it. The blackboard wanted to have friends to play with and be happy.One day, a small boy came into the room. He saw the lonely blackboard and wanted to help. The boy had an idea. He took a big cup of water and started to drink. Then, he dipped his finger into the water and began to draw on the blackboard.As the boy drew on the blackboard, something unexpected happened. The drawings came to life! The blackboard was not lonely anymore. It had many friends to play with and was very happy.The moral of the story is that sometimes, all it takes is a little bit of love and care to make someone feel happy and not lonely anymore.

Once upon a time, there lived a clever fox. She had a very clumsy shadow that followed her everywhere she went. Every day, the fox ran and played, trying to see how far she could go. But no matter what she did, her clumsy shadow always followed her. One day, the fox had an idea. She wanted to try to destroy her clumsy shadow and be on her own. The fox shouted to her shadow, "Go away, you clumsy one! I don't want to see you ever again." But the shadow didn't budge. It stayed right by the fox's side. The fox yelled, "Please leave me alone! I don't want to have you as my shadow any more." But the shadow refused to listen. It was as if it were glued to the fox's side.The fox got angry. She began chasing her shadow, trying to get rid of it. She jumped over logs, ran through the grass, and eventually corner her shadow near a tree. But no matter how hard the fox tried, she could not destroy her clumsy shadow. In the end, the fox decided it was best to just live with her clumsy shadow. And so, to this day, the fox and her clumsy shadow travel together throughout the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a stubborn little dog named Max. He loved to wander around the town. One day, Max wandered far away from his home and found a big store.Max went inside the store and saw many toys and treats. He wanted to play with the toys and eat the treats, but he didn't know how to ask for them. So, Max decided to wander around the store and look for someone to help him.As Max wandered, he found a kind little girl named Lily. Lily knew Max was lost and wanted to help him. She took Max's paw and showed him where the toys and treats were. Max was so happy and wagged his tail. Together, they played with the toys and shared the treats. From that day on, Max and Lily became best friends and Max promised not to wander away from home again.

Once upon a time, in a deep forest, there lived a little rabbit named Remy. Remy loved to play with his friends and enjoy the warm sun. One day, Remy saw a bright flame in the forest. He was curious and wanted to see what it was.Remy hopped closer to the flame and saw a little bird named Bella. Bella was scared of the flame and didn't know what to do. Remy said, "Don't worry, Bella! I will help you put out the flame."Remy and Bella worked together to put out the flame. They used dirt and water from a nearby stream. After the flame was gone, they were both very happy. Remy and Bella became best friends and enjoyed playing together every day. And they knew that they could always count on each other for help.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park. She took her basket with her. In the basket, she had toys to play with. At the park, she saw a boy named Tim. Tim was weak and could not play well. Lily wanted to help him.Lily said, "Choose a toy from my basket, Tim. We can play together." Tim looked at the basket and chose a ball. They played catch, but Tim was too weak to throw the ball far. Lily had an idea to make the game more fun for Tim.Lily and Tim played a new game. They rolled the ball on the ground, and Tim could do it! But then, something unexpected happened. A dog came and took the ball away. The dog wanted to play too! Lily, Tim, and the dog played together, and they all had fun.

Once there were two friends, a rabbit and a squirrel. The two were very different, but they were still the best of friends. The rabbit loved to sit and eat carrots, while the squirrel was always running around.One day, the two friends were playing near the river. The squirrel was running around, playing tag when suddenly, he saw something big walking across the bridge made of lumber.The squirrel ran over to the rabbit and yelled, "Come over and look at this, quickly!"The rabbit came running over, asking, "What is it?" The squirrel said, "I don't know, but it's different and it's really big".The friends both got a closer look, and they saw it was a bear! The bear was walking across the lumber bridge, and it was a very strange sight.The two friends were so happy to see such a different creature and they started jumping up and down and yelling with joy.

Once upon a time, there was a white bunny named Bobo. Bobo had a goal. He wanted to find the biggest carrot in the world. So, he went on a trip to find it.One day, Bobo met a big bear named Benny. Benny said, "I know where the biggest carrot is. I will reveal it to you if you give me some honey." Bobo agreed and gave Benny the honey. Benny showed Bobo a big hole in the ground. "The carrot is down there," Benny said.Bobo jumped into the hole to get the carrot. But it was very dark, and he could not see. He fell and hurt his leg. Bobo could not get out of the hole. He was very sad. The moral of the story is: do not trust strangers who want something from you.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a little squirrel named Sam. Sam was a careful squirrel who liked to find acorns to eat. Every day, he would look for acorns under the big trees.One day, Sam found a very big acorn. He was very happy and wanted to gain more. So, he looked and looked for more acorns. Sam found many acorns and put them in his little home.As Sam was careful, he knew that he needed to save some acorns for later. So, he hid some acorns in a secret place. Sam was happy that he gained so many acorns, and he knew he would have enough to eat for a long time.

One day, a modern box was in a room. A boy saw the box and wanted to open it. The box said, "Do not open me." The boy did not listen and tried to open the box.The box was sad and replied, "Please do not open me. It will not be good." The boy did not care and kept trying to open the box. The box was very upset.At last, the boy opened the box. A big mess came out of the box. The boy was not happy. The room was not clean anymore. The boy learned to listen when someone says no.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely dog named Spike. Spike had no friends to play with. One day, Spike went for a walk in the park. He saw a big ball and ran to it. As Spike got closer, he stopped to examine the ball. It looked very fun to play with. When he touched the ball, something unexpected happened. The ball started to talk!"Hi, Spike!" said the ball. "I'm Bally. I've been waiting for someone to play with me!" Spike was very surprised, but he was also happy. Now, Spike and Bally play together every day, and they are never lonely again.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a pink yogurt cup in the fridge. She wanted to eat it, but she needed help to open it. Mia went to her big sister, Lily, and asked, "Can you open the yogurt for me?"Lily smiled and said, "Yes, I can help you." She opened the pink yogurt cup for Mia, and Mia was very happy. She sat down and started to eat her yummy yogurt.While Mia was eating, her friend Tom came over to play. Tom saw the pink yogurt and said, "I like yogurt too!" Mia shared her yogurt with Tom, and they both enjoyed the tasty treat. After they finished the yogurt, they played with their toys and had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had long, messy hair. One day, she found a comb in her room. She wanted to make her hair pretty. So, she tried to comb her hair. But, she did not know how to use the comb. She was ignorant about it.Lucy's mom saw her trying to comb her hair. She said, "Lucy, let me help you." Lucy asked, "How do you use the comb, Mom?" Her mom replied, "You need to gently squeeze the comb and move it through your hair."As Lucy's mom started to comb her hair, something unexpected happened. The comb started to talk! The comb said, "Thank you for using me! I have been waiting for someone to comb their hair with me." Lucy and her mom were very surprised. They never knew that combs could talk!

One day, a bunny named Bob went for a hop. The sun was high and the grass was dry. Bob liked to hop on his strong legs. As he hopped, he saw a big tree with a small bird on a branch."Hi, bird!" said Bob. "Do you want to hop with me?""Sure, Bob!" said the bird. "I can hop too, even though I have little legs!"So, Bob and the bird hopped together. They hopped over dry leaves and small rocks. They laughed and played all day.As the sun went down, Bob and the bird were tired. They sat under the big tree to rest their legs. They smiled at each other, happy to have a new friend who liked to hop just like them.From that day on, Bob and the bird met under the tree every day to hop and play together. And they were the best of friends.

Once upon a time there was an adorable little girl named Daisy. Daisy lived in a small house with a tiny bedroom. Some nights, Daisy would lay in her bed and pray for something special.One night, something magical happened. Out of thin air, a sparkly genie appeared in Daisy’s bedroom. The genie told Daisy she would grant her three wishes. Daisy’s eyes grew wide with excitement and she knew what she wanted without hesitation.Unfortunately, the genie told Daisy she would only grant one wish, and Daisy had her heart set on all three. Daisy was so sad she began to cry.The genie felt so sorry for Daisy she said she could make all of her wishes come true. Daisy’s tears dried up and with a bright smile she thanked the genie, and together they made Daisy’s dreams come true.

One summer day, a boy named Tim went to play outside. He had a red ball to throw. He liked to throw it very high and far. The sun was hot and the sky was blue. Tim was very happy.Tim saw a big tree with lots of birds. The birds were loud. He wanted to play with them. So, he threw his red ball at the tree. The birds got scared and flew away. But something unexpected happened.When the red ball hit the tree, it made a loud noise. A big, friendly dog came out from behind the tree. The dog had the red ball in his mouth. Tim was surprised, but happy. Now, he had a new friend to play with and throw the ball for. They played all summer and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time there were two good friends, Tom and Jane. Tom always had a jolly attitude and Jane always admired his positive outlook. One day, Tom heard a sound coming from the woods behind their house. They decided to go and find out where it was coming from. Once they arrived at the source, they were surprised to see a little bird stuck in a bush. It was crying for help and Tom instantly wanted to help. Jane was scared because the bird was much bigger than them, but Tom stayed brave and admired how the little bird was so determined. Tom used a big stick to eventually free the bird, and the bird flew away with a loud chirp. As they were walking home, they shared a lesson they learned that day. It was that even when things seem hard and scary, we should still have the courage to try and help. Tom and Jane smiled at each other and continued jolly on their way home.

Once upon a time, there was a huge balloon. It was red and shiny. A little girl named Lucy loved the balloon very much. Her mother gave it to her as a gift. Lucy and her mother went to the park to play with the balloon.At the park, Lucy held the balloon tightly. She was scared it would fly away. Her mother said, "Don't worry, I am here to help you." They played with the balloon together, laughing and having fun.Suddenly, a strong wind came. Lucy felt the balloon pulling away from her. She was scared and called her mother for help. Her mother held her hand and said, "Let's release the balloon together." They both let go of the balloon and watched it fly high into the sky. Lucy was happy because she shared a special moment with her mother.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly bird named Bob. Bob loved to soar high in the sky. One day, while flying, Bob saw a shiny crystal on the ground.Bob picked up the crystal and took it to his friend, a wise old owl. The owl told Bob that the crystal was magic. It could make one wish come true. Bob was so happy and excited. He thought hard about what he should wish for.Bob wished to be the best at soaring. Suddenly, the crystal turned him into a big, strong eagle! Bob was so surprised. He thought he would stay a small friendly bird forever. Now, Bob could soar higher and faster than ever before. And he was still the friendly bird everyone loved.

Once upon a time, there was a baby. She was walking in a tidy park. The park was full of grass, trees and flowers.The baby said, "This is so pretty!"A lady walking in the park stopped and said, "Yes it is. You have to take care of it and keep it tidy" The baby nodded and kept walking. She saw an old man sitting on a bench. The baby went over to him and asked, "What are you doing?" The old man replied, "I'm just sitting here in the sun. It's nice and warm."The baby said, "I like it too. I'm going to take a walk"The old man smiled and said, "Good idea. Have fun walking!"The baby said, "Thank you". She waved goodbye and started walking. She walked around the park and enjoyed the sights and smells. When she was done, she went back to the old man and said, "That was fun!".The old man smiled and said, "Yes it was. You kept it tidy. Good job!" The baby was happy and smiled. She thanked the old man and continued walking, taking in all the beauty of the park.

One day, a cat named Tom saw a hoop. The hoop was different. It was big and red. Tom liked to play with hoops, so he went to the hoop.Tom played with the hoop all day. He jumped and ran around it. But then, he saw something. A big, soft bed lay near the hoop. Tom was very tired from playing, so he lay on the bed.When Tom lay on the bed, he heard a sound. It was a big surprise! The hoop opened up and out came many small hoops. The small hoops were different colors. Tom was so happy! He played with the new hoops and had the best day ever.

Lily liked to play with her toys in the garden. She had a doll, a car, a ball and a box. She was very creative and made up stories with them. One day, she saw a big pile of vegetables in the corner of the garden. They were old and brown and smelled bad. Lily wondered what they were.She asked her mom, who was working in the kitchen. "Mom, what are those things in the garden? Can I play with them?"Mom looked out of the window and saw the vegetables. She frowned and said, "No, Lily, you can't play with them. They are vegetables that we didn't eat. They are rotten. That means they are not good anymore. They can make you sick. We have to throw them away."Lily was curious. She wanted to see the rotten vegetables up close. She waited until mom was busy and sneaked out of the door. She ran to the pile of vegetables and picked up a carrot. It was soft and mushy and had holes in it. Lily thought it looked funny. She put it in her box and looked for more.She found a tomato, a potato, a cucumber and a lettuce. They were all rotten and smelly. Lily thought they were interesting. She put them in her box and carried it to her toys. She decided to make a new story with them. She said, "This is the princess, this is the prince, this is the horse, this is the castle and this is the dragon. They are going on an adventure."She played with her toys and the rotten vegetables for a while. She had fun and forgot about mom. She didn't notice that the vegetables were dripping juice and dirt on her clothes and hair. She also didn't notice that a fly was buzzing around her head.Mom finished her work and came out of t

One day, a boy named Tim was very sad. His day was dull and he was bored. He wanted to do something fun. His mom saw him and said, "Tim, do not be sad. We can make a dessert together!" Tim's eyes lit up, and he got very excited.They went to the kitchen and started to make a big cake. But, they did not have all the things they needed. Tim's mom started to panic. "Oh no, we need more eggs!" she said. Tim thought for a moment and then smiled. "Mom, I have an idea!" he said.Tim took his mom to the backyard. There, he showed her a big surprise. He had found a hen that laid eggs! Tim's mom was so happy. They got the eggs they needed and made the cake. It was the best dessert they ever had. And Tim's dull day turned into a fun day.

The little girl was very happy. She was in the classroom and saw a new desk. She ran up to it and started to clap her hands."Look at this desk!" She said to her teacher. "It's so interesting!"The teacher smiled and said, "Yes, it sure is! Why don't you have a seat and have a look?"The little girl nodded and sat down. She ran her hands along the desk and looked all around it. She smiled when she saw the drawers and opened them. Inside she found lots of interesting things to play with.The teacher watched her with a smile. "Full of surprises, isn't it?" She said.The little girl nodded and clapped her hands with excitement. "I love this desk!" She said and hugged it tightly.

Once upon a time, there was a big, ugly monster. The monster liked to take things from the people in the town. One day, a little girl named Lucy wanted to stop the monster. She wanted to win and make the town happy again.Lucy went to the monster's house. She saw the monster taking more things. Lucy said, "No, stop!" The monster did not want to listen, but Lucy did not resist. She kept saying, "No, stop!" The monster looked at her and was very mad.Lucy did not give up. She said, "No, stop!" one more time. The monster was tired of Lucy saying this. So, the monster gave all the things back to the people. Lucy had won! The town was happy again, and the ugly monster learned not to take things anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny called Tim. He loved watching TV every day. One day he hopped to the TV and saw something strange. He saw an orange, hairy cat. The cat said hello. Tim was very surprised. He asked the cat how it got there.The cat said it wanted to see what was on the TV too. Tim laughed and said it was a good idea.The two of them started hopping around the room, trying to find the best spot to watch TV. The cat jumped onto the couch, while Tim hopped up onto a chair. They both agreed it was the best place to watch TV.So every day, Tim and the orange, hairy cat would hop to the TV together and watch their favourite shows. They had so much fun together and it was the best TV time ever!

Once upon a time, there was a mighty cat named Tom. Tom loved to catch things. He would catch balls, mice, and even his own tail. One day, Tom heard a sound coming from the garden. It was a bird singing a pretty song.Tom went to the garden to see the bird. He saw it sitting on a tree branch. Tom said to the bird, "Hey bird, can I catch you?" The bird looked at Tom and said, "No, Tom, you cannot catch me. I am too fast for you."Tom was sad but he did not give up. He tried to catch the bird every day. The bird would always fly away, laughing. One day, Tom thought of a plan. He hid behind a bush and waited for the bird to come near. When the bird came close, Tom jumped out and caught it.The bird was surprised and said, "Wow, Tom, you are a mighty cat. You caught me!" Tom let the bird go and they became friends. From that day on, they played together in the garden, and Tom never tried to catch the bird again.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and jump all day with his friends. One day, Spot saw a big ball. He wanted to play with it, but a cat named Whiskers wanted it too.Spot and Whiskers started to fight over the ball. They pulled and tugged, but no one could have it. Spot said, "I want the ball!" Whiskers said, "No, I want it!" They were very mad at each other.Then, a wise old owl saw them fight. The owl said, "Stop! The ball has value to both of you. You should share it and play together." Spot and Whiskers thought about it, and they agreed. They played with the ball together and had lots of fun. They learned that sharing was better than fighting.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the bus stop. He saw a big, red bus coming. Tim was happy because he liked to ride the bus. It was fun to go up and down the hills.On the bus, Tim met a new friend. Her name was Sue. Sue had a tasty snack. She shared her snack with Tim. They both liked the snack a lot. Sue mentioned that she got the snack from her mom.Then, the bus stopped. Tim and Sue were sad because it was time to go home. They said goodbye and got off the bus. Tim walked home, but he felt sad because he missed his new friend Sue. The day was not so fun anymore.

One day, a big bird and a small bird were friends. The big bird was strong and could work hard. The small bird was delicate and could not work as hard.The two birds decided to build a nest together. Big bird said, "I will work hard and carry the big sticks. You can carry the small sticks." They worked together to make the nest.One day, while they were working, small bird had a fall. Small bird said, "Ouch! I fell and it hurts." Big bird stopped working and went to help small bird. They both learned that even though small bird was delicate, they could still work together and be friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. Lily loved to go to the market with her mom. She always wanted to help her mom pick out the best fruits and vegetables.One day, it was very icy outside. Lily put on her warm coat, hat, and gloves. Her mom said, "Lily, be careful! The ground is icy, and you might slip." Lily knew her mom was right, so she walked slowly and carefully.When they got to the market, Lily saw her friend Tom. They played together while their moms shopped. Lily and Tom had a lot of fun. They knew the market was a special place where they could see their friends and help their moms.

Once upon a time there was a charming bird. She wanted to fly around the world. One day, she set off with her wings spread wide. But when she arrived at her destination, she saw a tear in her left wing. She was so sad and worried that she wouldn't be able to fly again.Suddenly, she heard a voice behind her. "Don't worry, my little birdy," said a kind, old woman. "I'll help you make your wing better again."The kind old woman took out a needle and some thread. Carefully, she sewed the tear up with the stitch. The bird watched, amazed at the woman's skill.After some time, the woman said, "There, all done! Now you can fly again."The bird was so happy and thanked the kind old woman. Then, with a smile on her face, she spread her wings wide again and flew off into the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a strong bird named Tim. Tim could fly very high and very fast. He lived in a big tree with many other birds. They all liked to play and sing together.One day, Tim saw a big, yummy treat far away from his home. He wanted to eat it, so he decided to leave his tree and fly to the treat. Tim's friends were sad to see him go, but they knew he would come back soon.As Tim flew closer to the treat, he saw that it was not a treat at all! It was a big, colorful kite stuck in a tree. Tim felt silly, but he was happy to find a new toy. He played with the kite and then went back to his tree. His friends were happy to see him and they all played with the kite together.

John was happy and ready to go. He grabbed his camera, hopped in the car, and his dad drove away. The sun was shining and the wind was blowing their hair. They drove for a long time until they reached the ocean. John was so excited to take pictures of the waves crashing against the shore. But then his dad stopped the car. He said, "We can go take pictures of the ocean later. Now, I'm going to take you to get something to eat. I'm hungry and I know you must be too!" John smiled and nodded. He was never one to turn down food, especially when he was hungry.They drove a few more minutes, until they arrived at John's favorite restaurant. The smell of food was everywhere and John's mouth started to water. He skipped to the door and said, "I'm so excited. I can't wait to eat!" His dad laughed and opened the door for him. John knew that this was not a regular restaurant visit. He was excited to see what was in store for him. As John ate, he remembered his dad's words from earlier and realized why he wanted to drive to the restaurant first. John enjoyed his meal, and then they drove back to the ocean. He took pictures of the waves while his dad laughed and watched him. The day had been perfect and full of surprises!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy had a neighbor named Tim. Tim had a big, red ball that he liked to play with every day. Amy did not have a big, red ball, and she was jealous.One day, Amy dared herself to go ask Tim if she could play with his big, red ball. She walked to his house and said, "Hi Tim, can I play with your big, red ball?" Tim said, "Yes, Amy, you can play with my big, red ball."Amy and Tim played with the big, red ball all day. They had so much fun together. Amy was not jealous anymore. She was happy because she had a new friend to play with. They both learned that sharing is more fun than being jealous.

One day, a cute penguin was playing with a toy. He liked to use the toy to make fun sounds. He had a friend, a big bear. The bear liked the sounds too.The penguin and the bear were playing when they heard a new sound. "What is that?" asked the penguin. "I don't know, let's go see," said the bear. They walked to the sound and saw a little bird.The little bird was sad. "Why are you sad?" asked the penguin. The bird said, "I can't make fun sounds like you." The penguin and the bear had an idea. They gave the bird the toy to use.The bird used the toy and made a big, fun sound. The bird was happy, and they all played together. The cute penguin, the big bear, and the little bird were now best friends.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Joe wanted to ride his bike but he was having trouble. He went to ask his mom for help."Mom, I need some new gear for my bike," Joe said.Mom smiled and said, "Well, let's take a look and see what we can find."So, together they walked to the bike shop. Once inside, Joe saw lots of cool bike gear he wanted to try."Which one should I get?" he asked, feeling excited and a little overwhelmed.Mom said, "Let's take a look, but maybe we should get something that's strong and persistent."Joe thought hard and, in the end, chose some extra-strong gears to make sure his bike stayed in good condition. He was so proud of his first biking gear purchase and couldn't wait to go out for a ride!

Once upon a time, there was a big purple car. The car had four round tires. One day, one tire went flat. The car could not go fast anymore. The car was sad.A kind man saw the car and said, "Don't be sad, car. I can help you!" The man had a tool to raise the car. He raised the car and took off the flat tire. He put on a new tire that was not flat. The car was happy.Just then, a big wind came. It blew the man's hat far away. The purple car wanted to help the kind man. The car went fast on its new tire and caught the hat. The man was so happy, and he thanked the car. They both laughed and became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very creative. She liked to play with a long string. She made many things with it. She made a necklace, a bracelet, and even a toy for her cat.One day, Lily found a big box. She believed there was something fun inside. She used her string to open the box. When she opened it, she found many colorful balls. Lily was very happy.Lily used the string and the balls to make more things. She made a pretty dress for her doll, a hat for her cat, and a big picture on the wall. Lily loved her string and her creative ideas. She played with them all day long.

Once upon a time, a large dog named Max was in his stay. Max wanted to go out and play. He saw his friend, a small cat named Lily, outside. Max felt sad because he could not play with Lily.One day, Max found a zip on his stay. He pulled the zip with his mouth. Max was happy because he could go outside. Max ran to Lily and they played together. They had a lot of fun.But Max did not know that the zip was there to keep him safe. A big car came and Max did not see it. The car hit Max and he was hurt. Max should have stayed in his stay. The zip was there to keep Max from getting hurt.

Once upon a time, there was a purple frog. One day the frog was hopping through the grass when he heard a loud noise. The frog froze in fear and looked around. He saw a little girl and the girl said, "Hello, frog!"The frog was very nervous, but he was curious about the little girl. He asked her, "Why are you here?"The little girl smiled and said, "I have come to set you free."The frog was so happy and he hopped in the little girl's hand. She opened the door and set him free.The frog croaked in joy and said goodbye to the little girl. He hopped away, thankful for his freedom. He was very happy to be free.The little girl watched him hop away and smiled in satisfaction.The purple frog was free!

One day, a little girl named Lily went to play on the lawn. She saw a small, confused bird on the grass. The bird could not fly, and it was crying. Lily felt sad for the bird.Lily said to the bird, "Why do you cry?" The bird said, "I can't fly. I am lost and I miss my mom." Lily wanted to help the bird find its mom.Lily picked up the bird and walked around the lawn. They looked for the bird's mom. Soon, they found her. The bird stopped crying and was happy. Lily felt happy too, because she helped the bird.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play in Anna's room. Anna has a lamp that makes funny shapes on the wall. Ben likes the lamp too.One day, Anna's mom says they have to move to a new house. Anna is sad. She does not want to leave her room and her lamp. She tells Ben."I will miss you and my lamp," Anna says."I will miss you too," Ben says. "Can you take your lamp with you?""No, mom says it is too big. She says we will have a new lamp in the new house. But I like this lamp. It is my friend."Anna and Ben hug. They say goodbye.Anna and her mom go to the new house. Anna does not like it. It is small and dark. There is no lamp in her room. Anna cries."Mom, I want my lamp. I miss my lamp. And I miss Ben.""I'm sorry, Anna. We can't go back. We have to stay here. This is our new home."Anna is angry. She thinks her mom is rude. She does not understand why they have to move. She does not want a new home. She wants her old home and her old lamp and her old friend. She feels lonely.

Once there was a deaf bear who lived in a small cave near the forest. One day, the bear was feeling hot, so he decided to go for a bath in the river. He slowly made his way down the rocky path, but when he arrived at the river he found that the water was too deep for him to stand. He tried to turn around, but he had gone so far he couldn't make it back. He tried to call for help, but he was deaf, so nobody heard him. He looked around, and he saw a switch next to the river bank. He pressed the switch and a bridge appeared out of nowhere. With the bridge, the bear was able to cross the river and bathe in the cool water. When the bear was done bathing, he thanked the switch and scampered back home. He was squeezy clean and refreshed. It was the best bath he had ever had.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to visit her grandma. Grandma lived in a house with a wide garden. Lucy liked to play there with her toys. She had a toy case with many dolls and cars.One sunny day, Lucy went to visit her grandma. She brought her toy case to play in the garden. While playing, she saw a little boy named Tim. Tim was sad because he had no toys. Lucy thought for a moment and said, "Tim, do you want to play with my toys?"Tim's face lit up with joy. He said, "Yes, please!" Lucy shared her toys with Tim, and they played together all day. They had lots of fun and became good friends.The moral of the story is to always share your things with others. Sharing makes everyone happy and helps you make new friends.

Lily and Tom were friends who liked to play outside. They had a game where they pretended to be birds and flew around the trees. Lily was a light blue bird and Tom was a dark green bird. They made happy noises and flapped their arms.One day, a big wind came and blew the leaves and branches. Lily and Tom tried to fly, but the wind was too strong. It pushed them back and made them fall. Tom got scared and said, "I quit! This game is too hard. I want to go home."Lily did not want to quit. She liked the game and wanted to keep flying. She said, "Don't quit, Tom. We can do it. We have spirit. Spirit means we are brave and strong and we don't give up. Come on, let's try again."Tom looked at Lily and saw her light blue eyes. He saw that she was not afraid of the wind. He felt a warm feeling in his chest. He said, "Okay, Lily. I will try again. You are right. We have spirit. Let's be birds again."Lily and Tom flapped their arms and ran against the wind. They felt the wind lift them up and make them fly. They made happy noises and flew around the trees. They had fun and felt proud. They learned that spirit can help them overcome challenges and enjoy life.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to paint. One sunny day, she went outside to play and paint.Amy saw a big tree with rough bark. She also saw a root sticking out of the ground. Amy thought it would be fun to paint the tree and root with bright colors.Amy painted the rough bark with red, blue, and yellow. She painted the root with green and orange. The tree looked so pretty! Amy was very happy with her painting. She went inside to show her mom and dad her beautiful work.Her mom and dad loved the colorful tree and root. They were so proud of Amy. They put her painting on the fridge for everyone to see.From that day on, Amy painted many more beautiful pictures. She loved to share her art with her family and friends. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big, nice pond. In the pond, there were fish, frogs, and ducks. The ducks liked to swim and play in the water all day long.One day, a reliable dog named Max came to the pond. Max wanted to help the ducks. He saw that the ducks had many things to carry. Max said, "I can help you load your things.""Thank you, Max!" said the ducks. They were very happy. Max was strong and could carry many things. The ducks gave Max their things to load on his back. Max carried the things for the ducks, and they all went to a party by the pond.At the party, Max, the ducks, and all their friends had a lot of fun. They played games, ate yummy food, and laughed. Max was happy that he could help the ducks. The ducks were happy, too. They all had a great day by the pond.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a big basket. He was very excite. He wanted to show it to his friend, Sally. He ran to her house and knocked on the door.Sally opened the door and saw the basket. "Wow! What a big basket!" she said. They both laughed and played with the basket. They put silly things in it like toys, hats, and even a cat!As they played, they saw a little girl crying. They asked her, "Why are you sad?" The little girl said, "I lost my toy." Tim and Sally looked at each other and decided to help her find her toy.They searched and searched. Finally, they found the toy and put it in the basket. They gave it to the little girl. She was so happy and said, "Thank you!" Tim and Sally felt good for helping her.The moral of the story is: It is good to help others when they are sad.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dad went to the store. They wanted to buy some fireworks for a party. Tim was very excited. He wanted to see the fireworks go up in the sky and make pretty colors.At the store, Tim's dad was very careful. He picked the best fireworks and put them in the cart. Tim helped his dad load the fireworks into the car. They both could not wait for the party.On the day of the party, Tim and his dad set up the fireworks. When it was time to start, they lit the first firework. But instead of going up, it went down! It made a big hole in the ground. Tim and his dad laughed. They did not know the fireworks were magic! The hole led to a secret room full of more fun fireworks. The party was even better than they thought it would be.

John and Dad were walking along the street. Dad stopped to point at a car parked in the next street "That's a nice car, John," said Dad.John shook his head. "It's gross," he said.Dad laughed. "Maybe it's a bit old," he said.John disagreed and crossed his arms over his chest. "It's disgusting," he said.Dad patted him on the shoulder. "Now I know you prefer dogs," he said, pointing to a little pup wearing a blue collar.John grinned. "That's cute," he said."See, I told you," said Dad.John nodded and they walked home together.

Once upon a time, there was a big red bus. The bus was very lucky, and it could solve problems. One day, a little girl named Amy got on the bus. She was sad because she lost her toy. The bus wanted to help Amy.The bus said, "Don't cry, Amy! I can solve your problem. Let's go find your toy!" Amy stopped crying and smiled. The bus started to drive around the town, looking for the toy. They looked in the park, at the store, and near the school.Finally, they found the toy near a big tree. But when they got closer, they saw a mean dog guarding the toy. The bus tried to scare the dog away, but the dog didn't move. Amy was very sad because she couldn't get her toy back. The bus felt bad, but it couldn't solve the problem this time.

One day, a little boy went to visit his uncle. His uncle lived in a small house near a big tree. The boy liked to play and explore. He liked to examine things too. The uncle was slow and liked to rest.The boy found a small box under the big tree. He was very excited. He called his uncle to look at the box. The uncle came slowly and looked at the box with the boy. They opened the box together.Inside the box, they found a note. The note said, "Be kind and share." The boy and his uncle smiled. They decided to share the box with their friends. The friends were happy, and they all played together. The boy learned that sharing is good and makes others happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big red ambulance. It had an incredible job to do. It helped people who were hurt or sick.One day, the ambulance had to go help a little boy who fell off his bike. The ambulance raced down the street with its lights flashing and siren loud. The little boy saw the ambulance and felt better already.The ambulance had to struggle to get through the busy street. Cars moved out of the way to let the ambulance pass. Finally, the ambulance reached the little boy. The helpers inside made sure the little boy was okay. The boy said thank you to the incredible ambulance and its helpers. They all smiled and went back to their important job.

Once there was a girl called Anna. She was very selfish and liked to keep things for herself.One day, Anna was playing in the garden when she saw something exciting. Lying on the grass was a nice, juicy steak! Anna smiled and quickly scooped the steak up. She closed her hand around it, not wanting to share.Just then, a voice said,"Anna, what are you doing?" Anna looked up to see her brother standing there. He had seen her take the steak! Anna was very embarrassed. "It's mine," she said, her voice squeaking. "But you can't keep it all to yourself," said her brother. "It's not very nice to be so selfish!"Anna thought for a moment. Then she reluctantly opened her hand and gave the steak to her brother. "Here you go," she said.Her brother smiled and thanked her.  Then he closed the hand around the steak and ran off to share it with their friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Max. Max lived in a house near the west. He liked to play with his ball and run in the yard.One day, Max met a little cat named Bella. Bella wanted to play with Max's ball, but Max was selfish. He didn't want to share his ball with Bella. Bella felt sad and asked, "Can I please play with your ball?"Max thought for a moment and decided to reply, "Okay, Bella. We can play together." They played with the ball and had lots of fun. Max learned that sharing was more fun than being selfish. From that day on, Max and Bella were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot had a big network of friends. They all lived in a small town. They liked to play and have fun together.One day, a terrible storm came to the town. The wind blew hard and the rain fell fast. Spot and his friends were scared. They trembled because they did not like the storm.Spot had an idea. He told his friends to come to his house. They all went to Spot's house and played games inside. They did not tremble anymore. The storm went away and they were all happy.

Once upon a time, in a beautiful park, there was a big white dog. The dog loved to play and run around. One day, the dog met a little girl named Lily. Lily had a toy that could spray water. The dog and Lily became friends."Let's play!" said Lily. The dog wagged its tail and barked happily. Lily used her toy to spray water, and the dog jumped and tried to catch the water. They laughed and played for a long time.Then, something unexpected happened. A big cloud came and started to spray rain on them. Lily and the dog looked at each other and laughed. They danced and played in the rain, having more fun than ever. The rain made their playtime even more special. And from that day on, Lily and the dog loved to play in the rain together.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play in the park with their mom and dad. The park has swings, slides, and a big pond with ducks. Lily and Ben love to feed the ducks with bread crumbs.One day, mom and dad tell them a story about the park. They say the park is very old and has a lot of history. History means things that happened a long time ago. Mom and dad say the park used to be a farm with cows, sheep, and horses. They also say the park used to have a castle with a king and a queen.Lily and Ben are amazed by the story. They want to see the farm and the castle. They ask mom and dad where they are. Mom and dad point to a hill and a tower. They say the hill is where the farm was and the tower is what is left of the castle. They say the farm and the castle are gone now because they were destroyed by a wild fire. Wild means not tame or not nice.Lily and Ben feel sad for the farm and the castle. They wonder how the fire started and if anyone got hurt. They ask mom and dad more questions. Mom and dad say they don't know all the answers, but they say the fire was a long time ago and no one lives there now. They say the park is a safe and happy place now for people and animals.Lily and Ben feel better. They thank mom and dad for the story. They say they like the park and the history. They say they want to learn more about the past and the present. They run to the swings and slides and have fun. They also wave to the ducks and say hello. They are glad they have a park to play in.

Lila and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to run, slide and swing. They saw a big hill with colorful flowers. They wanted to climb the hill and smell the flowers."Come on, Ben, let's go up the hill!" Lila said."OK, Lila, but be careful. The hill is steep and there might be spikes on the flowers," Ben said.They started to climb the hill. They held hands and helped each other. They saw many beautiful flowers. Some were red, some were yellow, some were blue. They smelled sweet and fresh."Wow, these flowers are so pretty! Can we pick some?" Lila asked."No, Lila, we can't. The flowers belong to the hill and the bees. If we pick them, they will die and the hill will be sad. And the bees might sting us if we take their food," Ben said."But I want to have a flower for Mommy. She will be happy if I give her a flower," Lila said."Lila, you don't need to give Mommy a flower to make her happy. She loves you no matter what. And you can draw her a picture of the flowers instead. That way, the flowers can remain on the hill and the bees can have their food," Ben said.Lila thought about it. She realized that Ben was right. She didn't want to hurt the flowers or the bees. She wanted to be kind and respectful to nature. She smiled and hugged Ben."OK, Ben, you are a good brother. Let's go down the hill and draw Mommy a picture of the flowers. Maybe we can also draw a bee and a hill," Lila said.They went down the hill and found some paper and crayons. They drew a colorful picture of the flowers, the bee and the hill. They wrote "We love you, Mommy" on the bottom. They ran to Mommy and gave her the pic

Lily liked to think about her grandma. Grandma was elderly, but she was very kind and fun. She had white hair and glasses, and she always gave Lily hugs and cookies. Lily loved to visit grandma's house, where she could play with her toys and books.One day, Lily and her mom went to see grandma. Lily was very happy, and she ran to the door. But when she saw grandma, she was surprised. Grandma had a big bandage on her head, and she looked sad. Lily asked mom what happened.Mom said, "Grandma had a fall, and she hurt her head. She had to go to the hospital, and they fixed her up. But she needs to rest and be careful for a while. She might not remember everything, or she might get confused. That's why she has the bandage."Lily felt sorry for grandma. She wanted to make her feel better. She thought of something. She ran to her backpack, and took out a drawing. She had made it for grandma, with crayons and stickers. It was a picture of Lily and grandma, holding hands and smiling. Lily wrote "I love you, grandma" on it, with mom's help.She gave the drawing to grandma, and said, "This is for you, grandma. This is us. We are happy. You are my grandma, and I am your Lily. I love you very much. Do you like it?"Grandma looked at the drawing, and smiled. She hugged Lily, and said, "Thank you, Lily. This is very beautiful. I love you, too. You are my Lily, and I am your grandma. That is true. You make me happy." She put the drawing on her table, where she could see it.Lily was glad. She thought she had done a good thing. She kissed grandma, and said, "You're welcome, grandma. I hope you get better soon. Y

One day, a cat and a dog were playing near a tap. They were very happy. The cat saw the tap and had an idea. She wanted to start a game with the dog. The cat said, "Let's see who can jump over the tap!"The dog was excited and agreed to play. They took turns jumping over the tap. The cat jumped very high, but the dog was not so good at jumping. The dog felt guilty because he could not jump as high as the cat. He wanted to win the game, so he thought of a plan.The dog went behind the tap and pushed it. The tap started to move! The cat was surprised and could not jump over the tap anymore. The dog started to laugh, but then the tap fell down and water came out. The cat and the dog were wet and cold, but they learned to play fair and have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a man who had a staff. This staff was very special because it could glow. The man was not very nice, and he used the staff's light in a harsh way. He would shine the light in people's eyes and make them sad.One day, the man met a nice girl. The girl saw the glowing staff and thought it was very pretty. She asked the man if she could hold it. The man was mean and said no. The girl was sad but still wanted to be friends with the man.As they spent time together, the girl showed the man how to be kind. The man started to change and became nicer. One day, he let the girl hold the staff, and something unexpected happened. The staff's glow became even brighter and more beautiful. The man realized that being kind made the staff's light better. From then on, the man and the girl used the glowing staff to bring happiness to others. The moral of the story is that being kind makes everything better.

Tim and Mia are twins. They like to play in the bathroom. They turn on the faucet and splash water on each other. They laugh and giggle.But one day, Tim wants to play with the faucet by himself. He pushes Mia away and says, "This is my faucet. Go away!"Mia is sad and angry. She says, "No, this is our faucet. We share!"Tim says, "No, we don't. I am bigger and stronger. You are small and weak."Mia says, "That is not nice. You are mean and fierce."Tim says, "I don't care. You can't have the faucet."Mia tries to grab the faucet, but Tim pushes her again. She falls on the floor and cries.Mom hears the noise and comes to the bathroom. She sees Tim and Mia fighting. She is not happy.She says, "What are you doing? Why are you fighting?"Tim says, "I want the faucet. Mia wants the faucet. But it is mine."Mia says, "No, it is ours. Tim is fierce. He pushed me."Mom says, "Stop it. The faucet is not a toy. You can't play with it. You can't push your sister. You have to share and be kind."She makes Tim and Mia sit on the bed and think about what they did. She says, "You can't play in the bathroom until you say sorry to each other."Tim and Mia sit on the bed. They are quiet and sad. They look at each other. They feel sorry.They say, "Sorry, Tim. Sorry, Mia."They hug and make up. They say, "We love you, Tim. We love you, Mia."Mom hears them and smiles. She says, "That's better. Now you can play together. But not in the bathroom. Go to the living room and play with your toys."Tim and Mia say, "Okay, Mom. Thank you, Mom."They go to the living room and play with their toys. They share and are kind. They are

Once upon a time, there was a little adorable bird named Billy. Billy had many colorful feathers. One day, Billy found a very special feather on the ground.Billy showed the feather to his friend, Tommy the turtle. "Look, Tommy! I found a special feather," said Billy. "Wow! It's so pretty," replied Tommy.Billy and Tommy decided to separate the special feather from the other feathers. They put the special feather in a safe place. Every day, they looked at the special feather and smiled. They were very happy to have such a special treasure.

Once upon a time, in a modern village, there was a big swamp. Many kids liked to play near the swamp, but they were told not to go too close.One day, Tim and Sam went to the swamp. Tim said, "Let's make a big splash in the water!" Sam was scared but didn't want to say no. They both jumped in the swamp and made a big splash.In the swamp, they saw a big, mean frog. The frog did not like the splash they made. The frog said, "You make me mad! You should not be here!" Tim and Sam were very scared.The frog chased Tim and Sam out of the swamp. They ran all the way back to the village. They were so scared, they never went back to the swamp again. And the big, mean frog stayed in the swamp, making sure no one would bother him again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a toy car that he loved. Tim's friend, Sam, was jealous. Sam wanted a toy car too.One day, Tim's mom gave him a label. Tim put the label on his toy car. It had his name on it. Now everyone knew the toy car was his.The next day, Sam saw the label and had an idea. He gave Tim a new toy car with a label on it. The label had both their names. Now they could play with toy cars together. They were both happy and not jealous anymore.

Tim and Sam are brothers. They like to play with their cars and trucks. One day, they see a big box in the living room. It has a bow and a tag. The tag says "For Tim and Sam, from Grandma and Grandpa"."What is in the box?" Tim asks."I don't know. Let's open it and see!" Sam says.They hurry to the box and pull the bow. They rip the paper and lift the lid. Inside, they find a chubby teddy bear. It has brown fur and a red bow. It has a smile and two black eyes."Wow, it's a teddy bear!" Tim says."It's so soft and cuddly!" Sam says.They hug the teddy bear and thank Grandma and Grandpa. They decide to name the teddy bear Bob."Bob is the best teddy bear ever!" Tim says."I agree. He is our new friend!" Sam says.They take Bob to their room and play with him. They share their cars and trucks with him. They tell him stories and jokes. They have a lot of fun with Bob."Do you like Bob, Tim?" Sam asks."Yes, I do. He is very nice and funny. What about you, Sam?" Tim asks."I like Bob, too. He is very warm and cozy. He makes me happy. What is your opinion, Bob?" Sam asks.Bob does not say anything. He just smiles and winks. He likes Tim and Sam, too. They are his new family.

Once upon a time, there was a pale dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his ball. He would run and jump to catch it. One day, Spot lost his ball in the big park.Spot met a cat in the park. The cat's name was Fluffy. Spot asked Fluffy, "Did you see my ball?" Fluffy said, "Yes, I saw it by the big tree." Spot and Fluffy went to the big tree to find the ball.When they got to the big tree, they saw a print on the ground. It looked like the ball had been there. Spot and Fluffy looked up, and there was the ball in the tree! They were so happy. Spot and Fluffy played with the ball together and became good friends.

Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play in the woods. They find a big hut made of sticks and leaves. They want to go inside and pretend it is their home."Look, a hut!" Tom says. "Let's go in!""Wait, Tom!" Lily says. "We need to gather some things first. We need food and water and toys."Lily starts to look for berries and nuts and flowers. Tom is impatient. He does not want to gather things. He wants to go in the hut now."Come on, Lily!" Tom says. "We don't need those things. We can play with the sticks and leaves. They are fun!""No, Tom!" Lily says. "We need to gather things. It is more fun to have a nice hut. And what if we get hungry or thirsty?"Tom and Lily start to argue. They raise their voices. They are loud."Stop it, you two!" a voice says. It is a big bear. He comes out of the hut. He is angry. He does not like the noise. He does not like the children. He wants them to go away."Who are you?" Tom says. He is scared."This is my hut!" the bear says. "You are not welcome here! Go away or I will eat you!"Tom and Lily run away. They are very scared. They forget their things. They do not want to play in the woods anymore. They want to go home. They are sorry they argued. They hug each other and say they are sorry.The end.

Once upon a time, there was a messy boy named Tim. He loved to play with his toys and make a big mess in his room. One day, his mom found a beautiful ornament. It was shiny and round, like a ball. She wanted to teach Tim how to take care of it.Mom showed Tim the ornament and said, "This is special. I will teach you how to keep it safe." Tim listened to his mom and held the ornament carefully. He put it on a high shelf where it would not get lost in his messy room.Every day, Tim looked at the ornament and remembered what his mom taught him. He tried to keep his room less messy so the ornament would stay safe. And when Christmas came, Tim and his mom put the ornament on their tree, and it was the most beautiful one of all.

Once upon a time, in a big tree, there was a little bird. This bird had pretty wings. The bird could fly high and low with its wings. It liked to sing and answer when people talked to it. The bird was very happy.One day, it was very cold. The wind was bitter. The little bird was sad and could not fly. The bird's wings were too cold. The bird sat on a branch and did not sing. It waited for the wind to stop.Then, something unexpected happened. A big, warm coat fell from the sky. The little bird put the coat on its wings. Now, the bird was warm and happy again. It could fly and sing. The bird answered, "Thank you!" to the sky. The wind was still bitter, but the bird was warm and safe with its new coat.

Lisa and Ben are twins. They like to play in the garden. They see a big green ball on the ground. It is an avocado."Look, Ben, a ball!" Lisa says. She picks up the avocado and throws it to Ben."Ouch!" Ben says. The avocado is hard and heavy. It hits his arm. He drops it and cries."Sorry, Ben, sorry!" Lisa says. She runs to him and hugs him. "Are you okay?"Ben rubs his arm. He is not happy. He points to the avocado. "That is not a ball, Lisa. That is a fruit. It belongs to the tree."Lisa looks at the tree. She sees more avocados hanging from the branches. She feels bad. She did not know."Can we eat it?" she asks.Ben shakes his head. "No, Lisa. We need to ask Mom first. She knows how to cut it and make it yummy. Maybe she will share some with us."Lisa nods. She puts the avocado back on the ground. She takes Ben's hand. They go to find Mom.They see Mom in the kitchen. She is making a salad. She smiles when she sees them."Hi, kids. What did you find in the garden?" she asks.Lisa and Ben show her the avocado. They tell her what happened.Mom hugs them. She is not angry. She is glad they are safe."That is an avocado, kids. It is a fruit, but it is not a ball. It is harmless, but it can hurt if you throw it. It belongs to the tree, but we can have some if we ask nicely. Do you want to try some?" she asks.Lisa and Ben nod. They are curious. They want to taste the avocado.Mom cuts the avocado in half. She scoops out some of the soft green flesh. She gives them each a spoonful.Lisa and Ben try the avocado. They make a face. It is not sweet. It is not sour. It is not salty. It is not bitter. It is jus

One day, a fine cat named Lucy went out to play. She saw a big red umbrella by a tree. Lucy wanted to catch the umbrella, but it was too high for her to reach.Then, a small bird named Billy came by. Billy saw Lucy trying to catch the umbrella. He wanted to help her. So, Billy flew up and tried to push the umbrella down to Lucy. But the wind blew, and the umbrella went even higher.Lucy and Billy did not give up. They tried again and again. At last, they worked together to catch the umbrella. Lucy jumped high, and Billy pushed it down. They caught the umbrella and both were very happy. They became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy who loved to bake. One sunny day, she decided to bake a big, yummy cake for her family. Amy felt very useful when she helped in the kitchen.As Amy was baking, she felt the ground shake. It was an earthquake! Amy was scared, but she knew she had to save her cake. The cake was wobbling on the table, and Amy didn't want it to fall.Amy quickly grabbed the cake and ran to a safe place. The earthquake stopped, and everyone was okay. Amy's family was so happy that she saved the cake. They all sat down and enjoyed the delicious cake together. In the end, Amy's baking was not only yummy but also very useful during the earthquake.

Lily was a young girl who liked to help her mom. She helped her mom make breakfast for her dad and her brother. She put bread in the toaster and poured juice in the cups. She was happy to serve them food.But today was a cold day and Lily felt chilly. She looked for her sweater, but she could not find it. She asked her mom, "Where is my sweater?" Her mom said, "I don't know, maybe you left it in your room."Lily ran to her room and looked under her bed and in her closet. She saw her toys, her books, and her blanket, but no sweater. She felt sad and cold. She went back to the kitchen and said, "Mom, I can't find my sweater."Her mom hugged her and said, "Don't worry, Lily, I have a surprise for you." She opened a drawer and took out a new sweater. It was pink and soft and had a big heart on the front. She said, "I made this sweater for you. I hope you like it."Lily's eyes sparkled and she smiled. She said, "Thank you, mom, I love it!" She put on the sweater and felt warm and cozy. She hugged her mom and said, "You are the best mom ever!" Her mom said, "You are the best daughter ever!" They laughed and kissed. Lily was happy to have a new sweater and a loving mom.

Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big lock on the gate. They want to go inside, but they cannot."Who put the lock there?" Sara asks."I don't know. Maybe the park is closed," Ben says.They are sad. They look around. They see a big tree near the fence. The tree has a branch that goes over the fence."Look, Sara! We can hop on the branch and go inside the park!" Ben says.He runs to the tree and climbs up. He hops on the branch and swings over the fence. He lands on the grass."Come on, Sara! It is fun!" he shouts.Sara is scared. She does not like to hop high. She stays on the ground."Ben, I don't want to hop. It is too high. I might fall," she says.Ben sees that Sara is scared. He feels sorry. He hops back on the branch and climbs down the tree."It is okay, Sara. We don't have to hop. We can play here," he says.He gives Sara a hug. He sees a candy shop across the street. He has some money in his pocket."Hey, Sara! Do you want some candy? They have sweet candy there. We can share," he says.Sara smiles. She likes candy. She likes Ben."Yes, Ben! I want some candy. You are a good friend," she says.They hold hands and cross the street. They buy some candy and eat it. They are happy. They forget about the lock.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He lived in a small house with his mom and dad. They had a nice neighbor who lived next door. The neighbor had a big tree in his yard. Tim liked to play near the tree.One sunny day, Tim found a hidden toy under the tree. It was a red ball. Tim was very happy and started to play with the ball. He threw the ball up in the air and tried to catch it.While playing, Tim did not see a banana peel on the ground. He stepped on it and slipped. Tim fell down, but he did not cry. The neighbor saw what happened and came to help Tim. He picked up the ball and gave it back to Tim. Tim said "thank you" and they both laughed. Tim and the neighbor played with the ball together and had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a toy box full of toys. One day, she found a big square in her toy box. The square was new and Sue was very happy.Sue played with the square all day. She liked to poke it with her finger. But then, something strange happened. When Sue poked the square, it changed into a fake bird. The bird could not fly, but it could sing. Sue was so surprised!Sue showed the fake bird to her mom and dad. They could not believe it! They all laughed and clapped as the bird sang. Sue loved her new toy even more. And from that day on, she always poked the square to make the bird sing.

Jazz was a cat who liked to play music. He had a unique drum set made of cans and boxes. He would tap and bang on them with his paws and make loud noises. He thought he was the best drummer in the world.One day, he saw a mouse running across the floor. He wanted to catch it and eat it. He left his drum set and chased the mouse. The mouse was fast and smart. It ran under a sofa and hid. Jazz could not find it. He was angry and hungry.He went back to his drum set and played louder and louder. He wanted to scare the mouse out. He did not care that he was making a lot of noise. He did not care that it was night time and everyone else wanted to sleep.Soon, he heard a voice. It was his owner, a little girl named Lily. She came out of her room and said, "Jazz, please stop! You are making too much noise! I can't sleep! You are a bad cat!"Jazz felt sorry. He did not want to make Lily sad. He loved Lily. She was his friend. She gave him food and water and toys and hugs. He stopped playing and went to her. He rubbed his head against her leg and said, "Meow, meow, sorry, Lily. I was trying to catch a mouse. I did not mean to be bad."Lily smiled and said, "It's okay, Jazz. I forgive you. But you have to be quiet at night. Everyone needs to sleep. Sleep is good for you. It makes you healthy and happy. And you can play your music in the day. Your music is unique and fun. But not too loud, okay?"Jazz nodded and said, "Meow, meow, okay, Lily. I will be quiet at night. I will sleep with you. And I will play my music in the day. But not too loud. Thank you, Lily. You are the best."Lily hugged Jazz and said,

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very excited because he was going on vacation with his family. They were going to the beach, and Tim loved to play in the sand and water.One day, while playing, Tim met a little girl named Sue. Sue looked confused, and Tim asked, "Why are you confused?" Sue said, "I hear a funny sound, but I don't know where it's coming from." Tim listened and heard the sound too.
