Once upon a time, there was a big train. The train ran on a track. The track was very organized. It went up and down, left and right.One day, the train saw a cute cat. The cat was lying on the track. The train stopped. The train did not want to hurt the cat.The cat got up and walked away. The train was happy. The train went on the organized track again. The train and the cat were friends. They played together every day.

Ben was so worried. He looked around and saw his toy truck, but it wasn't moving. He asked his dad for help.His dad smiled and said, "Don't be worried, Ben. We just need some oil to rock the truck."So, Ben and his dad went to the store and bought some oil.Back at home, Ben's dad poured the oil into the truck and said, "Okay, now rock the truck and see if it works!"Ben rocked the truck back and forth and then it came alive! The truck moved forward and Ben was so excited. He shouted, "It's working! It's working!"Ben was so happy his toy truck was finally running. He thanked his dad and they both smiled.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Mina who was three years old. Mina had a sight; she could see things that other people couldn't. This made her feel different and uncomfortable.One day, Mina decided to go on an adventure. She started walking and soon came to a special place. All of a sudden, Mina noticed something in the distance. It was a man who was trying to get away from someone. Mina watched as the man stumbled and almost fell. Then she heard someone call out for help. She knew it was the man who had been trying to get away.Mina felt very uncomfortable because she was scared of the man. She wanted to help him but was afraid. Eventually, Mina plucked up the courage and ran to the man. Together, they were able to escape.Mina felt proud of herself for being brave. Even though it was uncomfortable, she was happy to have used her sight to help someone in need.

One day, a little girl called Anna went to the beach with her parents. She was very excited to go sailing on a big, colorful yacht. Her parents showed her the big, beautiful boat."Wow," said Anna.Anna's Dad smiled and said, "Let's start."Anna and her parents hopped on the yacht. Dad started the engine and the yacht gradually moved away from the shore. The colorful sails unfurled in the wind.Anna's Mom pointed out at the ocean, "Look Anna, those dolphins are so fast!"The wind blew gently and Anna and her family sailed away. It was a beautiful sight, with the blue water, white sails and the colorful boat.Anna smiled and said, "Can we go sailing again?" Her parents laughed and nodded.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. He saw a funny frog near a drain. The frog made a funny face and Tim laughed. He wanted to play with the frog."Hello, frog! Can I play with you?" Tim asked. The frog jumped and said, "Yes, but be careful. The drain can be dangerous."Tim and the frog played near the drain, but they were careful not to get too close. They played all day and laughed a lot. They became good friends and had lots of fun.

One day, a little girl named Mia was playing in her room. She saw a light book on her shelf. Mia liked stories, so she took the book and sat down."Mommy, can you read this story to me?" Mia requested. Her mommy smiled and sat down next to her. "Of course, Mia," she said.The story was about a big cat and a little dog. The cat and the dog were friends. They played together in the sun. The cat would say, "Dog, let's run!" and the dog would bark, "Yes, let's play!" They had so much fun.At the end of the story, Mia was happy. She hugged her mommy and said, "I like that story, Mommy. Thank you for reading it to me."Her mommy hugged her back and said, "You're welcome, Mia. I'm glad you liked the story. Now, let's get ready for bed."

Once upon a time, there was a very friendly puppy. Every day, the puppy prayed for a new home. But, no matter how much he prayed, no new home would come. One day, he noticed a teaspoon shining in the sun. It was a beautiful teaspoon. He thought of how much he could do with it. He could even use it for a home! So, he collected some sticks and leaves and built himself a small, cozy home with the teaspoon.And from then on, the puppy had a home. He learned that you don't need to pray for something big to get it. All you need to do is to be creative and make the best of what you have.Moral of the story: Be creative and make the best of what you have.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy he loved a lot. One day, Tim lost his toy. He looked and looked, but he could not find it. Tim felt very sad.Tim's mom saw him looking for his toy. She knew it was lost, but she also knew where it was. She had put it in a hot place to dry after it got wet. Tim's mom wanted to teach him a lesson, so she did not tell him where the toy was.Later, Tim's mom felt guilty for not telling him. She knew Tim was very sad. She gave him a big hug and told him where the toy was. Tim was so happy to find his toy! He promised to take better care of it.The moral of the story is to always take care of the things you love and to help others when they need it.

Tim was a lonely boy. He had no friends to play with. He only had his toys and his books. He liked to dream about going to the sea. He wanted to see the big waves and the fish and the boats. He wanted to taste the salt in the water and feel the sand on his feet.One day, his mom said they could go to the sea. Tim was very happy. He packed his toys and his books in a bag. He put on his hat and his sunscreen. He got in the car with his mom and they drove to the sea.When they got there, Tim ran to the water. He saw the big waves and the fish and the boats. He tasted the salt in the water and felt the sand on his feet. He was so happy. He said to his mom, "Mom, this is my dream. I love the sea. Can we stay here forever?"His mom smiled and said, "No, Tim, we can't stay here forever. We have to go back home soon. But we can come back another day. Now, let's have some fun. Do you want to build a sandcastle?"Tim nodded and said, "Yes, mom, I want to build a sandcastle. Can you help me?"His mom said, "Of course, Tim, I will help you. Let's find a good spot."They walked along the shore, looking for a good spot. They saw a big rock with a hole in it. Tim thought it looked like a cave. He said, "Mom, look, a cave. Can we build our sandcastle near the cave?"His mom said, "Sure, Tim, we can build our sandcastle near the cave. But be careful, don't go inside the cave. It might be dangerous. There might be crabs or snakes or spiders inside."Tim said, "OK, mom, I won't go inside the cave. I will stay with you."They started to build their sandcastle near the cave. They used a bucket and a shovel and some she

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a wish. He wanted to ride his bike all by himself. But every time he tried, he would fall. Tim was sad.One day, his friend Amy came over. "Why are you sad, Tim?" she asked. "I can't ride my bike," he said. "I always fall." Amy had an idea. "Let's try together!" she said.Tim and Amy tried many times, but Tim still couldn't manage to ride his bike. Then, they saw a big hill. "Let's try going down the hill!" said Amy. Tim was scared, but he said, "Okay."They went down the hill very fast. Tim was scared, but he didn't fall. At the bottom of the hill, Tim was happy. "I did it!" he said. "I rode my bike!" Tim's wish came true, and he and Amy rode their bikes together all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boat named Bob. Bob lived in a harbor with his boat friends. One day, Bob saw a big, shiny rock near the water. He wanted to show his friends the rock.Bob called his friend, "Hey, look at this big rock!" His friend came over, but as he got close, he started to feel dizzy. "Oh no, I don't feel good," said his friend. But Bob didn't listen. He wanted to show the rock to all his friends.One by one, Bob's friends came to see the rock. They all felt dizzy too. They knew something was wrong, but Bob didn't listen. He was so happy to show the rock. Then, it started to rain. The water became slippery, and the boats began to slip and slide in the harbor.Bob's friends tried to tell him to stop, but he didn't listen. The rain got harder, and the boats slipped more and more. They all felt dizzy and scared. The big, shiny rock was not fun anymore.In the end, all the boats slipped and crashed into each other. The harbor was a mess, and the boats were sad. Bob learned that he should have listened to his friends when they felt dizzy. Sometimes, things that look fun can be bad.

One day, a big cat and a little dog went for a walk. They wanted to find a fine place to play. The big cat took a step and saw a point near the big tree. "Look, little dog! That point looks like a fun place to play," said the big cat.The little dog took a step too and looked at the point. He saw the big tree and the fine place to play. "Yes, big cat! Let's go to that point and play," said the little dog.So, the big cat and the little dog went to the point near the big tree. They played and had a lot of fun. They liked the fine place to play. When they were tired, they went back home. They were happy to find a new place to play together.

Once upon a time there lived a family with two children, Mike and Sarah. They lived in a modest house with a large attic.  Mike and Sarah loved exploring the attic, looking for new and exciting things. One day, Sarah went to the attic alone. She started playing and soon got too close to the edge of the attic. Suddenly, she lost her balance and she fell! Mike, who was sitting in the living room, heard a noise from upstairs. He quickly ran to the attic to find Sarah lying on the floor with her eyes closed.“Are you okay, Sarah?” Mike asked.Sarah opened her eyes and said, “I'm okay, Mike! I just fell!” Mike helped Sarah up and they decided it was time to leave the attic. From then on, they were very careful not to fall again!

Once upon a time, there was a pale boy named Tom. He had a guitar that he loved to play. Every day, he would sit under a big tree and play his guitar. All the animals would come and listen to him.One day, while Tom was playing his guitar, a big bird came to listen. The bird liked the music so much that it wanted to play too. The bird took the guitar from Tom and started to play. Tom was sad, but he decided to listen to the bird play.As the bird played the guitar, something unexpected happened. The guitar started to change colors! It turned from brown to red, then blue, and finally to a beautiful rainbow color. Tom and the bird were amazed. They became best friends and played the magical guitar together every day, making all the animals happy with their music.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to design things. One day, he found a weird piece of metal. He wanted to make something special with it.Tim showed the metal to his friend, Sam. Sam said, "That's a weird metal! What will you design with it?" Tim thought hard and said, "I want to make a big, strong robot!" But Sam wanted to make a fast car with the metal. They both wanted to use the metal, but they could not agree on what to make.Tim and Sam talked and talked. They thought of a great idea. They would work together to design a robot car! It would be big, strong, and fast. They were both happy and started to work on their new project. And they became even better friends.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a toy car that he loved very much. It was red and had thin wheels. One day, while Tim was playing, the toy car broke. Tim was very sad.Tim's dad saw him crying and asked what was wrong. Tim showed him the broken toy car. His dad said, "Don't worry, Tim. We can repair it." Tim's eyes lit up, and he smiled.Together, Tim and his dad fixed the toy car. They used glue to stick the skin of the car back on. Tim was so happy to have his toy car back. He thanked his dad and played with it all day long.

One day, a bald man named Tom went to clean a big house. The house was very old and dusty. Tom saw a lot of dirt and cobwebs. He started to clean the floors and the walls.While Tom was cleaning, he heard a soft voice. "Hello, I am a kind spirit," the voice said. Tom looked around and saw a little glowing light. The spirit was friendly and wanted to help Tom clean the house.Together, Tom and the kind spirit cleaned the whole house. They laughed and talked while they worked. When the house was all clean, the spirit said, "Thank you, Tom. You are a good friend." Tom smiled and said, "Thank you too, kind spirit. We made the house look nice!"

Once upon a time, there was a cheerful little girl named Lucy. She loved to dance and sing. One day, her mom told her she could be in a big show. Lucy was very happy.The day of the show came, and Lucy saw the big stage. She was excited to dance on it. Lucy's mom said, "You will do great, just have fun!" Lucy smiled and went to the stage.Lucy danced and sang her best. All the people clapped and cheered for her. When she finished, Lucy ran to her mom. Her mom hugged her and said, "You were amazing!" Lucy felt proud and happy. They went home with big smiles on their faces.

Once there was a gentle mother. She had a little girl named Lily. They liked to play and laugh together. One day, they wanted to make a yummy snack. The gentle mother took out bread and jam. Lily was very happy.The gentle mother spread the jam on the bread. She gave it to Lily. Lily took a big bite. But then, something unexpected happened. The jam was not sweet. It was spicy! Lily's mouth felt hot. She looked at her mother, surprised.The gentle mother laughed. She had made a mistake. She spread spicy sauce on the bread, not jam. Lily laughed too. They cleaned the table and tried again. This time, the gentle mother spread sweet jam on the bread. Lily and her mother enjoyed their snack and laughed about the spicy surprise.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was an independent dog who liked to do things on his own. One day, he went for a walk in the park.While walking, Max saw a big ball on one side of the park. He wanted to play with it, but there was a big cat near the ball. Max was a little scared of the big cat, so he decided to ignore it and keep walking.Max walked to the other side of the park and found a small ball. He played with the small ball all day and had lots of fun. Even though he was an independent dog, Max learned that sometimes it's okay to ignore things that scare you and find something else to do.

One day, a cat named Tom felt confused. He did not know the law about sharing toys. He saw a dog named Max playing with a red ball. Tom wanted to play too, but he did not know if it was okay to take the ball.Tom asked Max, "Can I play with the ball?" Max said, "Yes, but we must share. That is the law." Tom was happy to learn the law and started playing with Max.As they played, a big wind came and took the ball away. Tom and Max were sad, but they learned that sharing made them feel good. They became best friends and played together every day, always remembering to share.

Once upon a time, there was a big bird named Ollie. Ollie was an ostrich. He was orange, and he lived in a big, green field.One day, Ollie saw a big, round fruit. It was an orange fruit. Ollie wanted to eat the fruit, but it was too high up in the tree. Ollie tried to jump and reach it, but he could not.Ollie felt sad. He thought of a plan. He asked his friend, a tall giraffe, to help him. The giraffe helped Ollie get the orange fruit. Ollie was happy and ate the fruit. He did not regret asking his friend for help. They played together in the big, green field all day long.

Once on a dark night, Tom was walking in the woods by himself. He was feeling fearless until he heard a mysterious sound coming from behind the trees. He stopped and listened. The sound was like a rail reverberating in the distance. Tom, feeling scared, started walking faster. Suddenly, he heard the sound of the rail coming closer. Tom was so scared he ran, making his way back home. When he finally stopped running, Tom looked behind and he saw a mysterious figure standing there. Tom was so scared he froze. The figure was so tall and with a very strange look he could barely move. The figure started walking closer, and Tom tried to run away but he could not. Just at that moment, the figure spoke, and he said: "I will be back soon." Tom was paralyzed with fear, but he still ran as fast as he could. He ran for a long time, until he arrived back home. Unfortunately, Tom never forgot that mysterious figure. The figure still scared him, even after all this time. He was often worried that one day the figure would return, just as the figure had promised. Sadly, Tom was right and the figure eventually returned, making Tom's story have a bad ending.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He loved to skip and jump in the park. As he was skipping, he saw a snake on the grass. Tim was not scared of the snake, but he knew he should be careful."Hello, snake," said Tim. "Why are you here in the park?" The snake looked at Tim and said, "I am hurt. I need help, please." Tim wanted to help the snake, but he did not know how.Tim thought for a moment and then said, "I will ask my mom for help." He ran to his mom and told her about the hurt snake. His mom came to the park with a box. They put the snake in the box and took it to a doctor who helps animals.The doctor helped the hurt snake and soon it was better. Tim was happy that he could help the snake. From that day on, Tim and the snake became good friends. They played in the park together and had lots of fun.

One day, a boy and a girl went to the park. They saw a big tree with a swing. The swing had a big knot in the rope. The boy said, "Let's play on the swing!"The girl said, "Yes, but we need to fix the knot first." They tried to untie the knot, but it was not fair. The knot was too tight. They pulled and pulled, but the knot did not come loose.Just then, a big dog came to the park. The dog saw the knot and bit it. The knot came loose! The boy and the girl were very happy. They said, "Thank you, dog!" Now they could play on the swing all day.

Bob was carrying an alarm in his little hands as he walked around the garden. He looked around in fascination, curious to see what sort of things he could find. Suddenly, he came across a strange-looking plant. It had beautiful yellow flowers and lively green leaves. "Mommy, what's this?" Bob asked, pointing to the plant. "That's a zinnia, sweetie," Mommy replied. "They are very creative and colorful plants."Bob smiled and continued walking around the garden, carrying the alarm. He began to think of what he could use it for. He wanted to be creative with it. When he found a tree, he knew exactly what to do. He placed the alarm at the bottom of the tree and stepped back. With just a slightly push he had a cool new alarm-tree right in front of him. Bob smiled with pleasure. He had been so creative with the alarm. He was so proud of himself!

Once upon a time, there was a special island. It was small and modest, but it was home to a lot of happy animals. They knew the island very well - they knew where to find food, and where to find shelter.One day, a good fairy came to the island and smiled. She knew the animals were happy and content, and she wanted to give them something special. She waved her wand and made the island even more beautiful. A river glistened in the sun, and tall trees rustled in the breeze. The animals loved their new home, and they thanked the fairy for her kind gift.The animals lived happily ever after - they danced, they sang, and they often shared stories about how lucky they were to know the island. Every day was an adventure. The island was modest, but it was always full of joy and love.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to her grandma's house. Grandma asked Amy to help her unpack some boxes. They were going to put things in the cupboard. Amy was very excited to help.As they unpacked, Amy found a small, shiny key. "Look, Grandma!" she said, "What does this key open?" Grandma smiled and said, "You will see soon, my dear." They put the key in a safe place and continued to unpack.After they finished unpacking, Grandma took Amy to a little door in the hallway. "This is a special cupboard," said Grandma. Amy used the shiny key to open the little door. Inside, there were many toys and games. Amy was so happy and knew she and Grandma would have lots of fun playing together.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely rocket. It lived high up in the sky. The rocket wanted friends to play with, but it was too far away from everyone.One day, the rocket saw a big, soft cloud. The cloud saw the lonely rocket and wanted to help. So the cloud went up to the rocket and wrapped around it like a big, warm hug.The rocket was not lonely anymore. It had a new friend in the sky. The rocket and the cloud played together every day. They were very happy and never felt lonely again.

Once upon a time, in a far away planet, there lived a small, anxious cat. The cat was always scared of everything around her. She didn't like to play with other cats or animals, because she was too scared.One day, the cat decided to be brave and go outside. She slowly walked through the grass, feeling a little less scared. As she walked, she saw a big tree with lots of leaves. The cat thought the tree looked fun to climb, so she went up the tree.As the cat climbed higher and higher, she started to feel scared again. But then, she saw a friendly bird sitting on a branch. The bird said, "Don't be scared, little cat. I will help you." The bird showed the cat how to climb down the tree safely. The cat was so happy and thanked the bird. From that day on, the cat wasn't as anxious and scared as before. She made many new friends and had lots of fun adventures on her planet.

Jimmy was playing with his toys when his mum called him. "Jimmy, come here please," she said. Jimmy's eyes widened. He ran to the kitchen and saw a bowl full of dough. It was so delicate. Jimmy's mum said, "It's time to make cookies. Help me mix the dough, ok?" Jimmy grabbed the spoon and began to mix the dough. After awhile, the dough was ready. Then Jimmy's dad took the tray of dough and put it in the oven. Jimmy waited and waited until the dough was done. Then he ran to get the cookies. They were so warm and smelled so good. Jimmy and his family enjoyed the delicious cookies.

Once there was a swan. She was a big, independent swan. She liked to swim and play with her friends in the pond. One day, the swan saw a problem. She wanted to solve it.The swan went to her friend, the duck. "Can you help me solve the problem?" she asked. "Yes, I can help," said the duck. They worked together to solve the problem.In the end, the swan and the duck solved the problem. They were very happy. They played and swam in the pond together. And from that day on, the swan and the duck were best friends.

John was very restless. He wanted to play hockey, like his brother. But he was too small. His brother was big and strong, and could tie up his own hockey stick with thick strings. John tried to do it too, but he couldn't tie the strings tight enough.John was frustrated and threw the string to the ground. He looked around, desperately looking for a way to play. Suddenly, he saw a rope lying on the ground. He took it and hurried to his brother. He asked if he could tie the rope around his stick. His brother smiled and agreed.John felt happy. He tried to tie the rope around the stick, but it was too difficult for him. No matter how hard he tried, he just couldn't do it. His brother helped him, and eventually the stick was tied.John was so excited. He and his brother both had hockey sticks now. Finally, he could play hockey with his brother. The two of them ran to the playground and started playing. John was so happy!

Once upon a time, in a big green garden, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily liked to play with her red ball. One sunny day, she went outside to play with her ball. The weather was mild, and the sun was shining.As Lily was playing, she gave the ball a big push. The ball rolled and rolled until it got stuck in a long vine. The vine was green and twisty, and it had lots of leaves. Lily tried to reach the ball, but it was too high for her small hands.Then, a friendly bird saw Lily and wanted to help her. The bird flew up to the vine and gave the ball a little push. The ball rolled out of the vine and back to Lily. She was so happy! Lily said "thank you" to the bird, and they played together all day long.

Ben and Sam were brothers. They liked to play with their toys, but they did not like to share. They always fought over who got the best toy, the biggest toy, or the newest toy. Their mom was sad to see them fight so much.One day, she had an idea. She gave them a big leather ball as a gift. She said, "This is a special ball. It is very old and very strong. It can bounce very high and very far. But you have to play with it together. You have to unite and be a team. If you fight over it, it will not work."Ben and Sam were curious. They wanted to try the leather ball. They took it outside and started to bounce it. They were amazed by how high and far it went. They had to run and catch it. They had to pass it to each other. They had to work together. They had fun. They forgot to fight.Their mom watched them from the window. She smiled. She was happy to see them unite and be a team. She thought, "They are gifted boys. They can do anything if they cooperate." She was proud of them. She hoped they would always remember the lesson of the leather ball.

One day, a thoughtful girl named Lucy found a phone. She did not know who it belonged to. Lucy wanted to find the owner, so she decided to wait for a call.Soon, the phone rang. Lucy picked it up and said, "Hello?" A voice on the other side said, "Hi, is this my phone?" Lucy replied, "I found a phone. Is it yours?" The voice said, "Yes, it is. Thank you for finding it."Lucy and the voice made a plan to meet at the park. When they met, the owner of the phone was very happy. They said, "Thank you for finding my phone, Lucy!" Lucy replied, "You're welcome. I'm glad I could help you." And they both went home with a big smile.

Once upon a time, there was a tall panda who wanted to borrow something. He searched everywhere, asking all his friends if he could borrow something. The panda asked the monkey, but the monkey said no. He asked the lion too, but the lion said no. He even asked the elephant, but the elephant said no.The panda was disappointed that he couldn’t borrow anything, so he decided to go on a walk in the park. That’s when he saw a little boy playing with a toy car. The panda asked the boy if he could borrow the car. The boy was surprised but he said yes! The panda was so excited. He thanked the boy and took the car for a spin around the park. The tall panda and the little boy had a great time together and they both went home very happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim wanted to play ball. He went to the park and saw a big girl playing ball. Tim asked the big girl, "Can I play ball with you?" The big girl replied, "Yes, you can be my player."Tim and the big girl played ball for a while. They had lots of fun. But then, Tim kicked the ball too hard. The ball flew far away and hit a man. The man was hurt and very sad. Tim felt sorry for the man.Tim went to the man and said, "I am sorry I hurt you." The man replied, "It's okay, but please be careful next time." Tim went back to play ball with the big girl, but she had to go home. Tim was sad because he had no one to play with and he had hurt the man. The day ended with Tim feeling sorry and all alone.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a red bike with pedals. He loved to ride his bike all day.One day, Tim saw a big hill. He wanted to ride down the hill very fast. Tim thought it would be fun. He did not know that the hill was heavy. He started to ride down the hill.As Tim was riding down the hill, he started to go too fast. He felt scared. He tried to stop, but the pedals were going too fast. Tim said, "Oh no! I wish I did not go down the hill."Finally, Tim stopped at the bottom of the hill. He was safe but he felt regret. He knew he should not have gone down the heavy hill. Tim learned to be more careful when riding his bike.

Once upon a time, there was a little kitten named Fluffy. Fluffy lived in a small house with a big family. Fluffy loved to play with her ball, but one day, the ball rolled under a scary, dark table.Fluffy was scared, but she wanted her ball back. So, she closed her eyes and went under the table. She felt something soft and thought it was her ball. Fluffy tried to pull it out, but it was stuck.Suddenly, the soft thing started to move! Fluffy was very scared, but then she saw it was just another kitten! The new kitten was named Whiskers. Whiskers and Fluffy became best friends and played with the ball together. They were not scared anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted police officer named Mark. He was kind and gentle, always helping people in need. One day, Mark was walking through the city and saw a 3 year old girl crying by herself. He asked her what was wrong.The girl told Mark that a thief had stolen her new toy. She had been so excited to get the toy, but was now heartbroken. Mark was sad to hear this. He took some time to think.Suddenly, Mark had an idea. He called some of his police friends and soon they had made a plan. Mark and his police friends went to the toy store and found the thief. Mark was so happy to help the little girl get her toy back! The little girl was so thankful for Mark and his friends. She thanked them with a huge hug. From then on, the people in the city knew that Officer Mark was the most gifted police officer around.

Mum and her daughter Ivy were playing in the garden on a sunny day. Ivy looked at the flowers with admiration.Mum: "Do you like the flowers, Ivy?"Ivy: "Yes they are very pretty!"Then they heard some birds chirping above them and Ivy pointed up to the sky.Mum: "The birds are singing and they are leading us around the garden."Ivy and Mum held hands and started walking around the garden. Ivy saw a delicate butterfly and as she moved closer it flew away.Mum: "Oh that's too bad. We must have been too noisy for the butterfly."Ivy looked sad, so Mum said: "Let's go back inside, I have something special for you."Mum opened a jar of creamy lotion and spread it all over Ivy's hands.Mum: "Look how delicate and soft the lotion makes your hands feel."Ivy smiled - everything felt so gentle and smooth. She laughed and hugged her Mum. She knew that everything would be alright.

One day, a boy named Tim and his friend, Sam, wanted to play a game. They could not agree on what game to play. Tim wanted to play a regular game like tag, but Sam insisted on playing a new game he made up.Sam said, "I insist we play my new game. It is more fun than a regular game." Tim was not sure, but he agreed to try Sam's new game. In this game, they had to run and jump over things. It was a little hard for Tim, but Sam was good at it.As they played, Tim tripped and fell down. He got hurt and started to cry. Sam felt bad for making Tim play his new game. They both learned that it is important to listen to each other and play games that everyone can enjoy.

Once upon a time, there was a big blue ball. The blue ball had many friends. They all lived in a happy park. The blue ball was very healthy and liked to play.One day, a little girl named Sue came to the park. Sue saw the blue ball and said, "Hello, blue ball! Can I play with you and your friends?" The blue ball said, "Yes, Sue! We would love to play with you!"Sue, the blue ball, and all the friends played all day. They had so much fun. Sue even managed to learn a new game from the blue ball. They all laughed and played until the sun went down. Sue was very happy she found new friends at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue liked to play with her toy car. One day, Sue found a big loop in her toy car track. She was scared to try it.Sue's toy car was brave. It did not want to be scared. The toy car wanted to go on the loop. But Sue refused to let the toy car try. She was too scared.Then, a little mouse came to play. The mouse saw the loop and wanted to try it. Sue was scared, but the mouse was not. The mouse pushed the toy car on the loop. The toy car went fast and made it! Sue was happy and not scared anymore. The mouse and Sue played together and had fun.

Once upon a time, there was a thin plane. The plane had a big job to do. It had to add more friends to its team.One day, the plane went to the park. It saw a ball, a bike, and a toy car. The plane asked them, "Will you be my friend? I need help to add more friends."The ball, the bike, and the toy car said, "Yes! We will be your friend." They all played together in the park. They had a lot of fun. The thin plane was happy to add new friends to its team.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely goose. The goose liked to play, but he had no friends. He walked and walked, looking for someone to play with.One day, the lonely goose met a kind duck. The duck said, "Let's play together!" The goose was very happy. They played in the water and had lots of fun.But then, a big dog came. The dog wanted to catch the goose and the duck. The goose and the duck were scared. They did not want to be caught. So, the goose and the duck said, "We surrender! Please don't catch us!" The dog was nice and let them go. The goose and the duck were safe and happy. They played together every day and were never lonely again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally loved to bake. She would bake cookies, cakes, and pies. One day, Sally wanted to bake something special. She wanted to bake a luxury cake.Sally asked her friend, Tim, to help her. Tim was sometimes rude, but Sally thought he could help. They went to the kitchen to start baking. Sally said, "Tim, please don't be rude today. We need to work together to bake this cake." Tim said, "Okay, Sally. I will try my best."Sally and Tim tried to bake the luxury cake. They mixed the cake and put it in the oven. But Tim started to be rude again. He didn't listen to Sally and put too much heat. The cake burned and smoke filled the kitchen. They couldn't eat the cake. Sally was sad and Tim was sorry for being rude.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to learn new things every day. One day, she went to the store with her mom to buy some fruit. There were many fruits available, but Lily wanted grapes. They bought the grapes and went back home. Lily's mom put the grapes in a bowl on the table. Lily was very happy and excited to eat them. She picked up a grape and was about to eat it when something unexpected happened. The grape started to talk!"Hello, Lily!" said the grape. Lily was very surprised. She didn't know that grapes could talk. The grape told her that he was a magical grape, and he could teach her many new things. Lily was excited to learn from the magical grape. Together, they had many fun adventures and learned a lot. And that's how Lily found a new friend in the most unexpected way.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a thin boy named Tim. Tim liked to run very fast. One day, there was a big race in the town. Tim wanted to win a medal.Before the race, Tim's mom asked him a question. She said, "Are you ready for the race, Tim?" Tim said, "Yes, Mom, I am ready to run fast and win the medal."The race started, and Tim ran very fast. He ran faster than all the other kids. Tim won the race and got a shiny medal. He was very happy and showed his medal to his mom. She was proud of him.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a little bear named Ben. Ben was upset because he lost his way home. He walked and walked but could not find his family.One day, Ben met a kind squirrel named Sam. Sam saw that Ben was upset and asked, "Why are you upset, Ben?" Ben said, "I am lost and I miss my family." Sam wanted to help Ben find his family.Sam and Ben walked through the forest together. They asked the birds, the trees, and the other animals if they knew where Ben's family was. Finally, they found Ben's family. Ben was so happy, he hugged Sam. "Thank you for helping me find my family!" Ben said. Sam smiled and hugged Ben back. They became best friends and played together in the forest every day.

Tommy had the best day ever. He had been tidying his room, just like his mummy told him to. He was nearly finished when he heard a loud noise coming from his bedroom window. Startled, he ran to the window and saw that his passport had fallen onto the ground.Mummy heard the noise too and came running up the stairs. "What has happened, Tommy?" she asked.Tommy pointed to the passport and said, "Look mummy! It fell out of the window!"Mummy picked up the passport and wiped off the dirt. "We must be more careful," she said. "Let's put it somewhere safe so this doesn't happen again."Mummy and Tommy put the passport back in the tidy drawer and made sure the window was closed so nothing would fall out again. What a relief! Tommy smiled and went back to tidying his room.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play games with his friends. They played all sorts of harmless games like hide and seek and tag.One day, Tim's mom said, "We will have a big party to celebrate your birthday, Tim!" Tim was very happy. He wanted to play games with his friends at the party.On the day of the party, Tim's friends came to his house. They played games and had lots of fun. Tim said to his friends, "Let's play the game of tag!" All his friends agreed and they played tag.After playing games, they ate yummy cake and ice cream. Tim's mom gave him a big hug and said, "Happy birthday, Tim!" Tim and his friends had a great time celebrating his birthday.From that day on, Tim and his friends played harmless games and celebrated their birthdays together. They were always happy and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a restless boy who loved to play outside. One day, Tim went to the park with his mom. They took a meal with them to eat under a big tree.While they were eating, Tim saw a girl named Sue. Sue was waving to him from the swings. Tim waved back and said, "Hi, Sue! Want to play with me?" Sue smiled and said, "Yes, Tim! Let's play together!"Tim and Sue played on the swings, the slide, and the sandbox. They had so much fun together. After a while, they got tired and sat down to eat their meal. Tim and Sue became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a new toy crocodile named Coco. Coco lived in a small house with a kind girl named Lily. Lily liked to play with Coco every day.One sunny day, Lily and Coco went to the park. They saw a big, round thing that could spin. Lily said, "Coco, let's spin on this!" So, they both got on the big, round thing and started to spin. They spun around and around, laughing and having fun.After they stopped spinning, they saw a new friend. It was a little boy with a toy frog. The boy said, "Hi, I'm Tom. Do you want to play with me and my frog?" Lily and Coco said, "Yes!" So, they all played together, spinning and laughing at the park until it was time to go home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to dance. She danced all day and all night. One day, Sue was feeling miserable. She did not want to dance anymore.Sue's mom saw her and asked, "Why are you sad?" Sue said, "I don't want to dance. I want to do something else." Her mom hugged her and said, "You can do anything you want."Sue tried to find something else she loved. She tried to play with her toys, but she did not love it. She tried to draw, but she did not love it. Sue was very sad.One day, while Sue was walking, she saw a big hole. She thought, "Maybe I will love to jump in the hole." So, Sue jumped in the hole.Sue fell down and down. She did not love it. She wanted to go back up, but she could not. Sue was stuck in the hole, and she was very sad.

Once upon a time, there was an elderly lady who loved to paint. She painted all day long. She painted pretty flowers, big trees, and happy animals. She had a lot of fun when she painted.One day, the elderly lady had a lot of waste from her painting. She had used many colors and made a big mess. She didn't know what to do with the waste.Then, she had an idea. She took the waste and made a new painting. She painted a beautiful rainbow with all the colors. Everyone who saw it loved it. The elderly lady learned that she could make something beautiful from waste. And she kept painting every day, making the world a more colorful place.

One day, a lazy cat named Tom went for a walk. He found a beautiful place with water and trees. This place was called an oasis. Tom liked the oasis and wanted to stay there.Tom met a nice bird named Sue at the oasis. Sue said, "Hi, Tom! The oasis is not pretty anymore. We need to make it pretty again." Tom agreed and said, "Let's restore the oasis together!"They worked together to clean the oasis. But then, something unexpected happened. A big rain came and helped them clean the oasis even more. The rain made the oasis beautiful again. Tom and Sue were happy and became best friends.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park. She saw a display of pretty flowers. They were many colors: red, blue, and yellow. Lily liked the flowers a lot. She wanted to pick one, but her mom said no. Lily felt impatient.Lily and her mom walked around the park. It was a cold day, so they wore warm coats. They saw ducks in the pond. The ducks were swimming and quacking. Lily laughed and clapped her hands. She liked the ducks, too.After playing in the park, Lily and her mom went home. Lily was still impatient about the flowers. Her mom saw this and had an idea. They went to the store and bought seeds. They planted the seeds in their garden. Soon, Lily had her own display of pretty flowers. She was very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big, dangerous lion. He lived in a big forest. He was always sad because he had a bad tooth. It hurt him a lot. One day, he found a small pill on the ground. He hoped it would make his tooth stop hurting.The lion put the pill in his mouth. He waited for his tooth to feel better. But something unexpected happened. The lion started to shrink! He became smaller and smaller until he was the size of a cat. Now, he was not so dangerous anymore.The other animals in the forest saw the small lion and were not scared. They became friends with him. They played and had fun together. The small lion was happy now. And the best part was, his tooth did not hurt anymore. The pill worked, but not in the way he thought it would.

Once upon a time, there was a tidy little house in the woods. A nice lady lived there with her big, fluffy dog named Max. Max loved to play outside in the yard, but he always kept things clean.One day, Max saw a mist coming from the woods. He barked and barked, trying to tell the nice lady. The nice lady said, "What is it, Max? Let's go see!" She took a key and unlocked the gate to the woods.As they walked into the mist, Max and the nice lady found a big, shiny box. The nice lady used her key to unlock the box. Inside, they found lots of toys for Max and the nice lady to play with. They were so happy and played all day long. And from that day on, the tidy little house was full of fun and laughter.

Sara and Tom were playing in the living room. They had many toys to choose from, but they liked the big box the most. They pretended it was a spaceship, a castle, a car, and anything else they could think of.One day, Mom came home with a new box. It was smaller than the old one, but it had a shiny ribbon on it. Mom said it was a present for Sara, because she had been a good girl. Sara was very happy and excited. She thanked Mom and ran to the box."Can I open it now, Mom?" she asked."Of course, sweetie. Go ahead," Mom said.Sara ripped off the ribbon and the paper. She opened the box and looked inside. She saw a pink dress with frills and flowers. She did not like it at all. She liked blue and green and yellow. She liked pants and shirts and hats. She did not like dresses, especially pink ones.She looked at Mom and saw her smiling. She did not want to hurt Mom's feelings, but she did not want to wear the dress either. She felt embarrassed and confused. She did not know what to say.Tom saw Sara's face and guessed how she felt. He wanted to help her. He had an idea. He grabbed the old box and put it on his head. He said in a funny voice, "Look at me, I'm a robot!"Sara laughed. She forgot about the dress for a moment. She grabbed another box and put it on her head. She said in a funny voice, "And I'm a rocket!"Mom laughed too. She saw that Sara and Tom were having fun. She did not mind that Sara did not like the dress. She loved Sara no matter what. She said, "You two are very creative. Why don't you play with the boxes for a while, and then we can have some cookies?"Sara and Tom nodded. They t

Once upon a time, in a great big forest, there lived a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside with his friends. One day, while playing, Tim saw a tiny mosquito. The mosquito was sad because he was lost.Tim asked the mosquito, "Why are you sad?" The mosquito replied, "I am lost and I want to return to my family." Tim wanted to help the mosquito, so they went on a journey to find the mosquito's family.They walked and walked until they found the mosquito's family. The mosquito was so happy to return home. He said, "Thank you, Tim, for helping me!" Tim waved goodbye to the mosquito and went back to play with his friends. From that day on, Tim and the mosquito became great friends.

Sara and Ben like to play in the snow. They make snowmen and snowballs and snow forts. They have fun and laugh a lot. They are jolly.But sometimes the snow is very cold. Sara and Ben feel their fingers and toes get numb. They shiver and sneeze. They are not jolly anymore.They run to their house and look for a warm place. They find a big blanket on the couch. They wrap themselves in the blanket and cuddle. They feel cozy and happy. They are jolly again.They watch the snow fall outside the window. They see a bird land on a branch. The bird is very still. It does not move or sing. It looks like a statue."Look, Ben, the bird is freeze!" Sara says."No, Sara, the bird is frozen!" Ben says.They giggle and correct each other. They learn a new word. They are jolly and smart.

Once upon a time, there was a clever dog named Max. Max liked to help his mom. One day, Max saw his mom load a big box with many things. Max saw a soft cloth on the floor. He picked it up with his mouth and put it in the box. Max's mom was happy.The next day, Max's mom took the box to a big sale. Max went with her. They put the box on a table. Many people came to look at the things in the box. Max saw a little girl pick up the cloth he had put in the box. She was very happy.But wait! The cloth was not just a cloth. It was a magic cloth! When the little girl touched it, she could fly! Max and the little girl became friends. They had fun flying and playing together. Max was a clever dog, and he had found a magic cloth. Everyone was happy and surprised.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat. She was very sleepy and just wanted to rest all day. She found the perfect spot to nap; right behind the curtain in the living room.One day, the cat heard someone talking. It was the neighbour and he was asking his daughter if she had seen his cat. The girl said that she hadn't and the neighbour was very sad.The cat wanted to help so she spoke from behind the curtain. She said: "Here I am! I'm the cat you were looking for!"The girl was so happy and she ran to the curtain. She opened it and there was the lazy cat, purring gently.The neighbour was so grateful and thanked the cat for speaking. From that day forward, he made sure the cat was well-fed and also took good care of her.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a tiny squirrel named Sam. Sam loved to find acorns and hide them in his home. One day, he found a very big acorn under a tall tree. He was very happy and ready to take it home.As Sam was walking home, he met his friend, Birdie the bird. Birdie asked, "Sam, what do you have there?" Sam said, "I found a big acorn! I want to take it to my home." Birdie was happy for Sam and said, "That's great! Let me help you." So, they both carried the big acorn together.When they reached Sam's home, the door was locked. Sam said, "Oh no, I need to unlock my door." Birdie saw a small key on the ground and gave it to Sam. Sam used the key to unlock the door, and they went inside. They put the big acorn in Sam's home and were very happy. Sam thanked Birdie for helping him, and they played together for the rest of the day.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. He saw a long path with many zigzags. Tim wanted to be successful in walking the zigzag path. So, he started to walk on it.As Tim walked, he met a girl named Sue. Sue asked, "Can I walk with you?" Tim said, "Yes, let's walk the zigzag path together!" They walked and talked, and had fun twisting and turning on the path.At the end of the zigzag path, they found a big tree. Tim and Sue were happy and proud. They were successful in walking the whole path. They played under the tree and became good friends.

One day, a little cat named Tom felt very hot. He saw a big tree with lots of shade. Tom went under the tree and lay down. He let out a big yawn, as he was tired from the hot sun. Under the tree, he saw a little bird named Tim."Hi, Tim!" said Tom. "It is hot today.""Yes, it is," said Tim. "But I found a rare, cool spot under this tree."Tom and Tim played together under the tree. They were happy to have found a cool place to rest. They shared their food and water with each other. They played games and told stories.At the end of the day, Tom and Tim learned that sharing and helping each other is important. They felt happy and grateful to have each other as friends. And they knew they would always help each other when they needed it.

One day, a little shoe went for a march. The shoe was red and shiny. It liked to march around the park. The shoe met a squirrel. The squirrel was eating a spicy nut."Hello, squirrel," said the shoe. "Why is your nut spicy?"The squirrel looked at the shoe and said, "I like spicy nuts. They make me happy."The shoe wanted to try a spicy nut too. The squirrel gave the shoe a spicy nut. The shoe tried the nut and said, "Wow! That is spicy!"The shoe and the squirrel became friends. They marched around the park together, eating spicy nuts and having fun.

One day, a bird named Bob was ready to soar. He flapped his wings and went up in the sky. He saw his friend, the cat named Sam, on the ground. Sam had a small cut on his lip."Sam, are you okay?" asked Bob as he flew down to see him. Sam looked sad and said, "I am okay, but I want to soar like you, Bob."Bob thought for a moment and had an idea. He found a big leaf and told Sam to hold on tight. Then, Bob carried the leaf with Sam on it, and they began to soar together.But as they were flying, something unexpected happened. The wind blew very hard, and Sam lost his grip on the leaf. He fell down and landed on the ground with a thud.Bob quickly flew down to check on his friend. Sadly, Sam was not okay this time. He had many cuts and a big bump on his head. Bob felt bad for trying to make Sam soar like a bird. From that day on, he never tried to make his friends do things they were not meant to do.

One day, a girl named Lily set a cup of cocoa on the table. She was very happy because she loved cocoa. It was warm and sweet. Lily wanted to drink it all up.But, a crazy cat jumped on the table. The cat saw the cocoa and wanted to drink it too. The cat tried to drink the cocoa, but it was too hot! The cat jumped away and knocked the cup over.The cocoa spilled all over the table, but something unexpected happened. The cocoa turned into a big, sweet cake! Lily was so surprised. She shared the cake with the cat, and they both had a yummy treat.

One day, a big green crocodile went for a walk. He was calm and happy. He liked to walk near the water. The sun was hot and the sky was blue.As the crocodile walked, he saw a man. The man was scared of the crocodile, and he made a wish. "Please, make the crocodile disappear," he said. Suddenly, the crocodile was gone!But then, something unexpected happened. The crocodile did not really disappear. He just changed into a tiny bug! The man was not scared anymore. The crocodile, now a bug, was sad. He wanted to be big and green again. So, he made a wish too. "Please, make me a crocodile again," he said. And just like that, he was a big green crocodile again. The man and the crocodile became friends and were not scared of each other anymore.

One day, a little boy named Tim wanted to find his toy car. He asked his dependable friend, Sam, to help him in his search. They looked under the bed, in the toy box, and behind the sofa. But they could not find the toy car."Where could it be?" Tim asked. Sam tried to explain, "Maybe it's outside. Let's go look." They went to the yard and searched near the trees and the sandbox. But still, they could not find the toy car.Just then, Tim's little sister, Sue, came out with the toy car in her hand. "I found it!" she said with a big smile. Tim and Sam were surprised. They didn't think Sue could find it. They all laughed and played with the toy car together. And from that day on, they knew Sue could be a dependable friend too.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to watch planes at the airport. He would go with his mom and dad to see the big planes fly in the sky. The planes were harmless and made Tim very happy.One day, while Tim was at the airport, he saw a magic plane. The magic plane could disappear! Tim watched as the plane flew up, up, up, and then it was gone. He clapped his hands and laughed with joy.Tim told his mom and dad about the magic plane. They were so happy to see him having fun. They all went to the airport every week to watch the magic plane disappear. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a cute bird wanted to fly to the grocery. He wanted to find food for his family. On his way, he saw a big cat. The cat wanted to catch the bird.The bird said, "Please don't catch me, I need to find food for my family." The cat thought for a moment and then said, "Okay, I won't catch you. But you must help me find food too."So, the cute bird and the big cat went to the grocery together. They found food for their families. They became friends and helped each other. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a big pond, there lived a little otter. This otter was very selfish. He liked to play with his toys all by himself and did not like to share with his friends.One day, the otter was playing with his favorite toy, a ball. He saw his friend, a duck, come to him. The duck asked if he could play with the ball too. The otter said no and kept the ball to himself. The duck felt sad and walked away.Later, the otter saw his friend the duck crying. He felt bad for not sharing his ball. So, he went to the duck and gave him the ball to play with. They played together and had lots of fun. The otter learned that sharing is good. After playing, the otter helped the duck wipe away his tears. From that day, the otter was not selfish anymore.

One day, a boy named Tim found a big red shirt. He liked the shirt very much. He wanted to wear the shirt to the park. But his mom said, "No, it's too big. You can't wear it." Tim was sad.Tim insisted, "Please, Mom! I love the shirt. I want to wear it." His mom thought for a moment. "Okay," she said, "but be careful at the park."At the park, Tim saw a dog. The dog was loyal and friendly. It liked to play with Tim. But the red shirt was too big. The shirt got stuck on a tree while they played. Tim and the dog tried to get the shirt off the tree."Help me, dog!" Tim said. The loyal dog pulled and pulled. The shirt came off the tree. Tim was very happy. He thanked the dog and they played some more. Tim learned to be careful with his big red shirt.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was an amazing dog. He had a funny shape, with big ears and a small tail. Max loved to run and play in the park with his friends.One day, Max and his friends were playing in the park when Max started to suffer. His leg hurt a lot. Max's friends were worried about him. They knew they had to help Max feel better.Max's friends took him to a nice lady who knew how to help animals. She looked at Max's leg and said, "Don't worry, Max. I can help you." She gave Max a hug and put a soft bandage on his leg. Soon, Max felt better and could play with his friends again. They all had a great time in the park, and Max was happy to be an amazing dog with a funny shape once more.

Once upon a time, there was a polite train named Tim. Tim loved to puff steam from his big chimney. One day, Tim was going to a party with his friends. He was very happy.On the way to the party, Tim saw a little girl who was weeping. She was sad because she lost her toy. Tim wanted to help her. So, he stopped and asked, "Why are you weeping?" The girl said, "I lost my toy and I can't find it."Tim had an idea. He asked all his friends at the party to help look for the girl's toy. They looked everywhere, but they could not find it. Then, something unexpected happened. Tim found a magic key. He showed it to the girl and said, "Maybe this key can help us find your toy."The girl used the magic key to open a secret door. Inside, they found her lost toy and many more toys for all the kids at the party. The girl stopped weeping and everyone was happy. Tim and his friends had the best party ever. And the little girl never lost her toy again.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Buddy. Buddy lived in a small house with his friend, a little girl named Emma. One day, Emma and Buddy went to the park to play. They had so much fun running and jumping.While they were playing, Buddy saw an enormous ball. It was so big and shiny. Buddy wanted to find out what was inside the ball. He thought it might be a luxury treat for him. But the ball was too big for Buddy to open by himself. He needed Emma's help.Buddy barked and barked, trying to get Emma to come and help him. Emma didn't understand why Buddy was barking so much. She was worried and didn't know what to do. Finally, she saw the enormous ball and understood. Emma and Buddy worked together to open the ball. Inside, they found a luxury treat for Buddy and a new toy for Emma. They were so happy and played with their new things all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He had a modern bicycle. It was red and shiny. Tim loved to ride his bicycle every day.One day, while riding his bicycle, Tim heard a sound. It was a small bird. The bird was sad. It could not fly. Tim wanted to help the bird. He put the bird on his bicycle and took it home.At home, Tim and his mom took care of the bird. They gave it food and love. Soon, the bird was happy and could fly again. Tim and the bird became best friends. They played together every day. And when Tim rode his bicycle, the bird would fly beside him. They were very happy.

John and Anne were playing in their room."Let's make a rug," said Anne.John clapped his hands. "Yes! Let's do it!"They gathered some things to make their rug. John found some strips of cloth and Anne found some strings.They started to tie the cloth together with the strings. The rug was beginning to take shape.John pushed the edges in, making them smooth. "Wow, it looks so good!" exclaimed Anne.They took the rug outside and placed it on the ground.They ran and jumped on it. The rug was so soft and smooth.John and Anne's mom came to see what they were doing. "Come inside for dinner," she said.John and Anne reluctantly returned their rug to their room. They hugged it and promised to come back tomorrow to play with it.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily was 3 years old and loved to explore the world.One day, Lily found her dad's razor. She liked the shiny metal and asked her dad if she could play with it. Her dad said no. He said it was dangerous and not safe.Lily was a bit sad but she understood. She thanked her dad for keeping her safe and asked if she could get a special razor of her own.Her dad smiled. He said she could have a safe plastic razor to play with. Lily was very happy. She said thank you and ran off to get her new razor.She pretended to shave her dolls' faces all day and was very happy with her new safe razor.

Once upon a time, there was a cheerful frog named Tim. Tim lived in a big pond with his best friend, a fish named Sam. They liked to play and swim all day long. One day, they saw a big box near the pond. They did not know what was inside the box, so they went to look.Inside the box, they found many colorful toys. Tim and Sam were very happy. They decided to trade toys with each other. Tim gave Sam a red ball, and Sam gave Tim a blue car. They played with their new toys and had a lot of fun.Then, something unexpected happened. A little girl came to the pond and saw the box of toys. She was sad because she had lost her toys. Tim and Sam felt bad for the girl. They decided to give the toys back to her. The little girl was so happy that she gave Tim a big kiss on his head. Tim turned into a handsome prince! The little girl, Tim, and Sam all played together and became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy was a very intelligent girl. She loved to draw and create things with her pencil. She had a big box of pencils in many colors.One day, Lucy decided to create a picture for her mom. She took out her favorite pencil and started to draw. She drew a big sun, a blue sky, and a green tree. She added some pretty flowers and a cute dog.When she finished her picture, she ran to her mom and showed her the beautiful drawing. Her mom was so happy and proud of her intelligent little girl. They put the picture on the fridge for everyone to see. And every time Lucy looked at her picture, she smiled and felt proud of what she had created with her pencil.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy. He was three years old and he loved vegetables. He especially loved celery. Every day after school, he would come home and eat a long and crunchy celery stick.One day, he tried something weird. He put peanut butter on his celery stick. He scooped some peanut butter onto the celery and took a bite. It was strange, but he liked it.The little boy couldn’t wait to show his friends. He ran to the playground and told them all about his weird snack. His friends couldn’t understand why anyone would put peanut butter on celery. But the little boy said it was delicious and he kept eating it.Finally, the little boy’s friends all gave it a try. They all agreed it was strange, but yummy too. Now all the kids love eating celery with peanut butter. The little boy was happy to have shared something he understood with all his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a large cat named Biggie. Biggie had a small friend named Tiny. Tiny was a little mouse. They lived in a house with a big yard.One day, Biggie and Tiny wanted to play a game. Biggie said, "Let's play hide and seek." Tiny said, "Yes! I know that game. I will start." Tiny closed his eyes and counted. Biggie ran and hid behind a large tree.Tiny looked for Biggie. He looked under the table, in the box, and behind the door. Then, he saw the large tree. He knew Biggie was there. "I found you!" Tiny said. Biggie laughed and they played all day.

One day, a little girl named Lucy wanted to watch her favorite show on the television. It was a warm day outside, but she didn't want to play. She just wanted to sit and watch her show. Her mom said, "Lucy, it's warm outside, let's go play." But Lucy insisted, "No, Mom, I want to watch TV."Lucy's mom thought for a moment and said, "Okay, you can watch one show, but then we have to go outside and play." Lucy was happy and agreed. They sat on the warm couch and watched the show together.After the show, Lucy's mom said, "Now it's time to go outside and play." Lucy didn't want to, but she remembered her promise. They went outside and played in the warm sun. Lucy had so much fun that she forgot all about the television. She was glad that her mom insisted they go outside and play.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a mighty lion. He was the king of the forest. The lion had a lot of friends. One day, they all wanted to surprise him.The little bird flew high and far to the east. She found a big, shiny star. She thought the lion would like it. So she brought it back to the forest. The big elephant found a pretty flower. He knew the lion would love it.The animals all gathered around the lion's home. They hid behind the trees and waited for the lion to come out. When the lion came out, they all jumped out and shouted, "Surprise!"The lion looked at his friends and said, "Thank you, my friends! I love the shiny star and the pretty flower." They all laughed and played together. The mighty lion was very happy to have such good friends.

Once upon a time, a furry cat named Tom went on a tour. He wanted to see new things and make new friends. He walked and walked until he found a big park.In the park, Tom saw a little bird. Tom wanted to introduce himself to the bird. He said, "Hi, I am Tom! Do you want to be my friend?" The bird looked scared, but said, "Okay, I am Sam. Let's be friends."They played and played, but Tom started to get very hungry. He saw Sam, and thought, "I am a cat, and cats eat birds." So, Tom ate Sam. After that, Tom felt bad and was sad. He lost his new friend because he was too hungry.

One day, a little girl named Lucy had a bathrobe. She loved her bathrobe very much. It was soft and warm. Lucy wore her bathrobe every day.One morning, Lucy could not find her bathrobe. She looked under her bed and in her closet, but it was not there. Lucy was sad. She wanted to wear her bathrobe, but she did not know where it was. Lucy's big sister, Jane, saw her looking sad. Jane was a compassionate girl who always helped her sister.Jane told Lucy, "Don't be sad. Let's look for your bathrobe together." They looked in the living room and the kitchen. Finally, they found the bathrobe in the laundry room. Lucy was so happy. She put on her bathrobe and gave Jane a big hug. Jane was happy that she could help her sister.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty dog named Max. Max loved to play outside and throw a ball. One day, while Max was playing, he found a shiny rock on the ground. The rock was a diamond, but Max didn't know that. He thought it was just a fun, new toy to play with.Max wanted to show his friend, a little cat named Luna, his new toy. He ran to Luna's house and showed her the shiny rock. Luna looked at the rock and knew it was a diamond. She told Max that it was very special and they should keep it safe.Max and Luna decided to hide the diamond in a secret place. They dug a hole under a big tree and put the diamond inside. But when they went back the next day, the diamond was gone! Max and Luna were sad and confused. They looked and looked but could not find it.Then, they saw a squirrel running up the tree with the diamond in its mouth. Max and Luna chased the squirrel, and it dropped the diamond. They caught it just in time! Max and Luna were so happy that they found the diamond again. They decided to keep it safe in a new secret place, and the squirrel never found it again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy loved to pack her toys in a big drawer. One day, Amy's friend, Tom, came to play with her. They both wanted to play with the same toy car. Tom said, "I want to play with the car first."Amy felt jealous because she wanted to play with the car too. She said, "No, I want to play with the car first." They both started to cry.Amy's mom heard them and came into the room. She said, "Why don't you both pack your toys in the drawer and find a new toy to play with together?" Amy and Tom stopped crying. They packed their toys in the drawer and found a big ball to play with. They played together and had lots of fun. They were not jealous anymore.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Joe and Ann. Joe was a turkey and Ann was a little girl. Every day they would go out and play together.One day, Ann asked Joe if they could go on an adventure. Joe was excited and said yes.They went to a park. Ann said she wanted to fly like a turkey. Joe was happy to oblige and told her to grab his feathers. They quickly soared into the sky, starting their grand adventure.But when they reached the top, Joe and Ann could see for miles. Suddenly, they felt the wind start to push them away from each other. Joe and Ann were separating.Joe started flying backward, away from Ann. He was scared and had no idea what to do. Meanwhile, Ann started to cry. She had never been so far away from Joe before.But then there was a loud noise, like a bell ringing. Suddenly, Ann and Joe felt the wind stop and they flew back together. They were so happy to be reunited and hugged each other tightly.They flew back home, both thankful for their long, but exciting adventure. From that day forward, Joe and Ann never wanted to be separated again.

Once there was a sunflower that wanted to get bigger. It was a normal sunflower, so it wanted to spread its petals out. It asked the sun for help."Will you help me to spread?" the sunflower asked. The sun replied with a kindly voice, "Yes, I will help you".The sunflower smiled happily and began to spread its petals. But the sun was being mean. It spread too much heat, and the sunflower's petals got too dry and droopy. The sunflower shouted, "Why are you being so mean to me?" But the sun didn't answer. Instead, the sun burned the sunflower until it withered away. The sunflower was gone, and the sun's meanness had ruined the normal sunflower.

One day, a little bird was nervous. It wanted to fly away from its bush. It was scared to leave. The bird had a friend, a tiny bug, who lived in the same bush.The bug said, "Don't be nervous, my friend. You can do it! Just release your wings and fly."The little bird took a deep breath and released its wings. It started to fly. The bird was so happy. It flew high in the sky and looked down at the bush. The tiny bug waved at the bird, proud of its friend.The bird flew back to the bush and said, "Thank you, tiny bug. You helped me not be nervous. Now, I can fly and see the world."From that day, the bird and the tiny bug were the best of friends. They played together every day, and the little bird was never nervous again.

One day, a little girl named Sally went to the park with her mom. They brought a big, yummy cake with them. Sally was very happy because she loved cake. She wanted to eat it all by herself.Sally's mom said, "Wait, Sally! You can't eat the whole cake. You have to share with your friends." Sally didn't want to share, but she knew her mom was right. So, she took a piece of cake and gave it to her friend Tim. Tim said, "Thank you, Sally! This cake is so yummy!"Just then, a big gust of wind came and blew the cake away! Sally and Tim were sad because they wanted more cake. But then, a nice bird flew down and gave them a new cake! The bird said, "I saw your cake fly away, so I brought you a new one. But you have to promise to share it with everyone." Sally and Tim agreed to share the cake and they all had a fun day at the park.

Molly was a funny girl. She was three years old and loved to play with her friends. One day, she wanted to make her meal special, so she asked her mom for some sauce. Her mom said yes, and Molly was really happy. But when Molly put the sauce on her food, it was way too spicy for her to eat. She tried to resist the heat, but it was too strong. She knew that the sauce was stupid and she should have asked her mom for something else. Molly went back to her mom and asked for something milder. Her mom smiled and gave her a jar of mild sauce this time. Molly was so relieved, and she put the mild sauce on her food. It was just what she needed and she was able to enjoy her meal. Molly was happy that she resisted the heat of the spicy sauce. From that day, she would always look for milder options when it came to her meals.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a thoughtful bunny named Bob. Bob loved to spring around the forest, playing with his friends. One day, Bob found a comb on the ground. He picked it up and looked at it.Bob went to his friend, the squirrel, and said, "Look what I found! What do you think it's for?" The squirrel looked at the comb and thought for a moment. "I don't know, but let's try to find out," said the squirrel.As they were trying to find out what the comb was for, a big bird flew down and took the comb from them. The bird said, "This is my comb! I lost it when I was flying." Bob and the squirrel were surprised but happy that they found the owner of the comb. The bird thanked them and flew away, comb in beak. From that day on, Bob and the squirrel were more thoughtful about the things they found in the forest.

The sun rose in the sky. It was time for the two best friends to go outside and explore. They began to walk through the fields, when one of them suddenly shouted "watch out!". A big rock was up ahead.The friends slowed down and were very careful not to trip. They found a new path that had not been taken before. They explored for what felt like ages and then the sun began to set.The two friends knew that it was almost time to head back home, but the path before them seemed so long and daunting. They decided to take the same path that they had found earlier.It was almost dark, but the two friends trusted that the path would lead them back home safe and sound. As they rounded the corner, they saw a beautiful light in the distance. It was the sun, rising in the sky. The two friends knew that they would make it back safely, just like they had done hundreds of times before. They kept walking, careful and happy.

Little Joey was out in the yard playing with his friends. His parents had given him strict instructions to behave. He was doing his best, but suddenly something caught his eye. It was an expensive whip!Joey couldn't keep himself from it – he reached out and touched the whip. He knew it was wrong, but he couldn't help it!His parents saw him, and they were not happy. They told him that they had told him to behave and not to touch the whip. Joey couldn't help but feel sad, he knew he had made a mistake.His parents showed him that it was important to obey their instructions. They told him that he needed to listen and that it was for his own good. Joey understood, and he promised to be better next time.

One day, a bright sun was shining in the sky. A little boy named Tim went to the park to play. He saw his friend, Tom, who had a toy gun. They both laughed and clapped their hands.Tom showed Tim how to play with the toy gun. They took turns pretending to be cowboys. They ran, jumped, and clapped their hands as they played. The bright sun made them feel happy and warm.After a while, they got tired and sat down under a big tree. They shared a yummy snack and talked about their fun day. Tim and Tom clapped their hands one more time before they went home. They couldn't wait to play together again.

Once upon a time, in a big jungle, there lived a fast rabbit. The rabbit liked to run and play all day with his friends. They would jump, hop, and race each other under the tall trees.One hot day, the fast rabbit was very tired from playing. He found a nice, cool spot under a big tree. He decided to rest there for a while. As he lay down, he looked up at the sky and saw the pretty birds flying above him.After a short rest, the fast rabbit felt much better. He jumped up and ran to find his friends. They all played together again, happy and full of energy. And when they were tired, they knew they could always find a nice spot in the jungle to rest.

Once there was a girl who decided to buy a sandwich. She had enough money, but wanted to find the cheapest sandwich in town. She went to the market and found a sandwich that was very cheap.The girl looked at the sandwich. It didn't look very tasty. She asked the seller, "Is this sandwich really cheap?"The seller smiled and replied, "Yes, it is. But you should probably wear gloves when you eat it. It's not fresh."The girl was too tired to search for another sandwich, so she decided to take the cheap sandwich anyway. When she came home and started eating it, she noticed that it tasted funny. She got sick and had to stay in bed for a week.The girl had learned her lesson. Always wear gloves when eating a cheap sandwich!

One day, a little girl named Amy was playing in her room. She had a big, soft mattress to jump on. Amy liked to count how many times she could jump. She felt good when she jumped high.Amy's friend, Ben, came over to play. They both started to jump on the mattress. Ben said, "I can jump more times than you!" This made Amy sad. They decided to have a jumping contest to see who could jump the most.As they started to jump, something unexpected happened. A funny, talking bird flew in through the window. The bird said, "Stop! If you jump too much, the mattress will break!" Amy and Ben stopped jumping. They looked at each other and laughed. They didn't know birds could talk. The bird had saved their mattress, and they all became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a pet lizard named Lizzy. Lizzy was a delicate lizard with soft green skin. Mia loved to play with Lizzy every day.One sunny day, Mia and Lizzy were in the garden. Mia saw many colorful rocks. She said, "Lizzy, let's sort the rocks by color!" Lizzy nodded her little head. Mia and Lizzy started to sort the rocks into piles of red, blue, and yellow.As they sorted, a little boy named Tim came by. He saw Mia and Lizzy and said, "Wow! What are you doing?" Mia smiled and replied, "We are sorting rocks by color with my lizard, Lizzy!" Tim joined them, and they all had fun sorting rocks together.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his old dog, Max. They played with a ball and ran all around. Tim felt hungry, so he sat on a bench and took out a waffle from his bag. Max sat next to Tim and yawned.A big bird saw the waffle and wanted it. The bird flew down and said, "Can I have your waffle? I am very hungry." Tim looked at the bird and thought for a moment. "Okay," said Tim, "You can have half of my waffle." The bird was happy and took the half waffle.Then, something unexpected happened. The bird grew bigger and bigger! It was a magic waffle! The bird said, "Thank you, Tim. Now I can fly very high and see the world." Tim and Max were amazed. They waved goodbye to the big bird as it flew away into the sky.

One day, a quiet girl named Lucy had a box of pastels. She liked to draw with them. She drew a big sun and a green tree. Lucy was very happy with her drawings.Lucy's friend, Tom, came over to play.
