"Can I draw too?" he asked. Lucy said, "Yes, but be careful with my pastels." Tom picked a blue pastel and drew a big river. They were having fun.Then, Lucy saw that her favorite pastel was gone. She felt sad and asked Tom, "Did you lose my pastel?" Tom looked around and said, "I don't know." They searched for it together. Suddenly, their drawings came to life! The sun was shining, the tree was dancing, and the river was flowing. The lost pastel was floating on the river. Lucy and Tom were surprised and happy. They took the pastel and kept drawing their magical world.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little dog named Max. Max loved to play with his ball. He would run and jump, and his friends would laugh and clap.One sunny day, Max saw a big stair. He thought, "I want to play on the stair!" So, Max ran to the stair with his ball. He put the ball at the top of the stair and let it roll down. The ball went "bump, bump, bump" all the way to the bottom.Max's friend, a little girl named Lily, saw him playing on the stair. She said, "Max, that looks fun! Can I play with you?" Max wagged his tail and barked, "Yes, let's play together!" So, Max and Lily played on the stair all day long, laughing and having fun. And they lived happily ever after.

Once there was a little boy who wanted to go swimming. He put on his swimsuit and grabbed his float. Then he ran to the pool.When he got there, he was so excited. He climbed into the pool and the cool water felt so good. He jumped in and started swimming. He swam around the edge of the pool.Then he went under the water and closed his eyes. He held his breath and dived deep. He swam around, pretending he was a fish. Suddenly the fog rolled in. It was dark and the little boy was so tired. He decided to go home. He quickly climbed out of the pool, dried off and put his clothes back on. He waved goodbye to the pool and ran home. He was so happy he had gone swimming, even though it was in the fog.

Once upon a time, there was a dragon. The dragon was big and had a long tail. It lived in a cave near a small town. The people in the town were scared of the dragon. They thought the dragon would hurt them.One day, a brave boy went to the cave. He wanted to shoot the dragon with a toy arrow. The boy thought this would make the dragon go away. He walked to the cave and saw the dragon. It was clear that the dragon was very big.But, the dragon did not want to hurt the boy. The dragon was sad and lonely. It wanted to be friends with the people in the town. The boy saw the dragon's tears and felt bad. He put down his toy arrow and hugged the dragon. They became friends, and the dragon helped the town by scaring away the bad animals. The people in the town were not scared of the dragon anymore. They all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a pirate who loved to swim. He had an interesting hat with a big feather. He lived near the sea and liked to find treasure.One day, the pirate was swimming in the sea when he saw a big box. He thought it was treasure and swam to get it. The pirate was very happy and excited.But when he opened the box, he found a little fish inside. The fish could talk! It said, "I am a magic fish. If you let me go, I will give you a wish." The pirate was surprised and let the fish go. The fish swam away, and the pirate got his wish. He wished for more interesting hats with big feathers.

Once upon a time, there was a little squirrel named Sam. Sam loved to wave to his friends. One day, Sam found a big, hairy acorn under a tree. He was so happy! He wanted to show it to all his friends.Sam waved to his friend, the bird, and showed her the hairy acorn. The bird was amazed. Then, Sam waved to his friend, the rabbit, and showed him the hairy acorn too. The rabbit was also amazed. Sam felt very proud of his big, hairy acorn.But then, something unexpected happened. The big, hairy acorn started to move! It was not an acorn at all, but a little, hairy bug! The bug waved to Sam and his friends. They all laughed and waved back. Now, Sam had a new friend to wave to every day.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow box. The box had a name. Its name was Boxy. Boxy was a happy box. Boxy liked to play with friends.One day, Boxy went to the park. Boxy saw a little girl. The little girl was sad. Boxy wanted to help. Boxy went to the girl and said, "Hi, my name is Boxy. Do you want to play with me?"The little girl smiled. She said, "Yes, I want to play with you, Boxy." They played all day. They played with a ball. They played with a toy car. They had fun.At the end of the day, the girl said, "Thank you, Boxy. You are a good friend." Boxy was happy. Boxy and the girl went home. They were best friends forever.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a patient cat named Tom. Tom was light and soft. He liked to play and sleep all day. One day, Tom saw a big yawn come from his friend, the dog. The dog was very tired.Tom wanted to help his friend feel better. He thought of a plan. He would find a soft bed for the dog to sleep on. Tom looked around and found a big, soft pillow. He pushed the pillow to the dog.The dog was happy to see the soft pillow. He lay down on it and closed his eyes. Tom felt proud of his work. But then, something bad happened. The pillow was too light and it moved away from the dog.The dog fell on the floor and woke up. He was very sad and still tired. Tom tried to help, but the bad ending made the dog sad. Tom felt bad too, and they both wished they could find a better bed for the dog to sleep on.

Lily and Tom were playing in the park. They liked to run, jump and slide. They had a lot of fun. But they did not see the big cloud that came over the sun. The cloud was dark and loud. It made a scary noise. Boom!Lily and Tom were scared. They ran to their mom. "Mom, mom, what is that?" they cried.Mom hugged them and said, "Don't worry, my loves. That is just thunder. It is the sound of the cloud. Sometimes the cloud makes thunder and rain. But it will not hurt you. It is just water."Lily and Tom looked at the sky. They saw drops of rain falling. They felt the rain on their skin. It was wet and cold. They did not like it."Can we go home, mom?" they asked."Sure, we can go home. But first, let me tell you something. Do you know why the cloud makes thunder and rain?" mom asked.Lily and Tom shook their heads.Mom said, "The cloud makes thunder and rain because it is tired. It has been carrying a lot of water for a long time. It needs to let go of some water. That is why it rains. And when it rains, it makes room for the sun to come back. The sun is always there, behind the cloud. It is waiting for its turn to shine. The sun is not scared of the thunder. It knows that the thunder is just a noise. And the sun is not angry at the cloud. It knows that the cloud is just tired. The sun and the cloud are friends. They share the sky. They take turns to give us light and water. They are both good for us."Lily and Tom listened to mom. They felt less scared. They understood that the thunder and rain were not bad. They were just part of nature. They learned to respect the sun and the cloud. They thanked mo

Once upon a time, there was a judge who everyone knew was very smart. He was so smart, that no one had ever been able to outsmart him. One day, a man came to town who was very ambitious. He was determined to prove he was smarter than the judge. So, he went to court and asked the judge a simple question. He said, "Do you think I'm stupid?"The judge thought for a moment and then he answered, "No, I don't think you're stupid. But I do think you might forget something."The daring man accepted the judge's answer, but he still wanted to prove he was smarter. So, he tried to think of something he could forget.A few days later, the man returned to court. He had forgotten to bring a witness which would have helped him to prove his case. The judge declared the man was wrong and that he had been too foolish to remember. The man went away embarrassed, realising that the judge had known he would forget something all along. He had been trying to prove something to the judge and all he had done was make himself look stupid.

Lila and Ben are playing with a big ball in the park. They like to bounce the ball and catch it. Sometimes they bounce the ball very high and it goes over the fence.One day, they bounce the ball too hard and it flies over the fence and lands in a bush. They run to the fence and look for the ball. They see the ball in the bush, but they also see something else. It is a small animal with sharp spikes on its back. It is a hedgehog."Look, Ben, a hedgehog!" Lila says. "It is so cute!""Can we touch it?" Ben asks."I don't know," Lila says. "Maybe it will hurt us with its spikes."They watch the hedgehog for a while. It does not move. It looks scared."Maybe it is lonely," Lila says. "Maybe it wants to play with us."She reaches her hand over the fence and tries to grab the ball. The hedgehog sees her hand and curls up into a ball. It shows its spikes."Ow!" Lila says. She pulls back her hand. It has a small scratch. "It bit me!""It did not bite you," Ben says. "It poked you with its spikes. It is trying to protect itself."He looks at the hedgehog and says in a gentle voice, "Don't be afraid, little hedgehog. We are not going to hurt you. We just want our ball back. Can you please move away from the ball?"The hedgehog hears Ben's voice and uncurls a little. It sees that Ben and Lila are not mean. It waddles away from the ball and hides under a leaf."Thank you, little hedgehog," Ben says. He reaches his hand over the fence and takes the ball. He shows it to Lila. "See? It is not broken. We can still play with it."Lila smiles and hugs Ben. She looks at the hedgehog and says, "Bye, little hedgehog. Maybe

Once upon a time, a big cat named Tom lived in a house. One day, Tom wanted to play in the hall. He saw a small box and thought it would be fun to fit inside it. But Tom was too big for the box. He tried and tried, but he just could not fit.Tom's friend, a little mouse named Jerry, saw him trying to fit in the box. Jerry laughed and said, "You are too big, Tom! You cannot fit in that box!" Tom felt embarrassed, but he did not give up. He wanted to show Jerry that he could fit in the box.Then, something unexpected happened. The box started to grow bigger and bigger! Tom was very surprised. He tried again, and this time, he fit in the box! Jerry was amazed and said, "Wow, Tom! You did it!" Tom felt very happy and proud. From that day on, Tom and Jerry played together in the hall with the magical box.

One day, a girl named Lily found a mop in her house. This mop was not like any other mop. It was amazing! The mop could talk and walk. Lily was very happy to have a new friend."Hi, I am Mr. Mop!" said the mop. Lily asked, "How can you talk and walk?" Mr. Mop tried to explain, but he did not know. He said, "I don't know, but I am happy to be your friend."Lily and Mr. Mop played all day. They had lots of fun. At the end of the day, Lily said, "Thank you, Mr. Mop, for being my friend." Mr. Mop smiled and said, "You are welcome, Lily. I am happy to be your amazing mop friend!"

Once upon a time, in a big dark forest, there was a little acorn. The little acorn was sad because it could not speak like the animals. It wanted to have friends and play with them. Every day, the little acorn would watch the animals play and wish it could join them.One sunny day, a small bird came to the acorn and said, "Hello, little acorn! Why are you sad?" The little acorn thought hard and then made a tiny sound. The bird was very happy and said, "You can speak! Now we can be friends and play together."From that day on, the little acorn and the small bird became best friends. They played together in the big dark forest every day. The little acorn was not sad anymore because it could speak and had a friend. All the animals in the forest were happy to see the little acorn and the small bird playing and having fun.

Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to run, jump and hide behind the trees. They saw many flowers, bugs and birds. They were happy and curious.One day, they found a big bush with green leaves and red balls. They had never seen it before. They wondered what it was."Look, Ben, what is this?" Lily asked."I don't know, Lily. Maybe it is a fruit?" Ben said."A fruit? Can we eat it?" Lily said.They picked one red ball and smelled it. It smelled sweet and fresh. They broke it in half and saw many tiny seeds inside. They tasted it. It was juicy and sour."Mmm, this is good!" Lily said."Yes, it is! I like it!" Ben said.They ate more red balls and smiled. They had discovered a new fruit. They called it a berry. They decided to share some with their mom and dad. They ran to the house with their hands full of berries. They were proud and excited.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her mommy and daddy. One day, Lily felt confused when she saw a new room in her house. She didn't know where it came from.Lily went inside the new room and saw a tiny kitten. The kitten looked sad and scared. Lily asked the kitten, "Why are you sad?" The kitten said, "I don't know where my mommy is."Lily wanted to help the kitten. She had an idea! She said, "I will raise you and take care of you." The kitten was happy. They played and had fun in the new room. Lily and the kitten became best friends.

One day, a boy named Tim had a radio. He loved to listen to songs on it. Tim was an obedient boy. He always did what his mom and dad said.One day, Tim's friend Sam came to play. They played with the radio. But then, the radio stopped working. Sam said, "I will offer to help fix it." Tim was sad and said, "No, I will do it."Tim and Sam started to argue. They both wanted to fix the radio. Tim's mom heard them and came to see what was wrong. She said, "You both can work together to fix the radio."Tim and Sam listened to Tim's mom. They worked together and fixed the radio. They were happy and played more songs. The moral of the story is to work together and be a good friend.

Once there was a boy named Joe who wanted to buy some gum. He went to the store with his mom. When he reached the store he was so excited, he wanted to try all kinds of flavors.Mom said, “Joe, this is not a plan. You need to be careful and only buy one!”Joe was fearful because he had never bought gum before. “Okay, mom”, he said nervously. He slowly looked at all the flavors and eventually chose his favorite one.He went to the counter to pay for the gum and the cashier asked, “Is this your plan, Joe?”Joe replied, “Yes, this is my plan.”The moral of the story is: sometimes it's best to stick to your plan. Joe was smart to listen to his mom and it was a good plan to only buy one type of gum. This made him feel better and much less fearful.

Once there was a monkey who loved to eat bananas. He was always so happy when he bit into a banana.One day, he noticed something strange. The banana he had was weak, not like the pleasant, juicy banana he was used to. Still, he decided to take a bite. The monkey heard a voice calling his name. It was the voice of his best friend, the parrot. "Come quick, friend!" the parrot shouted.The monkey scrambled over to the parrot and asked what he wanted.The parrot said, "I found a big, juicy banana! It's the best one I've ever seen!"The monkey was overjoyed! He ran as fast as he could to the spot where the parrot found it. But when he arrived, the banana was still weak.The monkey was disappointed, but the parrot made him laugh by telling a funny joke. The monkey was so grateful to the parrot for cheering him up.They both went off in search of a better banana.

Once there was a popular tiger. She loved to explore the big, wild world. One day she stumbled upon a tall, green tree. She wanted to climb the tree and see the world from a different perspective. The tiger was very excited and, with one big leap, she started to climb the tree. The tiger stumbled, but she kept going all the way up to the top of the tree. She soon reached the highest branch and was able to see the whole world from the top. The tiger was so happy! She ran from one branch to the next while admiring the landscape. But then she stumbled one last time and tumbled to the ground. She wasn't hurt, but the tiger was determined to climb the tree again. The next day, she attempted the climb again and finally made it to the top of the tree. The tiger was so proud of herself. She enjoyed the view until it was time to go home. The popular tiger was now famous for her climbing skills!

Once upon a time, there was a dog named Buddy. Buddy loved to dig and find bones. One day, he found a big bone in his yard. He was very happy.Buddy wanted to share his bone with his friend, Daisy. So, he picked up the bone and ran to Daisy's house. He felt anxious because he wanted Daisy to like the bone too.When Buddy got to Daisy's house, he said, "Daisy, I deliver you a big bone!" Daisy was very happy and said, "Thank you, Buddy!" They played with the bone all day and had lots of fun.

One day, a wild hippo went to the river to drink water. He felt very tired and wanted to sleep. He looked around and saw a big tree with soft grass under it. The hippo went to the tree and lay down on the grass to sleep.A little bird saw the sleeping hippo and flew down to talk to him. "Hello, Mr. Hippo! Why are you sleeping here?" the bird asked. The hippo opened his eyes and said, "I am very tired, and the grass is soft. It is a good place to sleep."But then, something unexpected happened! The tree started to shake, and the hippo and the bird looked up. They saw a big monkey jumping from one branch to another. The monkey was making a lot of noise, and the hippo could not sleep anymore. The hippo was sad, but the bird had an idea. The bird told the monkey, "Please be quiet, our friend hippo needs to sleep." The monkey felt sorry and stopped jumping. The wild hippo closed his eyes, and with the help of his new friends, he could finally sleep peacefully under the tree.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was very enthusiastic and loved to play with his friends. Tim had a favorite day, and that day was Tuesday. Every Tuesday, he would go to the park with his friends and play all day long.One Tuesday, Tim wanted to play with his best friend, Sam. But Sam wanted to play at home instead of the park. Tim insisted that they go to the park because it was his favorite day. Sam did not want to go, and they started to argue.In the end, Tim and Sam decided to play at home for a while and then go to the park together. They both had a great time, and Tim learned that sometimes it is important to listen to his friends too.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a big piano. A little girl named Amy lived there. She was fearful of the piano because it made loud noises.One day, Amy's friend Tom came to play. Tom wanted to play the piano. Amy said, "No, don't play the piano! It's scary!" Tom didn't listen to her. He wanted to play it anyway.Tom played the piano, and it made a very loud noise. Amy was so scared that she ran away. She tried to prevent Tom from playing more, but she couldn't. Tom kept playing, and the noise scared away all the other kids. In the end, Amy and Tom were all alone, and they didn't have any more fun.

One day, a boy named Tom went to the beach. He saw a small yacht in the water. He wanted to test it, so he asked his mom, "Can I play with the yacht, please?"His mom said, "Yes, but be careful." Tom was very happy. He went into the water and started to play with the yacht. He was very persistent and did not want to stop.Suddenly, a big wave came and took the yacht away. Tom was sad, but he did not give up. He looked and looked for the yacht. Then, he saw a big fish with the yacht in its mouth! The fish swam to Tom and gave him the yacht back. Tom said, "Thank you, fish!" and went back to playing with his yacht.

Once upon a time, there was a regular goose. The goose had many friends. They all lived on a big farm.One day, the goose had a good idea. It wanted to organize a fun day for all its friends. The goose told its friends about the plan. They were all very happy.The day came, and the regular goose had organized many games for its friends. They played, laughed, and had a great time. At the end of the day, all the friends thanked the goose for organizing the fun day. They all went to sleep with big smiles on their faces.

Once upon a time, there was a cheerful dog named Spot. Spot had very soft fur. He loved to play with his friends in the park. One day, Spot saw a big tree with a small cat stuck up high. The cat was sad and scared.Spot wanted to help the cat. He had an idea. He called his friend, Birdy. "Birdy, can you help me get the cat down?" Spot asked. Birdy said, "Yes, I can help you, Spot!"Birdy flew up to the tree and talked to the cat. The cat was still scared, but Birdy told her to trust Spot. The cat agreed to trust Spot. Birdy held the cat's paw, and they both flew down to the ground. The cat was happy to be down.Spot and the cat became good friends. They played together in the park every day. The cat was very thankful to Spot and Birdy for helping her. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a charming dog named Spot. Spot lived in a big lab with a kind man named Tom. They loved to play with a red ball every day.One day, Spot found a blue box in the lab. Spot wanted to put his red ball in the blue box. He picked up the ball with his mouth and carried it to the box.Spot put the red ball in the blue box. The ball fit perfectly! Tom saw Spot and smiled. They both clapped their hands and paws, happy to have found a new place for the red ball. And they continued to play and have fun in their big lab.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty dog named Max. Max was big and strong, and he loved to run and play with his friends. One day, Max got hurt while playing with his friends. His leg was in pain, so his owner took him to the vet.At the vet, the doctor said Max needed an operation to fix his leg. Max was scared, but his owner hugged him and said it would be okay. The operation would help Max feel better and play with his friends again.After the operation, Max had to rest for a while. He could not run or play with his friends yet. Max's owner stayed with him and gave him lots of love. Soon, Max felt better and was able to play again. He was happy and mighty once more, running and playing with his friends in the sun.

Once upon a time, there was a big, deep forest. In the forest, there was a log. The log was very big and long. Many animals liked to sit on the log and play.One day, a little rabbit named Hope came to the log. She saw her friends, a squirrel and a bird, playing on the log. They were having a lot of fun. Hope wanted to play with them too, but she was scared. The log was very high for her.Hope's friends saw her and said, "Come on, Hope! You can do it!" They helped her climb up the log. Hope was very happy to play with her friends on the big, deep log. They played all day and had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a bird named Bobby. Bobby loved to soar high in the sky. Every day, he would fly above the trees and look down at all his friends.One day, Bobby saw his friend, Ellie the elephant, looking sad. "Why are you sad, Ellie?" asked Bobby. "My back hurts," said Ellie. "I need a massage, but I can't reach my back." Bobby wanted to help Ellie feel better.Bobby had a persistent idea. He called his friends, the ants, and asked them for help. The ants climbed on Ellie's back and gave her a gentle massage. Ellie felt so much better! She thanked Bobby and the ants for their help. From that day on, they all became great friends who always helped each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little fairy. This fairy had a big heart, but she was not pretty. She was ugly. All the other fairies had pretty wings, but her wings were not nice.One day, a little girl saw the ugly fairy. The girl asked the fairy for help. The ugly fairy wanted to help the girl, but the girl was scared. She said, "No, I want a pretty fairy." The ugly fairy was sad, but she did not refuse.The ugly fairy went to find a pretty fairy. She asked her friend, the pretty fairy, to help the girl. The pretty fairy said yes. They both went back to the girl. The girl was happy to see the pretty fairy.The pretty fairy helped the girl, and the ugly fairy watched. The girl said thank you to the pretty fairy. Then, she looked at the ugly fairy. She said, "I am sorry I was scared. You are nice too." The ugly fairy smiled, and they all became friends.

Once upon a time, there was a long cat named Nod. Nod loved sugar. He would eat it all day if he could. One day, Nod found a big bag of sugar in the kitchen. He was very happy.But there was a problem. Nod's friend, a little dog named Momo, also liked sugar. Momo saw the big bag of sugar and wanted some too. Nod and Momo looked at each other. They both wanted the sugar, but there was only one bag.Nod had an idea. He thought they could share the sugar. Nod and Momo agreed to share the sugar and be happy friends. They each took some sugar and ate it together. From that day on, Nod and Momo always shared their treats and stayed the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a best friend named Will. They played together every day. They loved to run, jump, and laugh together.One day, Lily accidentally broke Will's toy. She felt so sorry. She didn't know what to do. She thought and thought. Then, she had an idea. She went to Will and whispered, "I'm so sorry, Will. I broke your toy. Can we fix it together?"Will looked sad, but he smiled and said, "It's okay, Lily. We can try to fix it." They worked together and fixed the toy. They were happy again.The moral of the story is to always say sorry when you make a mistake and to help each other fix problems.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little boy named Tim. Tim loved to whistle. He would whistle all day long. One day, Tim went to school. He was very excited.At school, Tim saw his friend, Sue. "Hi Sue!" said Tim. "Do you want to hear me whistle?" Sue nodded, so Tim whistled a happy tune. "Wow!" said Sue, "That was fun!"But then, the teacher came in. She did not like the whistling. "No whistling in school!" she said. Tim felt sad. He did not want to stop whistling.Later, Tim tried to whistle again. But the teacher heard him. She was very mad. "No more school for you!" she said. Tim had to go home.Tim was very sad. He loved school, but he could not go back. All because he could not stop whistling.

The day was boring. Not much was happening. John, a toddler, wanted to play outside.His dad said, "John, why don't you display what you can do?"John thought for a moment and then he ran to the kitchen. He grabbed a sandwich and ran back to his dad. He proudly displayed it in his hands and smiled.His dad laughed and said, "That's great! While that was a good display, why don't you try something more exciting?"John thought for a second and then ran off to the backyard. He grabbed his toy truck and ran back to his dad. He proudly displayed it in his hands and smiled.His dad was pleased. "That's even better! Great job, John. That was a very exciting display!"

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim really wanted a puppy to play with. One day, he saw a powerful puppy near his house. The puppy was big and strong.Tim went to the puppy and said, "Hi, puppy! I want to play with you." The puppy looked at Tim and wagged its tail. They played all day and had lots of fun. Tim was very happy.But then, something unexpected happened. The powerful puppy started to grow even bigger! It grew so big that it could not play with Tim anymore. Tim was sad and said, "Bye, big puppy." The big puppy walked away, and Tim never saw it again.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play with snow. They make a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They give him a carrot nose and two buttons for eyes. They are happy.But the sun is very hot. The snowman starts to melt. His hat falls off. His scarf gets wet. His nose and eyes drop. Lily and Ben are sad.They run to Lily's house. They find some paper and crayons. They draw a picture of the snowman. They make him smile. They write his name: Sam. They are happy again.They go back to the snowman. He is very small now. They put the picture next to him. They say goodbye to Sam. They hug each other. They are kind.The snowman sees the picture. He sees his smile. He sees his name. He sees Lily and Ben. He is happy too. He melts with love.

George was an old man who lived in the biggest house in town. Every morning he would take a walk in the park. One day, something special happened.George heard a noise. He looked around and saw a white rabbit racing towards him. It was so fast! George smiled as the rabbit ran by. He thought it was the most wonderful thing he had ever seen.Soon, more rabbits joined in the race. George watched as the white rabbits raced around the park. He loved to watch them go faster and faster.When the race was over, the old man was so happy. He said, “That was the best race I’ve ever seen!”. George went home and told all his friends about the wonderful white rabbits. They all wished they could watch the race too.

One day, a dog named Spot saw an unusual bird. The bird was very big and had many colors. Spot wanted to play with the bird, so he ran after it. The bird flew away and Spot sighed. He wanted to be friends with the bird.Spot saw the bird again and said, "Please be my friend. I want to play with you." The bird looked at Spot and said, "Okay, but we must play in peace. No running or loud noises."They played together in the park. Spot and the bird had fun and were very happy. They played in peace and made no loud noises. Spot and the bird became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a big wish to be like her mommy. Lucy would admire her mommy all day, as she cooked, cleaned, and took care of her.One day, Lucy thought she could be like her mommy if she put on her makeup. But Lucy was naughty and did not ask for help. She took mommy's makeup and put it all over her face. It was a big mess!Mommy saw Lucy and said, "Lucy, you should not be naughty and take my things without asking. Always ask for help when you need it." Lucy felt sad, but she learned her lesson. From that day on, she always asked for help and became a good girl. And when she grew up, she was just like her mommy, who she admired so much.

Ben and Mia were playing in the snow. They made a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They gave him a carrot nose and two rocks for eyes."Hello, Mr. Snowman!" Ben said. "Do you like our town?"The snowman did not say anything. He was very still and cold."Maybe he is shy," Mia said. "Or maybe he is dead."Ben and Mia looked at each other. They did not know what dead meant. They had heard it on TV, but they did not understand."What is dead?" Ben asked.Mia shrugged. She did not know either."Let's ask Mom," she said.They ran to their house and knocked on the door. Mom opened it and smiled."Hi, kids. Did you have fun in the snow?""Yes, Mom. But we have a question," Ben said."What is it?""What is dead?" Mia asked.Mom looked surprised. She knelt down and hugged them."Dead is when something is not alive anymore. When it does not breathe or move or feel. Like a flower that withers or a toy that breaks.""Is Mr. Snowman dead?" Ben asked.Mom shook her head."No, honey. Mr. Snowman is not dead. He is just frozen. Frozen is when something is very cold and hard. Like ice or snow. But frozen things can melt and change. Like when the sun comes out and makes the snowman smaller.""Will Mr. Snowman come alive then?" Mia asked.Mom smiled."No, sweetie. Mr. Snowman is not alive. He is just a fun thing we made with snow. But we can pretend he is alive and talk to him and play with him. And we can make him again next time it snows."Ben and Mia nodded. They understood a little bit better."Can we go back and play with Mr. Snowman?" Ben asked."Sure, but wear your coats and gloves. It is very cold outside.""Okay, Mom. Th

One day, a boy named Tim went for a walk. He saw a dark cave. Tim was scared, but he wanted to see what was inside. He took a deep breath and went in.Inside the cave, he found a big missile. Tim did not know what it was, but it made him smile. He thought it looked like a big toy. Then, he heard a voice say, "Hello, do you like my missile?"Tim looked around and saw a friendly robot. The robot said, "I am Rob, and this is my missile. I use it to help people." Tim smiled again and said, "I like your missile, Rob. It is big and dark like the cave."Rob and Tim became good friends. They played with the missile and had fun in the dark cave. From that day on, they always smiled when they saw each other.

Sam liked to dream at night. He dreamed of many things. He dreamed of flying in the sky, or swimming in the sea, or playing with his toys. Sometimes he dreamed of scary things, like monsters or ghosts, but he knew they were not real.One night, he dreamed of an alligator. The alligator was big and green and had many teeth. It was wet and slimy and made a loud noise. Sam was afraid of the alligator. He wanted to run away, but he could not move."Hello, little boy," the alligator said. "Do you want to be my friend?"Sam shook his head. He did not want to be friends with the alligator. He wanted to wake up."Why not?" the alligator asked. "I am lonely. I have no friends. Everyone is afraid of me."Sam felt sorry for the alligator. He did not like to be lonely. He had many friends at home and at school. He wondered why the alligator had no friends."Maybe you could be nicer to others," Sam said. "Maybe you could smile more and share your things and play nice games. Then maybe others would not be afraid of you."The alligator thought about what Sam said. He had never tried to be nice to others. He had always been mean and greedy and angry. He wondered if he could change."Maybe you are right," the alligator said. "Maybe I could try to be nicer. Will you help me?"Sam nodded. He decided to help the alligator. He taught him how to smile and share and play nice games. The alligator learned and had fun. He felt happy and grateful."Thank you, little boy," the alligator said. "You are a good friend. You have made me happy."Sam smiled. He was happy too. He had made a new friend. He was not afraid of the alliga

A mommy and her daughter were walking through the park. The mommy asked her daughter if she wanted something from the store. The daughter nodded her head enthusiastically. So, mommy and daughter went to the store. When they got to the store, the daughter saw a lovely shirt. She asked her mommy if she could have it. The mommy smiled and agreed. The clerk asked mommy and daughter if they need help. Mommy politely asked if they could supply the shirt. The clerk nodded and they bought the shirt.When they returned home, the daughter was very happy. She put on her shirt and thanked her mommy for being so polite to the clerk. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to number his toys. One day, Tim saw some ice outside. He wanted to play with the ice. He put on his coat and ran outside.Tim found a big empty box. He had an idea. "I will put the ice in the box," he said. So he picked up the ice and put it in the box. He numbered the ice, too. "One, two, three," he said.As Tim played with the ice, it began to melt. "Oh no," he said, "my ice is going away!" The ice turned into water. The box was not empty anymore. Tim was sad. He went back inside his house. The ice was gone, and Tim could not play with it anymore.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a little bird named Billy. Billy loved to sing. Every day, he sang happy songs. All the animals in the village liked to hear Billy sing.One day, a big, fearful cat named Tom came to the village. Tom liked to fight. He saw Billy singing and said, "Stop singing or I will fight you!" Billy was scared but he did not want to stop singing.A wise old owl saw the problem and said to Tom, "Why do you want to fight? Let him sing. His songs make everyone happy." Tom thought about it and decided to listen to the owl. From that day on, Tom and Billy became friends. Billy kept singing and Tom never fought again.The moral of the story is that we should not let our fears stop us from doing what we love, and that kindness can change someone's heart.

Once upon a time, there was a big clock in a small town. The clock was very pretty and everyone loved it. It was in the house of a wealthy man named Mr. Rich.One sunny day, Mr. Rich saw some kids playing outside his house. They were laughing and having fun. Mr. Rich wanted to play too, but he was always busy with his work. He never had time to play.Mr. Rich thought about the big clock in his house. He decided to stop working for a while and play with the kids. The kids were happy, and they all played together. They had so much fun, and Mr. Rich felt happy too.From that day on, Mr. Rich made time to play with the kids every day. He learned that being wealthy is not just about having a lot of things, but also about having fun and making friends.The moral of the story is: It's important to make time for fun and friends, no matter how busy you are.

Once there was a small harbor. It was a very charming harbor, with beautiful boats that glittered in the sunlight. There were many fish swimming in the harbor.One day, a silly little fish forgot that it was supposed to serve the other fish in the harbor. He thought he was too special, and swam away from the others. "It's better to do what I want," he said. The other fish were sad. They thought they had lost their friend and the harbor was not as fun anymore.But the little fish quickly learnt his lesson. He soon realized that by serving and helping the other fish in the harbor, he could have much more fun. So the little fish came back to the harbor and began serving and helping his friends. Everyone was so happy! The harbor became much more charming because of the little fish.The moral of the story is: Serving and helping others can make a place even more special, and bring you joy.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Suzy and Joe. They were both three years old and liked to play together. They had heard stories about nature and wanted to raise their own. One day, Suzy said, "Let's go and raise some nature, Joe!" to which Joe happily replied, "Okay!".So they set off and went into the woods. Suddenly, a terrible loud noise scared them and they froze. The noise seemed to be coming from a bear! Joe started crying, but Suzy tried to keep him calm and said, "It's alright Joe, let's stay still and it will go away". Sure enough, the bear eventually left and the two friends continued their adventure. They found a beautiful meadow and decided to raise a garden of nature there. When the garden was grown, Joe and Suzy were proud of their work and enjoyed spending time in their garden every day.

Far away in a far away land, a wise and old king was too tired to rule. So he decided to put a question to his people: he wanted to know who was the wisest.Many people tried to answer, but no one knew the right answer. Then a little boy stepped up and said he knew the answer. Everyone was shocked and the king demanded to know the answer.The little boy said that the wisest person was the king. Everyone laughed at this, but the king was not amused. He demanded an answer that was not himself.The boy was sad and could not think of any other answer. The king grew angry and demanded that the boy leave the land. So the little boy had to go away and was never seen again. All because of one wrong answer.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to pretend she was a colorful leopard. She would crawl around her room, making soft growls and pouncing on her toys.One day, Lily's friend, Tommy, came over to play. "What are you doing?" he asked. "I'm a colorful leopard!" Lily said. Tommy wanted to be a colorful leopard too, but Lily said there could only be one. They began to argue about who would be the colorful leopard.Then, something unexpected happened. Lily's mom walked in with a big box. She opened it, and inside were two colorful leopard costumes! Now, both Lily and Tommy could pretend to be colorful leopards. They put on the costumes and played together, crawling and pouncing all around the room.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. They make sand castles, swing on the swings, and slide on the slide. They have a lot of fun.One day, they see a big dog in the park. The dog is playful. He runs to them and wags his tail. He wants to play with them."Hi, doggy!" Lily says. "What is your name?"The dog barks. He licks Lily's face. He makes her giggle."Can we play with you, doggy?" Tom asks. "You are so nice and fluffy."The dog barks again. He nods his head. He makes them happy.Lily and Tom play with the dog. They throw a ball for him, and he fetches it. They rub his belly, and he rolls over. They hug him, and he snuggles with them. They have more fun.The dog's owner comes to the park. He sees Lily and Tom playing with his dog. He smiles."Hello, kids," he says. "You are very kind to my dog. His name is Max. He likes you a lot.""Hello, sir," Lily and Tom say. "We like Max a lot, too. He is very playful. He makes our day."The owner lets Lily and Tom pet Max one more time. Then he puts a leash on him and says goodbye."Bye, Max," Lily and Tom say. "We hope to see you again.""Bye, kids," Max barks. "You are very good friends."Lily and Tom wave to Max and his owner. They are sad to see them go, but they are glad they met them. They made their day playful and fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy alarm. He loved to play with it all day. The alarm made a loud noise when he pressed the button. It made Tim laugh and clap his hands.One day, Tim's mom had to go to the store. She told Tim to stay with his dad. But his dad was very busy. Tim wanted to play with someone, but no friends were available. So, Tim decided to send his toy alarm to find a friend.Tim put the alarm on the floor and pressed the button. The alarm went "Beep, beep!" and moved a little. Tim clapped his hands and said, "Go find a friend, alarm!" The alarm moved more and more. It went near a big tree. A little bird heard the noise and came to see. The bird liked the alarm and played with it.Tim was happy that his alarm found a friend. He watched the bird and the alarm play together. From that day on, Tim, the bird, and the alarm were the best of friends. They had lots of fun and played together every day.

A young boy named Mike and his dad were walking in the park one day. As they were walking, Mike noticed something in the grass. He asked his dad what it was and his dad said it was a game! Mike was very excited and asked to play. His dad agreed and told him he had to pull the hairy rope that was attached to the game. So Mike bent down, grabbed the rope, and pulled as hard as he could.Suddenly, a loud noise filled the park. Mike and his dad looked around and saw a bunch of colorful balloons floating in the sky! Mike clapped and cheered, happy to have made them fly. His dad smiled and said it was a surprise and that the game was full of fun surprises.Mike was so excited to experience all the fun surprises, and he couldn't wait to find out what else was in the game. He was sure he was in for an exciting adventure!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play outside in the bright sun. One day, he found a big rock in his yard. It was a pretty rock, with lots of colors.Tim wanted to show his new friend, Sue, the rock. He ran to Sue's house and said, "Sue, I want to introduce you to my rock!" Sue came outside and looked at the rock. She thought it was very nice.Tim and Sue played with the rock all day. They made a little house for it and gave it a name. They called it Rocky. Tim and Sue were very happy with their new friend, Rocky the rock.

One day, a little girl named Amy went upstairs to play. She found her toys all dry and dusty. She wanted to clean them, so she took a bow and wiped them.Amy's brother, Tom, came into the room. He saw Amy with his bow. "That's my bow!" he said. "Give it back!" Amy didn't want to give it back. She wanted to keep cleaning her toys.Tom tried to take the bow from Amy. They both pulled on it. Then, Amy let go. Tom fell down on the floor. He started to cry. Amy felt bad. She said, "I'm sorry, Tom. Here's your bow." Tom stopped crying and they played together with the clean toys.

Once upon a time, there was a cheap toy bear. The bear lived in a big toy chest with other toys. All the toys were friends, and they played together every day.One day, the toys decided to put on a show. They wanted to make everyone applaud. The cheap bear was shy and scared. He did not think he could make the people clap. But his friends said, "You can do it! Just try!"The bear went on stage and started to dance. Suddenly, something unexpected happened. The cheap bear's dance was amazing! All the people began to applaud loudly. The bear was so happy, and his friends were proud of him. And from that day on, the cheap bear knew he could do anything he set his mind to.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a box of chalk. He liked to draw with the chalk on the sidewalk. One day, he found an ugly bug while he was drawing.Tim wanted the ugly bug to go away. He had an idea. He drew a big circle around the bug with his chalk. Then, he said, "Disappear!" and the ugly bug was gone. Tim was happy.From that day on, Tim drew with his chalk every day. He made pretty pictures and made ugly things disappear. All the kids loved to watch him draw. Tim and his chalk made everyone happy.

Once upon a time, in a big sea, there was a little fish named Tuna. Tuna liked to play with his friends. They played a game called "Rise Up." In the game, they would swim up to the top of the water as fast as they could. Tuna was very good at this game.One day, Tuna met a new fish named Fin. Fin was very competitive. He wanted to play "Rise Up" with Tuna and his friends. Tuna said, "Okay, let's play!" All the fish lined up and got ready to race to the top of the water.When the race started, Tuna and Fin swam up very fast. They were both trying to win. Tuna and Fin reached the top at the same time. "Wow, you are fast too!" said Tuna. Fin smiled and said, "You are fast too, Tuna. Let's be friends and play together."From that day on, Tuna and Fin played "Rise Up" and other games together. They had lots of fun, and all the fish in the sea were happy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to run and play outside with his friends. One sunny day, Tim found a big book with many pages. He was nervous because he never saw a book so big before.Tim opened the book and saw that each page had a picture of a different animal. He saw a dog, a cat, a bear, and many more. Tim wanted to learn about all the animals, so he asked his mom to read the book with him.As they read the book together, Tim learned that it is important to be kind to all animals. He also learned that even if something makes you nervous, like a big book, it can still be fun to learn about new things. The end.

Once there was a little girl named Kim who was very persistent. She was always trying to find new things. One day she decided to search for a lemon. She went outside and searched in the garden, but she couldn't find the lemon. Kim was not discouraged, she kept looking. She searched in the kitchen, the dining room and the living room but still had no luck. Determined to find the lemon, Kim kept searching. She looked in the bedroom, the bathroom and then the garage. Kim was very persistent and she finally spotted a lemon under the sofa. She was so happy that she had been able to find the lemon. She hugged the lemon tightly and took it inside to show her family.

Once upon a time, there was a big dragon. He had a loud voice. People were fearful when they hear him. The dragon lived in a cave near a small town.One day, a little girl named Lucy walked close to the dragon's cave. She heard the dragon's voice. But Lucy was not fearful. She went inside the cave to see the dragon.The dragon saw Lucy and was surprised. No one had ever come to see him before. Lucy said, "Hello, Mr. Dragon." The dragon was happy to have a friend. From that day on, Lucy and the dragon played together and the people in the town were not fearful of the dragon anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a very creative boy. He loved to draw and make things with his hands. One day, Tim saw a big motorcycle on the street. He thought, "Wow, I want one of those!"Tim went home and told his mom, "I want a motorcycle!" His mom said, "You are too little for a real motorcycle, but we can make one together!" Tim was excited. He knew he could use his creative skills to make a fun motorcycle.Tim and his mom found a big box. They cut it and painted it to look like a motorcycle. Tim drew cool designs on it with his markers. When they were done, Tim sat on his new motorcycle and pretended to ride it all around the house. He was so happy with his creative motorcycle.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly cat named Tom. Tom liked to play with his ball and run around the yard. One day, Tom saw a big yawn coming from a hole in the ground. He was curious and wanted to see what was inside.Tom walked up to the hole and said, "Hello! Who is in there?" A tiny mouse named Jerry came out of the hole. Jerry was very scared because he thought Tom was a trap. But Tom just wanted to be friends. "I won't hurt you," said Tom.Jerry and Tom played together all day. They laughed and had fun. When it was time to go home, Tom and Jerry said goodbye. They promised to play together again soon. And from that day on, Tom and Jerry were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a pale blue truck. The truck loved to load big rocks from a mine. One day, the truck met a little red car near the mine. The little red car asked, "Can you help me load some rocks too?"The pale blue truck was happy to help. They both went to the mine and started to load rocks. The little red car tried its best, but it could only load a few rocks. The pale blue truck loaded many big rocks easily.After they were done, the little red car thanked the pale blue truck for helping. They became good friends and always helped each other at the mine. They had lots of fun loading rocks together every day.

Once upon a time, in a small school, there was a young teacher named Miss Lily. She had a big blackboard in her classroom. Miss Lily liked to draw and write on the blackboard to teach her students.One day, Miss Lily told her students, "Today, we will have a test. I will write the questions on the blackboard. You will answer them on your paper." The students looked at the blackboard and saw the questions. They picked up their pencils and started to write.During the test, a little boy named Timmy raised his hand. He asked, "Miss Lily, can you help me with this question?" Miss Lily walked over to Timmy and helped him understand the question. Timmy smiled and said, "Thank you!" He finished the test with a big smile on his face.After the test, Miss Lily said, "Great job, everyone! You all did very well!" The students were happy and proud. They liked learning with Miss Lily and her big blackboard.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy frog that he loved very much. He would take his frog with him everywhere he went. One day, Tim and his frog went to play in the park.At the park, Tim saw a big mud puddle. He wanted to jump in it! Tim put his frog down and jumped in the puddle. He got very filthy! Tim's frog was under a tree, watching him play. Tim went to pick up his frog and gave it a big squeeze. The frog made a funny sound when he squeezed it.Tim's mom saw how filthy he was and said it was time to go home. Tim and his frog went home, and his mom gave them both a bath. Tim squeezed his frog in the bath, and it made the funny sound again. Tim laughed and played with his frog, happy that they were both clean again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom liked to play with his toy gun. He would pretend to shoot at the sky and make loud noises. His mom would tell him, "Tom, we need peace in the house. Please play outside."One day, Tom went outside to play with his toy gun. He saw a big, dead tree. He thought it would be fun to shoot at the tree. So, he aimed his toy gun and shouted, "Bang, bang!" But something unexpected happened. The dead tree started to shake!As the dead tree shook, it dropped many big, round things. Tom was scared at first, but then he saw that the big, round things were actually fruits! The tree was not dead after all! It was just a very sleepy tree that needed a little noise to wake up. Tom's mom saw what happened and smiled. Now, Tom could play with his toy gun and bring peace to the house by helping the tree give them yummy fruits.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a playful boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside with his kite. One sunny day, he went to the park to fly his kite high in the sky.Tim saw another boy named Sam at the park. Sam had a kite too, but he did not know how to fly it. Sam looked sad. Tim walked over to Sam and said, "Hi, I'm Tim. Do you need help with your kite?" Sam smiled and said, "Yes, please. I don't know how to make it fly."Tim showed Sam how to test the wind and hold the kite just right. Soon, both boys were laughing as their kites danced in the sky. They played together all day and became good friends.The moral of the story is: Helping others can bring happiness and make new friends.

Ben and Lily were playing outside with their ball. They liked to kick the ball to each other and catch it. Sometimes they missed the ball and it rolled away. Then they had to run after it and bring it back.Suddenly, they heard a loud noise in the sky. It was like a big drum. They looked up and saw dark clouds. They felt some drops of water on their faces. It was raining."Let's go inside!" Lily said. "It's going to storm!"They picked up their ball and ran to the house. But Ben slipped on the wet grass and fell down. He hurt his knee and started to cry.Lily stopped and ran back to him. She helped him get up and hugged him."It's okay, Ben. Don't cry. I'll get you a band-aid."She pointed to the door. "Look, Mommy is coming. She'll make you feel better."Mommy came out with an umbrella. She saw Ben's knee and said, "Oh, poor Ben. What happened?""He fell down," Lily said. "The grass was slippery. And there was thunder."Mommy nodded. "Yes, there was thunder. It's very loud, isn't it? But it's not scary. It's just the sound of the clouds bumping into each other."She took Ben and Lily inside. She cleaned Ben's knee and put a band-aid on it. She gave them both a glass of milk and a cookie."Thank you, Mommy," Ben said. "You're the best."Lily smiled. She was glad Ben was okay. She was also a little embarrassed. She had been afraid of the thunder, too. But she didn't want to tell Mommy. She wanted to be brave like Ben.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the store with her mom. They wanted to buy some yogurt. When they got to the store, there were many kinds of yogurt. Lucy saw a big, red yogurt and a small, blue yogurt. She didn't know which one to pick.Lucy asked her mom, "Mom, which yogurt should we get?" Her mom said, "Let's add the big, red yogurt and the small, blue yogurt together to make a new, purple yogurt!" So they did, and the yogurt was very yummy.While they were eating the yogurt, a loud dog barked outside. Lucy was scared, but her mom said, "Don't worry, the loud dog is just saying hello." Lucy learned that sometimes things that seem scary are just trying to be friendly. And she also learned that adding things together can make something even better.

Once upon a time, a boy named Tim wanted to buy a gift for his mom. He thought it was difficult to find the perfect gift. He asked his friend, Sam, to help him."Sam, can you help me buy a gift for my mom?" Tim asked. Sam said, "Yes, let's go to the church. They have nice things there."At the church, they saw pretty flowers. Tim picked the flowers for his mom. They were so happy. They ran back home to give the flowers to Tim's mom.But, oh no! They tripped and fell. The flowers were all broken. Tim was sad. His mom did not get the gift. It was a bad ending.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big, fierce dog named Max. Lily and Max were best friends. They liked to play in the park and run in the sun.One day, Lily said to Max, "I hope we can find a new friend today." Max wagged his tail and barked, "Woof!" They went to the park and saw a small, sad boy sitting on a bench. Lily and Max walked up to him.Lily said, "Hi, I'm Lily and this is Max. What's your story?" The boy said, "I'm Tim, and I'm sad because I don't have any friends." Lily smiled and said, "Well, now you do! Let's all play together!" Max barked happily, and they all played in the park until the sun went down.

Once upon a time there was a girl who loved to squeeze things. Her favorite thing to squeeze was paper. One day she and her mommy went to the store and she saw something very impressive. It was a huge stack of paper! The girl was so excited and she had to squeeze it. She started to squeeze it and found it was so squishy and soft. She squeezed it and squished it until it was all gone! She had never seen anything so impressive before. She was so happy that she had found this amazing paper to squeeze.

One day, a messy cat named Tom found a big box. The box had a surprise inside. Tom was very happy and wanted to know what was inside the box. He tried to open the box but it was hard.Tom asked his friend, a dog named Max, to help him open the box. Max said, "I will help you!" and they both tried to open the box together. After some time, they opened the box and saw a big cake inside.Tom and Max were very excited and wanted to eat the cake. They tried to cut the cake but it was very messy. Tom's mom saw the mess and asked, "Who made this mess?" Tom and Max looked at each other and replied, "We did, but we found a surprise cake!" Tom's mom smiled and helped them clean up the mess. They all enjoyed the cake together.

Once upon a time, there was a nice man named Tom. Tom had a job to deliver things to people. One day, Tom had to deliver coffee to a house. The sky was full of big, dark clouds. Tom knew it would rain soon.Tom put the coffee in his big bag and started to walk. He saw a big tree and thought, "If it starts to rain, I can hide under the tree." The rain started to fall. Tom ran to the tree and stood under it. He was happy he found the tree, but the coffee was getting wet.When Tom got to the house, he gave the wet coffee to the lady who lived there. The lady was not happy. Tom felt bad. The next day, Tom brought a new coffee to the lady. This time, he had a big umbrella to keep it dry. The lady was happy, and Tom learned to always be ready for the rain.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the garden to pick radishes. The sun was warm and the sky was blue. Tim saw a big, dull radish in the ground. He pulled and pulled, but the radish didn't come out. Tim was sad.A little bird saw Tim and asked, "Why are you sad?" Tim said, "I can't pick this big, dull radish." The bird said, "I can help you!" The bird flew to the radish and started to pull with Tim. They pulled and pulled, but the radish still didn't come out.Just then, a big, friendly bear came by. The bear saw Tim and the bird and asked, "What are you doing?" Tim said, "We are trying to pick this big, dull radish, but we can't." The bear said, "I can help too!" So, the bear, the bird, and Tim all pulled together. And guess what? The radish came out, but it wasn't a radish! It was a treasure chest full of shiny gold coins! They were all very happy and shared the treasure.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. He wanted to buy a toy. Tim saw a crazy toy flea. It could jump and dance. He thought it was fun. His mom said, "Are you sure you want this toy? It might not be a good one." Tim said, "Yes, I want it!"They bought the crazy toy flea and went home. Tim played with it all day. He laughed as it jumped around. But then, the toy flea started to jump too high. It knocked over a cup of juice. The juice spilled everywhere. Tim was sad.Tim's mom came in and saw the mess. She said, "I told you that toy might not be a good one." Tim learned that sometimes it's better to listen to mom. He knew he should have picked a different toy. The crazy toy flea was not a good choice.

Once upon a time, there was a big moon in the night sky. The moon was very polite and liked to help others. One day, the moon saw a little cat who was lost. The cat was sad and did not know how to go home.The polite moon wanted to help the little cat. The moon urged the cat to follow its light. The cat listened to the moon and started to walk. The moon's light showed the cat the way to go.The little cat walked and walked, following the moon's light. Soon, the cat saw its home. The cat was very happy and thanked the polite moon. The moon smiled and said, "You're welcome." From that day on, the cat and the moon became good friends.

One day, a bright sun was shining in the sky. A little girl named Lily went outside to play. She saw a small bird on the ground. The bird was sad because it could not find a meal.Lily said to the bird, "Do not be sad, little bird. I will help you unlock the door to find a meal." The bird was happy and said, "Thank you, Lily!"Together, they looked for a key to unlock the door. They found the key under a big tree. Lily and the bird unlocked the door and found a big meal waiting for them. They ate the meal and became good friends. The bird was not sad anymore.

Once upon a time there was a fireplace. It was dry and needed some polishing. So, a boy went to the fireplace and polished it with some old rags. It got very shiny until suddenly it sparked, and the sparks started a fire. The boy was very scared and tried to put out the fire with some water, but it was too big. He called for help, but nobody came. Soon the flames were getting bigger and bigger, until they were too big to stop. The firefighters arrived too late and the whole house was on fire. The dry fireplace had caused an enormous fire. The boy was very sad he was not able to put out the fire in time. He sadly watched as the fire burned the house to the ground.

Once upon a time, there was a small island. On this island, there was a big tree. Under the big tree, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to read. He read many books under the tree.One day, a generous man came to the island. The man saw Tom reading under the tree. The man said, "Hello, Tom! I have a gift for you." Tom looked at the man and said, "What is the gift?" The man gave Tom a new book to read. Tom was very happy.Tom started to read the new book. He read and read, and did not look up. He did not see the water coming. The water came up to the island. The water got higher and higher. Tom did not know. The water covered the island, the big tree, and Tom. The generous man saw it all and was very sad.

One day, a wet helicopter was flying in the sky. It had been raining, so the helicopter was wet all over. The helicopter liked to fly high and make big circles in the sky. It was fun for the helicopter to fly in the rain.The helicopter saw a small toy on the ground. It was a soft, squishy toy. The helicopter wanted to play with the toy. It flew down to the ground and picked up the toy with its long arm. The helicopter felt happy and excited.The helicopter liked to squeeze the soft toy. It would squeeze and squeeze the toy with its long arm. The toy would make a funny sound when the helicopter squeezed it. The wet helicopter and the toy had lots of fun playing together in the sky.

One day, a little girl named Sue was playing near her house. She saw a stranger walking by. The stranger had a big bag. Sue was a stubborn girl and wanted to know what was in the bag. So, she followed the stranger.The stranger stopped and opened the bag. He took out wood and started to make a fire. Sue was scared, but she wanted to talk to the stranger. She said, "Hi, I am Sue. Why are you making a fire?" The stranger smiled and said, "Hi Sue, I am making a fire to cook food. I am very hungry."Sue watched the fire burn. She had an idea. She ran home and brought some food for the stranger. They both shared the food and became friends. Sue learned that sometimes strangers can be nice, and it is good to help others.

One day, a nice cat and a helpful dog went for a walk. They saw a big box on the way. The box had a cover on it. The cat said, "What is in the box?"The dog said, "I don't know. Let's open it and see!" They took off the cover and found many toys inside. The cat and dog were very happy.They played with the toys all day. Then, they decided to share the toys with their friends. All the animals had fun playing with the toys together. In the end, the cat and dog learned that sharing is a good thing to do.

Once upon a time, there was a big frog. The frog lived near a path. Every day, the frog would hop slow on the path. One day, the frog met a small bug. The bug was sad. The frog wanted to help the bug.The frog said, "I will kiss you, and you will be happy." The bug was scared, but the frog was nice. The frog gave the bug a kiss. Then, something strange happened. The bug changed!The bug was not a bug anymore. The bug was a beautiful butterfly! The butterfly was very happy. The frog was happy too. They played and laughed on the path. They were friends forever.

Once upon a time, there was a popular dog named Max. Max was very good at rescue. He liked to help his friends when they needed him.One day, Max's friend, a little bird named Lily, was very sad. She could not find any food. Max wanted to help her. He said, "Don't worry, Lily! I will rescue you and find food for you."Max looked high and low for food. He found some yummy berries on a bush. Max called out to Lily, "I found food for you! Come, eat the berries and be happy!"Lily flew to Max and ate the berries. She was very happy and said, "Thank you, Max, for rescuing me! You are a great friend." Max smiled and was happy that he could help his friend. They played together all day, and everyone knew that Max was a popular and helpful dog.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a very helpful boy. He liked to help his friends and family. One day, he went for a walk in the forest.While walking, Tim saw a big green frog. The frog had a sad face. Tim asked the frog, "Why are you sad?" The frog said, "My stomach hurts. Can you help me?" Tim wanted to help the frog.Tim thought for a moment. Then he remembered that his mom gave him a special fruit when his stomach hurt. He found the fruit in the forest and gave it to the frog. The frog ate the fruit and felt better. The frog was happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!" Tim was happy that he could help the frog. They became good friends and played in the green forest every day.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a hairy dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his favorite toy, a small stone. He would carry the stone around in his mouth and drop it for his friends to throw.One day, Spot saw a man with a big bag. The man was there to deliver mail to the people in the town. Spot ran up to the man and said, "Can I help you deliver the mail?" The man smiled and said, "Sure, Spot. You can help me."Spot was so happy to help. He carried the stone in his mouth and followed the man. When they got to each house, Spot would drop the stone and the man would put the mail in the mailbox. Then, Spot would pick up the stone and they would go to the next house.At the end of the day, Spot and the man had delivered all the mail. The man said, "Thank you, Spot. You were a big help today." Spot wagged his tail and said, "I had fun helping you!"From that day on, Spot and the man would deliver mail together. Spot always carried his stone with him, and everyone in the town loved to see the hairy dog helping the mailman.

Once upon a time, there was a brown dog named Jack. Jack liked to wander around the park. One sunny day, Jack found a red bucket near the big tree.Jack saw a little girl named Sue. Sue was sad. Jack asked, "Why are you sad?" Sue said, "I lost my red bucket. I need it to play in the sand." Jack wanted to help Sue, so he showed her the red bucket he found.Sue and Jack played with the bucket in the sand. They built a big sand castle. But then, a mean boy came and kicked their sand castle. The bucket broke into pieces. Sue and Jack were very sad. The mean boy laughed and walked away.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little boy named Tom. He liked to play all day long. But Tom was ignorant about cleaning his room. His toys were always all over the floor.One day, Tom's mom told him to clean his room. "You need to clean up your toys," she said. Tom did not want to do it, but he knew he had to listen to his mom. So, he started to pick up his toys and put them away.As Tom cleaned, he found a toy he thought was lost. It was hiding under his bed. He was very happy to find it. When he was done, there was no toy left on the floor. His room was clean and neat. Tom felt proud and promised to keep his room clean from now on. And he played happily ever after.

Mother and her three year-old daughter were walking through the park one day. "Mummy, look!" shouted the little girl, pointing to a tall man walking in front of them, "what's that?"The mother smiled, and said, "That's a sailor. Sailors are people who go on boats, and work on them." The little girl was surprised. She had never seen a sailor before. She looked closely, and noticed he was wearing a strange blue suit. "What is the sailor doing, mummy?" asked the little girl. The mother replied, "Well, he doesn't know much about sailing. He is still learning and sailors call that being 'ignorant'. That's why he has a cap on, and a special uniform. He's learning how to sail a boat!" The little girl was so surprised. She couldn't believe sailors had to learn how to sail! She waved to the sailor, and smiled. He waved back. The mother smiled, watching her daughter learn something new.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big truck in the park. The truck has many animals inside. Lily and Ben run to the truck. They want to see the animals.They see a lion, a monkey, a zebra, and a leopard. The leopard is very big and has many spots. Lily and Ben think the leopard is beautiful. They want to buy the leopard. They ask the man in the truck."Can we buy the leopard, please?" Lily and Ben say.The man in the truck laughs. He says, "No, you cannot buy the leopard. The leopard is not a pet. The leopard is wild and crazy. The leopard can bite and scratch. The leopard is not for children."Lily and Ben are sad. They really want the leopard. They think the leopard is not crazy. They think the leopard is nice and friendly. They have an idea. They wait until the man in the truck is busy. Then, they sneak into the truck. They open the cage of the leopard. They try to pet the leopard.But the leopard is not nice and friendly. The leopard is wild and crazy. The leopard roars and jumps. The leopard scares Lily and Ben. Lily and Ben scream and run. They run out of the truck. They run to their mom. They hug their mom. They are sorry for being naughty.The man in the truck hears the noise. He sees the leopard is out of the cage. He is angry and worried. He runs to the truck. He catches the leopard. He puts the leopard back in the cage. He locks the cage. He tells Lily and Ben to never touch the animals again. He tells their mom to watch them better.Lily and Ben are sorry. They say sorry to the man in the truck. They say sorry to their mom. They say sorry to th

One day, a small and weak dog went for a walk. The dog liked to look at things in the park. He saw a big tree, a red ball, and a funny cat. The dog was very happy to see all these things.As the dog walked, he saw a print on the ground. It was a big print, much bigger than his paw. He wanted to know what made the big print. So, he followed the prints to see where they went.The prints led the dog to a big box. The dog was excited to see what was inside. But when he tried to open it, he stumbled and fell. The box opened, and many small and weak dogs just like him came out. They were all happy to be free, and they played together in the park. The dog was surprised but very happy to have new friends.

Once there was a boy called Jack. He was three years old and loved the colour blue. One day, he saw something amazing flying in the sky - a big blue helicopter!Jack wanted to go for a ride in the beautiful helicopter. He waved to the pilot, who waved back and said hello.In the helicopter, Jack put on his special blue helmet and wiped away a tear of excitement.The helicopter flew high up in the sky and Jack saw lots of neat things. He was so happy!Eventually, the helicopter landed and Jack said goodbye to the pilot. Jack wiped his face with a tissue, happy to have gone for a ride in his favourite blue helicopter.

Tim and Mia are playing in the park. They like to slide, swing and run. They see a big tent. It is blue and yellow. They want to look inside."Can we go in?" Tim asks Mia."Maybe. Let's be quiet and careful," Mia says.They sneak to the tent. They lift a flap. They see a man and a woman. They are wearing funny clothes. They have hats and capes. They have a box and a wand."Who are they?" Tim whispers."I don't know. Maybe they are magic," Mia whispers back.The man and the woman are talking. They do not see Tim and Mia."Are you ready for the show?" the man asks."Yes, I am. I hope the kids will like it," the woman says."Me too. Let's practice our tricks. Watch this," the man says.He taps the box with his wand. He opens it. A rabbit appears. It is white and fluffy. It hops out of the box."Wow!" Tim and Mia say.The man and the woman hear them. They turn around. They see Tim and Mia."Hello, there. Who are you?" the woman asks."We are Tim and Mia. We are playing in the park. We saw your tent. We wanted to look inside. We are sorry," Tim says."That's okay. We are not angry. We are happy to see you. We are magic. We are here to do a show for the kids. Do you want to see more?" the man says."Yes, please. We like magic. We like rabbits," Mia says."Great. Come closer. We will show you more. But don't tell anyone. It is a secret," the woman says.Tim and Mia go closer. They sit on the ground. The man and the woman show them more tricks. They make flowers, balls and cards appear and disappear. They make things float and change color. They make Tim and Mia laugh and clap.They have a lot of fun. They forget ab

Once upon a time, there was a fast car. The car loved to speed down the road. One day, the car saw a big race. The car wanted to win the race, so it went very, very fast.In the race, the car had to turn left. But the car did not know how to turn left. The car was sad. A nice, slow bike saw the sad car. The bike said, "I can help you turn left."The car and the bike went to the race together. The car went very fast, and the bike went slow. The car learned how to turn left from the bike. They got to the end of the race, and the car won. But the bike was dead. The car was sad, but it knew the bike had helped it learn something important.The moral of the story is that sometimes, you need to slow down to learn new things. And when you do, you can win the race.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear who loved to cook. One day, he wanted to try something new. He thought of cooking with a lung. He had never cooked with a lung before.The bear went to the icy forest to find a lung. He looked and looked, but he could not find one. He was very sad. The icy wind blew and made the bear very cold. He did not like the cold.The bear was so cold and tired that he fell asleep in the icy forest. He never found the lung to cook with. The bear stayed in the forest and did not wake up. That was a bad ending for the bear.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He loved baseball very much. One day, he saw a distant field where kids played baseball. Tim wanted to join them.Tim walked to the field and asked, "Can I play baseball with you?" The kids said, "Yes, you can!" Tim was very happy. They all played together and had lots of fun.After a while, it was time to go home. Tim said, "Let's settle who gets the baseball." The kids decided that Tim could keep the baseball. They all said goodbye and went to their homes. Tim couldn't wait to play baseball again with his new friends.

Sam and Ben were brothers who liked to play outside. One day, they found a swamp near their house. It was wet and muddy and full of frogs and bugs. Sam and Ben wanted to catch some frogs and bugs for fun.They ran to the swamp and jumped in. They splashed and laughed and looked for frogs and bugs. Sam saw a big green frog sitting on a log. He ran to the log and tried to grab the frog. But the frog was too fast and jumped away. Sam was sad and angry.He saw Ben holding a stick. He had a bug on the end of the stick. He was poking the bug with the stick. He was happy and proud."Look, Sam, I caught a bug!" Ben said. "It is big and brown and has many legs. Do you want to see it?"Sam did not want to see the bug. He wanted to catch a frog. He was jealous of Ben. He ran to Ben and pushed him. Ben fell into the swamp. He dropped the stick and the bug. He was wet and dirty and scared."Hey, Sam, why did you do that?" Ben cried. "That was not nice. You made me lose my bug. You are a mean brother!"Sam felt bad. He did not mean to hurt Ben. He was just angry and frustrated. He wanted to have fun too. He said he was sorry."I'm sorry, Ben. I did not mean to push you. I was just mad because I could not catch a frog. You are a good brother. Can we still be friends?"Ben looked at Sam. He saw that Sam was sorry. He forgave him. He said he was sorry too."I'm sorry, Sam. I did not mean to make you mad. I was just happy because I caught a bug. You are a good brother too. Of course we can still be friends."Sam and Ben hugged. They decided to share the stick and the bug. They also decided to help each other catch fr

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to play with blocks. He would build tall towers and long roads. Tom felt powerful when he played with his blocks.One day, Tom built a very tall tower. He used all his blocks to make it. Tom leaned on the tower to see if it was strong. The tower did not fall. Tom was very happy.But then, something unexpected happened. A tiny ant came to Tom's tower. The ant leaned on the tower too. And guess what? The tower fell down! Tom was surprised that the little ant was so powerful. From that day on, Tom knew that even small things can be strong.

Once upon a time, there was a green plate. The green plate lived in a big house with a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to read books with her mom.
