One day, Sue and her mom read a book about a magic plate.Sue wanted to see if her green plate was magic too. So, she put the green plate on the table and asked it to make her favorite food. But the green plate did not make any food. Sue was sad.The next day, Sue tried again. She asked the green plate to make her a big cake. But the green plate did not make a cake. Sue was very sad. She cried and cried. The green plate was not magic, and Sue never found a magic plate.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim wanted to build a big house for his puppy, Max. Max was a very cute puppy, but sometimes he was a bit rude. He would bark at people and take toys from other kids. Tim thought that if Max had a nice house, he would be happy and not so rude.One day, Tim and Max went to the park to build the house. They brought wood, nails, and a hammer. They started to build the house under a big tree. Tim was very excited, and Max was wagging his tail. They worked all day long, and the house was almost done.As they were finishing the house, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew the house away! Tim and Max were very sad. They went back home, and Max was still a rude puppy. Tim learned that a nice house could not change Max, and they needed to find another way to help him be a good puppy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a lot of stuff in his room. One day, Tim decided to play a game. He wanted to hide all his stuff from his mom. Tim thought it would be fun to see if his mom could find everything.Tim hid his stuff all over the house. He put some under the bed, some in the closet, and some behind the couch. When his mom came home, she was very confused. She could not find any of Tim's stuff. She asked Tim if he knew where everything was. Tim just smiled and said, "I hid it all!"Mom was not happy. She told Tim it was rude to hide his stuff. She asked him to help her find everything. They looked and looked, but they could not find all the stuff. They were both very sad. They did not know that a sneaky cat had taken some of the stuff to play with.The next day, Tim and his mom found the cat playing with the missing stuff. They were very surprised! But the cat was very fast and ran away with the stuff. Tim and his mom could not catch the cat. They never saw the cat or their stuff again. Tim learned that hiding his stuff was not a good idea.

Anna and Ben like to play with blocks. They make houses, towers, and castles with them. One day, they decide to make a temple. A temple is a big and pretty house for God. They work hard and use many blocks. They are happy with their temple.But then, Sam comes. Sam is not nice. He likes to break things. He sees Anna and Ben's temple and laughs. He says it is silly and ugly. He kicks it with his foot. The blocks fall down and make a loud noise. Anna and Ben are sad and angry. They shout at Sam and tell him to go away.Sam feels ashamed. He knows he did a bad thing. He says he is sorry and tries to help Anna and Ben. But they do not want his help. They say he is mean and they do not like him. They take their blocks and go to another place. Sam is alone and sad. He wishes he had not broken the temple. He wishes he had played with Anna and Ben. He wonders if they will ever be his friends. He hopes they will forgive him. He learns a lesson. He decides to be nice and not break things. He hopes something good will happen.

Tim and Kim are twins. They like to play with their toys and books. But they do not like to share. Sometimes they fight and bite each other. Mom and Dad are not happy when they do that.One day, Mom and Dad want to take a photo of Tim and Kim. They put them in nice clothes and make them sit on the couch. They say, "Smile, Tim and Kim! We want a nice photo of you two!"But Tim and Kim do not want to smile. They want to play with their toys and books. They are bored and angry. They look at each other and make faces. They stick out their tongues and roll their eyes. They do not listen to Mom and Dad.Mom and Dad are getting tired and frustrated. They say, "Tim and Kim, please behave! We just want one photo of you two! Why are you acting so crazy?"But Tim and Kim do not care. They have a plan. They wait for Mom and Dad to count to three and say, "Cheese!" Then they do something very bad. They bite each other on the cheek!Mom and Dad are shocked and angry. They say, "Tim and Kim, how could you do that? That is very naughty and rude! You hurt each other and ruined the photo! Go to your room right now!"Tim and Kim run to their room. They are crying and rubbing their cheeks. They say, "Sorry, Tim. Sorry, Kim. I did not mean to bite you. I was just trying to make a funny photo."They hug and say, "It's okay, Tim. It's okay, Kim. I forgive you. I love you. But next time, let's not bite each other. Let's smile and be nice."They learn their lesson. They promise to share their toys and books. They promise to listen to Mom and Dad. They promise to never bite each other again.

One day, a girl named Sue was walking to her friend's house. On the way, she saw a man who was doing work in his yard. He was scatter seeds for the birds to eat. Sue thought it was nice and wanted to help."Can I help you scatter seeds?" Sue asked the man. The man smiled and said, "Of course! Here, take this bag and scatter the seeds all around." Sue took the bag and started to scatter seeds.Suddenly, a big wind came and blew all the seeds away. The man was upset because his work was gone. But then, a lot of birds came and started to eat the seeds from the ground. The man and Sue were happy because they made the birds happy too.

One day, a little boy named Tim found an orange ball. It was big and round. He wanted to play with it, so he gave it a push. The ball rolled and rolled in the park.Tim saw a cat. The cat was soft and had a rub on its head. "Hi, cat! Do you want to play with my ball?" Tim asked. The cat meowed and nodded its head. They played together, pushing the ball back and forth.Soon, a girl named Sue came to the park. She saw Tim and the cat playing with the orange ball. "Can I play too?" Sue asked. Tim and the cat said yes. They all played together, laughing and having fun. They pushed the ball until the sun went down.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a very impatient boy. He did not like to wait for anything. One day, Tim saw a big door with a shiny knob. He wanted to open it, but he was too small to reach it.Tim had an idea. He found a chair to stand on to reach the knob. He was so excited that he shouted, "I can do it!" But the chair was wobbly, and Tim fell down. He was not hurt, but he was sad that he could not open the door.The next day, Tim tried again. This time, he found a strong and steady chair. He stood on it, reached the knob, and opened the door. Inside, he found a room full of toys and games. Tim was so happy that he shouted, "I did it!" And from that day on, Tim learned to be more patient and never gave up.

Once upon a time, there was a graceful bird named Lily. Lily loved to fly and play with her friends. She also liked to learn new things.One day, Lily found a hanger on the ground. She did not know what it was, so she decided to learn about it. She picked it up with her beak and showed it to her friends.As they were looking at the hanger, something unexpected happened. A strong wind blew and the hanger got stuck on Lily's beak! She could not open her beak anymore. Her friends tried to help, but they could not.Then, a wise old bird came and saw Lily's problem. He knew what to do. He told Lily to fly very fast and then stop quickly. Lily did as she was told, and the hanger flew off her beak!Lily was very happy and thanked the wise old bird. She learned that sometimes, you need to ask for help when you do not know what to do. And from that day on, Lily became even more graceful and wise.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a cat and a dog. The cat and the dog did not like to share. They would often quarrel over their food. One day, the cat found a bowl of sauce. The sauce was very yummy.The dog saw the cat eating the sauce and wanted some too. The cat did not want to share the sauce. This made the dog very upset. The dog tried to take the sauce away from the cat, but the cat hissed and scratched the dog's nose.The dog was sad and went to find the mom. The mom saw the dog's nose and knew they had a quarrel. She made more sauce for the dog and the cat. The cat and the dog ate the sauce together and were happy. They learned to share and not quarrel anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little frog. The frog lived in a pond. The pond was smooth like a big mirror. The frog liked to jump and play all day.One day, a boy came to the pond. The boy saw the frog. He wanted to play with the frog. The boy picked up the frog. He decided to throw the frog up in the air. The frog was scared.The boy threw the frog high in the sky. The frog did not like it. The frog fell back down. It hit the ground hard. The frog was hurt and could not play anymore. The boy was sad, and the frog was sad too.

Tim and Sam were brothers who liked to dig in the yard. They wanted to find gold, because gold was shiny and pretty and worth a lot. They had a big shovel and a small shovel, and they took turns digging holes.One day, they dug a very deep hole, and they saw something glittering at the bottom. They were very excited and dug faster. They hoped it was gold. They pulled out a metal box that was heavy and rusty. They opened the box and saw many gold coins inside. They had succeeded in finding gold!They were very happy and hugged each other. They decided to share the gold with their mom and dad, who were always reliable and kind to them. They ran to the house with the box and showed their parents their treasure. Their mom and dad were very proud and surprised. They praised Tim and Sam for their hard work and honesty.They told them they could keep some of the gold coins for themselves, and use the rest to help other people who needed it. Tim and Sam agreed, because they knew that sharing was good. They thanked their mom and dad, and put the box in a safe place. They felt very lucky and grateful. They had found gold, and they had a loving family.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a toy iron that she loved to play with. One day, Lucy could not find her toy iron. She was sad because she thought she lost it.Lucy asked her mom, "Mom, where is my iron?" Her mom said, "I don't know, Lucy. Let's look for it together." They started to look for the toy iron in the house.They found the iron under Lucy's bed. Lucy was very happy. "Thank you, Mom!" she said. They played with the iron, and Lucy pretended to iron her teddy bear's clothes. Then, they saw a dead bug on the floor. Lucy's mom picked it up and threw it away. They continued to play and have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a boy who loved clapping his hands. He was always clapping, even when he was just having fun.One day, he wanted to make something special, so he decided to go shopping. He went to lots of stores but couldn't find what he was looking for.Then, he stumbled across the perfect thing - a big, expensive toy! When the boy saw the toy, he clapped his hands in delight. He was so happy that he bought it straight away.The boy couldn't wait to get home and show his friends the toy. When he got there, he touched it to make sure it was real.He couldn't believe it - the expensive toy was his! He clapped his hands together in excitement, and enjoyed his special toy with his friends all day long.

Mandy was tall and she wanted to decorate. She wanted to paint the walls of her bedroom a bright blue.  Her mom said yes and she started to paint. She was almost done when her dad came in with an olive. Mandy didn't like olives so she threw it away. Her dad got mad and he yelled at her. Mandy was sad and she started to cry. All of a sudden, the paint leaked onto the floor. It made a big mess and her dad was even more angry. He said she couldn't decorate anymore and Mandy had to go to bed.She was sad because she couldn't finish what she started. She was even sadder because her dad was mad at her. Mandy knew she had made a mess and she felt bad. She even wished she hadn't thrown away the olive.

Lila and her mom lived in a big city. They had a small home with a thin bed and a thin cat. Lila liked to play with the cat and look at the tall buildings. But sometimes she was sad because her mom was sick and had no money.One day, Lila's mom said they had to go to a new place. She said it was far away and they had to take a bus. Lila was scared and did not want to leave. She hugged her cat and her mom and cried.On the bus, Lila saw many new things. She saw trees and flowers and cows and birds. She also saw people who smiled and waved at her. She felt a little better and asked her mom where they were going.Her mom said they were going to a place where they could get help. She said there was a big house with many rooms and many people who cared. She said they could stay there until they were well and happy. She said they had to pray and thank God for this chance.Lila did not know what pray meant, but she saw her mom close her eyes and say some words. She copied her mom and closed her eyes too. She said, "Thank you, God, for my mom and my cat and the bus and the new place. Please make us well and happy. Amen." She opened her eyes and saw her mom smile. She smiled back and hugged her. She felt a warm feeling in her heart. She hoped the new place would be nice.

One Sunday, a girl named Amy wanted to record a song. She liked to sing and dance. Her friend, Tom, played the guitar. Tom was a reliable friend. They always had fun together.Amy and Tom went to the park. They found a quiet spot under a big tree. Tom played the guitar and Amy sang her song. They were very happy. They recorded the song on a little machine.They went home and played the song for their parents. Everyone clapped and smiled. Amy and Tom felt proud. They knew they could always count on each other. They were the best of friends.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play with toys. One day, Lily shows Ben her new doll. She says, "Look, Ben, this is my new doll. She has a pink dress and long hair. Do you like her?"Ben nods. He likes the doll. He says, "She is very pretty, Lily. Where did you get her?"Lily says, "My mom got her for me. She was in a cheap shop. There were many dolls in a row. I picked this one. She is my favorite."Ben says, "Can I hold her, Lily? I want to see her closer."Lily says, "Okay, Ben, you can hold her. But be careful. She is very soft and delicate. Don't drop her or pull her hair."Ben takes the doll gently. He looks at her face and her dress. He says, "She is very nice, Lily. I like her eyes and her smile. She looks happy."Lily says, "She is happy, Ben. She likes you. You are a good friend."Ben says, "You are a good friend, too, Lily. Thank you for showing me your new doll. Do you want to play with her and my cars?"Lily says, "Yes, Ben, I do. Let's play together. We can make a story with the doll and the cars. It will be fun."They smile and hug. They play with the doll and the cars. They are happy. They are friends.

Once upon a time, there was a girl called Sarah. One day, Sarah was walking in the garden when she saw something strange. It was black and shiny, like a stone. It was coal!Sarah was a very curious girl, so she picked up the coal to see what it was like. She rolled the coal back and forth between her hands, and wondered what to do with it.Suddenly, Sarah felt a warm breeze in the air. She looked up and saw a bird, flying above her and waving its wings! The bird dipped down and waved hello to Sarah.Sarah was so excited that she waved back. Then, she looked at the coal again, feeling a little confused. What should she do with it? She could not answer this question. So, Sarah carefully put the coal back where she had found it and continued on her way.

Ben and Sam are brothers. They live on a farm with their mom and dad. They have a barn with many animals. Ben loves the animals. He likes to feed them, pet them, and talk to them. Sam hates the animals. He thinks they are dirty, noisy, and smelly. He does not want to go near the barn.One day, mom and dad have to go to town. They tell Ben and Sam to stay at home and be good. They say they will be back soon. Ben and Sam say bye to mom and dad. Ben runs to the barn. Sam stays in the house.Ben has fun with the animals. He gives them hay, water, and carrots. He tells them stories and jokes. The animals make happy sounds. They like Ben. Sam is bored in the house. He has no toys, no books, no games. He looks out the window and sees Ben and the animals. He feels angry and jealous.He decides to go to the barn and scare the animals. He thinks that will make him happy. He sneaks to the barn and opens the door. He sees Ben and the animals. He yells, "Boo!" He waves his arms and makes faces. He hopes the animals will run away and Ben will cry.But the animals do not run away. They do not like Sam. They see that he is mean and rude. They stand up for Ben. The cow moos loudly. The horse neighs and kicks. The pig snorts and charges. The sheep baa and headbutt. The chicken pecks and flaps. The animals chase Sam out of the barn. Sam is scared and sorry. He runs to the house and slams the door.Ben is surprised and proud. He thanks the animals for protecting him. He hugs them and tells them they are brave and kind. The animals make happy sounds. They love Ben.Mom and dad come back from town. They see Ben and t

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a little bunny named Bobo. Bobo loved to play with his friends. One day, he saw a small bird with a broken wing. The bird looked confused and sad.Bobo wanted to help the bird. He found a stick and offered it to the bird. "Here, use this stick to help your wing," Bobo said. The bird was happy and thanked Bobo.Soon, the bird's wing got better, and they became good friends. They played together every day. The other animals saw how kind Bobo was, and they all wanted to be friends with him too. The moral of the story is to always help others when they need it.

Once there was a cool cop. His uniform was very bright and it shone and glowed in the dark. He loved to go on night patrol and show off his glowing suit. One night another cop came to visit. He saw the bright uniform and exclaimed with amazement. He asked the cool cop, "Where did you get that suit? It looks so awesome!"The cool cop replied, "I'm so glad you asked! It was a special gift from my grandmother. She said that I should always remember to glow, no matter what time of day it is!" The second cop nodded and said, "That's very wise advice indeed!"

Lily and Max were having lunch with their mom. They liked to eat bread and cheese and fruit, but they did not like salad. Salad was green and leafy and bitter. Mom said salad was good for them, but they did not care."Please, try some salad, kids," Mom said. "It will make you strong and healthy.""No, thank you, Mom," Lily said. She pushed her plate away. "Salad is yucky.""No, no, no, Mom," Max said. He shook his head. "Salad is gross."Mom sighed. She wanted her kids to eat well, but they were very picky. She decided to try a different approach."Okay, how about this?" Mom said. "If you eat some salad, I will tell you a story. A story about a big, scary monster who loves salad."Lily and Max looked at each other. They liked stories, especially scary ones. They wondered what kind of monster liked salad."Okay, Mom, we will eat some salad," Lily said. She took a small bite. "But only a little bit.""Okay, Mom, we will eat some salad," Max said. He took a tiny bite. "But only a tiny bit."Mom smiled. She was happy that her kids were willing to try something new. She began to tell them the story."Once upon a time, there was a big, scary monster who lived in the woods. He had sharp teeth and claws and horns and a long tail. He liked to roam around the woods and look for food. But he did not like meat or fruit or nuts. He only liked salad. He liked to eat all kinds of salad: lettuce, spinach, kale, cabbage, carrots, tomatoes, cucumbers, and more. He liked to mix them all together and make a big salad bowl. He liked to add salt and pepper and vinegar and oil and make a tasty dressing. He liked to eat hi

One day, a big boat was on the water. It was a hot day, but the water was icy cold. The boat had an anchor to help it stay in one place. The people on the boat were happy and having fun. They liked to swim in the icy water."Let's swim!" said one girl. The others agreed and they all jumped into the water. They played and laughed. But they forgot to let the anchor down. The boat started to move away from them. They did not see it.The boat went far, far away. The people in the water got scared. They yelled for help. A kind man in a small boat heard them. He came to save them. He let them get into his boat and took them back to their big boat.The people were very happy to be back on their big boat. They said "thank you" to the kind man. They learned that they should always let the anchor down before they swim. This way, their boat will not go away from them. And they will be safe and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to play outside. One day, Tom went to the park. The park had big trees and green grass. Tom saw a dark spot under a tree. He wanted to find out what it was.Tom went to the dark spot. He looked down and saw a long stick. It was a spear! Tom picked up the spear. He felt happy because he could play with it. Tom ran around the park with the spear. He pretended to be a brave knight.Tom played with the spear until the sun went down. It was time to go home. Tom took the spear with him. He showed it to his mom and dad. They smiled and said it was a cool find. Tom put the spear in his room. Every day, he played with it and had fun.

One day, a big lion with a rich, golden mane went for a walk in the forest. He was very big and strong. When he walked, his big paws made loud sounds on the ground. The lion liked to roar very loud. All the animals in the forest were scared of the lion's roar.The lion met a little mouse. The mouse said, "Why do you roar so loud? It scares all of us!" The lion laughed and said, "I roar loud because I am strong and big. I am not scared of anything!" The mouse looked at the lion and said, "I am small, but I am not scared of you."Just then, the sky turned dark and lightning lit up the sky. The lion was scared of the lightning. He hid behind a tree and started to cry. The little mouse saw the lion cry and said, "See, even you can be scared. We all get scared sometimes." The lion looked at the mouse and nodded his head.The lion and the mouse started to walk back to their homes. But the lightning did not stop. It came closer and closer. Suddenly, a big tree fell on the lion. The little mouse tried to help, but he was too small. The lion was hurt and could not get up. The mouse felt sad for the lion, but he could not do anything. The lion had to stay under the tree and the mouse went back to his home.

Ben and Lily like to play outside. They like to run and jump and make sand castles. One day, they see a big yellow ball in the sky. It is the sun. The sun is very bright and warm.Ben and Lily want to touch the sun. They think it is a toy. They try to jump and reach the sun, but they cannot. They try to climb a tree and grab the sun, but they cannot. They try to throw a stick and hit the sun, but they cannot. The sun is too high and too far.Ben and Lily are sad. They want the sun to come down and play with them. They ask the sun to please come down. They say they are sorry for throwing the stick. They say they will be nice and gentle with the sun.But the sun does not answer. The sun does not move. The sun does not care. The sun is busy shining and making the day.Ben and Lily are very sad. They cry and cry. They do not want to play anymore. They go inside and hug their mom. Their mom tells them that the sun is not a toy. The sun is a star. The sun is very hot and very big. The sun is not for touching. The sun is for looking and smiling.Ben and Lily learn something new. They say they are sorry for being silly. They say they will not try to touch the sun again. They say they will only look and smile at the sun. They say they love the sun.The next day, Ben and Lily go outside again. They see the sun in the sky. The sun is still bright and warm. Ben and Lily look and smile at the sun. The sun looks and smiles back. Ben and Lily are happy. They play and have fun. They thank the sun for making the day.

One day, a funny bunny named Bob and a big squash became friends. Bob loved to joke and make his new friend, the squash, laugh. They played and had fun all day long.One sunny day, a green frog heard them laughing. He felt envious because he wanted to join the fun too. The frog hopped over to Bob and the squash and said, "Can I be your friend too? I want to joke and laugh with you."Bob and the squash were happy to have a new friend. They all joked and laughed together. The frog was not envious anymore. They played all day and became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. He loved to play outside. One sunny day, Tom went to the park to play. The park was big and had many fun things to do. Tom saw a slide and he wanted to try it.Tom climbed up the steps to the top of the slide. He was a little scared, but he was a good and brave boy. He sat down and said to himself, "I can do it!" Then, Tom slid down the slide very fast. He laughed and had so much fun.His mom watched him and said, "Good job, Tom!" Tom was very happy. He went to the slide again and again. He played until the sun went down. Tom had a great day at the park.

One day, a little cat named Lucky went for a walk. He saw a big tree with a hook on it. Lucky thought it was fun to play with the hook. He jumped and tried to catch it.A bird saw Lucky and said, "Be careful, little cat! That hook can hurt you." Lucky didn't listen and kept playing. He jumped again and this time, he caught the hook. Lucky felt happy, but then he tried to let go and couldn't. The hook was stuck to his paw!Lucky was scared and cried for help. The bird flew down and said, "Don't worry, little cat. I will help you." The bird used its beak to squeeze the hook. With a little push, the hook came off Lucky's paw. Lucky was free and thanked the bird. From that day on, Lucky never played with hooks again.

One day, a big ostrich went for a slow walk. He saw a little boy sitting under a tree. The boy looked sad. The ostrich walked up to him and said, "Why are you sad?"The little boy looked up and said, "I lost my ball. Can you help me find it?" The ostrich nodded his head and said, "Yes, I will help you."They walked together, looking for the ball. The boy saw the ball near some flowers. He was happy and said, "Thank you, ostrich!" The ostrich nodded and smiled. They played with the ball and had a fun day.

One day, a boy named Tim found a small model car. It was dark blue and shiny. Tim liked the car a lot. He played with it all day and enjoyed making it go fast. He showed it to his friend, Sue. "Look at my car, Sue!" said Tim. "It is dark and fast. I enjoy playing with it." Sue looked at the car and smiled. "I like it too, Tim. Can I play with it?" Tim said yes, and they played with the car together.As they played, something unexpected happened. The model car began to grow bigger and bigger! Soon, it was big enough for Tim and Sue to sit in. They looked at each other with big eyes. They got in the car and drove around, enjoying the big, dark car that was once so small.

One day, a smart cat saw a triangle. The cat was very happy. It wanted to play with the triangle.The cat said, "Triangle, will you play with me?" The triangle said, "Yes, let's play!" They played and had a lot of fun.But then, something bad happened. The cat and the triangle got lost. They could not find their way home. The cat and the triangle were very sad.

Sam and Ben were brothers. They liked to play with cars and trucks. One day, they found a big yellow taxi in the street. It was dead. It did not move or make noise."Can we play with it?" Sam asked."Maybe," Ben said. "But we have to be careful. It is not ours."They went to the taxi and opened the door. Inside, they saw a lot of papers and pens. They also saw a red mark on the seat. It looked like blood."What is this?" Sam wondered."I don't know," Ben said. "But it is not good. Maybe someone was hurt."They decided to play with the papers and pens. They drew pictures and wrote their names. They had fun. They did not see the man who was hiding behind a tree. He was watching them. He had a gun. He was the one who made the red mark on the seat. He was angry. He wanted his papers back. He waited for the right moment to get them.He saw Sam and Ben get out of the taxi. They were going to their home. He ran to the taxi and grabbed the papers. He looked at them. He saw the drawings and the names. He saw the mark that Sam and Ben made. He was furious. He threw the papers on the ground. He got in the taxi and tried to start it. But it was still dead. He could not escape. He heard sirens. He saw lights. He saw police. He was caught. He was sorry.Sam and Ben did not know what happened. They only knew that they had fun. They did not know that they helped the police. They did not know that they marked the bad man. They only knew that they liked to play with cars and trucks. They were happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a wide tree and wanted to climb it. Tim saw a flag at the top of the tree. He thought it was very nice and wanted to borrow it.Tim started to climb the tree. When he got to the top, he tried to get the flag. But, the flag moved! Tim was very surprised. He looked around, and saw a big bird sitting on a branch.The big bird said, "This is my flag! I put it here to make my nest pretty." Tim felt sad, but he asked the bird if he could borrow the flag for a day. The bird thought for a moment and said, "Okay, you can borrow it, but you must bring it back tomorrow."Tim was very happy. He took the flag and played with it all day. The next day, he brought it back to the bird. The bird was happy too. Tim and the bird became good friends and played together in the park every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a restless boy who always liked to play and run. One day, Tim went to a big store with his mom. He was very excited to be there.In the store, Tim's mom told him to stay close. But Tim saw a toy he wanted and ran to it. When he looked up, he couldn't see his mom anymore. Tim started to feel scared. He knew he needed to find the exit to be with his mom again.Tim walked around the store and found a big sign that said "Exit." He remembered his mom telling him that "Exit" means the way out. So, Tim followed the sign and found the exit. When he walked out, he saw his mom waiting for him. She was so happy to see him. From that day on, Tim learned to always stay close to his mom and not be restless in big places.

One day, a girl named Sue went to the mall with her mom. They wanted to buy an original toy for Sue's friend's birthday. At the mall, there were many colorful shops and happy kids playing.Sue and her mom went into a toy shop. Sue saw a big, original doll that she thought her friend would like. "Mom, can we buy this doll for my friend?" Sue asked. "Yes, we can," her mom said with a smile.After they bought the doll, Sue and her mom went to the food area. They found a seat and ate yummy food. They were happy and had a fun day at the mall. Sue couldn't wait to give her friend the original toy at the birthday party.

One Sunday, a chubby cat named Tom went outside. He liked to play in the sun. Tom saw a big red ball in the yard. He wanted to play with it. So, Tom ran to the ball very fast.As Tom got close to the ball, it started to zoom away! Tom was surprised. He did not know that the ball could move. But, he wanted to play with it more. So, Tom ran after the ball again.Tom chased the ball all day. He did not know that his friend, a little mouse named Jerry, was inside the ball. Jerry was making the ball zoom away for fun. At the end of the day, Jerry came out of the ball and they both laughed. Tom and Jerry had a fun Sunday together.

Once upon a time, in a jolly little town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toys and say funny things. One day, Tim found a box in his room. The box had a label on it. The label said, "For Tim."Tim opened the box and found a new toy car inside. He was very happy. He ran to his mom and said, "Look, Mom! I found a new toy car!" His mom smiled and said, "That's great, Tim! Have fun playing with your new toy car."Tim played with his toy car all day. He made the car go fast and slow. He made the car go up and down. He even made the car jump over his other toys. At the end of the day, Tim was tired but very happy. He said to his toy car, "You are my favorite toy. I love you, toy car." And with that, Tim went to bed, excited to play with his toy car again the next day.

Once upon a time, there was a sleepy little mill by a river. In the mill, there lived a kind duck and a wise old owl. They were good friends and they always trusted each other. Every day, the duck would swim in the river and the owl would sleep in a tree.One sunny day, the duck said to the owl, "I trust you, my friend. Can you watch my baby ducks while I find food?" The owl nodded and said, "Yes, I will watch them. You can trust me."While the duck was away, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew the baby ducks into the river. The sleepy mill started to spin very fast. The wise old owl woke up and saw the baby ducks in the water. He flew down and saved them, just in time.When the duck came back, she saw the owl with her baby ducks. She was so happy and said, "Thank you, my friend. I knew I could trust you." The owl smiled and said, "We are always here for each other."From that day on, the duck and the owl became even better friends. They knew they could always trust each other, no matter what happened. And the sleepy mill by the river was a happy home for them all.

One day, a little girl named Amy found a small, nervous kitten under a big tree. The kitten was scared and cold. Amy wanted to help the kitten and make it happy.Amy said, "Don't be scared, little kitten. I will mind you and take you home." The kitten looked at Amy with big eyes and started to trust her. Amy picked up the kitten and took her home.At home, Amy gave the kitten some food and a warm bed. The kitten was happy and not scared anymore. But, something unexpected happened. The kitten started to grow and grow! It became a big, friendly dog! Amy was surprised but she still loved her new pet. They played and had fun together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a very fit boy who loved to play outside. One day, he went to the park with his mom. At the park, he saw a big hill. Tim thought it would be fun to rise to the top of the hill.Tim's mom told him that they would go up the hill after they rode the subway. Tim was excited! He had never been on a subway before. As they rode the subway, Tim couldn't stop thinking about the big hill he was going to rise to the top of.Finally, they got off the subway and went back to the park. Tim and his mom walked to the big hill. Tim started to rise up the hill. It was hard work, but he was a fit boy. When he got to the top, he felt so happy. He looked down and saw the subway far away. He knew he had done a great job rising to the top of the hill.

One day, a kind boy named Tim found a big box. He wanted to wrap the box as a gift for his friend, Sam. Tim worked very hard to make the box look nice. He put pretty paper and a big bow on it. Tim was excited to give the gift to Sam.Tim walked to Sam's house with the big box. When he got there, he said, "Sam, I have a gift for you!" Sam was very happy and opened the box. But when Sam opened the box, something unexpected happened.Out of the box came a tiny universe! It was so small, but it had stars, planets, and even a little sun. Tim and Sam were amazed. They looked at the tiny universe and said, "Wow, this is the best gift ever!" And they played with the tiny universe all day, making new friends with the little stars and planets.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. They wanted to buy a toy for Tim. Tim was very happy. He loved going to the store.When they got to the store, Tim saw a big, mean dog. The dog was not safe. Tim was scared. He did not want the dog to poke him. His mom said, "Do not go near the dog, Tim."Tim's mom had an idea. She talked to the store man. The store man took the dog away. Now, the store was safe. Tim was not scared anymore.Tim and his mom picked a toy. They went home and played with the toy. Tim was happy. The store was safe, and he had a new toy.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to the park. She had a bag of oats with her. Mia liked to feed the birds with the oats. She thought the oats were delicate and yummy for the birds.At the park, Mia met a boy named Tim. Tim saw Mia's bag of oats and said, "I want some oats too!" Mia said, "No, these are for the birds." Tim got mad and tried to take the bag of oats from Mia.Mia did not want this to happen. She held the bag tight and said, "No, Tim! We need to share!" Tim stopped and thought for a moment. He said, "Okay, let's share the oats and feed the birds together." Mia and Tim became friends and fed the birds with the delicate oats.

Once upon a time, there was a big, yellow ball. The ball was very hot. It lived up in the sky. It was friends with a little cloud. They liked to play together.One day, the yellow ball said to the cloud, "I want to play push with you." The cloud said, "Okay, let's play!" So the yellow ball pushed the cloud. The cloud moved and laughed.When the yellow ball pushed the cloud, they both felt happy. The heat from the yellow ball made the cloud warm. They played push all day until it was time for the yellow ball to go to sleep. The cloud said, "Good night, yellow ball!" The yellow ball said, "Good night, cloud!" And they both slept, waiting for another fun day to play push again.

Once upon a time, there was a fisherman. He wore a red hat and yellow boots.The fisherman was at the lake, casting his fishing rod into the water. He watched the lake closely, looking for anything interesting. He was very quiet and focused on what he was doing.Suddenly, he pointed at something in the lake. He had spotted something interesting! He pulled on the fishing rod and yelled, "I caught something!"The fisherman was excited as he pulled out a big, slimy fish. He said, "Wow, this is amazing! What an interesting fish!" The fisherman put the fish in a bucket and went home. He was very proud of his catch and couldn't wait to show it to everyone.

One day, a good fairy lived in the woods. She liked to play with her friends. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long.The good fairy met a boy. The boy said, "Can you shoot magic from your wand?" The fairy said, "Yes, I can. Do you want to see?" The boy said, "Yes, please!"The good fairy tried to shoot magic from her wand, but nothing happened. She tried again and again, but still nothing. The boy said, "Oh no! What happened to your magic?" The fairy was sad.Then, a big frog came and said, "I took your magic, but I will give it back if you promise to be my friend." The good fairy said, "I promise." The frog gave her magic back.Now, the good fairy, the boy, and the big frog were all friends. They played in the woods and had fun together. And the good fairy could shoot magic from her wand again.

Lila and Ben are twins who like to play with their toys. They have a lot of toys, but their favorite is a big red fire truck. The fire truck has a loud alarm that goes beep-beep-beep and a flexible ladder that can go up and down.One day, Lila and Ben are playing with the fire truck in their room. They pretend to be firefighters who save people and animals from fires. They take turns to drive the fire truck and use the ladder."Beep-beep-beep, there is a fire in the kitchen!" Lila says. "I will drive the fire truck and you will use the ladder, Ben.""OK, Lila, let's go!" Ben says. They zoom out of their room and into the hallway.But when they reach the kitchen, they see their mom cooking something on the stove. She looks at them and says, "What are you doing, Lila and Ben? You are making too much noise with your fire truck. You are not permitted to play with it in the kitchen. It is dangerous and messy. Go back to your room and play quietly."Lila and Ben feel sad and sorry. They did not want to make their mom angry. They say, "We are sorry, mom. We were just pretending to be firefighters. We did not know we were not permitted to play with the fire truck in the kitchen."Mom smiles and says, "I know you were just having fun, Lila and Ben. But you have to be careful and respectful when you play. The kitchen is not a place for your fire truck. It has hot things and sharp things that can hurt you. And your fire truck alarm can bother me and dad when we are working. You can play with it in your room or in the backyard, but not in the kitchen. Do you understand?"Lila and Ben nod and say, "We underst

Once upon a time, there was a little sheep named Fluffy. Fluffy was very healthy. She loved to run and play with her friends in the green field.One day, while playing, Fluffy saw a big red apple on the ground. She picked it up and asked her friend, Bunny, "What is this?"Bunny replied, "That's an apple. It is good to taste. You will like it."Fluffy took a bite of the apple and it was very yummy. She shared the apple with Bunny, and they both enjoyed the sweet taste. From that day on, Fluffy and Bunny loved to find and eat apples together. They stayed healthy and happy, playing in the field with their friends.

One day, a smart cat named Tom went to look at the big refrigerator. He wanted to find some food to eat. He used his paw to open the door and saw many yummy things inside.Tom decided to examine the food in the refrigerator. He saw a big yellow block of cheese, cold white milk, and a red apple. He thought about what he wanted to eat. Tom was a smart cat, so he knew he should pick something good for him.In the end, Tom picked the red apple. He knew it was a smart choice because it was healthy for him. He took the apple out of the refrigerator and ate it. Tom was happy because he made a smart choice and his tummy was full.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lisa. She had a pretty red balloon tied to her waist. Lisa loved her balloon very much. She played with it every day in the park.One day, Lisa felt tired after playing for a long time. She sat down on a bench to rest. While she was resting, the wind blew very hard. It made the knot on Lisa's waist come loose, and it started to release her balloon.Lisa saw her balloon going up in the sky. She was sad, but she knew she had to let it go. She waved goodbye to her balloon as it floated away. Lisa learned that sometimes, we have to release things we love.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to be creative and make things with her hands. One day, she found a big box of colorful wraps. She was very happy and started to play with them.Lily made a pretty dress for her doll. Her mom saw it and said, "Wow, you are so creative! Can you show me how to make a dress too?" Lily said, "Yes, I can!" and they made another dress together. They had lots of fun.One day, Lily's little brother, Tom, took her wraps and started to make a mess. Lily said, "Stop, Tom! Those are my wraps!" Tom didn't listen and kept making a mess. Lily's mom heard them and came to help. She said, "Lily, you need to share your wraps with Tom. It's good to share with others." Lily thought about it and agreed to share with her brother. They both played with the wraps and made many fun things together. Lily learned that sharing can make playtime more fun for everyone.

One day, a gray cat named Tom went to play in a big space with his friends. They liked to run and jump all day long. The sun was shining, and the sky was blue. Tom was very happy.Suddenly, a big gray cloud came and covered the sky. It started to rain, and all the little animals had to hurry back to their homes. Tom was sad because he wanted to keep playing with his friends.But then, something unexpected happened. The rain stopped, and a big, beautiful rainbow filled the sky. Tom and his friends could play again! They hurried back to the big space and had the most fun they ever had. The gray cloud turned out to be a good thing after all!

Once there was a brave girl named Jee. Every morning she would go for a walk in the park. One day, she stopped by the lake, where she spotted a lucky ear lying on the grass. She examined it carefully and decided to take it home for a nap.When she was about to put it in her pocket, she heard a voice. It was an old man from the village, who said: "Please don't take that ear! It's not yours to take!" But Jee didn't listen. She grabbed the lucky ear and ran back home.Unfortunately, bad luck followed. That night, Jee felt terribly unwell. She couldn't move her body and her mouth was dry. Jee couldn't understand what was happening. After a long doctor's visit, she was diagnosed with a terrible illness. It was caused by the lucky ear that she had taken from the park.Jee was so unlucky. She learnt the hard way that things should never be taken without permission.

One day, a red ball and a blue ball were in a big circle. The red ball said, "I want to be successful!" The blue ball said, "Me too!"They thought and thought. Then, they saw a big apple. The apple was starting to rot. They had an idea. The red ball said, "Let's push the apple out of the circle to help it!"So, they pushed the apple out of the circle. The apple was happy. The red ball and the blue ball were successful. They were happy too. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a famous dog named Spot. Spot had a very good sense of smell. He loved to observe things in the park.One day, Spot went to the park with his friend, a little girl named Lily. They played and ran on the ground. Spot observed many things, like trees, flowers, and other animals.Spot and Lily had a lot of fun that day. They were happy they could observe so many things in the park. They went home and told their family about their famous adventure on the ground.

Once upon a time, there was a dependable dog named Dolly. Dolly liked to help people. She was a very good dog.One day, Dolly went to the store. She needed to get some gear for her owner. She got a hat, a bag, and a big red ball. Dolly was happy to help.When Dolly got home, she gave the gear to her owner. Her owner was so happy to receive the gear. They played with the big red ball all day. Dolly was a very dependable dog, and everyone loved her.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful ball. It loved to play with the kids in the park. One sunny day, the ball saw a group of kids playing a game. They were trying to serve the ball and make a score.The colorful ball was very happy. It wanted to help the kids serve and make a score. The kids took turns to serve the ball. They threw it up and hit it with their hands. The ball went high into the sky and came back down.The kids were excited to see the colorful ball fly so high. They tried to make a score by hitting the ball over a line. The kids laughed and clapped when they made a score. The ball was happy to play with the kids and help them have fun. And they all played together until the sun went down.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy old man. He was always angry and never smiled. He had a big iron that he used to press his clothes. The iron was very heavy and made his clothes look nice.One sunny day, a little boy was playing ball near the grumpy old man's house. The ball bounced into the man's yard. The boy was scared to get his ball because he thought the man would punish him. But he wanted his ball back, so he went into the yard.When the grumpy old man saw the little boy, he wasn't angry. Instead, he picked up the ball and gave it back to the boy. The boy said "thank you" and the man smiled for the first time in a long time. From that day on, the grumpy old man was not so grumpy anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a blue cat named Mix. Mix was a very happy cat who loved to play with his friends. He lived in a big house with a nice family. They loved Mix very much.One day, Mix found a little book called a diary. It was a special book where you could write about your day. Mix thought it was very fun. He wanted to write in the diary too, but he didn't know how.So, Mix asked his friend, a little girl named Amy, to help him write in the diary. Amy was good at writing and liked to help her friends. Together, they wrote about Mix's day and the fun things they did. Mix was very happy to have a diary and a good friend like Amy.

Once upon a time, there was a strong boy named Tim. Tim could lift heavy things. One day, Tim saw a big ball. The big ball was the universe. It was far, far away. It was distant.Tim wanted to lift the universe. He reached up and up. It was very high. He jumped and jumped. He tried hard to touch the big ball. He wanted to show everyone how strong he was.Finally, Tim lifted the big ball. Everyone clapped and cheered. Tim was so happy. He put the big ball back in the sky. The distant universe was back where it belonged. And Tim was the strongest boy ever.

Once, in a small town, there was a church. It was a big church. People went there to pray. The church had a bell that rang loud. But, there was a deaf boy named Tom who could not hear the bell.One day, Tom saw some kids playing. They were adding rocks to a pile. Tom wanted to play too. He went to add a rock. But the kids said, "No, you can't play. You can't hear the bell."Tom was sad. He wanted to play with the kids. He wanted to hear the bell. He went to the church and prayed. He asked, "Please help me hear the bell."The next day, Tom went to the church. He put his hand on the wall. He could feel the bell ring. He was happy. He went to the kids and said, "I can feel the bell. Can I play now?"The kids said, "Yes, you can play." They all played together, adding rocks to the pile. Tom was happy. He could not hear the bell, but he could feel it.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the theater with her mom. They were very excited to see a show with singing and dancing. The theater was big and had many seats for people to sit and watch.During the show, Lily saw a cat on the stage. The cat was doing dangerous jumps and tricks. Lily's mom told her to ignore the cat, but Lily could not stop watching. She thought the cat was funny and wanted to play with it.After the show, Lily and her mom went home. They talked about the cat and how it was dangerous to jump like that. Lily learned to be careful and not to do dangerous things like the cat. She had a fun day at the theater with her mom.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to play outside. She saw a big box in her yard. She was very excited and wanted to know what was inside. Amy called her friend Tom to come and help her open the box. They both tried to open it and finally, they revealed what was inside.Inside the box was a shiny, new saw. Amy and Tom were very happy to see it. They knew they could use the saw to cut wood and make fun things to play with. They decided to make a small wooden car to race in the yard. They worked hard and soon, the car was ready.As they were racing the wooden car, Amy tripped and fell. She was embarrassed and started to cry. Tom helped her stand up and told her not to worry. He said that everyone falls sometimes, and it was okay. They continued to play with the wooden car and had a great day together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat broccoli. One day, he saw a broken toy on the floor. Tim felt sad because it was his favorite toy. He asked his mom, "Mom, can you fix it?"His mom said, "I will try, Tim. But first, let's eat dinner." They went to the kitchen and Tim saw a big plate of broccoli. His face lit up with joy. As they ate, Tim's mom told him a story about what happened to the broken toy.She said, "A little bird came into the house and played with your toy. The bird didn't know it was a toy and thought it was a friend. When the bird tried to fly away, the toy fell and broke." Tim listened carefully and understood.After dinner, Tim's mom fixed the broken toy. Tim was happy and thanked his mom. From that day on, whenever Tim ate broccoli, he remembered the story of the little bird and his broken toy.

One day, Rhys was out at the park with his mum and dad. He loves the park and loves to watch the animals there. Today, he saw something really exciting.He said to his mum and dad, "Look! There is a deer!" Rhys was so excited that he started to jump up and down.The deer was very beautiful and very gentle. It was so calm that it made Rhys feel excited and restless. He wanted to study the deer for a long time.So his dad said, "Come on Rhys, let's go sit over there and we can watch the deer together".Rhys was happy to sit with his dad and carefully study the deer. He watched it move, eat and run around the park. He felt very relaxed and happy watching the deer.Eventually it was time to go home. Rhys was still feeling restless but he knew that it would be back the next day and he would be able to study it again. So with a big smile on his face, he waved goodbye to the deer and walked away.

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing with his colors. He loved to draw and paint. His favorite color was blue. He was a little fearful of the color red because it reminded him of the time he fell and hurt his knee.Tim's mom called him, "Tim, come here! It's time to wash your hands before lunch." Tim went to the bathroom and washed his hands. He was happy to see the water wash away the colors from his hands. While Tim was washing his hands, he heard a strange noise from his room. He went back to see what it was. To his surprise, he saw that his red color was gone! He looked around and saw a tiny red bug holding his red color. Tim was not fearful anymore. He smiled and said, "Hello, little bug! Can I have my red color back?" The bug gave him the color back and flew away. Tim was happy and not scared of red anymore.

Once there was an ancient blanket. It was owned by a grandparent, who was very old.One day, the grandparent decided to allow the 3 year old to have the blanket. The child was very excited and ran to their bedroom where they held the blanket close to their heart.The 3 year old looked up to their grandparent and said, “Thank you so much for allowing me to have this ancient blanket”. The grandparent chuckled at the child’s excitement and said, “You’re welcome my dear. I’m glad you like it”. The 3 year old hugged their grandparent and said, “I’ll treasure this blanket forever!”. The grandparent smiled and said, “I know you will”.The 3 year old snuggled up in the blanket and fell asleep. As the grandparent watched the child, the grandparent smiled and thought to themselves that the blanket had now found its perfect home.

Once upon a time, there was a brave bunny named Bob. He lived in a big green meadow with lots of other animals.One day, Bob heard a loud noise. He got very alert and hopped around to find the source of the noise. He found a big brown fox carrying a big weapon. The fox looked angry and had taken the weapon from a nearby farm. Bob was scared but knew he had to help.He hopped closer to the fox and made a loud noise. The fox got scared and dropped the weapon. Bob hopped away to bring help. The other animals came to help Bob and the fox got taken away by the farmer. Bob was a hero and all the animals cheered for him. They thanked Bob for being brave and alert. The End.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a toy car in his room. The car was sad because it could not go. It needed a battery to make it go fast. Tim wanted to help the car, so he looked for a battery.Tim found a spoiled battery under his bed. He tried to put the battery in the car. "Snap!" The battery did not fit. The car said, "Oh no, I need a good battery to make me go fast."Tim looked everywhere for a good battery. At last, he found one in the kitchen. He put the battery in the car. "Snap!" The battery fit! The car was happy and said, "Thank you, Tim! Now I can go fast!" Tim and the toy car played all day, and they had lots of fun.

Once, there was a pretty crane. The crane had big wings and long legs. It liked to play near the pond. The crane had a lot of friends. They all liked to play together.One day, the pretty crane saw a big box. The crane hoped there was something fun inside. It called its friends to see the box. They all wanted to open it. They tried to push it, but it was too heavy.Then, a tiny ant came. The ant wanted to help the pretty crane and its friends. The ant said, "I can open the box!" The crane and its friends laughed. They did not think the tiny ant could do it. But the ant was strong. It pushed and pushed, and the box opened!Inside the box, there were many pretty things. There were shiny stones, soft feathers, and tasty treats. The pretty crane and its friends were very happy. They thanked the tiny ant for helping them. They all played with the pretty things and had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was a very alert dog. He liked to play in the yard by the fence. One day, Max saw a big bird on the fence. The bird looked at Max and said, "Why do you play alone?"Max just gave a little shrug. He didn't know why he played alone. He wanted to have friends to play with, but he didn't know how to make friends.The big bird felt sad for Max. So, the bird flew away and came back with more friends. They all played together by the fence. Max was so happy to have friends to play with. From that day on, Max was never alone by the fence again.

Once there was a little girl called Molly who wanted to go to the park. She was so excited to go that she went to get ready right away. She changed into her prettiest dress and put on her most graceful shoes. When Molly went outside, she saw that the sky was grey and cloudy. She was worried that it might start raining and ruin her plan. She looked up at the sky and said, “Please don’t rain! I want to go to the park.” Unfortunately, it started to rain and Molly had to go back inside. She was so sad that she couldn’t go to the park. Molly cried, tears running down her skin until she had no more tears left. Suddenly, a spark of hope lit up in her heart. She ran towards her room and grabbed her umbrella. She opened it and said, “The rain can’t stop me now!” Molly ran to the park with her bright umbrella in hand. She laughed and skipped, feeling the grass below her feet and the sunshine on her skin. Molly’s plan was a success, and she enjoyed her time at the park gracefully.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a calm witch. She had a big cat and a little bed. Every day, the witch would wake up, eat, and play with her cat.One day, the witch went for a walk. She saw a big tree and a small bird. The bird was sad. The witch wanted to help the bird. She used her magic to make the bird happy.But something went wrong. The magic was too strong. The bird flew away very fast and hit the big tree. The bird was not happy anymore. The witch was sad too. She went back to her small house and did not use her magic again.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot had a different foot. His foot was not like the other dogs' feet. He was a happy dog, but sometimes his foot hurt.One day, Spot was playing in the park when he met a big cat named Whiskers. Whiskers saw Spot's different foot and wanted to help. Whiskers told Spot to sit down and rub his foot on the grass. Spot did what Whiskers said, and his foot started to feel better.But then, something unexpected happened! When Spot rubbed his foot on the grass, his foot changed colors! Now, his foot was not just different, it was also colorful! Spot and Whiskers were very surprised. They laughed and played together all day, and Spot's colorful foot didn't hurt anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a big, ugly frog. The frog lived near a pond. Every day, the frog would hop around and play with his friends. He loved to watch the sunset by the pond.One day, the frog met a bossy bird. The bird liked to order everyone around. The bird said, "Frog, you must hop over there!" The frog did not want to be told what to do, but he hopped over there anyway.The frog and the bird watched the sunset together. The bird said, "This is a pretty sunset!" The frog agreed, "Yes, it is!" The bird stopped being bossy, and they became friends. From then on, they watched the sunset together every day.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play with blocks. They have many blocks of different colors. They can make towers, houses, bridges and more.One day, they want to see who can make the highest tower. They are competitive. They each take some blocks and start to build. They count the blocks as they add them. "One, two, three, four, five..." they say.Lily has a big black block. She thinks it will make her tower stronger. She puts it on top of her other blocks. But the black block is too heavy. It makes her tower fall down. The blocks snap and crash on the floor. Lily is sad. She cries.Ben sees what happens. He feels sorry for Lily. He does not want to win like this. He says, "Lily, don't cry. It's okay. We can share the blocks and make a new tower together. We can use the black block as the base. It will be fun."Lily stops crying. She smiles. She says, "Thank you, Ben. You are a good brother. I like to play with you." They hug. They take the blocks and make a new tower together. They are happy.

One day, a group of young kids were playing in a park. They were having lots of fun. They were running, jumping, and laughing. They were all good friends. They were ready to play a new game. One of the kids said, "Let's unite and play a big game of tag!"So they all got together and started to play. They were running around, trying to tag each other. The youth were having a great time. They were all happy and smiling. They were all friends.Then, something unexpected happened. A big dog came into the park. The dog was friendly, but it wanted to play too. The dog started to run with the kids. The kids were surprised, but they laughed and played with the dog. They all became friends with the dog. The dog was now part of their group, and they all played together in the park.

Sara and Tom were twins who liked to play with their toys. One day, they found a big box in the garage. It had many old things inside, like books, hats, and a belt. Sara and Tom wanted to see what was in the box, so they opened it and took out the things.Sara liked the belt. It was brown and shiny, and it had a buckle that made a noise when she moved it. She put it around her waist and pretended to be a cowboy. Tom liked the books. They had pictures and words, and he tried to read them. He opened one book and saw a story about a lion and a mouse.Sara saw the book and wanted it too. She said, "Give me that book, Tom. It is mine." Tom said, "No, Sara. It is mine. I saw it first." Sara and Tom started to fight over the book. They pulled and tugged, and the book ripped in half. They both heard a loud tear and stopped.They looked at the book and saw that it was ruined. The pages were torn and the cover was ripped. They felt sad and sorry. They had broken the book that they both liked. They wished they had shared it instead of fighting.They heard their mom coming. They quickly put the book and the other things back in the box. They hoped their mom would not see the broken book. They hid the belt under Sara's shirt. They tried to act normal.Their mom came in and said, "Hi, Sara and Tom. What are you doing?" Sara and Tom said, "Nothing, mom. Just playing." Their mom smiled and said, "That's good. Do you want some cookies? I made them for you. They are warm and yummy."Sara and Tom said, "Yes, please, mom. We love cookies." They followed their mom to the kitchen. They felt the belt around Sara's wai

One day, a silly robot named Bobo came to town. Bobo liked to dance and play. He wanted to make new friends.Bobo met a little girl named Lily. Lily said, "Hi, I am Lily. Let's play!" Bobo was happy and danced with Lily. They had fun together.Soon, it was time to celebrate Lily's birthday. Bobo and Lily invited all their friends. They ate cake and played games. Everyone laughed and had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to act like a big, strong lion. He would run and jump and play all day long. One day, Tom found a big, dull rock in the yard. He thought it was a magic rock.Tom took the rock inside his house. He put the rock on a file, like a special treasure. He acted like a guard to keep the rock safe. Tom thought the rock would make him a real lion.One day, Tom's friend came to play. They acted like lions together. They played and laughed and had fun. Tom showed his friend the dull rock on the file. They both felt like real lions with the magic rock. And they played happily ever after.

Once, a selfish whale was swimming around in the sea. Suddenly, he noticed other fish swimming by. He wanted the fish for himself, so he swam faster and ate the fish. But he did not feel happy in his stomach.The whale approached a crab and said, "Why am I not happy in my stomach?"The crab said, "Maybe it is because you are being selfish. You have destroyed the homes of other sea creatures and now it makes your stomach sad."The whale thought hard and realised that the crab was right. So, he decided to share the sea with others. From then on, he was no longer selfish, and he felt much happier.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. He saw a big chocolate bar and thought it looked incredible. Tim asked his mom, "Can I have that chocolate, please?" His mom said, "Not today, but if you support me with the house work, maybe we can get it next time."The next day, Tim helped his mom with the house work. He was excited to get the incredible chocolate. They went back to the store, but the chocolate was gone! Tim was very sad. His mom said, "Don't worry, we will find it."Then, something unexpected happened. Tim's friend, Sally, walked into the store with the last incredible chocolate bar. She said, "I saved this for you, Tim. I knew you wanted it." Tim was so happy and thanked Sally. From that day on, Tim and Sally were the best of friends, always supporting each other.

Lily liked to draw with her crayons. She had many colors and papers. She made pictures of flowers, animals, and people. She put her pictures in a folder. The folder was blue and had a sticker of a star.One day, Lily wanted to show her pictures to her friend Sam. She took her folder and went to his house. She knocked on the door and Sam opened it."Hi, Lily! What do you have?" Sam asked."I have my pictures. Do you want to see?" Lily said."Yes, please!" Sam said. He invited Lily inside.Lily opened her folder and showed Sam her pictures. Sam liked them very much. He said they were pretty and colorful."Can I have one?" Sam asked."Sure, you can have one. Which one do you like?" Lily said.Sam looked at the pictures and picked one. It was a picture of a butterfly. It had yellow and black wings and a red body."I like this one. It is a butterfly. It can fly and change. Sometimes it is a caterpillar, sometimes it is a butterfly." Sam said.Lily smiled and gave him the picture. She was happy that Sam liked her picture."Thank you, Lily. You are a good friend. Do you want to play with me?" Sam said."Yes, I do. What do you want to play?" Lily said.Sam thought for a moment and then said, "Let's play pretend. We can be butterflies and change. We can fly and see the flowers."Lily liked that idea. She and Sam put their folders away and went to the garden. They pretended to be butterflies and changed. They flew and saw the flowers. They had fun and laughed. They were happy.

One day, a little bird named Tim was flying near a big cliff. The cliff was very high and far away from his home. Tim saw a distant tree on the cliff and wanted to go there.Tim saw a big bear named Bob near the cliff. Tim flew down and asked Bob, "Can you help me get to the tree on the cliff?" Bob smiled and said, "Yes, I can help you, little bird."Bob climbed the cliff with Tim on his back. They reached the distant tree together. Tim was very happy and thanked Bob. They became good friends and played near the cliff every day.

Once upon a time, there was a fisherman. He loved to work near the big water. He caught many fish. One day, a foolish bird came to the fisherman. The bird wanted to eat the fisherman's fish.The fisherman had an idea. He told the bird, "If you help me work, I will give you fish." The foolish bird was happy. The bird helped the fisherman catch more fish. They worked together and had fun.But then, something unexpected happened. The bird saw a big fish in the water. The bird wanted the big fish for itself. The bird tried to catch the big fish alone. But the big fish was too strong. The bird got pulled into the water. The fisherman saved the bird. The bird learned to share and not be foolish. They both worked together and were happy.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a boy named Tom. Tom loved to race with his friends. One day, he found a big melon in his yard. Tom felt very lucky. He wanted to share the melon with his friends.Tom called his friends to come over. They all wanted to eat the melon, but they decided to have a race first. The winner would get the first piece of the melon. All the friends lined up and got ready to race. Tom was very fast, but he wanted his friends to have a chance too.The race started and all the friends ran as fast as they could. Tom slowed down a little to let his friends go ahead. In the end, his friend Sam won the race. Sam was so happy to win and get the first piece of the melon. Tom felt happy for Sam too.All the friends sat down and shared the big melon. It was sweet and juicy. They all enjoyed it and thanked Tom for sharing. The friends learned that sharing and being kind made everyone happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a small sunflower in the garden. It was slow to grow. Tim asked his mom, "Can I water the sunflower?"Mom said, "Yes, I permit you to water the sunflower." So Tim got the water can and gave the sunflower a drink.The next day, Tim went outside to check on the sunflower. To his surprise, the sunflower had grown very tall. It was as tall as the house! Tim was so happy. He said, "Wow, the sunflower is a big surprise!" And they all smiled at the big, tall sunflower.

Once upon a time, in a bright, sunny place, there was a big club. In this club, there were many kids who liked to play and have fun. One day, a new kid named Tim came to the club. Tim was very shy, but he wanted to make new friends.Tim saw a tall tree in the club. He thought, "If I can climb this tree, the other kids will think I am brave and want to be my friend." So, Tim started to climb the tree. He went up and up. But as he climbed higher, he began to feel scared.Suddenly, Tim started to fall from the tree. All the kids at the club saw this and ran to help him. They caught him just in time. Tim was safe and happy. The kids at the club told Tim that he did not need to climb a tree to be their friend. They all became good friends and played together every day. The moral of the story is that you don't need to do dangerous things to make friends.

Once there was a Mommy and her little girl. They lived in a house with a big garden outside. One day Mommy said to the little girl, "Let's go for a walk in the garden and look for birds."The little girl said "Yes Mommy, I want to go" and so they did. The sky was blue and the birds were singing in the trees. They picked some flowers and listened to the birds. Suddenly, they heard a bell from the house and Mommy said, "Oh, it's the lunch bell. Let's stay for lunch". The little girl was feeling sleepy but she was also hungry. Mommy said, "Come on, lets go inside and eat some lunch". So they went inside and had some lunch. The little girl was no longer sleepy and they all had a nice time at lunch.

One day, a girl named Lisa found a box. The box was bright and pretty. Inside the box, there were many things. It had chalk, toys, and books. Lisa was very happy.Lisa played with the chalk. She drew on the ground. She drew a big sun, a house, and a tree. The sun was yellow, the house was red, and the tree was green. Lisa had a lot of fun.Then, something unexpected happened. The sun, house, and tree came alive! The sun was warm and smiled at her. The house opened its door and said, "Come in!". The tree waved its branches. Lisa was surprised but happy. She played with her new friends all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to race with his friends. They would run fast in the park, laughing and having fun. One day, Tim and his friends decided to have a big race to see who was the fastest.The race was to start at the east side of the park and go to the west side. The sun was shining and it was a cold day. Tim wore a warm coat, hat, and gloves to stay warm. His friends also dressed in warm clothes. They were all excited to start the race.When the race began, Tim and his friends ran as fast as they could. They raced through the park, feeling the cold wind on their faces. Tim ran faster and faster, trying to reach the west side first. In the end, Tim won the race and all his friends cheered for him. They were all happy and had a great time racing on the cold day.

Once upon a time, there was a regular hippo named Happy. Happy lived in a big pond with his friends. They liked to play and splash in the water all day.One day, Happy saw a big tree with a swing. He wanted to hang on the swing with his friends. So, he called his friend, Tiny the turtle, and said, "Let's hang on the swing together!"Tiny smiled and said, "Yes, let's do it!" They took turns hanging on the swing, laughing and having fun. All the other animals saw them and wanted to join too.Soon, all the animals were hanging on the swing, one by one. They were so happy to play together. And from that day on, the regular hippo, Happy, and his friends had even more fun in their big pond with the swing.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a very obedient boy who always listened to his mom and dad. One day, Tim's mom called him for dinner. "Tim, come and eat your dinner!" she said.Tim ran to the table and settled into his chair. He saw his favorite food on his plate - yummy chicken and peas. Tim was very happy and started eating his dinner. His mom and dad were happy to see him eat so well.After dinner, Tim went to play with his toys. He had a fun time playing with his toy cars and trucks. When it was time for bed, Tim's mom said, "Time to sleep, Tim." Tim listened and went to bed like a good, obedient boy.

Once upon a time, there was a reindeer. The reindeer had many friends. They all lived in a big, rich forest. The forest had many trees, flowers, and animals.One day, the reindeer and his friends wanted to play a game. They wanted to organize a big race. All the animals would run from one side of the forest to the other side. The one who got to the other side first would win.The race started, and all the animals ran fast. The reindeer ran with his friends. They all had fun in the rich forest. In the end, the reindeer won the race. All the animals were happy and had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lucy. She had a busy day and was very tired. To make her feel better, her mommy said "Let's watch TV!"So Lucy and her mommy broke out the television and began to watch it. Lucy was so tired that she soon fell asleep with her head on her mommy's lap. Her mommy smiled as she watched her daughter sleep. She thought Lucy looked beautiful and was so proud of her. Then, her mommy thought it was time for her own sleep, so she switched off the television and tucked Lucy in bed. The next day, Lucy woke up feeling so much better and ready for a new busy day!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom had a toy that he loved very much. It was a small car that he played with every day. Tom liked to joke with his car and make it go fast. He thought the car had a lot of power.One day, Tom took his car to the park. While playing, he saw a big hill. He thought it would be fun to see how fast his car could go down the hill. Tom pushed the car hard, and it went down the hill very fast. He was so happy to see his car's power.At the bottom of the hill, there was a small bump. Tom didn't see it at first, but when his car hit the bump, it flew into the air! The car landed on the other side of the bump and kept going. It was the best joke Tom had ever seen his car do. He laughed and clapped his hands. From that day on, Tom knew that his car had the power to make him happy and laugh with its funny jokes.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a gray cat named Tom. Tom was a very nice cat. He liked to play with his friends, the other cats in the town.One day, Tom's friend, a small brown cat named Tim, came to visit him. Tim said, "Tom, I need your help. Can you send me a knife? I want to cut my food into small pieces." Tom wanted to help his friend, so he went to find a knife.Tom found a small knife in the kitchen. He picked it up with his mouth and carried it to Tim. When Tim saw the knife, he said, "Thank you, Tom! You are a very good friend." And they both lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was only three years old and on a special day, she went to the beach.The little girl was very excited and she loved to explore. When she stumbled upon an oyster, she was amazed. It looked like a box that was full of secrets. The little girl wanted to open the oyster, but she found out that it was very difficult. She started to get frustrated and was about to give up, when she remembered something: to never give up. That made her hopeful and she tried even harder.After many tries, she finally opened the oyster and inside it was something unexpected: a big, spicy pearl. The little girl was so happy and the moral of this story is to never give up on your hopes no matter how hard something might seem.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a girl named Sue. Sue loved the holiday time. She liked to see the pretty lights, sing songs, and eat yummy food. Sue had a job to do during the holiday. She had to deliver a big box to her grandma's house.On her way, Sue saw a big, muddy puddle. She jumped in the puddle and got very filthy. Sue's clothes, hands, and face were all dirty. She looked at the big box and saw it was dirty too. Sue was sad because she wanted the box to look nice for her grandma.Sue had an idea. She went to the river and washed the box and herself. She made sure the box was clean and pretty again. Then, Sue continued to deliver the box to her grandma. When she got there, her grandma was so happy to see Sue and the big box.
