They put it near the hole as a gift for the mole."Look, mole," said Lily. "We made this for you. It is pretty and smells nice. We hope you like it."The mole was curious. He sniffed the wreath. He felt the soft petals and the green stems. He liked it. He felt a warm feeling in his heart."Thank you, thank you," he said. "You are kind and sweet. I like your gift. I want to be your friend."He came out of his hole. He smiled at Lily and Tom. They smiled back. They clapped their hands. They were happy.They played together in the garden. They learned about each other. They had fun.The moral of the story is: Be respectful and gentle to others who are different from you. You might make a new friend.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play with toys and draw pictures. But sometimes they fight. Lily is bossy. She wants to choose what they do. Ben does not like that.One day, Lily and Ben go to Lily's house. Lily has a new screen. It is big and shiny. Lily wants to watch her favorite show. She tells Ben to sit and watch with her. Ben does not want to watch. He wants to play with the blocks. He says no to Lily.Lily gets angry. She says Ben is a bad friend. She says he has to watch or he has to go home. Ben does not like that. He says Lily is mean. He says he will go home. He gets his coat and his hat.Lily does not care. She turns on the screen. She watches her show. She smiles. She thinks she is happy.But she is not. After a while, she gets bored. She wants to play with Ben. She misses him. She looks at the door. She hopes he will come back. But he does not. He is at his house. He is playing with the blocks. He is happy. He does not miss Lily. He does not want to be her friend anymore. Lily is sad. She cries. She wishes she was not so bossy. She wishes she was nicer to Ben. But it is too late. She has lost her friend. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy had a soft velvet toy named Mr. Bunny. Lucy and Mr. Bunny were best friends. They played together every day. Lucy liked to share her delicious snacks with Mr. Bunny.One day, Lucy and Mr. Bunny played hide and seek. Lucy hid, and Mr. Bunny tried to find her. But Mr. Bunny could not find Lucy. He looked and looked, but Lucy was too good at hiding. Mr. Bunny wanted to quit. He felt sad.Just then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew Mr. Bunny up into a tree! Mr. Bunny was scared. But Lucy heard Mr. Bunny and came to help. She climbed the tree and saved him. Now, Lucy and Mr. Bunny knew they could always find each other, no matter what. They were happy and played together forever.

Anna likes honey. She likes to eat honey on bread. She likes to smell honey in the flowers. She likes to watch honey bees make honey.One day, Anna sees a big jar of honey in the kitchen. She wants to have some honey. She tries to reach the jar, but it is too high. She tries to climb on a chair, but it is too wobbly. She tries to ask her mom, but she is too busy.Anna feels sad. She really wants some honey. She sees her brother Tom in the living room. He is playing with his cars. Anna has an idea. She goes to Tom and says, "Tom, can you help me? I want some honey, but I can't get it. Can you get it for me, please?"Tom looks at Anna. He likes honey too. He says, "OK, Anna, I will help you. But you have to share the honey with me. And you have to play with my cars with me. Deal?"Anna nods. She says, "Deal. Thank you, Tom. You are a nice brother."Tom and Anna go to the kitchen. Tom is taller than Anna. He can reach the jar of honey. He takes the jar and opens it. He gives some honey to Anna on a spoon. He takes some honey for himself on another spoon. They both smile. They both say, "Yum, yum, honey is good."They eat some more honey. Then they put the jar back. They go to the living room. They play with Tom's cars. They have fun. They are happy. They are nice to each other. They love honey. They love each other. The end.

One day, a polite dog named Bobo went for a wander. He walked and walked until he got to a big mall. Bobo liked the mall because there were many things to see and do.Inside the mall, Bobo saw a big toy store. He went in and looked at all the fun toys. He saw a big, red ball and started to play with it. But then, something unexpected happened. The ball bounced and hit a big tower of toy blocks. The blocks fell down and made a loud noise.Bobo was scared, but a kind mall worker came to help. The worker saw that Bobo was just trying to play and have fun. So, instead of being mad, the worker gave Bobo a new toy to play with. Bobo was very happy and thanked the worker. From that day on, Bobo always remembered to be extra polite when playing with toys at the mall.

Once upon a time, there was a good chair. It was a very nice chair and everyone liked it. The chair lived in a big room with many other chairs. But the good chair was special because it was very strong and could hold anyone who sat on it.One day, a little girl named Lily came into the room. She saw the good chair and wanted to sit on it. Her mommy said, "Lily, you can trust the good chair. It will hold you and you will be safe." Lily smiled and climbed onto the chair.Lily sat on the good chair and felt very happy. She knew that the chair would keep her safe because she trusted it. The good chair was happy too, because it could help Lily and make her feel safe. And from that day on, Lily and the good chair were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a blue vest that he loved to wear. But one day, the vest did not fit him anymore. Tim was very sad.Tim's mom saw him crying and asked, "Tim, why are you sad?" Tim said, "My vest does not fit me, and I love it so much." His mom hugged him and said, "I can fix it for you."His mom worked hard and made the vest fit Tim again. Tim was so happy and said, "Thank you, Mom! I forgive you for making it too small before." His mom smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tim. I'm glad you are happy now."Tim wore his blue vest every day. He was very proud of it. And he learned that sometimes, it's okay to forgive when someone makes a mistake.

Tim and Mia were friends who liked to play in the jungle. They liked to see the animals and the trees and the flowers. One day, they saw a big lion who was sleeping under a rock. Tim wanted to touch the lion, but Mia was scared."Tim, don't go near the lion. He is powerful and he can hurt you," Mia said."But I want to see him. He looks soft and nice. I promise I will be careful," Tim said.He did not listen to Mia and he walked slowly to the lion. He reached out his hand and touched the lion's fur. The lion woke up and roared. He was angry and he bit Tim's arm. Tim screamed and ran away. Mia followed him and tried to help him."Tim, are you okay? I told you not to touch the lion. He is powerful and he can hurt you," Mia said."I'm sorry, Mia. I was wrong. I broke my promise and I was not careful. The lion hurt me and I am sad," Tim said.They went back to their home and told their parents what happened. Their parents were worried and they took Tim to the doctor. The doctor gave Tim some medicine and a bandage. He said Tim would be okay, but he had to be more careful in the jungle.The moral of the story is: You should listen to your friends and be careful in the jungle. You should not break your promises and you should not touch powerful animals. They can hurt you and make you sad.

One day, Tom and his dog, Spot, were playing outside. Tom saw a ball on the roof. Tom said, "Oh no! How can we get the ball down?" Spot looked up and wagged his tail.Tom's mom came out and saw them looking at the roof. "What's wrong?" she asked. Tom told her about the ball. His mom said, "I will mention it to your dad when he comes home. He can help you get it down."Tom and Spot played with other toys until dad came home. When dad heard about the ball, he got a long stick. He used the stick to get the ball off the roof. Tom was so happy that the stick was fit to reach the ball.Tom said, "Thank you, dad!" and gave him a big hug. Now, Tom and Spot could play with the ball again. They played until the sun went down and had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a big, graceful bird named Jet. Jet liked to lie in the sun all day. He had many friends in the sky.One day, Jet saw a big cloud. It was very close to the ground. Jet thought it was strange. He wanted to show his friends the big cloud. He called his friends, but they did not come.Jet flew closer to the cloud. He saw that it was not a cloud at all! It was a big pile of soft, white candy. Jet called his friends again. This time, they came. Jet and his friends ate the candy and played all day. They were very happy.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the city with his mom. They saw a helpless little bird on the ground. The bird was hungry and could not fly."Mom, can we feed the bird?" Tim asked. His mom said, "Yes, we can help the bird."They found some bread and fed the bird. But then, a big cat came. The cat saw the bird and wanted to eat it. Tim and his mom tried to stop the cat, but they could not.The cat took the bird away. Tim and his mom were sad. They went home and wished they could have saved the bird.

Once upon a time, there was a humble dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his ball in the park. One day, Spot went to the park to start a new game.As Spot was playing, he found a big box. He was curious and went to look. To his surprise, there was a little cat inside. The cat was scared, but Spot wanted to be friends.Spot and the cat played together in the park. They had lots of fun. Then, the cat's family came to find her. They were happy to see her safe. Spot and the cat were now best friends. The end.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a brilliant sun. Every day, the sun would rise and make the sky bright. The sun made everyone happy. The sun had a friend, the mist. The mist would come and play with the sun in the morning.One day, the mist came to play, but the sun was not there. The mist was sad and did not know where the sun was. The mist looked and looked, but the sun was not in the sky. The people in the town were sad too. They missed the brilliant sun.Then, the mist had an idea. The mist went up, up, up into the sky. The mist found the sun hiding behind a big cloud. The sun was shy and did not want to come out. The mist said, "Please come out and play. We miss you." The sun smiled and came out from behind the cloud. The sun and the mist played together, and the people in the town were happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a wise reindeer who could fly. He was the smartest reindeer in the world!One day, the reindeer flew up high in the sky. He flew as far as he could see. Suddenly, he spotted something shiny in the distance. When he flew closer, he found it was a beautiful golden star. The star was so beautiful that the reindeer wanted to keep it. But the reindeer was very wise. He knew that the star should stay in the sky, so that everyone in the world could enjoy its beauty. So, he flew back to the ground and buried the star deep in the ground. The reindeer was very proud of himself. He knew that he had done the right thing. From that day on, he had a special sparkle in his eyes!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to draw on paper. He would draw all day and make pretty pictures. His mom would always allow him to draw because it made him happy.One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came over to play. Sam saw Tim's pretty pictures and felt envious. He wanted to draw pretty pictures too. Tim was a good friend and shared his paper with Sam. They both sat down and started to draw together.As they drew, Sam started to feel better. He was no longer envious of Tim's pretty pictures. They both had fun drawing and made many pretty pictures together. Tim's mom was happy to see them play and share. She allowed them to draw and play all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a careless boy who liked to play with all the things he could find. One day, he saw a new thing on the table. It was round and red, and it looked like a toy.Tim wanted to taste the red thing, so he took a small bite. "Yum!" he said, as it was sweet and juicy. It was an apple, and Tim liked it very much. He ate the whole apple and felt very happy.Later, Tim's mom asked him, "Tim, did you eat the apple on the table?" Tim, who was usually careless, smiled and said, "Yes, mommy. It tasted very good!" His mom was happy that Tim liked the apple, and from that day on, Tim always looked for new things to taste.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to write a letter to his friend, Sam. He wanted to send a photo with the letter too. Tim found a funny photo of them playing in the park. He thought it would make Sam laugh.Tim started to write the letter. He wrote, "Hi Sam, I miss you. Let's play soon. Look at the funny photo!" Tim put the photo in the envelope with the letter.When Sam got the letter, he saw the photo and laughed. He showed it to his mom and said, "Tim sent me a funny photo! He is a good friend." His mom smiled and said, "Yes, he is. It's nice to have friends who are not rude."Sam wrote a letter back to Tim. He said, "Thank you for the funny photo! I miss you too. Let's play in the park again soon!" They both felt happy and couldn't wait to play together again.

One day, a little bird was flying in the sky. The bird had pretty wings. It liked to play with its friends. But, the bird was not good at flying fast. The bird felt embarrassed.One day, the bird saw a big race in the sky. All the birds were flying fast. The little bird wanted to try too. So, it joined the race. The bird tried to fly fast like the others. But, it was not easy.In the race, the little bird had to pause. It was tired. The other birds flew past it. The little bird felt sad. But, it did not give up. It tried again and again. At last, the little bird finished the race. All the birds clapped their wings. The little bird was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very obedient. He always did what his mom and dad said. One day, Tim's mom asked him to go to the attic. She told him to bring down a big box.Tim went up to the attic. He saw the big box. But when he touched it, he started to tremble. Tim was a little scared. He called out, "Mom, I am scared. Can you help me?"His mom came up to the attic. She saw Tim trembling. She hugged him and said, "It's okay, Tim. I will help you with the box." Together, they carried the big box down. Tim was happy that he was obedient and brave. From that day on, Tim was never scared of the attic again.

One day, a big, tough dog named Max went to the park. He saw a little girl named Sue playing with her toys. Max walked up to Sue and said, "Can I play with you?"Sue looked at Max and said, "Yes, but you have to add one toy to play with me." Max was happy and found a ball to play with. They played together and had lots of fun.While playing, Max stepped on Sue's toe by mistake. Sue cried, but Max said, "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to hurt your toe." Sue stopped crying and said, "It's okay, Max. We all make mistakes."Then, a big wind came and blew all the toys away. Max and Sue were sad. But Max had an idea. He used his strong legs to run and catch all the toys. Sue was very happy and said, "Thank you, Max!"The moral of the story is to always be kind and help your friends when they are in need.

One day, a little boy named Tim found some chalk. He was nervous to use it. He had an idea. He thought, "I can imagine something fun to draw!" Tim saw his friend, Sue. "What do you want to draw?" he asked. Sue said, "Let's draw a big sun!" They began to draw with the chalk. They were not nervous anymore. They were having fun.But then, a big dog came. The dog wanted to play with the chalk. The dog took the chalk from Tim and Sue. They were sad. Tim said, "We need to get the chalk back!" They worked together to get the chalk from the dog. They were happy again and continued to draw.

Once upon a time, there was a prince named Tom. He lived in a big castle. One day, Tom went for a walk in the woods. As he walked, he heard a sound. It was a small, sad cry. Tom looked around and saw a little bird on the ground."Little bird, why are you crying?" Tom asked. The bird looked up at him and said, "I fell from my nest, and my wing hurts. I can't fly back up."Tom wanted to help the little bird. He saw a disgusting bug nearby. Tom knew that birds liked to eat bugs. He picked up the bug and gave it to the little bird. The bird ate the bug and felt better.With a smile, the bird said, "Thank you, Prince Tom! You are very kind." Tom felt happy that he could help the little bird. From that day on, they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was an adorable little dog named Max. Max loved to play with his sack. He would put his toys in the sack and carry it around the house. One day, Max found a toy gun in the yard. He put the gun in his sack and went to show it to his friend, Sam the cat.Max and Sam were playing with the sack and the toy gun when something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew the sack away. Max and Sam were sad because they lost the sack and the toy gun. They looked everywhere, but they could not find it.Then, a friendly bird saw Max and Sam looking sad. The bird had seen where the wind took the sack and the toy gun. The bird told Max and Sam to follow her. They found the sack in a tree with the toy gun still inside. Max and Sam were so happy and thanked the bird. They played with the sack and the toy gun all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a brave king and he loved to talk. Everywhere he went, he talked about being brave and courageous. One day, the king went on a dangerous adventure.Many people were scared and did not want him to go. But the King was brave and he wanted to prove his bravery. He carried a sword and a shield and set out on the journey.When the King arrived at his destination, he met an evil monster. The monster was huge and very dangerous! The King was scared but he did not want to show it. He took a deep breathe and walked right up to the monster.The King started to talk to the monster and said, ‘I am brave and I will stand up to you!’ The monster was surprised and stepped back. Then the King and the monster talked for a long time about being brave and about friendship.In the end, the King and the monster became friends. The King went home and everyone was happy. The King had proven himself to be brave and everyone loved and respected him. The King taught everyone an important lesson: no matter how dangerous something may seem, if you are brave and talk about it, it can always have a happy ending.

One day, Tom and his friend, Sam, went to play outside. They saw a radio hanging on a tree. Tom said, "Look! A radio! Let's turn it on!" Sam replied, "Okay! Let's dance to the music!"They turned on the radio and started to dance. They were dancing like crazy! Suddenly, the radio started to talk. It said, "Hello, Tom and Sam! I am a magic radio!"Tom and Sam were very surprised. They never heard a talking radio before! The magic radio said, "I can grant you one wish. What do you want?" Tom and Sam looked at each other, and they wished to be the best dancers in the world.The magic radio made their wish come true. From that day, Tom and Sam danced better than anyone else. They were so happy and danced all day long.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the park with her mom. Amy loved the park because it was big and fun. She saw her friend, Tom, and they both smiled. They were happy to play together.Amy and Tom played a noisy game called tag. They ran and laughed. "You can't catch me!" Amy said to Tom. Tom tried to catch Amy, but she was too fast. They were having so much fun.But then, a big dog came into the park. The dog was very noisy and scary. Amy and Tom stopped playing their game. They were sad and scared. The dog barked and chased them. Amy's mom came and took them away from the park. They went home, and the fun day was over.

One day, a proud cat named Kitty found a big melon in the yard. She wanted to show her friend, Doggy. Kitty rolled the melon to Doggy's house. "Look what I found!" she said.Doggy looked at the melon and said, "Be careful, Kitty! I want to warn you. Melons can break."Kitty didn't listen. She rolled the melon down the hill. It went very fast. At the bottom of the hill, the melon hit a rock and broke. Kitty was sad, but Doggy was there to help. They ate the melon together and had fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, she put on her favorite dress and went to play with her friends.As they played, Lucy's dress got very dirty. She didn't care, because she was having so much fun. Her friends laughed and played with her, even though her dress was dirty.When it was time to go home, Lucy's mom saw her dirty dress. She smiled and said, "Welcome home, Lucy!" Her mom didn't mind the dirty dress, because she knew Lucy had a great day playing with her friends.

Once upon a time there was a nosy cat named Luxury. She was always prying into things that weren't hers. One day, while she was snooping around, she found a box of matches. She was fascinated by them and kept pushing them around with her paw. After a while, she accidentally knocked the whole box down and all the matches scattered. Luxury was a bit scared and hid away. But then she heard a little voice say, "Don't be scared! I'm here to help you put the matches back in the box." Luxury was surprised and saw a little girl and her mom. The little girl had a big smile on her face and the mom said, "It looks like you two are a match made in heaven!" Luxury felt happy and thankful. With the help of the little girl and her mom, she managed to put all the matches back in the box. From that day on, Luxury and the little girl were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy little dog named Toby. Toby liked to play with a big red drum. He would hit the drum with his tail and make loud sounds. Toby's friends would come over to play with him and they would include the drum in their games.One day, Toby and his friends were playing with the drum in the park. They were having so much fun! But then, a big wind came and blew the drum high up into a tree. Toby and his friends were so sad. They did not know how to get the drum down from the tree.Just then, a kind bird flew by and saw the drum in the tree. The bird knew that Toby and his friends needed help. So, the bird flew up to the tree and pushed the drum out of the tree. The drum fell down and Toby caught it. Toby and his friends were so happy! They thanked the bird and learned that it is good to help others. From that day on, Toby was not nosy anymore and always tried to help his friends.

Once there was a girl and she wanted to learn something new. She wanted to try opera and she went to her teacher. She was very excited and wasn't feeling a bit dry.The teacher started to explain what opera was, but it was all too confusing for the girl. She didn't understand. But her teacher said she must try and she didn't have to understand it all to get started.So the girl tried and tried and it was so much fun! She started to practice and soon she was singing opera all the time. She loved it, even when it was dry and she was tired.Soon all her friends knew opera, too and they would sing together. They had so much fun singing and they all became friends, too.The girl had been brave enough to try something new and it had worked out great! Opera had made her feel so happy.

One sunny day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He wanted to discover new things. He saw a big tree with many leaves. Tim thought it was fun to play near the tree.As Tim was playing, he saw a small, filthy ball under the tree. It was very dirty, but he picked it up. Just then, a little girl named Lily came running. "That's my ball!" she said. Tim smiled and gave her the ball.They played together and had a lot of fun. But then, Tim tripped and had a fall. Lily helped him up and they both laughed. They became good friends and played in the park every day.

One day, a cat and a dog were in a kitchen. They saw a big, unknown box. The cat said, "Let's race to the box!" The dog said, "Yes, let's race!"They started to run very fast. The cat was fast, but the dog was faster. The dog got to the box first. The cat was sad, but the dog said, "It's okay. We can open the box together."When they opened the box, they found many toys inside! They were so happy and played with the toys all day. The race had brought them a fun surprise, and they became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a man. The man was careless. He did not look where he was going. One day, he walked and walked. He was not looking. He fell into a big hole.A dog saw the man in the hole. The dog ran to the man. The dog said, "I will help you!" The dog tried to help the man out of the hole. But the dog was too small. The man was still in the hole.Then, a big bird saw the man and the dog. The bird said, "I can help you both!" The big bird picked up the man with its strong feet. The man was out of the hole. The man, the dog, and the big bird were happy. The man said, "Thank you!" And from that day, the man was not careless anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane. She loved to play in the park and swing on the swing. On one nice day, Jane wanted to play with a bow and arrow. She took out her bow, but she couldn't make it work. She yelled, "This bow is too hard!"Just then, her friend arrived. His name was Tom. Tom said, "Let me show you how to use that bow." He held the bow in his hands and pulled the arrow back until it clicked into place.Then he said, "Now, don't be so lazy! Pull back the arrow and let go. The arrow will fly across the park."Jane tried it and, sure enough, her arrow flew across the park. She was so happy she could barely contain her excitement. She yelled, "I did it! I can use the bow!"Tom smiled at her and said, "Good job, Jane! Now you know how to use the bow."From then on, Jane and Tom played with the bow every day. They had so much fun!

One day, a girl named Lucy went for a walk. She saw a tidy hut in the woods. She knocked on the door to see who lived there. An old lady opened the door and said, "Hello, dear. What do you want?" Lucy replied, "I just wanted to say hi."The old lady invited Lucy inside the hut. They sat and talked. Lucy saw a big, nice cake on the table. The old lady said, "I made this cake for my friend, but she is not here yet." Lucy looked at the cake and thought it looked very yummy. She wanted to eat it, but she knew it was not for her.Just then, there was a loud knock on the door. The old lady opened it, and Lucy saw a big, scary bear! But the bear was not mean. It was the old lady's friend! The bear said, "Thank you for the cake!" Lucy was very surprised. She never thought a bear could be friends with an old lady. The bear, the old lady, and Lucy all sat down and ate the cake together.

Once upon a time, there was a little sunflower named Sunny. Sunny was nervous because he was shy. He lived in a big field with other flowers.One day, a kind bird came to visit. The bird said, "Hello, Sunny! Why are you nervous?" Sunny looked down and whispered, "I am shy and scared to talk to other flowers."The kind bird had an idea. "I will help you, Sunny!" The bird flew away and came back with a small stick. Gently, the bird used the stick to poke other flowers and said, "This is Sunny! He wants to be your friend."The other flowers smiled and said, "Hi, Sunny! We want to be your friend too!" Sunny felt happy and not so nervous anymore. From that day on, he had many friends and they all played together in the field.

One day, a gifted squirrel named Sam found a big acorn. He was very happy. He wanted to share it with his friend, Tom the rabbit. Sam said, "Tom, look at my big acorn!"Tom and Sam played with the acorn. They rolled it and threw it. They had a lot of fun. But then, the acorn vanished. They looked around, but they could not find it. They were sad.A bird saw them and said, "I took your acorn. I am sorry." The bird gave them back the acorn. Sam and Tom were happy again. They learned that sharing is good and friends can help each other.

One sunny day, a big dog named Max saw a man deliver a box to his house. Max was confused. He did not know what was inside the box. Max went to the lawn to think.Max saw his friend, a small cat named Lily. Max said, "Lily, a man just delivered a box to my house. I don't know what's inside." Lily was curious too. They both decided to find out what was in the box.When they got to the box, they saw a big bird named Sam sitting on it. Sam did not want Max and Lily to open the box. Max and Lily were sad. They asked Sam, "Please let us see what's inside the box." Sam thought for a moment and then said, "Okay, we can all look together." They opened the box and found fun toys inside. Max, Lily, and Sam played with the toys on the lawn and became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was an otter that loved to soar high in the sky. The otter's friends watched longingly as she glided above and around them, far and wide.One day, the otter's friend, a bunny said, "I wish I could soar in the sky like you do."The otter replied, "Maybe one day you will, too!"So, the bunny practiced and practiced until she was able to glide high above the clouds. She felt so happy and amazed.The otter and bunny soared together and had lots of fun discovering the world from above. They laughed and smiled as they flew over the wide fields and over the tall trees.They had such a good time soaring above that when it was time for them to come down, they stayed up there a little longer—just to squeeze in a few more adventures in the sky!

Once upon a time, there lived a jolly bear called Jimmy. Jimmy always had a big smile on his face and loved to laugh. One day, Jimmy felt very hungry, so he asked his friend Rabbit for help. Jimmy said, "Rabbit, can you please get me something to eat?" Rabbit replied, "Of course! I'll get you something really yummy!".Rabbit hopped away quickly to get Jimmy some food. When Rabbit returned, he was carrying a big bowl of porridge. Jimmy was so excited and said, "That looks yummy, Rabbit! Thank you!" Rabbit smiled and said, "You are welcome, Jimmy. I hope it will fix your hungry tummy!"Jimmy started eating the porridge and said to Rabbit, "It's so warm and delicious! I want more. Can you please put some more in my bowl?" Rabbit laughed and said, "Sure thing! Let me get it for you - nice and quick". Rabbit hopped away quickly and got Jimmy more porridge. When Rabbit returned, Jimmy said with a smile, "Thank you Rabbit! You are so jolly and kind!" Rabbit replied, "You're welcome, Jimmy! I'm so glad you're happy!"

One day, a big, mysterious box came to the town. No one knew what was inside. A little girl named Mia was very curious about it. She wanted to open it and see what was inside.Mia asked her mom, "Can I open the big box?" Her mom said, "No, Mia. We do not know what is inside. It could be something bad." Mia was sad but she listened to her mom.That night, the box opened all by itself. Out came a funny clown. The clown had a big red nose and long ears. He started to perform tricks for the town. Everyone laughed and clapped. The clown made Mia and her friends very happy. The mysterious box was not bad after all. It was a surprise gift for the town.

Once upon a time, in a small garden, there was a tiny flower. The flower wanted to bloom and be pretty. It was sad because it did not know how to bloom. It asked the sun and rain for help. The sun and rain were kind and helped the flower. Soon, the flower bloomed and was very happy.One day, a little boy came to the garden. He had a tasty sandwich. He took a bite and said, "Yum!" The boy saw the pretty flower and wanted to pick it. But the flower was scared and did not want to be picked.The flower said, "Please do not pick me. I want to stay in the garden and make it pretty." The boy thought about it and decided to leave the flower. He shared his tasty sandwich with the flower. They became friends and the flower made the garden pretty for everyone to enjoy.The moral of the story is to be kind and share with others. When we share, we make friends and make the world a better place.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a funny rabbit named Remy. Remy was always happy and loved to play with his friends. One day, Remy and his friends found a big piece of meat near the river. They were all very hungry and wanted to eat it.Remy decided to poke the meat with a stick to make sure it was safe to eat. But when he poked it, the meat started to move! All the little animals were scared and ran away. They hid behind the trees and watched as the meat turned into a big, kind bear named Benny.Benny told the little animals that the meat was not good to eat because it was his food. Remy and his friends learned that it was important to ask before taking something that didn't belong to them. They all said sorry to Benny and promised to be more careful next time. Benny forgave them and they all became good friends. From that day on, Remy and his friends always asked before taking anything, and they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a little girl named Sue had a birthday. She was very happy. She got a big, red ball as a gift. Sue loved to play with her ball. She would rub it, throw it, and kick it all day long. Sue's friend, Tom, was sad because he did not have a ball to play with.One day, Tom said to Sue, "Can I play with your ball, please?" Sue said, "No, this is my special birthday ball." Tom felt very poor because he did not have a ball like Sue's. He walked away with a sad face.The next day, Sue went to play with her ball, but it was gone! She looked everywhere for it, but she could not find it. Sue was very sad. Then, she saw Tom playing with a new ball. It was not her ball, but it looked just like it. Tom saw Sue's sad face and said, "I found a ball just like yours! Now we can both play together!" Sue was so happy, and they played with their balls all day long.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a magazine on the table. She liked the pretty pictures in it. She saw a picture of a calm lake with ducks swimming. Lily wanted to count the ducks, so she started to number them.Lily's mom came into the room and saw her looking at the magazine. "What are you doing, Lily?" her mom asked. "I am counting ducks in the magazine, Mommy," Lily said with a big smile.Mom sat down next to Lily and helped her count the ducks. "One, two, three," they counted together. They felt very calm and happy as they looked at the pretty pictures in the magazine.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. They needed to buy food for dinner. Tim saw a big piece of meat and asked his mom, "Can we get this, please?" His mom said, "Yes, we can."At home, Tim's mom cooked the meat. It smelled very good. Tim was excited to eat it. Just then, there was a knock at the door. Tim opened it and saw a big, interesting looking bird. The bird said, "Hi, I am Bobo. Can I have some meat too?"Tim was surprised but said, "Okay, you can have some." They all sat down to eat. But when they looked at the meat, it was gone! Tim and his mom were confused. Then, they saw Bobo holding the meat. He said, "I received it for my friends too!" Tim and his mom laughed and shared the meat with Bobo and his friends.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a girl named Lily. Lily loved to create things. She would draw, paint, and build with her toys. One day, she found a big box. Lily had an idea. She wanted to make a piano.Lily worked very hard to create her piano. She used the box, some paper, and colors. When she was done, the piano was very pretty. It had many keys and it was very colorful. Lily was happy with her piano.One day, Lily's friend, Tim, came over to play. Tim saw the piano and said, "Wow, what a nice piano! Can I play it?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, you can play it. Let's make calm music together." They both played the piano and the music was soft and calm. They had a lot of fun playing the piano and creating music together.

Once upon a time, there was a little frog named Bob. Bob was different from the other frogs because he had a big red spot on his back. One day, Bob was in the pond with his friend, a little fish named Tim. They liked to play and jump together."Let's have a jumping race!" said Tim. "We can start at this rock and jump all the way to the other side of the pond."Bob and Tim got ready to start their race. They counted, "One, two, three, jump!" and they both jumped as far as they could. They jumped and jumped, laughing and having fun. But then, something unexpected happened.As they were jumping, a big bird swooped down and picked up Bob. Tim was scared and didn't know what to do. But the bird didn't want to hurt Bob; it just wanted to see his big red spot. The bird thought it was very pretty. "Sorry, I just wanted to see your spot," said the bird. "You can go back and play now."The bird let Bob go, and he jumped back into the pond with Tim. They were both happy and continued their race, laughing and jumping all the way to the other side of the pond.

Once upon a time, there was a messy plane. It had paint all over it. The plane was sad because it wanted to be clean and pretty like the other planes.One day, a kind man saw the messy plane. He said, "Mind if I help you?" The plane was very happy and said, "Yes, please! I want to be clean like the other planes."The kind man took a big cloth and started to clean the plane. He wiped away all the paint and made the plane shiny and pretty. The plane was so happy and said, "Thank you, kind man!"Now, the plane could play with the other planes and not feel sad. The kind man waved goodbye and the plane flew high in the sky, feeling proud and happy. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small store, there was a fragile toy made of leather. It was a cute dog with big eyes, and all the kids loved it. But the toy dog was sad because it was so fragile that no one could play with it.One day, a little girl named Anna came to the store with her mom. She saw the leather dog and said, "Mom, I like this dog! Can I have it, please?" Her mom looked at the toy and said, "But Anna, this dog is very fragile. It might break if you play with it."Anna thought for a moment and said, "I will be gentle with the dog. I promise!" So, her mom bought the fragile leather dog for her. Anna took the dog home and played with it very carefully. The toy dog was happy because it finally had a friend who loved it.Anna and the leather dog became best friends. They played together every day, and Anna always remembered to be gentle with her fragile friend. The toy dog was no longer sad, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She was very adventurous and loved to play outside. One day, she found a magical belt that glowed. She put the glowing belt around her waist and felt very special.Sue went to show her friends the glowing belt. They were all amazed and wanted to see what it could do. So, they went to the park to play. While they were playing, something unexpected happened. The belt made Sue fly up into the sky!Sue was scared at first, but then she started to have fun. She flew around the park, up and down, and her friends cheered. But then, the belt stopped glowing and Sue fell down. Her friends caught her and they all laughed. They realized that the belt was just a fun toy, not magic. Sue and her friends had a great day, and they never forgot their adventure with the glowing belt.

Once upon a time, in a tidy little house, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim loved to march all around his house, making loud sounds with his feet. He would march from his room to the kitchen and back again, making his mom and dad laugh.One day, Tim found a tiny toy in his pocket. It was a small red car. He decided to march with the car around the house. He held the car in his hand and marched up and down the hall. The car went "vroom, vroom" as he played.Tim's mom saw him marching with the car and smiled. "Why don't you put the car in your pocket and keep it safe?" she said. Tim listened to his mom and put the car back in his pocket. Then, he went outside and continued to march around the yard, his pocket holding the little red car safe and sound.

The sun shined in the big sky. Tommy was playing outside in the garden and he felt warm. As he walked around, he noticed something different in the ground. It was a step. He touched the step and it felt warm too. Suddenly, the step started to melt!Tommy got scared and he ran to get his mom. "Mom! Mom! The step is melting!"Tommy's mom laughed. "It's just the sun, Tommy," she said. "It's making the step a bit different."Tommy felt relieved. He knew now that the step wasn't melting, it was just feeling a bit different. Tommy ran around and played in the garden happily for the rest of the day.

One day, a little girl was walking around with her mom. Suddenly, she found something shiny on the ground. She picked it up and said "Mom, look! I'm so lucky!" It was a dime. Her mom smiled and said "Let’s go to the store and see what you can buy with this!"They went to the store and the little girl bought a small box of juice. She was so happy and said "Mom, I'm so lucky I found this dime!" Her mom sent her a big hug. The girl opened the juice and took a sip. She gave the rest to her mom and said, "Yay! I’m so happy I could buy us juice with my dime!" Her mom smiled and sent her a big kiss. The little girl was proud of her luck, and her and her mom enjoyed the juice together.

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play in the park. They have a ball and a bike. They take turns to kick the ball and ride the bike.One day, they see a big tree with red apples. They want to pick some apples and eat them. They run to the tree and look for the best apples."Look, Mia, this one is big and shiny!" Tom says. He reaches for the apple."No, Tom, that one is mine!" Mia says. She pulls Tom's hand away. "I saw it first!"Tom and Mia start to fight. They push and pull and shout. They forget about the ball and the bike.A dog sees the ball and the bike. He thinks they are toys. He runs to the park and grabs the ball. He bites it and makes it flat. He sees the bike and jumps on it. He makes it fall and break.Tom and Mia hear a loud noise. They pause and look at the dog. They see the ball and the bike. They are sad and angry."Hey, dog, stop it!" Tom yells. He runs to the dog and tries to get the ball."Go away, dog, that's our bike!" Mia yells. She runs to the bike and tries to fix it.The dog barks and runs away. He is scared of Tom and Mia. He leaves the ball and the bike.Tom and Mia look at the ball and the bike. They are ruined. They start to cry.They look at each other. They feel sorry. They hug and say sorry."I'm sorry, Mia, I should have shared the apple with you," Tom says."I'm sorry, Tom, I should have let you have the apple," Mia says.They look at the tree. There are still many apples. They pick some apples and share them. They are happy. They are friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Ann. She loved to eat spicy food. One day, her mom made a spicy soup for her. Ann was very happy.Ann's mom wanted to test if the soup was too spicy for her. She gave Ann a small spoon to taste it. Ann thought it was just right. She ate and ate until her bowl was empty.Suddenly, Ann's bowl vanished! She looked around and saw her dog, Max. Max had taken her bowl to play with it. Ann laughed and played with Max. They had a fun day together.

One day, a dog named Spot and his owner, Tom, went to the park. They were ready to play with a big red ball. Tom threw the ball far, far away. Spot ran fast to get it. He was so happy!As Spot picked up the ball, he saw a big box. Spot thought it was fun to cover the box with leaves. He barked to call Tom. "Woof, woof!" Tom came running to see what Spot found. "Wow, Spot! What is this?" Tom asked.Tom pulled off the leaves and opened the box. Inside, they found many toys and treats! They were very surprised. Spot and Tom shared the toys and treats with their friends at the park. It was the best day ever!

One day, a little girl named Mia went for a walk. She saw an adorable cat. Mia wanted to play with the cat. She looked at the cat and the cat looked at her. They were happy.Mia and the cat walked together. They saw a big rainbow in the sky. The rainbow was very pretty. Mia and the cat looked at the rainbow and smiled.Suddenly, the cat jumped into the rainbow. Mia was surprised! The cat changed into a beautiful bird. The bird looked at Mia and sang a sweet song. Mia laughed and clapped her hands. The bird flew away, and Mia knew she had a magical friend.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Mary. She liked to explore the world and learn new things. One day she decided she wanted to sail away and discover new places. Mary asked her parents if she could go sailing. Her mom gave her a helpful dictionary so she could find out what sailing was all about. Mary pored over the dictionary and learned that sailing was lots of fun. She asked her mom, “Can I sail away?”Her mom smiled and said, “Yes, but first you have to learn how to sail.”Mary set out to learn all she could about sailing. She studied the dictionary every day and soon she had the knowledge to sail away!The next day, Mary took her new boat out on the open sea. She was so excited and showed her parents how she could sail the boat. She waved goodbye and sailed away, happily exploring the world.

Once upon a time, there was a quick bunny named Bob. Bob was very quick but also very sleepy. One day, Bob went to the park to play.At the park, Bob saw a bird named Tim. Bob wanted to be friends with Tim. So, Bob said, "Hi, I am Bob. I am a quick bunny. Can we be friends?" Tim said, "Hi, I am Tim. I am a bird. Yes, we can be friends." They were very happy to meet each other.They played together all day. They ran and they jumped. They had so much fun. But soon, the sun went down, and it was time to go home. Bob was very sleepy. He said, "Bye, Tim. I am sleepy. See you tomorrow." Tim said, "Bye, Bob. Sleep well. See you tomorrow." And they both went home, excited to play together again the next day.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a girl named Lily. She had a big, heavy bag that she carried everywhere. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends.At noon, Lily felt tired and her back began to suffer. She sat down on the grass and said, "Ouch, my back hurts." Her friend, Tom, looked at her and asked, "Why do you carry such a heavy bag, Lily?"Lily thought for a moment and said, "I don't know. I just always have." Tom smiled and said, "Maybe you should take some things out of your bag. You don't need to carry everything with you all the time." Lily listened to Tom and took some things out of her bag. Her back felt much better, and she could play with her friends again.The moral of the story is that sometimes we carry things we don't need, and it can cause us to suffer. It's important to let go of things that are not necessary and enjoy life.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the bookshelf to find a book. It was cold in the room, so he wore a big coat. Tim saw a big red book on the shelf. He wanted to read it.Tim took the book and opened it. Inside, he found a word he did not know. The word was "reverse." He asked his mom, "What does 'reverse' mean?" His mom said, "It means to go back or change something."Tim thought it would be fun to reverse the cold room. He said, "I want to reverse the cold!" But he did not know how to do it. He tried to say the word "reverse" many times, but nothing happened. The room stayed cold.Tim felt sad and started to cry. He did not like the cold room and he could not change it. His mom tried to help, but the room stayed cold. In the end, Tim and his mom had to stay in the cold room with the big red book. They were not happy.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty dog named Max. Max lived in a big house with a soft rug. He loved to play on the rug all day.One day, Max saw a little cat outside the house. The cat looked cold and sad. Max wanted to help the cat, so he offered to share his rug with her.The cat came inside the house and they both sat on the rug. They played together and became good friends. Max and the cat were happy because they had each other. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia and her mom went to the market to get some food. They walked and talked, holding hands.At the market, Mia saw a big, scary dog. She was scared and said, "Mommy, I'm scared of that dog!" Her mom said, "Don't worry, Mia. The dog won't hurt you."Suddenly, the dog started to dance! Mia and her mom were surprised. The dog wasn't scary at all. It was a dancing dog! Mia laughed and said, "Look, Mommy! The dog is dancing!" They all danced together and had a fun time at the market.

Once, there was a boy named Tim. Tim liked to fold paper. He made paper birds, paper boats, and paper hats. Folding paper was fun for Tim.One day, Tim saw a video on TV. The video showed how to fold a big paper star. Tim wanted to make a big paper star too. He thought it looked hard, but he wanted to try.Tim found a big paper. He tried to fold it just like the video. It was hard at first, but he did not give up. After some time, Tim made a big paper star. He was very happy and showed it to his mom and dad. They were proud of him for not giving up.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a big box of toys. One day, she wanted to sort her toys. She put her dolls in one corner and her cars in another corner.Mia's mom said, "You are doing a great job, Mia! In a minute, we can have a snack." Mia was happy and worked faster. She knew that she would get a rare treat for her snack.Finally, Mia finished sorting her toys. She felt proud of her work. Her mom gave her a rare treat – a big, red apple. Mia and her mom sat down and enjoyed their snack together.

Once upon a time, there was a panda named Pandy. Pandy loved to play with his friends in the big green forest. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long.One day, Pandy and his friends heard a loud noise. It was a big tree that had fallen down. Pandy and his friends were scared, but they wanted to help. So, they started to strike the tree with their paws to make it smaller and easier to move.After a lot of hard work, Pandy and his friends moved the tree. They were very happy and proud. They played and had fun for the rest of the day. And from that day on, whenever there was a loud noise, Pandy and his friends knew they could work together to make things better.

Ben and Mia liked to play in the park. They liked to swing, slide and run. One day, they saw a big crane near the park. The crane was lifting heavy things and putting them on a truck."Wow, look at that crane!" Ben said. "It is so big and strong!""I want to see it closer!" Mia said. "Let's go!"They ran to the fence and looked at the crane. They saw a man sitting in a small box on top of the crane. He was pushing buttons and moving a stick."Hello, Mr. Crane!" Mia shouted. "Can you hear us?"The man looked down and smiled. He waved at them and said, "Hello, kids! Do you like my crane?""Yes, we do!" Ben and Mia said. "It is amazing!""Thank you!" the man said. "Do you know what I do with my crane?""No, what do you do?" Ben asked."I help to build new houses and buildings. I lift the bricks, the wood, the metal and the glass. I put them where they need to go. It is a lot of work, but it is fun!""That sounds cool!" Mia said. "Can we help you?"The man laughed. He said, "Well, you are too small to help me now. But maybe when you grow up, you can be crane drivers too. You just need to learn a lot and practice a lot. And you need to be lucky too. Lucky to find a good job and a good crane."Ben and Mia nodded. They said, "We will do that! We want to be like you!"The man said, "That's great! I'm sure you can do it. But for now, you should go back to the park and play. Have fun and be safe!""Okay, thank you, Mr. Crane!" Ben and Mia said. They waved goodbye and ran back to the park. They were happy and excited. They had seen a big crane and talked to a nice man. They had learned something new and made a new

Once upon a time, there was a pretty flower. The flower was sad because it could not bloom. Every day, the flower tried to bloom, but it just could not. The flower was very sad.One day, a kind bird saw the sad flower. The bird was compassionate and wanted to help. The bird said, "Why are you sad, little flower?" The flower said, "I can't bloom, and I don't know why."The bird thought about it and said, "Maybe you need some help. Let's ask the sunset." So, the bird and the flower asked the sunset for help. The sunset said, "You need more light, little flower. I will give you more light."The next day, the flower got more light from the sunset. The flower was happy and finally bloomed. The bird and the sunset were happy too. They all lived happily ever after.

Janie was playing with her dolls when she noticed a pink knot near her foot. She picked it up and showed it to her mom."Mommy, what's this?" May asked, holding the knot in her hand. "That's a knot," Mommy replied. "Now put it back where you found it."Janie heard her mom, but she didn't want to. The knot was so pretty and colourful, she decided she wanted to keep it."No, I won't!" Janie said. "I want to keep it!"Mommy became cross. She didn't want Janie to have the knot in her room. It wouldn't be safe."You must put it back where you found it," Mommy said firmly.Janie knew that her mom was right. She reluctantly put the pink knot back on the floor. But out of the corner of her eye, she thought she saw it move.

Once upon a time, a wolf lived in a big forest. This wolf loved to mix things. He was a very patient wolf. He would mix leaves, sticks, and mud to make fun things to play with. All the other animals liked to watch him mix.One day, the wolf found a big bowl. He thought, "I can mix something really big!" So, he started to mix leaves, sticks, and mud in the big bowl. He mixed and mixed, being very patient. Soon, all the other animals came to see what he was doing.As the wolf mixed, something unexpected happened. The mix in the bowl started to grow and grow! The wolf and the other animals were very surprised. The mix became so big that it turned into a giant ball. The animals all played with the giant ball and had so much fun. The patient wolf was happy that his mix made everyone smile.

Once upon a time, there was a white cat named Snowy. Snowy was very smart and loved to learn. One day, Snowy had a big exam at her school. She was a little scared, but she knew that she could do well if she tried her best.Snowy's friend, a kind dog named Buddy, saw that she was worried. Buddy wanted to help Snowy feel better. So, he decided to lend her his favorite toy, a soft, red ball. "This will make you feel happy," Buddy said. Snowy smiled and thanked Buddy for being such a good friend.The day of the exam came, and Snowy took the red ball with her. Every time she felt scared, she looked at the ball and thought of Buddy. The red ball helped her feel brave and strong. Snowy did very well on her exam, and she knew it was because of her friend Buddy. They played with the red ball together and were very happy.

Once upon a time, in a normal little town, there lived a girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her pebbles. She had a big box full of them. She had pebbles of all colors: red, blue, green, and yellow. Lily would spend hours playing with her pebbles, making pictures and patterns on the ground.One day, Lily's mom said, "Lily, it's time to wash your pebbles. They are very dirty." Lily agreed and took her box of pebbles outside. She filled a big bowl with water and began to wash her pebbles one by one. As she washed them, they became shinier and prettier than before.As Lily was washing her pebbles, her friend Tom came over. He saw the shiny pebbles and asked, "Lily, can I help you wash the pebbles?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, Tom! Let's wash them together." So, Lily and Tom washed all the pebbles until they were clean and shiny.When they were done, Lily and Tom made a big rainbow with the pebbles on the ground. It was the most beautiful rainbow they had ever seen. They were very happy and proud of their work.From that day on, Lily and Tom would wash their pebbles and make beautiful pictures together. And they lived happily ever after, playing and creating with their shiny, clean pebbles.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park. She saw her friend Tom playing with a ball. Tom looked sad and had a frown on his face. Lily asked, "Tom, why are you sad?"Tom said, "I lost my heart necklace. My mom gave it to me. It is very special." Lily wanted to help Tom find his necklace. They looked and looked, but they could not find it. They were both very sad.Just then, a small bird flew down and landed near them. The bird had something shiny in its beak. It was Tom's heart necklace! The bird dropped the necklace in Tom's hand. Tom and Lily were so happy and surprised. Tom's frown turned into a big smile. They thanked the bird and played in the park all day.

Once upon a time, there was a big rock. It was in a nice place with water and trees. This place was called an oasis. Many animals came to the oasis to drink water and rest.One day, a modern bird came to the oasis. The bird was new and different. It had shiny colors and could sing beautiful songs. All the animals liked the new bird and wanted to be its friend.The big rock saw the new bird and wanted to be friends too. The rock asked the wind to help it move closer to the new bird. The wind blew and blew, and the rock moved a little bit. The new bird saw the rock and smiled. They became good friends, and the oasis was a happy place for everyone.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a weird door in his room. He didn't know where it came from. He asked his mom, "Mom, what is this door for?" She said, "I don't know, Tim. You can imagine what's behind it."Tim thought and thought. He imagined a big, fun playground behind the door. He opened the door and saw the playground! It was real! He played and played until he got tired.Then, he imagined a big ice cream behind the door. He opened the door again, but there was no ice cream. Instead, he saw his dad with a big smile. "Surprise!" said his dad. "I brought you a new toy to play with!" Tim was happy and played with his new toy all day.

One day, a bald man named Tom went to the store. He wanted to buy paper to draw on. He picked a big pack of paper and took it home.At home, Tom started to draw. He drew a big sun and a green tree. Then, something unexpected happened. The tree on the paper began to grow! It grew and grew, and the paper started to increase in size.Tom was very surprised. He never thought his drawings could come to life. He decided to draw more things, like a big house and a friendly dog. And just like the tree, they all became real too! From that day on, Tom's life was full of fun and magic.

One day, a little boy named Tim wanted to watch a movie. He asked his mom, "Can I watch a movie, please?" His mom said, "Yes, but only if you are honest and protect your little sister, Sue."Tim and Sue sat down to watch the movie. They laughed and clapped at the funny parts. Tim was being a good big brother, making sure Sue was safe and happy.After the movie, their mom asked, "Did you protect Sue and have fun?" Tim said, "Yes, I was honest and kept Sue safe. We had lots of fun!" His mom was proud of him for being a good brother. They all had a big hug and enjoyed the rest of the day together.

One day, a polite cat named Sam went for a walk. He saw a little girl sitting by a tree. The girl was crying. Sam went up to her and asked, "Why do you cry?"The girl said, "I fell down and hurt my skin. It hurts a lot." Sam wanted to help her feel better. He had an idea. He told the girl to wait and ran back to his home.Sam came back with a big, soft pillow. He gave it to the girl and said, "Sit on this. It will make you feel better." The girl sat on the pillow, and her tears stopped. She smiled at Sam and said, "Thank you, Sam. You are a kind cat."Just then, something unexpected happened. The pillow started to move! It was not a pillow at all, but a big, friendly turtle. The turtle said, "I heard the girl cry and wanted to help. I am glad we could make her feel better." Sam, the girl, and the turtle all laughed and played together for the rest of the day.

Maggie was feeling grumpy. Her mom asked why and she just shrugged. Her mom said "Let's go play in the park!" She brightened up and jumped with joy.At the park, Maggie saw a swing. She asked her mom to lift her up on it. Maggie swung back and forth and laughed. She said she was no longer grumpy.A little boy appeared and wanted to join her. Maggie told him that he could play with her. She smiled as she helped lift him onto the swing.The two children swung and giggled while they played. All of a sudden the grumpy feeling had gone away. Maggie's mom said it was time to go and thanked them for sharing the swing. Maggie waved goodbye and smiled as she walked away.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big, noisy dog. His name was Max. Lily and Max liked to play outside all day. One day, they saw a big gray cloud in the sky. Lily said, "Max, I think it will rain soon."Lily and Max went home. They went inside the house. Lily's mom said, "Lily, let's pray for the rain to stop so you can play outside again." Lily and her mom closed their eyes and prayed. Max sat down and was quiet.After they prayed, the rain stopped. Lily said, "Thank you, Mom. Our prayer worked!" Lily and Max went outside to play again. They were so happy. The sun was shining, and they played all day.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a girl named Amy. Amy loved to dance. She would dance all day long. She was also very obedient. She always did what her mom and dad said.One day, Amy's mom said, "Amy, can you add more wood to the fire?" Amy said, "Yes, mom!" She went outside to get wood. While she was outside, she saw her friend, Tom. Tom was dancing too. "Tom, do you want to dance with me?" Amy asked. Tom said, "Yes!" So they danced and danced.But Amy forgot to add wood to the fire. The fire went out, and the house got very cold. Amy's mom and dad were not happy. They told Amy that she should have been more obedient and added wood to the fire like they asked. Amy was sad because she made her mom and dad upset. She promised to be more obedient next time.

Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Lucy. She was only 3 years old and she loved playing by the river. One day, Lucy went down to the river to play like she always did. But this time, something strange happened. She saw a fish jump out of the water, right up close to her.The fish said to Lucy, "Hi there! Do you want to come and play with me?"Lucy was very surprised and she replied, "Yes, I do!" But then, the fish said "Not so fast! You must be careful if you want to come and play with me. I'm afraid of people's eyes. So you must not look at me with your eyes, okay?"Lucy was a little bit scared, but she said to the fish "Okay, I'll be careful."The fish smiled and jumped back into the water. Lucy followed carefully, being very careful not to look at the fish with her eyes.  They then played happily together in the river.The end.

One day, a little bird was very happy. It wanted to fly high in the sky. It saw a hedge with many green leaves. The bird thought it would be fun to play there.The bird flew down to the hedge and said, "Hello, hedge! Can I play with you?" The hedge said, "Yes, little bird! I would love to play with you!" So, the bird and the hedge started to play together.While they were playing, something unexpected happened. The hedge started to move! The bird was surprised and said, "Hedge, I didn't know you could move!" The hedge smiled and said, "I am a magic hedge! I can fly too!" The bird and the hedge laughed and flew together in the sky, and they were both very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a furry duck. The duck lived in a small pond. The duck liked to play with his friends.One day, the duck saw a big toy car. He wanted to play with it. The duck asked his friends to help him. They pushed the toy car near the pond.The furry duck and his friends played with the toy car. They made it go forward and reverse. They had a lot of fun. They played all day long.When it was time to go home, the furry duck said "thank you" to his friends. They all went back to their homes. The duck was very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He had a favorite jacket. This jacket was very special. It had prints of cars and trucks on it. Tim wore it every day.One day, Tim and his mom went to the park. The park was distant, so they had to walk a long way. Tim saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. He took off his jacket and put it on the ground.After playing, Tim and his mom went home. But Tim forgot his jacket at the park! They went back to the distant park to find it. When they got there, they saw a little girl wearing Tim's jacket. She was cold and it kept her warm.Tim felt sad, but he knew the right thing to do. He let the little girl keep his jacket. Tim's mom was proud of him. She said they would print a new jacket with even more cars and trucks. Tim felt happy and knew he did a good thing.

Once upon a time, there was a prince. The prince was very successful. He was good at many things. He could run fast, jump high, and sing loud. Everyone in his town liked him.One day, the prince was very tired. He wanted to relax. So, he went to a quiet place near a big tree. He sat down under the tree and closed his eyes. The wind blew softly, and the birds sang sweet songs.Soon, the prince fell asleep. He had a nice dream. In his dream, he played with his friends and laughed a lot. When he woke up, he felt happy and not tired anymore. The prince went back to his town, ready to be successful again.

Once upon a time, in a wild, big forest, there lived a happy round ball. The ball loved to roll all day long. It would roll down hills, through the grass, and sometimes even in the mud.One hot day, the sun was shining very bright. The round ball felt the heat and decided to roll under a big, green tree. The tree gave the ball some cool shade. The ball was happy to be out of the heat.As the ball rolled around the wild forest, it made many friends. It met a cute bunny, a funny squirrel, and a nice bird. They all played together and had fun. And when the sun went down, they all said goodnight and went to sleep. The ball couldn't wait to roll and play with its friends again the next day.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. They have a ball and a kite. They have fun.One day, a stranger comes to the park. He has a big bag. He says he has candy and toys in his bag. He asks Lily and Tom if they want some. He says it is easy to get them. He says they just have to follow him.Lily and Tom are curious. They want candy and toys. They think the stranger is nice. They forget what their mom and dad told them. They told them never to go with strangers. They told them strangers can be bad.Lily and Tom start to follow the stranger. But then they see a dog. The dog is barking. The dog is angry. The dog runs to the stranger. The stranger is scared. He drops his bag and runs away.Lily and Tom look in the bag. They see no candy and no toys. They see rocks and dirt. They see the stranger lied to them. They feel sad and sorry. They remember what their mom and dad told them. They run back to the park. They hug their ball and their kite. They have learned a lesson. They have learned to be careful. They have learned to not trust strangers.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the park with her orange ball. She loved to play with her ball and throw it high in the sky. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing. It was a beautiful day.At the park, Amy saw a small dog. The dog was very cute and friendly. It wagged its tail and ran around, playing with the other kids. The dog saw Amy's orange ball and wanted to play too.Amy threw the ball, and the dog ran to catch it. The dog jumped high, but it could not catch the ball. The ball dropped to the ground, and the dog picked it up with its mouth. The dog brought the ball back to Amy, and they played together all day long. They had so much fun at the park with the orange ball.

Once upon a time there was a red root. It was lying in the sun, baking in the heat all day. Every day, the root would get hotter and hotter until it could take no more heat.One day, a brave little boy spotted the root and knew it needed some help. So he scooped it up and took it to the nearest river. He washed the root in the river and watched as the heat that had built up was washed away.The brave little boy was happy that he had helped the root and knew it was important to help those in need, no matter how small. So he told the root to remember, when things start to get too hot, all you need to do is take a nice cool bath!

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jessie. She was very smart and always eager to learn new things. Her parents were so proud of how intelligent she was.One morning, Jessie's mom asked her to hurry and get ready for school. Jessie was excited to go and see her friends, so she quickly put on her school shoes and ran to the stand.When she arrived at the stand, Jessie was surprised to see that all of her friends were already there. Jessie waved and said, "Hi everyone! I'm here."Everyone shouted, "Hello Jessie!"Jessie was happy to have made it in time and her friends praised her for being so clever and fast. The bus arrived and everyone quickly climbed onboard. Jessie and her friends laughed as they waved good-bye from the windows.The moral of the story is that with a little bit of hurry and intelligence, you can get to where you want to go in time!

Once upon a time, there was a peaceful little town. In this town, there was a band. They loved to play music for everyone. The band had a big drum, a small flute, and a shiny horn. The people in the town liked to dance and sing when the band played.One day, a new boy came to the town. His name was Tim. Tim was very shy, but he loved music. He wanted to make his own music, but he did not know how to play any instruments. Tim went to the band and asked, "Can I join your band?"The band said, "You can join us, but first you need to learn how to play an instrument." Tim was happy and excited. He started to learn how to play the small flute. He practiced every day and got better and better.One day, the band had a big show in the town. Everyone came to listen and dance. Tim was nervous, but he knew he was ready. When it was time for the show, the band started to play. Tim played his small flute, and the music was beautiful. The people in the town clapped and cheered. Tim was so happy that he could make his own music and be a part of the peaceful town's band.

Lily liked to paint. She had many colors and brushes. She painted flowers and trees and animals. She was very good at painting.One day, she went to the park with her mom. She saw some kids playing with a big ball. She wanted to join them, but she was shy. She did not know how to say hello.She sat on a bench and took out her paints. She started to paint the ball and the kids. She used red and blue and yellow and green. She made the ball look like a rainbow.A boy saw her painting. He came over and said, "Hi, I'm Ben. What are you painting?"Lily was scared. She did not say anything. She held her paintbrush tight.Ben smiled. He said, "I like your painting. It's very pretty. Can I paint with you?"Lily looked at him. He had kind eyes and a friendly voice. She nodded. She gave him a brush and a color.They painted together. They painted the sky and the grass and the sun. They had fun. They talked and laughed.Lily felt happy. She was not shy anymore. She made a new friend. She learned that painting was a power. A power to make things beautiful and to make friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little brown dog named Mark. Mark loved to play in the yard. He liked to run and jump, but most of all, he liked to crawl under the big green bush.One sunny day, Mark met a tiny bug under the bush. The bug said, "Hi, I'm Tim! I like to crawl too. Do you want to play with me?" Mark wagged his tail and said, "Yes! Let's crawl and play together!"So, Mark and Tim crawled under the bush and played all day long. They had so much fun and became best friends. From that day on, they always played together and crawled under the big green bush, happy as can be.

One day, a girl named Lily wanted to travel. She put on her bright red hat and went outside. She walked and walked, looking at the pretty flowers and big trees.Lily saw a wallet on the ground. She picked it up and looked inside. There was a picture of a happy family. She wanted to give the wallet back to them.Lily asked her friends, the birds, to help her find the family. They all flew high and saw the family in a park. Lily went to the park and gave the wallet back. The family was so happy and thanked Lily. They all played together in the park and had a fun day.

Once there was a big red bus. The bus loved to go fast. One day, a little boy named Tim saw the bus. He wanted to ride it. Tim asked his mom, "Can I ride the bus, please?"His mom said, "Yes, you can ride the bus. But be careful."Tim was so happy. He got on the bus and sat down. The bus started to move. Tim saw a ball on the floor. He thought it would be fun to kick it. So, he kicked the ball. The ball flew and hit the bus driver. The driver laughed and said, "That was a successful kick, little one!"Tim felt proud and smiled. He knew that he had a fun day on the bus.

Once upon a time, there was a modest cat named Tom. Tom liked to play with his friend, a little bird named Tim. They played all day in the sun.One day, Tom's mom told him to quit playing and help her with some order. Tom did not want to stop playing with Tim, but he knew he had to listen to his mom.Tom tried to help his mom, but he did not know how to do the order. He made a big mess. His mom was sad, and Tom felt bad. The end.

One day, a boy named Tom and a girl named Sue went to play in the park. They saw a big, tidy sandbox. They wanted to play with their toys in the sandbox. Tom had a red truck and Sue had a blue car.Tom said, "Let's have a race with our toys!" Sue thought it was a fun idea. They put their toys at one end of the sandbox and started the race. The red truck and the blue car went very fast. It was a close match!In the end, the red truck won the race. Sue was a little sad, but Tom said, "Let's share my truck and play together!" Sue was happy to share. They played with the truck and the car, and had lots of fun in the tidy sandbox.

Once upon a time there was a lively princess. She loved to explore the kingdom and go on new adventures. One day, she was walking through the woods when she heard a voice call out to her.“Hello, princess!”The princess looked around to see where the voice was coming from. Behind a tree, she saw a small, friendly rabbit.“Hi!” said the princess. “What is your name?”“My name is Rabbit,” said the bunny. “Would you like to come to my special place with me?”The princess was excited. She quickly agreed and followed Rabbit to a magical field filled with wildflowers. As they walked through the field, something amazing happened. Everyone and everything in the kingdom started to laugh and sing!The princess was so surprised. She thanked Rabbit for the wonderful surprise, then headed back to the castle, feeling very lively.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Spot. Spot loved to celebrate with his friends. One day, he went to the store with his best friend, a little boy named Tim.At the store, they saw a big, mean cat. The cat did not like to celebrate. The cat wanted to make trouble for Spot and Tim. The cat took a toy from the store and ran away.Spot and Tim did not want the cat to be mean. They wanted the cat to be playful and celebrate with them. So, they chased the cat and got the toy back. The cat saw how fun it was to be playful and celebrate. From that day on, the cat, Spot, and Tim became good friends and celebrated together.

One day, a little girl named Amy found a big purple bathtub in her yard. She was so happy and excited. She ran to her mom and said, "Mom, look! A big purple bathtub is in our yard!"Her mom came outside and saw the bathtub. She said, "Wow, Amy! That is a big purple bathtub! Let's have some fun with it." They filled the bathtub with water and bubbles. Amy put on her swimsuit and jumped in. She started to splash and play.Suddenly, the bathtub started to move! It began to slide down the yard, faster and faster. Amy was scared at first, but then she started to laugh. "Weee!" she shouted, as the bathtub slid across the grass. Her mom laughed too and said, "Hold on tight, Amy!"The bathtub slid all the way to the park, where Amy's friends were playing. They all saw the purple bathtub slide to a stop. Amy's friends clapped and cheered. They all took turns sliding in the big purple bathtub. It was the most fun day ever!

One day, a fat cat named Tom saw a big chimney. He wanted to climb it and see what was inside. Tom was very curious. He tried to climb the chimney, but he was too fat. He could not fit.A little bird named Sue saw Tom. Sue said, "Tom, why are you trying to climb the chimney? You are too fat to fit." Tom said, "I want to see what is inside." Sue thought for a bit and said, "I can fit. I will go and tell you what I see."Sue flew up and went inside the chimney. Tom waited and waited. Suddenly, Sue came out with a big smile. She said, "Tom, you will not believe it! There is a lot of food inside the chimney!" Tom was very happy. He said, "Let's feed each other all the food we find!"So, Tom and Sue ate and ate until they could not eat anymore. They shared the food and became the best of friends. From that day on, they always fed each other and had many more fun adventures together.

Once there was a wise old fox who lived in a park. The fox liked to run around and explore the park, so he knew every corner of it.One day, he saw a new animal in the park. It was a little rabbit. The fox said, "Welcome to the park, little rabbit!"The little rabbit was scared and didn't know what to do. He hopped away quickly. The fox tried to follow and keep talking to him, but the rabbit didn't want to stay.The fox was confused. Why was the rabbit so scared? He thought and thought, but he could not figure it out. He didn't know what to do.The fox wandered around the park, feeling sad. He looked around until he saw the rabbit again, this time with some other animals. They were laughing and having fun.The fox was happy and ran up to the animals. This time, the rabbit was smiling. The fox said, "Welcome to the park, everyone. Let's have fun together!"The other animals were happy to be welcomed and ran around the park with the fox and the rabbit. From that day forward, the fox and the rabbit were the best of friends.
