They never forgot how wise the fox was for figuring out a way to make peace.

Once upon a time, there was a stubborn goat. The goat did not like to do what others said. One day, the goat met a big dog. The dog said, "Goat, do not go near the big hole!" But the stubborn goat did not listen.The goat went near the big hole. The dog said, "Goat, please listen to me. The big hole is not safe!" But the stubborn goat still did not listen. The goat and the dog began to fight. The dog tried to make the goat listen, but the goat was too stubborn.In the end, the stubborn goat fell into the big hole. The dog was very sad. The goat could not get out of the big hole. The stubborn goat had a bad ending because it did not listen to the dog.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had very long hair. His mom said, "Tim, you need a haircut." Tim was scared. He did not want a haircut. He started to complain.His mom said, "Don't worry, Tim. Be brave. Haircuts are not scary." Tim thought about it. He wanted to be brave. So, he went to the haircut place with his mom.The haircut person was nice. They talked to Tim. "What kind of haircut do you want?" Tim said, "I want to look like a superhero." The haircut person smiled and began to cut Tim's hair. Tim was brave and did not cry. When it was done, Tim looked in the mirror. He looked like a superhero. Tim was happy, and his mom was proud of him for being brave.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Julianne. She was only three years old but she was a very smart girl! She wanted to learn something new and exciting.One day, she asked her daddy, "What is an underground?" Her daddy smiled and said, "An underground is very fast, like a rocket! It travels from one place to another very quickly." Julianne was so excited she grabbed her pen and paper and said, "Can we print one?" Her daddy laughed and said, "No, no, no. We can't print one! But we can use an underground to get to places quickly. Would you like to take an underground ride? It will be lots of fun!" Julianne jumped up and down, "Yes Daddy! Please take me for a ride!" So, Julianne and her daddy went on an adventure and took an underground ride and had lots of fun! Julianne was so excited, she couldn't stop telling her friends all about her journey underground.

Once upon a time, there was a big red barn on a farm. In the barn, there were many animals. The animals were happy and loved to play together. The barn had cows, pigs, and chickens. The farm also included a big green field for the animals to run and play.One day, a little boy named Tim came to the farm. Tim wanted to play with the animals in the barn. But every time he tried to play with them, they ran away. Tim felt frustrated because he just wanted to be friends with the animals.Tim's mom saw that he was frustrated and had an idea. She gave Tim some food to feed the animals. Tim went back to the barn and gave the food to the cows, pigs, and chickens. The animals loved the food and started to play with Tim. Tim was so happy that he could finally play with the animals in the big red barn.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She was a fearful girl who was scared of big words. One day, she went to school and her teacher said they would learn a new word. Sue was scared, but she wanted to be brave.In class, the teacher wrote the word "save" on the board. Sue looked at the word and felt a little better. It was a small word, not a big word. She said the word "save" out loud in class. Sue was happy she could say the new word.Later, Sue went home and saw her cat stuck in a tree. Sue knew she had to save the cat. She was scared, but she remembered the word "save" from school. Sue climbed the tree and saved the cat. She was not fearful anymore. Sue learned that she could do big things, even with small words.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a small smooth stone. This stone was a special triangle shape. It lived with its friends, the round stones, near a clear, blue river.One day, a tiny bird fell from its nest. The triangle stone saw the bird and wanted to protect it. So, it moved close to the bird and made a safe place for it to rest.The bird was very happy and thanked the triangle stone. They became best friends and played together every day. The triangle stone always protected the bird, and they lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy named Tim saw a big aeroplane in the sky. He wanted to play with the aeroplane. So, he ran to his toy box and found a small toy aeroplane. Tim thought his toy aeroplane could match the big one in the sky.Tim went outside with his toy aeroplane. He saw his friend, Sam, playing with a ball. Tim said, "Look, Sam! I have a toy aeroplane. It can match the big one in the sky." Sam looked at the toy and said, "I am sorry, Tim. I don't think it can match the big one."Tim did not listen to Sam. He threw his toy aeroplane high in the air. He hoped it would fly like the big aeroplane. But the toy aeroplane fell down and broke into pieces. Tim felt very sorry and sad. His toy aeroplane could not match the big one in the sky, and now it was broken.

Once upon a time, there was a cat named Tom. Tom was a very good cat. He liked to play with his ball. One day, Tom saw his ball was left in a tight spot. He wanted to get it back.Tom tried to act like a big cat. He thought big cats can get the ball. He jumped and tried to get the ball. But the ball was still in the tight spot. Tom was sad.Tom tried again and again. He acted like a big cat, but he could not get the ball. Tom was very sad. He did not get his ball back. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big factory. The factory made toys for kids. In the factory, there was a man named Tom. Tom was an incredible worker. He could balance many toys in his hands.One day, a little boy named Timmy came to the factory. Timmy saw Tom and said, "Wow! You can hold many toys!" Tom smiled and said, "Yes, I can balance them well!"Timmy wanted to learn how to balance toys like Tom. Tom taught Timmy how to hold and balance the toys. Timmy was so happy. They became good friends and played with the toys together. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a little monkey named Momo. Momo had a long, curly tail that he loved to swing from tree to tree with. One day, Momo was playing with his friends, when his tail got stuck in a tree branch. "Oh no!" he cried.A silly bird named Bree heard Momo's cry and flew down to help. "Don't worry, Momo," said Bree, "I will help you get your tail out!" Bree pulled and pulled, but Momo's tail was still stuck. Momo started to feel sad and said, "I want to quit trying. My tail will be stuck forever."Bree didn't want Momo to quit, so she thought of a new plan. "I have an idea," she said, "Let's ask our big friend, Ellie the elephant, for help!" So, Bree and Momo went to find Ellie. When they found her, they told her about Momo's stuck tail.Ellie the elephant was very strong. She used her long trunk to gently pull Momo's tail free from the tree branch. Momo was so happy that he could swing and play again. He thanked Bree and Ellie for their help, and they all played together for the rest of the day.From that day on, Momo, Bree, and Ellie became the best of friends. They learned that no problem was too big when they worked together. And they all agreed that Momo's tail was not so silly after all.

One day, a little girl named Amy was playing with her blocks. She made a big stack with them. She was very proud of her stack, but she thought it looked boring. So, she called her friend, Tom, to come and help her make the stack more fun.Tom came over and looked at the stack. He said, "Let's add some colors to the stack!" So, they found some colorful blocks and put them on the stack. Now, the stack was not boring anymore.Amy and Tom played with the stack all day. They had so much fun. They called their friends to come and see their big, colorful stack. All the friends loved the stack and played together. In the end, they all said, "This is the best stack ever!"

Once upon a time there lived an old lady who loved to cook delicious soups. Every day she said to her grandchild, "Let's try to imagine something new!"One morning, the grandchild suggested that they try to make a pink soup.The old lady smiled. "That's a great idea! We can mix different fruits like strawberry, raspberry and banana."The old lady and the grandchild went to the market to buy the ingredients for the pink soup. When they returned, the old lady showed her grandchild how to chop the fruits and mix them in the pot.Once the soup was finished, the grandchild's eyes lit up. "It looks so yummy," he said.The old lady laughed. "Let's try it then!"They both took a spoonful of the pink soup, and it was the most delicious soup they'd ever tasted.The grandchild said, "Can we make this soup again?"The old lady smiled, "Of course! We can imagine even more amazing soups together."

One day, a shy mole was playing in the dirt. He liked to add more and more dirt to his big hill. He was happy to make his hill grow. The shy mole had a lot of fun.But one day, something unexpected happened. A big bird came down and started to add dirt to the mole's hill too. The shy mole was very surprised. He did not know what to do.Then, the big bird said, "I want to be your friend!" The shy mole was so happy. They both added dirt to the hill together. The shy mole was not shy anymore. They were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a fast rabbit who lived in a big forest. He had many friends, like the slow turtle and the happy bird. They liked to play and have fun together. But one day, they heard about a war between the big animals and the small animals.The fast rabbit did not understand why there was a war. He thought everyone should be friends and play together. So, he had an idea. He went to the big animals and talked to them. Then, he went to the small animals and talked to them too.In the end, the fast rabbit helped all the animals understand that they could be friends and play together. The war stopped, and everyone in the forest was happy again. They all thanked the fast rabbit for helping them understand and making their home a happy place.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to the park with her mom. Mia saw a big tree with a lot of pears on it. She wanted to eat one, so she asked her mom, "Can I have a pear, please?" Her mom said, "Yes, you can have one, but be careful not to drop it."Mia picked the biggest pear she could find. She was so happy, she started to clap her hands. But as she clapped, the pear slipped from her hand and fell on the ground. Mia felt embarrassed and sad that she dropped her pear.Just then, a friendly squirrel came running over. The squirrel picked up the pear and gave it back to Mia. Mia was so surprised and happy! She thanked the squirrel and shared her pear with her new friend. From that day on, Mia and the squirrel would play in the park and share pears together.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Johnny. One day he went to the store with his mommy. He asked her for an avocado. "What's an avocado?", his mommy asked him. "It's a fruit, and it's really good to eat", Johnny said. His mommy smiled, "Ok, let's get an avocado". Johnny was so excited. When they got home, his mommy cut the avocado in half and gave some to Johnny. Johnny took a bite and he was amazed by how sweet it was. He smiled and said, "Yummy, mommy, this avocado is so sweet!" His mommy smiled and gave him a hug. From then on, every time Johnny and his mommy went to the store, they always picked up an avocado. Johnny was so happy to eat the sweet fruit.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a magic basket that could shrink things. Sue loved to play with the basket and make her toys small. One day, she saw a big, slow snail in her garden. She thought it would be fun to make the snail small too.Sue used her magic basket to shrink the slow snail. The snail became very, very small. Sue was happy and showed it to her mom. Her mom told her that it was not nice to shrink the snail. The snail had a family and friends too. Sue felt bad for what she did.Sue used her magic basket to make the slow snail big again. The snail was happy to be back with its family and friends. Sue learned that it was not nice to play with others without asking. She promised to be kind and never use her magic basket to shrink anyone again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to design things with his toy blocks. One day, he made a big tower with his blocks. He was very happy with his tower. But he wanted the tower to light up, like a real building. So he asked his mom for help.His mom said, "We need a battery to make it light up." Tim was excited. He went to find a battery with his mom. They looked in the kitchen, and they looked in the living room. But they could not find a battery. Tim started to feel angry. He really wanted his tower to light up.Then, Tim remembered he had a flashlight in his room. He ran to his room and found the flashlight. Inside the flashlight, there was a battery! Tim and his mom put the battery in the tower. The tower lit up, and it was very beautiful. Tim was not angry anymore. He was very happy, and he and his mom played with the tower all day.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia liked to write. She used a pen and paper to write pretty words. One day, she saw something unknown in the corner of her room. It was a cobweb. Mia had never seen a cobweb before.Mia wanted to show her mom the unknown cobweb. She took her mom's hand and led her to the corner of the room. Her mom saw the cobweb too. She told Mia that a small spider made the cobweb. Mia thought the spider must be good at making things, just like she was good at writing.Mia's mom cleaned the cobweb away. Mia went back to her table to write. She wrote about the unknown cobweb and the spider who made it. She was happy to share her story with her mom and dad. They all smiled and were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to play with her toy violin. Lucy was very persistent. She played her violin every day.One day, Lucy asked her mom, "Can I play my violin outside?" Her mom said, "I permit you to play outside, but don't go too far." Lucy was happy and took her violin to the front yard. She played her violin and danced under the sun.As Lucy played, a little boy named Tom heard her music. He walked up to Lucy and said, "I like your violin. Can I play too?" Lucy smiled and said, "Yes, you can play with me." So, Tom and Lucy played their violins together and had lots of fun. They became best friends and played music every day.

Sara and Ben are twins. They like to play in the park. They like to slide on the big slide. They go up the steps and down the slide. Whee!One day, they find a shiny penny on the ground. Sara picks it up and shows it to Ben. "Look, Ben, a penny!" she says. "Can we buy something with it?"Ben shakes his head. "No, Sara, a penny is not enough. We need more pennies to buy something. Maybe we can save it for later."Sara nods. She puts the penny in her pocket. She and Ben go back to the slide. They slide again and again. They have fun.But then, they hear a loud noise. It is a big dog. It is barking and running towards them. Sara and Ben are scared. They run away from the slide. They hide behind a bench. They are very quiet.The dog stops at the slide. It sniffs around. It sees the penny on the ground. It picks it up with its mouth. It runs away with the penny.Sara and Ben peek from behind the bench. They see the dog and the penny. They are sad. They lost their penny."Bye, penny," Sara says."Bye, penny," Ben says.They hug each other. They are still scared of the dog. They decide to go home. They hope to find another penny someday.

One day, a thin cat found a cube in the park. The cat was very happy. It played with the cube all day. The cat had a friend, a dog. The cat wanted to invite the dog to play with the cube too.The cat said to the dog, "Come play with me and my cube!" The dog was excited and ran to the cat. They played with the cube together. They took turns rolling the cube and chasing it.After playing for a long time, the cat and the dog were tired. They sat under a tree and shared a snack. The cat and the dog were happy they could play with the cube together. They promised to invite each other to play again soon.

It was a wild day. Zoey and her dad decided to go outside to paint the creek. Zoey was so excited she ran around looking for the perfect spot to start painting. Her dad watched with a smile.At last, Zoey found the best spot in the creek. She told her dad she was ready to start painting. He helped her set up, and then said goodbye for a moment as he went to get the paints.Zoey waited and waited and then, finally, her dad returned with the paints! Zoey yelled, "Let's paint!" and they began. With each brush, the creek came alive in color.The creek glowed with all the hues of color. Zoey and her dad beamed with pride at their amazing work. The wild creek was beautiful and Zoey knew she'd never forget it's beauty.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Tom. Tom liked to sleep all day and play all night. One day, Tom saw a red ball of thread. He wanted to play with it.Tom went to his friend, Sam the dog. Tom said, "Sam, can you help me get the red thread? It is stuck in a tree." Sam was a good friend and wanted to help. They tried to get the thread, but it was too high. They needed to fix a plan.Then, they saw a big bird named Sue. Sue could fly high. Tom asked, "Sue, can you help us get the red thread?" Sue said, "Yes, I can help." But when Sue went to get the thread, it turned into a butterfly! The butterfly flew away, and Tom, Sam, and Sue laughed. They played together and had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a nice bedroom with a big bed, a toy box, and pretty pictures on the walls. Lily loved her bedroom very much.One day, Lily was playing in her bedroom with her toys. She started to feel angry because her toy car was not working. Lily began to complain, "My toy car is not moving! I want it to go fast!" She started to cry.Mommy heard Lily complain and came to her bedroom. Mommy saw the angry little girl and said, "Don't worry, Lily. I will help you fix your toy car." Mommy fixed the toy car, and Lily was happy again. She played in her bedroom all day, and her toy car went very fast.

Little Sally clapped her hands, feeling very happy. She had a pink string in one hand and a purple one in the other. She smiled when she saw her mommy coming towards her. "Mama, can you help me tie these strings together?" asked Sally."Yes sure," said Mama. She took the strings from Sally and quickly tied them together. "But why did you want to tie the strings," asked Mama with a serious voice.Sally smiled and said in a very serious tone, "I'm going to try to fly, mama!" Mama shook her head and said, "No, no, no. Flying is too dangerous. But you can have fun clapping with the strings." So, Sally and her mama clapped the strings together, laughing and being silly until they both got tired and went inside.

Once upon a time, there was a famous crocodile. He lived by a river with many fish and birds. Every morning he would shake his tail and smile at everyone. He was very happy. One day, a man noticed the famous crocodile. He brought lots of friends to see the crocodile and they all watched the crocodile shake. They were all amazed by how the crocodile moved. The crocodile was very proud.The crocodile enjoyed the attention and kept shaking its tail. Soon, many more people started coming to see the famous crocodile every day. They marveled at its powerful tail, which never seemed to stop shaking. The crocodile was so happy! The people kept coming and the crocodile kept shaking. And they all enjoyed watching the famous crocodile in action. It really was a beautiful sight to behold.

One day, a gentle dog named Max went for a walk. Max was very happy. He saw a big lab. Max went inside the lab. He saw many things he did not know. Max started to wonder what was in the lab.In the lab, Max saw a big cat. The cat was not nice. The cat said, "This is my lab. You cannot be here." Max was sad. He wanted to be friends with the cat. Max tried to be nice to the cat. But the cat did not want to be friends.Max had an idea. He found a toy in the lab. Max gave the toy to the cat. The cat liked the toy. The cat said, "Thank you, Max." Max and the cat became friends. They played with the toy in the lab. Max was happy. The cat was happy too.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily liked to play in the dirt. One day, she found a small box. She thought it was important. So, she decided to bury it in the dirt.Lily's friend, Max, came to play. Max saw the dirt pile and asked, "What is that?" Lily said, "I buried an important box." Max wanted to see the box, so they dug it up together.When they opened the box, they found a note. The note said, "Surprise! You found the treasure!" Inside the box were shiny stickers. Lily and Max were so happy. They shared the stickers and played all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to create things with her hands. She liked to make things out of paper, clay, and even food! One day, Sue had an idea. She wanted to make a special snack for her mommy and daddy.Sue found a tray in the kitchen. The tray was dull and not very pretty. But Sue knew she could make it look nice with her special snack. She put her favorite fruits on the tray. There were red apples, yellow bananas, and green grapes. The tray looked so colorful and happy now!Sue carried the tray to mommy and daddy. They were so surprised and happy to see the beautiful snack Sue made for them. They all sat down and enjoyed the fruits together. Sue felt proud that she could create something so nice for her family.

Once upon a time, in a big, green forest, there lived a small animal named Leo. Leo loved to play with his friends in the sun. The sun would shine so bright and make Leo very happy. One day, Leo found a big red fruit. He thought it was pretty and wanted to share it with his friends.Leo showed the big red fruit to his friends, and they all wanted to taste it. They didn't know that the fruit was spicy. Leo's friend, Mia the bird, took a tiny bite of the fruit. Mia's face turned red, and she started to hop around. Leo and his friends laughed, and they knew that something fun was going to happen.One by one, Leo's friends took turns tasting the spicy fruit. Each time, they would make a funny face and dance around. They all laughed and played in the sun, enjoying the spicy surprise. The sun continued to shine, and the animals had a great day together. And from that day on, whenever they found a spicy fruit, they would remember the fun they had and smile.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a green frog. The green frog liked to spoil things. One day, a man and a woman were having a marriage. They were very happy.The green frog saw the marriage and wanted to spoil it. He jumped into the cake and made a big mess. The man and the woman looked at the cake and were sad.But then, the man said, "Let's dance!" So, they danced and laughed. The green frog saw that they were still happy. He learned that he could not spoil their love. The green frog said, "I am sorry." The man and the woman forgave the green frog, and they all became friends.

Once upon a time, there was an adorable little girl called Lily. She had a dream and searched everywhere for something special. One day, Lily saw a little bird chirping in a tree and she knew this was the right thing. She asked the bird where it was going and the bird replied “I’m searching for a dream and if you come with me, I’ll show you the way too”.Lily gladly accepted and started following the bird. On their journey, they met a fox and the fox said “I will take you to where you need to go. Just listen to me and you will find your dream.” As Lily nodded eagerly, she felt like something amazing was about to happen.Finally, after a long search, the trio reached a big castle. As soon as Lily stepped inside, she knew it was what she was looking for. The dream she had been hoping for had come true! She embraced the bird and fox in a big hug and thanked them for all their help. Lily was so grateful that she promised to come and visit them again soon. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Ducky. Ducky loved to play in the water. One sunny day, Ducky went to the pond to bathe. The pond was deep, but Ducky was not scared. He liked to swim and splash in the water.As Ducky was playing, he saw a big grape on the ground near the pond. "Yummy!" said Ducky, "I like grapes!" He waddled out of the pond and picked up the grape with his beak. Ducky was very happy.Just then, Ducky's friend, Bunny, hopped over. "Hi, Ducky!" said Bunny. "What do you have there?" Ducky showed Bunny the grape. "I found a grape! Do you want to share it with me?" Bunny smiled and said, "Yes, please!" So, Ducky and Bunny shared the grape and had a fun day playing together by the deep pond.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a curious little girl named True. True loved to explore and find new things. She had a big yard with many trees and flowers. One day, her mommy told her that there was a surprise in the yard, but she had to promise not to tell anyone.True was very excited and promised her mommy that she would not tell. She went outside and started to look for the surprise. She looked behind the trees, under the flowers, and even in the bushes. True was sure that she would find the surprise soon.As she was looking, she saw a small box under a big tree. True opened the box and found a beautiful toy inside. She knew this was the surprise her mommy was talking about. True was so happy and remembered her promise to her mommy. She played with her new toy all day and kept her promise, never telling anyone about the surprise.

Once upon a time, there was a farmer. He was very powerful. He could stand all day and work on his farm. He had many animals like cows, pigs, and chickens.One day, the farmer saw a big rock in his field. He wanted to move it. He tried to push it, but it was too heavy. So, he asked his animals to help him. The cows, pigs, and chickens all came to help the powerful farmer.Together, they pushed and pushed the big rock. The powerful farmer was happy. The cows, pigs, and chickens were happy too. They all stood together and looked at their work. The big rock was now out of the field, and they could all play and work there. The farmer and his animals were very happy, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy had very long hair. She liked to comb her hair every day. One day, she lost her comb. Lucy was sad. She had to find her comb.Lucy started to think. She looked under her bed. She looked in the kitchen. She looked in the garden. There, she saw a weak, little bird with her comb. The bird was using the comb to make a nest. Lucy felt happy that the bird found a good use for her comb.Lucy decided to let the bird keep the comb. She learned that sometimes, it is good to share things with others who need them more. Lucy felt happy and proud. She told her friends and family about the bird and her comb. They all learned that sharing can bring happiness to everyone.

Sara liked to play with her toys in her room. She had many toys, but her favorite was a clock. The clock had a face with two hands and numbers. Sara liked to move the hands and make the clock say different times. She also liked to pretend that the clock was her friend and talk to it.One day, her brother Tom came into her room. He saw the clock and wanted to play with it too. He said, "Give me the clock, Sara. I want to see it."Sara did not want to give him the clock. She said, "No, Tom. This is my clock. You have your own toys. Go away."Tom did not listen. He tried to grab the clock from Sara. Sara held on to the clock and shouted, "Stop it, Tom. You are being mean. Leave me alone."They pulled and pushed the clock until it fell on the floor. The clock broke into pieces. Sara and Tom were both shocked and sad. They heard their mom coming up the stairs. She had told them to keep their room tidy and not to fight.Sara and Tom knew they were in trouble. They quickly tried to hide the broken clock under the bed. They hoped their mom would not see it. They pretended to be nice to each other and smiled at their mom. But their mom was not fooled. She saw the mess on the floor and the clock under the bed. She said, "What have you done, Sara and Tom? You have broken the clock. That was a gift from your grandma. How could you be so careless and rude?"Sara and Tom felt sorry and ashamed. They said, "We are sorry, mom. We were playing and we had a fight. We did not mean to break the clock. We love the clock and we love grandma."Their mom was angry and disappointed. She said, "You need to learn to share

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big billboard. The billboard was charming and had a picture of a happy family. The family was smiling and having fun. The people in the town liked to look at the billboard because it made them feel happy.One day, a naughty boy named Tim wanted to disturb the charming billboard. He threw stones at it and made the picture look bad. The people in the town were sad because they could not look at the happy family anymore.A wise old man saw what Tim had done and told him that it was not nice to disturb things that make others happy. Tim felt bad and said sorry. He helped to fix the charming billboard so the people in the town could be happy again. The moral of the story is that we should not disturb things that make others happy.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a girl named Sue. Sue loved to dress up. She had many fun clothes for her body. She was very creative.One day, Sue found a big box. She knew it was special. Sue thought, "I will find something fun inside." She could not wait to open it. She felt happy and excited.When Sue opened the box, she found the most amazing dress. It was so pretty! She put it on her body and danced around. Sue knew the box was special. She was right! Sue felt so creative and had the best day ever.

Once upon a time, in a beautiful forest, there lived a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to wash her hands in the clear stream that ran through the forest. One sunny day, while washing her hands, she met a friendly frog named Fred."Hi, I'm Fred," said the frog. "I like to jump and play in the forest.""Hi, Fred! I'm Lily. I like to wash my hands in the stream," Lily replied.Fred and Lily played together all day. They laughed and jumped, taking big breaths with their lungs. As the sun began to set, they said goodbye and promised to meet again at the stream. Every day, Lily and Fred would play in the beautiful forest, becoming the best of friends.

Anna and Ben are twins. They share a bedroom. They like to play with their toys and books. But sometimes they fight over them.One day, Anna wants to play with the big red truck. But Ben has it. He says, "No, it is mine. You play with the doll."Anna says, "No, I want the truck. You had it yesterday. Give it to me."They pull and tug on the truck. They are both angry. They do not listen to each other.Then, Ben pushes Anna. Anna falls on the floor. She cries. She hurts her knee.Mom hears the noise. She is alert. She runs to the bedroom. She sees Anna and Ben. She is not happy.She says, "What is going on here? Why are you pushing and crying? You need to share and be kind."She helps Anna up. She hugs her. She puts a band-aid on her knee. She says, "I'm sorry you got hurt, Anna. Ben, you should not push your sister. That is not nice. You need to say sorry."Ben feels bad. He says, "I'm sorry, Anna. I was wrong. Do you want to play with the truck?"Anna says, "It's okay, Ben. I forgive you. Yes, I want to play with the truck. But we can take turns. You can play with the doll, too."Mom smiles. She says, "That's better. I'm glad you are making up. Now, play nicely and have fun."She leaves the bedroom. Anna and Ben hug. They play with the truck and the doll. They are happy. They are friends.

Sammy liked to stretch. Whenever he had a minute to spare, he would sit down on the floor in the living room and stretch his arms, legs, and back. His mom always smiled and said, "Good stretching, Sammy!"On his third birthday, Sammy's mom and dad presented him with a special gift: a robot! He was so excited to see it and quickly opened the box. Inside, the robot was made of plastic and had a big, friendly smile.Sammy gave the robot a hug and it hugged him back. Its arms were soft and flexible, and Sammy felt very comfortable when it was around. They became good friends and went for long walks together. At the park, Sammy would stretch with his robot. They both put their arms straight out in the air and challenged each other to see how far they could go. It was always a fun way to end the day.

There were two best friends, Bonnie and Tom, who loved playing with their blocks. Bonnie and Tom were playing one day when Tom noticed something strange in the park. He saw a big tall man with a strange hat and he was scared. "Who is that?" asked Tom anxiously.Bonnie looked at the man and said, "I don't know, let's get out of here." They quickly ran away from the park and back to Bonnie's home. Tom was still scared and anxiously asked Bonnie, "What happened to him?""I don't know," Bonnie said, "but he scared me too. Let's not go to the park for a while." Bonnie and Tom decided to stay in Bonnie's house and play with their blocks. They laughed and enjoyed playing together so much that they soon forgot about the strange man in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly bear named Bobo. Bobo loved to eat honey. Every day, he would wake up and look for honey in the big forest.One day, Bobo met a little bee named Buzz. Buzz said, "Hello, I make honey. Do you want some?" Bobo was very happy and said, "Yes, please! I love honey."Buzz took Bobo to his hive, where all the bees were making honey. Bobo tasted the honey and it was the best honey he had ever eaten. From that day on, Bobo and Buzz were best friends, and they always shared honey together.

Once upon a time, there was a man. This man was very reliable. He was always there to help his friends. One day, he saw a little bird. The bird was sad. The man asked, "Why are you sad, little bird?"The bird said, "I lost my nest. I don't know where it is." The man wanted to help the bird. He said, "Don't worry, little bird. I will help you find your nest."They looked and looked. At last, they found the nest. The bird was happy. The man was happy too. They became good friends.The bird said, "Thank you, man. You are a good friend. I value your help." The man smiled and said, "You're welcome, little bird."The moral of the story is: always help others and be reliable. Friends value friends who are there for them.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little bird. He loved to sing all day long, but he always had to look for food. One day, he found a strange looking spot on the ground. It was a pool of fuel. The clever little bird had an idea! He decided to use the fuel to fly away! He put a twig in the fuel, and sang a song as loud as he could. All at once, the twig burst into flames! He was so excited! But even though he was now able to fly through the sky, he still had to make sure he always had enough fuel to fly back down! The clever little bird had thought of everything!

Once upon a time, there was a little red engine. The engine was very good at guessing things. It lived in a small town with many friends. They all liked to play a game called "Guess the Thing." The engine always won the game because it was so good at guessing.One day, the weather was very cold and bitter. The little red engine and its friends were playing "Guess the Thing" inside a warm house. Suddenly, there was a loud noise outside. Everyone was scared. The engine guessed that it was a big monster and they all needed to hide. But, it was not a monster. It was a big snowball that had rolled down the hill and hit the house.The little red engine and its friends went outside to see the big snowball. They all laughed and played in the snow. The engine learned that sometimes it is better to not guess and just wait to see what happens. The friends had a great day playing in the snow and they all learned the importance of not jumping to conclusions.

One day, a little girl named Mia and her dog, Max, went on a journey. They walked and walked. The sun was very hot. Mia started to feel tired and thirsty. She saw a big tree and thought, "Maybe there is something to drink there."As they got closer to the tree, Mia saw a small, sour fruit hanging from a branch. She picked it and took a bite. "Yuck!" she said, making a funny face. Max barked and wagged his tail, as if he knew something good was coming.Mia and Max continued their journey until they found a small, cold river. They both drank the cold water and felt much better. Mia looked at Max and said, "I'm glad we found this river, Max!" Max barked happily in agreement.As the sun started to set, the air became cooler. Mia and Max began to shiver. They knew it was time to go home. They walked back, remembering their journey and the sour fruit. When they got home, they were happy to be warm and cozy again.Mia hugged Max and whispered, "Today was a fun journey, but I'm glad we're home now." Max wagged his tail and snuggled close, happy to be home too.

Anna and Ben were best friends. They liked to play in the park every day. They admired the big slide, but they were afraid to go on it. It was too high and too fast.One day, a new boy came to the park. His name was Tom. He saw the big slide and ran to it. He climbed up and slid down. He laughed and said, "That was fun! You should try it!"Anna and Ben watched him. They wanted to be brave like him. They decided to go on the slide too. They held hands and climbed up. They looked down and felt scared. But they did not want to show it. They smiled at each other and said, "Ready?"They pushed themselves and slid down. But they slid too fast and lost their balance. They fell off the slide and hit the ground. They cried and felt pain. They had bruises and scratches. They wished they had not gone on the slide.Tom saw them and laughed. He said, "You are silly and weak! You can't handle the big slide! You should go back to the baby slide!"Anna and Ben felt sad and angry. They did not like Tom. He was mean and rude. They did not want to play with him. They wanted to go home. They learned that being brave is not always good. Sometimes, being careful is better.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to listen to her mom tell stories. One day, her mom told her about an unusual event in the park.In the park, there were many animals. A big dog, a small cat, and a funny bird all lived there. The unusual event was a race between the animals. The dog, the cat, and the bird all wanted to see who was the fastest.The race began, and the dog ran fast, the cat ran faster, but the funny bird flew the fastest of all. The bird won the race and everyone was happy. Lily loved the story and couldn't wait to go to the park to see the animals.

One day, a young boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. They needed to buy some food and a bottle of wine for a party. Tim was very excited because he loved parties.At the store, Tim saw a big red ball. He asked his mom, "Can I have the ball, please?" His mom said, "Yes, you can have the ball, but only if you help me find the wine." Tim agreed and started to look for the wine with his mom.They found the wine and went to the checkout. The cashier saw the ball and said, "You must be excited to play with that ball!" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, I am!" They paid for the food and the wine, and went home to get ready for the party. Tim couldn't wait to have fun with his new ball.

Once upon a time there was a giant who had a big, long mustache. He leaned against a tree and smiled at everyone who passed by. His smile was very big and people always thought he was nice.The giant loved children and often gave them everything they wanted. Everyone said he was very spoiled, but the giant didn't care. He wanted to make the kids happy.One day, the giant saw a little girl. She was only three years old and she was looking sad. The giant smiled at the little girl and said, "Do you want something special?" The little girl nodded her head and said, "Yes!"So the giant reached into his pocket and pulled out a candy. He said, "Here, this is for you." The little girl thanked the giant and smiled. She hopped away with the candy in one hand and leaned against the tree.The giant watched the little girl as she enjoyed her sweet treat and smiled. He was glad that he had made her happy. With one last wave, the giant said goodbye to the little girl and continued on his way.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Max. Max loved to play in the park with his friends. One sunny day, Max went to the park with his favorite toy, a red ball.In the park, Max saw a water spray. He ran to the spray and jumped in it. Max was very happy and wet. He liked the cool water on his fur. Max's friends joined him, and they all played in the spray together.After playing in the water, Max's mom came to take him home. She had a soft wrap to dry Max off. Max loved the soft wrap. It made him feel warm and cozy. Max went home, had a big dinner, and fell asleep dreaming of his fun day at the park.

Sara and Tom were twins who liked to play together. One day, they found a big box in the garage. They decided to make it into a house. They cut out windows and a door, and drew pictures on the walls. They put a blanket inside and some toys. They were very happy with their house.But soon they started to argue. Sara wanted to play dance in the house, but Tom wanted to play cars. They both wanted the blanket for themselves. They shouted and pulled and pushed. The house began to fall apart."Stop it!" said Mom, who heard the noise. "You are ruining your house and your fun. Why can't you settle and share?"Sara and Tom looked at each other. They felt sorry for being mean. They said sorry to each other and to Mom. They decided to take turns playing dance and cars. They fixed their house and put the blanket in the middle. They hugged and smiled.Mom was proud of them. She said, "That's better. You are good twins. You know how to settle and share. That's how you make a happy house and a happy family." She gave them a kiss and a cookie.Sara and Tom learned a lesson. They learned that being lazy and selfish is not good. They learned that being kind and generous is better. They learned that settling and sharing is the best way to play. They had a lot of fun in their house. They played dance and cars and many other games. They were happy twins.

One day, a little girl named Lucy was very excited. She wanted to make a yummy waffle. She asked her mom to help her. Her mom said, "Yes, let's make a waffle together!"Lucy and her mom went to the kitchen. They put flour, eggs, and milk in a big bowl. They mixed it all up. The mix was ready to go in the waffle maker. Lucy was so happy she clapped her hands.When the waffle was complete, Lucy and her mom put it on a plate. They added butter and sweet syrup. Lucy took a big bite and smiled. She loved the waffle she made with her mom. They had a great day together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily had a big, red coat. She loved her coat very much. It kept her warm when it was cold outside.One day, Lily went to the park with her coat. She saw a little bird. The bird was trying to fly but it could not. Lily felt sad for the bird. She wanted to help the bird fly.Lily had an idea. She whispered to the bird, "I will help you fly." She put the bird on her coat and ran very fast. The bird felt the wind and started to fly. The bird was successful! It could fly now.Lily was very happy. She said, "Goodbye, bird!" The bird flew away and Lily went home. She knew she had done a good thing.

Lily and Tom were playing in the park. They saw a big tree with red fruits. Lily wanted to try one. She said to Tom, "Let's get a fruit. They look yummy."Tom was nervous. He said, "No, Lily. We don't know what they are. They might be bad for us. Mom said not to eat things we don't know."But Lily did not listen. She ran to the tree and climbed up. She reached for a fruit and picked it. She brought it down and smiled. She said, "Look, Tom. It's so pretty. I'm going to eat it."Tom shook his head. He said, "Don't do it, Lily. Please. It might make you sick. Let's go home and ask Mom."But Lily did not listen. She bit the fruit and put it in her mouth. She made a face. It was sour and bitter. She spat it out and threw it away. She said, "Yuck. This is not yummy. This is nasty."Then she felt a pain in her tummy. She clutched it and cried. She said, "Tom, help me. It hurts. It hurts so much."Tom was scared. He ran to her and hugged her. He said, "Lily, I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'll get help. Don't worry."But it was too late. The fruit was poison. Lily fell to the ground and did not move. She did not breathe. She was gone. Tom was alone. He screamed and cried. He wished he could go back and stop Lily. But he could not. He had lost his sister. He was sad. He was sad forever.

Once upon a time there was a bird who wanted to find a home. She looked high and low, but could not find a nice nest. She was feeling embarrassed and sad.One bright, sunny day, she saw something that made her very happy. A thoughtful boy had build her a new nest for her to live in! The bird was so excited and thanked the boy for his kindness.The bird and the boy became good friends. Each day he would come to check on the nest, and they would spend time playing together. Whenever other animals teased her, the bird felt safe knowing that the boy was there to look out for her.The bird and the boy were soon best friends and they were always very happy together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very adventurous. He loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Tim found a small green mint in his pocket. He was very happy because he loved the taste of mint.Tim and his friends decided to play a game. They would take turns hiding the mint, and the others would try to find it. Tim hid the mint first, and his friends looked for it. They looked and looked, but they could not find it. They started to complain.Then, something unexpected happened. A small bird flew down and picked up the mint with its beak. The bird flew away with the mint. Tim and his friends were surprised, but they laughed. Now they had a new game: to find the bird and get the mint back.

Once upon a time, in a big town, there was a boy named Tim. He loved to play with his toy cars. One day, Tim felt a pinch in his tummy. His mom took him to the doctor. The doctor said that Tim needed an operation to make him feel fine again.The day of the operation came. Tim was scared, but his mom said it would be fine. The doctor gave Tim a toy car to hold. Tim felt better and was ready for the operation. But then, something unexpected happened.The doctor found that Tim did not need the operation after all. The pinch in his tummy was just from eating too many cookies! Tim was happy and felt fine. He went home with his mom and played with his toy cars, but he didn't eat too many cookies anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a big dragon. The dragon had a hard skin. It was very strong. The dragon lived in a cave near a small town.One day, a little boy named Tom went to watch the dragon. He wanted to see what the dragon did all day. Tom hid behind a tree and watched the dragon play with stones and fly in the sky.Tom liked to watch the dragon every day. They became friends. The dragon would show Tom how to fly high and play with the hard stones. Tom and the dragon were very happy. They played together every day and had lots of fun.

One day, a brown dog named Max went to the kitchen. He saw the fridge and wanted to get a snack. He tried to open the fridge, but he could not. Max was sad.Max's friend, a cat named Lily, came into the kitchen. She saw Max and asked, "Why are you sad, Max?" Max said, "I want a snack from the fridge, but I can't open it."Lily had an idea. She said, "Let's ask Mom to help us!" They went to Mom and told her about the fridge. Mom opened the fridge for them. She took out snacks that include a bone for Max and a fish for Lily. Max and Lily were happy and ate their snacks. They thanked Mom and went to play outside.

Once upon a time, there was a little red ball. The ball was very happy and loved to play with its friends. One day, it saw a big, sharp rock. The ball wanted to play with the rock, but it was scared.The sky was getting dark and wet. Rain started to fall. The little red ball was sad because it could not play outside anymore. It rolled closer to the sharp rock, wanting to play with it, even though it was scared.As the rain fell harder, the ball rolled too close to the sharp rock. The rock poked the little red ball, and it became broken. The little red ball could not play with its friends anymore. The ball was very sad, and so were its friends. And they all missed playing together.

Once upon a time, there was an ostrich named Ollie. Ollie was a big bird with long legs. He lived in a place with many trees and grass. One day, Ollie met a little boy named Tim. Tim was sad because his toy car was broken. Ollie wanted to help Tim.Ollie said to Tim, "Let's fix your toy car!" Tim was happy that Ollie wanted to help. They worked together to fix the car. Ollie used his beak to hold the pieces, and Tim put them back in place. Soon, the toy car was fixed and working again.Tim was very thankful to Ollie for helping him. He said, "Thank you, Ollie! You're not ignorant at all. You're a very smart ostrich!" Ollie and Tim became best friends, and they played together every day. And from that day on, Ollie knew that he could help his friends, no matter how big or small the problem was.

Once upon a time, there was a red ball. It was a very pretty ball. The red ball had a friend who was a black cat. They liked to play together every day. They played in the sun and had lots of fun.One day, the red ball and the black cat saw a man. The man wanted to sell ice cream. The red ball and the black cat wanted some ice cream too. They asked the man if they could have some ice cream. The man said yes and gave them some ice cream.The red ball and the black cat were very happy. They ate their ice cream and played some more. They played until the sun went down. Then, the red ball and the black cat went home. They knew they would play together again the next day.

One day, a little girl named Sue was in her yard. She saw a small bird with an open beak. The bird looked very hungry. Sue wanted to help the bird.Sue went to her mom and said, "Mom, please, can I have a prune for the bird?" Her mom gave her a prune. Sue took the prune to the bird. The bird was happy and ate the prune.But then, a big cat came. The cat wanted to catch the bird. Sue was scared. The bird was scared too. The cat jumped to catch the bird, but something unexpected happened. The bird grew very big! The cat was scared now and ran away. The bird said, "Thank you, Sue" and flew away. Sue was happy she could help the bird.

Once upon a time there was a clumsy bear named Robert. Robert was very slow and could never keep up with the other animals. He always felt sad because he wasn't as fast as the others.One day, Robert decided to try to go faster. He worked hard and eventually he ran faster than ever before!Robert was very excited to show the other animals his speed. When he arrived, the other animals were amazed."Wow, Robert, you're so fast!" one of the animals said.Robert couldn't believe his ears. "You really think I'm fast?" he asked."Yes, we do!" they all said happily.From then on, Robert believed in himself and his speed. He was no longer clumsy and could always keep up with the others.

Ben and Lily liked to play with their toy cars. They had many cars of different colors and sizes. They liked to make them go fast on the floor and pretend they were in a race.One day, they decided to have a parade with their cars. They lined them up in a row and made noises like horns and sirens. They marched around the room with their cars, waving to their mom and dad.But then, Ben saw that Lily had more cars than him. He felt sad and angry. He wanted to have more cars too. He tried to take some of Lily's cars, but she said no. They started to fight and pull the cars.Mom and dad heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. They saw Ben and Lily crying and yelling. They asked them why they were fighting.Ben said, "Lily has more cars than me. It's not fair. I want more cars for the parade."Lily said, "Ben tried to take my cars. They are mine. I don't want to share."Mom and dad looked at the cars and saw that they had many cars. They said, "You have enough cars for both of you. You don't need to fight. You can share and have fun together. You can supply each other with cars and make a bigger parade."They helped Ben and Lily to calm down and say sorry to each other. They showed them how to share and trade the cars. They gave them some stickers and ribbons to decorate the cars. They said, "Now you have a beautiful parade. You can show us your cars and tell us their names and stories."Ben and Lily smiled and hugged each other. They thanked mom and dad for their help. They picked up their cars and continued their parade. They made them go fast and slow, loud and quiet, happy and silly. They h

One day, a little dog named Tim went for a walk with his mom. Tim was an obedient dog and always listened to his mom. They walked in the park and saw many pretty flowers and big trees. The sun was shining and the birds were singing. It was a beautiful day.As they walked, they met a big cat named Sam. Sam had a gift for Tim's mom. He said, "I have a gift for you because you are so nice." Tim's mom smiled and said, "Thank you, Sam." She opened the gift and found a pretty bow inside.Tim's mom put the bow on her head and said, "Look, Tim! I have a pretty bow now." Tim was happy and said, "You look nice, mom." Then, they all played together in the park. Sam and Tim became good friends.The moral of the story is: Be obedient and nice to others, and you will make good friends.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tom had a toy car. He loved to play with his car and go on journeys. One day, he met a new friend, Sam. Sam had a fierce toy lion. They decided to play together.Tom said, "Let's have a race!" Sam agreed, and they started to race their toys. The car would zip, and the lion would run. They were having so much fun. But suddenly, the lion jumped on the car and stopped it.Sam said, "My lion is the winner!" Tom was sad. But then, Sam saw that Tom was sad and had an idea. He said, "Let's make them friends instead." So, they played together with the car and the fierce lion as friends. They went on many fun journeys together.The moral of the story is that it is better to be friends and play together than to compete and make someone sad. And sometimes, something unexpected, like a fierce lion and a car becoming friends, can bring more fun and joy.

Once there was a little rabbit and he liked to imagine things. He imagined himself running around the woods and eating lots of berries. He imagined the sweet taste of the juicy berries that grew in the forest.One day, the rabbit went out to find berries, but all he could find were bad ones. They were not juicy and sweet. They were dry and tasted bad. The rabbit felt sad and disappointed.But then he remembered something his mom told him. She said that if he mixes bad berries with sweet berries, he can still make something tasty. So the rabbit gathered some more sweet berries and mixed them with the bad ones.The rabbit was so excited when he tasted his special berry mix. It tasted so good! From then on, the rabbit always thought of mixing bad berries with sweet ones to make something delicious.

Once upon a time, a boy named Tom had a pair of dull pants. He didn't like them because they were not pretty. One day, while playing outside, he fell down and hurt his leg. His mom came to heal his leg and asked, "What happened, Tom?""I was running and fell down," said Tom, feeling sad. His mom put a bandage on his leg, and Tom felt better. The next day, Tom wore his dull pants again and went to play with his friends. They all had pretty pants and laughed at Tom's pants.Tom felt bad and ran away. While running, he saw a girl crying. Her pants were torn, and she had no other pants to wear. Tom thought for a moment and gave his dull pants to the girl. She smiled and thanked him. Tom felt happy that he could help someone.In the end, Tom learned that even dull pants can make someone happy. The moral of the story is that it's not how things look, but how we use them that matters.

Tim and Jen are twins. They like to play with their toys. They have a big box of toys in their room. One day, they want to play with the same toy. It is a red car with four wheels."I want the car!" Tim says. He grabs the car from Jen."No, I want the car!" Jen says. She pulls the car from Tim.They tug and tug. The car breaks. One wheel falls off. Tim and Jen are sad. They are also grumpy."Look what you did!" Tim says. He points at the wheel on the floor."It's your fault!" Jen says. She points at Tim.They start to cry. Mom hears them. She comes to their room."What's wrong, my loves?" Mom says. She sees the broken car and the wheel."Tim and Jen broke the car. They both wanted it. Now they are grumpy," Mom says.She hugs them and wipes their tears."I'm sorry, Mom," Tim says."I'm sorry, too," Jen says.Mom smiles. She picks up the wheel and the car."Don't worry, my loves. We can fix the car. It's just a wheel. We can glue it back. Then you can share the car. How about that?" Mom says.Tim and Jen nod. They say sorry to each other. They hug Mom. They are not grumpy anymore. They are happy. They help Mom fix the car. Then they play with the car together. They take turns. They have fun. They love each other.

Once upon a time, there was a powerful dog named Max. Max had a big neck and loved to play with his friends. They would run, jump, and have fun all day long.One day, Max saw a big cup of water. He was very thirsty, so he tried to pour the water into his mouth. But when he tried to pour it, something unexpected happened! The water turned into many little balls that bounced all over the place.Max and his friends were surprised and started to play with the little water balls. They had even more fun than before! The powerful dog with the big neck learned that sometimes, unexpected things can make life more exciting.

Once upon a time, there was a goose. The goose was independent. It liked to go on walks by itself. One day, while walking, the goose found a broken toy car. The goose wanted to help.The goose said to itself, "I will repair the toy car!" It tried to fix the toy car, but it was hard. The goose did not give up. It kept trying until the toy car was fixed.Just as the goose finished, a little boy came running. He saw the goose and the toy car. The boy said, "Thank you, goose, for fixing my car!" The goose was happy to help. The boy and the goose became friends and played together. From that day on, the independent goose learned that sometimes, it is nice to have friends to play with too.

Once upon a time, there was an ordinary clock. It lived in a little house with a girl named Sue. Sue was a happy girl who liked to learn new things. The ordinary clock wanted to learn too.One day, Sue's mom showed her how to tell time. The ordinary clock listened and learned too. Now, the ordinary clock knew when it was time to eat, play, and sleep. It was very happy to learn.Every day, Sue and the ordinary clock would learn together. They learned about colors, shapes, and numbers. They had lots of fun, and the ordinary clock was not just an ordinary clock anymore. It was a very smart clock, and Sue was a very smart girl. They were the best of friends.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a tall man with a big hat. He has a look on his face that makes them curious."Who is he?" Lily asks Tom."I don't know. Maybe he is a magician," Tom says.They want to see his hat. Maybe he has a rabbit or a flower inside. They run to the tall man and say hello."Hello, little ones. What can I do for you?" the tall man asks."Can we see your hat, please?" Lily asks."Sure, why not? But you have to be careful. There is something very special in my hat," the tall man says.He takes off his hat and shows them. Inside, there is a tiny bird. It has bright feathers and a long tail. It sings a sweet song."Wow, it's beautiful!" Lily and Tom say."It's a parrot. His name is Coco. He can talk, too. Say hello, Coco," the tall man says."Hello, Coco," the parrot repeats.Lily and Tom laugh. They think the parrot is funny. They ask the tall man if they can pet him."Of course, you can. But be gentle. He is very shy," the tall man says.He lets them touch the parrot's soft feathers. The parrot likes them. He says their names and makes funny noises.Lily and Tom are happy. They thank the tall man and his parrot. They say goodbye and go back to play. They have a new friend in the park.

Once there was a small human. This human was very fast and always running around the house. One day, the family decided to remove all the furniture and carpets from the living room.The small human was very excited and asked, “Why are you doing this? What are you going to do?” The family replied, “We are going to make this living room bigger. Then you can run around even faster!”The small human was so thrilled that they smiled and started dancing around the room. The family laughed and removed all the furniture and carpets in no time.When the living room was finished, the family put in some new furniture. As the small human ran around the room, they were delighted to run so fast and exclaimed, “Wow, this is so much fun!”

George was walking one day when he dropped his toy. It rolled away from him and he couldn't reach it. Now he was afraid he wouldn't get it back.He saw a very big dog called Duke running around nearby. But Duke's owner was far away, walking in the distance.George called out, "Please help me. I dropped my toy!"Duke's owner saw him and said, "Come here and I'll help you look for it."George ran over and soon they both found the toy. George thanked the distant owner and was so grateful. Duke was happy too and ran around in circles. Finally, the toy was back in George's hands and he smiled. He had a large adventure that day, and a new friend too.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a modest doll that she loved very much. The doll had a pretty dress and soft hair. Lily would play with her doll every day.One day, Lily and her doll went to the park. They sat on a big rock near the playground. Lily said to her doll, "I love you, and I will always take care of you." The doll could not talk, but Lily knew that the doll loved her too.While they sat on the rock, Lily rocked her doll gently. They watched the other kids play and have fun. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing. It was a perfect day for Lily and her modest doll.

Once upon a time, there was a girl called Alice. She was very original and loved stories. She was always telling the most colourful tales.One day, Alice decided to go for a walk in the park. She was so surprised to see a little house in the middle of it! She couldn't believe her eyes.Alice approached the house and knocked on the door. "Welcome!" said a cheerful voice from inside. Alice entered the house to find an old man in the living room. Alice introduced herself and asked, "Do you tell stories?" The old man smiled and replied, "Yes I do! And I even have an original story just for you!" Alice happily listened and learned a lot from the old man's story. When it was over, she thanked him and waved goodbye. Alice left feeling inspired. Every day when she walked in the park, she would stop to visit the old man and listen to more of his original stories.

Lily was a curious girl who liked to learn new things. She had a big book with many pictures and words. She wanted to read the book, but some words were hard for her. She asked her mom to help her."Mom, what does this word mean?" Lily pointed to a word in the book. It was "weigh"."Weigh means how heavy something is," Mom said. "For example, this pencil weighs very little, but this book weighs more."Lily picked up the pencil and the book. She felt the difference in her hands. She nodded. She understood."Can I weigh other things?" Lily asked."Sure, you can. But be careful not to break anything," Mom said.Lily ran to her room. She found a toy scale that she got for her birthday. She put the pencil on one side of the scale and a stuffed bear on the other side. The scale tipped to the bear's side."The bear weighs more than the pencil," Lily said to herself.She tried other things. She weighed a ball, a flower, a cookie, and a necklace. She had fun comparing them.Then she saw her cat sleeping on her bed. She wondered how much the cat weighed. She was very curious. She picked up the cat and put it on the scale. The cat did not like it. It meowed and scratched Lily's arm. It jumped off the scale and ran away."Ow!" Lily cried. "That hurt!"Mom heard Lily and came to her room. She saw the scratch on Lily's arm and the scale on the floor."What happened, Lily?" Mom asked."I wanted to weigh the cat, but the cat was angry," Lily said.Mom hugged Lily and cleaned her wound. She explained to Lily that the cat did not like to be weighed. She said that some things are better left alone."I'm sorry, Mom. I was j

Once upon a time, there was a cool cat named Tom. Tom was a guard who liked to keep all the little animals safe. He was very good at his job and all the animals liked him.One day, a new little bird came to the town. Tom did not recognize the little bird. The bird was lost and needed help to find his family. Tom wanted to help the little bird, so they started looking for the bird's family together.They looked high and low, near and far. Finally, they found the bird's family in a big tree. The little bird was so happy to be with his family again. Everyone thanked Tom, the cool guard cat, for helping the lost little bird. And from that day on, Tom and the little bird were the best of friends.

Lily and Ben were playing in the bathroom. They liked to splash water and make bubbles. Lily saw a bottle of soap on the shelf. She wanted to make more bubbles. She reached for the bottle and opened it."Look, Ben, soap!" she said. "Let's drink it and blow bubbles!"Ben looked at the bottle. He was not sure. He remembered that Mommy said soap was not for drinking. He shook his head."No, Lily, soap is bad. It makes you sick. Mommy said so."Lily did not listen. She thought soap was amazing. It smelled nice and looked pretty. She put the bottle to her mouth and drank some soap."Yuck!" she cried. "Soap is not amazing. Soap is yucky. It hurts my mouth."She dropped the bottle and started to cry. Ben ran to her and hugged her."It's okay, Lily. Don't cry. Let's rinse your mouth with water. Then we can tell Mommy. She will help you."They ran to the sink and turned on the faucet. They rinsed their mouths with water. Then they dried their faces with a towel. They went to find Mommy and tell her what happened.Mommy was in the kitchen. She heard them coming. She saw their wet clothes and their sad faces. She knew something was wrong."What happened, my loves?" she asked.Lily and Ben told her about the soap. They said they were sorry. They said they learned their lesson.Mommy hugged them and kissed them. She was not angry. She was glad they were okay. She gave them some juice and cookies. She told them to be careful next time."Soap is for washing, not for drinking," she said. "But you are amazing. I love you very much."

Sam and Lily were playing in the kitchen. They liked to pretend they were chefs and make yummy food. They saw a big red tomato on the counter. Sam wanted to cut it and put it in a salad. Lily wanted to cook it and make it spicy."No, no, no!" Sam said. "Tomato is good for salad. It is fresh and juicy. Spicy is bad. It makes your mouth hurt.""Yes, yes, yes!" Lily said. "Tomato is good for spicy. It is sweet and tangy. Spicy is good. It makes your mouth warm."They both grabbed the tomato and pulled. The tomato slipped from their hands and rolled on the floor. It bumped into the door of the pantry. The door opened and a big bag of flour fell out. The bag burst and flour went everywhere. Sam and Lily sneezed and coughed."Oh no!" they said. "We made a big mess. Mommy will be mad."They heard Mommy coming. They ran to the pantry and hid inside. They closed the door and locked it. They hoped Mommy would not find them."Sam? Lily? Where are you?" Mommy called. "What happened in the kitchen? It looks like a snowstorm. And where is my tomato?"Sam and Lily did not answer. They were scared and sorry. They hugged each other and whispered."Maybe we can share the tomato next time," Sam said."Maybe we can try both salad and spicy next time," Lily said.They waited for Mommy to open the door and say sorry. They hoped she would not be too mad. They hoped she would still love them.

One day, Tom and Sue plan to play basketball. They go to the park with a big basketball. The sun is out, and they are happy. They bounce the ball and throw it to each other.An angry dog sees the basketball. The dog runs fast and takes the ball away. Tom and Sue chase the dog, but the dog is too fast. They are sad and want their basketball back.Tom and Sue try to get the ball from the angry dog, but the dog bites the ball. The basketball pops and goes flat. Tom and Sue cry because their basketball is gone. They go home with a bad day.

Once upon a time, there was a bird who could fly. This bird was different from the other birds. It wanted to teach the other birds how to fly in a new way. The bird was very excited to show them.One day, the bird called all the other birds to come and learn. The other birds were happy to try something new. The bird started to teach them the new way to fly. They all tried very hard to learn.But the new way to fly was not good. The birds got very tired and could not fly as high as before. They were sad and missed the old way to fly. The different bird felt bad for teaching them the wrong way. In the end, the birds could not fly high anymore, and they all felt sad.

Once upon a time, there was a young girl named Lucy. She loved playing outside in the fresh air. One day she was walking through the forest and she saw a very unique herb. It looked so tasty, so Lucy decided to pick it and try it. When she tasted it, it was the most delicious herb she had ever had. Just then, a magical owl fluttered down from the sky and offered her a deal. He said, "If you can teach me a new game, I'll reward you with more of this wonderful herb." Lucy thought that was a great idea, so she taught the owl a game called hide-and-seek. The owl was so pleased with Lucy's new game that he offered her a reward. He opened his wings and a stream of unique herbs spilled out onto the forest floor. Lucy thanked the owl, collected her reward and went on her way, thankful for the great experience.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim in the big blue sea. He had many friends who liked to swim with him. They played all day under the warm sun and the tall palm trees.One day, a big angry crab named Snap came to the beach. Snap was not happy because he lost his favorite shell. Fin and his friends wanted to help Snap find his shell, so they all swam together to look for it.They swam and swam until they found the shiny shell under a big rock. Snap was so happy to have his shell back! Now, Snap was not angry anymore. He became friends with Fin and they all swam and played together under the palm trees. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy named Tim went for a walk. He wore a red cap to protect his head from the cold wind. Tim saw a little bird sitting on a branch. The bird was cold too."Hello, little bird," said Tim. "You look cold. Do you want my cap to protect you from the cold wind?"The bird nodded and said, "Yes, please. Thank you, Tim."Tim took off his red cap and put it on the bird. The bird felt warm and happy. They played together all day. Tim and the bird became good friends, and they always helped each other stay warm and protected.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play pretend. Today, they are pirates. They have fake swords and hats. They look for treasure in the yard."Arrr, matey, where is the gold?" Ben asks."I see a big X over there!" Anna says. She points to a pile of leaves. "Maybe it is under the leaves."They run to the pile of leaves. They use their swords to move the leaves. They find a shiny box."Wow, we found it!" Ben says. He opens the box. Inside, there are some coins and jewels."Look, they are so pretty!" Anna says. She picks up a necklace. "Can I wear this?""Sure, you can. You are a great pirate!" Ben says. He encourages Anna. He gives her a high five.Anna smiles. She puts on the necklace. She feels happy. She encourages Ben too."You are a great pirate too! You are brave and smart!" She says. She gives him a hug.They share the treasure. They play some more. They have fun. They are good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy duck. He lived by a big pond. The duck did not like to play with other ducks. He liked to be alone.One day, the grumpy duck found a big red apple. He wanted to taste it. He took a big bite of the apple. It was very good. The duck was happy.Soon, other ducks saw the grumpy duck with the apple. They wanted to taste it too. The grumpy duck shared his apple with them. They all tasted the apple and liked it. The grumpy duck was not grumpy anymore. He made new friends and they all played together by the pond.

Once upon a time, there was a big thick tree. It had many long branches, and a big neck. A little bird lived in the tree. The bird loved to sing and play all day.One day, the bird saw a man. The man had a bag of food. The bird wanted some food too. The man said, "If you sing a song for me, I will give you some food." The bird was happy to pay for the food with a song.The bird sang a beautiful song. The man was very happy. He gave the bird some food. The bird ate the food and said, "Thank you!" The man and the bird became good friends. They played and sang together every day under the thick tree with the big neck.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk with his mom. They saw a small dog with no home. Tim wanted to help the dog find a place to live. He said, "Mom, let's find a shelter for the dog."They walked and walked until they found a big house. This house was for dogs who needed a home. Tim and his mom took the dog inside. The nice lady at the house said, "This is a rich place for dogs to live. They will have lots of friends and good food."Tim was happy the dog found a home. He gave the dog a big hug. Before leaving, Tim's mom helped him zip his coat. They said goodbye to the dog and went back home. Tim knew the dog would be happy in its new home.

One day, a little boy named Tim and his mom were in the kitchen. Tim was fearful of trying new things, but today he wanted to help his mom. She was making hot cocoa for them to drink."Can I stir the cocoa, mom?" Tim asked. His mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can help me stir the cocoa, Tim." She gave him a big spoon, and he began to stir the cocoa carefully.As Tim stirred the cocoa, he became less fearful. He was having fun helping his mom. When the cocoa was ready, they sat down to drink it. Tim felt happy and proud that he helped his mom.The moral of the story is: Don't be fearful to try new things, because you might find that you enjoy them and feel proud of yourself.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to have adventures. She would play in her yard, climb trees, and find new friends.One day, Lily saw a boy named Tim. Tim was holding a cup of juice. Lily wanted the juice, so she took it from Tim. "Hey, that's my juice!" said Tim. Lily felt bad for taking the juice, so she gave it back to Tim. Tim and Lily became friends and played together. They learned that it is not nice to steal from others. They had many more adventurous days together, and they always shared their juice.

Once upon a time, there was a hungry butterfly. The butterfly did not know where to find food. It flew around looking for something to eat.One day, the butterfly met a big, friendly bear. The bear knew where to find food. He said, "Come with me, little butterfly. I will show you where to find yummy flowers." The butterfly was very happy and said, "Thank you, big bear!"The bear took the butterfly to a beautiful garden full of flowers. The butterfly ate and ate until it was not hungry anymore. The butterfly and the bear became good friends. They played together every day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a blue bird named Bob. Bob loved to sing and clap his wings. One day, he saw a label on a big tree. The label had a picture of a bird like him.Bob flew to his friend, a little girl named Sue. "Sue, look at the label on the tree!" Bob said. Sue looked at the label and smiled. "It is a label for a bird house, Bob! Let's build one for you," she said.Together, Sue and Bob built a beautiful bird house. Other birds saw the house and wanted one too. Sue and Bob helped them build houses. All the birds clapped their wings and sang happily. The moral of the story is that when we help each other, everyone can be happy.

Once upon a time, there was a unique girl named Lily. She had a toy that could shrink. One day, she played with her toy in the park.While playing, a boy named Tom came. He asked, "Can I play with your toy?" Lily said, "Yes, but be careful. It can shrink things." Tom didn't believe her. He took the toy and pointed it at a tree. The tree began to shrink!Tom and Lily were both very surprised. They played with the toy and made many things shrink. They had a lot of fun. But then, the toy started to shrink itself! The toy became so small that they couldn't find it anymore. Lily and Tom learned that sometimes unique things can be a little tricky.

One day, a furry cat named Tom went to the store. At the store, he saw a big jar of jam. Tom wanted to test the jam to see if it was good. He asked the store man, "Can I test the jam?"The store man said, "Yes, you can test the jam." Tom opened the jar and tasted the jam. It was very good! He was happy and wanted to take the jar home.But, when Tom tried to pick up the jar, it was stuck to the floor! He pulled and pulled, but the jar would not move. Tom was sad and did not know what to do. Then, a strong dog named Max came to help. Max pulled the jar with Tom, and they both got the jar unstuck. Tom was happy and thanked Max. They both went home with the jam and became good friends.
