One day, a clever cat and a happy dog went to visit a small island. They went on a big boat. The island had many trees and pretty flowers. The cat and the dog played all day long. They ran, jumped, and had fun together.While they were playing, they saw a big box. The clever cat and the happy dog were very curious. They wanted to know what was inside the box. They pushed and pulled, and finally, the box opened.Inside the box, they found a big cake. The clever cat and the happy dog were very surprised. They did not know who put the cake in the box. They decided to share the cake and eat it together. After eating the cake, they continued to play on the island until it was time to go home.

One day, a black cat and a white dog were playing. They found a shiny gold rock. They did not know what it was. They began to discuss who should keep the gold rock.The white dog said, "I found it first, so I should keep it." The black cat said, "But I saw it first, so it should be mine." They talked and talked, but they could not agree.As they talked, a little mouse came by. The mouse saw the gold rock and said, "I know what that is! It is gold. It is very special." The cat and dog were surprised. They did not know it was so special.The mouse said, "You should share the gold. That way, you both can be happy." The black cat and white dog agreed. They learned that sharing is good. And they all became good friends.

Once, there was a big mattress. It was very soft and cozy. A cat and a dog both wanted to sleep on the mattress. They knew they needed to share, but they did not want to.One day, the cat jumped on the mattress first. The dog felt guilty because he wanted to sleep there too. So, the dog barked loudly to scare the cat away. The cat ran away and hid under a table.The dog slept on the mattress, but he still felt guilty. He knew he needed to share with the cat. The next day, the dog let the cat sleep on the mattress. They both learned to share and became good friends. They both slept on the mattress together and were happy.

One day, a cat and a dog were playing in a big yard. The cat saw a shiny thing high up in a tree. It was a laser! The cat wanted to play with the laser, but the dog was scared.The dog said, "Cat, don't go up there! I need to warn you, it might be bad!" But the cat did not listen. The cat climbed the tree to get the laser. When the cat touched the laser, something unexpected happened.The laser turned the cat into a big, pretty bird! The dog was very surprised. The bird flew down and said, "Thank you, dog, for trying to warn me. But now I can fly high in the sky!" The dog and the bird stayed friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, Jack wanted to go out and play in the sun. He said to his daddy, "Can I go outside, please?" His daddy said, "Yes, Jack, but don't twist your ankle." He winked and smiled. Jack ran out of the house and into the garden, excited to explore! He saw a big pile of waste and thought it might be fun to jump on it. He hopped towards it and started to twist around the pile. But suddenly, he felt something sticky. He looked down and saw the waste was filthy. He started to cry, feeling very sad. But then his daddy came out of the house and took Jack's hand. He said, "Let's get you cleaned up, Jack," and took him inside. Jack felt much better when he was all clean again. The next day, his daddy said, "Today, let's go to the park, Jack. But remember, don't twist your ankle." Jack smiled as he remembered what happened the day before and knew to stay away from the waste. He ran off to the park, laughing and enjoying the sun.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little girl named Raju. She used to play in her backyard every afternoon. One day, a strange witch appeared in the garden. Raju was scared and started to run away, but then the witch said in a friendly voice:"Don't be scared, Raju. I'm not here to hurt you. I just want to be your friend."Raju was still scared and didn't trust the witch. But then the witch said: "I promise I will never do anything rough. Will you please trust me?"Raju thought it over and decided to trust the witch. From that day on, Raju and the witch were the best of friends. They laughed and played together every day in the garden. The witch taught Raju all kinds of things, like how to plant flowers and how to bake a cake. They had so much fun, and Raju was so grateful for her new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a lively town. Every day the people in the town would gather in the town square to clap and celebrate.One bright morning, Andy and his mom went to join the others. Andy was just three years old and was very excited. His mom bought him a big and juicy apple. He took one bite and said, "Mommy, it's so tasty!"Everyone around them smiled and clapped. Andy clapped too and soon the whole town was clapping and celebrating together."Let's keep clapping," said his mom. They clapped and danced until dark!

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big parade. All the people in the town were happy. They liked to watch the parade. They saw many fun things in the parade, like big balloons and pretty flowers.In the parade, there was a man who did a foolish dance. He wore a funny hat and had a big red nose. He made everyone laugh. The little kids loved to watch him dance and do tricks.At the end of the parade, the people clapped and cheered. They were very happy. The man who did the foolish dance took a bow. Everyone went home with big smiles on their faces. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy who lived in a big house all by herself. She was feeling very helpless and lonely.One day, she went to the kitchen and there she saw lots of big jars and a big oven. She decided to try to bake something to make herself feel better.She searched the big bookshelf in her house and found an old cookbook. Lucy opened the cookbook and it had all sorts of yummy recipes inside. She chose the recipe for a cake, because it sounded yummy.Lucy carefully measured the ingredients into a big bowl and then stirred it all together with a spoon. Then she put the cake mixture into a pan, and put the pan into the oven.The cake started to smell so delicious, and soon the kitchen was full of yummy smells. Lucy waited patiently for the cake, until finally it was ready.Lucy was so happy when she pulled the cake out of the oven. She ate it with a big smile, and then went to bed feeling much less helpless than before. The end.

Once upon a time there was a curious fox. He wanted to explore the world around him. He wore a nice coat to keep warm and started his journey. Along the way, he met a lovely bunny. The fox thought the bunny was very cute, so he said hello. The bunny smiled back and said hi.The fox got an idea. He wanted to give the bunny a special surprise. He gave the bunny a big, sweet kiss. The bunny smiled wide and was very happy.The two friends said goodbye and the fox started to walk away. But before the fox could go too far, the bunny handed the fox its coat. The fox was so happy it put the coat on and went off on its way.The fox was happy and curious with its new coat. He continued to explore and discover wonderful things, wearing his coat with pride.

Lily and Ben were twins who liked to play with puzzles. They had many puzzles with different pictures, like animals, cars, and flowers. They liked to make the puzzles on the floor of their room.One day, their mom told them to clean their room before dinner. She said they had to put away their puzzles and toys, and throw away any trash. Lily and Ben did not want to clean their room. They wanted to keep playing with their puzzles."Let's hide the puzzles under the bed," Ben said. "Mom won't see them there.""No, that's not good," Lily said. "Mom will be angry if she finds out. And hiding is not nice. We should do what mom says.""But cleaning is boring," Ben said. "And we don't have much time. Maybe we can pray and ask God to clean our room for us."Lily shook her head. "That's not how praying works, Ben. God helps us when we need him, but he also wants us to do our best. Praying is not a magic trick. We have to clean our room ourselves."Ben sighed. He knew Lily was right. He did not want to make God or mom unhappy. He decided to help Lily clean their room. They put away their puzzles and toys, and threw away any trash. They worked together and finished before dinner.Mom was very happy when she saw their clean room. She gave them a hug and a kiss, and praised them for being good and responsible. She also gave them a surprise: a new puzzle with a picture of a rainbow. Lily and Ben were very happy and thanked mom and God. They learned that cleaning was not so bad, and that praying was not a way to avoid work, but a way to show love and gratitude.

Once upon a time, in a small world, there was a beautiful flower. The flower was very shy and did not want to bloom. It was afraid of the fierce sun that shined so bright in the sky. The other flowers tried to help the shy flower, but it stayed closed.One day, a kind little girl saw the shy flower. She knew that it needed some help to bloom. So, she brought water and gave it to the flower every day. She also talked to the flower, telling it how pretty it would be when it bloomed.After some time, the shy flower started to feel better. It was not so afraid of the fierce sun anymore. And one sunny day, the flower finally bloomed! The little girl was so happy to see the flower open up. And the world was a more beautiful place because of the flower that learned to bloom.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a small, dry coin that she found on the road. Sue loved her coin very much and took it everywhere she went.One day, Sue went to the park with her coin. She played on the swings and in the sand. As she played, a big boy named Tom saw Sue's coin and wanted it. He walked up to Sue and said, "Give me your coin!" Sue said, "No, it is mine!" Tom got mad and slapped Sue's hand. The coin fell on the ground. Tom picked it up and ran away. Sue cried and went home. She told her mom what happened. But they could not find Tom or the coin. Sue was very sad and missed her coin.

Once upon a time, there was a small village near a big river. The people in the village were very happy. They played and worked together every day.One day, a wise old man mentioned that a big flood was coming. The people were scared. They did not want their village to be in danger. So, they worked together to build a tall wall to keep the water away.The big flood came, but the wall was strong. The village was safe. The people were happy again. They had a big party to celebrate. They danced and sang songs about the brave old man who helped them. And they always remembered to listen when someone mentioned something important.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big orange ball. Tim wanted to play with the ball. He saw a girl named Sue also looking at the ball. Tim and Sue became friends."Let's play with the ball," said Tim. Sue nodded and they started to play. They had lots of fun together. Many kids in the park saw them playing and wanted to join. Tim and Sue became very popular.As they played, they saw a big bird fly down. The bird took the orange ball and flew away. Tim, Sue, and the other kids were sad. But then, the bird came back with a bigger, more fun ball. All the kids were happy and played together with the new ball.

Mum and her daughter went to the park. As they were walking, the daughter saw a tiger. She pointed at it and said, "Mummy, look! It's a tiger!" Mum smiled and said, "Yes, that's a tiger." The daughter then asked her mum if they could find the tiger, and Mum agreed. They looked everywhere in the park and could not find it. Mum thought it must have gone and suggested that they look somewhere else. The daughter was so excited about seeing the tiger that she started to get angry. Suddenly, she saw the tiger walking regular around the park. She ran to it and gave it a big hug. The tiger was surprised but did not mind. Mum and her daughter had a great day, and the daughter remembered to hug the tiger every time they went to the park from then on.

One day, a lovely cat named Kitty went to a cafe. She wanted to order a big ice cream. When she sat down, a dog named Max came in. Max was very loud and ran around. Kitty did not like this."Please stop," Kitty said to Max. "I want to eat my ice cream in peace." But Max did not listen. He kept being loud and running around. Kitty felt sad and did not know what to do.Kitty had an idea. She would teach Max how to be quiet in the cafe. She said, "Max, if you sit down and be quiet, I will share my ice cream with you." Max liked ice cream, so he agreed. They both sat down and enjoyed the ice cream together. They became good friends and learned to share and be kind to each other.

One day, a big dog named Max was playing in the park. He saw a thick stick and picked it up with his mouth. Max was very happy and wanted to show his friends. As he walked, he found a cross on the ground. Max was curious and put the stick on the cross.Suddenly, the stick began to shrink! Max was very surprised. The stick became smaller and smaller until it was too small for Max to play with. Max was sad, but he kept walking and looking for a new stick.As Max walked, he saw a tiny dog with the same small stick. The tiny dog was so happy to find a stick that was just the right size for him. Max felt happy for the tiny dog and realized that the unexpected shrinking of the stick was a good thing after all. Max and the tiny dog became best friends and played together in the park every day.

Mummy was cooking breakfast in the kitchen. She was humming a happy song. Suddenly, she heard a noise coming from the front porch.Mummy's eyes grew wide. She went to the front door and opened it. There was a thief on the porch! He was rocking back and forth on the porch chair.Mummy was very angry. She shouted, "What are you doing here, you disgusting thief!"The thief was startled. He quickly jumped off the chair and ran away.Mummy felt much better once the thief was gone. She closed the door and returned to the kitchen to finish making breakfast. She was no longer humming her happy song.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a lucky jacket with a zipper. He loved to wear it all the time. The jacket made Tim feel happy.One day, Tim saw a small dog. The dog was lost and sad. Tim wanted to help the dog find its home. He thought, "I can act like a hero with my lucky jacket." So, he put on his jacket and zipped the zipper up.Tim and the dog walked and walked. They found the dog's home. The dog's family was so happy. They said, "Thank you, Tim!" Tim felt very lucky to have his jacket with the zipper. He knew he could be a hero when he wore it.

Once upon a time, there was a little furry cat. The cat liked to play with a ball. She played with the ball every day. She was very happy.Yesterday, the cat lost her ball. She did not know where it was. She looked under the chair. She looked in the box. But she could not find her ball. She was sad.Then, the cat's friend, a big dog, came to help. The dog knew where the ball was. He found the ball behind a tree. The cat was so happy! They played with the ball together and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a lawyer named Tom. Tom was a bit careless. He sometimes forgot to put away his things.One day, Tom had a big test. He had to go to court and help his friend. But, Tom was in a rush and left his important papers at home. He was very sad.His friend, Sally, saw that Tom was sad. She said, "Don't worry, Tom! I can help you find your papers." They went back to Tom's house and found the papers. Tom was very happy, and he did a good job on his test. From that day on, Tom tried not to be careless anymore.

Once there was a girl named Mary. Mary was only 3 years old. One day Mary went outside to see the earth and explore. As Mary was walking, she noticed something heavy on the ground. She cautiously walked closer and saw what it was. It was an old chest! Mary was so excited. She opened the chest and found a magical jokes book inside."Wow!" exclaimed Mary, "Can I really play with this book?"The magical book replied, "Yes Mary, I'll teach you how to joke!" Mary couldn't believe it and eagerly accepted the book's offer.The magical joke book taught Mary all kinds of fun jokes. Soon she had learnt so many that she made her mom, dad and all her friends laugh.Mary was so happy with the magical joke book, she took it and the chest wherever she went on Earth. Whenever someone was feeling sad, she would tell them a joke and make them laugh and feel better.Mary was a joke master!

Once upon a time, there was a big, hairy dog named Max. Max lived in a small house with a backyard. He loved to play and run in the backyard. One day, Max saw a small rock in the backyard. He did not know what it was, so he left it alone.The next day, Max went to the backyard to play again. He saw the rock again, but this time, it was a little bigger. Max thought it was strange, but he still left it alone. He played with his ball and had fun in the backyard.On the third day, Max went back to the backyard. The rock was now very big! Max was surprised and curious. He went close to the rock and gave it a little push. The rock started to move! It was not a rock, but an egg! The egg cracked open, and out came a baby bird. Max and the baby bird became best friends, and they played together in the backyard every day.

Once upon a time, there was a cat named Tim. Tim was a flexible cat. He could bend and twist in many ways. One day, Tim went for a walk in the park.As Tim took a step, he saw a bow on the ground. The bow was big and pretty. Tim thought the bow would look nice on his tail. So, he picked up the bow and tied it to his tail.Tim walked around the park, showing off his pretty bow. All the other animals in the park liked Tim's bow too. They clapped and cheered for Tim. Tim was very happy and proud of his new bow.

One day, a little girl named Mia went for a walk with her dog, Spot. It was a perfect, sunny day. Mia held Spot's lead, and they walked together through the park. They saw flowers, trees, and other kids playing.As they walked, Mia tripped and fell on her knee. "Ouch!" she cried. Spot looked at Mia with big, worried eyes. A kind lady saw Mia and came to help. "Are you okay?" she asked. Mia nodded, but her knee still hurt.The lady helped Mia stand up and gave her a band-aid for her knee. "Thank you," Mia said with a smile. The lady smiled back and waved goodbye. Mia and Spot continued their walk, happy to be together on such a perfect day.

Tom and Sue are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big mill near the park. The mill has a big wheel and a big door."Let's go and see the mill," Tom says."OK, but be careful," Sue says.They walk to the mill. They hear a loud noise inside. They peek through the door. They see a big machine with many teeth. The machine is making flour from wheat."Wow, that is how they make flour for bread and cake," Tom says."Yes, flour is tasty," Sue says.Suddenly, the machine stops. A man comes out of the mill. He sees Tom and Sue."Hey, what are you doing here? This is not a place for children. Go away!" the man shouts.He scares Tom and Sue. They run away from the mill. They go back to the park."Sorry, Tom, I did not like the mill. The man was mean and the machine was scary," Sue says."It's OK, Sue, I did not like it either. Let's play something else. Do you want to swing or slide?" Tom says."I want to swing. Swinging is fun and not scary," Sue says.They go to the swing. They swing high and low. They laugh and smile. They forget about the mill. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big, friendly bear named Bobo. Bobo lived in a green forest with many trees. He had many friends, like birds, rabbits, and squirrels. One sunny day, Bobo was walking in the forest when he heard a sad sound.Bobo found a little bird with a hurt shoulder. The bird said, "Ouch, my shoulder hurts. Can you help me, Bobo?" Bobo wanted to help his friend, so he sat down next to the bird.Bobo gently rubbed the bird's shoulder to make it feel better. As he rubbed, the bird started to feel better and better. Soon, the bird was happy again. The bird said, "Thank you, Bobo! My shoulder feels good now!" Bobo smiled, happy to help his friend. They played together in the forest for the rest of the day.

One day, a boy named Tom went to the port with his dad. They saw big, heavy boats. The boats were very loud. Tom felt scared."Look, Tom," said Dad. "We can wipe the boats clean." So, they took a cloth and wiped the boats. The boats looked nice and shiny. Tom felt happy.But then, a big, heavy boat started to move. It went too fast and hit another boat. The boats got broken. Tom and his dad were sad. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim went to the jungle with his dad. They wanted to find a big, broken tree.In the jungle, they saw a monkey. The monkey said, "Hello, I can help you find the broken tree!" Tim and his dad were happy. They followed the monkey and found the broken tree.Near the broken tree, there was a race. Tim wanted to win the race. He ran very fast. The monkey and Tim's dad cheered for him. Tim won the race and they all had a fun day in the jungle.

One day, a little boy named Tim was very excited. He got a new bike with pedals. He wanted to ride it all day. Tim put on his helmet and went outside.Tim started to pedal fast. He was having so much fun! But then, he fell off his bike. Tim hurt his knee. It was red and it hurt a lot. He cried and went to his mom.His mom put a band-aid on his knee to help it heal. She hugged him and said it would be okay. In a few days, his knee felt better. Tim was excited to ride his bike again. He knew he would be more careful next time.

Lily and Ben were playing at the harbor. They liked to watch the boats and the birds and the water. They saw a big boat with pretty flags and people on it. They wanted to go closer and see."Can we go on the boat, Mommy?" Lily asked."No, sweetie, that boat is not for us. It is for people who go far away. We can look from here," Mommy said.Lily and Ben nodded. They held Mommy's hand and walked along the harbor. They saw a small boat with a man and a dog on it. The dog was brown and fluffy and had a red collar. Lily and Ben liked dogs. They wanted to pet the dog."Can we pet the dog, Mommy?" Ben asked."Maybe, honey, but we have to ask the man first. He is the owner of the dog. We have to be polite and careful," Mommy said.Lily and Ben nodded. They walked up to the small boat and said hello to the man. The man smiled and said hello back. He said his name was Sam and his dog's name was Max. He said they could pet Max if they were gentle and nice.Lily and Ben were happy. They reached out their hands and touched Max's fur. Max wagged his tail and licked their faces. Lily and Ben giggled. They said Max was a good dog.But then, something bad happened. Ben felt a sharp pain in his finger. He looked and saw a small crab had pinched him. He cried out and pulled his hand back. The crab fell into the water."Ow, ow, ow! Mommy, it hurts!" Ben said."Oh, no, Ben, I'm sorry. Let me see your finger. It's okay, it's just a little pinch. It will get better soon. Here, let me kiss it," Mommy said.She kissed Ben's finger and hugged him. She said he was brave and strong. She said the crab was scared and didn't mean

Once upon a time, in a big jungle, there lived a messy gorilla named Gogo. Gogo loved to play in the mud and get dirty. All the other animals in the jungle would laugh and say, "Look at Gogo, he is so messy!"One day, a little bird named Peep flew to Gogo and said, "Gogo, can you help me? My nest is broken, and I cannot fix it." Gogo wanted to help, so he said, "Okay, Peep, I will help you. Let's go fix your nest!" Gogo and Peep went to the tree where Peep's nest was.Gogo looked at the broken nest and thought about how to fix it. He requested, "Peep, can you find some sticks and leaves? I will use them to fix your nest." Peep flew around and brought Gogo some sticks and leaves. Gogo used his big hands and fixed Peep's nest. Peep was very happy and thanked Gogo.From that day on, the animals in the jungle stopped laughing at Gogo. They saw that even though he was messy, he was kind and helpful. Gogo and Peep became the best of friends, and they played together every day. And sometimes, Peep would even join Gogo and play in the mud!

Once upon a time, there lived a nosy mouse. The mouse was always searching. One day, he was searching in an old barn.Suddenly, the mouse spotted something! He passed it once and then quickly passed it again. It was a yummy piece of cheese!The mouse was so excited. He scratched and scratched, but the cheese was stuck inside a box.The mouse squeaked and squeaked, asking a nearby caterpillar for help.The caterpillar was very nosy. He wanted to take the cheese for himself!The caterpillar said: "You can pass the cheese to me, and then I will try to find a way to open it for you."The mouse was so excited to pass the cheese, but it was all a trick. The caterpillar never opened the box, he just took it away.The mouse was sad. He never got to enjoy his yummy cheese.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy had a candle that she loved very much. The candle was her friend, and she would talk to it every night.One day, Amy's friend Sam came to play. Sam saw the candle and wanted to play with it, too. Amy was scared that Sam would break her candle. But she wanted to be a good friend, so she let Sam play with it. They were both very happy.In the end, Amy learned that sharing made her and her friends happy. She also learned that being kind and sharing with others is important. And from that day on, Amy and Sam played together with the candle, and they were always happy.

One day, a pale bunny named Bo was playing in the park. He saw a big box and wanted to see if he could fit inside. Bo hopped over to the box and tried to get in. He pushed and pushed, but he was too big. Bo felt sad that he couldn't fit in the box.Soon, Bo's friend, a little bird named Pip, flew over to him. Pip saw Bo was sad and asked, "Bo, why are you sad?" Bo told Pip about the box and how he couldn't fit inside. Pip had an idea to make Bo feel better. "Let's go have some tea at my house," Pip said.Bo and Pip went to Pip's house and had a nice tea party. They had tea and cookies and talked about fun things. Bo forgot all about the box and felt happy again. He was glad to have a good friend like Pip who knew how to make him feel better.

One day, Daddy and his little girl went to the park. They wanted to complete a puzzle together. They sat down on the open grass and started to put the pieces together. The sun was shining, and they were very happy.Suddenly, a big wind came and blew all the puzzle pieces away. "Oh no!" said Daddy. "What do we do now?" The little girl looked sad, but then she had an idea. "Let's find the pieces and finish the puzzle, Daddy!"They started to look for the pieces. They found one in a bush, another on the slide, and even one on a bird's nest. As they were searching, they met a friendly squirrel who had found the last piece. The squirrel gave it to them and said, "Here you go! Now you can complete the puzzle!" Daddy and his little girl were so happy and surprised. They thanked the squirrel and finished the puzzle together in the open park.

Once upon a time, there was a messy cat named Tom. Tom loved to travel and find new places to play. One sunny day, Tom went for a walk to find a nice shade to rest.As Tom walked, he saw a big tree with a cool shade. He ran to the tree, but there was a dog named Max already sitting in the shade. Max was a big, loud dog, and Tom was scared.Tom wanted the shade, so he thought of a plan. He found a ball and threw it far away. Max saw the ball and ran to get it. Tom quickly went to the tree and enjoyed the shade. Max came back and saw Tom in the shade. He decided to share the shade and they both became friends.

Once upon a time, there was a soft bunny named Bobo. Bobo loved to cook with his mommy in their little kitchen. They had a big pan that they used to make yummy food. One day, Bobo wanted to make a cake for his friend's birthday.Bobo asked his mommy, "Can we make a cake in our big pan?" His mommy smiled and said, "Yes, we can! But first, we need to measure all the ingredients to make the cake just right."So, Bobo and his mommy started to measure the flour, sugar, and other things they needed. They put them all into the big pan and mixed them together. The cake started to look very yummy.When the cake was done, Bobo and his mommy took it out of the big pan. They put pretty decorations on top of the cake. Bobo was so excited to give the cake to his friend.At the birthday party, Bobo gave the cake to his friend. Everyone loved the cake and said it was the best they ever had. Bobo felt so happy that he could make something so yummy with his mommy and their big pan.

Once upon a time, in an ancient land, there was a big rock. The rock was very old and wise. Many people liked to visit the rock to ask for help.One day, a little boy went to the rock. He said, "Rock, I want to play with gas. Can I play with gas?" The rock said, "No, little boy. Gas is not safe to play with. It can hurt you."But the little boy did not listen to the rock. He went to play with gas. The gas made a big boom and the little boy got hurt. The people in the land were sad.The moral of the story is to always listen to wise words and not to play with things that can hurt you.

Once upon a time, there was a little train. It loved to go to the station. At the station, the train would welcome people on board. The train was very happy to help people.One day, a bossy big train came to the station. The bossy train told the little train to leave. The little train was sad, but it left the station. The bossy train took over and welcomed people on board. But the people did not like the bossy train.The people missed the little train. They wanted the little train to come back. So, they all went to find the little train. When they found the little train, they asked it to come back to the station. The little train was very happy and went back to the station.The bossy train saw that the people loved the little train. The bossy train felt bad and said sorry to the little train. The little train forgave the bossy train, and they both welcomed people on board at the station. The little train and the bossy train became good friends, and everyone was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a small dog named Max. Max was deaf, but he was still very happy. He loved to play in the rain. One day, Max hurt his paw while playing in the rain. His paw was red and it hurt a lot.Max's friend, a big cat named Tom, saw Max's hurt paw. Tom said, "Max, your paw looks bad. Let me help you heal it." Max did not hear Tom, but he knew Tom wanted to help. Max let Tom try to heal his paw.Tom tried to help Max, but he did not know how to heal a hurt paw. Max's paw got worse and worse. Max was sad, and Tom was sad too. They wished they knew how to heal Max's paw, but they just didn't know. So Max's paw did not get better, and Max and Tom stayed sad.

Once upon a time, there was a happy lion who lived in a land far, far away. His name was Gerald and he was a very cheerful lion, always smiling and laughing. He was always so friendly that all the other animals in the land, even the ones he didn't know, were always so happy to see him.One day, he was walking through the woods when he spotted an oyster sitting on a rock. Gerald was so excited that he stepped closer to get a better look. But when the oyster saw him, it started to roar! Gerald was a little scared, but he was still very cheerful."Oh no! Please don't be scared! I'm Gerald and I'm your friend," he said in a gentle voice.The oyster stopped roaring and looked at Gerald. After a few moments, the oyster smiled and said, "Well, hello to you too! I'm Gertrude, and I'm so happy to meet you."The two of them laughed and talked on and off for the rest of the afternoon. And ever since then, they've been the best of friends!

Once upon a time, there was a playful cat named Kitty. She loved to run, jump, and play all day. Kitty had a best friend, a little girl named Sue. Sue and Kitty would play together every day. They were very happy.One day, Kitty found a little bird. The bird could speak! Kitty was very surprised. She listened with her ears as the bird talked. The bird said, "Hello, Kitty! Let's play!" Kitty was excited to have a new friend who could speak.Kitty, Sue, and the bird played together all day. They ran in the sun and jumped in the grass. Sue and Kitty listened with their ears as the bird spoke funny words. They all laughed and played together. And they were the best of friends forever.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Hana. She was three years old and very thoughtful. One day, her mummy asked her to help make dinner. Hana was very excited to help!Mummy gave Hana a teaspoon and asked her to stir the soup. Hana did as she was told. She stirred and stirred until the soup looked just right!Mummy was very proud of her daughter for being so helpful. She thanked Hana for being so thoughtful.Hana was very pleased with herself. She had done a big job and felt very excited. From that day on, every time dinner needed to be made, Hana was given a teaspoon and asked to help.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside in his yard. One day, he saw a small hole in the fence. Tim was worried. He did not want his toys to get lost through the hole.Tim thought hard about how to fix the fence. He asked his dad for help. His dad said, "Tim, you can work with me to fix the fence." Tim was happy to work with his dad. They went to the store and bought some wood and nails.Together, they worked and fixed the fence. Tim was proud of their hard work. Now, he could play in his yard without worrying about his toys getting lost. Tim learned that when you work together, you can fix things and make them better.

Once upon a time, in a little town, there lived a girl named Mia. Mia loved to eat yummy food. One day, she found a big barrel in her backyard.Mia opened the barrel and saw lots of yummy fruit inside. She started to eat the fruit. Mia's friend, Tim, came over and saw her eating. "What are you doing?" asked Tim."I found this barrel with yummy fruit," said Mia. "Want to try some?" Tim tried the fruit and thought it was yummy, too. They ate and ate until their bellies were full.The next day, the barrel was empty. Mia and Tim started to complain. "We want more yummy fruit!" they said. They looked everywhere for another barrel, but they couldn't find one.Mia and Tim learned that they should not eat all the yummy fruit in one day. They promised to share better next time. They were happy they found the barrel, even if it was only for a little while.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was very restless. He liked to run and play all day long. Tim had a small room with many toys. One day, he saw a big ball in his room. He wanted to play with it, but it was stuck under his bed.Tim tried to get the ball, but he could not reach it. He felt sad. His mom saw him and asked, "What is wrong, Tim?" Tim said, "I want the ball, but I can't get it." His mom said, "You can do it. Try again and you will succeed."Tim tried again. He pushed and pulled. At last, he got the ball out from under the bed. He was so happy! Tim succeeded in getting the ball. Now, he could play with it all day long. His mom was proud of him. And Tim learned that with a little help and trying, he could do anything.

John and Suzanne were two children who were best friends. They had a lot of fun doing things together. One day, John got an idea.He said to Suzanne: "Let's get a prize!"Suzanne was excited. "Yes, let's do it!" she said.John and Suzanne were very busy. They looked for the best prize. Finally, they found a nice one. It was a toy boat with lots of fun colors.John said, "Let's get this prize!"Suzanne was so happy. "Yes, let's do it!"The two friends got the prize and went back home. They had lots of fun playing with the toy boat.They were the happiest best friends in the world.

Once upon a time, there was a lucky cat named Spot. Spot had a big friend named Tom. Tom was a boy who loved to print pictures. They played together every day.One day, Tom wanted to print a picture of Spot. Spot was very happy. Tom printed the picture and showed it to Spot. Spot liked the picture a lot. They put the picture on the wall.A week later, Tom and Spot had a party. They showed the picture to all their friends. Everyone thought Spot was a lucky cat. They all had fun and played games. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once there was a small girl called Lucy. She lived with her mom and dad in a house near a post box. One day, her mom asked her to go outside and post something in the post box. Lucy was very polite and said yes. On the way to the post box she saw a man. He was wearing a hat and coat and he asked Lucy to help him. He promised her a special surprise if she did. Lucy wanted to help him so she said yes. The man asked Lucy to hold something for him. She agreed, but when she looked in her hands she saw it was money. She didn't understand what was happening but the man celebrated and said his surprise was for her. Suddenly, two policemen appeared. They asked Lucy where the man had gone. The policemen told Lucy it was a bad man who had stolen money. Lucy had been tricked and was very sad. The policemen took Lucy home but she was very worried. Lucy learned it was not polite to accept presents from strangers. She promised herself to never do that again.

Once there was a little girl who loved yoga. She tried it every day and was very excited to do more new poses. One day, she asked her mom if they could go to a yoga studio. Her mom agreed and they set off.When they arrived at the studio, the little girl was so happy. But when they opened the door, the teacher inside was lazy. She was not prepared and so the class was cancelled. The little girl was very sad. She was not able to do yoga that day. She looked up at her mom and said, "I hope I can do yoga tomorrow."But the next day, the studio was closed. The teacher had decided to stay home and be lazy.The little girl was very disappointed. She couldn't do her yoga and was sad all day. She had been so excited to try new poses, but it didn't happen. She had lost hope.

Baby James was jumping on the bed. His mom was reading the enormous newspaper."James, you should be careful," she said.James just kept jumping. He absolutely loved it! Suddenly, the bed collapsed with a loud thump. James tumbled out from the mess and burst out into tears.His mom came running and quickly picked him up. "It's okay, I was expecting something like this," she said. James stopped crying and looked up. "You were?" His mom nodded and gave him a hug. "Yes, I knew if I kept on reading the newspaper and didn't tell you to stop jumping, something like this could happen." James smiled and hugged his mom back tight. "That's okay! We can just buy a new bed," he said. His mom nodded and laughed. The next day, they went to the store and bought an enormous new bed. James couldn't help but jump on it straight away. His mom laughed, "Hey, don't forget our lesson!" James just smiled and kept on jumping.

Once upon a time, in a big, green forest, there lived a sleepy human named Tom. Tom liked to take long naps under the tall trees. One day, Tom woke up and saw a big, red bird. The bird looked sad."Hello, bird," said Tom. "Why are you sad?""I want to improve my nest, but I am too small," said the bird.Tom wanted to help the bird. He picked up sticks and leaves and helped the bird make a better nest. The bird was very happy."Thank you, Tom," said the bird. "Now I have a nice, warm nest."Tom felt good about helping the bird. He went back to his nap, feeling less sleepy and more happy. And the bird sang a sweet song to help Tom sleep.

One day, a big cat named Tom found a huge sack. He did not know what was inside. He wanted to look, so he opened the sack. Inside, he saw many ice cubes. The ice cubes were very cold and made him freeze.Tom wanted to show his friend, a small dog named Max. He called Max and said, "Look at this huge sack I found. It is full of ice cubes and makes me freeze."Max came to see the sack. He touched the ice cubes and said, "Wow, these are so cold! Let's play a game with them." Tom and Max decided to play a game where they threw the ice cubes at each other.They had so much fun playing with the ice cubes. But soon, the ice cubes started to melt. Tom and Max were sad that their game was over. But they were happy they had fun with the huge sack of ice cubes.

Once upon a time, there was a small, brown squirrel. He was looking for something to eat, and he spotted a nut underneath a big tree. He was so excited! He quickly scampered over to it, but when he got closer, he realised it was filthy. He sniffed it and sighed – it was still ok to eat, so he decided to go ahead. He took a tiny peek and started to eat.The squirrel had barely finished the nut when he heard a loud noise. Looking around, he immediately saw a big, black cat right behind him. He was so scared! The cat started to stalk the squirrel and the frightened squirrel tried to run away. But the cat was too fast and it caught the squirrel in its claws. The squirrel knew nothing good was coming next.The cat started playing with the squirrel, and within moments, the squirrel was nothing but a pile of fur. The squirrel was gone, and his nut was still sitting there, dirty and forgotten. The cat licked its lips and crossed its way, leaving the poor squirrel behind.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily had a big dream. She wanted to step on the moon. One day, she told her mom about her dream. "Mom, I want to step on the moon!" Lily said. Her mom looked worried. She knew that stepping on the moon was not easy. "Lily, that is a big dream. Are you sure?" her mom asked. Lily nodded her head. "Yes, I am sure."Lily tried and tried to find a way to step on the moon. She jumped as high as she could, but she could not reach the moon. She was sad and worried. Her mom saw her and said, "Lily, it's okay. You can have other dreams." But Lily did not want to give up.One night, Lily had an idea. She found a big box and put it under her feet. She stood on the box and tried to step on the moon. But the box was not strong. It broke, and Lily fell down. She was hurt and cried. Her mom came and hugged her. "I'm sorry, Lily. You cannot step on the moon." And Lily's dream did not come true.

Once upon a time, there was a peaceful town. In this town, there was a big structure. The structure was a house where many friends lived. The friends liked to play and have fun together.One day, the friends saw a sign near the structure. The sign had a picture of a ball on it. The friends were very happy because they loved to play with balls. They decided to go find a ball to play with.The friends found a big, red ball and started to play near the structure. They laughed and played together. The peaceful town was filled with joy and fun. The friends were happy, and they played until the sun went down. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a little ball was rolling down a hill. It was having so much fun. The ball had a great idea to roll faster and faster. As it rolled, it saw a big tree and thought it would be fun to roll around it.The ball started to roll around the big tree, but it got frustrated. It was not easy to roll around the tree because of the roots. The ball tried again and again, but it just couldn't do it. The ball was very sad and wanted to go back to the hill.Suddenly, the ball saw a big dog coming. The dog wanted to play with the ball. The ball thought the dog would help it roll around the tree. But the dog picked up the ball and ran away. The ball was not happy and never saw the hill or the tree again.

Once upon a time, in a big brown house, there lived a small dog named Max. Max loved to play in the yard. One day, while he was playing, he found a shiny gold rock. Max did not know what it was, but he thought it was very pretty. He picked it up and brought it into the house to show his family.Max's family looked at the gold rock and thought it was very special. They put it on the table and told Max, "We will see what happens with this rock." Max wagged his tail and went to play outside again. He felt happy that his family liked the gold rock.A few days later, a man came to the brown house. He saw the gold rock on the table and told Max's family, "This rock is very rare and special. I will give you lots of treats and toys for it." Max's family agreed, and they traded the gold rock for treats and toys. They gave some to Max, who was very happy. From that day on, Max knew that good things come when you share with your family.

One day, a boy named Tim saw a smooth rock outside. He picked it up and showed it to his mom. His mom said, "I guess that is a nice rock, Tim." Tim was very happy and played with the smooth rock all day.At night, Tim put the smooth rock on his bed. He went to sleep and had a dream. In his dream, the rock was not a rock, but a comet! The comet was flying in the sky with Tim on it. They went up and up and saw the stars.Then, something unexpected happened. The comet turned into a big, friendly bird! The bird took Tim back home and said, "Thank you for playing with me, Tim." Tim woke up and looked at the smooth rock. He smiled and knew that the rock was special.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jenna. Jenna was three-years-old and loved to explore the world around her.One day Jenna was walking through the woods when she saw something that made her tremble. It was a huge image of a tiger painted on the side of a tree. Jenna loved animals, especially tigers and the image made her so excited that she ran up to it.But when Jenna got closer to the image she noticed that it was made of something very expensive and special. Jenna knew she couldn’t touch it so she just stared in awe at its beauty.Jenna continued to look at the image until the sun went down and it was time to go home. Jenna was so excited that she’d been able to see the image that she didn’t even tremble on her way back.

One day, a little monkey named Max was very curious. He saw a big line of ants marching near his tree. Max wanted to know where they were going, so he followed them.As Max followed the ants, he saw a big yellow banana on the ground. He picked it up and said, "Hello, banana! Do you want to march with the ants too?" The banana said, "Yes, Max! I want to march and see where they go."So Max and the banana marched with the ants. They went up and down hills and around trees. At last, they found a big ant hill. The ants were taking food inside. Max and the banana were happy to see where the ants lived.Max said, "Thank you, ants, for letting us march with you!" The ants said, "You're welcome, Max and banana! Come back and visit us soon." Max and the banana went back to their tree, and they had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a restless little boy named Tim. He liked to run and play all day. One day, he found an onion in the kitchen. Tim thought it was a ball, so he picked it up and played with it.While playing, Tim saw his friend, the cat, sleeping on the floor. Tim wanted to play with the cat too, so he rolled the onion to the cat. The cat woke up and didn't like the smell of the onion. The cat felt upset and slapped the onion away with its paw.Tim was sad that the cat didn't want to play with the onion. But then, his mom came into the room and saw the onion on the floor. She smiled and said, "Let's put the onion back in the kitchen and find a real ball to play with." Tim and his mom found a ball, and they played with the cat. The cat was happy, and so was Tim. They all had a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to sort his toys. He had many toys, but his favorite toy was a small red car. One day, Tim was playing with his car near the stairs. He wanted to see if his car could go down the stairs. Tim put his car on the top stair and let it go. The car went down one stair, then two stairs, and then three stairs. But the car was too big to fit on the fourth stair. The car stopped and Tim was sad.Tim's mom saw him and knew what to do. She found a smaller car that would fit on the stair. Tim tried the new car and it went down all the stairs. Tim was happy and clapped his hands. From that day on, Tim always played with the smaller car on the stairs.

Once upon a time, in a white land, there lived a little bunny. The bunny loved to bounce all day long. He would bounce near the trees, by the flowers, and in the soft grass.One day, while bouncing, the bunny met a big, green frog. The frog said, "Hello, bunny! Do you want to play with me?" The bunny said, "Yes! I love to bounce. Can you bounce too?" The frog smiled and said, "I can bounce very high."As they played together, the frog showed the bunny how to bounce even higher. They were having so much fun. But then, something unexpected happened. The bunny bounced so high that he touched the sky!The bunny was scared, but the frog said, "Don't worry, I will help you get back down to the land." The frog jumped up and caught the bunny. They both landed safely on the soft grass. The bunny said, "Thank you, frog! You are a good friend." From that day on, the bunny and the frog were best friends, and they loved to bounce together in the white land.

Lila and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big dog. The dog is brown and has a long tail. The dog runs to them and wags his tail."Hello, dog!" Lila says. "Do you want to play with us?"The dog barks and licks Lila's face. He is happy. Ben is scared. He thinks the dog will bite him."Go away, dog!" Ben says. "You are big and scary!"The dog does not go away. He sniffs Ben's pocket. He smells something good. Ben has a sandwich with meat in his pocket. The dog wants the meat."Hey, that's mine!" Ben says. He tries to pull his sandwich away from the dog. The dog growls and pulls harder.Lila sees that Ben and the dog are fighting. She does not like fighting. She wants them to be peaceful."Stop, stop!" Lila says. "Ben, share your sandwich with the dog. He is hungry. He is not scary. He is friendly. He wants to be your friend."Ben listens to Lila. He thinks for a moment. He does not want to be mean to the dog. He breaks his sandwich in half and gives one half to the dog."Here, dog. You can have this. But you have to be nice to me. And you have to play with us."The dog takes the meat and eats it. He is happy. He wags his tail again. He licks Ben's face. He is thankful."Thank you, Ben. You are kind. You are my friend. Can I play with you and Lila?"Ben smiles. He is not scared anymore. He likes the dog. He pets the dog."Sure, dog. You can play with us. What is your name?"The dog barks. He does not have a name."Can we give you a name?" Lila asks.The dog nods. He likes that idea."How about Brownie?" Lila suggests.The dog barks. He likes that name."OK, Brownie. Welcome to

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing in his room. He was looking for his red sock. He looked under his bed, behind the door, and in his toy box. Tim was anxious because he could not find his sock.Then, Tim saw his dog, Max, come into the room. Max had something in his mouth. Tim went closer to Max and saw that it was his red sock! Tim was so happy. He said, "Max, you found my sock!"Tim took the sock from Max and touched it. It was wet and dirty, but Tim did not care. He was just happy to have his red sock back. Tim put the sock on and went to play outside with Max. They had a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was a bald man. He lived in a tall, green tree in a forest. Every day he would take out his bright, shiny flute and climb as high as he could in the tree. He would sit and play the flute while the birds around him sang along.One day, a little girl came to the forest. She heard the man's flute and followed the sound until she came to the tree. She watched him play the flute, amazed by the beautiful music he made.The girl asked the man if she could join in. He smiled and handed her the flute. She started to climb the tree, higher and higher until she almost reached the top. The man clapped for her as she came down with the flute held tight in her hands.The man and the girl played the flute together for hours, until the sun started to go down. The little girl thanked the bald man, thanked him for showing her how to climb and play the flute so beautifully. The man smiled, waved goodbye, and continued to climb the tree every day - to make beautiful music with his flute.

Once upon a time, there was a young dog named Hope. Hope liked to play outside in the sun. She loved to roll in the grass and run fast.One day, Hope saw a little bird on the grass. The bird was sad because it could not fly. Hope wanted to help the bird. She had a big heart.Hope and the bird became friends. They played in the grass every day. Soon, the bird learned to fly. Hope was very happy for her friend. They played together in the sun and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time there was a large moon in the night sky. It shone so brightly in the darkness. One night, a little girl called Sarah wanted to open the moon and explore the world inside.So Sarah opened her bedroom window and she searched through the night and spotted the moon up in the sky. She waved her arms as she reached out to the moon. Suddenly, a magical doorway opened, leading into the large moon.Sarah opened it and stepped inside. She was so excited! The moon was full of sparkles and stars, a river of shining light and a rainbow of colours. She ran and danced around in the moonlight and felt so happy. She explored the world in the moon until the sun came up, and then quickly returned home before anyone noticed she had gone.Now whenever Sarah looks up to the night sky, she remembers that wonderful night when she opened the moon.

Once upon a time, there was a busy little dog named Max. Max loved to run and play all day. One day, Max found a pretty vest in the park. It was red and blue. He put on the vest and felt very happy.Max played with his friends in the park. They played catch and ran around. Max would pause to show off his new vest. His friends liked it too. Max felt very special in his vest. A big bird saw Max and his vest from a tree. The bird looked at Max and then flew away.The next day, Max played in the park again. The big bird came back with a small bag. The bird dropped the bag near Max. Max opened the bag and found a shiny toy. Max knew the bird gave him the toy because of his pretty vest. Max and his friends played with the shiny toy and had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Tom. Tom was very hungry. He wanted to eat some food. His friend, a girl named Sue, wanted to help him. Sue was a good friend.Sue found a pill to feed Tom. The pill was mild and safe for him to eat. She gave the pill to Tom. Tom ate the pill and he felt better. He was not hungry anymore.Tom and Sue played together all day. They were very happy. They had a lot of fun. In the end, Tom and Sue went home to rest. They were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big, scary bear. This bear liked to steal things from other animals. One day, he saw a spark in the sky. The spark was pretty and shiny. The bear wanted to steal the spark.The scary bear climbed a tree to get closer to the spark. But as he got closer, he saw that the spark was a little bird. The bird was crying. The bear felt bad for the bird and didn't want to steal anymore.Instead, the bear helped the bird find its mom. The bird was happy and the bear felt good. From that day on, the scary bear did not steal. He became friends with the bird and all the other animals. They all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big mountain. The mountain was incredible. It was very tall and had lots of trees. Many animals lived on the mountain. They were happy and played all day.One day, a little bird wanted to fly to the top of the mountain. The bird tried and tried, but it was too hard. The bird was sad. Then, a kind bear saw the bird and wanted to help. The bear said, "I will support you, little bird."The bear climbed the mountain with the bird on its back. The bird was very happy. Together, they reached the top of the incredible mountain. They looked at the beautiful view and smiled. The bird and the bear became best friends and they played together every day on the mountain.

Sara and Tom are playing with their toys in the living room. Sara has a doll and Tom has a car. They are having fun, but they are also very noisy."Can you please be quiet?" Mom asks from the kitchen. "I need to rest. I have a headache.""OK, Mom," Sara and Tom say. But they keep playing and making noise.Mom comes to the living room and sees the mess. She is not happy. "Look at this! You did not listen to me. You need to clean up and go to your rooms. Now!"Sara and Tom are sad and angry. They do not want to clean up or go to their rooms. They think Mom is not fair."But Mom, we were just playing!" Sara says."Yeah, Mom, we did not mean to make you sick!" Tom says."I know, but you have to respect my opinion. I asked you to be quiet and you did not. That is not helpful. You have to think of others, not just yourselves. Now, do as I say, or you will have no dessert tonight."Sara and Tom do not like that. They love dessert. They look at each other and sigh. They decide to do what Mom says. They pick up their toys and put them in their boxes. They say sorry to Mom and give her a hug. They go to their rooms and play quietly.Mom smiles and thanks them. She goes back to the kitchen and takes a pill. She hopes to feel better soon. She loves her children, but sometimes they are too loud. She needs some rest.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia was very independent. She liked to do things by herself. One day, Mia found a key on the ground. She picked it up and thought about what it could unlock.Mia walked around her town and saw a big door with a sign that said "Club". She had never been inside before. Mia decided to try the key she found to unlock the door. When the door opened, she was very excited.Inside the club, Mia found a room full of animals! There were cats, dogs, rabbits, and even a small elephant. The animals were having a party. They were playing games and eating yummy food. Mia thought the club was for people, but it was really a secret party for animals. She laughed and joined the party, making new friends with the animals.

Once upon a time, there was a regular cat. The cat was white. The cat liked to play and jump. One day, the cat went for a walk. The sun was shining, and the cat was happy.As the cat walked, it saw a big box. The cat was curious. It went close to the box and looked inside. To its surprise, there was a little dog inside the box. The dog was friendly and wanted to play.The cat and the dog played all day. They had so much fun. At the end of the day, the cat and the dog went back to the box. They were tired but happy. The cat had a new friend, and it was a surprise to find a friend in a box.

Once upon a time, there was a fish who loved to swim. He lived in a big pond. The fish had a friend, a frog. The frog lived on the ground near the pond. They liked to play together.One day, they saw a mysterious new fish in the pond. The new fish was big and scary. The fish and the frog were afraid. They did not know what to do.Then, something unexpected happened. The big, scary fish started to sing! The fish and the frog were not afraid anymore. They all became friends and played together. And they all swam and sang happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a small house with a porch. The porch was always filthy because he never cleaned it. One day, his friend Sam came to play.Sam said, "Tim, why is your porch so dirty? We can't play here." Tim didn't understand why Sam was upset. He thought it was okay to have a dirty porch.Just then, a big wind came and blew all the dirt from the porch into the house. Tim and Sam were shocked! They didn't like the dirt in the house. Tim said, "I didn't know the wind could do that!"Tim and Sam worked together to clean the porch and the house. They learned that keeping things clean is important. From that day on, Tim always kept his porch clean. And they played happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, she saw a ball. It was big and heavy. She wanted to play with the ball, but it was too heavy for her to lift.A nice dog came by and said, "Hi, Lily! I can help you with the heavy ball." The dog used his nose to push the ball. They played together and had lots of fun.Suddenly, the ball started to get bigger and bigger. It was so big that it made Lily and the dog fall down. They looked at each other and laughed. The big, heavy ball was not a ball at all. It was a big, round, bouncy house! Lily and the dog went inside and played all day.

Once upon a time, there was a smart cat named Tom. Tom loved to read books. He went to the library every day. The library was a big house with many books. Tom had many friends at the library.One day, it was very cold outside. Tom wanted to stay warm. He found a big, soft cloth. Tom decided to wrap the cloth around him. He wrapped the cloth like a big hug. Now, Tom was warm and cozy.Tom went to the library with the cloth wrapped around him. His friends saw him and smiled. They thought Tom looked very smart and warm. Tom was happy to read books with his friends. They all had a great day at the library.

Siddy and Dada were best friends. They live together and were always together. One Sunday they went to the park to play.Siddy was very serious and didn't want to do anything.Dada said,"What's wrong? Let's play!"But Siddy said, "No. I want to share something with you."Dada sat down and looked at Siddy, who was very serious."Go ahead," said Dada.Siddy smiled and said, "I have a new toy, and I want you to have it. It's for you, not for me."Dada's face lit up and he said, "Thank you! That's so nice of you!"And they were happy ever since.

Paul and his dad were playing together. Dad asked Paul to help him in the garden. Paul saw Dad bringing a great big knife and he became scared as he had never seen a knife before. Dad gently said to Paul, “This knife is great, Paul. It will help us unite these pieces of wood together.”Paul looked at Dad unsure of what he meant, so Dad showed him. He cut the wood into two pieces and then used the knife to stick the pieces together. Paul was amazed at the magic of the knife for bringing the wood together. He said excitedly, “That is so great Dad! Can I try it?”Dad explained that he had to be very, very careful when using the knife and then handed it to Paul. After a few tries, Paul successfully united the two pieces of wood. He beamed with pride at his accomplishment!

One day, a cat and her baby were walking in the woods. The baby cat was very small and had a long tail. They were looking for food. The baby cat asked her mother, "When will I become big like you?"The mother cat said, "You will become big when you learn to be kind and help others."As they walked, they saw a small bird stuck in a tree. The baby cat wanted to help, but she was scared. The mother cat said, "Help the bird, and you will grow."The baby cat used her long tail to help the bird. The bird was happy and said, "Thank you!"After helping the bird, the baby cat became big like her mother. The mother cat was proud. The baby cat learned that being kind and helping others makes you grow.

John was playing outside in the garden. He loved to slide down the tall slide, which made him squeal with delight. He would slide over and over again, until his clothes were covered with mud.John ran to the nearby puddle, with a mischievous smile on his face. But as he was about to slide into it, he saw something he hadn't before. It was a huge, tall monster with huge arms, legs, and a big scary face.John was terrified and wanted to run away. He scrambled up the tall slide and slid down it quickly, trying to get away from the monster. But the monster chased him and got closer. John was too scared to move.But suddenly, the monster stopped and started to laugh. It wasn't a monster at all - it was his dad, who was wearing a costume! John was relieved and laughed along with his dad. They hugged each other, and John went back to playing in the puddle.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a grumpy old bear. He lived alone in a dark cave. One day, he found a big skull near his home. He did not know what it was, but he thought it was very fun to play with.One sunny day, a little bird came to the bear's cave. The bird saw the bear playing with the skull and said, "Mr. Bear, why are you so grumpy? You should enjoy the beautiful day outside!" The bear looked at the bird and thought about it. He decided to take the skull and play outside with the bird.As they played, the bear started to feel happy. He was not grumpy anymore. He enjoyed the sun, the fresh air, and his new friend, the little bird. The bear learned that it is good to share and play with others. From that day on, the bear was not grumpy and enjoyed playing with all his new friends in the forest.

Tom and Anna like to play with trains. They have many trains and tracks in their room. They make a big station with bridges and tunnels and houses. They have fun making the trains go fast and slow and stop and go.But Tom does not like to share his trains. He wants to play with all the trains by himself. He says to Anna, "These are my trains. You can't touch them. Go away!" Anna feels sad and angry. She says to Tom, "That's not fair. We have to share. You are mean!"Tom does not listen to Anna. He pushes her away and takes all the trains. He puts them in a big pile on his bed. He says, "Ha ha! Now I have all the trains. You have none. You can't play with me."Anna cries and runs to their mom. She tells her what Tom did. Mom is not happy. She goes to their room and sees the big pile of trains on Tom's bed. She sees the messy station on the floor. She sees Tom smiling and Anna crying. She says to Tom, "Tom, you are in trouble. You did not share with your sister. You made a big mess. You were rude and selfish. You have to say sorry to Anna and give her some trains. And you have to clean up the station with her. Now!"Tom does not want to say sorry. He does not want to give Anna some trains. He does not want to clean up the station. He says to mom, "No! I won't do it. These are my trains. I don't care about Anna. I don't care about the mess. You can't make me do it."Mom is very angry. She says to Tom, "That's enough. You are being very naughty. You have to do what I say. If you don't, you will have no trains at all. I will take them away and put them in a box. And you will have no TV, no snacks, n

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a reliable dog named Buddy. Buddy was a good friend to all the animals in the forest. One day, a little bird named Chirpy came to Buddy and said, "Buddy, can you help me? I drop my toy in the river."Buddy said, "Don't worry, Chirpy. I will help you." So, Buddy and Chirpy went to the river to find the toy. They looked and looked, but they could not see the toy. Then, Buddy had an idea. He asked a fish friend to help them look in the water.The fish friend found the toy and gave it back to Chirpy. Chirpy was very happy and said, "Thank you, Buddy, and thank you, fish friend. You both are very reliable friends." And they all played together in the big forest, happy to have each other.

Once there was a nice little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, Lily saw a pretty flower that was about to bloom. She was so happy to see it.Lily ran to her mom and said, "Mom, look! The flower is going to bloom!" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, my dear. It will be very pretty when it does."Lily wanted to help the flower bloom, so she asked her mom for the key to the shed. Her mom gave her the key and Lily went to the shed. She found a small can for water and filled it up.Lily watered the flower every day. Soon, the flower bloomed into a beautiful, big, and colorful flower. Lily and her mom were so happy to see it. They knew that the nice little girl had helped the flower bloom with love and care.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Max. Max loved to sleep all day. One day, Max saw a magazine on the floor. It had a picture of a distant place with many trees and a big lake. Max wanted to go there and play.Max asked his friend, a little bird named Mia, to help him find the distant place. Mia said, "We must be quick and not sleep all day if we want to find it." Max agreed and they started their journey. They walked and walked, and Max did not sleep at all.After a long time, Max and Mia found the distant place with the trees and the lake. They played and had fun. Max learned that it is good to not sleep all day and to try new things. He was happy he found the beautiful place with his friend, Mia. The moral of the story is to not be lazy and to explore the world around you.

Tom and Lily were playing with their toy cars in the yard. They liked to make noises and pretend they were racing. Sometimes they crashed their cars and made a big wreck."Look at my car, it's so fast!" Tom said, zooming his red car around."Mine is faster, watch this!" Lily said, chasing him with her blue car.They were having fun, but they did not see that their dog, Max, was sleeping under a tree. Max was a big and friendly dog, but he did not like loud noises. He was having a nice dream, but the noise of the cars woke him up. He opened his eyes and saw the cars coming towards him. He thought they were monsters and he got scared.Max jumped up and barked loudly. He ran after the cars and tried to bite them. Tom and Lily were scared too. They dropped their cars and ran away. Max caught one of the cars and shook it in his mouth. He broke it and spit it out.Tom and Lily hid behind the fence and cried. They were afraid of Max and they were sad about their car. They heard Max whining and scratching the fence. He wanted to play with them, but he did not know he had scared them and ruined their car."Max, go away!" Tom shouted. "You are a bad dog, you scared us and wrecked our car!"Max stopped and looked at Tom. He tilted his head and wagged his tail. He did not understand why Tom was angry. He thought he was playing. He felt ashamed. He dropped his ears and walked away.Tom and Lily stayed behind the fence for a while. They calmed down and looked at their cars. One was broken and the other was dirty. They felt sorry for Max. He was not a bad dog, he was just scared and confused."Maybe we were too l

Once upon a time there was a little girl who was very misreable. She went for a walk in the woods and suddenly she saw a big bear! She was so scared, she started to cry. The bear got closer and said in a gentle voice, "Why are you so miserable little one?"The girl replied, "I just want to be happy, but I can't seem to find joy anywhere".The bear said, "Come closer, I may be able to help you find happiness". So the girl stepped closer and the bear said, "All you need to do is demand joy for yourself. Find what makes you happy and you will find joy"! The girl thanked the bear and promised to always remember her advice. With that, each of them went their own way. The girl was much happier and never felt so miserable again!

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to travel. One day, he found a sword. The sword was important.Tom took the sword and went to see his friend, Sue. Tom said, "Look, Sue! I found an important sword!" Sue said, "Wow, let's go show others!" So, they went to show their friends.But, they did not know that the sword was not good. When they showed the sword to their friends, everyone felt sad. The important sword made everyone unhappy. Tom and Sue learned that not all important things are good.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Mark. One day, Mark wanted to taste the juicy melon he had seen in the store, but his mom said no. Mark was sad and started to cry. Then his mom said, "It's alright, Mark. I know what you can do. You can try to use your mind. You need to think hard and figure out how to get the melon."Mark had an idea! He went to the melon and grabbed it with both of his hands. But it was tough and he could not open it. He looked at it and thought. Then he remembered his mom has a knife in the kitchen.Mark quickly ran inside and grabbed the knife. He ran back outside and now he was ready to open the melon. He worked hard and soon he was successful. He cut through the tough outside of the melon. Inside, it was dark and there was juice everywhere. He could finally taste the juicy melon. It was delicious!Mark enjoyed the juicy melon and learned that he could use his mind to solve any problem.

Once upon a time, a big, intelligent dog named Max lived in a small house. Max was very smart and loved to play with his toys. One day, Max found a shiny copper penny on the ground. He picked it up and decided to show it to his friend, a little girl named Lily.Max arrived at Lily's house with the copper penny in his mouth. He barked and wagged his tail to show her the penny. Lily was so happy to see the shiny penny. She clapped her hands and said, "Wow, Max! You found a pretty penny!"Together, Max and Lily played with the copper penny all day. They took turns hiding it and finding it again. They laughed and had so much fun. When it was time for Max to go home, he gave the penny to Lily as a gift. She hugged Max and said, "Thank you, Max! You are the best friend ever!"

One day, Sarah went for a walk with her mom. As they walked, Sarah stopped and said, "Mommy, I see a statue!" Her mom said, "Yes, that is a statue!" Sarah stared at the statue. Its head was bowed and its eyes were closed, and it looked very sad. She asked her mom, "Why is the statue so sad?". Her mom said, "Maybe it is sad because no one is visiting." Sarah was very sad. She waved to the statue and said, "Hi! I am here!" Suddenly, the statue opened its eyes and smiled. Sarah was so happy and said, "See, Mommy? The statue isn't sad anymore!"

One day, a little girl named Lily found an umbrella. It was an incredible umbrella with many colors. Lily loved her umbrella and took it everywhere she went. She knew it would help her if it rained. One day, Lily saw a sad boy named Tim. He was wet from the rain. Lily wanted to improve his day, so she shared her incredible umbrella with him. They both stayed dry and happy under the umbrella. The next day, the sun was shining bright. Lily and Tim went to the park with the umbrella. They opened it and something unexpected happened. The incredible umbrella turned into a big, colorful kite! They laughed and played with the kite all day, and the umbrella made their days even better than before.

Tom and Lily were bored. They had no toys to play with and no books to read. Their mom was busy in the kitchen and their dad was at work. They looked out the window and saw a big slide in the park. They wanted to go there and have fun."Mom, can we go to the park and slide?" Tom asked."Not now, dear. I have to finish cooking. Maybe later," Mom said.Tom and Lily did not listen. They put on their coats and shoes and ran out of the door. They did not tell Mom where they were going. They crossed the street and ran to the park. They saw the big slide and smiled."Let's go, Lily. I'll go first and you follow me," Tom said.He climbed up the ladder and sat on the top of the slide. He pushed himself down and felt the wind in his hair. He laughed and shouted, "Whee!"Lily climbed up the ladder and sat on the top of the slide. She saw Tom waiting for her at the bottom. She pushed herself down and felt the wind in her hair. She laughed and shouted, "Whee!"But then something bad happened. The slide was broken and had a sharp edge. Lily did not see it and slid over it. It cut her leg and made her bleed. She screamed and cried, "Ow! Ow! Ow!"Tom heard her scream and ran to her. He saw her leg and felt scared. He did not know what to do. He shouted, "Help! Help! Help!"Mom heard the shouts and looked out of the window. She saw Tom and Lily in the park and felt angry. She also saw Lily's leg and felt worried. She grabbed her phone and ran to the park. She called Dad and the doctor. She hugged Lily and Tom and said, "Why did you go to the park without telling me? You could have been hurt or lost. You were very n

Once upon a time, there was a gentle bunny who loved to hop. One day, he went to the big garden to play. In the garden, he saw a guard. The guard was big and tall. The guard took care of the garden and made sure it was safe.The gentle bunny wanted to be friends with the guard. So, the bunny hopped up to the guard and said, "Hello, I am a gentle bunny who loves to hop. Can we be friends?" The guard smiled and said, "Yes, we can be friends."Every day, the gentle bunny and the guard played in the garden. They had so much fun together. The bunny would hop, and the guard would laugh. They became best friends, and the garden was always a happy place.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful button. The button lived on a big shirt. The shirt was worn by a happy man. The happy man loved the colorful button very much. The button made the man's shirt special.One day, the happy man decided to have a party. He wanted to invite all his friends to come and play. The colorful button was excited about the party too. It wanted to help the man invite his friends.The colorful button had an idea. It asked the happy man to make more colorful buttons for his friends. The man thought it was a great idea. He made more colorful buttons and gave them to his friends as invites.The day of the party came. All the friends wore their colorful buttons. They played games, ate yummy food, and laughed a lot. The colorful button was happy. It had helped the man have a great party with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a small boy named Tim. Tim had a regular pen that he used every day. He liked to draw and write with his pen. One day, Tim's mom said, "We need to pass the pen to your sister for her to use."The next day, Tim's sister, Sue, got the pen. She was very happy to have it. She drew a big sun and a happy face. But then, something unexpected happened. The pen started to glow! Sue called Tim, and they both looked at the glowing pen. They were very surprised. They touched the pen, and it made their hands glow too! They laughed and played with the glowing pen all day. It was a magic pen, not a regular pen!

Lily and Ben were friends. They liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a big slide. They wanted to go on it."Let's go on the slide!" Lily said."OK!" Ben said.They ran to the slide.
