But there was a problem. The slide was too high. They could not reach it."Maybe we can find a way to climb up," Lily said.They searched for a ladder, a box, or a stool. They did not find anything.Then they saw a man. He had a big bag. He was walking away from the slide."Maybe he has something we can use," Ben said."Let's ask him," Lily said.They ran after the man. They did not see where they were going. They did not see the car.The car was fast. It hit them. They fell down. They were hurt.The man heard the noise. He turned around. He saw Lily and Ben on the ground. He was scared. He dropped his bag and ran away.The bag was full of money. He had stolen it from a bank. He was a bad man.Some people saw what happened. They called for help. They tried to help Lily and Ben. But it was too late. Lily and Ben were gone.The people were sad. They wished Lily and Ben had not chased the man. They wished Lily and Ben had stayed in the park.The moral of the story is: Do not talk to strangers. Do not leave the place where you are safe. Be careful when you cross the street.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy doctor set. He would play operation all day with his toys. He liked to fix them and make them feel better. One day, Tim found a big and scary spider in his room. He thought it was hurt and needed an operation.Tim got his toy doctor set and started the operation on the scary spider. He was very careful and tried to help the spider. But something unexpected happened. The spider was not hurt, it was just sleeping. The spider woke up during the operation and got very angry.The angry spider jumped on Tim's toy doctor set and broke it. Tim was very sad and scared. He ran to his mom and told her what happened. His mom said that they should not play operation on real animals. Tim learned his lesson and promised never to play operation on real animals again. The scary spider went away, and Tim never saw it again.

One day, a small bean wanted to move. It was tired of staying in the same place. The bean was very fair and shiny. It wanted to see the world and make new friends.The bean met a big rock and said, "Hello, Rock! Can you help me move? I want to see the world." The rock replied, "Sure, Bean! I will help you. Just wait and see." The bean was excited and couldn't wait to move.The next day, it rained a lot. The water made the bean move down the hill. The bean was so happy to finally move! It saw many things and met new friends. But then, the bean stopped moving. It had grown into a big bean plant! The bean plant was happy and said, "Thank you, Rock, for helping me move and grow."

Once upon a time, there was a small boat. It wanted to become a big, impressive yacht. It worked very hard to grow bigger and stronger. One day, a mean storm came. The storm was very big and scary. The small boat was not scared. It wanted to show the storm that it could be a big yacht. The small boat fought the big storm. It was a hard fight. In the end, the storm went away. The small boat was very happy. It had become a big, impressive yacht.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mom. Lily was very happy. She loved to play on the swings and slides. While playing, Lily saw a pretty rock. She picked it up and put it in her pocket.After a while, it was time to go home. Lily wanted to show her mom the pretty rock. But when she looked in her pocket, the rock was gone! Lily was worried. She told her mom, "My rock is gone. Can we search for it?"Lily and her mom searched all around the park. They looked under the swings and by the slides. Just when they were about to give up, a little boy came up to them. He said, "Is this your rock? I found it by the sandbox." Lily was so happy and surprised. She thanked the little boy and went home with her pretty rock and a new friend.

Anna and Ben like to play in the garden. They see many bugs and flowers. They also see a cricket. It is green and jumps fast."Look, a cricket!" Anna says. "Let's catch it and keep it as a pet."Ben nods. He runs after the cricket with a jar. But the cricket is too quick. It jumps over the jar and hides under a leaf."Come on, cricket, don't be shy," Ben says. "We will be nice to you."But the cricket refuses to come out. It likes to be free and hop around. It does not want to live in a jar.Anna and Ben are sad. They want a pet. They look around for another bug. They see a snail. It is slow and slimy."Maybe we can keep the snail as a pet," Anna says. "It won't run away."Ben shakes his head. He does not like the snail. He thinks it is boring and icky."No, thank you," he says. "I want a pet that is fun and reliable. Like a dog or a cat."Anna and Ben decide to leave the bugs alone. They go back to the house and ask their mom for a real pet. Maybe she will say yes.

Once upon a time, in a small pond, there lived a fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim all day long. He swam in patterns, making big circles and little circles. Fin was a harmless fish and was friends with everyone in the pond.One day, while Fin was swimming, he met a new friend. The new friend was a frog named Fred. "Hi, I'm Fin!" said Fin. "Hi, I'm Fred!" said Fred. "Let's swim together!" So, Fin and Fred swam in patterns, making big circles and little circles together.As they swam, something unexpected happened. A big bird swooped down and tried to catch Fred! But Fin was quick. He jumped out of the water and pushed Fred away. The big bird missed them both. Fin and Fred were safe! They swam back to their friends, happy to be together. And from that day on, they were best friends forever.

One day, a funny frog named Fred was hopping by a pond. He saw a big net lying on the ground. He thought, "I can use this net to catch flies!" Fred picked up the net and started to swing it around. He saw a fly near a flower and tried to catch it. "I guess I can catch you, little fly!" said Fred. But the fly was too fast and flew away.Fred did not give up. He tried again and again. Finally, he caught a fly in the net. "I got you!" he shouted happily. Fred had a lot of fun catching flies with his new net.

Once upon a time, there was a big race. All the kids wanted to win the trophy. Sam, a small boy, was not sure if he could win. He thought it would not be easy. But Sam wanted the trophy very much.On the day of the race, all the kids lined up. They were ready to run. Sam was scared but he knew he had to try. The race started and all the kids began to run. Sam pushed and pushed with all his might. He ran as fast as he could.As they got close to the finish line, Sam saw the trophy. He knew he had to push harder. He ran faster and faster. And then, Sam crossed the finish line first! He had won the race! It was not easy, but Sam had pushed himself and won the trophy. All the kids cheered for Sam.

One day, a young girl named Lucy went to her friend Tom's house to play. They saw a big bookcase with many books. They both stared at the bookcase, thinking about which book to read.Tom said, "I want to read the book on the top shelf." But the book was too high for them to reach. They tried to jump, but they could not get the book. Lucy and Tom felt sad.Later, Lucy had an idea. "Let's use a chair to stand on!" she said. They put a chair close to the bookcase and climbed up. They got the book and read it together. They were happy now, and they learned that they could solve problems by working together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to be organized. He always put his toys away when he was done playing with them. One day, Tim's mom mentioned they were going to the park. Tim was excited and couldn't wait to go.Tim and his mom walked to the park. Tim saw the swings and couldn't wait to play on them. He ran to the swings and started to swing high in the sky. Tim felt like he was flying. His mom watched and smiled as Tim had fun.After playing on the swings, Tim wanted to play on the slide. He climbed up the ladder and slid down, laughing all the way. Tim had lots of fun at the park. When it was time to go home, he was tired but happy. Tim couldn't wait to come back to the park again.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby cat named Tim. Tim loved to stretch in the sun. One day, Tim saw a shiny ornament hanging from a tree. It was so pretty! Tim wanted to play with it.Tim asked his friend, the bird, "Can you help me get the ornament?" The bird said, "No, I am too small. I cannot reach it." Tim was sad. He wanted the ornament so much!But then, Tim had an idea. He would stretch and stretch until he could reach the ornament himself. So, he stretched and stretched, and finally, he got the ornament! Tim was so happy, and he shared the ornament with his bird friend. They played together all day long.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a great festival. Everyone in the town was happy and excited. The festival had music, games, and yummy food. The people in the town loved the festival.One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the festival with her mom. They saw a game where you had to raise a ball and try to get it in a hole. Lucy wanted to play the game. She said, "Mom, can I play the game?" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, Lucy, you can play the game."Lucy raised the ball and tried to get it in the hole. She tried again and again. Finally, the ball went into the hole. Lucy was so happy! She won a big, soft toy. Lucy and her mom had a great time at the festival. They went home with big smiles on their faces.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with chalk on the sidewalk. One day, she found a beautiful blue chalk and wanted to draw a big sun in the sky.Lily started to draw, but her little brother, Max, wanted to hold the blue chalk too. He tried to take it from her, but Lily didn't want to share. Max became upset and started to cry.Their mom heard the cry and came outside. She told Lily and Max that they should share the chalk and draw together. So, Lily let Max hold the blue chalk, and they drew a big sun and a happy family. They learned that sharing made them both happy and they could make better drawings together.

Paul was feeling very guilty. He had chewed up his teacher's favourite pen and she was very mad. He had run out of the classroom, scared of what she might do.Paul had run outside and sat under a tree, feeling very lonely and sad. Suddenly he heard a voice. It was gentle and kind.The kind voice asked "Why are you feeling so guilty Paul?"Paul looked around and saw a big, friendly bird staring at him. He looked very surprised and didn't know what to say.The bird smiled and said "It's ok, you can tell me. I won't judge you."Paul felt a bit better and told the bird that he had chewed up his teacher's pen. The bird looked a bit sad and said "Maybe you should go back and tell your teacher you're sorry. It will make you feel better and make your teacher happy."Paul thought about this and realized that it was the right thing to do. So he took a deep breath and walked back to the classroom. When he got back, his teacher looked at him and said "I'm glad you came back. Are you ready to apologize?"Paul nodded and said sorry. His teacher looked at him and smiled. "It's ok, Paul. I forgive you. Now let's try to find another pen." Paul felt so much better. He knew it was the right thing to

Once upon a time, there was a pale boy named Tim. He loved rockets more than anything in the world. He had a big dream to fly a rocket one day.One sunny day, Tim met a kind man who could supply rockets. The man gave Tim a small rocket to play with. Tim was very happy and thanked the man.Tim played with his rocket every day. He made it fly high in the sky. Tim's dream came true, and he was the happiest boy in the world.

Once upon a time, there was a fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim all day. One day, Fin felt very sleepy. He yawned and said, "I need a nap."Fin swam to his favorite spot under a big rock. He looked left and right to make sure it was safe. Fin was happy when he saw no big fish around. He knew it was a good place to sleep.Fin closed his eyes and started to sleep. He dreamed of swimming fast in the water with his fish friends. When Fin woke up, he felt good and ready to swim again. He swam all day, happy and full of energy.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Tim. Tim loved to eat sauce. One day, Tim saw a big jar of sauce on the table. Tim wanted to eat all the sauce by himself because he was a selfish cat.Tim jumped on the table to eat the sauce. But then, he heard his friend, the dog named Max, coming. Tim had to pause. He did not want Max to see him eating the sauce. Tim hid behind the jar of sauce.Max came into the room and saw the jar of sauce on the table. He knew that Tim loved sauce, so he called out, "Tim, do you want to share this sauce with me?" Tim thought about it and decided not to be selfish. He came out from behind the jar and said, "Yes, Max, let's share the sauce!" So, Tim and Max ate the sauce together and were very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle bunny named Bob. He lived in a small house in the woods. Bob loved to play with his friends, the birds and the squirrels.One day, Bob found a shiny gem in the forest. It was so pretty and sparkly. He showed it to his friends, and they all liked it too. They wanted to keep it, but they knew they had to pay for it.Bob and his friends decided to do nice things for others to pay for the gem. They helped carry nuts for the squirrels, sang songs for the birds, and gave hugs to the other animals. Everyone was very happy with their help.Finally, the forest fairy saw how kind and gentle Bob and his friends were. She told them they could keep the gem because they had paid with their good deeds. They were so happy and continued to be kind to everyone in the forest. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim was a good boy who loved to learn. One day, his teacher told the class they would have an exam. The exam was to name different animals. Tim was excited because he knew many animal names.Tim and his friends, Sam and Lily, talked about the exam. "I want to name the most animals," said Sam. "No, I want to name more than you," said Lily. They all became competitive and wanted to do their best.On the day of the exam, Tim, Sam, and Lily named many animals. They named dogs, cats, birds, and more. After the exam, they were happy because they all did well. They learned that it was okay to be competitive, as long as they were still friends. And they all remained good friends.

Sara and Ben were playing with their toys in the living room. They liked to make noises and pretend they were animals. Sara had a doll that she loved very much. She called her doll Lily and gave her hugs and kisses. Ben had a car that he liked to zoom around the floor. He called his car Max and made vroom-vroom sounds.One day, their mom said she had to go to the store and asked them to be good. She said she would bring them a reward if they did not make a mess or fight. Sara and Ben said they would be good and waved goodbye to their mom. They decided to play with their toys until their mom came back.But soon, they got bored of their own toys and wanted to play with each other's. Sara asked Ben if she could hold his car for a little while. Ben said no, his car was his and he did not want to share. Sara got angry and tried to grab his car. Ben pulled it away and said it was fragile and she would break it. Sara did not care and kept trying to get his car.Ben got angry too and pushed Sara away. Sara fell on the floor and hit her head. She started to cry and dropped her doll. Ben saw his chance and ran to get her doll. He said he would take her doll as a reward for his car. Sara saw him and screamed. She got up and ran after him.They chased each other around the living room, knocking over lamps and pillows and books. They did not see their mom come back from the store. She saw the mess and heard the noise and got very mad. She yelled at them to stop and took away their toys. She said they were not good and they would not get any reward. She said they had to go to their rooms and think about wha

Once upon a time, there was a little child named Tim. Tim was very nervous because he did not know how to tie his shoes. Every day, he would ask his mom to help him with his shoes. One day, Tim's mom told him that he needed to learn how to tie his shoes by himself.Tim tried and tried to tie his shoes, but he just could not do it. He felt sad and worried. Then, a friendly cat came to play with him. The cat saw Tim's untied shoes and started to play with the laces. To Tim's surprise, the cat tied his shoes for him!Now, Tim was not nervous anymore. He knew that he had a special friend who could help him. Tim and the cat played together every day, and the cat always helped him tie his shoes. But one day, while they were playing, Tim suddenly learned how to tie his shoes all by himself. The cat was very proud of Tim, and they continued to play together, now with Tim tying his own shoes.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to school. She had a big bag with her. In the bag, there were many orange crayons. Lucy wanted to draw on the blackboard with her orange crayons. She was very excited.Lucy went to the blackboard and said, "I want to draw with my orange crayons!" She started to unpack her big bag. But, when she opened the bag, there were no orange crayons! Instead, there were many orange balls. Lucy was surprised.Her friend Tom saw Lucy and said, "Lucy, let's play with the orange balls!" They played with the orange balls and had a lot of fun. Lucy forgot about the orange crayons and was happy with her new orange balls.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog. His name was Max. Max loved to run and play in the park. He had a lot of friends. They all liked to play together.One day, Max and his friends had a fair. They played games, ate yummy treats, and had lots of fun. Max won a race and got a big bone. He was very happy.After the fair, Max was tired. He went home to relax. He lay down on his soft bed and closed his eyes. Max had a big smile on his face. He loved the fair and his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived in a small house with his mom and dad. In his room, he had a wide bed and a lamp on a table.One night, Tim could not sleep. He saw a bug on the wall. Tim called out to his mom, "Mom, there is a bug! I am scared!" His mom came into the room and turned on the lamp. She saw the bug and said, "Do not worry, Tim. I will take the bug away."Tim's mom took the bug outside. Then she came back in and said, "Now, go to sleep, Tim." But Tim asked, "Can we delay turning off the lamp? I am still scared." His mom smiled and said, "Okay, we can delay it a little bit." So, they kept the lamp on for a while, and Tim felt safe. Soon, he fell asleep with a smile on his face.

Once upon a time there was a hero who was very selfish. He never shared anything and would never help anyone no matter how hard they tried.One day, the hero was walking through the forest when he saw a small flower. He went over to it and decided to touch it. He did not think that would do any harm but it was a special flower and touching it made the hero angry. When he touched it, he wanted even more things for himself.The hero became even more selfish and started taking things from the people in the forest. He even started taking things from the animals. He would simply walk up and take whatever he wanted, no matter how much it hurt the other creatures.The hero touched so many things in the forest that it made everyone else so sad. Finally, the hero went too far and touched something that he should have never touched. The result was very bad and the hero was never seen again in the forest.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She had long brown hair and it always blew in the wind. She was very curious and always wanted to play. The little girl was exploring in her backyard one day when she noticed a package. It was wrapped in a shiny paper with a bow on top. It looked harmless, so she picked it up carefully. Inside the package, the little girl found something exciting. It was a game. She started to play and it was lots of fun! She played with it until the sun began to set. Once it was nighttime, the little girl carefully wrapped the game back up in the shiny paper. She put the bow on top and went back inside her house with a big smile on her face. She was so happy to have found such a harmless and fun surprise.

Once upon a time, there was a musician. He wore a black hat. He played music in the park.One day, a little cat came to the park. The cat liked the music. The cat stared at the musician. The musician stared back at the cat.The musician played a fun song. The cat danced to the music. Everyone in the park was happy. The cat and the musician became best friends. They played music and danced together every day.

One day, a fast car named Speedy went to a big house called a museum. In the museum, there were many things to see. Speedy liked the big animals and the old cars. He went around and saw many new things.Speedy met a girl named Lily. Lily could not hear, so she was deaf. But she was very good at talking with her hands. Speedy and Lily became friends. They played and looked at the things in the museum together.After playing, Speedy and Lily went outside. They had a race. Speedy was very fast, but Lily was fast too. They laughed and had fun. At the end of the day, they said goodbye. Speedy and Lily were happy they became friends at the museum.

Once upon a time, there was a big slide in the park. It was a gloomy day, and no kids were playing outside. A little boy named Tim wanted to play on the slide, but he was scared. He had never gone on the big slide before. So, Tim asked his mom for help.His mom mentioned that it was okay to be scared, but trying new things could be fun too. She told Tim that she would be there to help him. So, Tim and his mom went to the park and walked up to the big slide. Tim was still scared, but his mom held his hand.Tim slowly climbed up the steps and sat at the top of the slide. His mom was waiting at the bottom with a big smile. Tim took a deep breath and slid down the slide. He laughed and felt happy. He learned that trying new things could be fun, even if it was scary at first. And from that day on, Tim was never scared to try new things again.

Once upon a time there was a beautiful smooth shop. Little Joey was three years old and he wanted to know what was inside. He asked his mom to take him there.When they got to the shop, Joey's mom opened the door and they both stepped in. Joey couldn't believe his eyes. Everything inside was smooth! There were shelves full of smooth toys and a smooth counter where you could buy smooth things. Joey was so excited! He wanted to know more about the shop."So this is the shop! What can I buy here, Mommy?" Joey asked."Well, you can buy toys, snacks, and anything else you want," said his mom.Joey smiled. He already knew what he wanted to buy! He knew the shop would be one of his favorite places to explore.

Sam and Anna were best friends. They liked to play together every day. Sometimes they played with dolls, sometimes they played with cars, and sometimes they played pretend.One day, they decided to play pretend with a big box. They cut out a door and a window in the box and made it their house. They used a thread to make a curtain for the window and a blanket to make a roof."Let's imagine we are a family," said Sam. "I will be the dad and you will be the mom.""OK," said Anna. "And this is our baby." She held a stuffed bear in her arms.They had fun pretending to cook, clean, and take care of the baby. They also pretended to go to work, to the park, and to the store.But then, Sam had an idea. He wanted to pretend to be a superhero. He took a towel and tied it around his neck like a cape. He said, "I will be Super Sam. I can fly and save the world."Anna wanted to play along, but she also liked their house. She said, "But what about our baby? Who will take care of him?"Sam said, "You can be Super Anna. You can fly with me and help me fight the bad guys."Anna said, "But I like our house. It is cozy and nice. And our baby needs us. He might get lonely or scared."Sam said, "Don't worry. He will be fine. He has the thread curtain and the blanket roof. Come on, let's go."Anna felt sad. She wanted to be a good mom and a good friend. She didn't want to leave the baby or the house. But she also didn't want to make Sam unhappy. She didn't know what to do.She thought for a moment. Then she said, "How about this? We can take turns. First, you can be Super Sam and I will be the mom. Then, I can be Super An

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the kitchen with her mom. Lily liked to be useful and help her mom cook. One day, Lily's mom told her that they would make a yummy cake. Lily was very excited.Before they started, Lily's mom said, "Lily, please be careful and listen to me. If you don't, you might do something you regret." Lily nodded her head and promised to be careful. They started to make the cake, and Lily was very helpful. She gave her mom the eggs, the milk, and the sugar.But then, Lily saw a big jar of salt. She thought it would make the cake taste even better. She didn't listen to her mom and put a lot of salt in the cake mix. When they ate the cake, it tasted bad! Lily felt sad and regretted not listening to her mom. From that day on, Lily always listened to her mom and became even more useful in the kitchen.

Once upon a time, there was a graceful bird who could raise its wings high in the sky. The bird had a special power to make the sun shine bright. All the animals in the forest loved the bird and the warm sun.One day, a big, mean cloud came and blocked the sun. The animals were sad and cold. The graceful bird tried to use its power to make the sun shine again, but the cloud was too strong. The bird and the cloud had a big fight.The bird tried very hard to win, but the cloud was too big and mean. The bird got tired and could not raise its wings anymore. The sun did not come back, and the forest stayed dark and cold. The animals were sad, and they missed the warm sun and their graceful bird friend.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a happy puppy named Spot. Spot loved to play with his toys and run around in the yard. He had a big smile on his face every day because he was so happy.One day, Spot found a big box in the yard. He was curious and wanted to see what was inside. So, he used his paws to open the box. Inside the box, there were lots of toys for Spot to play with. He was so excited that he started to play with them right away.While playing, Spot accidentally broke one of the toys. He didn't mean to destroy it, but he was just so excited. Even though the toy was broken, Spot was still happy because he had so many other toys to play with. And from that day on, Spot learned to play more gently with his toys, so he wouldn't destroy them.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. He walked to a small creek near his house. He liked to gaze at the water and see the fish swimming. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing.Tim saw a big, red apple on the ground. It looked tasty. He picked it up and took a bite. As he ate the apple, something unexpected happened. The apple started to talk!"Please, don't eat me!" said the apple. Tim was very surprised. He didn't know apples could talk. The apple told Tim that it was a magic apple. It could make tasty food for him if he didn't eat it. Tim thought about it and decided to keep the magic apple.From that day on, Tim and the magic apple became good friends. The apple made tasty food for Tim, and they had lots of fun together. And every time they went to the creek, they would gaze at the water and remember the day they met.

Tom and Lily were friends who liked to play in the garden. One day, they found a big onion in the dirt. They wondered what it was and how it tasted."Let's race to the kitchen and ask Mom," Tom said."OK, but I will win," Lily said.They ran as fast as they could, holding the onion between them. They passed by the dog, the swing, and the flowers. They laughed and shouted as they raced.But when they got to the kitchen, Mom was not there. She was in the living room, talking on the phone. She looked at them and frowned."What are you doing with that onion?" she asked. "It's not a toy. It's for cooking."Tom and Lily stopped and looked at each other. They did not know what cooking was. They wanted to try the onion."Can we eat it?" Tom asked."No, you can't. It's very strong and spicy. It will make you cry," Mom said.She took the onion from them and put it on the counter. She told them to go and wash their hands.Tom and Lily were sad. They wanted to taste the onion. They thought it would be fun.They went to the bathroom and turned on the tap. They put their hands under the water. They felt something wet and cold on their fingers.They looked at their hands and saw that they were covered with onion juice. They smelled the onion and made a face."Yuck!" Tom said."Yuck!" Lily said.They rubbed their eyes and felt a sting. They started to cry.They ran back to the living room and hugged Mom. They told her they were sorry.Mom smiled and wiped their tears. She gave them a kiss and a cookie.She told them that onions were good for some things, but not for racing.Tom and Lily nodded and agreed. They decided to ra

Lily likes to play in the garden. She sees many things that make her happy. She sees flowers, birds, and bugs. She likes to watch the bugs and learn about them.One day, she sees a large ant. The ant is bigger than the other ants. It has a big head and big jaws. Lily thinks the ant is scary. She wants to run away. But she also wants to know more about the ant. She decides to be brave and watch the ant.She follows the ant as it walks on the ground. She sees the ant find a crumb of bread. The ant picks up the crumb with its jaws. The crumb is almost as big as the ant. Lily is amazed. She wonders how the ant can carry such a big thing.She sees the ant take the crumb to a hole. The hole is the ant's home. The ant goes inside the hole with the crumb. Lily wants to see what is inside the hole. She decides to peek inside.She bends down and puts her eye near the hole. She sees many ants inside. They are all busy. They are moving food, making tunnels, and taking care of eggs. Lily thinks the ants are smart and hard-working. She decides she likes the ants. She is not scared of them anymore.She smiles and says hello to the ants. She hopes they can hear her. She says thank you for letting her see their home. She decides to leave a piece of cookie for them. She thinks they will like it. She says goodbye to the ants and goes back to her mom. She tells her mom what she saw and learned. She says she wants to be friends with the ants. Her mom hugs her and says she is proud of her.

Tom and Sue like to play with fire. They find matches and light them. They watch the fire and laugh. They think fire is fun and pretty.One day, they play with fire in the kitchen. They see a big pot on the stove. They want to see what is inside. They climb on a chair and reach for the pot. But the pot is very hot. The fire under the pot makes it hot."Ow! Ow! Ow!" Tom screams. He drops the match and grabs his thumb. He burns his thumb on the pot. It hurts a lot. He cries and runs to his mom.Sue is scared. She sees the match fall on the floor. The match is still on fire. It catches the rug on fire. The rug burns and makes smoke. Sue coughs and runs to her mom.Mom sees Tom and Sue. She sees the fire and the smoke. She is very angry and scared. She grabs a bucket of water and throws it on the fire. She puts out the fire. She calls dad and tells him what happened."You two are crazy!" Mom yells. "You could have burned the house down! You could have hurt yourselves or me or dad! Fire is not a toy! Fire is dangerous! You are never ever to play with fire again! Do you understand?"Tom and Sue nod. They are sorry. They hug mom and say they are sorry. They show mom their thumbs. Mom puts ice on their thumbs. She kisses them and says she loves them. But she also says they are in big trouble. They have to go to their room and think about what they did. They have to learn to be safe and smart. They have to listen to mom and dad. They have to say no to fire.

Once upon a time, there was a big boat. The boat had a big anchor. One day, the boat met a little fish. The little fish was very flexible. It could bend and twist in the water.The boat said, "Little fish, will you stay and play with me?" The little fish said, "Yes, I will stay and play with you, big boat."The big boat dropped its anchor so it could stay in one place. The little fish swam around the anchor. It twisted and turned. The big boat watched the little fish play.As they played, a big wave came. The big boat and the little fish were scared. But the anchor held the big boat in place. The big boat and the little fish stayed safe.After the wave went away, the big boat and the little fish were happy. They stayed together and played every day. And they were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little brown dog named Penny. Penny loved to play in the park with her friends. One sunny day, Penny went to the park to find a new friend.Penny saw a big seat and a small boy sitting on it. She walked up to the boy and said, "Hello, can I sit on the seat with you?" The little boy smiled and said, "Yes, Penny! You can sit with me."They sat on the seat together, and Penny found a new friend. They played and laughed all day long. From that day on, Penny and her new friend would always meet at the park and share the seat, making many happy memories together.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a little girl named Anna. She had a best friend named Tom. They loved to play together and help others.One sunny day, Anna and Tom saw a baby bird that was not comfortable. It was very hot and the bird needed some fresh air to breathe. Anna said, "I recommend we help the bird get some oxygen." Tom agreed, and they both found a nice, shady spot under a tree where the bird could get fresh air.The baby bird felt better and thanked Anna and Tom for their help. The bird's mommy also thanked them and said, "You two are very kind. By helping others, you make the world a better place." Anna and Tom learned that it is important to help others and care for them. They promised to always be kind and helpful to everyone they meet.

One day, Tim and his mom went to the park. They saw a big, hot sun in the sky. Tim's mom had a bottle of bubbles. She blew some bubbles into the air. Tim liked to watch the bubbles float and pop."Can I blow bubbles too?" asked Tim. His mom gave him the bottle. Tim blew and blew, but no bubbles came out. He looked sad. His mom wanted to prevent him from being sad, so she had an idea."Let's try something new," she said. She put her finger over the top of the bottle and shook it. When she took her finger off, a big bubble came out! Tim was very happy. The big bubble floated higher and higher. Suddenly, the hot sun popped the big bubble, and it rained tiny bubbles all over the park. Tim and his mom laughed as they played in the unexpected bubble rain.

One day, a little gray bird was flying in the sky. The bird saw a big tree with many green leaves. The little bird wanted to find a leaf to rest on. He flew closer to the tree and saw a very nice leaf. The bird said, "I want to sit on that leaf!"The bird tried to land on the leaf, but it was not easy. He tried and tried, but he could not manage to sit on it. The bird was sad and asked the tree, "Can you help me sit on the leaf?" The tree said, "Yes, little bird, I will help you."The tree moved its branches and made it easy for the bird to land on the leaf. The bird was happy and said, "Thank you, tree!" The tree was happy too and said, "You're welcome, little bird. Rest on my leaf as long as you want." The little gray bird sat on the leaf and took a nice, long rest.

Once upon a time, there was a potato named Sam. Sam was so amazing, because he could guess what people were thinking. Every day, he would guess what people wanted to eat. One day, Sam had a problem. He guessed that everyone wanted to eat him! He didn't want to be eaten, so he ran away. Sam ran into the forest, and he looked around. Suddenly he saw a fox. The fox said, "I can help you. I know a secret hiding place." So the fox took Sam to a secret cave, and Sam was safe!The fox and Sam became friends, and they played together every day. Sam loved his new friend and soon he was not scared of being eaten anymore. Sam had an amazing adventure and he learned a lot!

Once upon a time, there was a painter. The painter liked to paint. One day, the painter saw a gray wall. The painter thought, "I want to make the gray wall pretty."The painter painted the gray wall with many colors. The wall became very pretty. People saw the pretty wall and smiled. The painter was happy to see people smile.Then, the painter realized something. The painter learned that making things pretty can make people happy. The painter felt good inside. The moral of the story is to do nice things for others to make them happy.

Once upon a time, there was a funny dog named Max. Max liked to wear crazy pants. One day, Max went outside to play with his friend, a cat named Lily.Max said, "Lily, look at my crazy pants!" Lily laughed and said, "Max, you remind me of a clown!" They played together and had lots of fun.At the end of the day, Max and Lily were tired. They sat down under a big tree. Max said, "I love my crazy pants. They make everyone smile." Lily agreed and said, "Yes, they remind us to be happy and have fun." And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a brave bird named Mark. Mark had big wings and he loved to fly high in the sky. Mark was the bravest bird in the whole forest.One day, Mark saw a little cat stuck in a tree. The cat was scared and needed help. Mark used his strong wings to fly up to the cat. He was not scared, because he was very brave.Mark used his beak to help the cat climb down the tree. The cat was so happy to be back on the ground. All the animals in the forest cheered for Mark and his brave wings. From that day on, Mark and the cat were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little bug named Tim. Tim liked to crawl on the ground. One day, Tim met a big bug named Sam. Sam was rough and had a big voice.Sam said, "Hey Tim, do you want to play a quiz? It will be fun!" Tim was scared but he wanted to try. They started the quiz. Sam asked, "What is the color of the sky?" Tim said, "Blue!" Sam asked, "What is the color of grass?" Tim said, "Green!"Tim and Sam played the quiz all day. They became good friends. They crawled together and they laughed together. Even though Sam was rough, he was a good friend to Tim. And they lived happily ever after.

Anna and Ben are playing with dolls in the park. Anna has a new doll that looks like a princess. She has long hair, a shiny dress and a crown. Ben has an old doll that looks like a pirate. He has a patch, a hat and a sword."Your doll is so pretty," Ben says to Anna. "Can I hold her?""Okay, but be careful," Anna says. She gives her doll to Ben. Ben stares at the doll. He sees something on her face."What is this?" Ben asks. He points to a spot on the doll's skin. It is peeling off."Oh, that's nothing," Anna says. "She just has some fake skin. It comes off sometimes. It's not a big deal."Ben does not like the fake skin. He thinks it is ugly and weird. He gives the doll back to Anna."I don't like your doll," Ben says. "She is not real. My doll is real. He has real skin and real hair and real clothes."Anna is hurt by Ben's words. She likes her doll very much. She thinks she is beautiful and special."That's not nice, Ben," Anna says. "My doll is real too. She is real to me. I love her. And she has real hair and real clothes too. They are just different from yours."Ben and Anna start to argue. They do not want to play with each other anymore. They take their dolls and go to different sides of the park. They are both sad and angry. They miss their friend.

Once upon a time, a boy named Tim had a toy boat. He liked to play with his boat and sail it in the water. One day, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue had a toy rocket that could fly into space. They both wanted to play together.Tim said to Sue, "Let's sail my boat on the water and then fly your rocket into space!" Sue agreed and said, "Yes, let's do it!" So, they went to the pond and sailed Tim's boat. The boat moved smoothly on the water. They had a lot of fun.After they sailed the boat, they played with Sue's rocket. They pretended the rocket flew high into space. They imagined they were astronauts exploring new planets. Tim and Sue had a great day playing with their toys and made new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim all day in the big pond. One day, while swimming, Fin saw a big statue in the middle of the pond. The statue was of a big fish just like him.Fin was anxious because he had never seen a statue before. He swam closer to the statue and said, "Hello, big fish! Do you want to swim with me?" But the statue did not answer. Fin tried again, "Please talk to me, big fish. I want to be friends!" Still, the statue did not say anything.Fin felt sad and swam back to his friends. He told them about the big fish statue. They all swam together to see the statue. When they saw it, they all knew it was just a statue and not a real fish. They laughed and played around the statue, and Fin was not anxious anymore. From that day on, Fin and his friends loved to swim around the big fish statue and have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a hero. He was brave and strong. He was always doing nice things for people and everyone loved him.One day, the hero decided to show everyone how strong and brave he was. He decided to do a long, long jump. He jumped higher and higher and everyone was so proud of him. “That was amazing!” one of his friends said. “I bet no one else could do such a long jump. You’re a true hero!”The hero was so proud. He smiled, and showed everyone his strength once more. He jumped even higher this time, and the crowd cheered and clapped. The hero was so happy. He knew he had done something special. He had shown everyone how brave and strong he was.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a light shop. The shop was very pretty. It had many bright lights. The shop was run by a nice man named Tom. Tom loved to see the sun rise. Every morning, he would watch the sun come up before he opened the shop.One day, a little boy named Sam came to the shop. He wanted a light for his room. Sam said, "Tom, can you help me find a light for my room?" Tom smiled and showed Sam all the lights in the shop. They looked at many lights, but Sam could not find one he liked.As they were looking, a big wind came. The wind blew the door open. Tom and Sam tried to close the door, but the wind was too strong. The wind blew all the lights down. The lights broke and made a big mess.Tom and Sam were very sad. The shop was now dark and not pretty anymore. The lights were all gone, and Sam could not find a light for his room. The sun began to set, and the day was over. Tom closed the shop, and they both went home with no light.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to gaze at the sky and watch the birds fly by. One day, Tim saw a big bird holding a cookie in its beak. Tim wanted that cookie very much.Tim had an idea. He climbed up a tree to get closer to the big bird. As he got closer, he could see that the cookie was spicy. Tim loved spicy cookies, so he reached out to grab it from the bird.But the big bird did not want to share the cookie. It flew away very fast, and Tim lost his balance. He fell from the tree and landed on the ground. The spicy cookie was gone, and Tim was sad. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big, hairy dog named Bob. Bob loved to run and play in the park. One day, while playing with his ball, Bob saw a small cat. The cat was very scared of the big, hairy dog.Bob wanted to learn how to be friends with the small cat. He tried to play with the cat, but the cat ran away. Bob felt sad and did not understand why the cat was scared. He wanted to learn how to make the cat happy.Then, something unexpected happened. Bob found a toy mouse and gave it to the cat. The cat loved the toy mouse! They both played together and became best friends. Bob learned that sometimes, to make friends, you need to share what they love. And the cat learned that even big, hairy dogs can be kind and gentle. They played and laughed, and there was no more pain from being scared or alone.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his marbles. He had big ones, small ones, and some that were very pretty. He played with them all day long.One day, Tim found a yummy candy. He was very happy and wanted to eat it. But, he was also playing with his marbles at the same time. By mistake, he put a marble in his mouth instead of the candy. He started to chew the marble. It was very hard and not yummy at all. Tim was scared and did not know what to do.His mom heard him cry and came running. She saw the marble and quickly took it out of his mouth. Tim was safe now, and he learned a big lesson. From that day on, Tim never played with his marbles while eating. He knew it was not safe to do both at the same time. And the yummy candy? His mom let him eat it after all, but only when he put his marbles away.

One day, a fat cat named Tom saw a red wagon. He wanted to play with it. He tried to pull the wagon, but it was too heavy. Tom let out a big sigh.Tom saw his friend, a dog named Max. "Max, can you help me pull the wagon?" Tom asked. Max nodded and said, "Yes, I will help you, Tom." They tried to pull the wagon together, but it was still too heavy. They both sighed.Then, they saw a big horse named Sam. "Sam, can you help us pull the wagon?" Max asked. Sam said, "Of course, I can help you." With Sam's help, they pulled the wagon easily. Tom, Max, and Sam were happy and played with the wagon all day.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Abby. She had long brown hair and loved to play. One day she wanted to go for a walk in the park.Her mom agreed and said "Your walk should include a long leg." Abby knew exactly what this meant. She raced off to the park with a smile on her face.At the park, Abby saw some other children playing. She ran up to them with enthusiasm and asked, "Do you want to play with me?"The children said "Sure! What games do you want to play?""We should play tag with our long legs," Abby said. The other children laughed and agreed.The kids ran around the park, pretending to be airplanes with their long legs and playing tag until they grew tired. Abby smiled and said "That was so much fun!" and thanked the others for playing. Then she thanked her mom for suggesting she include a long leg in her walk.

Once upon a time, there was a stubborn child named Tim. He did not like to learn new things. One day, his mom tried to teach him how to tie his shoes. "Tim, let me show you how to tie your shoes," said Mom. But Tim said, "No, I don't want to learn."Mom was sad, but she had an idea. She asked Tim's big sister, Sue, to help. Sue was good at teaching. Sue said, "Tim, if you learn how to tie your shoes, you can play with my toy car."Tim loved toy cars, so he said, "Okay, I will try." Sue showed him how to tie his shoes, and Tim listened carefully. After a few tries, Tim could tie his shoes all by himself. He was very happy, and so was his mom. Tim learned that it was good to try new things, even if he was stubborn.

Lila and Ben like to play in the kitchen. They have a big bowl and a big spoon. They pretend to make soup with water and toys. They stir and stir and stir. They say, "Mmm, yummy soup!"One day, they see a jar on the shelf. It has something shiny and sparkly inside. They want to see what it is. They climb on a chair and reach for the jar. But the jar is fragile. It breaks when they touch it. The shiny and sparkly thing is glitter. It flies out of the jar and goes everywhere.The wind comes in from the window. It blows the glitter all over the kitchen. It makes a big mess. Lila and Ben are scared. They say, "Uh-oh, Mommy will be mad!"Mommy comes in and sees the glitter. She is not mad. She smiles and says, "Wow, what a beautiful soup you made! It looks like magic!" She hugs Lila and Ben and says, "But next time, please be careful with the fragile jar. It was a gift from Grandma."Lila and Ben say, "Sorry, Mommy. We love you and Grandma." They help Mommy clean up the glitter. They still like to play in the kitchen. But they do not touch the fragile jar anymore. They stir and stir and stir their water and toys. They say, "Mmm, yummy soup!"

Once upon a time, in a peaceful forest, there was a very big log. The log was very old and had many holes in it. One day, a little squirrel named Sam found the log and thought it would be a good place to live.Sam started to fill the holes in the log with leaves and nuts to make it a cozy home. He worked very hard and soon, the log was full of soft leaves and tasty nuts. Sam was very happy and proud of his new home.One day, a big storm came and the wind blew very hard. The wind was so strong that it blew all the leaves and nuts out of the log. Sam was sad, but then he saw other animals who lost their homes too. Sam decided to share his log with his new friends. They all worked together to fill the log again. In the end, Sam learned that sharing and helping others can bring happiness and make the world a better place.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He lived near a big lake. One day, he saw an unusual kayak by the water. It was very pretty and had many colors. Tim wanted to see it up close.As he got closer, he saw the kayak start to glow. Tim was very excited. He said, "Wow! I want to touch it!" When Tim touched the kayak, it glowed even more. The colors were so bright and pretty. Tim knew this was a special kayak.Tim decided to take the glowing kayak for a ride. He got in and started to paddle. As he paddled, the kayak glowed brighter and brighter. Tim's friends saw the glowing kayak and called out, "Hey Tim, your kayak is so cool!" Tim smiled and waved, happy to share his unusual glowing kayak with his friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim saw a big dog. The dog was lost and sad. Tim wanted to help the dog. He said, "Come with me, dog. I will find your home."They walked and walked. The dog was very dependable. It did not run away. Tim saw a girl named Sue. Sue said, "I know this dog. His name is Max. His home is far away."Tim and Sue had a problem. They did not know how to get Max home. They thought and thought. Then, they had an idea. They would ask for help.They went to a big man. The man said, "Welcome! I know Max. I can take him home." Tim and Sue were happy. The big man took Max home. Tim and Sue felt good. They had helped their new friend Max.

Once upon a time there were two friends named Lilly and Jill. They lived next to each other and would play together every day. One day, they heard a special kind of noise and decided they wanted to go and explore.They followed the noise and found a grocery store. They looked inside and were amazed to see all the delicious snacks and treats. They decided to enter the store and take a closer look.Once inside, they noticed that the store was running a special competition. Everyone who bought groceries had to balance them in their hands while they walked around the store. Whoever managed to keep the groceries balanced the longest would win the competition.Lilly and Jill couldn't resist the challenge, so they both began loading up their arms with groceries. The competition started and the two girls began walking around the store together.They stayed in the competition for a long time, but in the end, Lilly found it too hard to balance all her groceries and had to drop out. Jill, however, kept all her groceries balanced and won the competition!Lilly was a bit disappointed, but she was proud of her friend for being so competitive and and winning the challenge. They both celebrated with snacks from the store and went happily back home.

Once upon a time, there was a bird who could fly very high. The bird was nervous because it had never flown so high before. One day, the bird met a doctor who was also a friend.The doctor said, "Little bird, you can fly very high, but be careful not to go too high." The bird was still nervous, but it listened to the doctor's words.One day, the bird decided to fly very high, even though the doctor told it not to. It went higher and higher into the sky. The bird was so high that it could not see the ground anymore. It was scared and wanted to go back down, but it could not find its way.Then, the bird got very tired and could not fly anymore. It fell from the sky and did not get up again. The doctor was sad when he found the bird on the ground, but he knew that he had warned the bird about flying too high.

Once upon a time, there was a charming dog named Spot. Spot loved to wear a big red hat. He felt very happy when he wore his hat. One sunny day, he went to the park to play with his friends.At the park, Spot met a little cat named Fluffy. Fluffy saw the big red hat on Spot's head and said, "Wow, Spot! I like your hat! Can I wear it too?" Spot smiled and said, "Sure, Fluffy! You can wear my hat for a little while."Fluffy put on the big red hat and they played together all day. They ran, they jumped, and they laughed. When it was time to go home, Fluffy gave the hat back to Spot. They both agreed that sharing the hat made their day even more fun. From that day on, Spot and Fluffy became the best of friends.

Once upon a time there was a tall desk in a deep dark room. A little boy, who was only 3 years old, named Jack was walking by that room and he suddenly stopped in front of the desk. He wondered what was inside it. As he was about to open the drawer, he heard a voice."Hello, who is there?" the voice said.Jack was surprised because he had no idea where the voice was coming from. He looked around and couldn't see anyone, until suddenly he noticed a little creature sitting behind the desk."I'm Jack," he said."Oh, it's nice to meet you Jack!" the creature said with a smile.Jack looked at the creature. It was quite small compared to the tall desk, so he had to look up to see it."What's your name?" Jack asked. "My name is Mr. Desk," the creature replied.Jack was a bit shocked, he had never met a desk before. "It's nice to meet you, Mr. Desk," he said.Mr. Desk smiled. "It's nice to meet you too Jack. Do you want to explore this room with me?"And so, Jack and Mr. Desk went on an adventure in the deep dark room. They explored, laughed and made new friends. Jack had a great time, and it was

Tommy was walking in the park enjoying a nice day. He saw an old man sitting on a bench. The old man turned to Tommy and said, “Hello there, young man. Can I tell you a story?" Tommy nodded, eager to hear the story. The old man said, “Once upon a time there was a boy who was very naughty. He did bad things and evn tore up the streets. One day, the police came to arrest him. He was so fearful and he was put in jail. ” Tommy was scared. He didn't want to end up in jail. He started running. But then he slipped and fell. The police were there in a split second and arrested Tommy. They put him in jail. Tommy became sad and fearful. His dreams of becoming a firefighter were gone. He had to stay in jail - forever.

Once upon a time there was a blue laundry basket. It was round and soft and it held lots of clothes.Every day the laundry basket was filled with shirts and socks and towels. Then Mama or Daddy would take it away. After a few days, the laundry basket came back full of clean, nice-smelling clothes. Mama or Daddy would put the clothes away.Sometimes, when Mama or Daddy was putting the clothes away, they would remind the little girl how important it is to keep the laundry basket full. That way, when it was time for the laundry to go away and get washed, the little girl would already have plenty of clothes ready to go.The little girl nodded and smiled. She knew it was important to listen to Mama and Daddy, so she made sure to keep the laundry basket full. She especially liked putting her special blue shirt in it; it would remind her of her Mama and Daddy.

Once upon a time, in a small house, a boy named Tim lived with his mom. They had a big tree in their yard. The tree had many pears. The pears were big, round, and green. Tim liked to eat pears. But, Tim was small, and he could not reach the pears on the tree.One cold day, Tim saw a pear on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to his mom. "Look, Mom! I found a pear!" he said. His mom smiled and said, "Good job, Tim! Let's eat it together."Tim and his mom sat down to eat the pear. They cut it into pieces. The pear was sweet and juicy. Tim was happy. He wanted to reach more pears from the tree. So, he asked his mom, "Can you help me reach the pears on the tree?"His mom said, "Yes, Tim. I will help you." She picked up Tim and lifted him high. Tim reached for the pears. He got a big, green pear from the tree. Tim and his mom ate more pears. They were very happy. And from that day on, they always reached for pears together.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play basketball in the park. They have a big orange basketball that bounces high. They take turns to throw the basketball into the hoop.One day, a nosy boy comes to the park. He sees Lily and Ben playing basketball. He wants to play too, but he does not ask nicely. He says, "Give me the basketball. I am better than you. You are too small and slow."Lily and Ben do not like the nosy boy. He is rude and mean. They say, "No, you cannot have our basketball. It is ours. We are playing nicely. You are not. Go away."The nosy boy gets angry. He tries to grab the basketball from Lily and Ben. He pushes and pulls and shouts. Lily and Ben hold on to the basketball. They do not let go.A lady sees the nosy boy. She is the park keeper. She comes to Lily and Ben. She says, "What is going on here? Why are you fighting over the basketball?"Lily and Ben tell the lady what happened. They tell her that the nosy boy was rude and mean. They tell her that he did not ask nicely. They tell her that he tried to take their basketball.The lady nods. She says, "I see. That is not nice at all. The nosy boy should say sorry. He should learn to share and be polite. He should not bother you when you are playing nicely."The lady takes the nosy boy by the hand. She says, "Come with me. We need to talk. You need to learn some manners. You need to say sorry to Lily and Ben."The nosy boy hangs his head. He says, "Sorry, Lily and Ben. Sorry, lady. I was wrong. I will not do it again."Lily and Ben smile. They say, "Thank you, lady. Thank you, nosy boy. We forgive you. Maybe you can play with

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a terrible mess in her room. There were toys, clothes, and papers everywhere. Sue's mom told her she needed to clean her room.Sue started to clean her room. She found a note under her bed. The note was from her friend, Tom. It said, "Let's play at the park." Sue smiled and put the note in her pocket. She kept cleaning until her room was nice and tidy.When Sue was done cleaning her room, she showed her mom. Her mom was very happy. Sue took the note out of her pocket and showed her mom. They both went to the park to play with Tom. They had a great day, and Sue learned that cleaning her room was important.

One day, a boy named Tim went to play in the park. He saw a big slide and wanted to do some fun. He climbed up and slid down fast. Tim was very happy.Then, Tim saw a puddle. It was wet from the rain. He jumped in it and splashed water. His feet got wet, but he did not care. Tim laughed and jumped some more.After playing in the wet puddle, Tim went back to the slide. He did more fun things at the park. When it was time to go home, he was tired but happy. He could not wait to play at the park again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pretty bag made of leather. She loved her bag and took it everywhere she went. It was attractive and all her friends liked it too.One sunny day, Lily and her friends went to the park to play. They ran, jumped, and played games. Suddenly, Lily's bag split and her toys fell out. She was sad and didn't know what to do.But then, something unexpected happened. A kind squirrel saw Lily's bag and quickly fixed it with some leaves and sticks. The bag looked even more attractive now! Lily and her friends were so happy. They thanked the squirrel and continued playing with their new, special bag.

Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Tim. He had a cup that he loved very much. Every day, he would fill the cup with water and drink from it. One day, Tim saw a rock near his house. He thought it would be fun to talk to the rock."Hi, rock," said Tim. "Do you want to be my friend?" To his surprise, the rock answered, "Yes, Tim, I would like to be your friend!"Tim was so happy to have a new friend. He played with the rock all day. They had fun running, jumping, and laughing. Then, Tim had an idea. He ran inside and got his cup. He filled it with water and brought it to the rock."Here, rock, have some water," Tim said, pouring the water on the rock. Suddenly, the rock began to shake and change. It grew bigger and bigger until it turned into a big, friendly dog!The dog wagged its tail and licked Tim's face. "Thank you, Tim," said the dog. "I was a dog turned into a rock by a mean witch. You saved me with your kindness and your cup of water!"From that day on, Tim and the dog were the best of friends. They played together every day and had lots of fun. And Tim learned that even the smallest act of kindness could make a big difference.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to play in her garden. It was a normal day, and the sun was shining. Lily loved her garden because it had many pretty flowers and soft grass.While playing, Lily saw a small bird on the ground. The bird was crying. Lily felt sad for the bird and asked, "Why do you cry, little bird?" The bird looked at Lily and said, "I can't fly. My wing hurts."Lily wanted to help the bird. She picked up the bird and took it to her mom. Her mom put a band-aid on the bird's wing. The bird stopped crying and said, "Thank you, Lily and Mom." The bird then flew away, happy and free. Lily felt happy too because she helped her new friend.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a young boy named Tim. Tim liked to help his mom and dad. He would provide them with things they needed, like toys for his baby sister, and food for the family dog, Spot.One sunny day, Tim went to the park with his mom, dad, baby sister, and Spot. They played with a ball and had lots of fun. They had not had lunch yet, so they decided to go home and eat some sandwiches.When they got home, they found a surprise! There was a big, colorful box in front of their door. Tim's dad opened the box, and inside was a big cake! Tim and his family did not know who sent the cake, but they were very happy. They all enjoyed the cake and had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sara. She had a small stand in her yard. Sara loved to make spicy food. One day, she made some spicy soup to sell at her stand.A boy named Tom walked by and saw Sara's stand. He said, "What do you have here?" Sara replied, "I have spicy soup. Would you like to try some?" Tom said, "Yes, please!" He tasted the soup and it was very spicy. He liked it a lot!Tom told his friends about Sara's spicy soup. Soon, many kids came to try it. They all loved the spicy soup. Sara was happy that everyone liked her soup. From that day on, Sara's stand was very popular in her town.

Once upon a time, there was a big, attractive park. In the middle of the park, there was a tall slide. Kids loved to play on the slide all day long.One sunny day, two friends, Tom and Sue, went to the park to play. Tom said, "Sue, let's go on the slide!" Sue was scared, but she wanted to try. So, they went to the slide and climbed up. Tom went down the slide first, and he laughed. Sue went down the slide next, and she laughed too. They had lots of fun.As the sun began to set, it was time to go home. Tom and Sue knew they had to leave the park. They said goodbye to the slide and walked close together, holding hands. They learned that trying new things can be fun and that it's important to be brave.

One day, a small cat named Kitty went out to play. She liked to match things, like her toys and her socks. Kitty was very good at matching. She had a lot of fun and was very happy.But then, Kitty found some trouble. She saw a big dog who was sad. The dog lost his toy bone and could not find it. Kitty wanted to help the big dog, so she looked for the bone. She looked under the tree, behind the bush, and in the grass.Kitty found a bone that looked like the dog's toy bone, but it was not the same. It was a real bone! The big dog was very surprised and happy. He did not know he wanted a real bone. Kitty and the dog played with the real bone and became good friends. The trouble was gone, and they had a fun day.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Kim. She was 3 years old and was feeling sad. Her mommy and daddy asked a nice lady called the tutor to help her.The tutor was gentle and spoke softly. She asked Kim why she was sad and Kim said she missed her friends. The tutor comforted her and said she would teach her fun things to do.Kim learnt to count, draw pictures and how to write her name. She was happy when she finished and the tutor hugged her. Kim was so happy she laughed.The tutor stayed with Kim for a few weeks and she became Kim's best friend. She taught her lots of fun things. Kim's parents were happy to see their little girl so happy.The tutor left with a big smile and Kim hugged her goodbye. Kim said she would miss the tutor and asked if she could come visit again. The tutor said of course she could and gave Kim a big hug. Kim was so happy that she never felt sad again.

Once upon a time, in a peaceful town, there was a big building called a university. People went there to learn many things. One day, a little boy named Timmy went to the university with his mom.Timmy's mom said, "I recommend you listen and learn, Timmy." Timmy nodded and promised to listen well. They walked inside the university and saw many people talking and laughing.Suddenly, a big, loud noise came from outside. Everyone was surprised! Timmy and his mom ran outside to see what happened. A big truck had dropped a lot of ice cream on the ground. Everyone laughed and enjoyed the sweet treat. The unexpected ice cream made the peaceful day even more fun.

Once upon a time in a big forest, there was a bear. This bear was very long. One day, the long bear saw a sign. The sign had a picture of a bear and an arrow. The long bear thought, "I am a bear. I should follow the arrow."The long bear walked and walked. He followed the arrow on the sign. He saw another sign with a bear and an arrow. The long bear was very happy. He thought, "I will find something good at the end."At last, the long bear found a big box. He was very excited. He thought there would be food inside. But when he opened the box, he found a long, soft bed. The long bear was tired from walking. He lay down on the bed and slept. When he woke up, he was so happy. He had the best sleep ever. The signs had led him to a perfect bed just for him.

Once there was a silly avocado. He always wanted to raise up high. One day he asked the other avocados for help. "Will you help me raise up?" he asked them.The other avocados shook their heads. They said it was too hard for them.The silly avocado didn't give up. He kept asking everyone for help. Finally a kind bird said, "I'll help you."The bird flew around the silly avocado. With a strong flap of her wings, she raised him up into the sky.The silly avocado was so happy! He thanked the kind bird and flew away. From then on, he could raise up all by himself.

Once upon a time, there was a brown dog named Buddy. Buddy liked to work with his best friend, a lawyer named Tom. They would go to Tom's office every day to help people.One day, a little girl named Lucy came to the office. She was sad because she lost her toy. Buddy wanted to help Lucy find her toy. Tom said to Lucy, "Don't worry, we will find your toy."Buddy and Tom looked all around the town for the toy. They looked in the park, at the store, and at the school. Finally, they found the toy under a big tree. Lucy was so happy to have her toy back. She thanked Buddy and Tom for their help. From that day on, Lucy, Buddy, and Tom became great friends.

Lily and Ben were twins who liked to play in the garden. They enjoyed digging, watering and picking flowers. One day, they saw a bright red berry on a bush. It looked yummy and juicy."Can we eat it?" Lily asked Ben."I don't know," Ben said. "Maybe it is poison. Poison is bad. It makes you sick or sleepy.""Let's ask Mom," Lily said. "She is dependable. She knows everything."They ran to the house and showed Mom the berry. Mom looked at it and shook her head."No, no, no," she said. "This is not a berry. This is a cherry tomato. It is not poison. It is good. You can eat it, but only after you wash it."She took them to the sink and helped them wash the cherry tomato. Then she cut it in half and gave one piece to each twin."Mmm, this is delicious," Lily said."Thank you, Mom," Ben said.They smiled and hugged Mom. They were happy and safe. They enjoyed their snack.

One day, a cat and a dog were playing in the yard. The cat saw a wire on the ground. "Look, Dog, I found a wire!" said the cat. They both looked at the wire and thought it was easy to play with.As they were playing, the wire started to move. The cat and the dog were very surprised. "Why is the wire moving?" asked the dog. They followed the wire and found a big hole in the ground. The wire went into the hole.The cat and the dog were curious, so they went into the hole too. Inside the hole, they found a magic bunny. The bunny said, "Hello, I am a magic bunny! I can make things vanish!" The cat and the dog were amazed. They asked the bunny to make the wire vanish. The bunny waved its paw and the wire vanished. The cat and the dog were very happy and thanked the magic bunny. They all became good friends and played together every day.

Once there was a little girl named Anna. Anna was so small and was only three years old. One Sunday, Anna and her family went on a picnic.Anna was so excited to try all the wonderful treats at the picnic. She ate and ate until her tummy was very full. But even though her tummy was full, Anna kept eating.Soon, Anna could feel her stomach struggle to hold all the food. Her stomach hurt and Anna had to stop eating.Anna felt so sad that she couldn't keep eating the amazing treats. She wished she listened to her parents earlier and stopped eating sooner.The next time Anna went on a picnic, she remembered to listen to her parents' advice. She ate only until her stomach felt full and felt so happy that she made the right choice. Anna learned that it's ok to eat amazing treats, but to only eat until her tummy is full. That way, she can enjoy the treats without making her stomach struggle!

Once upon a time, there was a farmer. He had an impressive big red barn. The farmer had two animals, a cat and a dog. The cat and the dog would often disagree and not get along.One sunny day, the cat said to the dog, "I think I can jump higher than you!" The dog said, "No, I can jump higher!" They decided to have a contest to see who could jump the highest.The farmer watched as the cat and the dog took turns jumping. The cat jumped very high, but the dog jumped even higher. The cat was sad, but the dog was happy. The farmer said, "Good job, both of you!" From that day on, the cat and the dog learned to get along and not disagree so much.

One day, a tough bunny named Bob was hopping in the forest. He loved to spring high into the air and feel the wind in his fur. While he was playing, he met a squirrel named Sam."Hi, Bob!" said Sam. "Do you want to play with me?""Yes, Sam! Let's spring high and find nuts," said Bob.As they played, Bob felt something strange in his mouth. His tooth was loose! He was scared and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, the tooth fell out! Bob and Sam looked at the tooth on the ground."Don't worry, Bob," said Sam. "You will grow a new tooth soon."Bob felt better and they kept playing. Then, something unexpected happened. A fairy appeared and picked up Bob's tooth. She smiled and gave Bob a big, shiny nut."Thank you for your tooth, Bob," said the fairy. "This nut is a gift for you."Bob and Sam were so happy. They thanked the fairy and shared the nut. From that day on, they knew that losing a tooth could bring a nice surprise.

Mum and Dad were having a picnic by the lake. The sun was shining and Dad wanted to show Mum something special.Dad said, “Look!” He was pointing at a big old log by the edge of the lake.Mum said, “What is it?”Dad smiled and said, “It's an old log. Look, I'm going to show you how to make it float.”Mum watched as Dad waded into the water. Dad picked up the log and set it gently into the lake. Slowly, it began to float away.Mum was amazed. “That was successful!” she said.Dad smiled and said, “There you go. That's how you make a log float.”

Once there was a small boy named Jack. He was only three years old and he lived in a little cabin with his family. Jack really wanted to learn to print the words and letters, so Mommy and Daddy said he could try.One day Jack asked, "Can I print something now?" Mommy smiled and said, "Yes, that sounds like a good idea!"Jack happily went to the table with some paper and a pencil and tried his best to print. But every time he tried, he felt a little fearful. He wasn't sure he could do it.Mommy noticed how frightened he was and said, "It's okay, Jack. You can take your time. Just try it a few times and I'm sure you will get it." Jack smiled and tried again. After a few more tries, he finally printed a beautiful "A". He was so excited and ran to show Mommy and Daddy.Daddy said, "Wow, that's amazing Jack! You did it!"Jack felt so proud of himself and from that day on he practiced everyday until he was able to print all of the letters of the alphabet.

Harry was looking at the window of the store, wishing he could get everything he sees. He had a pocket filled with coins, but he knew it wouldn't be enough. That's when he noticed a woman walking by with a bag of goodies.Harry noticed the bag had something he wanted in it. He ran up to her, asking her if he could buy it. She replied with a bitter no. But then the shopkeeper called out to the woman and said that she had a special order to make.Harry saw this as the perfect opportunity. He asked the shopkeeper if he could buy the order instead. The shopkeeper agreed, but reminded him that he didn't have enough coins. Harry looked around, feeling helpless, until he noticed the woman was staring at him.Harry knew what he had to do. Even thought it was a bit bitter, he started to beg her for the money. After a minute of begging, she finally agreed and handed him the coins. Harry stopped in awe, but thanked her as he ran off to buy the order.The woman gave him a knowing look and smiled, as if she knew what she was doing when she gave him the money. Little did Harry know, this act of kindness would change his life.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely little girl named Lily. She was a pupil in a small school. One day, she wanted to have a party at her house. She was very excited and started to invite her friends.But, there was a problem. Lily had a big fight with her friend, Tom. They were not talking to each other. Lily did not want to invite Tom to her party. Everyone in the school was talking about the party and Tom felt very sad.Lily saw Tom was sad and thought about it. She knew it was not nice to leave him out. So, she went to Tom and said sorry. She invited him to the party, too. Tom was happy and they became friends again. They all had a great time at the party and played fun games together.

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing with his bubble toy. He loved to watch the bubbles float in the air. He was very happy. Tim saw his friend, a little girl named Jane, coming to play."Look, Jane! I have a bubble toy!" Tim said. Jane was impatient. She wanted to play with the bubble toy too. "Can I try?" she asked. Tim paused for a moment, then said, "Yes, let's take turns."They took turns blowing bubbles. They laughed as the bubbles floated around them. They tried to catch the bubbles, but they would pop. They played until the sun went down, and it was time to go home.

Tom and Lily are playing with blocks. They like to make different shapes with the blocks. They make a house, a car, a boat and a star."Look, I made a star!" Lily says. "It is yellow and shiny.""That is a nice star," Tom says. "But I like my boat better. It is blue and fast."They hear their mom calling them. "Tom, Lily, hurry! It is time for lunch!"They look at the clock. It is noon. They are hungry."Let's go, Lily," Tom says. "We can play with the blocks later."They pick up their blocks and put them in a box. The box is useful. It helps them keep their blocks together.They run to the kitchen. Their mom has made sandwiches and juice for them."Thank you, mom," they say. "We love you."They sit down and eat their lunch. They tell their mom about the shapes they made with the blocks.Their mom smiles and listens. She is proud of them. They are smart and creative.

Once upon a time, there was a careful child. They liked to play outside. One day, the child disagreed with their mum. The mum was sad and the child felt bad so they tried to say sorry. They said nice things with a big smile and gave their mum a hug.After that, the child was very careful. They tried hard to listen, do what they were supposed to, and always be kind. The mum was happy and said, "Thank you for being careful and listening."From then on, whenever the child and mummy disagreed, the child was careful. They took their time to hear each other out and find a way to make both of them happy. The end.

One day, Daisy and her parents were playing outside. Daisy could see the porch from their backyard. She liked the porch because it was soft. Daisy hopped over to the porch and stood on it. "Do you want to take a walk around the porch?" asked her dad. Daisy nodded excitedly.As Daisy and her parents walked around the porch, Daisy hopped from one soft spot to another. She loved feeling the softness beneath her feet. She looked up and saw the clouds in the sky. She waved to the birds that flew around chirping.At the end of their walk, Daisy ran back to the porch and hopped around it. "Let's go hop again tomorrow!" she said, smiling. Her parents agreed, and together they went back inside.
