Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sally. She was walking through a meadow when she saw a hungry bee. The bee had gathered some pollen and wanted a lemon to sweeten it. Sally had a lemon in her pocket, but she felt bad for the bee. She didn't want to give it away.The bee started to urge her to give it the lemon, but Sally wasn't sure. She wanted the lemon for herself. She was feeling sleepy, so she decided to take a nap and think about what she should do.While Sally was sleeping, the bee got closer and closer. It kept urging her to give it the lemon. Suddenly, Sally woke up when the bee started to buzz in her ear. She quickly grabbed the lemon and threw it at the bee.The bee flew away with the lemon, happy that it got what it wanted. Sally was glad that she had been able to help the bee, even though she was a bit sleepy.

Once upon a time, there was a little gray bird named Tim. Tim was sad because he did something he didn't want to do. He felt regret. He was not happy. Tim wanted to make things better.One day, Tim heard some news. A big party was happening in the park. Tim thought, "I can go to the party and make new friends. That will help me feel better." So, Tim flew to the park to join the party.At the party, Tim met other birds who were happy to play with him. They sang songs and played games. Tim started to feel better. He learned that even when you feel regret, you can make things better by trying new things and making new friends. And Tim was never sad again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to watch the world outside his window. Every day, he would see birds, cars, and people walk by.One day, Tim saw a rich man with a big hat. The rich man was giving out toys to all the kids. Tim ran outside and got a toy too. He was so happy and played with his new toy all day long.As the sun went down, Tim looked out his window again. He watched the world become dark and quiet. Tim smiled, hugged his toy, and went to bed. He knew he would watch the world again tomorrow.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a small pebble. It was the most special pebble she had ever seen. She wanted to give it to her friend, Tom. She looked for something to wrap it in. Lily found a soft cloth and wrapped the pebble like a gift.Lily went to Tom's house, excited to give him the gift. She said, "I have a surprise for you, Tom!" Tom was very happy and wanted to see the surprise. Lily told him, "Wait until we go to the park. I will show you there."At the park, Lily and Tom found a nice spot under a big tree. Lily said, "Now, I will show you the surprise!" She took out the wrapped pebble and gave it to Tom. Tom opened it and saw the special pebble. He said, "Wow, thank you, Lily! This is the best gift ever!"They played with the pebble all day, and it became their favorite toy. From that day on, Lily and Tom were the best of friends. They always remembered how a simple gift brought them closer together.

Once upon a time, there was a eager deer. He loved to explore the forest and see what kind of new adventures he could find. One day, the deer was walking around and he spotted a little cabin. He wanted desperately to explore the cabin, but he was very shy.The deer crept up to the cabin and heard a voice inside. "Who's there?" it said. The deer was so startled he didn't know what to do. He heard the voice again, "Come on in, I won't hurt you!" The deer was a bit scared but eager to explore, so he opened the door and stepped inside. Inside the cabin, he saw a small family of people. They looked so friendly! They introduced themselves and showed the deer around. The deer loved exploring the cabin and meeting the family. They asked the deer if he wanted to stay, and the deer was so excited he quickly agreed! The deer said goodbye to the family and promised to come back soon. From that day on, the deer visited the family often. He was always so eager to stay and explore the cabin. The two of them were very happy together.

One day, a little girl named Sue was playing with her toy blocks. She wanted to make a tower with a big number of blocks. Sue's friend, Tom, came over to help her build the tower. They were having fun putting the blocks on top of each other.Tom said, "I have a useful idea! Let's put the big blocks at the bottom and the small blocks at the top." Sue thought that was a great idea, so they started to build the tower again. As the tower got taller, it became harder to reach the top.Suddenly, a little bird flew into the room and landed on the tower. The tower started to shake and wobble. Sue and Tom both shrugged, not knowing what to do. The bird looked at them and said, "I can help you make the tower taller!"The little bird picked up the small blocks with its beak and put them on top of the tower. With the bird's help, Sue and Tom made the tallest tower they had ever seen. They were so happy and thanked the little bird for its help. The bird smiled and flew away, leaving Sue and Tom with their amazing tower.

Tim and Sam were brothers who liked to play pirates. They had a big box that they pretended was their ship. They put some toys and books inside the box and called them their treasure. They wanted to sail to a new island and find more treasure.One day, they saw a dark cave near their house. They thought it might have some hidden treasure inside. They decided to load their box with their treasure and drag it to the cave. They put on some hats and scarves and said, "Arr, mateys, let's go explore the cave!"They reached the cave and pushed their box inside. It was very dark and cold. They could not see anything. They heard some strange noises and felt some wet things on the floor. They were scared. They wanted to go back to their house.They tried to pull their box out of the cave, but it was too heavy. They had loaded it with too much treasure. They could not move it. They cried for help, but no one heard them. They were stuck in the cave with their treasure. They wished they had not been so greedy. They wished they had stayed at home and played with their toys and books. They were very sad and sorry.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy beetle. He lived in a small house in the woods. He was grumpy because he had no friends to play with.One sunny day, the grumpy beetle went for a walk. He saw a little girl who was sad. She told the beetle that her mom punished her because she was naughty. The beetle felt bad for the girl and wanted to help her.The grumpy beetle and the girl became friends. They played together every day. The girl was not naughty anymore, so her mom didn't punish her. The grumpy beetle was not grumpy anymore because he had a friend. They were both happy and lived a fun life in the woods.

One day, a girl named Lucy found a flute. She was glad because she loved music. She took the flute and went to the river to bathe. While she was bathing, she put the flute on a big rock near the water.A frog saw the flute and said, "Can I play your flute, Lucy?" Lucy said, "Yes, you can play it while I bathe." The frog played the flute and made nice music. Lucy liked the music and she sang along.But then, a big fish heard the music and wanted the flute too. The big fish jumped out of the water and tried to take the flute from the frog. The frog and the fish fought, but the fish was stronger. The fish took the flute and swam away. Lucy and the frog were sad because they lost the flute and could not make music anymore.

One day, a pretty girl named Lucy went to the park. She saw a big tree with lots of apples. She wanted to pick an apple to eat. She saw a little boy named Timmy under the tree. Lucy said, "Hi Timmy, can you help me get an apple?" Timmy said, "Yes, I can help you." He tried to reach the apple, but he was too short. Just then, a big bird came and took the apple. Lucy and Timmy were sad. But then, the bird came back with a camera. The bird wanted to record them picking apples. Lucy and Timmy laughed and picked more apples with the bird recording them. They all had a fun day at the park.

Once there was a seed. The seed sat in the ground, alone in the dirt. The sun shone down on the seed, and it began to grow. Up it grew until it became a tall celery plant.The celery was green and tall, and it grew until it was time to pick it. Someone plucked the celery from the ground and found it was very sweet. They chopped it up and made a delicious salad.The celery tasted so sweet. Everyone enjoyed eating it. Even the little children liked it. They ate the celery and had a wonderful meal.After they finished the salad, they buried some of the seeds in the ground. Soon they grew into a new celery plant. This next one grew just as sweet as the old one. The celery kept growing and growing, making everyone happy!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to play with her toys. One day, she found a big box with a lot of tape on it. Sue was very excited and wanted to open the box.Sue tried to open the box, but the tape was too strong. She started to frown because she couldn't open it. Then, her mom came and helped her take off the tape. When the box was open, Sue saw something amazing inside.Inside the box was a big, colorful ball. Sue was so happy and her frown turned into a big smile. She played with her new ball all day long, and it was the most amazing day ever.

Once upon a time, there was a delicate lock. It was silver and shiny, and looked very special. One day, a little girl wanted to open the lock to see what was inside. She shook it, but it wouldn't open! She tried to pull it, but it was too hard.Then, one day, the girl's mommy came in and said, "Let me try". She held the lock and felt it. She smiled and said, "I know what will open this lock" and reached out for a small tool. She used the tool to carefully push a button on the lock and it made a CLICK.The little girl was so excited and said, "Oh, it opened! What do we have inside?” Inside the lock were two bags of candy! The little girl ate a few pieces, but the mommy said, "No, don't spoil yourself. Save some of the candy for later, okay?” The little girl hugged her mommy and said, "Of course!" She put the candy back inside the lock and said, "Oooh, this is very special". And from that day on, the little girl and her mommy saved the candy inside the delicate lock, so the little girl could have a special treat every once in a while.The end.

Once upon a time, in a quiet little town, there was a club where kids loved to play. The club was a fun place with many toys and games. Every day, children would come to the club to play with their friends.One day, a boy named Tim and a girl named Sue met at the club. They both liked to play with toy cars. Tim said, "Hi Sue, do you want to play cars with me?" Sue smiled and said, "Yes, Tim! I love to play with cars too!"Together, they played with the toy cars, making them zoom around the room. They laughed and had a great time at the club. Soon, more kids joined them and they all played together. The quiet club became a happy place filled with the sounds of children playing and having fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Bobo. Bobo loved to spring around the pretty landscape near his home. He liked to look at the flowers, trees, and big hills.One day, while Bobo was springing around, he met a friendly squirrel named Squeaky. Squeaky said, "Hi Bobo! Do you want to try some tasty nuts?" Bobo smiled and said, "Yes, please! I like tasty food."Bobo and Squeaky sat under a big tree and ate the tasty nuts. They talked and laughed. The sun was warm and the sky was blue. They became the best of friends and enjoyed the pretty landscape together. And they lived happily ever after.

One day, a kind boy named Tim went on a trip with his mom and dad. They had big luggage with them. They put clothes, toys, and food in the luggage. Tim was very happy to go on the trip.On their trip, they saw a big tree. Tim wanted to play near the tree. He saw a stick on the ground. Tim picked up the stick and started to strike it against the tree. It made a fun noise.Tim's mom and dad came to see what he was doing. They all laughed and played together. They had a great time on their trip. Tim was very happy and loved his kind mom and dad.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was only three years old. She was a brave and curious girl and every day she had a goal to explore the world around her. One day, she was playing with some of her plastic blocks in her room and saw something outside the window. It looked very beautiful, and she could see far away. She wanted to explore, so she decided to go outside. When the little girl got outside, she saw it was a lot bigger and it was so beautiful! She wanted to go even farther, but she was scared. She said to herself, "It looks so far, but I think I can do it. I just have to be brave." But while she was taking a step forward, her mom called her back and scolded her. She said, “The world out there is too big and dangerous for you. You need to stay here.” The little girl was disappointed because her goal was to explore. But there was something mysterious in the sky that caught her eye. It was a huge rainbow in the distance, and it was so beautiful! She looked closely and there was something at the end of the rainbow. She thought to herself, “Maybe that is the goal I should try to reach?” The little girl was determined to reach the end of the rainbow, so she kept going no matter how scared she was.

Once upon a time, there was a large ostrich named Ollie. Ollie lived in a big field with his friends. Ollie was very tall and had a long neck. He loved to run fast and play with his friends.One day, Ollie found a red ball. He loved the red ball very much. He would kick it with his big feet and chase after it. His friends liked to watch Ollie play with the red ball. They would laugh and clap their hands.Ollie and his friends had lots of fun playing with the red ball. They would take turns kicking the ball and running after it. The sun was shining, and they were all very happy. Ollie knew he loved his friends and his big field, and they loved him too.

Once upon a time, there was a nice lady who loved to spin. She would spin all day and all night. She had a big, round toy that she would spin and spin.One day, a little girl came to play with the lady. The little girl asked, "Can I spin the toy too?" The lady smiled and said, "Yes, you can play with me."So, the little girl and the lady spun the toy together. They spun it so fast that it made them dizzy. They laughed and laughed as they spun the toy. They had so much fun spinning the toy and being dizzy together. And from that day on, they became the best of friends.

One day, a little dog named Spot went for a wander in the park. Spot was a clumsy dog. He always tripped and fell. In the park, he saw a big tree. Under the tree, there was a piece of cake. Spot was very happy. He wanted to eat the cake.A little girl named Sue was also in the park. She saw Spot and the cake. Sue said, "Spot, don't eat the cake! It might be bad!" But Spot did not listen. He was too excited about the cake.Spot ate the cake. It tasted good. Then, he started to feel sick. Sue took care of him. She said, "I told you not to eat the cake, Spot." Spot was sad. He knew he should have listened to Sue. From that day on, Spot learned to listen to his friends.

One day, a fat cat named Tom was walking in the park. He saw a pair of scissors on the ground. Tom looked at the scissors and said, "I can use these to cut paper!"Tom took the scissors and went to find his friend, a little girl named Sue. Sue was playing with her toys. Tom showed Sue the scissors and said, "Look, I found scissors! Let's cut paper together." Sue was happy and said, "Yes, let's do that!"As they started to cut paper, a bird flew down and took the scissors from them. Tom and Sue were surprised. They looked at each other and said, "Oh no! The bird took our scissors!" They laughed and decided to play with their toys instead. The bird flew away with the scissors, and Tom and Sue had fun playing together.

Once upon a time there was a little boy. His name was Alex, and he was three years old.Alex needed things like food and water. He also needed a hug and a kiss. But most of all, he needed his mother.His mother was so kind and loyal. She would always spend time with Alex. She would make Alex's favourite foods and play games with him. Alex loved spending time with her.So no matter what Alex needed, he knew his mother would always be there for him. He was so glad to have such a loyal mother. The two were very close. Alex was happy to have a mother like her.

Once upon a time, there was a big bull named Tom. Tom lived on a farm with many other animals. One day, a new truck came to the farm. The truck brought a new bull named Tim. Tim was very big and strong, too.Tom did not like Tim. Tom wanted to be the only big bull on the farm. So, Tom and Tim had a fight. They ran at each other very fast. They tried to pick each other up with their big horns.The other animals saw the fight and were scared. They did not want Tom and Tim to hurt each other. So, they all worked together to stop the fight. They made a big wall with their bodies to stop Tom and Tim from running at each other.Tom and Tim stopped fighting. They looked at the other animals and saw that they were all scared. Tom and Tim felt bad for scaring their friends. They said sorry to each other and became friends. From that day on, they played together and helped each other on the farm.

One day, a little car felt very sad. It needed fuel to go, but it had none. The car felt miserable. It wanted to go fast and see its friends, but it could not.A big truck saw the little car and wanted to help. The truck had a lot of fuel. It raised a big hose and gave the little car some fuel. The little car felt better.Now, the little car could go fast again. It was so happy! The little car and the big truck went to see their friends. They played and had fun all day. The little car was not miserable anymore.

Once upon a time, in a big, green garden, there was a grumpy, little bug. He had a big spot on his back. The bug liked to play with his friends, but he always felt sad because of his spot.One day, the grumpy bug saw a tall flower. He wanted to climb it to see the whole garden. But the bug started to struggle. He tried and tried, but he could not climb the flower.A kind, little bird saw the grumpy bug and wanted to help. The bird flew down and picked up the bug. They went high up in the sky. The bug saw the whole garden and smiled. He was not grumpy anymore. The bug and the bird became best friends, and they played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a cheerful fish named Bob. Bob liked to pick up little stones from the sea floor. One day, he saw a big, dark shadow in the water. Bob did not know what it was, but he felt scared.Bob swam fast to his friend, Sally the sea turtle. He told her about the big shadow. Sally knew that it was a shark. She told Bob to be careful and stay near the rocks, so the shark could not find him. Bob listened to Sally and hid in the rocks.Later, the shark swam close to the rocks. He was looking for a fish to eat. But Bob was safe in his hiding spot. The shark could not see him. Bob was so happy that he had listened to Sally. From that day on, Bob and Sally were the best of friends. They played together and picked up stones, always staying close to the rocks.

Once upon a time, in a cool little house, there lived a mouse named Mimi. Mimi loved cheese more than anything else. One day, she saw a big piece of cheese in the kitchen. She wanted to take it and store it in her room.Mimi tried to take the cheese, but it was too big. She asked her friend, Cat, for help. "Cat, can you help me store this cheese?" Cat said, "Okay, Mimi. But I want some cheese too." Mimi agreed, and they both started to move the cheese together.But then, Dog saw them and got angry. "Stop! That cheese is mine!" he yelled. Mimi, Cat, and Dog all wanted the cheese, but they didn't know how to share. They started to argue about who should get the cheese. In the end, they decided to share the cheese together. They all became friends and enjoyed the yummy cheese.

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant sun in the sky. It was so bright and shiny, like gold. The sun loved to play with all the animals in the forest.One day, the sun decided to invite all the animals to a big party. The sun asked the birds to sing, and the squirrels to dance. All the animals were so happy and excited to go to the sun's party.At the party, the animals played games and had lots of fun. They ate yummy food and laughed together. The brilliant, gold sun shined down on them, making everyone feel warm and happy. And from that day on, the animals and the sun became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived in a modern house with a big pool. He loved to play in the pool with his friends. They splashed water and laughed a lot.One day, Tim saw a frog near the pool. The frog said, "Ribbit, ribbit. I am a magic frog. I can make your pool even more fun if you believe in me." Tim was surprised but excited. He wanted to see what the magic frog could do.So, Tim believed in the frog. The frog jumped into the pool and it changed colors. Now, the pool was full of bright and fun colors. Tim and his friends played in the colorful pool all day, and they had the best time ever. They thanked the magic frog for making their pool even more fun.

One day, a clever cat named Tom went outside to play. He saw a little thing jumping in the grass. It was a green frog! Tom wanted to catch the frog and make a new friend.Tom said to the frog, "Hey, let's play! I will try to catch you." The frog agreed and started to jump very fast. Tom tried to catch the frog, but the frog was too quick. They both laughed and had fun.After a while, Tom finally caught the frog. They were both very happy and tired. Tom and the frog became best friends and played together every day. They loved their fun game of catch.

Ben and Lily are friends. They like to play together. One day, Ben invites Lily to go to church with him and his family. Lily says yes. She is happy to see Ben's church.They get ready and go in the car. Ben's mom and dad are nice. They sing songs in the car. Lily likes the songs. They are fun and happy. Ben and Lily clap their hands and smile.They get to the church. It is big and pretty. There are many people there. They say hello to Ben's mom and dad. They go to a room with other kids. There is a lady who tells them stories. The stories are about God and Jesus. They are good and kind. Ben and Lily listen and learn. They also draw and color. They make pictures of the stories.After the stories, they go back to the car. Ben's mom and dad ask them if they liked the church. Ben and Lily say yes. They thank them for inviting them. They hug and say goodbye. They go back to their homes.Ben and Lily are not lazy. They are good friends. They like to go to church. They like to learn and play. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a famous bunny. This bunny could do a special thing. The bunny could vanish! Every day, the bunny liked to play with his friends in the park.One day, while playing, the bunny saw a big dog. The dog was running fast. The bunny got scared. He did his special thing and vanished. His friends were amazed.The dog kept running and did not see the bunny. The bunny came back when the dog was gone. His friends were happy to see him again. They played together and had lots of fun. The famous bunny's special thing saved the day.

Once upon a time, there was a small island. On the island, there was a boy and a girl. They liked to play and have fun. One day, they found a big, fake rock. They wanted to see what was under the rock.The boy said, "Let's move this rock and see what's there!" The girl agreed, and they both pushed the rock. Under the rock, they found a tiny baby bird. The baby bird was scared and alone.The boy and girl decided to protect the baby bird. They took care of it and played with it. But one day, when they went to play with the baby bird, it was gone! They looked and looked but could not find it. Suddenly, they saw a big bird in the sky. The big bird was the baby bird's mom! The baby bird was with its mom, and they were both happy. The boy and girl were happy too, because they knew the baby bird was safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little fox. The fox lived in the woods. He had many friends, like the birds and the rabbits. They played together every day.One day, an angry bird came to the woods. The bird did not want to play. He wanted to take the food from the other animals. This made the fox sad.The fox had an idea. He told his friends to share their food with the angry bird. They all agreed. As they shared their food, the bird became less angry. The love in the woods increased. Soon, the angry bird became a happy friend too.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went for a walk. She saw a fragile bird that could not fly. Lily felt sad and wanted to help the bird. She started to search for something that could make the bird feel better. Lily found some food and gave it to the bird. The bird ate the food and felt stronger. Then, something unexpected happened. The bird started to grow bigger and bigger! Lily began to wonder what was happening.The bird turned into a big, friendly dragon. The dragon thanked Lily for her help. He told her that he was under a magic spell, and her kindness had set him free. Now, Lily had a new friend, and they had many fun adventures together.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim saw a clown with a big red nose and funny clothes. The clown was making people laugh by making funny faces and doing silly dances. Tim was happy to see the clown and wanted to know more about him.Tim asked his mom to explain what the clown was doing. His mom said, "The clown is here to make us laugh and have fun. He does funny things to make people happy." Tim liked the idea of making people happy and wanted to learn how to be like the clown.The clown saw Tim watching him and came over. He gave Tim a light balloon that he made into a fun shape. Tim smiled and thanked the clown. He knew that he wanted to be just like the clown when he grew up, making people laugh and feel happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved ice-cream. One sunny day, Tim's mom gave him money to buy an ice-cream. Tim was very happy.Tim went to the ice-cream shop. He picked a big, yummy ice-cream. But, on his way home, something unexpected happened. Tim tripped on a rock and his ice-cream fell on the ground. Tim was sad because he lost his ice-cream.Just then, a nice man saw Tim and his empty hands. The man was the ice-cream shop owner. He knew Tim loved ice-cream. So, the man gave Tim an even bigger and yummier ice-cream for free. Tim was very happy and surprised. He went home with a big smile and a full tummy.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the mall with her mom. They walked past many stores and saw many things. Amy felt tired from walking so much, but she was happy to be at the mall.In one store, Amy saw a big sign with a picture of a toy she liked. She asked her mom, "Can I have that toy, please?" Her mom said, "No, Amy. We are here to buy a gift for your friend's birthday. We can't buy a toy for you today."Amy was sad, but she knew it was important to think of others. They picked out a nice gift for her friend and went to pay. When they got to the counter, the store worker said, "You are our 100th customer today! You win a prize!" The prize was the toy Amy wanted!Amy was very happy and learned that when you think of others first, good things can happen to you too.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow cat. The cat had a long tail. One day, the cat found a hat. The cat wanted to wear the hat. So, the cat put the hat on its head.The cat walked around the town. The cat was happy to wear the hat. But then, something unexpected happened. The hat fell off the cat's head, and it landed on the cat's tail. Now, the cat was wearing the hat on its tail!Everyone in the town saw the cat with the hat on its tail. They laughed and clapped. The cat was surprised, but it liked the attention. So, the cat kept wearing the hat on its tail. And the yellow cat with the hat on its tail was the happiest cat in town.

One day, Tim and his dog, Max, went for a walk. They saw a filthy plant by the road. Tim wanted to touch the plant, but Max barked at him. Max was trying to warn Tim."No, Tim! Don't touch!" Max said. Tim looked at Max and asked, "Why, Max?"Max told Tim, "The plant is dirty. It can make you sick." Tim listened to Max and did not touch the plant.They walked away from the filthy plant and played in the park. Max and Tim had lots of fun. They were happy they stayed safe and clean.

Once upon a time, there was a huge fish named Fin. Fin loved to dive deep into the water. One day, while diving, he found a big box. The box was full of sugar.Fin wanted to share the sugar with his friends. He called his friends to come and see the sugar. They were all very happy. They took the sugar and shared it with everyone.The sugar made everyone very happy. They all played and laughed together. They thanked Fin for finding the sugar. From that day on, they had the sweetest time in the water.

One sunny day, a little girl named Lily went to the park. She saw a cherry tree with lots of red cherries on it. She wanted to pick some cherries to eat. Lily tried to reach the cherries, but they were too high.A tall, compassionate boy named Max saw Lily. He asked, "Do you need help?" Lily said, "Yes, please. I want some cherries." Max was kind and helped Lily get the cherries. They both ate the cherries and became friends.After they ate the cherries, Lily said, "Thank you, Max. You remind me to be nice and help others." Max smiled and said, "You're welcome, Lily. It's good to be kind to others." From that day on, Lily and Max always helped their friends and family. They learned that being compassionate is important and makes everyone happy.

Anna likes to play with her mom's makeup. She thinks it is fun to put colors on her face and pretend she is a princess. But she knows she has to be careful and not make a mess.One day, when her mom is busy, Anna sneaks into her bedroom and finds her makeup bag. She opens it and sees many shiny things. She takes out a huge lipstick and tries to put it on her lips. But it is too big and she smears it all over her mouth and chin. She looks in the mirror and laughs.She wants to try more things, so she takes out a blush and a mascara. She rubs the blush on her cheeks and nose, making them very pink. She opens the mascara and tries to put it on her eyelashes, but it is too hard and she pokes her eye. She cries out loud.Her mom hears her and comes into the bedroom. She sees Anna with makeup all over her face and the bed. She is shocked and angry."Anna, what have you done?" she asks. "This is not a toy, this is my makeup. You are not allowed to touch it. You have made a huge mess. You have to wash it off right now."Anna feels sorry and scared. She does not want her mom to be mad at her. She says, "I'm sorry, mom. I just wanted to play. I wanted to be like you. You are so pretty."Her mom sighs and hugs her. She says, "I love you, Anna. But you have to ask me before you use my things. And you don't need makeup to be pretty. You are beautiful just the way you are. Now, let's go to the bathroom and wash your face. And then we can clean up this mess together."

Once upon a time, in a big blue sea, there was a dolphin. This dolphin was very messy. He liked to play in the mud all day long. Other dolphins did not like to play with him because he was so messy.One day, the messy dolphin wanted to play with his friends. But his friends said, "No, we don't want to play with you. You are too messy!" The messy dolphin was sad. He did not want to be messy anymore. So, he decided to quit being messy.The messy dolphin tried to clean himself, but he did not know how. He swam in the water, but the mud did not come off. He asked the fish for help, but they did not know how to clean him either. The messy dolphin was very sad. He could not quit being messy, and he could not play with his friends. And so, the messy dolphin stayed messy and alone, with no one to play with.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sally who lived in the city. Every day she would go out to play, which made her very happy.Today Sally decided to go for a walk. As she strolled along, she heard an unfamiliar sound. It made her feel scared!Sally stopped and called out, "Who's there?". Suddenly, from behind a big bush, a friendly voice called out, "Don't be scared! It's just me".Sally was relieved to see that it was her best friend, Sam.Sam said, "Let's go for some exercise to make us feel better".Sally and Sam went for a walk to the park. They breathed in the fresh air and felt the sunshine on their faces. They did some calm exercises together and soon felt much better. The two friends enjoyed their walk in the park and were no longer scared.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They saw a big flower with many colors. Lily wanted to smell it, but Ben said no."That flower is fake. It is not real. It is made of paper and glue. It is for people to look at, not to touch," Ben said.Lily was sad. She liked the flower. She thought it was pretty. She did not believe Ben. She went closer to the flower.Suddenly, a bee came out of the flower. It buzzed and flew around Lily's head. Lily was scared. She screamed and ran away.Ben laughed. He thought it was funny. He said, "I told you the flower was fake. The bee was fake too. It was a toy. I put it there to trick you. It was a joke."Lily was angry. She did not like Ben's joke. She said, "That was not a joke. That was mean. You made me feel bad. You are not a good friend."Ben felt sorry. He realized he was wrong. He said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I did not mean to hurt you. I was just having fun. Please forgive me. I will not do it again."Lily looked at Ben. She saw he was sincere. She said, "OK, Ben. I forgive you. But next time, be nice. Do not play tricks on me. Or on anyone else."Ben nodded. He said, "You are right, Lily. I will be nice. I will not play tricks. I will be a good friend."Lily smiled. She said, "Thank you, Ben. You are a good friend. Do you want to play with me?"Ben smiled too. He said, "Yes, Lily. I want to play with you. What do you want to play?"Lily said, "How about we play with the slide? It is fun and real."Ben agreed. He said, "OK, let's play with the slide. It is fun and real. And no more fake flowers or bees."They held hands and ran to the slide. They played and laughed.

One day, a smart rabbit named Bob was playing in the woods. Bob loved to spring high into the air and feel the wind on his face. He would jump and jump, laughing and having fun.Suddenly, there was a big shake. It was an earthquake! Bob was scared and didn't know what to do. He saw a big tree and decided to hide under it until the shaking stopped.After a while, the earthquake was over. Bob came out from under the tree and saw that his friends were okay too. They all knew that being smart and finding a safe place to hide had saved them. From that day on, Bob and his friends always knew what to do when the ground shook, and they continued to play and spring in the woods, happy and safe.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a mechanic named Tom. He was a very nice man who would fix cars. One day, Tom was feeling anxious because he had to fix a big truck, and he didn't know how to do it.Tom's friend, Sally, came to visit him. She saw that Tom was feeling anxious and asked, "Tom, why are you so anxious?" Tom said, "I need to fix this big truck, but I don't know how to use the tools."Sally wanted to help her friend. She said, "Don't worry, Tom, I can show you how to use the tools!" Tom was happy that Sally was there to help him. They worked together and fixed the big truck.After they were done, Tom was no longer anxious. He thanked Sally for her help and they went to play in the park. From that day on, Tom was never anxious again because he knew he could always ask his friends for help.

Tom and Sam are friends. They like to play with cars. They have many cars of different colors and sizes. Tom has a big red car that is very fast. Sam has a small blue car that is very shiny.One day, they decide to have a race with their cars. They find a long road near their house and draw a line with a stick. They put their cars behind the line and get ready to start."Are you ready, Sam?" Tom asks."Yes, I am ready, Tom," Sam answers."OK, let's go! One, two, three, go!" Tom shouts.They push their cars as hard as they can. The cars zoom along the road. Tom's car is faster than Sam's car. It reaches the end of the road first. Tom is happy. He jumps and cheers."I win, I win!" Tom says.Sam is sad. He walks to the end of the road and picks up his car. He looks at Tom's car and sighs."Your car is better than mine, Tom. It is big and fast. My car is small and slow. You are wealthy. I am poor," Sam says.Tom hears Sam and feels sorry for him. He likes Sam and does not want him to be sad. He thinks for a moment and then smiles."Sam, do you want to play another game?" Tom asks."What game, Tom?" Sam asks."Let's play match. We can match our cars by color. You have a blue car and I have a red car. We can find other cars that are blue and red and put them together. It will be fun," Tom says.Sam thinks and then nods."OK, Tom, let's play match. That sounds fun," Sam says.Tom and Sam run to their house and look for other cars that are blue and red. They find many cars and match them by color. They make a big pile of blue cars and a big pile of red cars. They laugh and have fun. They forget about the race an

Once upon a time, there was a big bear named Ben. Ben loved to play in the woods. One day, he saw a clear sign. The sign said, "Be kind to your friends." This sign reminded Ben to be nice to everyone.Ben had a friend named Tim, the tiny mouse. Tim was sad because he lost his toy. Ben wanted to help. He looked everywhere in the woods. Ben found the toy and gave it back to Tim. Tim was so happy and said, "Thank you, Ben!"From that day on, Ben always remembered the sign. He was kind to all his friends in the woods. Everyone loved Ben, and they all played happily together. The moral of the story is to always be kind to your friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Audrey. Audrey was only three years old and loved to explore the world around her. One day Audrey went for a walk in the park with her mom. Audrey's mom asked her a question: "Where do you want to go?". Audrey thought for a moment, and then said, "Let's go to the pond."The two of them passed many trees and flowers until they finally reached the pond. Audrey was so excited to see the pond, but when they got close the water looked uncomfortable and scary. Audrey's mom said, "Don't worry Audrey, you don't have to go in the pond if you don't want to." Audrey smiled and said, "I'm okay, let's just look at it."The two of them watched the pond together, and Audrey's mom passed her a few questions about the animals living in the pond. Audrey answered them all with a smile on her face. The two of them slowly walked away from the pond. Audrey was happy to have seen the pond, even if it made her feel a bit uncomfortable. And they lived happily ever after.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a flea in his room. He looked at the flea and said, "Hi, flea! Do you want to play with me?" The flea jumped up and down, happy to play with Tim.Tim and the flea played with a ball. The ball was heavy, but they had fun. They threw the ball to each other and laughed. Tim said, "Flea, can you imagine we can be best friends?" The flea jumped high, showing it was happy to be friends with Tim.At the end of the day, Tim and the flea were tired. They lay down on the soft bed and closed their eyes. The flea was very small, but it was a big friend to Tim. They knew they would play together again tomorrow.

Once upon a time, in a peaceful little town, there lived a cat and a dog. They were good friends and liked to play together. But one day, they had a quarrel over dinner.The cat said, "I want to eat fish for dinner tonight." The dog disagreed and said, "No, I want to eat chicken tonight." They could not agree on what to have for dinner, and they started to argue.Finally, the cat and the dog decided to ask their friend, the wise old owl, for help. The owl listened to their problem and said, "Why don't you both have dinner together? The cat can have fish, and the dog can have chicken."The cat and the dog liked the idea and decided to have dinner together. They stopped quarreling and became friends again. From that day on, they always enjoyed their dinner together, and the peaceful town was happy once more.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a girl named Lucy. She loved to mix things together. One gloomy day, she found some mud outside. She thought it would be fun to play with it. So, she took some mud inside her house.Lucy mixed the mud with water in a big bowl. She felt the texture of the mud. It was soft and squishy. She liked how it felt in her hands. Lucy thought it would be fun to make something with the mud.Lucy made a little mud house with her hands. She put it by the window to dry. When the sun came out, the mud house became hard. Lucy was happy with her little mud house. She showed it to her mom and dad. They were proud of her and her fun creation.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Jack and John. They were always playing together and they would joke around all the time. One day, they were walking by a pond and Jack saw a huge net in the water. He was very curious to know what was inside of it.Jack asked John to help him get the net out of the water. John thought Jack was joking and they both started laughing. But Jack was serious and he kept insisting that they needed to get the net. Eventually, John agreed and they both went into the water to get the net.When they finally got it out of the water, they saw that it was full of fish! Jack and John were so surprised, they had no idea what to do with all the fish! They looked at each other and started to joke again, then they both agreed to take the fish home to their families.The two friends had a great time as they carried the net full of fish back home. Jack was very curious to know what their families would think when they saw all of the fish. He knew it was going to be a funny surprise!

Once upon a time, there were two best friends: Bob and Tim. They were always together and never fought, until one day when they had to accept a new job. They both wanted to work in the same factory. "No, I want to work in the factory," said Bob. "I want to work in the factory," said Tim. "We can't both work in the same factory," said Bob. "No, I have to have this job!" said Tim. Bob was getting a little bossy and said, "It's my turn, I want this job!" But Tim didn't accept it and started to argue.Just then, the boss came and said, "Stop arguing. You can both have jobs in the factory!" Bob and Tim smiled and hugged each other in excitement. They both accepted the job and ran off to start their first day together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite patch on her dress. The patch was red and had a picture of a cat. Lily loved her patch very much.One day, Lily's friend Sam came to play. Sam saw the patch on Lily's dress and said, "I don't understand why you like that patch so much. It looks spoiled." Lily felt sad, but she tried to explain. "I like my patch because it is special to me."Sam thought for a moment and then said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I didn't know it was special to you. I understand now." Lily smiled and they played together all day, happy to be friends who understand each other.

Tim and Lily were playing in the garden. They saw a big vine that grew on the wall. It had many green leaves and purple flowers."Let's climb the vine!" Tim said. "It looks like fun!"Lily was not sure. "But what if we fall? Or what if Mom and Dad get angry?"Tim shrugged. "Don't be scared. They won't see us. And the vine is tough. It can hold us."He grabbed the vine and started to pull himself up. Lily followed him, but she felt nervous. The vine was high and wobbly.They reached the top of the wall and looked around. They saw the neighbor's dog, a big and black one. It barked at them and ran towards the wall."Uh-oh!" Tim said. "The dog is mad at us! We have to go down!"They tried to slide down the vine, but it was not easy. The vine was rough and scratchy. It hurt their hands and legs. The dog jumped and snapped at them."Help!" Lily cried. "Mom! Dad!"Mom and Dad heard them and came outside. They saw Tim and Lily on the vine and the dog on the ground. They were shocked and worried."Tim! Lily! What are you doing?" Mom shouted. "Get down from there!"Dad grabbed a stick and scared the dog away. He helped Tim and Lily down from the vine. They were dirty and bleeding.Mom hugged them and checked their wounds. She was angry and sad."Why did you climb the vine?" she asked. "You could have been hurt badly! Or bitten by the dog! You know you are not allowed to do that!"Tim and Lily looked down. They felt sorry and ashamed."We wanted to have fun," Tim said. "We thought the vine was tough.""But it was not safe," Lily said. "We were wrong."Mom and Dad took them inside and cleaned their wounds. They gave t

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved her mom's toast. Every morning, her mom made toast for breakfast. Sue felt proud when she could help her mom in the kitchen.One day, Sue's friend Tim came to play. Tim was hungry, so Sue wanted to make toast for him. Sue asked her mom if she could help. Her mom said yes and showed Sue how to make the toast.Sue tried her best and soon the toast was ready. Tim was happy when the toast arrived. He said it was the best toast he ever had. Sue felt very proud of herself. She learned that helping others and trying her best can make her feel good. And that was the moral of the story: always do your best and help others when you can.

Once upon a time, there was a flexible kite. It loved to fly high in the sky. The kite was very happy when it was up in the air. One day, the kite met a bird. The bird was also flying in the sky."Hi, bird!" said the kite. "I like to fly in the sky. Do you like it too?""Yes, kite!" said the bird. "I love to fly in the sky. It is so much fun!"One day, the bird saw a little girl. The girl was sad because she had no toys. The bird wanted to give her a gift. The bird thought the flexible kite would make her happy."Kite, will you let me give you to the little girl? She is sad and needs a toy," asked the bird."Yes, bird! I will make her happy," said the kite.So, the bird gave the flexible kite to the little girl. The girl was so happy to have a new toy. She played with the kite every day, and they both loved to fly high in the sky together.

One day, a green bird lived in a cage. The cage was in a big tree. The bird was sad in the cage. It wanted to fly and play with other birds. The bird did not like the cage.A boy saw the bird in the cage. He wanted to help the bird. The boy opened the cage. The bird flew out of the cage. The bird was happy. It flew up high in the sky.But then, something strange happened. The bird started to rot. It fell from the sky. The boy was sad. He did not know why the bird rotted. The bird was not a real bird. It was a toy bird. The boy did not know. He thought it was a real bird.

One day a brave driver was driving down a road. He was so brave and strong, he thought nothing could ever hurt him. Suddenly he saw an animal in the road and he knew he had to make the decision – to stop or keep going. He tried to think of the best thing to do and then he decided to keep going. The animal ran away in time, but then the driver heard a terrible noise. He had hit a rock and the car had turned over. The driver was hurt and scared, but he was also very brave. He tried to make the car work again, but he couldn't do it. He had to wait there until help arrived. The brave driver was safe but his car was broken and he was sad.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a dirty spade that she loved to play with in her yard. One sunny day, Amy went outside to dig in the dirt with her spade.As she dug, she saw a big cat. The cat was sleepy and let out a big yawn. Amy said, "Hi, cat! Do you want to play with me and my spade?" The cat looked at Amy and said, "Yes, I want to play!"So, Amy and the cat played in the dirt with the dirty spade. They dug and dug until they were both very tired. They both yawned and went inside to rest. Amy and the cat became best friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a big green crocodile. He lived in a pond near a small village. The crocodile was very restless. He would swim and play all day long.One day, the crocodile found a broken toy boat near the pond. He wanted to help, so he decided to repair the boat. The crocodile used some sticks and leaves to fix the boat. He worked very hard until the boat was like new again.The next day, a little boy from the village came to the pond. He saw the crocodile and the fixed toy boat. The little boy was so happy to see his boat was fixed. He thanked the crocodile and they became good friends. They played with the boat in the pond every day, and the crocodile was not restless anymore.

One day, a thin cat and a big dog were playing in the park. The cat was very fast and the dog was very strong. They were both very excited to play together.But then, they saw a ball with the word "power" on it. They both wanted to play with the ball. The cat said, "I found it first, so it's mine." The dog said, "No, I saw it first, so it's mine."They both tried to grab the ball, but the cat was too thin and the dog was too strong. The dog got the ball and ran away. The cat was very sad and went home.In the end, the thin cat and the big dog did not play together anymore. They both lost a friend because they fought over the ball with the word "power" on it. It was a bad ending for both of them.

Once upon a time there was a big, colorful ground. It was filled with sun, trees, and grass. Every day lots of animals came to the ground. They came to play and have fun. But, something strange also happened.At night when the animals were asleep, a mysterious figure appeared on the ground. He was a tall man wearing a white coat. He was very gentle and he would walk around the ground, taking care of everything.The creatures didn't quite understand why the man kept coming around. But they were thankful to have him. He carefully looked over their trees and flowers and gave them the care they needed. One night, when the man came around, he had a big surprise. He had brought along a giant cupcake. He wanted to share it with the creatures, so he carefully divided it between them. Everyone enjoyed the delicious treat. The animals finally understood why the man kept coming around. He was there to serve them and take care of them. From that day forward, the mysterious figure became known as the Servant of the Ground. He served that colorful ground until the end of time!

One day, a big dog named Max went for a walk. Max liked to walk slow in the fog. The fog was soft and cool. Max saw a little cat named Lily. Lily was sitting on a big rock.Max said, "Hi, Lily! Do you want to walk with me in the fog?" Lily said, "Yes, Max! I like the fog too." So Max and Lily walked slow in the fog. They were happy.Max and Lily found a big stick. Max liked to chew on sticks. Max said, "Look, Lily! A big stick to chew!" Max chewed the stick and Lily watched. They played in the fog until it was time to go home.

Millie had a new square. It was a bright yellow square with buttons on it. It was a remote control! Millie loved it and she knew it belonged to her. Millie used the remote control to turn on the TV and watch her favourite show. She could use it to make the TV louder, or to change the channel. Whenever Millie was not using the remote control, she kept it in a drawer in her room. It belonged to her, and she wanted to keep it safe. Millie loved her new square. It made her feel so grown up. She wanted to show it to everyone, but she knew it belonged only to her.

Once upon a time, in a big garden, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very independent and liked to do things by herself. One day, Lily saw a tree with small, round fruits on it. She did not know what they were, so she asked her mom, "Mommy, what are these?"Her mom replied, "Those are prunes, Lily. They are good for you, but you need to ask for help when picking them."Lily wanted to pick the prunes by herself, but she remembered her mom's words. She waited for her mom to come and help her. They picked the prunes together and had a fun time.Later, Lily's friend, Tim, came to play. He saw the prunes and wanted to pick them too. But he did not ask for help. He tried to climb the tree and fell down. He got a big boo-boo and cried.Lily learned that it is good to be independent, but sometimes it is better to ask for help. This made her a wise and happy girl.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was excited because today was the festival. Lily wanted to learn how to make a beautiful kite for the festival. She asked her mom to help her.Lily and her mom started to make the kite. But it was hard for Lily. She tried and tried but the kite did not look good. Lily felt frustrated. Her mom said, "Don't worry, we can try again."They tried again and again. Each time, the kite looked better. Finally, Lily made a beautiful kite. She was so happy. At the festival, Lily and her mom flew the kite together. They had so much fun. And Lily learned that trying again can help when you feel frustrated.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play shop. Lily is the shopkeeper and Ben is the customer. Lily has a lot of things to sell. She has beef, bread, milk, eggs, and cheese. Ben has some money to buy.Ben comes to Lily's shop. He says hello to Lily. He looks at the things. He wants to buy some beef. He asks Lily, "How much is the beef?" Lily says, "The beef is five coins." Ben says, "That is too much. Can you make it cheaper?" Lily says, "No, I cannot. The beef is good and fresh. It is not old or bad."Ben thinks for a while. He really wants the beef. He says, "Okay, I will buy the beef. But can you give me something else too?" Lily says, "What do you want?" Ben says, "I want a hat. It is cold outside and my head is cold." Lily says, "I have a hat. But it is very tight. It might not fit you." Ben says, "Let me try it." He puts the hat on his head. It is very tight. It hurts his head. He says, "Ouch! This hat is too tight. I do not want it."Lily says, "I told you it was tight. Do you want something else?" Ben says, "No, I do not. I just want the beef. Here are five coins." He gives Lily the money. Lily gives him the beef. She says, "Thank you for buying from my shop. Come again soon." Ben says, "You are welcome. Thank you for selling me the beef. Goodbye." He takes the beef and goes home. He is happy. He will cook the beef and eat it with his family. Lily is happy too. She has more money for her shop. She hopes more customers will come and buy her things.

Once upon a time, there was a small house near the woods. In this house, there lived a happy girl named Lucy. Lucy loved to play outside with her toy car and her big, round ball.One day, Lucy saw a boy near her house. The boy looked sad and had a frown on his face. Lucy wanted to make the boy happy, so she asked him to play with her. The boy's name was Tom.They played together with the toy car and the big, round ball. The sky was clear and the sun was shining. As they played, Tom's frown turned into a big smile. Lucy and Tom became good friends and played together every day near the small house.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toys all day. One day, Tim's uncle came to visit. His uncle was very nice and liked to play with Tim too.Tim and his uncle were playing with Tim's toy cars. Tim had a red car and his uncle had a blue car. They raced their cars across the empty floor, making "vroom vroom" sounds. Suddenly, Tim's car crashed into his uncle's car. Tim's uncle said, "Oh no, Tim! We need to be careful with our toys."Tim felt sad and said, "I'm sorry, uncle." His uncle smiled and said, "It's okay, Tim. Just remember to be careful next time. I won't punish you, but let's clean up the mess we made." So Tim and his uncle picked up the cars and put them back in their places.After they cleaned up, Tim and his uncle played more games together. Tim was very happy to have his uncle visit and they had lots of fun. Tim learned to be more careful with his toys, and he knew his uncle was always there to help him.

Once upon a time, there was a great big tree. In the tree, there was a small nest. A dove lived in the nest. The dove had a friend, a small boy named Tim. Tim and the dove liked to play together.One day, Tim saw the dove in the tree. He said, "Dove, come down and play with me!" The dove wanted to play, but it was scared. Tim urged, "Please, dove, do not be scared. I will catch you if you fall."The dove trusted Tim, so it jumped from the tree. Tim caught the dove in his hands. They played all day and had lots of fun. The dove was happy it had a friend like Tim. And Tim was happy too because he had a great friend in the dove.

Tom liked to whistle. He whistled when he walked, when he played, and when he was happy. He learned to whistle from his dad, who whistled a lot too. Tom wanted to whistle like his dad, who could make different sounds and tunes with his mouth.One day, Tom and his dad went to the park. They saw a big, modern building with glass and metal. Tom thought it looked shiny and cool. He asked his dad what it was."That's a museum, Tom. It's a place where people can see old and new things, like paintings and statues and machines. Do you want to go inside and look?" his dad said."Yes, please!" Tom said. He was curious and excited.They went inside the museum and saw many things. Tom liked the colorful paintings and the funny statues. He also liked the machines that moved and made noises. He whistled along with some of them. His dad smiled and whistled with him.They came to a room that had a sign that said "Rocks and Minerals". Tom saw many stones of different shapes and colors. Some were shiny, some were dull, some were smooth, some were rough. He wanted to touch them and feel them."Can I touch the stones, dad?" he asked."Sure, but be careful. Some of them are very old and fragile. And don't take any of them with you, okay? They belong to the museum," his dad said."Okay, dad," Tom said. He touched some of the stones gently. He liked how they felt in his hand. He saw one stone that was round and white. It had a hole in the middle. It looked like a donut. He thought it was funny and cute. He picked it up and put it in his pocket. He forgot what his dad said.They left the museum and went back to the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little panda who loved to swing. One sunny day, the panda went to the park. The park was very busy with many kids playing.The little panda saw a big swing and wanted to play on it. He asked a girl, "Can I swing too?" The girl said, "Yes, you can swing after me." The panda waited and watched the girl swing high.When it was the panda's turn to swing, he got on and started to swing. He went higher and higher. But he forgot to hold on tight. The panda fell off the swing and got hurt. The girl and others came to help him, but it was too late. The little panda could not play anymore.

John opened the door and saw something on the porch. It was green and hopping around.John: "Mom! Look at the frog!"Mom came to the door and smiled.Mom: "Yes, it's a frog! It looks so creative!"John and Mom watched the frog for a few minutes. The frog kept hopping around the porch.John: "What does the frog do?"Mom: "It hops around and looks for food. It's very sleepy during the day and active during the night."John: "Can I do something with the frog?"Mom: "Yes, you can be very creative with the frog. You can play games, make up stories, or just watch it. Just be careful not to scare it."John smiled and started watching the frog. He was so excited to play with the frog every day. He was creative and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time there were two brothers. One brother was called John and the other one was called Joe. John owned a reliable car and Joe owned a toy tooth. John and Joe got in a fight because Joe wanted to use John's car. John told Joe that he could not have the car because he owns a toy tooth. Joe was sad and did not understand why he could not have the car. He asked John why he could not have the car. John explained that he could not give him the car because it is important to be reliable and dependable. He said that he only wanted to lend his car to people who are reliable. Joe thought about this for awhile. He realized that it is important to be dependable and reliable so that when others need your help, you can give it to them. Joe decided to put away his toy tooth and work on gaining John's trust by being reliable and dependable. From that day forth, Joe and John became the best of friends. The moral of the story is that it is important to be reliable and dependable in order to be trusted by others.

Lily was a curious girl who liked to explore new things. One day, she saw a big crane near her house. It was lifting heavy things and making loud noises. Lily wanted to see it closer, so she ran to the fence and climbed on it."Hey, what are you doing there?" a man shouted from the crane. He was wearing a yellow hat and a blue shirt. He looked angry."I want to see the crane," Lily said. "It is big and cool.""You can't be here, it is dangerous," the man said. "The crane can hurt you, or you can fall. And there is fire over there, it can burn you. Go back to your house, now!"Lily saw the fire. It was orange and red, and it was making smoke. It was coming from a pile of wood and metal. Lily felt scared. She did not like the fire. It was hot and bad."OK, I will go," Lily said. She climbed down from the fence and ran to her house. She did not want to see the crane anymore. She wanted to be safe and warm.She told her mom what she saw. Her mom hugged her and said, "I'm glad you are OK, Lily. You should never go near the crane or the fire. They are not for playing. They are for working. And you should always listen to the man in the yellow hat. He knows what is best."Lily nodded. She learned her lesson. She was still curious, but she knew some things were better to watch from far away. She decided to play with her toys instead. She liked her toys. They were fun and nice.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy loved to create things with her hands. She would make drawings, paint pictures, and fold paper into fun shapes. One day, Lucy decided to make a special folder for her art.Lucy found a big, broken box in her room. She thought it would be perfect to make her folder. She cut the box into a flat piece and folded it in half. Then, she used colorful tape to fix the broken parts and make it pretty.Lucy was so happy with her new folder. She put all her drawings, paintings, and paper shapes inside. Every day, Lucy would create more art and add it to her folder. She was proud of her art and loved to show her folder to her friends and family.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat prunes. One day, he found an interesting prune tree in his yard. The tree was big and had many prunes.Tim wanted to get the prunes from the tree. He asked his friend, Sam, "Can you help me get the prunes?" Sam said, "Yes, let's do it!" They tried to reach the prunes, but they were too high. So, Tim and Sam found a big stick to poke the prunes.As they poked the prunes, some fell on the ground. Tim and Sam were happy. But then, Tim slipped on a prune! He fell and laughed. Sam laughed too. They picked up the prunes and shared them. They had a fun day with the interesting prune tree.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Dare. Dare lived in a big tree near a river. He had many friends who played with him every day.One day, Dare found a small pebble near the river. He thought it was very useful. He decided to show it to his friends. Dare picked up the pebble with his beak and flew to his friends.Dare showed the pebble to his friends, but they did not think it was useful. They all laughed at Dare. This made Dare very sad. He flew away with the pebble and did not play with his friends again.

Janet had a special surprise for the school's assembly. She was excited to show it off!"What do you have?" asked her friend Amy. "A magic wand," Janet said.The next day, she pointed her wand into the air and said, "Let's make something yummy for the assembly tomorrow!" The week went by quickly as Janet made something special for the assembly. Everyone was excited to find out what her surprise was. At the assembly, she pulled out a big box that had a yummy smell coming from it. Everyone clapped in excitement. Janet opened the box and pulled out the most delicious chocolate cake anyone had ever seen. The assembly erupted in cheers and everyone enjoyed the yummy cake!  Janet knew that her magical wand had made the assembly extra special.

Once upon a time, in a big field, there was a small flower. The flower wanted to bloom and be strong like the big trees. One day, a kind girl named Lily came to the field. She saw the small flower and said, "You can be strong too!"Lily took the small flower to a temple. The temple was a special place where flowers could grow big and strong. Lily said to the flower, "You will bloom here and become strong like the trees." The small flower was happy and excited.Days went by, and the small flower started to grow. One day, Lily came back to the temple. She saw the flower had bloomed and become strong. "Look at you!", she said. "You are so big and strong now!" The flower was very happy and thanked Lily for helping it grow.

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play with blocks and dolls. But one day, Tom is angry. He does not want to share his blocks with Mia. He says, "Go away, Mia. These are my blocks. You are bad."Mia is sad. She does not understand why Tom is angry. She likes Tom and his blocks. She says, "Please, Tom. Can I play with you? I am not bad. I am your friend."Tom does not listen. He pushes Mia away. Mia falls down and hurts her knee. She cries. She sees blood on her knee. She is scared.Tom feels sorry. He did not mean to hurt Mia. He says, "I am sorry, Mia. I did not want to hurt you. I was angry. I hate this note."Mia looks at the note. It is from Tom's mom. It says, "Tom, you have to go to the dentist today. I know you do not like it, but it is good for your teeth. I love you."Mia says, "Oh, Tom. I understand. You are afraid of the dentist. I am afraid too. But it is not so bad. The dentist is nice. He gives you a sticker and a toy. And your mom loves you. She wants you to be healthy."Tom smiles. He says, "Thank you, Mia. You are a good friend. I am sorry I was mean to you. Can I give you a hug?"Mia nods. She says, "Yes, Tom. I forgive you. Can we play with the blocks and the dolls together?"Tom says, "Yes, Mia. We can. And can you help me write a note to my mom? I want to tell her I love her too."Mia says, "Of course, Tom. I can help you. Let's write the note with crayons. And let's draw a heart and a smiley face."Tom and Mia hug. They are happy. They write the note. They play with the blocks and the dolls. They are friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big tank. It was a fierce tank, but it was also very nice. The tank lived in a land where everything was hot. One day, the tank met a new friend. The friend was a small ice cube. The ice cube was very cold.The tank and the ice cube liked to play together. They played fun games like hide and seek, and tag. But the ice cube started to feel too hot. It was not happy in the hot land. The ice cube began to melt.The tank saw the ice cube melting and wanted to help. It thought of a plan. The tank took the ice cube to a cold place, where it would not melt. The ice cube was happy again. The tank and the ice cube stayed friends forever, and they played together whenever they could.

Once upon a time, there was a huge leopard. He had big spots and lived in a forest. The huge leopard loved to play with his friends. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long.One day, the huge leopard found a big tree. He wanted to climb it. He tried and tried, but he could not get up. He felt sad. His friends saw him and wanted to help. They had a big idea.They got a long vine and tied it to the tree. Then, they pulled the vine tight. The huge leopard held on to the vine and his friends pulled him up. They all laughed and cheered as the huge leopard reached the top of the tree. Now, the huge leopard could see the whole forest. He was so happy and had lots of fun with his friends.

One day, a little red ant was walking in the grass. The sun was shining, and the ant was happy. He saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. As he started to climb, he saw a big cat."Hello, cat," said the ant. "Can you help me climb the tree?"The cat looked at the ant and said, "I can help you, but I need something first." The cat had to sneeze. "Achoo!" The cat sneezed so hard that the little red ant flew up into the tree."Thank you, cat!" said the ant. He was now in the big tree. The ant was very happy and played in the tree all day. The cat and the ant became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Mia went to the park. She had a big red bag with her. In the bag, she had a ball, a toy car, and a rare, shiny rock. Mia loved her shiny rock because it was very special.At the park, Mia saw a boy named Tom. Tom wanted to learn how to throw a ball. Mia said, "I can help you!" So, they took the ball out of the bag and played together. Mia showed Tom how to throw the ball, and soon he learned.After they played, Mia showed Tom her toy car and the rare shiny rock from her bag. Tom liked the shiny rock too. They became good friends and promised to play together again. They put everything back in the bag and went home, happy to have learned and shared.

Lila and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to run and slide and swing. But then Ben fell down and hurt his knee. He cried and cried. Lila ran to him and said, "Don't cry, Ben. I will help you."Lila took out her backpack and opened it. She had a bandage inside. She said, "Look, Ben. I have a bandage for you. It will make your knee feel better." She put the bandage on Ben's knee and said, "There. Now you are brave and strong."Ben stopped crying and smiled. He said, "Thank you, Lila. You are a good friend. Can I see your bandage?" Lila nodded and said, "Sure, Ben. But you have to be careful. It is a special bandage."Lila lifted her sleeve and showed Ben her arm. She had a bandage too. But under the bandage, there was something shiny and colorful. It was a sticker. Lila said, "This is my sticker. It is a star. I got it from the doctor. He said I was brave too."Ben gasped and said, "Wow, Lila. Your sticker is so pretty. Can I have one too?" Lila said, "Maybe, Ben. But you have to go to the doctor first. He will check your knee and make sure it is not bad. Then he will give you a sticker too."Ben said, "Okay, Lila. Let's go to the doctor. Maybe he will have a sticker for me too. But can I keep your bandage? It is so soft and dry." Lila said, "Of course, Ben. You can keep my bandage. And I will keep yours. We are bandage buddies." They hugged and laughed and went to the doctor. They were happy and brave.

One day, a little bird named Tim wanted to dive into the soft, green grass. He was in wonder at how fun it would be. So, Tim flew up high in the sky to get ready for his big dive.As Tim was getting ready to dive, he saw his friend, the big yellow sun, smiling down at him. The sun made him feel warm and happy. Tim took a deep breath and then he started to dive down, down, down towards the soft, green grass.Just before Tim touched the grass, he opened his wings and landed softly on the ground. He was so happy that he had done it! Tim looked around and saw his friends, the trees and flowers, clapping for him. They were proud of Tim for his big dive into the soft, green grass. And Tim was full of wonder and joy.

Once upon a time, there was a musician. He loved to play his blue guitar. Every day, he played songs for all his friends. They loved to hear him play.One day, the musician needed a new guitar string. He went to the store to buy one. When he got back, he saw that his blue guitar was gone. He was very sad and didn't know what to do.Then, a little bird flew by and said, "I know where your guitar is!" The musician followed the bird. They found his blue guitar by a big tree. The bird had taken it to play music too! The musician was happy and played a song with the bird. They became best friends and played music together every day.

Once upon a time, a little cat named Mimi loved to yawn. She would yawn all day and all night. Mimi also liked to look at prints on the wall. Her favorite print was a big, light sun.One day, Mimi was looking at the sun print and yawning. She yawned so big that the print started to shake. Mimi was scared, but she couldn't stop yawning. The sun print fell off the wall!When the print fell, Mimi saw a door behind it. She had never seen this door before. Mimi was curious, so she opened the door. Inside, she found a room full of more prints! Mimi was so happy, and she yawned again. This time, her yawn did not make the prints shake.

Once upon a time, there was a clean mailbox on a street. It was a nice mailbox where people put their mail. One day, a boy named Tim wanted to test how strong the mailbox was. So, he pushed it a little bit.As Tim pushed the mailbox, something unexpected happened. The mailbox started to talk! It said, "Hello, Tim! I am a magic mailbox. I can give you a surprise if you help me."Tim was very excited. He wanted to see the surprise. So, he helped the magic mailbox by cleaning it more. When he was done, the mailbox opened up, and out came a big, colorful ball. Tim was so happy and played with the ball all day. The magic mailbox and Tim became good friends.

One day, a little girl named Lily went for a walk in the deep woods with her mom. They saw many pretty things like trees, birds, and flowers. Lily's favorite flower was the rose. She loved how red and pretty they were.As they walked, Lily saw a big rose bush with a very big red rose. She wanted to pick it, but it was too high for her to reach. A nice boy named Tom was near the bush. He saw Lily looking at the rose and said, "Do you want that rose? I can get it for you." Lily smiled and said, "Yes, please!"Tom picked the big red rose and offered it to Lily. She was so happy and said, "Thank you, Tom!" Lily and her mom walked home with the pretty rose, and Lily knew she had made a new friend in the deep woods.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tom went on a holiday with his family. They went to a quiet place near the sea. Tom liked to play with his ball near the water. One day, Tom saw a big crab near the water. The crab had a big claw that could hold things.Tom wanted to be friends with the crab, but the crab was scared of the ball. Tom tried to show the crab that the ball was fun, but the crab ran away. Tom was sad and didn't know what to do. He wanted the crab to like him and the ball.Then, Tom had an idea. He found a small stick and held it out to the crab. The crab liked the stick and held it with its big claw. Tom and the crab played with the stick and became friends. They had a great holiday together, and Tom learned that sometimes you need to try new things to make friends.

One day, a boy named Tim and his mom went on a trip. They decided to go to the park. The park was big and had many fun things to do. Tim was very excited.At the park, Tim saw a lemon tree. He picked a lemon and said, "Mom, can I eat this?" His mom said, "It might be sour, but you can try." Tim took a bite and made a funny face. The lemon was very sour! Tim's mom laughed and said, "I told you it would be sour!"Tim was sad that the lemon was sour. He wanted to find something sweet to eat. He saw a girl with a big ice cream cone. He asked her, "Can I have some of your ice cream?" The girl said, "No, this is mine!" Tim was upset, but then his mom said, "Let's go buy our own ice cream." They went to the ice cream stand and bought a big sweet ice cream cone. Tim was happy again, and they enjoyed the rest of their trip at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Bobo. Bobo was an independent dog who loved to joke and play. One day, Bobo saw a big cat named Whiskers. Whiskers was not in a good mood.Bobo said, "Hey Whiskers, why not joke and play with me?" Whiskers replied, "No, I am tired and need a nap."Bobo didn't like this. He wanted to play now. So, he tried to wake Whiskers up. This made Whiskers very mad. Bobo and Whiskers talked about it. They learned that sometimes, you need to let others rest. Now, they play together when Whiskers is not napping. They both learned to be kind to each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Bob. Bob was very nervous because he wanted to escape to the west. He had heard that the west was the best place to find yummy food and make new friends.One day, Bob met a big bird named Sam. Bob asked, "Can you help me escape to the west?" Sam said, "Yes, I can show you the way. But first, we must be brave and not be nervous."Bob and Sam started their journey to the west. They flew over hills and rivers. Bob felt less nervous because Sam was with him. They talked and laughed as they flew together.Finally, they reached the west. Bob was so happy to see all the yummy food and new friends waiting for him. He thanked Sam for helping him escape and not be nervous. From that day on, Bob and Sam were best friends, and they lived happily in the west.

Once upon a time there was a little boy who thought he could do anything. But one day, he started getting wet and crazy.He asked his mom, "Mommy, why am I getting wet and crazy?"His mom just smiled. "Come outside and you'll find out," she said.The boy went out into the backyard and he was amazed! Everywhere he looked there were buckets filled with water!The boy's mom laughed and said, "This is for you! Today is the start of your water balloon fight!" She then showed him how to fill up balloons with water, and the boy's eyes lit up.He started to have so much fun! Scooping up water, filling the balloons and then throwing them at his mom and dad! He continued getting wet and crazy, but he was having the time of his life.The little boy realized that his mom was right - he could do anything! He just needed to start, and before he knew it, he was having an incredible time with his family.

Lily and Ben are playing in the pool. They like to splash and swim and have fun. Lily sees a white cloth at the bottom of the pool. She wants to get it."Look, Ben, a white cloth!" she says.
