"I want to dive and get it. Can you dive too?"Ben nods. He likes to dive. He can hold his breath for a long time. He follows Lily as she dives into the water. They swim to the white cloth.Lily reaches the cloth first. She grabs it and swims up. Ben swims up too. They both come out of the water and smile."Wow, you did it, Lily!" Ben says. "You are a good diver. What is the white cloth?"Lily looks at the cloth. It is soft and fluffy. It has a picture of a duck on it. She remembers. It is her towel. She left it on the edge of the pool."It is my towel, Ben," she says. "I forgot it here. It is wet now. But it is still my towel. I like it. Do you want to share it?"Ben nods. He likes Lily. He likes to share. They wrap the towel around them and hug. They are happy. They are friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim and a little girl named Sue were playing in their room. They both liked to play with their toy phone. The phone was very special because it was powerful. It could make fun sounds and light up. Tim and Sue loved to pretend to call their friends on the phone.One day, Tim wanted to play with the phone, but Sue was already playing with it. Tim said, "I want to play with the phone now." Sue said, "But I am playing with it." They both wanted to play with the powerful phone, but they didn't know how to share.Their mom heard them and came into the room. She said, "Why don't you both share the phone? You can take turns and play together." Tim and Sue thought about it and decided to try. Tim played with the phone for a little bit, then gave it to Sue. Sue played with the phone and then gave it back to Tim.As they shared the powerful phone, they had even more fun than before. They called their pretend friends and talked about their day. They laughed and smiled as they played together. Tim and Sue learned that sharing made their playtime even better.

There was an event at the park. Jack and Julie were excited to go but their mom told them it had to be a modest event. So Jack and Julie left the house and went to the park.When they got to the park, they looked around but all they could see was a pile of dirt. Jack said, "Mom said it was an event! Where is it?!" Julie said, "Maybe there's something buried here?"So Jack and Julie started to dig. Sure enough, after a short time, they found a box buried in the dirt. Jack said, "We found something! Open it up, Julie!" Julie said, "Ok!"When Julie opened the box, she found a strange creature inside. Jack and Julie screamed in terror. "Run!" Jack shouted, and they both ran away as fast as they could. As they left, the creature was still screaming, and it sounded like it was angry. Mom was waiting back at the house and when they ran in, she said, "what happened? Why are you so scared?!" But Jack and Julie just wouldn't talk about it.They had left the event with a bad ending, and they wanted to forget it ever happened.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He lived in a small house with his mom, dad, and baby sister. Tim's room was upstairs, right next to his sister's room. He loved to play with his toys and read books in his room.One day, Tim's mom asked him to behave while she went to the store. She told him to be a good boy and not make a mess. Tim promised to be good and started to play with his toys. But then, he saw a bitter lemon on the table. It looked so yummy, so he took a big bite. "Yuck!" he said, making a funny face.Tim decided to go upstairs and play with his sister. They played nicely and behaved just like their mom asked them to. When their mom came home, she was happy to see that they were behaving well. She gave them both a big hug and a sweet treat for being such good kids. And Tim learned that behaving well made his mom happy and proud of him.

Once upon a time, in a big green park, there was a chubby cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play and tease the birds that lived in the trees. One day, Fluffy saw a big red ball on the ground. He thought it would be fun to play with it.Fluffy went to the big red ball and rolled it around the park. As he played, he saw a little girl named Lily. Lily was sad because she could not find her big red ball. Fluffy thought, "I have not seen Lily smile yet. I want to help her be happy."Fluffy rolled the big red ball to Lily and said, "Is this your ball?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes! Thank you, Fluffy!" They played together with the big red ball and became good friends. From that day on, Fluffy did not tease the birds anymore. He learned that it was more fun to play with friends and make them happy.

One day, a little girl named Lucy and her sister, Lily, went to the park. They were very lucky because the sun was shining and the sky was blue. Lucy and Lily loved to play on the swings and slide.While playing, Lucy saw a big rock on the slide. She said to Lily, "Let's remove the rock so we can play safely." Lily agreed, and they both pushed the rock away. Now the slide was clear, and they could play without worry.After playing for a while, Lucy and Lily were tired. They sat on the grass and shared a yummy snack. Lucy said, "I'm lucky to have a sister like you, Lily." Lily smiled and said, "I'm lucky too, Lucy." And they continued to enjoy their fun day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a tall boy named Tim. Tim liked to race with his friends. They would run fast and laugh. Tim always won the races because he had long legs.One day, after winning a race, Tim went home. He saw his mom watching television. The television showed people racing too. Tim wanted to race with the people on the television. He thought it would be fun.Tim went outside and started to race with the television. But something unexpected happened. A big dog joined the race! Tim was scared, but the dog just wanted to play. They raced together and became best friends. Now, Tim and the big dog always race together and have fun.

One day, a big dog named Max and a small cat named Lily were playing in the park. Max was very strong and had big muscles. Lily was small but she was very fast. They liked to play together even though it was sometimes difficult for Lily to keep up with Max.Max said to Lily, "Let's play a game of catch. I will throw the ball and you try to catch it." Lily was scared because Max threw the ball very far. But she did not want to refuse the game. So, she said, "Okay, let's play!"Max threw the ball far, far away. Lily ran as fast as she could to catch the ball. It was difficult, but she did not give up. She used all her muscles to jump and catch the ball. Max was very happy and said, "Good job, Lily! You are very strong and fast!"Lily was very proud of herself. She learned that even if something is difficult, she should not refuse to try. Max and Lily played more games and had a lot of fun together.

One day, a furry cat named Kitty had a job. Her job was to find a big, red ball. Kitty looked everywhere for the ball. She looked under the table, and she looked in the yard. But, the big, red ball was not there.Kitty asked her friend, Doggy, "Did you see my big, red ball?" Doggy said, "Yes, I saw it. It went that way!" Doggy pointed with his paw. Kitty said, "Thank you, Doggy!" She ran to find the ball.Kitty found the big, red ball near the tree. She was so happy! She played with the ball all day. Kitty did her job well. Now, she can play with her friend, Doggy. And that is what happened.

Once upon a time there was a girl who wanted to go on an adventure. She went to the beach and found a reef. She gathered a lot of interesting stones and shells.The girl was determined to succeed and decided to dive further. But it was so dark and she was a bit scared. She was about to turn back when she saw a dolphin.The girl asked the dolphin, "Will you help me succeed?"The dolphin said, "Yes! Climb on my back and I will take you further."The dolphin took the girl to a magical underwater world filled with interesting creatures and plants. The girl was very excited and succeeded in reaching the other side of the reef. When she came back, she was so happy and couldn't wait to tell everyone about her successful adventure.

Tim and Anna are rabbits who live in a hole under a big tree. They like to play and eat carrots every day. One night, they hear a loud noise outside their hole. They peek out and see a big truck with bright lights and a big net."Oh no!" Tim says. "That is a bad truck. It wants to catch us and take us away. We have to hide!""Where can we hide?" Anna asks. "It is dark and we cannot see well."Tim thinks for a moment. He remembers a place where they can be safe. "Follow me!" he says. "We can go to the farmer's garden. There are many carrots there and a big fence. The truck cannot get in there."Tim and Anna run as fast as they can to the garden. They squeeze under the fence and find a pile of carrots. They are hungry and scared, so they start to eat some carrots."Yum, these are good carrots!" Anna says. "Thank you for bringing me here, Tim. You are a brave rabbit."Tim smiles and hugs Anna. "You are welcome, Anna. You are a kind rabbit. We can stay here until the truck goes away. Then we can go back to our hole."They eat some more carrots and cuddle together. They feel warm and happy. They do not hear the truck anymore. They fall asleep under the stars.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Shelly. Shelly was only three years old and she loved to explore. As she was walking through her house, she saw a desk and wondered what it was used for. She asked her mom, "Mommy, what is this desk for?"Her mom smiled and explained, "This is a very important desk. This is where I write letters and make phone calls. The desk helps me to do my job."Shelly thought about this for a moment, then she said, "Can I have a desk too? I want to do important things too!"Her mom tousled her hair and said, "Oh Shelly, you can do important things! You can help me tidy my desk and then you will be helping me do my job. Helping others is an important thing to do."Shelly smiled and began to busily tidy her mom's desk. She learned an important lesson that day - that all jobs were important, and that helping others was very valuable.

One day, a girl named Sue went to a big box. It had a veil on it. Sue wanted to see what was inside. She said, "I want to open the box!" So, she pulled the veil off and opened the box.Inside the box, Sue found an ugly doll. The doll had a big nose and messy hair. Sue said, "You are ugly, but I will play with you." She took the doll outside to play.As they played, something unexpected happened. The ugly doll started to talk! The doll said, "Thank you for playing with me." Sue was surprised but happy. They played together all day and became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly bean named Mark. He lived in a small garden with his bean friends. They all liked to play and have fun in the sun.One day, Mark and his friends decided to play a game. They wanted to see who could jump the highest. Mark was very good at jumping. He jumped so high, he could touch the sky."Wow, Mark! You jump so high!" said his friend, Bean. "I want to jump like you!" Mark smiled and said, "You can do it, Bean! Just try your best!" So, Bean tried to jump as high as Mark. They all had a fun day playing together.

Once upon a time, there was a mole who lived in a rare old den. Inside, it was filled of wonderful things that she would stir up during the day.One night, the mole heard a noise coming from outside her den. She could barely make out a voice saying, "I'm looking for something rare!" The mole was curious. She popped out of her den to see what was going on.She saw a little girl standing there with a big stirring spoon in her hand. "Can you help me?" the little girl said.The mole asked, "Help with what?""I'm looking for something rare for my mom," she replied. The mole smiled. "I think I might know of something rare that would make your mom happy. Why don't you come inside and I'll show you what it is."The little girl was excited and followed the mole into her special den. Inside, the mole stirred up a huge pot of soup with a special ingredient that only she knew of.When the soup was finished, the mole showed it to the little girl. "Wow!" the little girl said. "This looks really rare. I'm sure my mom will love it!"The mole smiled and said, "I'm glad you like it. Now go home and stir up some happiness!"

Once upon a time, there was a frog that was living in a pond. One day, the frog wanted to find a new home and started hopping around, looking for somewhere it could remain.The frog kept hopping until it came across an unusual pond. The pond was very different to the other ponds it had seen, in that it was surrounded by lots of colourful pebbles. The frog was so excited, that without thinking, it jumped right into the pond.At first, the frog was very happy and remained in the pond for many days. But the frog soon discovered that this special pond had an unusual secret. When the frog was in the water, it found it hard to jump out.The frog learned a valuable lesson - never stay somewhere that you do not fully understand. After some careful thinking, the frog was able to jump out of the pond and find a home where it could remain happily.

One day, a busy ant named Tim was walking on a carpet. The carpet was big and soft. Tim was looking for food to take back to his ant friends.As Tim walked, he saw a big cookie on the carpet. He said, "Wow! This cookie will make my friends happy!" Tim tried to lift the cookie, but it was too heavy. He needed help.Tim went back to his ant friends and said, "I found a big cookie, but I need help to carry it." Many ants came to help Tim. Together, they lifted the cookie and carried it back. The ants were so happy that their food increased a lot. They thanked Tim for finding the cookie and shared it with everyone.

One day, a little boy named Timmy decided to wander through the park by himself. He didn't know where he was going and he had never been to this park. After awhile, he came to a strange old station. It was very spooky and made Timmy feel a bit scared.Suddenly, he heard a loud noise. He quickly looked around but he couldn't see anything. He started to feel a little ashamed because he thought he had done something wrong. But then he heard it again, and he realized it was a train. He got very excited and stood up to get a better look. He realized that the station was a train station and he had wandered right up to it. Timmy was so happy he had found the station. He watched the train chug away until it was out of sight. When it was gone, he smiled and decided to go back home.

Once upon a time, in a big tree, there was a lucky owl. The owl had many friends who lived near him. They would play and have fun all day long.One day, the owl heard about a big show happening in the forest. All the animals were going to perform and show their skills. The owl wanted to be part of the show too. He thought about what he could do and decided to sing a beautiful song.The day of the show came, and all the animals were excited. The lucky owl was a little scared, but he knew his friends would be there to cheer him on. When it was his turn, the owl sang his song. Everyone was so happy and started to applaud. The lucky owl felt proud and knew he had done a great job. From that day on, he knew he could do anything with the help of his friends.

Sara and Ben were very excited to go to the air show with their dad. They loved to see the big jets fly in the sky and make loud noises. Dad said they would also see a special display of old planes that were used in a big war.When they got to the air show, they saw many jets parked on the ground. Some were shiny and new, and some were old and rusty. Sara and Ben ran to look at them and touch them. Dad told them to be careful and not to climb on them."Look, Dad, this jet has a star on it!" Sara said, pointing to a red and white plane."That's a Soviet jet, Sara. It was used by our enemies in the big war. But now we are friends with them," Dad explained."Wow, that's cool. And look, this jet has a cross on it!" Ben said, pointing to a black and yellow plane."That's a German jet, Ben. It was also used by our enemies in the big war. But now we are friends with them, too," Dad said.Sara and Ben nodded. They wondered how the jets could be friends after fighting in the big war. They wanted to see them fly and make peace signs.Soon, the air show started. The jets took off and flew in the sky. They made loops and twists and turns. They flew very fast and very high. Sara and Ben clapped and cheered. They loved the jets.Then, the old planes came out. They were smaller and slower than the jets. They had propellers and wings. They looked like toys. Sara and Ben were not very impressed.But then, something amazing happened. The old planes started to shoot at each other. They made loud bangs and smoke. They pretended to be in the big war. Sara and Ben gasped. They were scared."Dad, why are they shooting at

Once upon a time, there was a big, yellow duck. The duck loved to soak in water all day. He liked to splash and play with his friends in the pond. They had so much fun together.One day, a new duck came to the pond. He was a little bit selfish. He wanted to soak his body all by himself. He did not want to share the water with the other ducks. The big, yellow duck was sad because he wanted to play with the new duck.The big, yellow duck had an idea. He decided to show the new duck how much fun they could have if they played together. So, they splashed and soaked their bodies in the water. The new duck saw how much fun it was and stopped being selfish. Now, all the ducks played together and had fun in the pond.

Once upon a time, a little dog named Spot wanted to enter a big red house. The house looked fun and he thought he might find a friend inside. So, Spot walked up to the door and went in.Inside the house, Spot found a big room with a lot of toys. He saw a little girl named Sally. Sally was playing with her toys and looked very happy. Spot wanted to play too, but he felt uncomfortable. He was not sure if Sally would like him.Spot decided to be brave and walked up to Sally. He wagged his tail and smiled. Sally saw Spot and smiled back. They started to play together and had a lot of fun. Spot was not uncomfortable anymore. He was happy he entered the big red house and made a new friend.

Sara and Sam are twins. They like to sing. They sing in the morning, in the afternoon, and at night. They sing loud and happy songs.One day, they go to the park with Mom. They see a big slide. They want to go on the slide. They run to the slide and wait for their turn."Can we sing on the slide, Mom?" Sara asks."Sure, you can sing on the slide, but be careful and hold on tight," Mom says.Sara and Sam nod. They climb up the ladder and sit on the slide. They hold each other's hand and start to sing."Twinkle, twinkle, little star, how I wonder what you are," they sing.They slide down the slide, singing and laughing. They land on the ground and hug each other."That was fun!" Sam says."Let's do it again!" Sara says.Mom smiles and claps. She thinks Sara and Sam are good twins. She loves their singing.

Once upon a time, there was a thoughtful cat named Tom. Tom liked to help his friends. One day, Tom's friend, a bird named Sally, came to visit him. Sally had some news to share with Tom."Tom," said Sally, "I lost my toy. Can you help me find it?" Tom thought for a moment and said, "Yes, Sally. I will help you find your toy." So, they went on a journey to find Sally's toy.After looking high and low, Tom found the toy under a big tree. He picked it up and said, "Sally, I found your toy!" Sally was so happy. She thanked Tom for his help. They returned to Tom's house and played with the toy together. From that day on, they became the best of friends.

One morning, a dependable dog named Spot went for a walk with his best friend, a little boy named Tim. They liked to play and run in the park. The sun was shining and the birds were singing. Spot and Tim were very happy.While they were playing, Tim threw a ball for Spot to catch. But this time, the ball went very far away. Spot ran and ran to get the ball, but he could not see it. Spot was sad because he did not want to lose the ball.Spot looked around and saw a nice girl named Sue. Spot asked her, "Have you seen my ball?" Sue said, "Yes, it is over there!" Spot found the ball and was very happy. Tim and Spot thanked Sue and went back to playing. They had a fun morning at the park.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big basket of grapes on a bench. They are hungry and curious."Who left these grapes here?" Anna asks."I don't know. Maybe someone forgot them," Ben says."Can we have some?" Anna says.Ben looks around. He does not see anyone. He is nosy and wants to try the grapes. He picks one and puts it in his mouth. It is sweet and juicy."Mmm, these are good. Do you want one?" Ben says.Anna nods. She reaches for a grape. But before she can take it, a loud voice makes them jump."Hey, what are you doing with my grapes?" the voice says.Anna and Ben turn around. They see a man with a big hat and a beard. He looks angry. He is holding a bag and a book. He is the owner of the grapes."Sorry, sir. We thought they were for everyone," Anna says."No, they are not. They are mine. I bought them at the market. I was going to read my book and eat them. But you nosy kids took them without asking," the man says.He walks to the bench and grabs the basket. He glares at Anna and Ben."Go away. And don't touch other people's things," he says.Anna and Ben feel scared and sorry. They run away from the bench. They look for a new place to play."Are you okay?" Ben asks."Yes, I'm okay. But I feel bad. We should not have taken the grapes," Anna says."Me too. We should have asked first. Or found our own snack," Ben says.They find a swing and sit on it. They swing back and forth. They try to forget the angry man and the grapes.Then they see a lady with a dog. The dog is small and fluffy. It has a pink bow on its head. It runs to Anna and Ben. It wags its tai

Anna and Ben were playing in the backyard. They saw a big ladder leaning on the wall. They wanted to climb it and see what was on the other side."Let's go up the ladder!" Ben said. "It looks fun!""I don't know," Anna said. "It looks high and scary. What if we fall?""Don't worry," Ben said. "I will go first and you can follow me. Just trust me, okay?"Anna nodded. She was a little afraid, but she was also curious. She was flexible and liked to try new things.Ben climbed the ladder slowly and carefully. He held on to the rungs with his hands and feet. He reached the top and looked over the wall. He saw a big park with swings and slides and flowers."Wow!" he said. "It's so pretty! Come on, Anna, you have to see this!"Anna heard Ben's voice and felt more brave. She followed him up the ladder. She was careful not to look down. She reached the top and saw the park too."It is pretty!" she said. "Can we go there and play?""Sure!" Ben said. "But first we have to go down the ladder. Be careful, okay?"They climbed down the ladder together. They were happy and proud. They had done something new and exciting. They trusted each other and had fun. They ran to the park and played until it was time to go home.

In a small town, there was a big tree. It was a popular tree where all the kids liked to play. One day, a little boy named Tim went to the tree. He saw his friend, Sue, standing by the tree. The sky was full of mist, making it hard to see."Hi Sue," Tim said. "I can't see very well. The mist is too thick.""Hi Tim," Sue said. "I know, it's hard to see. But I found something cool. Come see!"Tim and Sue walked around the tree. They found a big box. It was a surprise! They opened the box and saw many toys. They were so happy and played with the toys all day. The mist went away, and the sun came out. Tim and Sue had a fun day with their new toys.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Ella. Every day, Ella went to the park near her house to play. She loved the warmth of the sun and the smell of the grass.One day, Ella noticed something strange in the park. A big, grey cloud appeared in the sky. The wind began to blow and Ella started to shiver. She was chilly and her nose felt cold.As the cloud moved closer, Ella heard a loud noise. It was the law and it said that the park was closed! Ella didn't understand. Why was the park closed?The next day, Ella returned to the park and noticed something strange. The sun was shining brightly and the air felt warm. Ella was so happy and suddenly, she understood why the park was closed the day before.A big storm was coming and the law closed the park to keep the people safe. Ella felt relieved and so happy that the law kept people warm and safe.

Once upon a time, in an enormous universe, there lived a little girl named Mia. Mia had a best friend, a big bear named Ben. They liked to play, laugh, and explore together. One day, they found a big, shiny box under a tree. "What's in the box?" Mia asked Ben."I don't know," Ben said, "Let's open it!" When they opened the box, they found a big, magic ball. The ball could talk! "Hello, I am a magic ball," it said, "I can make things seem different."Mia and Ben were very surprised. They didn't know what to do. "What do you mean?" asked Mia. The magic ball showed them. It made the sky seem green and the grass seem blue. Mia and Ben laughed and laughed. They had so much fun with the magic ball. And they knew they had found a new friend in their enormous universe.

One day, Sam was playing in the park when his dad came by with a big bag. Sam was very excited and asked, "What's in the bag, Dad?" "It's a surprise," said Dad. He took out a comb and handed it to Sam. "This is for you," said Dad.Sam was so happy and said, "Thank you, Dad." He quickly took the comb and combed his hair. Then he tried to pay Dad with a hug.Dad smiled and said, "That's very sweet of you, but I didn't pay for the comb. I got it for free."Sam looked a little tired and said, "Oh. Can we go home now, Dad? I'm getting very tired." "Of course," said Dad. He picked Sam up and carried him home. As they walked home, Sam combed his hair while he held onto Dad tightly.

Lily and Max are twins. They like to play with blocks. They have many blocks of different colors and shapes. They can make houses, towers, cars and animals with their blocks.One day, they decide to have a contest. Who can make the best animal with blocks? Lily says, "I will make a cat. Cats are cute and soft." Max says, "I will make a dog. Dogs are brave and loyal." They start to build their animals with blocks.Lily adds a triangle block for the cat's nose. She adds two round blocks for the cat's eyes. She adds four long blocks for the cat's legs. She adds a curved block for the cat's tail. She adds two small blocks for the cat's ears. She says, "Look, I made a cat. It is very pretty."Max adds a square block for the dog's head. He adds two oval blocks for the dog's eyes. He adds four short blocks for the dog's legs. He adds a straight block for the dog's tail. He adds two big blocks for the dog's ears. He says, "Look, I made a dog. It is very strong."They look at each other's animals. They both think their own animal is better. They start to argue. "My cat is better than your dog," Lily says. "No, my dog is better than your cat," Max says. They get angry and competitive. They do not want to share their blocks.Mom hears them and comes to see what is wrong. She sees their animals and smiles. She says, "You both made very nice animals with blocks. But you know what? You can make even better animals if you work together. Why don't you try to add some blocks from each other's animals and see what happens?"Lily and Max think about it. They decide to try. Lily adds one of Max's big blocks to her

Once upon a time, there was a blue bird named Bob. Bob loved to joke and make his friends laugh. One day, he found a cloth while flying in the sky. The cloth was soft and colorful. Bob had an idea to make his friends laugh with the cloth.Bob went to his friend, a little cat named Tina. "Tina," said Bob, "I have a joke for you." Tina looked at Bob and smiled. "Okay, show me the joke," said Tina. Bob took the cloth and put it on his head like a hat. He danced around and made a funny face. Tina laughed and clapped her paws.Bob felt happy that his joke made Tina laugh. He went to see his other friends and showed them the joke with the cloth too. All of his friends laughed and had a great time. From that day on, Bob and his friends played with the cloth, making jokes and having fun together. And they all lived happily ever after.

Tom and Lily were playing in the kitchen. They liked to pretend they were chefs and make food with the pots and pans. They also liked to open and close the cabinet doors and see what was inside.One day, they found a big jar of yellow powder in one of the cabinets. They did not know what it was, but it looked like sand. They decided to use it for their food. They poured some of it into a bowl and mixed it with water. Then they tasted it."Yuck!" Tom spat out the yellow paste. "This is bitter! It is not good for food!""Let me try!" Lily said. She took a spoonful of the paste and put it in her mouth. She made a face and spit it out too. "You are right, Tom. This is bitter and yucky!"They did not want to play with the yellow powder anymore. They wanted to get rid of it. They looked around the kitchen and saw the trash can. They thought that was a good place to put the yellow powder. They carried the bowl to the trash can and dumped the paste inside.But they did not see that the trash can was full of paper and cardboard. The yellow powder was not sand. It was fire powder. It made a big boom and a big fire. The fire spread to the paper and the cardboard and the trash can. It also spread to the cabinet and the wall and the curtains."Help! Help!" Tom and Lily screamed. "Fire! Fire!"Mom and Dad heard their screams and ran to the kitchen. They saw the fire and grabbed the fire extinguisher. They sprayed the fire with the white foam and put it out. They were very angry and scared."Tom! Lily! What did you do?" Mom shouted. "You could have burned the house down! You could have hurt yourselves!""We are s

Once upon a time, there was a lovely little girl named Lucy. She had a favorite toy, a pretty doll with a pink dress. Lucy played with her doll every day and took her everywhere she went.One day, Lucy's mom asked her to complete a task. She wanted Lucy to put away all her toys and clean her room. Lucy did not want to do it, but she knew it was important to listen to her mom. So, she put away her toys and cleaned her room. When she was done, she felt very proud.That night, as Lucy went to bed, she had a happy memory of the day. She learned that when she listens to her mom and does what she is asked, it makes her feel good. The moral of the story is to always listen to your parents and do what they ask, because it will make you feel proud and happy.

Once upon a time, there was an ancient car. The car was very old and tired. It went "vroom vroom" but it needed help. One day, a little boy named Tim saw the car. He wanted to make it better.Tim said, "Car, I will help you!" He found some gas and put it in the car. The car was happy. It blinked its lights to say thank you. Tim smiled and started to drive the car.As they drove, they saw a big hill. The car tried to go up the hill, but it was hard. Tim said, "Don't worry, car! We can do it!" The car blinked its lights again and tried harder. They made it to the top of the hill, and they were very happy. They drove home together, the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly duck. The duck lived near a creek. The water in the creek was clear and cold. The friendly duck loved to swim and play in the creek.One day, the friendly duck found a dress. The dress was pretty and colorful. The friendly duck wanted to wear the dress. So, the duck put on the dress and looked at its reflection in the creek. The duck felt very happy.The friendly duck swam and played in the creek with the dress on. All the other animals saw the duck and smiled. They loved the duck's pretty dress. The friendly duck felt proud and had a fun day at the creek.

Once upon a time, there was a thoughtful little girl named Lily. She had a magic toy that could glow. The toy's name was Glowbug. Lily and Glowbug loved to play together all day.One day, Lily and Glowbug went to the park. They played on the swings and the slide. After a while, they got tired. Lily said, "Glowbug, let's take a nap under the big tree." Glowbug agreed, and they both lay down for a nap.As they slept, the sun began to set. When Lily woke up, it was dark. She was scared, but then she remembered her magic toy. She said, "Glowbug, please glow and light up the way home." Glowbug glowed brightly, and they walked home together, safe and sound.

Once upon a time, there was a big fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim in the deep blue sea. He had many friends who liked to swim with him. They played and laughed all day long.One day, Fin found a shiny thing at the bottom of the sea. It had much value. He showed it to his friends and they all wanted it. They started to fight over the shiny thing. The big fish and his friends were not happy anymore.Then, something unexpected happened. A very big wave came and took the shiny thing away. Fin and his friends were sad. They had lost the thing with value and their fun times together. Now they knew that the shiny thing was not as important as their friendship. But it was too late.

Lily and Ben were playing in the garden with a hose. They liked to spray water on the flowers and the grass. Sometimes they sprayed each other and laughed."Look, Lily, a butterfly!" Ben said, pointing to a big yellow and black one. "It is so pretty and rare. I want to catch it."Ben ran after the butterfly with the hose. He tried to spray it, but he missed. The butterfly flew away. Ben was sad."Ben, don't spray the butterfly!" Lily said. "It is not nice. The butterfly will feel pain. You will hurt its wings."Lily put down the hose and went to Ben. She gave him a hug. "It's okay, Ben. There are more butterflies. We can watch them, but not spray them. They are our friends."Ben nodded. He felt sorry for the butterfly. He hugged Lily back. "You are right, Lily. I am sorry. I will be nice to the butterflies. They are our friends."Lily and Ben smiled. They held hands and walked to the flower bed. They saw many butterflies of different colors. They were happy. They watched them and said hello. They did not spray them. They were kind to them.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play in the park. They see a big slide. They want to go on the slide."Me first!" Lily says. She runs to the slide. She climbs up the ladder. She slides down fast. She laughs."Me too!" Ben says. He runs after Lily. He climbs up the ladder. He slides down fast. He smiles.They have fun on the slide. They go up and down many times. They are happy.Then they see a man. He has a tray. On the tray there are cupcakes. The cupcakes are sweet. They have frosting and sprinkles. They look yummy."Hello, children!" the man says. "Do you want a cupcake? They are free!""Yes, please!" Lily and Ben say. They run to the man. They each take a cupcake. They say thank you. They bite the cupcakes. They are sweet and soft. They like them.They share their cupcakes with the man. They talk to him. He is nice. He tells them stories. They listen. They are friends.They finish their cupcakes. They say goodbye to the man. They run back to the slide. They play some more. They are happy.

Once upon a time there was a boy called Jack. One day, Jack decided to go on a drive in his mommy's car. He was so excited.As he drove, Jack saw a big and cold lecture hall. He wanted to go in and explore, so he asked his mommy to stop and let him go inside. His mommy agreed, so Jack went in.He looked around and saw lots of chairs and tables - it was so exciting. Then, he felt the coldness of the room. It was so cold that Jack had to put his scarf on and run back to the car.Mommy said, "Jack, don't worry - we can come back in the summer when it's warm, okay?"Jack smiled, happy he had been on a fun drive and that he would definitely come back. He was so excited.

Once upon a time, there was a car. It wanted to go somewhere, so it started to go. It drove down the road, but then it saw something strange. It was a fake car! The car was so excited that it stopped to take a closer look. It saw that the fake car was painted in bright colours and was very shiny. The car was amazed by how nice it looked.  The real car drove around the fake car and waved to it. The fake car waved back and smiled. The two cars wanted to go together, so they zoomed off together down the street. The real car was so happy to have a new friend. The two cars drove together all the way to the beach. The real car and the fake car had so much fun playing in the sand. They splashed around in the water and built a fake sandcastle. The real car and the fake car were the best of friends now.So they drove off together, the real car and the fake car. Everyone was so happy that they had met and were now friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a door to the attic. The attic was dark and a little scary. Tim saw a rough, old box. He opened the box and found a small, magic cup. The cup was shiny and pretty. Tim took the cup to his room.In his room, Tim showed the cup to his friend, Sam. "Look, Sam! I found a magic cup!" said Tim. Sam looked at the cup and said, "Let's drink from it!" Tim filled the cup with water and they both took a sip. They felt very happy and giggly.The next day, Tim and Sam went back to the attic. They found more rough, old boxes. In one box, they found a note that said, "If you drink from the magic cup, you will have a fun day!" Tim and Sam smiled at each other. They knew they had found something special. From then on, they always drank from the magic cup and had lots of fun together.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. He saw a big tree with a small, green leaf on it. Tim wanted to touch the leaf, but it was too high for him to reach. He jumped and jumped, but he could not get the leaf.Tim saw a tall girl named Sue. He asked her, "Can you help me get the leaf?" Sue just shrugged and said, "I don't know if I can." But she tried anyway. She reached up high and got the leaf for Tim. Tim was so happy!But then, a naughty squirrel came and took the leaf from Tim's hand. Tim was sad and Sue was mad. They chased the squirrel to get the leaf back. The squirrel ran fast, but Tim and Sue did not give up. At last, the squirrel dropped the leaf and ran away. Tim and Sue picked up the leaf and smiled. They had won the chase and became good friends.

One day, a small boy named Tim was playing in the park. He saw a smooth stone on the ground. He picked it up and thought it was very pretty. Tim wanted to show his friend, Sara, the stone. He knew she would like it too.Tim found Sara by the big tree. "Look at my smooth stone," said Tim. "Wow, it is so nice!" said Sara. But when Tim tried to give it to Sara, the stone fell from his hand. It rolled away and went into a waste bin. Tim was sad, and Sara tried to help him reach for the stone.A tall man saw them and helped Tim reach the stone. He took it out of the waste bin and gave it back to Tim. The man said, "You should be careful not to drop things into waste bins. You might lose them forever." Tim thanked the man and promised to be more careful.Sara and Tim learned that they should always be careful with their things. They knew that if they were not careful, they could lose something important. And they also learned that it is good to ask for help when they need it.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy machine. It lived in a big room with other machines. But this machine did not like to be touched. It would make a loud noise if anyone tried to touch it.One day, a little girl named Lily came to the room. She saw the grumpy machine and wanted to touch it. But her mommy said, "No, no, Lily. That machine does not like to be touched." Lily was sad, but she listened to her mommy.Later, a little boy named Tim came to the room. He did not know about the grumpy machine. He touched it, and it made a very loud noise. Tim was scared and ran away. The grumpy machine was happy that no one would touch it again.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim had a terrible habit of taking money from his friends without asking. One day, he took money from his best friend, Sam, to buy a toy. Sam was very sad when he found out.Sam told his mom about what Tim did. His mom said, "You should talk to Tim and tell him how you feel." Sam went to Tim's house and told him, "You took my money, and it made me sad." Tim felt bad and said, "I am sorry, Sam. I won't do it again. Can you forgive me?"Sam thought about it and said, "Yes, I forgive you, but you must promise not to take my money again." Tim promised and gave the money back to Sam. From that day on, Tim never took money from his friends again, and he and Sam stayed best friends forever.

Once upon a time, there was a bald man named Tom. Tom liked to walk in the park every day. One day, he saw a little dog with a spike on its collar. The dog was running very fast, but it did not stop.Tom wanted to help the dog, so he started to run too. He tried to stop the dog, but it just kept going. Tom was very tired, but he did not give up. He knew that the dog needed his help.At last, Tom caught up to the dog and stopped it. He saw that the spike on its collar was stuck in a bush. Tom helped the dog get free. The dog was very happy, and it licked Tom's face. Tom felt good because he did not give up, even when it was hard. The moral of the story is to always keep trying, even when things are tough.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to a fun party. At the party, she saw a man with a funny costume. The man was bald and wore a big red nose. He made Sue laugh a lot.Sue wanted to show her mom the funny man. She took her mom's hand and pointed at the bald man in the costume. But when they looked, the man was not there anymore. Sue was sad because she wanted her mom to see him too.Then, something unexpected happened. Sue's dad came out of the kitchen. He was wearing the funny costume and had a big red nose too! Sue laughed and clapped her hands. It was her dad all along! Sue's mom hugged her dad and they all laughed together at the fun surprise.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a pretty dress and a bottle. One day, she went to play with her friend, Tom.Tom said, "Sue, I am thirsty. Can I have some water from your bottle?" Sue gave Tom the bottle, but the water was bitter. Tom made a funny face and said, "Yuck! This water is not good." Sue felt sad because she wanted to help her friend.Sue and Tom went to find good water. They found a clean river and filled the bottle. They both drank the water and it was good. Sue learned that sharing is good, but it's important to share good things. From that day, Sue and Tom always shared good things with each other and were happy.

Sam and Mia like to play in the park. They like to swing on the swings, slide on the slide, and run on the grass. One day, they see a new thing in the park. It is a pitch. It has a big net and a small ball."Look, Mia, a pitch!" Sam says. "Let's play with the ball!""OK, Sam, but how do we play?" Mia asks.Sam picks up the ball and throws it to Mia. Mia catches it and throws it back. They do this for a while, and then Sam has an idea."Let's swing the ball!" he says. "I will swing it to you, and you will swing it to me!""OK, Sam, but how do we swing the ball?" Mia asks.Sam shows Mia how to swing the ball. He holds the ball in one hand, and swings his arm back and forth. Then he lets go of the ball, and it flies to Mia."Wow, Sam, you swing the ball so well!" Mia says. She tries to swing the ball back to Sam, but she swings too hard, and the ball goes over the net."Oh no, Mia, the ball is gone!" Sam says. "How will we get it back?"They run to the net, and see that the ball is on the other side. There is a gate, but it is closed."Maybe we can open the gate," Mia says. She pushes the gate, but it does not move."Maybe we can climb the net," Sam says. He tries to climb the net, but it is too high.They are sad, and do not know what to do. Then they hear a voice."Hello, kids, do you need some help?" the voice says.They look up, and see a man. He is wearing a hat and a shirt with a logo. He is holding a big bag."Who are you?" Sam asks."I am the coach," the man says. "I work here at the pitch. I teach people how to play with the ball.""Can you help us get our ball back?" Mia asks."Sure, I can," the coac

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy had a small, fragile nest up in a tree. He loved to sit in his nest and sing happy songs all day long.One day, while Billy was sitting in his nest, he saw a tiny cell on a leaf. The cell was very small and all alone. Billy felt sad for the little cell and wanted to help it.Billy thought of a plan. He would sit by the cell and sing a beautiful song to make it feel better. The cell listened to Billy's song and started to grow. Soon, the cell was not alone anymore, and it had many friends on the leaf. Billy was happy that he could help the cell, and they all lived happily ever after.

John and his family went to the park to play. When they got there they saw a big billboard with lots of colorful pictures. John ran over to it, excited to look at all the fun it showed. John's parents smiled at him and said, "John, this billboard looks very dependable, let's have some fun." John and his family played on the swings and the slides. At first it was a lot of fun, but eventually the billboard got in the way. John reached out to push it away, but his mom said, "No, John, it's dependable and shouldn't be touched." John felt frustrated and kept pushing at it. Then suddenly he heard a loud snap and he toppled off the billboard and landed on the ground! He started crying and his parents quickly rushed to his side. John's parents were angry and disappointed with him. They were sad that he had been so careless and ruined the dependable billboard. They scolded him and told him to always be careful in the future. John was sad and now he knew to always be careful around dependable things.

One day, a jolly dog named Spot went to the theater. He wanted to see a fun show with his friends. They were all very happy to be there. The theater was big and full of people.During the show, Spot saw a cat on the stage. The cat was dancing and singing. Spot liked the cat's dance. He said to his friend, "Look, the cat is good at dancing!" His friend agreed and they both clapped for the cat.Suddenly, the show had to pause. Everyone was quiet and looked around. The cat had lost her hat while dancing. Spot saw the hat and picked it up. He gave it back to the cat. The cat was so happy and thanked Spot. The show went on and everyone had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny who was anxious about the weather. He wanted to play outside, but it was very windy. The bunny's mom told him, "You can go out, but be careful."The bunny went outside and saw a big scale. He wanted to weigh himself to see if he was heavy enough to play outside without being blown away by the wind. He hopped on the scale and saw that he was light. He felt sad because he thought he couldn't play outside.But then, a friendly bird came and said, "Don't worry, bunny. We can play together and I will help you stay on the ground." So, the bunny and the bird played together all day. The bunny learned that even if he was light, he could still have fun outside with the help of a friend. And the moral value is that friends can help us when we need it.

One day, a little duck went for a walk. He liked to step near the lake. The sun was shining, and it was warm outside. The little duck was happy. He saw his friend, the frog, sitting by the lake."Hi, frog!" said the little duck. "Do you want to play by the lake?""Yes, I do!" said the frog. They played near the lake together. They splashed in the warm water and had lots of fun.After playing, the little duck and the frog sat down on the warm grass. They looked at the lake and saw the sun shining on the water. They were very happy to be friends and to play together on this warm day.

One day, Tom and Sue were playing in their room. They saw a long cupboard in the corner. Tom said, "Let's imagine that the cupboard is a secret door to a fun world!"They opened the cupboard and walked in. Inside, they found many toys and games. They played for a long time. Then, they heard a voice say, "Hello, I am Mr. Cat. Would you like to play with me?"Tom and Sue were surprised to see a talking cat. They played with Mr. Cat and had a lot of fun. But soon, it was time to go home. They said bye to Mr. Cat and walked out of the cupboard.When they looked back, the cupboard was gone! They wondered if it was all a dream. But then, they saw a little toy cat on the floor. They knew that their adventure with Mr. Cat was real!

Once upon a time, there was a helpful dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play with his friends. One day, Spot and his friends decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.The race started, and all the dogs ran as fast as they could. Spot was in the lead, but then he saw his friend, Tiny, stumble and fall down. Spot stopped running and went back to help Tiny.Tiny was sad that he fell, but Spot was a helpful friend. Spot helped Tiny up, and they finished the race together. Even though they didn't win, they were happy because they helped each other.

Once upon a time, there was a big fish. This fish was very selfish. He did not like to share with his friends. One day, the fish saw a tunnel in the water. He thought there might be food inside.The selfish fish decided to dive into the tunnel. He swam and swam, but he did not find any food. The tunnel was very dark and scary. The fish started to feel alone and sad.After a while, the fish wanted to leave the tunnel. But he could not find the way out. He was stuck in the dark tunnel. The selfish fish wished he had shared with his friends before. Now, he was all alone in the dark tunnel and could not get out.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a high tree with a hole in it. Tim wanted to see what was inside the hole. He tried to jump, but he could not reach it.Tim saw his friend, the squirrel. He asked, "Squirrel, can you help me see what is in the hole?" The squirrel climbed the high tree and looked inside the hole. He found a ball.The squirrel brought the ball down to Tim. They decided to play with it. Tim would strike the ball and the squirrel would catch it. They played all day long and had lots of fun. Tim was happy he found the hole in the high tree.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a suit that he loved to wear. It was a very nice suit. He wore it when he went to parties with his mom and dad. One day, the sky was gloomy and it started to rain.Tim was sad because he wanted to wear his suit to a party, but it got wet in the rain. His mom told him not to worry. She said they would dry the suit before the party. Tim smiled and helped his mom hang the suit near the warm fire. They watched as the suit became dry.When the suit was dry, Tim put it on and went to the party with his mom and dad. The gloomy sky turned bright again, and the sun came out. Tim danced and played with his friends at the party, happy that he could wear his favorite suit.

Once upon a time, there was a hot queen. She was always looking out for her people, making sure they were safe and happy. One day, she was walking outside when she heard a noise. She blinked and saw a tiny mouse.The queen kneeled to pick up the mouse, holding her close and talking softly. The mouse was scared, but the queen calmed her down with kind words. The mouse said, "Why are you so kind to me?"The queen smiled. "I could never leave one of my people in need," she said.The queen walked the mouse home and then turned back to look at the sky. The hot sun made her blink, but she was still sure of her decision. "All of my people are safe with me," she thought.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy loved to print pictures on paper. She had a big printer in her room. One day, she found a new way to print. She thought it was very useful.Amy wanted to show her friends the new way. She printed many pictures for her friends. Her friends were happy and said thank you. But Amy forgot to ask her mom if it was okay to print so many pictures.Amy's mom came into the room and saw all the paper on the floor. She was not happy. The printer was out of ink. Amy's mom said, "No more printing for a long time." Amy was sad because she could not print anymore.

Once upon a time in a jolly forest, there lived a bear named Bobo. Bobo loved honey. He would twist the lids off the honey jars and eat it all day.One sunny day, Bobo met a little girl named Lily. Lily was lost in the forest. She was sad and hungry. Bobo wanted to help Lily. He asked, "Do you want some honey?"Lily smiled and said, "Yes, please!" So, Bobo twisted the lid off a honey jar and shared it with Lily. They both ate the sweet honey and became friends. Bobo then helped Lily find her way home. They played and laughed all the way. And from that day on, Bobo and Lily were the best of friends, sharing honey and having fun in the jolly forest.

One day, a little girl named Mia went for a walk with her mom. They saw a high cactus. Mia looked at the cactus and said, "Mom, the cactus is very high!" Her mom said, "Yes, Mia, it is. The cactus reminds me of a tall tree."As they walked, they saw a little bird sitting on the cactus. The bird was singing a pretty song. Mia and her mom stopped to listen. Then, something unexpected happened. The bird started to talk! It said, "Hello, Mia and Mom. I can help you find a big surprise."Mia and her mom were very surprised. They followed the talking bird. The bird led them to a big, shiny box. Mia opened the box and found lots of yummy candy inside. Mia, her mom, and the talking bird had a fun day eating candy and playing together.

One day, a beautiful bird named Bella lived in a big tree. Bella liked to eat toast. She felt happy when she ate toast. She had a friend named Tim. Tim was a little boy. Tim and Bella liked to play together.One day, Tim said, "Bella, do you want to eat toast with me?" Bella felt excited and said, "Yes, I want to eat toast with you!" They went to Tim's house to eat toast. They had a fun time eating toast together.But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and took the toast away. Bella and Tim felt sad. But they did not give up. They ran after the toast. They caught the toast and felt happy again. They went back to Tim's house and ate the toast together. They had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little fish named Finny. Finny loved to play in the big blue sea. He liked to ride on the waves and swim with his friends.One day, Finny saw a big wave coming. He wanted to ride the wave, but he was scared. His friends told him, "Finny, you are clever! You can do it!" So, Finny took a deep breath and swam towards the wave.As Finny rode the big wave, he felt happy and brave. When the wave settled, Finny swam back to his friends. They all cheered and clapped for him. From that day on, Finny knew he could do anything if he just tried.

Lily likes to teach her dolls how to eat dinner. She has a pink table and pink plates and pink cups. She puts some food on the plates and gives them to her dolls. She says, "This is how you eat dinner. You use a fork and a spoon. You say please and thank you. You do not make a mess."But one of her dolls, Anna, does not listen. She throws her food on the floor. She spills her cup. She says, "No, no, no!" Lily is sad and angry. She says, "Anna, you are a bad doll. You do not eat dinner like that. You have to be nice and polite. You have to learn from me."Lily takes Anna to the corner and puts her on a chair. She says, "You have to stay here until you say sorry. You have to think about what you did wrong. You have to be a good doll." Then she goes back to her pink table and eats dinner with her other dolls. They are all happy and quiet. They say, "Lily, you are a good teacher. You teach us how to eat dinner." Lily smiles and says, "Thank you. I love you all."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a pretty vase in her room. The vase was very special to her. It was a gift from her mom. Sue loved to put pretty flowers in the vase. One day, Sue saw a sad and miserable cat outside her window. The cat was wet from the rain. Sue wanted to help the cat feel better. She thought about what she could do.Sue had an idea. She would bring the cat some flowers from her vase. She picked the prettiest flowers and put them in the vase. Sue went outside and showed the cat the flowers. The cat sniffed the flowers and started to feel better. The cat was not miserable anymore. Sue was happy she could help the cat with her vase and flowers.

Once upon a time, there was a big black cat. The cat liked to play with a ball. One day, the cat found a book. The book was a novel. The cat did not know what a novel was. The cat wanted to learn.The cat tried to read the novel, but the words were hard. The cat had an idea. The cat would number the words. The cat thought this would help. The cat numbered one, two, three, and more.As the cat numbered the words, something strange happened. The words began to jump off the page. The words danced around the cat. The cat was scared. The cat did not know what to do. The cat ran away from the novel. The cat never played with a book again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a red mitten that she loved very much. One day, it was cold and bitter outside. Amy put on her red mitten and went out to play.While playing, Amy met her friend, Tim. Tim said, "I like your red mitten, Amy. It looks warm." Amy smiled and said, "Thank you, Tim! It is very warm." They played together all day. But soon, the sky became dark, and it was time to go home.As Amy walked home, she felt her hand was cold. She looked down and saw that her red mitten was gone. She was sad and cried. The next day, when she went to play with Tim, he had a surprise for her. He had found her red mitten! Amy was so happy, and they played together all day, with her hand warm in her red mitten.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely hill. On the hill, there was a big tree. The tree was sad because no one came to play near it.One day, a little boy named Tim came to the hill. He saw the tree and said, "Hello, tree! Why are you so sad?" The tree replied, "I am sad because I am lonely. No one comes to play with me."Tim wanted to help the tree. So, he thought of a plan to prevent the tree from being lonely. He told all his friends about the tree on the hill. The next day, Tim and his friends came to play with the tree. They played games and had fun.Suddenly, the tree started to shake. The tree was not sad anymore. It was happy! The tree had a big surprise for Tim and his friends. It turned into a magical tree that could give them anything they wished for.The moral of the story is that when we help others, good things can happen to us too.

Once upon a time, there were two littles, a brother and a sister. They were both very curious and always wanted to explore the world. One day, the brother and sister decided to escape from home. As they were leaving, they were worried their mommy would catch them but they ran very fast.The brother and sister explored many places, running and laughing. The sun began to set and they knew they had to go home. But when they got home, they couldn't find the door! They were stuck!Suddenly, the brother saw a big window that was clear and open. He ran and opened it, and the brother and sister jumped to the ground and ran as fast as they could. They had escaped!The brother and sister were so happy and excited to be free. They ran all night and when the morning came, they were safe. The brother and sister hugged each other and laughed. They were no longer worried and had a clear view of the world ahead of them.

Lily loved to draw. She drew many things: flowers, animals, stars, and people. She used many colors and made her pictures bright and happy. She wanted to show her drawings to everyone.One day, her teacher said they would have a drawing contest. The children could display their drawings on the wall and a judge would pick the best one. Lily was very enthusiastic. She thought she could win the contest. She worked hard on her drawing and made it very big and beautiful.The next day, the children brought their drawings to school. Lily saw that the other children had different kinds of drawings. Some were small and simple, some were dark and scary, some were funny and silly. Lily thought her drawing was the best. She put it on the wall and waited for the judge.The judge came and looked at all the drawings. He smiled and nodded and said nice things. He said he liked all the drawings because they showed the children's imagination and feelings. He said there was no best drawing, because every drawing was special and unique. He gave every child a sticker and a hug.Lily felt confused. She thought her drawing was better than the others. She wanted to win the contest. She wanted the judge to say her drawing was the best. She felt angry and sad.Her teacher saw her face and came to talk to her. She said, "Lily, why are you unhappy? You have a wonderful drawing and a sticker and a hug. You should be proud of yourself."Lily said, "But I wanted to win. I wanted to have the best drawing. I worked so hard on it."Her teacher said, "Lily, drawing is not a competition. Drawing is a way to express yourself and hav

Once upon a time, there was a wise cat. The cat loved to question things. One day, the cat found a letter on the ground.The cat looked at the letter and said, "What is this? Who is it for?" The cat did not know what to do with the letter. Then, the cat had an idea. The cat would take the letter to the wise owl.The wise owl looked at the letter and smiled. The owl said, "This letter is not for a person. It is for you, wise cat!" The cat was very surprised. The cat opened the letter and found a toy inside. The wise cat and the wise owl played with the toy and had lots of fun.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to the park with her mom. They brought a huge basket full of toys to play with. In the basket, Mia found her favorite toy, a big ball. She also found some sand toys, like a bucket and a shovel. Mia was very happy.Mia saw a boy named Tim playing in the sand. He had a fun toy that could mix sand and water. Mia asked Tim, "Can I play with you?" Tim said, "Yes, let's play together!" They took turns using the toy to mix the sand and water. It was so much fun.After they played in the sand, Mia and Tim decided to play with the big ball from the huge basket. They kicked the ball back and forth, laughing and having a great time. When it was time to go home, Mia and Tim said goodbye and promised to play together again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max had big ears that could hear very well. One cold day, Max went outside to play with his friend, a little bird named Lily.Max and Lily were playing when Max started to shiver. "Brrr, I am cold," Max said. "My ear is cold too!" Lily wanted to help Max, so she thought of an idea."Wait here," Lily told Max. She flew away and came back with a small, important hat. She put the hat on Max's head to cover his ears. Max stopped shivering and smiled. "Thank you, Lily! Now my ears are warm, and we can keep playing." And they played happily all day long.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to visit a shop with her mom. They walked to the shop holding hands. Lucy was very happy because she loved to visit shops with her mom.When they got to the shop, Lucy saw a toy she wanted. But her mom said, "No, not today." This made Lucy upset. She wanted the toy so much, but her mom said they could not buy it.Lucy was still upset when they left the shop. Her mom hugged her and said, "Don't be upset. We will come back and visit the shop another day." Lucy felt a little better and went home with her mom, looking forward to the next time they could visit the shop together.

Tom and Amy were friends who liked to play with cars. They had many cars of different colors and sizes. One day, Tom got a new car from his mom. It was a shiny silver car that looked very fast and cool."Wow, look at my new car!" Tom said, showing it to Amy. "It is the best car ever!"Amy looked at the car and felt sad. She did not have a silver car. She only had a red car, a blue car, and a yellow car. She wanted a silver car too."Can I play with your silver car?" Amy asked Tom."No, you can't!" Tom said. "It is my car and I don't want to share it. You can play with your own cars."Amy felt hurt and angry. She did not like Tom's answer. She thought he was being mean and selfish. She did not want to play with him anymore.She turned away and started to play with her red car. She pretended it was a fire truck and made siren noises.Tom saw Amy playing with her red car and felt curious. He liked fire trucks too. He wanted to join her and play together."Can I play with your red car?" Tom asked Amy."No, you can't!" Amy said. "It is my car and I don't want to share it. You can play with your own car."Tom felt hurt and angry. He did not like Amy's answer. He thought she was being mean and selfish. He did not want to play with her anymore.He turned away and started to play with his silver car. He pretended it was a rocket and made zooming noises.But soon, he felt bored and lonely. He realized that playing with his silver car was not as fun as playing with Amy. He missed her and wanted to be friends again.He looked at Amy and saw that she was bored and lonely too. She realized that playing with her red

One day, a playful cat named Kitty was walking in the house. She saw a glass on the table. Kitty wanted to play with the glass. She jumped on the table and pushed the glass. The glass fell on the floor and broke.Mommy heard the noise and came to see what happened. She saw the broken glass and asked, "Kitty, did you break the glass?" Kitty looked at Mommy and nodded her head. Mommy was not happy.Mommy had to explain to Kitty that playing with a glass was not safe. She said, "Kitty, you cannot play with a glass. It can break and hurt you." Kitty listened to Mommy and said, "I am sorry, Mommy. I will not play with a glass again." From that day on, Kitty played with her toys and left the glasses alone.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends called Sam and Ben. They liked playing together every day. But one day, something happened.Sam saw that Ben had a perfect telephone. He wanted to play with it, but Ben said no. "This is my telephone and you can't have it," Ben said. Sam was really sad. He wanted to separate from Ben, but he didn't want to say goodbye. Suddenly, an idea popped into Sam's mind. He went to the store and bought a perfect telephone for himself.When Sam got back home, he proudly showed Ben his new telephone. Ben's eyes lit up, and soon the two were playing together again - this time, with two telephones! They were happy and perfect!

Once upon a time, there was a big bucket. It was the first bucket, the original bucket. This bucket had a lock that no one could open. Everyone in the town wanted to see what was inside the bucket.One day, a little girl named Amy found a key. She thought, "Maybe this key can unlock the bucket!" She ran to the bucket and put the key in the lock. She turned the key and the lock clicked open.When the bucket was unlocked, everyone gathered around to see what was inside. They all thought there would be something amazing. But they were surprised! Inside the bucket, there were just more keys. The people didn't know that these keys could unlock other things in their town. The keys made everyone happy because they could open new doors and find new adventures.

Alice was walking in the park with her mom. She loved exploring new things and looking for colors. Her mom pointed out a colorful seat and said, "Look, Alice! What a colorful seat!" Alice was so excited. She ran to the cheer and she started to attach colorful ribbons to the seat.Alice made sure that all the ribbons matched the seat. She was so pleased with her work. she smiled and turned to her mom and asked,"Did I do a good job?"Her mom smiled and replied, "Yes, you did an amazing job to make the seat colorful." Alice couldn't help but blush with pride. She hugged her mom and couldn't wait to see how the other park goers would enjoy the seat.

Once upon a time, there was a strong square. The strong square lived in a big box with other shapes. One day, a little girl named Lucy found the box. She took the strong square and the other shapes out to play.Lucy said, "I will protect you, strong square!" She put the strong square next to a small circle. The strong square and the small circle became friends. They played together all day long.Then, something unexpected happened. The strong square started to talk! "Thank you for protecting me, Lucy," said the strong square. Lucy was very surprised. She didn't know shapes could talk. The strong square and the small circle became Lucy's best friends, and they all played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a swamp. In this swamp, there lived many animals. One day, a big storm came and made a big mess in the swamp. The animals were frightened.After the storm went away, the animals wanted to make their swamp nice again. They wanted to restore it. They all worked together to clean up the mess.The birds picked up sticks. The frogs moved rocks. The turtles helped too. Soon, the swamp was clean and nice again. The animals were happy and not frightened anymore. They played together and had fun in their restored swamp.

Jack was a charming 3 year old boy. He loved to explore, and one day he found a notebook. He picked it up and started to pull it apart. But inside the notebook was a bee! The bee got angry and it stung Jack. He started to cry, and his mom ran over to help. She hugged Jack, but the bee sting was very painful so Jack kept crying. In the end, Jack had to go to the doctor because the sting was too bad. The doctor gave him a shot so the bee sting would go away. But Jack was very sad, and he couldn't pull the notebook apart again.

Once upon a time, there was a lively little fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim in the big blue sea. Every day, he would swim and play with his friends. But Fin had a secret. He wished he could hug like the animals on land.One day, Fin saw a big rock with lots of soft green plants. The plants looked like they could give hugs. Fin swam closer and closer to the rock, hoping to get a hug from the plants. As he got close, he saw a tiny crab hiding in the plants. The little crab was sad because he was lost.Fin wanted to help the crab find his way back home. He told the crab to hold on to his fin and they swam together. They swam past the pretty shells and the tall seaweed. They swam until they found the crab's family.When they found the crab's family, they were so happy. The crab's mom gave Fin a big hug with her soft green plants. It was the best hug Fin had ever had. And from that day on, Fin knew that sometimes, the best hugs come when you help someone else.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a gentle cat. The cat liked to play with the kids and make them happy. Every day, the cat would run around the village, chasing butterflies and birds.One day, the cat felt very tired. It let out a big yawn and decided to take a nap under a tree. As the cat slept, the kids in the village missed their friend and started looking for the cat.Soon, they found the gentle cat sleeping under the tree. They all sat down quietly and waited for the cat to wake up. When the cat opened its eyes, it saw all the kids smiling at it. The cat let out another yawn and got up to play with its friends again. They all had a fun day together in the village.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to her grandma's house. Grandma had a big fireplace in her living room. Lily saw that the fireplace was dirty. She wanted to help her grandma, so she said, "Grandma, I will polish the fireplace for you!"Grandma was happy and gave Lily a cloth to clean the fireplace. While Lily was polishing the fireplace, she found a small, spicy pepper hidden in the corner. She picked it up and showed it to her grandma. "Look, Grandma! I found a spicy pepper!""Oh no!" said Grandma. "That spicy pepper belongs to Mr. Fox. He must have left it here by mistake." Lily knew that Mr. Fox lived next door and sometimes he was not very nice. She was a little scared, but she wanted to do the right thing.Lily went to Mr. Fox's house and knocked on his door. When Mr. Fox saw the spicy pepper, he was happy. "Thank you, Lily," he said. "I've been looking for that spicy pepper all day!" Lily felt brave and happy that she could help Mr. Fox. From that day on, Mr. Fox was much nicer to Lily and her grandma.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a fast dog running around. The dog was playing with a ball. Tim wanted to play with the dog too. So, he asked his mom, "Can I play with the dog?"His mom said, "Yes, but be careful, Tim. The dog is very fast."Tim ran and played with the fast dog. They had a lot of fun. But then, Tim fell down and hurt his leg. He cried and his mom came to help him. She said, "Oh no, Tim. We need to go home now."At home, Tim's mom put him in bed. His leg hurt a lot. Tim was sad because he could not play anymore. The fast dog went back to the park without him. Tim learned to be more careful when playing with fast dogs.

Once there was a young boy who wanted to touch something long. He searched and searched until he found a big red ribbon. He ran up to it and jumped up to touch the ribbon, but he was too short. He stretched and stretched until he could feel the soft fabric of the ribbon in his fingers. He smiled, feeling the long ribbon in his hands.He laughed with joy, and ran around the room, swinging the ribbon around him. Suddenly he heard a noise, and he stopped and stared. His mom had come in, holding a basket full of clothes.The boy quickly tucked the ribbon behind his back, hoping his mom hadn't seen it. But his mom had seen it, and she smiled and knelt down to touch the ribbon with her own fingers.The boy brightened and grinned, knowing his mom was happy he had found something beautiful to touch. He twirled the long ribbon around for a little while longer before his mom picked him up and hugged him tight.

One day, a big dog named Sam went to play with his ball. He was an independent dog who loved to play alone. Sam saw a goal far away and decided to kick his ball into it.As Sam was running, he saw a little cat named Mia. Mia was very tired and let out a big yawn. "Why are you so tired?" asked Sam. "I was trying to kick my ball into the goal too, but it's too far away," Mia said.Sam had an idea. "Let's try together!" he said. Mia and Sam kicked their balls at the same time. Something unexpected happened - both balls went into the goal! They were so happy and decided to play together from that day on.

Anna liked to climb. She climbed on chairs, on tables, on beds, on anything she could find. She wanted to see everything and touch everything. But her big sister Lily did not like it. Lily was bossy. She always told Anna what to do and what not to do.One day, Anna saw a lamp on the shelf. It was shiny and pretty. It had a red shade and a yellow bulb. Anna wanted to see it closer. She climbed on the couch and reached for the lamp. But Lily saw her and shouted."Anna, no! That lamp is not for you! It is Mommy's lamp. It is old and breaky. You will make it fall and smash. Get down now!"But Anna did not listen. She was curious and stubborn. She grabbed the lamp and pulled it. But the lamp was heavy and wobbly. It slipped from her hand and fell to the floor. It made a loud crash and a bright flash. The bulb broke and the shade tore. Anna was scared and sad. She started to cry.Lily ran to Anna and hugged her. She was angry and worried. She checked if Anna was hurt. She was not. She was lucky. Lily said."Anna, I told you not to touch the lamp. You did a bad thing. You broke Mommy's lamp. She will be mad and sad. You have to say sorry and help me clean up."Anna nodded. She was sorry and ashamed. She loved Mommy and did not want to make her mad and sad. She said."I'm sorry, Lily. I'm sorry, Mommy. I was bad. I will help you clean up. I will not climb on things anymore."Lily smiled. She was still bossy, but she was also kind. She said."It's okay, Anna. I love you. You are not bad. You are just little. You have to learn and listen. I will help you. We will fix the lamp and make Mommy happy."They hugge

Once upon a time, there was a jolly dog named Max. Max liked to play and run in the sun. One day, it started to rain. Max needed a shelter to stay dry. He saw a big tree and went under it.While Max was under the tree, he started to shiver. The rain made him cold and wet. Max did not like to be cold. He wished for the sun to come back.Then, something unexpected happened. A big, jolly frog hopped to Max. The frog had a big leaf with him. The frog put the leaf over Max's head. Now, Max had shelter from the rain. He stopped shivering and felt warm again. Max and the frog became good friends, and they played happily under the tree until the sun came back.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very tired. He had a letter in his hand. He wanted to pay for a toy.Tim walked to the toy store with the letter. He saw a big, red ball. He wanted the ball so much. Tim gave the letter to the man in the store. The man looked at the letter and smiled.The man said, "This is not money, but it is a special letter." The man gave Tim the big, red ball for free! Tim was so happy. He went home and played with his new ball all day long.

Sara and Ben were twins who liked to play in the garden. They had a big tree with red cherries that they could pick and eat. But they had to be careful, because there was a naughty bird who liked to steal cherries too. The bird was black and white and had a long beak.One day, Sara and Ben decided to make a cherry pie for their mom. They took a basket and went to the tree. They picked many cherries and put them in the basket. They were very happy and proud. They said to each other, "Mom will love our pie. It will be so yummy and sweet."But the naughty bird was watching them from a branch. He saw the basket full of cherries and he wanted them for himself. He waited until Sara and Ben went inside the house to get some flour and sugar. Then he flew down and landed on the basket. He started to peck at the cherries and eat them. He made a big mess and threw the pits on the ground.Sara and Ben came back and saw the bird and the basket. They were very angry and sad. They shouted at the bird, "Go away, you bad bird!
