Comet!” She chased the comet around the garden, trying to catch it, but it was too fast. Gwen ran and ran until she was out of breath. Then, she sat down under a tree and watched the comet, who twinkled and glittered in the night sky.Suddenly, the comet lit up and created a beautiful rainbow in the sky. Gwen gasped and shivered with joy. She clapped her hands as the comet flew off, leaving behind a trail of sparkles and glitter. Gwen waved goodbye and said happily, “Bye Bye, Comet! Thanks for making us all jolly!” Then she ran back inside to tell her mom all about her magical evening.

Once upon a time, there was a furry dog named Max. Max loved to play outside in the sun. One day, Max found a big stick in the shape of a cross. He was so happy and wanted to show his friend, Tom the cat.Max ran to Tom and said, "Look, I found a cross stick! Let's play with it!" Tom replied, "That's a cool stick, Max! Let's play hide and seek with it." Max wagged his tail and agreed.They took turns hiding the cross stick and then finding it. After a while, Max had a new idea. "Let's bury the stick and find it again!" Max said. Tom thought it was a great idea. So, they dug a hole, put the cross stick in it, and covered it with dirt. They had so much fun digging and finding the stick again and again. And they played together until the sun went down.

Once upon a time, in a far and distant land, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a pretty scarf that her mom made for her. She loved her scarf very much and wore it every day.One day, Mia was playing outside when she saw something hiding behind a big tree. She was curious and wanted to see what it was. So, she slowly walked closer to the tree and said, "Hello, who's there?"To her surprise, a small bunny came out and revealed itself. The bunny was scared and cold. Mia felt sad for the bunny and decided to help. She took off her scarf and gently wrapped it around the bunny to keep it warm.The bunny was very happy and thanked Mia for her help. They became good friends and played together every day. Mia and the bunny always stayed close, and the scarf kept them both warm and happy.

Once upon a time there was a little flower called Daisy. She was so eager to bloom, but she was stuck in the garden.Daisy watched sadly as the other flowers basked in the sunshine and the bees flew among them. She wished that she could be like them. Just then, she spotted a wire and remembered her friend Turtle. He had told her that with enough hard work she could bloom too.So she started working, pushing the wire aside and growing towards the sun. Everyone else in the garden cheered her on, and she worked even harder.Finally, after a few days of hard work, Daisy bloomed. She was so proud of herself, and so were all the other creatures in the garden.Moral of the story: If you work hard and stay determined, you can do anything.

Once upon a time, there was a tall tree in a big park. In the tree, there was a cube. The cube was stuck high up in the branches. A little boy named Tim saw the cube and wanted to play with it.One day, a nice bird came to the park. The bird saw the cube and wanted to help. The bird flew up to the tall tree and tried to rescue the cube. But the bird was too small to move the cube.Then, something unexpected happened. A big wind blew through the park. The wind shook the tall tree, and the cube fell down. The bird caught the cube in its beak and brought it to Tim. Tim was so happy to play with the cube, and he thanked the bird for the rescue. The bird and Tim became good friends and played together in the park every day.

One day, a funny monkey named Bobo found a big banana tree. He was very happy. Bobo loved to eat bananas. He jumped up and down and clapped his hands. "Yay, bananas!" he said.Bobo tried to pull the banana from the tree. It was hard. He tried again and again. "Oh no, I can't pull it," said Bobo. He was sad.Then, Bobo's friend, a little bird named Toto, came to help. "Don't be sad, Bobo. I can help you," said Toto. Toto flew up to the banana and helped Bobo pull. Together, they pulled and pulled. The banana fell from the tree. Bobo and Toto were very happy. They laughed and ate the yummy banana together.

Lila and Tom are friends. They like to play with their bikes. They have red bikes. They ride their bikes to the park. The park is in the town. The town is big and busy.One day, they see a big truck in the park. The truck has a lot of balloons. The balloons are many colors. They are bright and shiny. Lila and Tom want a balloon. They go to the truck."Hello," says the man in the truck. "Do you want a balloon?""Yes, please," says Lila."Me too," says Tom.The man gives them each a balloon. He ties a string to the balloon. He says, "Be careful. Don't let go of the string. The balloon will fly away."Lila and Tom say, "Thank you." They hold the string. They are happy. They have balloons.They ride their bikes with their balloons. They go around the park. They see other kids. The other kids see their balloons. They say, "Wow, nice balloons. Where did you get them?""We got them from the truck," says Lila."The truck in the park," says Tom.The other kids want balloons too. They follow Lila and Tom. They go to the truck. They ask the man for balloons. The man gives them balloons. He says, "Be careful. Don't let go of the string. The balloon will fly away."Soon, many kids have balloons. They are all colors. They are bright and shiny. They make the park look pretty. Lila and Tom are popular. They have the first balloons. They share with the other kids. They are kind and friendly.They have fun with their balloons. They play games. They sing songs. They laugh and smile. They are happy. They have balloons.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy, an ugly duck. The duck had a long neck. Tim loved his duck very much.One day, Tim and his duck went for a walk. They walked and walked until they saw a big tree. Tim wanted to climb the tree. He put the duck down and started to climb. But Tim did not see a big rock.As Tim climbed down from the tree, he did not look where he was going. He did not see the big rock. Tim's foot hit the rock, and he started to stumble. "Oh no!" Tim said as he fell to the ground.The ugly duck with the long neck saw Tim fall. The duck called out, "Tim, be careful!" Tim looked at his duck and smiled. He was happy that his duck was there to help him. They walked back home, hand in hand, and had a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was a clumsy crab named Carl. Carl lived near the water, where the tide would go up and down. He liked to play in the sand and watch the waves.One day, Carl saw a big shell. He wanted to show his friends, so he picked it up with his claw. But he was clumsy and dropped it. The shell broke into pieces. Carl was sad.Later, Carl saw a pretty starfish stuck in the sand. He helped the starfish get back into the water. All of Carl's friends saw what he did. They were happy and started to applaud. Carl felt proud and smiled. From that day on, he knew that even a clumsy crab can do good things.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big red ball on the dry grass. He wanted to play with it. So, he used his hands to push the ball. The ball rolled fast and far away.Tim heard a voice from behind a tree. A little girl named Sue said, "That's my ball!" Tim felt bad and said, "I'm sorry, I didn't know." Sue was nice and said, "It's okay, we can play together!" They smiled and took turns pushing the big red ball.As they played, the sky got dark. They knew rain was coming. Tim and Sue pushed the ball under a big tree to keep it dry. They stood under the tree and laughed as the rain fell around them. They were happy they had become friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived in a small house with his mom and dad. They had a chamber in their house where they kept all their toys. But the chamber was very filthy. Tim's mom and dad always told him to clean it, but he didn't like to clean.One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came over to play. They wanted to play with their cars, so they went to the chamber. Sam said, "Ew, it's so filthy in here! I don't want to play with your cars if it's so dirty." Tim felt sad and embarrassed.Tim decided to twist the doorknob and open the chamber. He started to clean the filthy chamber with Sam. They picked up all the toys and put them away. When they were done, the chamber was clean and tidy. Tim's mom and dad were so happy, and they said, "Good job, Tim! Now you can have fun playing with your toys in a clean room."From that day on, Tim always made sure to keep his chamber clean. He learned that it was important to take care of his things and keep his room tidy. And now, all his friends loved to come over and play with him in his clean chamber.The moral of the story is: always keep your things clean and tidy, and you will have more fun playing with them.

Once upon a time, in a small town near the sea, there was a poor boy named Tom. Tom liked to watch the boats sail on the water. He wanted to be a sailor one day.One day, Tom met an old sailor named Sam. Sam had a small boat. "Can I sail with you?" Tom asked. Sam said, "Yes, you can come with me. I will teach you how to sail."Tom and Sam went on the boat. They sailed on the water. Tom was happy. He learned how to sail. He said, "Thank you, Sam, for teaching me." Sam smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tom. You will be a great sailor one day."Tom and Sam became good friends. They sailed together every day. Tom was not poor anymore. He was a sailor, just like he wanted to be. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her friends. They would run, jump, and pass a ball to each other. But sometimes, Lily and her friends would get competitive. They wanted to see who could pass the ball the fastest.One day, Lily's mom gave her a colorful thread. "What do I do with this?" Lily asked. Her mom said, "You can make a friendship bracelet for your friends." Lily thought it was a great idea. She wanted her friends to know she loved them, even when they were competitive.Lily made a bracelet for each friend. The next day, she gave them the bracelets. Her friends were so happy! They said, "Thank you, Lily! We love them!" They all wore the bracelets and played together. They still passed the ball fast, but they remembered that they were friends first. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old and very curious. She loved going to the park with her mom and dad to play.One day, as they were walking through the park, Sarah heard a loud noise. She looked up in the sky and saw an automobile. She pointed to it and said, "Look mommy! What is that?"Her mom said, "That's an airplane, honey."Sarah screamed with excitement, and the sound echoed through the park. She jumped up and down in joy and began running towards the car. She was fascinated by it, but it was moving too fast for her to keep up!Mom and Dad saw that she was getting too far ahead and called for her to come back. Suddenly, she stepped in a dry patch of sand, and she slipped and fell.Sarah screamed uncontrollably with surprise and fear, and Mom and Dad ran to her. She was okay, but her dress was all dirty and covered in sand.Mom and Dad picked her up and hugged her tight. They all laughed together as they walked back home, marveling at how brave Sarah was.

Once upon a time, there was a light frog named Tim. Tim lived near a river. He loved to jump and play in the water.One day, Tim met a fish named Sam. Sam was sad. Tim asked, "Why are you sad, Sam?" Sam said, "I want to quit swimming. I want to jump and play like you, Tim."Tim thought for a moment. He had an idea. "Let's play together, Sam!" said Tim. They played all day, jumping and swimming in the river. Sam was happy again. They became best friends and never quit playing together.

Once upon a time, there was a shy bug named Bob. Bob liked to fly, but he was scared of other bugs. One day, Bob saw a big cobweb in a tree. He wanted to play with the cobweb, but he was very shy.Bob watched the cobweb from far away. He saw other bugs fly to the cobweb and play. They had a lot of fun. Bob wanted to have fun too, but he was too shy to go near the cobweb. He sat on a leaf and thought about what to do.Then, Bob took a deep breath and decided to be brave. He flew to the cobweb and started to play. The other bugs were nice to him. Bob was not shy anymore. He had a lot of fun playing with the cobweb and made new friends.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a girl named Lily. She had a beautiful cloth. It was very original, with many colors. Lily loved her cloth so much.One day, Lily wanted to prepare a surprise for her mom. So, she took her original cloth and made a pretty dress for her mom's doll. She worked very hard on it. When she was done, she put the dress on the doll and put the doll on the table.When her mom came home, she saw the doll on the table. She said, "Wow, Lily! What a beautiful dress! Did you make it with your original cloth?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, Mom! I wanted to prepare a surprise for you!" Her mom hugged her and said, "Thank you, Lily. This is the best surprise ever!"

Molly was a little girl. She was three years old and very glad. She liked to play with her friends and go outside.One day, Molly wanted to go down the slide, but she was too scared. She stepped up to the top of the slide but stopped. She was too afraid to take the first step.Molly's mom saw her and came over. She knelt down so she was eye to eye with Molly. She said, "Molly, you can do this. I know you are scared, but if you try you can do it."Molly looked up at her mom and nodded. She felt a little braver and stepped forward. To Molly's surprise, she found out it wasn't so scary. All her friends had already slid down and were waiting at the bottom, looking up and clapping.Molly felt glad that she was able to accept her mom's advice and try the slide. She felt brave and happy. She ran down to her friends and they celebrated Molly's bravery.

Once upon a time, there was a big iron. The iron was very good at its job. It liked to sort things. One day, a rude boy came to the iron. The boy said, "You can't sort my toys!"The iron was sad, but it wanted to try. So, the iron started to sort the toys. The rude boy laughed and said, "You can't do it!" But, the iron did not give up.Then, something unexpected happened. The iron sorted all the toys in a fun way. The toys were now in a big circle. The rude boy was surprised. He said, "Wow! You did it!" After that, the boy was not rude anymore. He and the iron became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Ella. Ella was only three years old and she loved to march. Every day she marched around the house, to the garden and around the school playground.One day, Ella was marching around and she found a broken soap. She was very excited and decided to take it home. When she arrived home, she saw her mum in the kitchen."Mum, look what I found!" said Ella, holding the broken soap up high."Oh, how lovely," said her mum. "Why don't you wash your hands with it and march around to show me?"Ella laughed and ran to the sink. She washed her hands with the broken soap, then ran back to the kitchen, marching around and around. Ella's mum laughed and clapped her hands. Ella and her mum had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play hockey. He also liked to collect delicate things, like pretty rocks and soft feathers. Tim had a big box where he kept all his special things.One day, Tim went to the park to play hockey with his friends. After the game, he saw a shiny rock on the ground. He picked it up and put it in his pocket. When he got home, he put the rock in his special box.Later, Tim's mom called him for dinner. When he came back to his room, he saw that his special box was open. All his delicate things were gone! Tim was sad. Then, he saw a trail of shiny rocks on the floor. He followed the trail and found his little sister. She had taken his things to make her dollhouse pretty. Tim was happy to share his special things with her.

One day, a big giant was walking in the forest. He was very rude. He would step on flowers and break trees. The animals in the forest did not like the giant.A little bird saw the giant and said, "Mr. Giant, please do not be rude. We all live here, and you hurt our home." The giant looked at the bird and felt sad. He did not want to hurt the bird's home."I regret being rude," said the giant. "I will be nice now." The giant started to help the animals. He would fix the trees and help the flowers grow. The animals were happy, and the giant was happy too. They all became friends and lived happily in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a fat cat named Tom. Tom loved to sit in front of the screen and watch his favorite show about a hero who rescues animals. One day, Tom saw a little bird stuck in a tree outside his window.Tom said, "I want to rescue the bird like the hero on the screen!" So, Tom went outside and climbed the tree. He got close to the bird and said, "Don't worry, bird! I will help you!"Tom carefully helped the bird get out of the tree. The bird said, "Thank you, Tom! You are my hero!" Tom felt very happy that he could rescue the bird, just like the hero on the screen. From that day on, Tom and the bird were best friends.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a cute little girl named Lily. She loved to look at the moon every night before she went to bed. One night, she saw that the moon looked a little different. It had a small crack on it. Lily wanted to fix the moon.The next day, Lily asked her friend Tom, "Can you help me fix the moon?" Tom said, "Yes, let's try!" They got a big ladder and tried to reach the moon, but it was too high. They needed a new plan.Lily and Tom thought and thought. Then, they had an idea. They made a big kite and tied it to the ladder. They flew the kite up to the moon. Lily climbed up the ladder and put a band-aid on the crack. The moon was fixed! Lily and Tom were so happy. Now, they could enjoy the beautiful moon every night.

Once upon a time, there was a foolish dog named Spot. Spot liked to move his toy jug around the yard. One day, while he was moving the jug, he saw a wise old cat named Whiskers."Spot, why do you move that jug all day?" asked Whiskers. Spot said, "It's fun! I like to see how far I can move it." Whiskers shook her head and said, "You should try to do more helpful things, like helping others."One day, Spot saw a little bird with a hurt wing. He remembered what Whiskers said, so he stopped moving his jug and went to help the bird. He brought the bird to his warm dog house and took care of it.Soon, the bird got better and flew away. Spot felt happy that he helped the bird. From that day on, Spot didn't just move his jug around. He also looked for ways to help his friends. The moral of the story is: it's good to have fun, but it's also important to help others.

One day, Sam was feeling very anxious. He had to try something he was afraid of. He looked at his feet as he slowly walked forward. Sam took a deep breath and pushed one foot forward. It was so hard, but he kept pushing until he made it to the other side. He was so excited that he wanted to do it again.So, Sam concentrated and pushed his feet again. He was able to take two steps this time. His heart was pounding and it was hard to keep going, but he did!Sam took a few more steps and then it happened. He was able to push his feet all the way across the room. He shouted out in joy and his parents clapped their hands and cheered. Sam had done it! He was so proud of himself and excited to try more things. He had finally conquered his fear and was no longer anxious.

Once upon a time, there was a little inch worm named Inky. Inky was a dependable friend, always there to help. He lived in a big garden with many other bugs.One day, Inky's best friend, a ladybug named Lulu, lost her spots. Lulu was very sad and started to worry. She didn't know what to do. Inky wanted to help his friend feel better.Inky and Lulu went on a journey to find her spots. They met other bugs who tried to help them. Inky was a dependable friend, and he didn't give up. In the end, they found Lulu's spots under a leaf. Lulu was happy, and they both went back to the garden. Inky and Lulu were the best of friends, and they lived happily ever after.

Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play with puzzles. They have many puzzles with animals, cars, and flowers. Sara is good at puzzles. She can solve them fast. Ben is not so good. He needs more time.One day, they find a new puzzle. It is very big and hard. It has many pieces. Sara and Ben want to try it. They start to look for the edges and the corners. Sara finds many pieces. She puts them together. Ben finds only a few pieces. He does not know where to put them.Sara sees that Ben is sad. She says, "Ben, do you need help?" Ben nods. He says, "Yes, please. This puzzle is too hard for me. I can't solve it." Sara smiles. She says, "Don't worry, Ben. We can solve it together. You can have some of my pieces. I have too many. I will share with you. I am generous."Ben smiles too. He says, "Thank you, Sara. You are a good friend. You are generous and kind. I will share with you too. Look, I have a piece with a lion's skin. It is yellow and brown. Do you have a piece with a lion's face?" Sara says, "Yes, I do. Here it is. Let's put them together. They match."Sara and Ben work together. They help each other. They find more pieces. They solve the puzzle. They are happy. They hug each other. They say, "We did it! We solved the puzzle! We are a good team!" They are proud of themselves. They are friends.

Tim and Liz were playing in the park. They saw a big tree with a hole in it. They wanted to see what was inside."Let's enter the tree!" Tim said."OK, but be careful!" Liz said.They crawled into the hole and found a dark and cozy space. They saw a trunk with a lock on it."Wow, what is in the trunk?" Liz wondered."Maybe it is a treasure!" Tim guessed.They tried to open the trunk, but it was too hard. They pushed and pulled, but nothing happened.Suddenly, they heard a voice."Who is there? What are you doing in my tree?" The voice was angry and loud.Tim and Liz were scared. They saw a man with a beard and a hat. He was the owner of the tree and the trunk."We are sorry, sir. We were just playing. We did not mean to bother you." Tim said."You should not enter other people's homes without permission. That is rude and wrong. And you should not touch other people's things. That is stealing and bad." The man said.Tim and Liz felt ashamed. They knew they had made a mistake."We are very sorry, sir. We will not do it again. Please forgive us." Liz said.The man looked at them. He saw they were young and curious. He decided to be kind."OK, I forgive you. But you have to promise me to respect other people's property and privacy. And you have to leave now. This is my home, not a playground." The man said.Tim and Liz nodded. They thanked the man and crawled out of the hole. They ran back to their parents and told them what happened. They learned a lesson that day. They never entered the tree again.

Once there was a bright sun in the sky. It sent heat down to the ground and made everywhere nice and warm.One day, something special happened. Someone sent a bright beam of light up to the sun.The sun felt so happy to get the beam of light that it sent more heat down to the ground. Everything became really warm, and the flowers were very happy.The sun kept sending heat down, and it was so bright that everyone had to put sunglasses on.Everyone enjoyed the warmth and brightness from the sun, and it made everyone smile.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was very polite and always said please and thank you. One day, Sue was playing with her friends in the park. She noticed a funny looking thing on the ground and she picked it up. It was a funny metal outline in the shape of a finger! Sue was curious so she asked her friend, “What is that?”Her friend replied, “It's a special finger! You can attach it to your finger and move things.”Sue was excited. She quickly attached the finger to her own finger and she was able to move objects with it. Sue and her friends had a lot of fun with the finger! At the end of the day, before Sue had to go home, she detached the finger and said a polite “Thank you” to her friend. Then she went home with the finger to show her mum what she had found.

Once upon a time, there was a big fish named Splash. Splash liked to teach little fish how to swim. One day, Splash saw a helpless little fish named Tiny. Tiny was sad because he could not swim.Splash wanted to help Tiny. So, Splash started to teach Tiny how to swim. They practiced every day in the pond. Tiny was getting better and better at swimming. Splash was very happy to help Tiny.One day, while they were swimming, something unexpected happened. Tiny started to change! Tiny was not a fish at all, but a frog! Tiny had learned how to swim with Splash's help. Now, Tiny could hop and swim too. Splash and Tiny became best friends, playing in the pond every day.

Once upon a time, there was a big tree in the forest. The tree had many leaves and branches. Under the tree, there was a small apple. The apple fell on the ground. One day, a little bug came to the apple. The bug was hungry. It started to eat the apple. The apple began to rot. The apple turned brown and smelled bad. Soon, the apple was dead. The bug was sad. It could not eat the apple anymore. The bad smell stayed on the ground. The bug had to find a new home. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a perfect bird. The bird loved to fly high in the sky. It had a best friend, a shield bug. The shield bug was small but strong.One day, the bird and the shield bug went out to play. They flew up, up, up in the sky. The bird was fast, but the shield bug was not. The shield bug held onto the bird's back. They had so much fun flying together.As the sun went down, the bird and the shield bug went back home. They were tired but happy. They knew they had the perfect day. And they knew they would have more perfect days together, flying high in the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big pair of pants that his mom gave him. He loved his big pants very much. They were red and blue, just like his favorite toy car.One day, Tim went to play at the park. He saw a girl named Sue who was sad. Sue didn't have any pants to wear, and she felt cold. Tim wanted to help Sue and make her happy. He thought about what he could do.Tim decided to give Sue his big pants. Sue was so happy and thanked Tim. They played together all day at the park. Tim learned that sharing and giving can make others happy, and that made him happy too.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved to play outside with her friends. One sunny day, Mia and her friends went to the park. They saw a perfect tree with strong branches. They decided to hang a swing on the tree.Mia's friend, Tom, said, "Let's take turns on the swing!" So, Mia and her friends took turns swinging on the perfect tree. They laughed and played for hours.After they were tired from swinging, Mia's mom came to the park with a big jug of juice. "Time for a break!" she said. Mia and her friends sat under the perfect tree and drank the juice. They talked and laughed until the sun went down. It was a fun day at the park.

Once upon a time, in a small valley, there lived a little dog named Buddy. Buddy was an independent dog who loved to play and run around. One day, while he was playing, he met a big dog named Max."Hi, I'm Buddy," said the little dog. "Do you want to play with me?" Max looked at Buddy and said, "Sure, but first, let's finish our lunch." So, they ate their lunch together and then started to play.They played and played, but then it started to rain. Buddy and Max ran to find shelter, but they got lost. They tried to find their way back home, but they couldn't. The rain got stronger and stronger, and they got very wet and cold.Buddy and Max were sad because they were lost. They wished they had stayed home instead of playing in the valley. The rain never stopped, and they never found their way back home.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the library with her mom. The library was a big room with many books. Lily liked the library because it was a fun place to find new stories to read.In the library, Lily saw a big, ordinary cat. The cat was sitting on a table near the books. Lily gazed at the cat and the cat gazed back at her. They looked into each other's eyes for a long time.Lily's mom found a book for them to read together. The cat jumped down from the table and sat next to Lily and her mom. They all read the book and had a fun time. Lily thought it was a special day at the library with her new cat friend.

Lily and Ben were best friends. They liked to play in the park and share their snacks. One day, they saw a big cloud in the sky. It was dark and scary. They heard a loud noise like a lion roaring."What is that?" Lily asked."It is a hurricane," Ben said. "It is a very bad wind that can break things and hurt people. We have to go home fast."They ran to their bikes and started to pedal. The wind was strong and pushed them back. They saw leaves and branches flying in the air. They were scared and held hands."Are we going to be okay?" Lily asked."Yes, we are," Ben said. "We are brave and strong. And we have each other."They reached their homes and ran inside. Their moms and dads hugged them and told them they were safe. They gave them hot chocolate and cookies. Lily and Ben smiled and thanked them."Can I kiss Ben?" Lily asked her mom."Of course you can," her mom said. "He is your friend and he helped you."Lily kissed Ben on the cheek. He blushed and kissed her back."Your kiss is sweet," he said."Your kiss is sour," she said.They laughed and hugged. They were happy and glad. The hurricane was gone and the sun came out. They looked out the window and saw a rainbow. They knew it was a sign of hope and love.

One day, a boy named Tim went for a walk with his dog, Max. They walked to the park where they saw a big fog. Tim could not see very well, but he could hear Max barking. He called out, "Max, where are you?"Max barked again, and Tim followed the sound. He found Max near a big empty box. Tim asked Max, "What is in the box?" Max did not mention anything, but he kept barking at the box.Tim opened the box, and a big bunch of balloons flew out! The balloons lifted the fog, and Tim could see again. Tim and Max were so happy, they played in the park all day.

One day, a little girl named Mia went for a walk. She saw a big palace made of ice. Mia was very excited and wanted to go inside.As she walked in, she met a deaf queen. The queen could not hear, but she could talk with her hands. Mia said, "Hello, Queen! Your palace is very pretty!" The queen smiled and showed Mia around the palace.As they were walking, they saw a big red button. Mia wanted to press it, but the queen said, "No, don't! It will freeze everything!" But Mia did not listen and pressed the button. Suddenly, everything froze! The queen and Mia were scared. They had to find a way to unfreeze the palace before it was too late.

One day, a little boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, went to the park to play. Tim wanted to play a game with Spot. He had a ball and thought it would be fun to play a game with it. Tim said, "Spot, let's play a game with the ball!"Tim saw a distant tree and thought it would be a good goal. He told Spot, "The tree is the goal. I will kick the ball and you will catch it before it gets to the tree." Spot wagged his tail, ready to play.At first, they had fun playing. But then, a big wind came and blew the ball far away from the goal. Tim was sad because he could not find the ball. Spot suggested, "Let's look for the ball together!" They looked and looked, and finally found the ball under a bush. Tim was happy again, and they went back to playing their game.

Once upon a time, there was an ugly grape. The grape lived in a big tree. The grape was sad because it was not pretty like the other grapes.One day, a little bird came to the tree. The bird saw the ugly grape and said, "Hello, grape! Can you speak?" The ugly grape was surprised and spoke, "Yes, I can speak. But I am sad because I am ugly."The little bird looked at the grape and said, "You may be ugly, but you are special because you can speak. Let's be friends." The ugly grape smiled and said, "Yes, let's be friends!"From that day on, the ugly grape and the little bird were best friends. They talked and laughed together. The ugly grape was not sad anymore. It was happy because it had a friend who liked it just the way it was.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a friend named Sam. They liked to play and have fun together. One day, they found a dead bug in the park. Tim and Sam felt sad for the bug.Tim said to Sam, "I hate to see a dead bug." Sam agreed and said, "Me too, Tim. Let's give the bug a nice place to rest." Tim and Sam dug a small hole in the dirt and put the bug inside. They covered the bug with dirt and said goodbye.After that, Tim and Sam played in the park all day. They were happy to be friends and to help the bug. They knew that even when sad things happen, they could still have fun together.

Max was a loyal dog. He was never far away from his owners. One day his owners came home with a special surprise - a stage! Max had never seen one before. He was so excited he started to bark with joy. His owners could tell he was eager to try it out. So, they let him!Max bounced around the stage and lay down on the floor. His owners were amazed by his enthusiasm. Max's owners laughed and clapped when they saw him perform his tricks. "Max, you're a star!" they said.Max felt like a famous dog. He was so proud, he decided to lie down on the stage to rest. His owners were loyal to him and he was loyal to them. They couldn't have been happier.

Lily and Sam like to play dress up. They have many clothes and hats and masks. They can be anyone they want. Today, they want to be animals.Lily picks a yellow dress with black stripes. She puts on a tiger mask and a tail. She says, "I am a tiger. I am big and strong. I can roar and run and jump."Sam looks for a tiger costume too, but he cannot find one. He sees a brown coat and a brown hat. He puts them on and says, "I am a bear. I am big and furry. I can growl and climb and fish."Lily and Sam go to the garden. They pretend to be in the jungle. They hide behind the trees and the flowers. They make noises and chase each other.But then, they hear a real roar. They see a big tiger in the garden. It is not a mask. It is not a dress. It is a real tiger. It is not happy. It is angry.Lily and Sam are scared. They run to the house. They slam the door. They take off their costumes. They hug each other.They hear a knock on the door. They hear a voice. It is their dad. He says, "Sorry, kids. I forgot to tell you. I brought home a tiger from the zoo. He is my new friend. He is very nice. He just wanted to play with you. Can you come out and say hello?"Lily and Sam look at each other. They shake their heads. They say, "No, thank you. We do not want to play with a tiger. We do not want to wear tiger costumes. We want to be safe and warm and hidden."

Once upon a time, there was a little bird who lived in a birdcage. The bird was troubled because he wanted to fly high in the sky. He would look out of his birdcage and worry that he would never be free.One day, a kind girl saw the little bird in the birdcage. She felt sad for the bird and said, "Don't worry, little bird. I will help you be free." The girl opened the birdcage door and the little bird flew out.The little bird was so happy to be free. He flew high in the sky and sang a happy song. The kind girl smiled and said, "I'm glad I could help you, little bird." And from that day on, the little bird and the kind girl were the best of friends.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to play outside. She saw a small, rough rock on the ground. Sue picked up the rock and looked at it. It had a funny face drawn on it. Sue thought the face looked sad.Sue wanted to make the face on the rock happy. She had an idea! She took the rock to a big puddle and let it soak in the water. The water was cool and wet. The rock's face started to look happy.Sue said, "Do you like the water, Mr. Rock?" The rock didn't talk, but Sue knew it was happy. She played with the rock in the puddle for a long time. They splashed and laughed together. Sue and the rock were the best of friends.

Once upon a time there was a thin castle. Inside the castle was a special machine. Every day the machine had to be loaded so it could work. So every day the King and Queen would take an old bucket and fill it with loads of rocks and stones. Then they would carry it up to the top of the castle, and pour it right into the machine. After that it was ready to go!Sometimes they would even invite their friends to help with the loading. All their friends would bring buckets of stones and fill up the castle. Everyone had fun! When they were finished loading, they all clicked their heels together and the machine came to life. Everyone cheered, and from then on the machine worked every day. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a dog named Spot. Spot was a very big dog. Some people thought Spot was scary. But Tim and Spot loved each other very much.One day, Tim and Spot went to the park to play. They saw a little girl crying. Tim asked the girl, "Why are you sad?" The girl said, "I lost my toy. Can you please help me find it?" Tim and Spot said, "Yes, we will help you."Tim, Spot, and the girl looked all over the park. They found the toy under a big tree. The girl was so happy! She said, "Thank you, Tim and Spot!" Spot was not scary to the girl anymore. They all became good friends and played together every day.

One day, a smart cat named Tom wanted to play a game. He thought of a fun quiz for his friends. He was very excited to see if his friends could answer all the questions.Tom went to his friend, a dog named Max. Tom said, "Max, do you want to play my quiz? It will be fun!" Max was happy and wanted to play. They started the quiz, and Max tried to answer all the questions. Max was very intelligent, and he did a good job.After the quiz, Tom had to leave to go home. Max said, "Thank you, Tom, for the fun quiz! I had a great time!" Tom was happy that his friend liked the quiz. They both said goodbye and went back to their homes.

Once upon a time, there was a big red truck. The truck was owned by a wealthy man named Tom. Tom was very nice and liked to help people. One day, Tom saw a little boy named Tim. Tim was sad because he lost his toy.Tom asked, "Why are you sad, Tim?" Tim said, "I lost my toy when I stumble near the park." Tom wanted to help Tim find his toy. So, they went to the park together.At the park, they saw a big pile of toys. Tim was so happy! He thanked Tom and they became good friends. The moral of the story is that helping others can bring happiness to everyone.

Lily and Ben were very happy. They had a ticket to see a funny show with clowns and animals. They held their mom's hand and walked to the big tent. They saw many people and colors and balloons."Look, mom, a big elephant!" Ben said, pointing to a gray animal with a long nose."And a funny monkey!" Lily said, laughing at a brown animal with a long tail.They found their seats and waited for the show to start. They heard music and saw lights. They clapped their hands and cheered.The show was very funny. The clowns made jokes and tricks. The animals did silly things. Lily and Ben laughed and laughed. They liked the show very much.But then, something went wrong. One of the clowns tripped and fell. He dropped a big cake on his face. The cake was not real. It was made of foam and paint. The clown was not hurt. He was just messy.The other clowns laughed at him. They tried to help him, but they made more mess. They threw pies and water and confetti. They slipped and slid and bumped.Lily and Ben laughed even more. They thought it was part of the show. They thought it was the funniest thing ever.But their mom did not laugh. She did not think it was funny. She thought it was a disaster. She looked at her ticket and saw something. She saw a small word that she had missed before. It said: "Warning: This show may contain accidents and surprises. Enjoy at your own risk."She sighed and shook her head. She wished she had read the ticket more carefully. She hoped the show would end soon. She hoped the clowns would clean up. She hoped the cake would not stain her clothes.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom had a toy sword that he loved to play with. One day, Tom went to the park with his toy sword to play with his friends.Tom and his friends played a game where they would spin around with their swords. They would spin and spin until they got dizzy and fell down. They laughed and had so much fun spinning with their swords.But then, a big dog came to the park. Tom and his friends were scared of the big dog. They held their swords and spun around to protect themselves. The big dog saw them spinning and thought they were playing. So, the big dog spun around too, and they all played together. Tom and his friends were not scared anymore and had a great day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play the drum. He played the drum every day. But Tim's drum was filthy. It had dirt and dust on it. Tim did not like to clean his drum.One day, a little bird came to Tim's window. The bird was hungry. Tim wanted to help the bird. He went to the kitchen and found some bread. Tim fed the bird with the bread. The bird was happy and sang a beautiful song.Tim thought about the bird and his drum. He wanted his drum to be happy too. So, Tim cleaned his filthy drum. The drum looked shiny and new. Tim played the drum, and it sounded better than ever. The bird sang along with the drum.The moral of the story is: taking care of things, like feeding a hungry bird or cleaning a dirty drum, can make everything better and happier.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy old cat. The cat did not like to play with the other cats. One day, a little bird came to the cat. The bird said, "Why are you so grumpy, cat? Let's play!"The cat did not want to play. The bird tried to take the cat's toy. The cat got very mad. The cat said, "No! That is my toy! Go away, bird!"The bird was sad but did not go away. The bird wanted to be friends with the cat. The bird tried to touch the cat's neck to make the cat feel better. But the cat was still grumpy.The cat got even more mad. The cat said, "I told you to go away!" The cat chased the bird away. The bird flew away and never came back. The cat was still grumpy and all alone.

One day, a little bird was feeling very miserable. It was cold and hungry. It saw a peanut on the ground and wanted to eat it. The little bird flew down to get the peanut.Just as the little bird was about to eat the peanut, a big cat came. The cat said, "That is my peanut! I found it first!" The little bird was scared, but it did not want to give up the peanut.The little bird had an idea. It said, "Let's cover the peanut with leaves. We will wait and see who the peanut belongs to." The cat agreed. They both covered the peanut with leaves and waited.After a while, a kind squirrel came by and saw the peanut under the leaves. The squirrel was also hungry. The little bird and the cat decided to share the peanut with the squirrel. They all became friends and were not miserable anymore.The moral of the story is that sharing can make everyone happy.

Once upon a time, there was a brave boy named Tim. Tim loved to play sports. His favorite sport was to kick a ball. One sunny day, Tim went to the park to play with his friends.While they were playing, a big dog came running to them. The dog wanted to play, too. But Tim and his friends did not know that. They were scared of the big dog. They started to panic and ran away.Then, the dog found the ball and kicked it back to Tim. Tim saw that the dog just wanted to play. He stopped being scared and started to play with the dog. The big dog was not scary after all. Tim and his friends had lots of fun playing with their new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play games with his friends. One day, Tim and his friends were playing a game to see who could run the fastest. Tim really wanted to win, but he did not know if he could.As they were getting ready to race, Tim's friend, Sam, said, "I wonder who will win today?" Tim felt a little scared, but he knew he had to try his best. He said, "I don't know, but I hope I am the lucky one!"When the race started, Tim and his friends ran as fast as they could. Tim was running so fast, he felt like he could fly! Just as he was about to reach the finish line, a little bird flew down and landed on Tim's head. Everyone was so surprised!The bird looked at Tim and said, "You are a very fast runner, and I want to help you win!" The bird gave Tim a big push, and he crossed the finish line first. Tim was so happy and thankful to the bird. He knew he was the lucky one that day.From that day on, Tim and the bird became best friends. They played together and had lots of fun. Tim learned that sometimes, a little bit of luck and help from a friend can make all the difference.

Once upon a time, there was a cat named Tim. Tim was a nervous cat. One day, he saw a big bowl of cream. Tim loved cream. He wanted to eat it all. But he was scared that someone would see him.Tim saw a bird named Sam. Sam was good at singing. Tim had an idea. He asked Sam, "Can you sing a song for me?" Sam said, "Yes, I can sing for you." Tim said, "I will record your song." He hoped that Sam's song would make everyone busy, so he could eat the cream.Sam started to sing. Everyone was happy and listened to Sam's song. Tim went to the cream and started to eat. But then, he felt bad. He knew it was not right to take the cream without asking. So, Tim stopped eating and went to say sorry.He told everyone, "I am sorry for taking the cream. I was nervous and did not ask." Everyone forgave Tim. They shared the cream with him. Tim learned that it is better to ask and share, than to take without asking.

Once upon a time, there was a fast bunny named Bob. Bob liked to run and play in the big field. One day, Bob saw a pretty green spot far away. He wanted to see what it was, so he ran fast to the green spot.When Bob got there, he found an oasis. The oasis had a small pond with water and many trees. Bob was happy to find this place. He played in the water and ate some leaves. He thought that nothing could happen to him here.But, one day, something strange happened. A big bird came to the oasis. Bob was scared of the big bird. He thought the bird would hurt him. But, the big bird was kind. The bird told Bob, "I am your friend. I will not hurt you." They became best friends and played together in the oasis every day.

One day, a girl named Lucy went for a walk. She saw a cactus. The cactus was big and green. Lucy wanted to touch it, but her mom said, "No, it can hurt you."Lucy and her mom went home. They wanted to cook something yummy. They made a big pot of soup. The soup was hot and smelled good. Lucy helped her mom stir the soup.After they ate the soup, Lucy and her mom went back outside. They looked at the cactus again. Lucy knew not to touch it. She was happy to be with her mom and learn new things.

Lily and Ben were playing with a big box of toys. They liked to make different things with the pieces. Lily made a house, and Ben made a car. They were having fun.Then, Lily saw a shiny piece that looked like a star. She wanted to use it for her house. But Ben saw it too, and he wanted to use it for his car. They both reached for the piece at the same time."Mine!" Lily said."No, mine!" Ben said.They pulled the piece from each other, and it broke in half. They both felt sad and angry."Look what you did!" Lily said."You did it!" Ben said.They started to cry.Then, they heard a voice. It was their teacher, Miss Rose. She came to see what was wrong."What happened, children?" she asked.They told her about the piece and how they both wanted it and how it broke.Miss Rose looked at the piece. She smiled."I have an idea," she said. "Why don't you share the piece and make something new together?"She showed them how to spin the piece on a stick. It made a pretty sound and a bright light."Wow!" Lily and Ben said.They liked the spinning piece. They decided to make a windmill with it. They used some paper and glue and other pieces. They worked together and helped each other.They finished their windmill and put it on the window. It spun and shone in the sun.They were happy."Thank you, Miss Rose," they said."You're welcome, children," she said. "You are very kind to share and cooperate. That's what friends do."

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim wanted to buy a glass. He liked to drink juice from a glass. But he had a sister named Sue. Sue was competitive. She wanted to buy a glass too.One day, Tim and Sue went to the store with their mom. Tim found a nice glass. Sue found a nice glass too. They both wanted to buy their glass. But their mom said they could only buy one glass.Tim and Sue did not know what to do. They both wanted their glass. So, they had a race. Whoever won the race could buy their glass. Tim and Sue ran very fast. Tim won the race. Sue was sad.Tim felt bad for Sue. He decided to share his glass with her. They both bought the glass together. Now, Tim and Sue could drink juice from their glass. They were happy. They learned to share and not be competitive.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to measure things. One day, she found a big book with many pages. The pages were not organized. They were all mixed up.Lily asked her mom, "Mom, can I measure the pages in this book?" Her mom said, "Yes, but first, we need to organize the pages."So, Lily and her mom worked together to organize the pages. They put them in the right order. Then, Lily started to measure the pages. She was very happy.But, something unexpected happened! As she measured the last page, a small door opened in the book. Lily and her mom looked inside and found a hidden treasure! They were so surprised and happy.The moral of the story is that when you work together and stay organized, you can find amazing things.

Once upon a time there was a little boy who wanted to play the guitar. But he had a problem, he was too small and the guitar wouldn't fit him. He got very sad.He wanted to play the guitar so badly, but he kept trying and trying. One day while he was very gloomy and sad, he got a surprise. His dad had made a special guitar just for him! It was the perfect size so it fit him perfectly. The little boy was so happy and he started playing the guitar right away. And he learned the moral of the story; if you keep trying, you can do anything!

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a mighty train. This train loved to let out big puffs of steam as it moved on the tracks. All the children in the town liked to watch the train go by.One sunny day, a little boy named Tim found a small box. He wanted to bury the box and make a secret hiding spot. He dug a hole near the train tracks and put the box inside. Then, he covered the hole with dirt.As Tim finished burying the box, the mighty train went by. The train let out a big puff of steam and said, "Hello, Tim! What are you doing?" Tim smiled and said, "I'm hiding a secret box!" The train laughed and said, "That's a fun idea! Have a great day, Tim!" And with another puff of steam, the mighty train continued on its way.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a helpful man named Tom. Tom worked at a mill. The mill made flour from wheat. Everyone in the town liked Tom because he was always ready to help.One day, a little girl named Lily came to the mill. She said, "Tom, will you help me? I lost my toy in the mill." Tom insisted, "Yes, I will help you." They looked and looked for the toy, but they could not find it.Then, something unexpected happened. A little mouse came out of a hole in the wall. The mouse was holding the toy in its mouth! The mouse gave the toy back to Lily. She was so happy! Tom and Lily thanked the mouse and they all became good friends.

Once upon a time, a graceful deer lived in a big forest. She liked to play and jump in the grass. The deer had many friends, like the rabbit, the squirrel, and the bird.One day, something happened. The deer saw a big hole in the grass. She was scared and did not know what to do. She called her friends to come and help her.The rabbit, the squirrel, and the bird came to help the deer. They worked together and found a way to fix the hole. The deer was very happy and thanked her friends. They all played in the grass again, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Tom and Bob. Tom was glad to be playing in the park with Bob and they both ran around happily together. Then, Bob saw something that made him angry. It was a big statue of his enemy. Tom noticed Bob was mad, so he asked him what was wrong. Bob explained that he didn’t like the statue, he wanted to get rid of it.“Let’s shoot it!” Tom suggested.Bob smiled. He liked the idea. He grabbed some rocks, placed them in a pile and told Tom to shoot them. Tom had never shot rocks before, but he did his best and when the rocks started to hit the statue, Bob was so glad. The statue had been blasted to pieces! Now Tom and Bob could play in the park without the statue getting in their way.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very excited because his birthday was coming soon. He knew he would get a gift, and he hoped it would be something interesting.One day, Tim's big sister, Sue, came home with a big box. She hid it in her room and told Tim not to look. Tim thought that maybe this was his gift. He tried to peek, but Sue would always show him away.Finally, Tim's birthday came. Sue gave him the big box. Tim was so happy! He opened it and found the most interesting toy inside. It was a colorful robot that could dance and sing. Tim knew that Sue had shown him away from the box because she wanted to surprise him with the best gift ever. And she did!

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a lot of snow. A little dog named Max was very enthusiastic about playing in the snow. He loved to jump and run in the cold, white snow.One day, while Max was playing, he heard a tiny cry. "Help! Help!" said a little voice. Max looked around and saw a small bird shivering in the snow. The bird was cold and scared. Max knew he had to rescue the bird.Max gently picked up the bird with his mouth and carried it to his warm home. He shared his soft bed and some food with the bird. The little bird was so happy and said, "Thank you, Max, for rescuing me from the snow!" Max felt very proud and continued to play with his new friend. They played in the snow but stayed close to their warm home, so they would always be safe and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his toy ball. He would run and jump and chase the ball all day long.One day, Spot found a long string. He had a fun idea. He decided to tie the string to his toy ball. Now, Spot could swing the ball around and make it go even faster!Spot played and played with his new toy. He was so happy. He showed his friends how to tie their toys too. They all had a great time playing together. And they all lived happily ever after.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play with dolls and cars. One day, they find a big box in the garage. The box has many things inside. They see scissors, glue, paper, and stickers."Let's make something with these things," Lily says. "We can cut and glue and stick.""OK," Ben says. "What do you want to make?"Lily thinks for a moment. She sees a doll with long hair. She has an idea."I want to make a hat for my doll," she says. "A hat with paper and stickers."She takes the scissors and the paper. She starts to cut a circle. Ben watches her."Can I help you?" he asks.Lily nods. She offers him the glue and the stickers. "You can glue and stick," she says.Ben takes the glue and the stickers. He starts to glue and stick. He makes a pattern with the stickers. He likes the colors.Lily finishes cutting the circle. She puts it on her doll's head. She smiles. "Look, my doll has a hat," she says. "She is ready for a party."Ben looks at her doll. He sees the hat. He sees the long hair. He has an idea."I want to cut your doll's hair," he says. "I want to make it short and funny."He takes the scissors. He moves them to the doll's hair. Lily sees him."No, don't do that!" she shouts. "That is my doll's hair. You can't cut it."But Ben does not listen. He cuts the doll's hair. He cuts and cuts and cuts. He makes it short and funny. He laughs."Look, your doll has a new hair," he says. "She is ready for a joke."Lily looks at her doll. She sees the hat. She sees the short and funny hair. She feels sad and angry. She cries."That is not a joke," she says. "That is mean. You ruined my doll. You are not my frien

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a compassionate boy named Tim. He loved to play ball with his friends. One day, they decided to see who could make the highest score in the game.As they played, Tim's ball went up high and started to fall. Tim's friend, Sam, said, "Look, the ball is falling! Catch it, Tim!" Tim jumped and caught the ball just in time."Good catch, Tim!" said Sam. Tim smiled and said, "Thank you, Sam! Let's keep playing!" They continued to play and had lots of fun. In the end, Tim made the highest score, and everyone cheered for him. They all had a great day, and Tim showed his friends how kind and compassionate he was by sharing his prize with them.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was a stubborn boy who always wanted his way. One day, Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big tree with many apples on it. Tim wanted to pick all the apples, but his mom said they should only take a few.Tim did not listen to his mom. He picked all the apples and put them in a big bag. Later, they went to a party to celebrate his friend's birthday. Tim wanted to give all the apples to his friend, but his mom said they should share with everyone at the party.Tim was stubborn and did not want to share. His mom told him that sharing is caring and it makes everyone happy. Tim thought about it and decided to share the apples with everyone at the party. Everyone was happy, and Tim learned that sharing is a good thing.

One day, a little girl was walking in her garden. She had a messy nose, which she wanted to wipe clean. She saw a box in the corner of the garden and she decided to take a closer look. As she opened the box, she spotted a beautiful butterfly inside. Before the butterfly could fly away, the girl shut the box quickly and excitedly. The butterfly was scared and flew out of the box, but it couldn't get very far because its wings were too tired. The girl blew into the box and the butterfly flew inside again. She shut the box quickly, to make sure the butterfly was safe. The little girl was so excited to have the butterfly with her, she forgot all about her messy nose. She laughed with joy and waved her arms, sending flower petals everywhere. She was so happy that she even started to dance. The girl spent the rest of the day playing with the little butterfly. When it got too dark to play, she shut the box and made sure the butterfly was safe and snug. She said goodbye to her little friend and went inside to have dinner.

Once there was a little boy named John. One day, John and his parents drove to a big city. John was very anxious, he had never been to a city before. When they arrived, John noticed a lot of people in suits. He asked his parents why they were all wearing suits and they told him they were important people.John was very curious, he wanted to know more. But then his parents saw a big building and told him they had to go inside.John demanded to know why they had to go inside. His parents explained that they had to go to a meeting with very important people and they had to wear their suits. John was still very anxious but he put on his suit and went inside the building. Inside, the walls were very tall and John felt very small. John and his parents waited for the meeting, but John heard some loud voices coming from the room. He was so scared that he had to hide behind a chair! Finally, when the meeting was over, John was relieved. He was so happy to go home, play with his toys and never wear a suit again.

One day, a smart cat named Tom was looking at a pretty view. He saw a big tree and many birds. Tom wanted to tell his friend, a dog named Max, about the view. But Max was far away. So, Tom thought he would write a note and send it to Max.Tom found a small paper and a pen. He wrote, "Max, I saw a pretty view today. I want to show you. Come and see it with me!" Tom gave the note to a bird, and the bird flew away to find Max.After some time, Max got the note and read it. He said, "Wow, I want to see the pretty view too!" Max ran to Tom's house. When he got there, Tom was waiting for him. "Tom, I got your note. Let's go see the pretty view!" Max said with a big smile.Tom and Max went to the big tree and looked at the pretty view together. They saw many birds and a beautiful sky. They were very happy to share the view, and they knew they were smart to write the note. From that day on, Tom and Max always shared the pretty views they found.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play and run around all day. One day, he found a big room called a gym. The gym was a place where people could play and exercise.Tim saw an adorable puppy in the gym. The puppy was small and cute. Tim wanted to play with the puppy and help it improve its running and jumping. So, they played together in the gym every day.After many days, the puppy got better at running and jumping. Tim was very happy to see the puppy improve. They became best friends and played in the gym all the time. And they lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy named Tim and his toy robot, Rob, were playing in his room. They loved to play a game called "quiz." Tim would ask Rob questions and Rob would try to answer them. Today, Tim asked Rob, "What is big and can destroy things?" Rob thought for a moment and then said, "A big truck can destroy things!"Later, they went to the park to play. They saw a big truck that was not moving. Tim asked his mom, "Is the truck dead?" His mom said, "No, it is just not turned on." Tim was happy to hear that.Back at home, Tim and Rob played another quiz game. This time, Rob asked Tim, "What can make a truck not dead?" Tim thought and then said, "A key can make a truck not dead!" They were both happy to learn new things from their quiz game.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. It was a cold day, but he put on his warm coat and hat. He liked to play near the big tree in his yard. As he played, he saw a white thing behind the tree. It was a ghost!"Hello," said the ghost. "I am lost. Can you help me return home?"Tim was brave and wanted to help. He took the ghost's hand and they walked together. They walked and walked until they found a small house. The ghost stopped and looked at Tim."Thank you for helping me," said the ghost. "Now, I have a surprise for you."The ghost changed into a big, friendly dog! Tim was so happy. The dog was not a ghost at all, but a lost pet. The dog licked Tim's face and wagged its tail. Tim and the dog played and became best friends. They returned home together and were never cold or scared again.

Charlie was walking in a meadow when he noticed a strange insect. He bent down on one knee and tried to get closer but it hopped away. He followed it, slowly and carefully and it eventually stopped on a rock.“Hello strange insect,” Charlie said. “Where do you live?” The strange insect just stepped away from the rock and onto the grass.Charlie followed it, taking small steps and admiring its shiny antennae. Eventually, they reached an icy river. The river was so dark and cold that Charlie could not remember ever seeing an insect so close to it. The strange insect stepped onto the icy water and for the first time Charlie noticed the reflection of his own face. He smiled and waved to the insect, and the insect waved back with it’s little leg, and then hopped away into the woods.

Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his friends. They would play games, sing songs, and have fun all day. One day, Tim and his friends decided to play a new game. They wanted to make a quiz. The quiz was about their favorite animals.As they were making the quiz, something unexpected happened. A little bird flew down and landed on the paper. The bird could talk! The bird said, "I know a way to make your quiz even more fun. Let's unite all the animals in the forest to play the quiz with you!"Tim and his friends were so surprised and excited. They followed the bird into the forest. There, they found all the animals waiting to play the quiz. The animals were very good at the quiz. It turned out that the little bird was a magical bird who wanted to help the animals make new friends.In the end, Tim and his friends had a great time playing the quiz with the animals. They learned that even when something unexpected happens, it can lead to a fun adventure. And so, Tim, his friends, and the forest animals became the best of friends, and they played together every day.

One day, Mom and Dad were talking. Mom said, "I want to mention our new baby will need a smooth blanket." Dad agreed and they went to the store to find one.At the store, they found many smooth blankets. They picked a blue one because it was very soft. They were happy and went back home.When they got home, their dog, Spot, was waiting. Spot saw the smooth blanket and thought it was a toy. He took it and ran away. Mom and Dad were surprised, but they laughed. They said, "We will get another blanket for the baby, and this one can be Spot's toy."

One day, a small dog named Max was playing in a big field. He loved to run and jump in the tall grass. He saw a big red ball and ran to get it. Max was very happy.In the field, Max saw a big cat named Tom. Tom was not nice. He wanted to take the red ball from Max. Tom said, "Give me the ball or I will hurt you." Max felt helpless. He did not know what to do.A big bird named Sam saw Max and Tom. Sam wanted to help Max. He flew down and warned Tom, "Leave Max alone. He is my friend." Tom was scared of Sam and ran away. Max was safe and happy. He thanked Sam for helping him. From that day on, Max and Sam were best friends.

Once there was a little girl who had a very fancy sister. She liked to watch her big sister play. One day, her big sister liked to roll around on the floor. The little girl thought it looked like so much fun. She started to roll around, just like her fancy sister. They rolled and rolled until they were too tired to keep going. Then they both laughed and rolled some more. It was a fun day for the two sisters!

One day, a little boy named Tim found a funny cube in his room. He did not know what it was or where it came from. The cube had many colors on it. Tim liked to gaze at it and turn it around in his hands.Tim showed the cube to his friend, Sam. Sam said, "Wow, that's a funny cube! What does it do?" Tim said, "I don't know. Let's find out!" They played with the cube and tried to make all the colors match on each side. But it was very hard.Then, something unexpected happened! When they turned the cube one more time, a big rainbow came out of it! The rainbow filled the room with bright colors. Tim and Sam were so surprised and happy. They played with the rainbow and had lots of fun. The funny cube was magic after all!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to observe her mom as she worked in the kitchen. One day, Lucy's mom was using the dishwasher to clean the dishes. Lucy watched and wanted to help."Mom, can I help with the dishwasher?" Lucy asked. Her mom smiled and said, "Sure, Lucy. You can put the cups in the dishwasher." Lucy was very happy to help. She picked up a cup and carefully put it in the dishwasher.But then, Lucy accidentally dropped a cup. It broke on the floor. Lucy felt embarrassed and said, "I'm sorry, Mom." Her mom hugged her and said, "It's okay, Lucy. We all make mistakes. Just be more careful next time."Lucy smiled and continued to help her mom with the dishwasher. From that day on, she always tried her best to be careful and help her mom in the kitchen. And whenever she felt embarrassed, she remembered her mom's kind words.

One day, a boy named Tim went out to play in the evening. He saw a modern toy car near his house. He picked it up and looked around. He saw another boy named Sam. Tim asked Sam, "Did you lose this car?"Sam said, "No, but I want to play with it too." So, they played together with the car. They made it go fast and slow. They had a lot of fun.But then, it got dark. The sky was black. Tim and Sam did not want to go home. They wanted to keep playing. They did not listen when their moms called them.Finally, their moms found them. They were mad. Tim and Sam had to go home. They did not get to play with the car anymore. They were sad because they did not listen.

Tom and Sue like to play in the sand. They make castles and dig holes. One day, they find a big shell in the sand. They think there is a treasure inside."Let's open it!" Tom says. He tries to pull the shell apart, but it is too hard. He twists and twists, but nothing happens."Let me try!" Sue says. She takes the shell from Tom and twists it too. She twists so hard that the shell breaks in half. But there is no treasure inside. There is only a shrimp."Yuck!" Tom says. He looks at the shrimp. It is pink and slimy. It does not move. It is dead."Maybe it was the treasure for someone else," Sue says. She feels sorry for the shrimp. She puts the shell back together and buries it in the sand."Let's make a new castle," Tom says. He forgets about the shrimp. He and Sue play in the sand until the sun goes down. They do not know that the shrimp was the dinner for a hungry crab. The crab was hiding under the sand, waiting for the right moment. But the crab was too late. The shrimp was gone. The crab was sad and hungry. It had to find another meal.

Once upon a time, in a distant land, there was a man named Tom. Tom loved to test wine. One day, he found a big bottle of wine. He was very happy and wanted to share it with his friend, Sam.Tom went to Sam's house and said, "Sam, I found a big bottle of wine. Let's test it together!" Sam looked at the bottle and said, "I don't like wine. I like juice." Tom was sad because he wanted to share his happiness with Sam.Tom had an idea. He went to the market and bought some juice for Sam. He came back to Sam's house and said, "Sam, I have juice for you. Now we can both be happy!" Sam smiled and they both enjoyed their drinks together. In the end, they were happy because they could share something they both liked.

Once upon a time, there was a big iron. The big iron lived in a house with a little girl named Sue. Sue liked to watch her mom use the big iron to make clothes flat and nice. One day, Sue wanted to try using the big iron too.Sue asked her mom, "Can I try the big iron?" Her mom said, "Not yet, you are too little. But you can watch me." So Sue watched her mom use the big iron. She saw how the big iron made the clothes flat and nice. Sue wanted to help her mom.Then, something happened. The big iron said, "I can help you, Sue!" The big iron showed Sue how to use it very carefully. Sue was happy and helped her mom. The big iron, Sue, and her mom made all the clothes flat and nice together.

Tom was a painter. He liked to make pictures with colors. He had many brushes and paints. He had a big paper on the wall. He wanted to make a nice picture for his mom.But Sam was a bad boy. He did not like Tom. He wanted to make Tom sad. He took a brush and some paint. He ran to Tom's paper. He made a big mess on it. He laughed and said, "Your picture is ugly!"Tom was very sad. He saw his paper. It was ruined. He felt hurt. He wanted to cry. He wanted to hit Sam. But he knew that was wrong. He tried to resist. He said, "Go away, Sam. You are mean. You are not my friend."But Sam did not go away. He wanted to make more mess. He took another brush and more paint. He threw them at Tom. They hit Tom's face and clothes. They made him dirty and wet. Sam laughed more and said, "You are ugly, too!"Tom was very angry. He could not resist anymore. He forgot what was right. He grabbed a brush and some paint. He ran to Sam. He hit Sam with the brush. He painted Sam's face and hair. He said, "You are mean, Sam. You are not my friend. You are a bad boy!"Sam was very scared. He felt hurt. He wanted to cry. He wanted to run away. But he could not. Tom was stronger. Tom was madder. Tom kept hitting and painting him. He said, "This is what you get, Sam. This is what you deserve."No one saw them. No one heard them. No one helped them. They kept fighting and hurting each other. They made a big mess of themselves and the room. They ruined their paints and brushes. They ruined their friendship. They were not happy. They were not nice. They were not painters. They were just bad boys.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird with a big wing. The bird loved to fly high in the sky. The bird was very generous and liked to help other animals.One day, the bird saw a small bug who was lost. The bug said, "I wonder how to get home." The bird wanted to help the bug. So, the bird used its big wing to fly the bug home.The bug was very happy and thanked the generous bird. They became good friends. The bird and the bug played together every day. And they lived happily ever after.

One day, Mandy was playing in her room all alone. She looked around and saw a big safe against the wall. She was curious, so she decided to open it. She ran to the safe, and put her hand on the door."Open, open," she said while turning the knob.Suddenly, the safe opened and Mandy was surprised. Inside the safe, there was a toy box. Mandy was so excited that she quickly opened the box and started playing with the toys inside.Suddenly, Mandy noticed something sticking out of the toys. It was a sharp needle. She got scared and tried to pull it out, but it was stuck. She started to feel hurt and started to cry.Mandy's mom heard Mandy's cries and ran into the room."What's wrong, sweetheart?" she asked.Mandy showed her the needle and how it had made her hurt.Mom hugged Mandy and said, "It's ok, sweetheart. You were being brave for opening the safe."Mom quickly got a band-aid and put it on Mandy's finger.Mandy smiled and hugged her mom. Through her tears, she said, "Thank you mommy."Mom smiled and said, "It's alright, sweetheart. Let's play with the toys together and make sure we're careful with the needle."

Toby and Timmy were two brothers who were always competing. Every day they would race each other and try to do the same activities faster or better than the other. This day was special because it was the day of the big competition. Toby and Timmy were both competing!They each had their own trophies to win. Toby was determined to get the great trophy and Timmy was sure he could do it. When the big race started, Toby got a head start and looked like he was going to finish first. But then Timmy had a great race and came flying past the finish line! He won the great trophy!Toby was disappointed but still very proud of his brother. He hugged Timmy and congratulated him on his win. Toby was sad but still happy for his brother. They both knew that even though his brother was the winner, Toby had put in his best effort. It was a great day for both brothers as they each went home with their own trophies. Even though Toby had not won, everyone knew that he had put in his best effort and had tried his best.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat fruit. His favorite fruit was a big, round melon. One day, Tim saw a melon in the store. He asked his mom, "Can I get the melon, please?" His mom said, "Yes, you can."Tim was so happy to get the melon. But he was also a little anxious. He had never cut a melon by himself before. Tim's mom saw that he was anxious and said, "Don't worry, I will help you cut the melon."Together, Tim and his mom cut the melon into small pieces. Tim ate some of the melon and shared it with his friends. They all loved the sweet and juicy melon. Tim felt proud and not anxious anymore. He learned that with help, he could do new things. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a rag that she loved to play with. The rag was very popular with all the kids. They liked to watch Sue play with it.One day, Sue was playing outside with the rag when a big wind came. It blew the rag high up into a tree. Sue was very sad. She tried to get the rag, but the tree was too tall.Then, a kind boy named Tom came to help. He climbed the tree and got the rag for Sue. She was so happy! Sue and Tom became good friends. They learned that helping each other is important.

Anna was a thoughtful girl who liked to help others. She often visited her grandma, who was old and used a cane to walk. Anna liked to talk to her grandma and listen to her stories.One day, Anna saw a big bag of apples at the market. She thought they would make a nice gift for her grandma, who loved apples. She asked the seller how much they cost. The seller said they cost one coin for each apple.Anna counted her coins. She had five coins. She could buy five apples, but the bag had more than five apples. She wanted to buy the whole bag for her grandma. She had an idea. She asked the seller if he had a scale to weigh the apples.The seller nodded and brought out a scale. He put the bag of apples on one side and a weight on the other side. The scale balanced. He said the bag of apples weighed the same as the weight.Anna looked at the weight. It had a number on it. The number was ten. Anna thought hard. She remembered that her grandma's cane also had a number on it. The number was ten. She wondered if her grandma's cane weighed the same as the bag of apples.She asked the seller if he would trade the bag of apples for her grandma's cane. The seller was surprised, but he agreed. He gave Anna the bag of apples and took her grandma's cane.Anna was happy. She ran to her grandma's house with the bag of apples. She knocked on the door and gave her grandma the bag of apples. She said she traded her grandma's cane for the apples.Her grandma was shocked. She asked Anna why she did that. She said she needed her cane to walk. She said she could not walk without her cane.Anna felt sad. She did not think of

Once upon a time, there was a clumsy pumpkin.
