In the morning, she woke up and said to herself, “Today is going to be a great day!” She hopped out of bed, but then she stumbled, tripping over her own clumsy feet.She heard a voice, “Be careful! You do not want to get hurt.”The clumsy pumpkin looked around, but no one was there. Suddenly, she spotted a tiny little mouse in the corner who had spoken. She gasped, “Oh my! You scared me! How can you talk?” The mouse replied, “I can talk because I am magic. Now, look at what I can do!” With the flick of the mouse’s tiny little paw, a giant pumpkin appeared in the room.The clumsy pumpkin smiled and said, “That’s amazing! I love pumpkins! Is it for me?” The mouse nodded. “Yes, it is! Enjoy!” The clumsy pumpkin happily hugged the pumpkin and thanked the mouse. With a smile on her face, she said goodbye and skipped out of the room.

Once upon a time there was a girl called Jenny. Jenny was very creative and she liked to draw. She had a pencil which she kept with her always. One day, Jenny was drawing with her pencil when her mum called her. " Jenny, I need your help," said Mum. Mum showed Jenny a big cake she had been making. "Can you help me decorate the cake?" Jenny was very excited and got to work. She carefully decorated the cake with her pencil and they worked together to make it look beautiful. When they were finished, Mum said, "You've done a wonderful job Jenny. I'm sure your friends will love the cake! Now let's not spoil it before they come." Jenny laughed. She was very proud of the cake they had made and was excited to show it off. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a bright red coat with a big zip. One day, he went to the park with his mom.At the park, Tim saw a tall hill. "Mom, I want to go up there!" he said. Mom smiled and said, "Okay, let's go!" They walked up the hill together. Tim felt good because he could zip his coat all by himself.When they got to the top of the hill, Tim saw a beautiful view. He could see the whole park! Tim looked at his mom and said, "Wow! This is a good view!" Mom agreed and said, "Yes, it is a good view, Tim." They sat on the hill and enjoyed the view together.

Once upon a time, in a cheerful little town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his blocks. He would stack them high, making tall towers. One sunny day, Tim was playing with his blocks in the park.As Tim was stacking his blocks, a dog came running by. The dog bumped into Tim's stack, and the blocks fell down. Tim was sad, but he did not shout. He knew the dog did not mean to knock down his stack.Tim started to stack his blocks again. This time, he made an even taller tower. But something unexpected happened. The dog came back with more dogs, and they all helped Tim build the biggest stack ever. They all had fun together, and Tim made new friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk with his mom. They saw a shiny rod on the ground. Tim picked it up and said, "Look, Mom! A shiny rod!" His mom smiled and said, "Yes, it is very shiny!"As they walked, they saw a big, disgusting bug. It was green and slimy. Tim held the shiny rod near the bug and said, "Go away, bug!" The bug looked at the shiny rod and went away. Tim's mom said, "Good job, Tim! You made the bug go away!"Tim and his mom continued their walk, happy that the shiny rod helped them. They played at the park and had a fun day together. When it was time to go home, Tim put the shiny rod in his pocket, ready to use it again if another disgusting bug came their way.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was very impatient. She wanted a cookie right away! So she closed her eyes and prayed. She said "Please give me a cookie".She waited and waited but nothing happened. She got more and more impatient. Then suddenly her mom came into the room. She had a big plate full of cookies!The little girl was so happy. She thanked God for answering her prayer.The End.

There was one little girl named Emma. She was three years old and she loved to play. One day, Emma was in her room playing with her toys. Suddenly, a ghost popped out from behind the curtains. "Boo!" said the ghost.Emma was scared and started crying. She didn't know what was going on. Then, Emma thought of a plan. She took a big deep breath and bravely said:"Go away!"The ghost was surprised. He didn't expect Emma to be so brave. He thought it was time to leave, so he flew up towards the window. But before the ghost left, he turned around and said:"I'm not scared of you Emma. I'll come back!"Emma was determined not to be scared anymore. She ran over to the window, and with all her strength, she kicked at the ghost. The ghost flew away and Emma shouted,"Go away ghost and don't come back!"Emma felt proud of herself for being so brave and kicking the ghost away. Never again would she let a ghost scare her!

Once upon a time, a little puppy named Pippin lived in a warm house. Pippin loved to play with his friend, a little girl named Lucy. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long. Pippin was a very happy puppy.One day, Lucy found a big, shiny rock. She showed it to Pippin and said, "Look, Pippin! I want to polish this rock to make it even more shiny." Pippin wagged his tail and barked, "Woof! Woof!" He wanted to help Lucy.Lucy and Pippin worked together to polish the rock. They rubbed it with a soft cloth until it was smooth and shiny. When they were done, they both felt very proud. They put the shiny rock on a shelf in the warm house to remember their fun day. From that day on, Lucy and Pippin loved to find and polish rocks together, making their warm house even more special.

Jill and Ben were twins who liked to play with blocks. They had many blocks of different colors and shapes. They could build houses, towers, bridges and anything they wanted. But they had a problem. Jill liked to complete her blocks and make them stable. Ben liked to knock down his blocks and make them fall.One day, they were playing in their room. Jill was making a big house with a roof and a door. Ben was making a tall tower with no base. He wanted to see how high he could go. Jill said, "Ben, be careful. Your tower is not stable. It will fall down and break my house." Ben said, "No, it won't. My tower is the best. I don't care about your house. It is boring."Jill felt sad and angry. She worked hard to complete her house. She wanted Ben to like it and play with her. But Ben only cared about his tower. He did not share or help. He was selfish and rude.Suddenly, a strong wind blew through the window. It made the blocks shake and wobble. Ben's tower was not stable. It fell down with a loud crash. It hit Jill's house and broke it too. All the blocks were scattered on the floor. Jill and Ben were shocked and scared. They cried and hugged each other.They realized they had made a big mistake. They had wasted their blocks and hurt their feelings. They had not been good siblings. They said they were sorry and asked for forgiveness. They decided to work together and rebuild their blocks. They made a new house and a new tower. They made them stable and complete. They played and had fun. They learned to be kind and respectful. They were happy and proud.The moral of the story is: Be careful with your

Once upon a time there was a little girl named May. She was so happy, always playing and running around. One day, May found a sad puppy. It was all alone, lying in a corner. May didn't hesitate and went to comfort the puppy. She put her arms around the puppy and said "It's alright, don't be sad".Surprisingly the puppy spoke. It said "Thank you, May. I'm really hungry". May thought for a moment, then she said "Come with me, I'll give you something to eat". May took the puppy home and gave it a bowl of broccoli. The puppy loved it and ate it all up.May and the puppy became best friends. Whenever May was sad, the puppy also became sad and tried to comfort May. Even when May was being lazy, the puppy was always there, ready to play. May said "Thank you for always being here for me". The puppy barked back and wagged its tail happily. May smiled and the two of them played together the whole day. May and the puppy lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little bee. The bee was adventurous. He loved to fly and see new things. One day, the bee met a kind lady.The lady said, "Hello, little bee. Do you want to cook with me?" The bee was excited. He liked to learn and try new things. So, the bee said, "Yes, I want to cook!"They went to the lady's house. The lady showed the bee how to cook a yummy cake. The bee helped her mix and stir. The cake was ready and it smelled good. The bee and the lady ate the cake together. They both loved it.The adventurous bee had a fun day with the lady. They became good friends. The bee learned how to cook and he was very happy. The bee flew back to his home and told his bee friends all about his new adventure.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim went for a run. Tim loved to run, and he was always anxious to start. He liked to run when the sun came up, because the sunrise was pretty.One day, as Tim was running, he saw a little bird. The bird said, "Hi Tim! Can I run with you?" Tim was surprised but happy. So, Tim and the little bird ran together. They ran and ran until they were tired.As they stopped to rest, they saw the sun was going down. Tim and the bird looked at each other and smiled. They had run from sunrise to sunset. The little bird said, "Thank you, Tim, for a fun day!" And they both went home, excited for their next run together.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a famous girl named Lily. She had a big smile that made everyone happy. Lily liked to help people and make them smile too.One day, Lily was walking in the woods. She saw a little house. Smoke came out of the house. "Oh no!" said Lily. "The house is starting to burn!" She ran to the house to help.Lily got water from a nearby pond. She threw the water on the house. The fire stopped. The people who lived in the house were very happy. They thanked Lily for her help. Lily's smile made them smile too. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to sort her toys into different groups. Mia had a big box full of toys. She would sit on the floor and put all the dolls in one corner, all the cars in another, and all the blocks in a third corner. She liked to see her toys look nice and neat.One day, Mia found a big ruler in her mom's room. It was a measure stick! She thought it would be fun to use it with her toys. Mia took the measure stick and started to see how long her dolls, cars, and blocks were. She found that some were long, and some were short. Mia thought this was very interesting.Mia wanted to build a tower with her blocks. She tried to stack them up, but it was hard. The blocks kept falling down. Mia did not give up. She used the measure stick to find the biggest blocks and put them on the bottom. Then, she put the smaller blocks on top. At last, Mia built a strong tower with her blocks. She felt very happy and proud of her work.

One day, a little girl named Amy found a big, yummy lollipop. She was so happy. She wanted to show her friend Tom. She ran to his house and said, "Look, Tom! I found a big lollipop!"Tom looked at the lollipop and felt sad. He wanted a lollipop too. He said, "I want a lollipop. Where did you find it?" Amy pointed to the park. They both went to the park to find a lollipop for Tom.At the park, they saw a silly dog with a lollipop in its mouth. Tom and Amy tried to get the lollipop from the dog. The dog ran away, and they chased it. Finally, the dog dropped the lollipop, and Tom picked it up. "Hooray!" said Tom. "Now we both have lollipops!" They went home and enjoyed their yummy treats together.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the park with her mom. She saw a big package near a tree. Lucy was very alert and wanted to know what was inside the package.She asked her mom, "Mom, can we open the package?" Her mom said, "We should tell the park man, maybe it is not ours."Lucy and her mom went to the park man and told him about the package. The park man said, "Thank you for telling me. Let's open it together." They all went to the package and opened it.Inside the package, there were new toys for the park. The park man said, "These toys are for all the kids to play with. You can play with them too, Lucy." Lucy was happy and played with the new toys all day.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty flower. It was time for the flower to bloom. The flower was very happy to grow big and strong.One day, a little bug came to see the flower. The bug saw a trap near the flower. The trap was not good for the bug. The bug was scared of the trap.A reliable bird saw the bug and the trap. The bird wanted to help the bug. The bird picked up the bug and flew away from the trap. Now, the bug and the flower were safe and happy. They had a new friend, the reliable bird. They all played together every day.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big, round chair that he loved to sit on. One day, Tim saw a strange symbol on the wall. It was a big, red circle. He did not know what it was, but it made him feel frightened.Tim ran to his mom and said, "Mom, there is a big red circle on the wall, and it makes me scared." His mom looked at the symbol and smiled. "Oh, Tim, that's just a drawing your sister made. There is no need to be frightened."Tim felt better after talking to his mom. He went back to his big, round chair and sat down. He looked at the symbol again and thought, "Maybe it's not so scary after all." And from that day on, Tim was not frightened by the big red circle anymore.

One day, a little girl named Mia went for a walk. She saw a cactus in the sand. The cactus looked sad. Mia asked, "Why are you sad, cactus?"The cactus said, "I need water. I am so thirsty." Mia wanted to help the cactus. But she did not have any water. She felt sad too. Mia went to look for water. She found a small pond. She got some water in her hands. She went back to the cactus. She gave the water to the cactus. The cactus drank the water.The cactus was grateful. It smiled and said, "Thank you, Mia." Mia was happy. The cactus was not sad anymore. They were both happy now.

One day, a big bird named Bob wanted to carry a word to his friend, the little bird named Sue. The word was "hello". Bob felt a little uncomfortable because he had never carried a word before. He practiced by saying the word over and over again.As Bob flew to Sue, he saw a big tree. He thought it would be fun to sit on the tree for a while. But when he sat down, the tree started to shake! Bob was scared and flew away quickly. The shaking tree was actually a big green dinosaur named Dan. Dan was not mean, but he was very big and that made Bob uncomfortable.Dan the dinosaur saw Bob drop the word "hello" when he flew away. Dan picked up the word and carried it to Sue. When Sue saw Dan, she was not scared. She knew Dan was a nice dinosaur. Sue said "thank you" to Dan for bringing her the word. Bob saw that Sue and Dan were friends, and he felt happy. From that day on, Bob, Sue, and Dan were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to run and play outside. One day, he found a small, red rocket in his backyard. He picked it up and looked at it. It was very pretty.Tim showed the rocket to his friend, Max. Max said, "Wow! That's a fierce rocket! Let's play with it!" Tim and Max took the rocket to the park. They ran very fast, holding the rocket high in the air.At the park, they met a dog named Spot. Spot was a big, fierce dog, but he was also very nice. Spot liked the rocket too. Tim, Max, and Spot played with the rocket all day. They ran and had lots of fun. And they all became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted dog named Max. Max was very good at using a rope. He could serve his friends by helping them with the rope.One day, Max and his friends were playing with the rope. They were pulling and running, having lots of fun. Then, something unexpected happened. The rope broke into two pieces!Max and his friends were sad. But Max had an idea. He used his gifted skills to tie the rope back together. Max served his friends by fixing the rope. The twist was that now the rope was even stronger than before!Max and his friends played with the rope all day. They were very happy. Max was proud to serve his friends with his gifted skills. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to watch her screen all day. One day, her mom said, "Lily, let's go outside and play. It will excite you."Lily was not sure, but she went outside with her mom. They found a big, pretty tree. It had many original leaves with different shapes and colors. Lily and her mom played under the tree, and they laughed a lot.As they played, Lily forgot about her screen. She realized that playing outside was more fun than watching her screen all day. She learned that it is important to try new things and enjoy the world around her.

Tom and Mia are playing with their toys in the living room. Tom has a big truck and Mia has a doll. Tom likes to make loud noises with his truck and pretend to crash into things. Mia likes to dress up her doll and talk to her."Tom, stop being so rude!" Mia says. "You are making too much noise and you are hurting my doll!"Tom does not listen to Mia. He thinks his truck is more fun than her doll. He drives his truck closer to Mia and bumps into her doll. Mia's doll falls on the floor and her dress gets dirty."Tom, you are mean!" Mia cries. "You made my doll fall and you ruined her dress!"Tom laughs and picks up Mia's doll. He sees that the doll has a rubber band around her hair. He pulls the rubber band and snaps it on the doll's head. The doll's hair gets messy and Mia gets more upset."Tom, give me back my doll!" Mia shouts. "You are hurting her!"Tom runs away with the doll and heads to the door. He wants to hide the doll in his room and make Mia chase him. He thinks it is a funny game. He opens the door and runs outside. But he forgets to close the door behind him.Mia sees the door open and runs after Tom. She wants to get her doll back and tell him to say sorry. She catches up with Tom in the garden and grabs the doll from his hands. Tom tries to hold on to the doll, but Mia is stronger. She pulls the doll away and hugs her."Tom, you are a bad boy!" Mia says. "You need to say sorry to me and to my doll!"Tom does not want to say sorry. He thinks Mia is boring and he does not like her doll. He sticks out his tongue and makes a face at Mia. He turns around and runs back to the door. He wants

Once upon a time there were two friends called John and Lucy. They had a big garden with lots of flowers and trees. One day, they were playing hide and seek. Suddenly, they heard a loud trumpet sound! They were very alert and they knew they had to find out where it was coming from.John said, "Let's go and find out who is playing such a loud trumpet!" Lucy said, "OK!". So they followed the noise. When they arrived at a big hill, they found an old man playing a trumpet. The man said, "Hello children! Can you help me find my glasses?" John and Lucy said, "Yes!" But, they didn't see the glasses anywhere.The man said, "Let's look together!" So, John and Lucy looked for the glasses and eventually found them behind a nearby bush. The man was so happy to have his glasses back, he said, "Thank you children! I am so grateful. Here, please have this trumpet as a gift!"John and Lucy were overjoyed with their special gift and they kept it forever. The end!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Jane. She searched everywhere to find her favourite teddy bear.Jane's mum said: "Go and search for it, Jane. I'm sure you will find it soon."So Jane looked out of the window, around the chairs and under the sofa. She even looked outside the house but still found nothing.Suddenly, Jane saw a shoulder in the corner and ran over to check it out. She looked closer and could not believe her eyes - there was her teddy bear! Jane was so happy she ran over to hug it.But then, a little puppy appeared around the corner! Jane was angry that the puppy had taken her teddy bear and the puppy did not look very happy either.Jane stuck out her hand and said: "Give me back my teddy bear." But the puppy didn't want to let go and growled.But Jane was too determined to give up. She said: "Please give it back," and looked the puppy in the eyes with a determined smile.And the little puppy finally let go of the teddy bear and ran away.The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pink dress that she loved very much. One day, she went to the park with her mom. Lily's mom had a wallet with her to buy ice cream later.At the park, Lily played with her friends. They ran, jumped, and laughed. Lily's mom sat on a bench and watched them play. She put her wallet next to her. Lily saw her mom's wallet and thought, "I should keep it safe."Lily took the wallet and hid it in a secret place. She then went back to play with her friends. After a while, it was time to go home. Lily's mom looked for her wallet but could not find it. She asked Lily if she saw it. Lily said, "I hid it to keep it safe!"Lily's mom asked her to get the wallet. Lily tried to remember where she hid it, but she could not. She insisted that she could find it if she looked more. They looked and looked, and finally, they found the wallet under a bush.Lily and her mom were happy to find the wallet. They went to get ice cream, and Lily learned to always ask before taking something. From that day on, Lily never hid her mom's wallet again.

One day, a little fish named Fin was very hungry. He wanted to find some food to eat. He swam around the big blue sea, looking for something yummy. As he swam, he saw a big building in the water. Fin was curious and decided to swim closer.As he got near the building, he saw a little crab named Carl. Carl was also hungry. Fin said, "Hi, I'm Fin. I'm looking for food. Are you hungry too?" Carl said, "Yes, I am. Let's look for food together!" So, Fin and Carl swam around the building, searching for something to eat.As they swam, they found a hidden door in the building. They went inside and saw a big room full of food! They couldn't believe their eyes. Fin and Carl ate and ate until they were not hungry anymore. They were so happy they found the secret food room. From that day on, Fin and Carl were best friends and always swam together in the big blue sea.

One day, a big dog named Max went for a walk. He saw a wide pond with ducks. Max was very happy to see the ducks. He wanted to play with them.Max ran to the pond and shouted, "Hello, ducks! Let's play!" The ducks looked confused. They did not know what Max wanted to do. One duck said, "Why do you shout, Max? We are scared."Max felt sad. He did not want to scare the ducks. He said, "I am sorry, ducks. I just want to be friends." The ducks smiled and said, "Okay, Max. We can be friends, but please do not shout." Max and the ducks played together and had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a strong bear named Ben. Ben loved to nap under his favorite tree. He had a pattern of napping every day after eating his lunch.One day, while Ben was taking his nap, a little bird saw him. The bird thought, "I want to be friends with this strong bear." So, the bird sat on a branch above Ben and started to sing a pretty song.Ben woke up from his nap, surprised by the song. He looked up and saw the little bird. Ben smiled and said, "Thank you for your song, little bird. Let's be friends." The bird and Ben became best friends, and they learned that even the smallest act of kindness can make someone's day.

Once upon a time, there was a wise old dog named Spot. Spot lived in a small house with a big yard. Every day, Spot would run and play in the yard. He loved to chase birds and dig holes.One day, a little boy named Tim came to the yard. He saw Spot and said, "Hi, Spot! Can I play with you?" Spot was happy to have a friend and they played together all day. They ran and jumped and had lots of fun.As the day went on, it was time for Tim to go home. Spot didn't want Tim to leave, so he didn't close the gate to the yard. When Tim left, Spot went to sleep. In the night, a big mean dog came into the yard. The big dog saw the open gate and went in. The big dog chased Spot and hurt him. Spot was very sad and wished he had closed the gate.

Sara and Ben were twins who liked to play together. One day, they found a big bottle of milk in the fridge. They wanted to drink some, but they did not know how old it was."Let's try it," Ben said. He opened the bottle and smelled it. He made a face. "It smells funny.""Maybe it's good," Sara said. She wanted to encourage Ben. "Maybe it's a new kind of milk. Maybe it's sweet and yummy."Ben was not sure, but he liked to try new things. He poured some milk into a cup and took a sip. He spat it out right away. "Blech! It's sour! It's bad! It hurts my mouth!"Sara saw Ben's reaction and felt sorry for him. She did not want to drink the milk anymore. She gave him a hug and said, "I'm sorry, Ben. I was wrong. It's not a new kind of milk. It's old milk. It's spoiled. We should throw it away."They ran to the sink and poured the milk down the drain. They rinsed their cups and mouths with water. They decided to have some juice instead. They learned to check the date on the bottle before they drink milk. They also learned to trust their noses more than their ears.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a man with a big leather bag. The man said, "Hi! I provide tasty treats for kids. Would you like one?" Tim's mom said yes, and the man gave Tim a tasty cookie.Tim and his mom walked around the park. They saw a big tree with a hole in it. Tim put his hand in the hole and felt something soft. He pulled it out, and it was a small leather bag! It looked just like the big leather bag the man had.Tim opened the small leather bag and found more tasty cookies inside. He shared them with his mom and said, "Now I can provide tasty treats too!" Just then, a squirrel came out of the tree hole. The squirrel looked at Tim and said, "Thank you for finding my tasty treats!" Tim and his mom were surprised to hear the squirrel talk, but they were happy to share the cookies with their new friend.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Madison was playing in her garage. She saw a cookie on the ground and was so excited to eat it. "Yummy! I love cookies," she exclaimed.She took a bite and tried to chew it, but it was too hard. Madison wrinkled her nose and said, "This cookie is too hard." Suddenly, Madison heard a voice from behind her. It was her mom. "Madison, why don't you try putting the cookie in your mouth, taking a sip of your drink and then try to chew it again?" Madison followed her mom's advice. She put the cookie in her mouth, took a sip of water and then she was able to chew it more easily. Madison smiled brightly. "Yay! I can eat the cookie now!" And so Madison happily finished her delicious cookie.

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful school in a small town. In this school, many little kids came to learn new things. One day, a new girl named Lily joined the school. She was shy and scared to talk to the other kids.At playtime, a boy named Tom saw Lily sitting alone. He walked up to her and said, "Hi, I am Tom. Do you want to play with me?" Lily looked up and smiled. She said, "Yes, I would like that." They played together and had a lot of fun.As the days went by, Lily and Tom learned many things together in the beautiful school. They learned to share their toys and help each other. The other kids saw them and started to do the same. Everyone in the school became kind and helpful. The moral of the story is that when we are kind and help others, we can make the world a beautiful place.

Lila and Tom were playing in the park. They liked to look for things in the grass and the trees. They found some stones, some leaves, and some twigs. Lila picked up a twig and tried to whistle with it. She put it in her mouth and blew hard, but nothing happened."Look, Tom, I have a whistle!" she said.Tom looked at her and laughed. "That is not a whistle, Lila. That is a twig. You cannot whistle with a twig. You need a hole in it, like this." He showed her his whistle, which was a small plastic tube with a hole in the middle."Wow, can I try?" Lila asked."Sure, here you go." Tom gave her his whistle and took her twig. He blew on the twig, but nothing happened. He smiled and said, "See? It does not work."Lila put the whistle in her mouth and blew hard. She made a loud sound that scared some birds. She was very happy and said, "Look, Tom, I can whistle!"Tom clapped and said, "Good job, Lila! You are very smart. Can I have my whistle back?"Lila nodded and gave him his whistle. They took turns whistling and laughing. They did not see a hidden squirrel that was watching them from a tree. The squirrel was curious and wanted to try the whistle too. It waited until Lila and Tom were busy with something else, and then it jumped down and grabbed the whistle. It ran away with it, making a funny noise.Lila and Tom heard the noise and looked around. They saw the squirrel with the whistle in its mouth. They were surprised and said, "Hey, that is our whistle! Give it back, squirrel!"They chased the squirrel, but it was too fast and too clever. It climbed up another tree and hid the whistle in a hole. Lila

Lily and Ben were playing in the backyard. They found a big box with some tools inside. Lily picked up a hammer and wanted to hit the box."Look, Ben, I have a hammer!" she said.Ben saw the hammer and felt scared. He did not like loud noises or hard things. He urged Lily to put the hammer down."Please, Lily, no hammer. Hammer is bad. Hammer makes noise. Hammer hurts box. Put hammer back," he said.Lily did not listen to Ben. She liked the hammer. She thought it was fun to hit the box. She hit the box harder and harder. The box made a loud bang. Ben covered his ears and cried."Stop, Lily, stop! You are mean. You make me sad. You make box sad. Hammer is not fun. Hammer is mean," he said.Lily heard Ben cry and felt sorry. She did not want to make Ben or the box sad. She stopped hitting the box and put the hammer back. She hugged Ben and said sorry."I'm sorry, Ben. I did not know you did not like hammer. I did not know hammer was mean. I will be gentle. I will not hit box. I will play with you. Do you want to play with me?" she said.Ben nodded and smiled. He forgave Lily. He was glad she was gentle. He wanted to play with her. They looked for something else to play with in the box. They found a ball and a teddy bear. They played with the ball and the teddy bear. They had fun. They were happy.

One day, a thoughtful boy named Tim went to a party. At the party, there were many balloons. Tim really liked balloons. He saw a big, red balloon that he wanted to take home. But there was only one big, red balloon at the party.Tim's friend, Sue, also wanted the big, red balloon. They both looked at the balloon and didn't know what to do. Tim said, "I want the balloon." Sue said, "I want it too." They both felt sad and didn't want to fight.Tim thought for a moment and decided to share the balloon with Sue. He said, "Let's share the balloon. We can play with it together at the party and then take turns taking it home." Sue liked the idea and they both felt happy.So, Tim and Sue played with the big, red balloon at the party. They took turns holding it and made sure it didn't fly away. At the end of the party, Tim let Sue take the balloon home first. They were both happy and became even better friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was great at playing with hoops. She could play for hours and hours. Every day she would find a new hoop and release it, watching it as it spun around and around.One day, she found the biggest hoop she had ever seen. She was so happy and wanted to release it immediately. But it was too big for her to do by herself.Luckily she had some great friends who were there to help. Together they ran with the hoop, released it and watched it soar through the sky. They watched it until it had gone so far that it was out of sight.The little girl had had so much fun and she thanked her friends for helping her release the hoop. And that was the great adventure of the hoop. The end.

Once upon a time, in a village far away, lived a little bunny called Lucy. One day, Lucy wanted to travel and she hopped off into the wood. She hopped and hopped and saw many things, as she stopped to smell the flowers.But then, Lucy came across a wreck - a broken-down old car! Lucy hopped up to take a closer look and was amazed at how fast it was. She spoke out loud, "I wonder how it got here!".A wise owl heard her and said, "It's a lesson for you, Lucy. Things that go too fast end up slowing down or stopping completely. If you want to travel, you must go at a steady and safe speed".Lucy thanked the wise owl and hopped off, hopping at the steady and safe speed she should. Lucy's travels were more enjoyable now and she learned a valuable lesson. The moral of the story is that we must learn to take care of our things and not go too fast, so we don't wreck them!

One day, a loyal dog named Max saw a cop car. The cop car had a big hat on top. Max knew that the cop needed help. He ran to the cop car and the cop said, "Max, I need you to put this hat on the bad cat."Max went to find the bad cat. He saw the bad cat take a toy from a little kid. The kid was sad. Max knew he had to stop the bad cat. He barked and said, "Bad cat, you must give the toy back."The bad cat saw the hat and knew he was in trouble. He gave the toy back to the kid. The kid was happy. Max put the big hat on the bad cat. The cop came and took the bad cat away. Max was a hero and everyone cheered for him.

Once upon a time, there was a fast dog named Max. Max was very good at running. He liked to run all day. But Max had a chain. The chain was long and heavy. Max could not run far because of the chain.One day, Max saw a big tree. The tree had many leaves. Max wanted to play near the tree. He thought, "If I run fast, maybe the chain will break." Max ran very fast. But the chain did not break. Max was sad. He had to remain near his house.A few days later, Max saw a squirrel. The squirrel was on the big tree. Max wanted to catch the squirrel. He ran fast again. This time, the chain broke! Max was so happy. He could play near the big tree and catch the squirrel. Max learned that if he tried hard, he could break free and have fun.

Tom and Mia are playing in the garden. They have a big box and some toys. They pretend the box is a house and the toys are their friends. They have fun talking and laughing.Suddenly, they hear a loud ring. It is the doorbell. They wonder who it is. They run to the door and look through the window. They see a man with a big bag. He is wearing a red hat and a blue shirt."Who are you?" Tom asks."I am the mailman. I have a letter for you," the man says."A letter? For us?" Mia says."Yes, for you. It is from your grandma. She lives far away. She misses you and loves you. Do you want to see it?" the man says."Yes, yes, please!" Tom and Mia say.They open the door wide and take the letter. They thank the mailman and wave goodbye. They run back to the box and open the letter. It has a picture of their grandma and a big heart. It also has some words. They cannot read them, but they know they are nice.They hug the letter and smile. They are happy. They put the letter in the box and keep playing. They think of their grandma and send her a kiss. They hope she will visit them soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to collect small toy figures. He had a big box full of them. Every day, he would play with his figures and make up fun stories.One day, his mom said, "Tim, let's go to the park!" At the park, Tim saw a big tree. He decided to put his figures on the tree branches. As he played, a squirrel came by. The squirrel was very persistent. It wanted to play with the figures too! The squirrel said, "Can I play with you?"Tim was surprised that the squirrel could talk! He said, "Yes, you can play with me!" So, they played together with the figures in the tree. They had so much fun. But then, something unexpected happened. The squirrel took one of Tim's figures and ran away!Tim was sad, but he didn't give up. He chased the squirrel and said, "Please give my figure back!" The squirrel stopped and said, "I'm sorry, I just wanted a friend to play with." Tim smiled and said, "You can keep the figure if you promise to be my friend and play with me." The squirrel agreed, and they became best friends.

One day, a cat named Max went to the city. Max liked to sit and watch the birds. Max saw a big tree, so he went to sit under it. Max thought the city was fun and silly with all the noise and people.Max saw a big, red ball in the city. He wanted to play with it. Max jumped and tried to catch the ball. But, the ball was not a ball! It was a big, red balloon!The big, red balloon took Max up in the sky. Max was scared at first, but then he saw the city from up high. It was so pretty! Max liked the city even more now. The balloon took Max back down, and he was happy to be back on the ground. Max thought the city was full of surprises, and he couldn't wait to visit again.

Cindy was happy to go to the park that day. She had been feeling sad, but being outside made her feel much better.As she wandered, she noticed a squirrel walking along a path. It had a small piece of paper in its hands."What do you have there, squirrel?" Cindy asked.The squirrel stopped and looked at her. It then handed her the paper."This is a poem," said the squirrel. "It'll make you happy."Cindy looked at the poem and smiled. She could tell it was going to be special.But then as she read the poem, something strange happened. Everything felt like it was happening in slow motion. Cindy soon realized that the poem had a lesson for her. It was about how sometimes stupid things happen and how it's important to learn from them.The poem reminded Cindy that it was ok to make mistakes and to never give up. She smiled and thanked the squirrel for the special present. She left the park feeling much happier than when she had arrived.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely queen. She lived in a big, pretty castle. The queen had a shiny crown. She loved her crown very much.One day, the queen wanted to polish her crown. She asked her friend, the cat, "Will you help me polish my crown?" The cat said, "Yes, I will help you."So, the queen and the cat polished the crown together. They made it very shiny and bright. The queen was very happy. She said, "Thank you, cat!" And they lived happily ever after.

Henry was a little boy. One day, Henry saw a square in the sky. It was a big, gloomy square. Henry wanted to find out what it was, so he ran to it. When he got there, Henry saw a dark creature. It was very tall, with two wings. It was holding a beautiful box. It said it had to deliver the box to Henry. Henry was excited! But then suddenly the sky grew dark and the creature changed into a monster. It had sharp teeth and it growled. The monster snatched the box and flew away with it. Henry couldn't do anything. He was sad and scared. Henry never got the box, but he learned to never be too curious. He was careful never to go near gloomy squares again.

One day, a little girl named Lily went for a walk. She liked to skip and walk in zigzag lines. She was a slow walker, but she was happy.Lily saw a big dog. The dog wanted to play with Lily. But Lily did not want to play with the dog. She was scared. The dog chased Lily, and she had to run fast.Lily found a tall tree. She climbed the tree to get away from the dog. The dog could not climb the tree. Lily was safe. She waited in the tree until the dog went away. Then, she climbed down and went home.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty bunny. The bunny loved to jump all day long. It would jump in the grass, on the rocks, and even on the sand.One day, the pretty bunny saw a big pile of coal. The bunny thought it would be fun to jump on the coal too. So, the bunny went to the coal and started to jump on it.But, the coal was not soft like the grass or the sand. The pretty bunny hurt its foot when it jumped on the coal. The bunny cried and could not jump anymore. The pretty bunny was sad because it could not jump and play like before.

Sara and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys and their dog, Spot. One day, their mom gives them a camera. She says they can take pictures of anything they want."Wow, a camera!" Sara says. "Let's go outside and take pictures of the flowers and the birds.""Okay!" Ben says. "And we can take pictures of Spot, too. He is very funny."They run outside with the camera and Spot. They see many pretty things. They take turns to hold the camera and press the button. They hear a click sound when they take a picture."Look, a butterfly!" Sara says. She points to a yellow and black butterfly on a pink flower. She gives the camera to Ben. "You take a picture of it."Ben holds the camera and tries to aim at the butterfly. He presses the button. But the butterfly flies away."Oh no!" Ben says. "I missed it."Sara hugs him. "It's okay. Maybe we can find another butterfly. Or we can take a picture of something else."They look around and see Spot. He is chasing his own tail. He is spinning and spinning. He looks very silly."Let's take a picture of Spot!" Sara says. She takes the camera from Ben. She aims at Spot and presses the button. She hears a click sound.But Spot stops spinning. He looks at the camera. He blinks. He thinks the camera is a toy. He runs towards Sara and Ben. He jumps on them. He licks their faces."Spot, no!" Sara says. "You are making us wet.""Spot, stop!" Ben says. "You are messing up the camera."They laugh and push Spot away. They look at the camera. They see a picture of Spot on the screen. He is blinking and smiling."Wow, what a lucky picture!" Sara says. "Spot looks very cute.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a graceful girl named Lily. She loved to dance and play with her friends. One day, while she was dancing, she fell and hurt her leg. She cried and cried, feeling very sad.Her friend Tom came to her and said, "Don't worry, Lily. Your leg will heal soon." Lily tried to smile and said, "I hope so. I want to dance again with you and our friends."Days went by, and Lily's leg did not heal. She could not dance or play with her friends. She felt very sad and lonely. One day, a big storm came to the town. The wind blew and the rain fell hard.Lily's house was old and weak. The storm broke her house, and it fell down. Lily's leg was still hurt, so she could not run away. She cried for help, but her friends could not hear her over the loud storm.The storm went away, and the town was a mess. Lily's friends found her under the broken house. They were very sad. They wished they could have helped her. From that day on, they always remembered Lily and her graceful dance.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a little girl named Lucy. She loved to sail her toy boat on the pond near her house. One sunny day, Lucy decided to have a picnic by the pond.Lucy packed a basket with yummy food like apples, cheese, and sandwiches. She put her toy boat in the basket too. Lucy and her dog, Spot, walked to the pond for their picnic.When they got to the pond, they saw a big duck. The duck was selfish and wanted all the food for itself. The duck tried to take the food, but Lucy said, "No, we can share!" So, they all had a fun picnic together, and the duck learned not to be selfish anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a gloomy room with a big fireplace. In this room, there was a boy named Tom. Tom was sad because the room was very dark. One day, Tom had an idea to make the room bright and happy.Tom found a ball that could glow. He thought, "If I throw the ball into the fireplace, the room will be bright and not gloomy anymore." So, Tom threw the ball into the fireplace. The ball started to glow and made the room bright.But, something unexpected happened. The ball did not just make the room bright, it also changed colors! The room became a rainbow of colors. Tom was so happy and surprised. Now, the gloomy room was a fun and colorful place to play.

One day, a kind boy named Tim went to play at the park. He saw a big pitch where kids played ball games. Tim wanted to join them, so he ran to the pitch.As he got closer, he saw a little girl crying. Tim stopped and said, "Why are you sad?" The girl looked up and said, "I lost my ball." Tim wanted to help her, so he said, "Let's look for it together."They looked all around the pitch. They looked under the trees and behind the bushes. Then, they found the ball near the swings. The girl was happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!" They played together and had a fun day at the park.

One day, a little monkey named Tom found a new banana. He was very happy. He wanted to eat the banana, but he heard a whisper. The whisper said, "Don't eat the banana!"Tom looked around and saw a tiny ant. The ant said, "I am your friend. I whispered to you. That banana is not good for you. It is not a real banana."Tom was confused. He looked at the banana again. It looked like a real banana. But then, he touched the banana, and it was hard! It was not a real banana. It was a toy banana.Tom thanked the ant for helping him. They became good friends. Tom learned that sometimes, things are not what they seem. And he knew that he had a new friend who would always be there to help him.

Lily liked to help her mom in the kitchen. She liked to mix things in a big bowl. Mom said mixing was fun and good for making yummy food.One day, mom gave Lily a banana. She said, "Do you want to make banana bread with me?" Lily nodded and smiled. She loved banana bread. It was sweet and soft and warm.Mom peeled the banana and broke it into small pieces. She put them in the bowl with some flour and sugar and eggs and milk. She gave Lily a big spoon and said, "Now you can mix everything together. Mix, mix, mix!"Lily stirred the bowl with the spoon. She watched the banana and the other things become a smooth batter. She liked the sound of the spoon scraping the bowl. She liked the smell of the banana. She said, "Mix, mix, mix!"Mom smiled and said, "You are a great helper, Lily. You are very friendly and kind. I love you very much." She gave Lily a hug and a kiss. Then she poured the batter into a pan and put it in the oven. She said, "Soon we will have delicious banana bread to share. Do you want to help me set the table?"Lily nodded and smiled. She liked to help her mom in the kitchen. She liked to mix things in a big bowl. She liked to make banana bread with mom. She was happy.

Jane was shy and only three years old. She was exploring the park one day when she discovered something special. In the dirt near the slide, she saw a big copper penny. She could hardly believe it!Jane knew she had to lift the penny from the ground. It was too heavy for her to pick up, so she asked her mom for help. With a little effort, Jane's mom was able to lift the penny and put it in Jane's hand. It was hers!Jane held the penny tightly, with a huge smile on her face. She was very excited to have found such a special treasure. She continued exploring the park, with her shiny penny in her pocket.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a popular girl named Lily. She had a special blanket that she loved very much. She took it everywhere she went. One day, she lost her blanket at the park.Lily was very sad. She looked and looked but could not find her blanket. Her friend Tom saw her crying and asked, "Lily, why are you so sad?" She told him about her lost blanket. Tom wanted to help, so they both searched the park together.Then, they saw a little dog holding Lily's blanket in its mouth. They ran to the dog and Lily said, "Please give me my blanket back." The dog dropped the blanket and wagged its tail. Lily was so happy to have her blanket back. She hugged Tom and said, "Thank you for helping me find my blanket." From that day on, Lily and Tom were best friends and she always felt comfort with her blanket and her friend by her side.

Tom and Lily were hungry. They wanted to eat something delicious. They saw some potatoes in the kitchen. They asked their mom if they could cook them."Sure, you can cook the potatoes. But you need to be careful and follow my instructions. Do you want to make mashed potatoes?" Mom said."Yes, we love mashed potatoes!" Tom and Lily said."Okay, then you need to wash the potatoes, peel them, and cut them into small pieces. Then you need to put them in a big pot with some water and salt. I will help you turn on the stove and watch the pot. When the potatoes are soft, we will drain the water and mash them with a fork. Then we will add some butter and milk and mix them well. Do you understand?" Mom said."Yes, we understand. Thank you, Mom!" Tom and Lily said.They did what Mom told them. They washed, peeled, and cut the potatoes. They put them in the pot with water and salt. Mom turned on the stove and watched the pot. When the potatoes were soft, she drained the water and gave them a fork. They mashed the potatoes with the fork. They added some butter and milk and mixed them well."Wow, the mashed potatoes look so good and creamy!" Tom said."They smell so good and yummy!" Lily said.They put some mashed potatoes on their plates and tasted them."Mmm, they are so delicious!" Tom and Lily said."Good job, you made delicious mashed potatoes! I'm proud of you!" Mom said.They ate their mashed potatoes and enjoyed them. They were happy and full. They thanked Mom and helped her clean the kitchen. They hugged and kissed her."We love you, Mom!" Tom and Lily said."I love you too, my sweet potatoes!" Mom said.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a green mint on the floor. She picked it up and looked at it. "Yummy!" she said. She wanted to eat it, but she remembered her mom said not to eat things she found on the ground. Lily felt scared because she didn't want to get sick.Lily went to find her mom to ask if she could eat the mint. As she walked, she saw her friend Tim. "Hi, Tim!" Lily said. "Look what I found!" Tim looked at the mint and said, "Wow! Can I see it?" Lily gave him the mint, but as Tim took it, he slipped and fell down. The mint flew out of his hand and landed far away.Lily and Tim were both sad. They wanted to find the mint again. They looked and looked, but they could not find it. Tim said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I didn't mean to lose it." Lily said, "It's okay, Tim. We can find another one someday." They both smiled and went to play together. The mint was gone, but they were still happy because they had each other.

Once there was a white home with a big problem. At night, lots of animals would attach to the house and make noise. This made the family inside the home very sad.One day, the family decided to do something. They built a fence around the house to keep all the animals away. But the family was still not sure if that was enough.The next night, the family watched through the window, worried. As the animals tried to attach to the fence, the family saw something exciting. A big white cat appeared and scared away all the animals.The family and the cat became friends, and the animals never came back. The white cat became part of the family and made their home safe. The family was happy to have their white home back.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy. He was playing with his orange toy car, when suddenly his sister came over. She was carrying a bag, and it looked exciting.The little boy asked his sister, "What is in your bag?"The sister said, "It's a surprise!"The little boy was so excited that he quickly opened the bag. Inside was a big orange ball. He couldn't stop staring at it.Then his sister said, "This is a special ball. If you bite it, it will make your knee feel better!" The little boy didn't know what to do. He had hurt his knee and he wanted it to feel better. So, he decided to take a bite. After the first bite, he felt an amazing sensation. Suddenly, his knee stopped hurting and the orange ball tasted sweet! From that moment on, the little boy and his sister shared the special orange ball every time his knee hurt.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby cat named Tom. He loved to play with his ball and eat yummy food. One day, Tom saw a little bird in the tree.Tom stared at the bird. He wanted to play with it, but the bird was too high up. Tom tried to jump, but he could not reach the bird. He felt sad and sat down.Then, Tom had an idea. He said the word "please" to the bird. The little bird heard Tom and flew down to play with him. They played all day and became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a popular boy in his school. Every day, he would step into his classroom with a big smile on his face. He loved to learn and play with his friends.One day, Tim's teacher said, "Today, we will learn about animals." All the kids were very excited. Tim's friend, Lily, asked, "What is your favorite animal, Tim?" Tim thought for a moment and said, "I like dogs. They are fun to play with."At the end of the day, Tim stepped out of the classroom and saw a cute dog outside. He ran to the dog and played with it. Tim's friends came out and played with the dog too. They all had a great time. From that day on, Tim and his friends always played with the dog after school. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a penguin named Bob. He lived in a cold, cold place. Bob was sad because he wanted to play with the other animals but they were far away.One day, a man came to Bob and said, "I can take you to the other animals. But you have to pay me with fish." Bob thought the man was cheap, but he wanted to play with the other animals. So he gave the man all his fish.The man took Bob to the other animals. But when they got there, the other animals did not want to play with Bob. They said, "You are a penguin. You are too cold to play with us." Bob was very sad and cried. He wished he never gave the man his fish.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily found a big feather near the river. She was so happy. She wanted to sail on the water with the feather.Lily was very careful. She put the feather on the water and said, "Let's sail, feather!" The feather started to sail on the water. Lily walked next to the river, watching the feather go.A little duck saw Lily and the feather. The duck said, "Quack! Can I sail with the feather too?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, let's sail together!" So, the little duck and the big feather sailed on the water, and Lily and the duck became good friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a fragile box. The box had a picture of a film on it. Tim wanted to open the box and see what was inside. He asked his mom if he could open the box. His mom said, "Be careful, Tim. The box is fragile."Tim was very excited and tried to open the box very slowly. But, oh no! The box broke into pieces. Tim was sad because he broke the fragile box. He thought the film inside the box was gone too.But then, something unexpected happened. A big, colorful bird flew out of the broken box. The bird was not a film, but a real bird! Tim was so happy and surprised. He and the bird became good friends and played together every day. The fragile box was not what Tim thought, but it brought him a new friend.

One day, a girl named Sue went on a tour with her mom and dad. They were going to see many new things. Sue was very happy. She knew she would choose something special on this tour.In the first place, they saw big animals. Sue liked the big animals, but she did not choose one. She knew there was something else for her. Then, they went to a place with yummy food. Sue wanted to eat, but she did not choose the food. She knew there was something better.At the last place, Sue saw a small, cute dog. She knew this was what she wanted to choose. She had waited for this. Sue took the dog home with her. She was very happy. The tour helped Sue find her new best friend.

Once upon a time, there was a mommy and a baby. Mommy was tired from a long day of work, but she was determined to have a playtime with the baby. She reached for a box in the corner and opened it up. Inside was beautiful jewelry. "Look baby. Mommy found some jewelry. Wow, it's so sparkly and so bright," Mommy said. The baby smiled and gave a happy yell. "Yay!"Then the baby grabbed the jewelry and put it on. Mommy was so happy that the baby liked the jewelry so much. But soon the baby was tired, and he started to cry. Mommy knew it was time for bed, so she took the jewelry off the baby and said, "Time for bed now, it's getting late." The baby gave one last loud yell and then he was off to bed, ready for a good night's rest. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird who loved to soar high in the sky. The bird had a friend, a tiny ant. They both lived in a big tree near a dark forest. The bird and the ant liked to play together every day.One sunny day, the bird saw a big blueberry on a bush near the dark forest. The bird wanted to share the blueberry with the ant. So, the bird picked up the blueberry in its beak and flew back to the big tree.The bird and the ant shared the big blueberry and had a fun day. They played hide and seek, and they laughed a lot. At the end of the day, they watched the sun go down and felt happy to have each other as friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big tree. The tree had many different leaves. Some leaves were big, some were small. But they all lived together on the tree.One day, the wind came and started to separate the leaves. The leaves were in trouble. They did not want to leave the tree. They called to the wind, "Please stop! We want to stay together!"The wind heard the leaves and stopped. The leaves were happy. They knew they were different, but they loved being together. They learned that being different is not bad. It makes the tree beautiful.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. It was a hot day, and Tim wanted to play in the shade. He saw a big tree and ran to it. Under the tree, he found a modern toy car. It was red and shiny."Mom, look what I found!" Tim said, holding up the toy car. "Can I keep it?"His mom looked at the car and said, "Yes, you can keep it, but first, let's see if it belongs to someone else."Just then, a little girl named Lily came running over. She looked sad. "I lost my toy car," she said. "Have you seen it?"Tim wanted to keep the car, but he knew it was right to give it back to Lily. "Here it is," he said, handing the car to her."Thank you!" Lily said, and she smiled. Then, something unexpected happened. Lily asked, "Do you want to play with me and the car together?" Tim was so happy, and they played with the car under the shade of the big tree all afternoon.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy turtle named Slow. Slow was very slow, just like his name. Tim and Slow liked to play together in Tim's room.One day, Tim and Slow were playing near the big chair. The big chair was part of the furniture in Tim's room. Tim said, "Slow, be careful near the big chair!" But Slow did not listen. Slow went too close to the big chair and got hurt.Slow began to suffer because he was hurt. Tim saw that Slow was hurt and said, "Oh no, Slow! I told you to be careful." Tim picked up Slow and gave him a hug. Slow felt better after the hug.From that day on, Slow always listened to Tim and stayed away from the big chair. Tim and Slow continued to play together and have fun in Tim's room. And they both lived happily ever after.

Lily and Sam were best friends. They liked to play with dolls, cars and books. One day, they heard a loud noise outside. They ran to the window and saw a parade. There were people with drums, flags and costumes. There were also animals, like horses, dogs and elephants."Wow, look at the parade!" Lily said. "It is so pretty and fun!""I want to go and see it!" Sam said. "Can we go, please?"Lily and Sam asked their moms if they could go to the parade. Their moms said yes, but they had to be careful and stay together. They also had to come back soon, because it was almost lunch time."OK, we promise!" Lily and Sam said. They put on their coats and hats and ran outside. They held hands and followed the parade.They saw many things that made them happy and curious. They saw clowns, dancers, balloons and cars. They saw a fire truck, a police car and an ambulance. They waved and smiled at the people in the parade. They also saw some people who were sad and cold. They had no coats, hats or shoes. They had no food, toys or books."Who are they?" Lily asked."They are people who need help," Sam said. "They have no home, no family, no money.""That is very sad," Lily said. "Can we help them?"Sam thought for a moment. He remembered that he had a sandwich, a cookie and a juice box in his backpack. He also remembered that he had a compassionate heart."Yes, we can help them," Sam said. He opened his backpack and took out his lunch. He gave half of his sandwich, his cookie and his juice box to a man who looked hungry. He gave the other half of his sandwich, his hat and his scarf to a woman who looked cold. He ga

Sara was sick. She had a fever and a cough. She felt hot and wet. Her mom took her to the doctor. The doctor was nice. He gave her some medicine and a sticker."Take this medicine three times a day," the doctor said. "And drink lots of water. You will feel better soon."Sara and her mom went home. Sara lay on the couch. She drank some water. She took her medicine. She watched some cartoons. She felt a little better.The next day, Sara's mom had to go to work. She called a nurse to come and take care of Sara. The nurse was not nice. She was ignorant. She did not know how to make Sara feel better.She did not give Sara her medicine. She did not give Sara water. She did not let Sara watch cartoons. She made Sara eat dry toast. She said it was good for her cough.Sara did not like the dry toast. It hurt her throat. She wanted water. She wanted her mom. She wanted the nice doctor. She cried."Why are you crying?" the nurse asked. "Stop being a baby. You are not that sick. Eat your toast and be quiet."Sara felt angry. She felt sad. She felt sick. She threw the dry toast at the nurse. The nurse got mad. She yelled at Sara. She grabbed Sara's arm. She hurt Sara.Sara screamed. She screamed loud. She screamed for her mom. She screamed for the nice doctor. She screamed for help.Her mom heard her scream. She came back from work. She saw the nurse. She saw the dry toast. She saw Sara's arm. She saw Sara's tears.She fired the nurse. She hugged Sara. She gave Sara water. She gave Sara medicine. She gave Sara a kiss."I'm sorry, Sara," her mom said. "I did not know the nurse was ignorant. I will never leave you

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play with blocks. They have many blocks of different colors and shapes. They can make towers, houses, cars and animals with the blocks.One day, Tom and Mia are playing with blocks in the park. They are making a big tower with red, blue, yellow and green blocks. They are happy and proud of their tower."Look at our tower, Mia! It is so tall and pretty!" Tom says."Yes, Tom! It is the best tower ever! We are very good at making blocks!" Mia says.But then, a big wind comes. It blows hard and fast. It makes the tower fall down. The blocks scatter everywhere. Tom and Mia are sad and angry. They feel bad."Bad wind! Go away! You broke our tower!" Tom shouts."No, no, no! Our tower is gone! We worked so hard!" Mia cries.They look at the broken tower and the blocks. They see a pale block that they have never seen before. It is white and shiny. It looks different from the other blocks."What is this, Tom? It is a new block. It is pale and bright. Where did it come from?" Mia asks."I don't know, Mia. Maybe the wind brought it. Maybe it is a special block. Maybe it can make us feel better." Tom says.They pick up the pale block and hold it in their hands. It feels warm and soft. It makes a gentle sound like a bell. It makes them feel calm and happy. They smile and hug each other."Maybe this is a magic block, Mia. Maybe it is a gift from the wind. Maybe it is saying sorry for breaking our tower." Tom says."Maybe you are right, Tom. Maybe we can make a new tower with this block. Maybe it will be even better than the old one." Mia says.They start to gather the other block

Once upon a time, there was a pretty bird named Blue. Blue lived in a small cage in a little girl's room. Every day, Blue would look out the window and sigh. He wanted to fly free and escape his cage.One sunny day, the little girl left the cage open. Blue saw his chance to escape. He flew out the window and up into the sky. Blue was so happy to be free.Blue flew around and met new friends. He played with other pretty birds in the trees. At the end of the day, Blue decided to go back to the little girl. She was sad without him. Blue knew he could still have fun and be free, even if he lived in a cage.

One day, a girl named Sue went to play outside. She wore her favorite wide hat and pretty clothes. Sue saw a big box near her house. She was very curious.Sue went to examine the box. She called her friend, Tim. "Tim, come see this big box!" Tim came running to see. They opened the box together. Inside the box, they found more clothes and wide hats.The next day, Sue and Tim wore the new clothes and wide hats. They played outside all day. Their friends saw them and said, "Wow! You look great!" Sue and Tim smiled, happy that they found the big box.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a clever cat named Tom. Tom loved to play and jump around. One day, Tom found a tiny friend. It was a little inch bug named Tim.Tom and Tim liked to play together. They had lots of fun. Tom would recommend good games to play. They played hide and seek, and catch the ball. Tim was very happy to have a big friend like Tom.As days went by, Tom and Tim became very close friends. They always helped each other. Tom would find food for Tim, and Tim would help Tom when he was stuck. They were the best of friends and lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a brown dog named Max. Max liked to play with his toy car. One day, Max met a driver named Tom. Tom drove a big, red truck. Max wanted to ride in the truck with Tom."Can I ride with you?" Max asked Tom. Tom said, "Yes, but first you must set your toy car down." Max set his toy car down and jumped into the big, red truck. They drove and drove, having lots of fun.As they drove, Max saw his toy car on the side of the road. He asked Tom to stop the truck. Max picked up his toy car and said, "Thank you for the ride, Tom!" Max and Tom were now good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a modest little girl named Lily. She had a big dream to fly like a bird. Every day, she would look up at the sky and watch the birds fly.One day, Lily saw a little bird who couldn't fly. She went to the bird and asked, "Why can't you fly?" The bird said, "I am too small and scared." Lily wanted to help the bird, so she thought of a plan.Lily found a big leaf and put the bird on it. She held the leaf and started to run. The bird started to yell, "I can fly! I can fly!" Lily smiled as she watched the bird fly away. Now, Lily knew she could make her dream come true by helping others.

Once upon a time, there was a big crocodile that lived in a river. He was not nice to the other animals. He would take their food and play mean tricks on them. The other animals did not like the crocodile.One day, a wise old owl told the crocodile that he should behave and be fair to the other animals. The crocodile did not listen to the owl. He kept being mean to the other animals. The owl was sad because the crocodile did not listen.Then, one day, the crocodile got stuck in the mud. He asked the other animals for help. They did not want to help him because he was not nice to them. The crocodile was scared. He promised to be good and fair to the other animals if they helped him. The other animals decided to give him a chance. They worked together and got the crocodile out of the mud. From that day on, the crocodile behaved and was fair to the other animals. They all became friends and lived happily in the river. The moral of the story is to be nice and fair to others, so they will be nice and fair to you.

Once upon a time, there was a big structure in the middle of the town. It was very tall and strong. All the people in the town liked the structure, but one little boy named Tim did not. Tim would always say, "I hate the structure."One day, a kind and patient man came to Tim and asked, "Why do you hate the structure?" Tim thought for a moment and said, "I don't know, I just do." The patient man smiled and said, "Come with me, I want to show you something."The patient man took Tim to the top of the structure. Tim had never been up so high before. He looked down and saw the whole town. It was so beautiful. The patient man said, "The structure helps us see the beauty of our town. It's not so bad, is it?" Tim thought for a moment and then smiled. "You're right," he said. "I don't hate the structure anymore." From that day on, Tim loved the structure and learned that sometimes, things we think we hate can turn out to be good.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue liked to play outside. One day, she saw a clean trail in the woods. She thought it would be fun to try to walk on the trail.Sue put on her shoes and started to walk on the trail. She saw big trees, pretty flowers, and little bugs. Sue was happy. She tried to look at everything on the trail. She wanted to see it all.Sue walked and walked. Soon, she was tired. Sue turned around and walked back home. She had a fun day on the clean trail. Now, Sue knew she could try new things and have fun.

One day, a little boat went to a big port. The boat was scared. The port was unknown to the boat. The boat saw many big ships. The boat did not know what to do. The boat just gave a little shrug.In the port, the boat met a nice ship. The ship was big and strong. The ship said, "Do not be scared, little boat. I will help you." The little boat was happy. The ship showed the boat around the port.Then, something unexpected happened. The little boat found out it was a magic boat! The boat could help all the ships in the port. The little boat was not scared anymore. The boat and the ship became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big whale. The whale was very big and strong, but it had a fragile heart. It lived in the deep blue sea and liked to play with its friends, the fish.One day, the whale met a little fish. The little fish said, "Hi, whale! I want to go back to my home. Can you help me?" The whale wanted to help its new friend, so it said, "Yes, little fish. I can help you."The whale told the little fish to hold on tight. Then, the whale started to swim very fast. But it was going the wrong way! The little fish said, "Whale, you need to reverse!" The whale listened and swam the other way. Soon, they found the little fish's home.The little fish said, "Thank you, whale! You are a good friend." The whale was happy to help and now had a new friend. From that day on, the whale and the little fish played together in the deep blue sea.

Once upon a time, there was a little kitten named Fluffy. Fluffy liked to play with her ball of yarn. One day, Fluffy saw a big, heavy box in the room. She wanted to see what was inside, so she tried to pull the box.Fluffy pulled and pulled, but the box was too heavy. She felt sad and tired. Then, her friend, a small bird named Chirpy, flew in. Chirpy saw Fluffy trying to pull the heavy box and wanted to help. They both pulled the box together. With Chirpy's help, they were able to move the box.Inside the box, they found many fun toys to play with. Fluffy and Chirpy were very happy. They learned that when you work together with friends, you can do things that are hard to do alone. And that was the moral of the story: always help each other and work together.

Once there was a furry bear. He was walking around looking for food. He saw a big knee and thought it might have something inside. So he hopped onto the knee and started to cover it with his body. He was so excited to see what was underneath! But when he uncovered the knee, all he saw was a rock. He was disappointed but he was still happy because he had had an adventure. The furry bear went off to look for food elsewhere. He had so much fun uncovering the knee!

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a big cupboard. A little boy named Tim lived there with his mom and dad. Tim loved to play hide and seek with his friends. One day, Tim decided to hide in the cupboard.While Tim was hiding, he heard a loud roar. He felt frightened. The roar came from a big lion that had gotten into the house. The lion was hungry and looking for food.Tim wanted to run away, but he was too scared. The lion found him in the cupboard and roared again. Tim's mom and dad heard the roar and tried to save him. But the lion was too strong. The lion ate Tim, and everyone was very sad.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely little girl named Lily. She had a big pocket on her red dress. Lily loved to put things in her pocket. She put rocks, leaves, and even small toys in it.One day, Lily saw a small, scared cat. She wanted to help it. Lily said, "Don't be scared, little cat. I dare you to come to me." The cat looked at her and slowly walked to Lily. She picked it up and put it in her pocket.Lily took the cat home to her mom. "Look, Mom! I found this cat. Can we keep it?" Lily asked. Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, we can keep the lovely cat. You were very brave to dare the cat to come to you." Lily and the cat became best friends and lived happily ever after.

One day, a big dog named Max went to his friend's house. His friend was a little cat named Luna. Max wanted to play with Luna's new toy. But he had to ask before he could play with it. Max said, "Luna, can I borrow your new toy?"Luna thought for a moment. She said, "Okay, Max. You can borrow it, but you have to give it back to me. And be careful, it's not a strong toy yet."Max was very happy. He played with the toy all day. But then, he remembered what Luna said about the toy not being strong yet. Max knew he had to be careful, or the toy might break.Later, Max and Luna played together with the toy. They had a lot of fun. Max was careful, and the toy did not break. When it was time for Max to go home, he gave the toy back to Luna. They both smiled, knowing they had a great day playing together.

Tommy loved his scooter. He liked to ride it fast and make loud noises. He did not like to share it with anyone. One day, he saw his friend Lily at the park. Lily had a new scooter. It was shiny and pink and had a bell."Hi, Tommy!" Lily said. "Do you want to try my scooter? It is very fun!"Tommy did not say hi. He did not want to try Lily's scooter. He wanted to have it. He felt angry and greedy. He ran to Lily and pushed her. Lily fell down and cried. Tommy grabbed her scooter and rode away.Lily's mom saw what happened. She was very mad. She ran after Tommy and caught him. She took the scooter from him and gave it back to Lily. She scolded Tommy and told him to go home.Tommy did not listen. He tried to stand and get the scooter again. He did not see the big rock in front of him. He tripped and fell. He hit his head and his knee. He bled and cried. He had no scooter and no friend. He was very sad and sorry. It was a gloomy day.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Max. Max loved to stretch in the warm sun. One day, Max went to the beach to play near the water. The water would come in and go out. This was called the tide.While Max was playing, he saw a big, fierce dog. The dog barked very loud. Max was scared and ran away. The dog chased Max, but Max was fast.Max ran back to his family on the beach. They were happy to see him safe. The tide came in and the fierce dog went away. Max was brave and happy. From that day on, Max always stayed close to his family when he went to the beach.

Mama was in the kitchen when she heard a loud noise. She ran into the living room where she saw Sammy crying with a squash in his hands. Mama asked Sammy what had happened and Sammy said that the squash was supposed to be normal, but now it was all rotten. Mama carefully examined the squash and saw that it had rotted. Thinking quickly, Mama told Sammy that they could make squash soup out of the squash. Sammy's face lit up and he helped Mama make the soup. After a few hours, the soup was ready. Sammy took a sip and said that it was delicious. Daddy praised Sammy for turning a rotten squash into something as wonderful as soup. From then on, Sammy knew that it was always important to make the best out of a bad situation.

Once upon a time, in a big garden, there lived a selfish bird named Blue. Blue did not like to share his food with anyone. One sunny day, Blue found a tasty insect to eat. He was very happy and did not want to share it with his friends.As Blue was about to eat the insect, he saw that it was stuck in a spider's web. The insect was very scared and needed help. Blue thought about being selfish but then decided to rescue the insect. He used his strong beak to break the web and set the insect free.The insect was very thankful and became friends with Blue. They played together in the garden every day. Blue learned that sharing and helping others was more fun than being selfish. He became a kind and happy bird, loved by all his friends in the garden.

Once upon a time, there was a big fair event in a small town. Many kids and their moms and dads went to the fair to have fun. They saw a big wheel, a puppet show, and many games to play. Everyone was happy and excited.At the fair, there was a kind man who sold balloons. The man had red, blue, yellow, and green balloons. The kids loved the balloons and wanted to take one home. The man said, "You need to pay me one coin for a balloon."A little boy named Tim wanted a blue balloon but did not have a coin to pay. Tim was sad. His friend, Sara, saw him and wanted to help. Sara had two coins, so she decided to pay one coin for her balloon and one coin for Tim's balloon. Tim was very happy and thankful to Sara.The kids at the fair learned that it is good to help others when they need it. They also learned that it is important to pay for things at the event. Everyone had a great time at the fair and went home with big smiles on their faces.

Molly and her mommy were visiting the park. While walking, Molly spotted something green, prickly and small. Molly asked, "What is dat?"Her mommy replied, "That is a cactus. They have long spikes and small flowers." Molly was very curious and wanted to get closer. She asked, "Can I have dat one, please?"Her mommy smiled and said, "Yes, you can have it. You can take it home and take care of it. Make sure you give it lots of sunlight and water." Molly was so excited! She carefully picked up the cactus, and smelled it. It had a sweet smell.
