Lily said. "Hello, dog. What is your name?"The dog barked. It wagged its tail. It licked Lily's face. She giggled."Hi, dog. You are friendly. Do you want to play with us?" Sam said.The dog nodded. It sniffed their cake. It looked tasty. It took a bite."Hey, that's our cake!" Lily said. "You can't eat that. It's not real. It's made of leaves."The dog spit out the leaves. It made a funny face. It did not like the taste. It looked sorry."It's okay, dog. We forgive you. You didn't know." Sam said. "But you can't have our cake. You can have this stick instead. Do you like sticks?"The dog barked. It liked sticks. It took the stick from Sam. It ran away. It came back. It dropped the stick. It wanted Sam to throw it."Okay, dog. Let's play fetch. Ready?" Sam said.He threw the stick. The dog ran after it. It caught it. It brought it back. They played fetch for a long time.Lily and Sam had fun with the dog. They were happy. They made a new friend. They forgot about their cake. They did not mind. They had something better. They had a d

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a shiny crown that she loved to wear. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends.At the park, Lily saw a boy named Tim. Tim was weak and could not balance well. He tried to climb on the seesaw but kept falling. Lily went to help him. She said, "Don't worry, Tim. I will help you balance."Lily held Tim's hand and helped him climb on the seesaw. They played together and had lots of fun. Tim was happy and thanked Lily for helping him. Now, they both wore their crowns and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a clever bird named Billy. Billy had many pretty feathers. He lived in a small cage in a big house. Billy did not like the cage. He wanted to fly and be free.One day, Billy saw the cage door open. He thought, "This is my chance to escape!" So, he flew out of the cage and into the big house. Billy was very happy to be out of the cage.As Billy flew around the house, he saw a cat named Tom. Tom saw Billy and wanted to catch him. Tom said, "I will get you, Billy!" But Billy was too clever for Tom. He flew high and fast, and Tom could not catch him. Billy found an open window and flew away. He was free at last!

Once upon a time, in a big garden, there was a tiny flower. The flower was slow to bloom. All the other flowers around it had big, pretty petals. The tiny flower felt sad.One day, a small cat with soft fur came to the garden. The cat saw the tiny flower and sat down next to it. The cat liked the tiny flower because it was small like her. They became good friends.As the days went by, the tiny flower started to bloom. It grew bigger and prettier, just like the other flowers. The cat with soft fur was very happy. They played together in the garden every day. And they were the best of friends.

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play with cars. Tom has a big red car. Mia has a small blue car. They drive their cars on the floor and make noises."Vroom, vroom, I am fast!" Tom says."Beep, beep, I am smart!" Mia says.They have fun with their cars.But then, Sam comes. Sam is older. He has a new yellow car. His car can move by itself. He puts his car on the floor and pushes a button. The car starts to drive around the room. It makes loud noises and lights."Wow, look at my car! It has motion!" Sam says.Tom and Mia stop playing. They look at Sam's car. They feel jealous. They want a car like that."Your car is not fair!" Tom says."Your car is too noisy!" Mia says.They are angry at Sam. They do not want to play with him.Sam does not care. He likes his car. He drives his car near Tom and Mia. He laughs at them."Ha, ha, my car is better than yours!" Sam says.Tom and Mia are very sad. They do not like Sam. They do not like his car. They wish they had a car with motion.

One day, a boy named Tim found a heavy, magic rock. The rock could make things shrink. Tim wanted to try it out. He went to the kitchen and saw the dishwasher. He thought it would be fun to shrink it.Tim said, "Rock, please make the dishwasher small!" The rock started to glow, and the dishwasher began to shrink. It became smaller and smaller. Tim was very happy and laughed.But then, something unexpected happened! The dishwasher started to grow again. It grew bigger and bigger. Tim was scared. He said, "Rock, please stop!" The rock stopped glowing, and the dishwasher stopped growing. Tim learned to be careful with magic.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to play with her colorful blocks. One day, she wanted to make a tall stack with her blocks. So, she started to try.Amy put one block on top of another, but the stack was not very tall yet. She saw her cat, Mittens, who was very flexible. Mittens could bend and twist in funny ways. Amy said, "Mittens, can you help me make my stack taller?"Mittens meowed and came over to help. With Mittens' flexible paws, they tried together to stack the blocks higher and higher. Finally, they made a very tall stack! Amy and Mittens were so happy. They had fun trying new things and playing together.

Lily was a shy girl who liked to play with her dolls and dress up in her mom's clothes. She had a pretty veil that she found in a box in the attic. It was white and soft and had flowers on it. She liked to wear it and pretend she was a princess or a bride.One day, her mom told her they were going to visit her aunt and uncle and their new baby. Lily was excited to see the baby, but she was also nervous to meet new people. She decided to wear her veil to feel more confident and pretty. She put it on and looked at herself in the mirror. She smiled and said, "I am a princess today."Her mom saw her and said, "You look lovely, Lily, but you have to be careful with the veil. It is very old and delicate. It belonged to your great-grandma. She wore it on her wedding day. It is a special thing that we have to keep safe. Do you understand?"Lily nodded and said, "Yes, mom. I will behave and take good care of the veil. I promise."They got in the car and drove to her aunt and uncle's house. Lily held the veil gently in her lap and looked out the window. She saw trees and flowers and birds. She felt happy and curious.When they arrived, her aunt and uncle greeted them warmly and invited them in. They showed them the baby, who was sleeping in a crib. He was small and cute and had a lot of hair. Lily wanted to touch him, but she was afraid to wake him up. She stayed close to her mom and said hello in a quiet voice.Her aunt and uncle had a big dog, who was friendly and playful. He saw Lily and ran to her, wagging his tail and barking. He wanted to say hello and play with her. He jumped on her and licked her

One day, a clever cat named Tom saw a post. The post was big and tall. Tom wanted to climb the post to see what was on top.Tom started to climb the post. He went up, up, up. When he got to the top, he saw a big toy car. The toy car could zoom very fast. Tom wanted to play with the toy car.Tom got in the toy car and it started to zoom! But something unexpected happened. The toy car could fly too! Tom and the toy car zoomed in the sky, high above the post. Tom was so happy and had lots of fun in his new flying zoom car.

Lily and Ben were best friends. They liked to play in the park. They liked to spin on the swings and slide down the slide. They liked to make wishes on the dandelions.One day, Lily and Ben went to the park. But they saw a big sign. The sign said: "Park closed. No playing." Lily and Ben were sad. They wanted to play in the park."Why is the park closed?" Lily asked."I don't know," Ben said. "Maybe they are fixing something.""Maybe they are making it better," Lily said."Maybe," Ben said. "But I wish we could play now."Lily saw a dandelion on the grass. She picked it up and blew on it. She made a wish. She wished the park would open soon."Look, Ben," she said. "A dandelion. You can make a wish too."Ben picked up a dandelion and blew on it. He made a wish. He wished the park would open soon.They held hands and walked to the fence. They looked at the park. They hoped their wishes would come true.Then they heard a voice. It was the park keeper. He was smiling."Hello, kids," he said. "I have good news. The park is open again. You can play now."Lily and Ben were happy. They thanked the park keeper. They ran to the swings and the slide. They spun and slid and laughed. They were glad their wishes came true.

One day, a polite girl named Lily went on a safari with her mom and dad. They saw many big animals like elephants, lions, and giraffes. Lily was very happy to see them.As they walked, Lily saw a baby monkey. She said, "Hi, monkey! My name is Lily. What's your name?" The baby monkey replied, "Hi, Lily! I'm Max." Lily and Max became good friends.While playing with Max, Lily stumbled on a rock. She fell down, but Max helped her up. They both laughed and continued to play. The safari was fun, and Lily had a great day with her new friend, Max.

Once upon a time, there was a cat named Tom. Tom liked to balance on things. One day, he saw a big stick. The stick was broken. Tom wanted to balance on the broken stick.Tom tried to balance on the broken stick, but it was hard. He fell down, but he did not give up. Tom tried again and again. Soon, he could balance on the broken stick very well.One day, Tom saw a bird in a jail. The bird was sad. Tom wanted to help the bird. He used the broken stick to open the jail. The bird was free and happy. Tom and the bird became good friends. They played together every day.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. They saw the big surf and the water was very mysterious. Tim wanted to play in the water, but his mom said, "Be careful, Tim. The water is very mysterious today."Tim played in the sand and built a big sand castle. He saw a small stick and used it to stir the wet sand. He made a moat around his castle. As he stirred the sand, he found a shiny key. Tim showed the key to his mom and said, "Look, Mom! I found a key in the sand!"His mom smiled and said, "That's very interesting, Tim. Maybe it will open something special." They walked along the beach and found a small treasure chest. Tim used the key to open the chest, and inside, they found beautiful shells and shiny stones. Tim and his mom were very happy. They knew that the mysterious surf had brought them a special gift.

One day, a little girl named Lily was in her room. She saw her dad load a big bookcase. The bookcase was fragile, so her dad was very careful. Lily wanted to help her dad. She said, "Dad, can I help you?"Her dad smiled and said, "Yes, Lily. But you have to be very gentle with this bookcase. It's fragile."Lily was very happy to help. She picked up a small book and put it on the bookcase. Suddenly, the bookcase started to shake! Lily and her dad were surprised. They didn't know what was happening.A tiny mouse came out from behind the bookcase. It was the mouse that made the bookcase shake! Lily and her dad laughed. The mouse was very fast and ran away. They finished loading the bookcase and Lily learned to be careful with fragile things.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a pair of pants that he loved very much. They were his favorite pants. But one day, Tim's pants got dirty and spoiled. He was very sad.Tim's mom saw him crying and asked, "Why are you sad, Tim?" Tim said, "My pants are spoiled, and I don't want to wear any other pants." His mom hugged him and said, "Don't worry, Tim. We can clean your pants and make them as good as new."That night, Tim went to bed and prayed, "Please help my mom clean my pants so I can wear them again." The next day, Tim woke up and saw his pants were clean and not spoiled anymore. He was so happy!Tim put on his clean pants and ran to his mom. He said, "Thank you, Mom, for cleaning my pants!" His mom smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tim. I'm glad you're happy." And from that day on, Tim learned to take better care of his pants, and he never had spoiled pants again.

Lily and Ben were playing in the woods. They liked to find sticks and stones and make things with them. They saw a big hole in the ground. They wanted to see what was inside.They went closer to the hole and looked in. They saw something white and hard. It looked like a head, but it had no eyes or nose or hair. It was a skull. Lily and Ben were scared."Who is that?" Lily asked."I don't know. Maybe it was a bad person who did bad things and no one liked him. Maybe he died alone and no one buried him. Maybe he rotted in the hole." Ben said."That is sad. We should be good people and do good things and make friends. We don't want to end up like him." Lily said."Yes, you are right. We should be kind and helpful and happy. We don't want to rot in a hole." Ben said.They left the skull in the hole and ran back to their home. They hugged their mom and dad and told them they loved them. They were good children and they were not afraid of skulls.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to talk to his friends. One day, Tim saw a big rock. The rock was not soft; it was harsh. Tim thought the rock was from the earth.Tim tried to talk to the rock. "Hello, rock from the earth!" he said. But the rock did not talk back. Tim felt sad. He wanted the rock to be his friend.Tim did not give up. He talked to the rock every day. One day, the rock talked back! "Hello, Tim!" said the rock. Tim was so happy. He and the rock became good friends. They talked and played every day.

Once upon a time, in a little town, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toys and make new friends. One day, she found a small copper coin on the ground. Lily was very happy and wanted to buy a toy with the coin.Lily went to the toy store with her mom. She saw a little toy car that she liked. "Please, can I have the toy car?" asked Lily. Her mom said, "Yes, you can use your copper coin to buy the car."Lily gave the copper coin to the store man and got her little toy car. She played with the car all day and showed it to her friends. They all loved the car and played together. Lily was very happy and always said "please" when she asked for something. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a new toy car that she loved very much. One day, she was playing with her car in her room. She pushed the car too hard and it went into the closet. Amy went to her big sister, Sarah, and said, "Help, my car is in the closet!" Sarah went to the closet and got the car out for her. But, the car was broken. Amy was sad and started to cry.Sarah looked at Amy and said, "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to break your car. Will you forgive me?" Amy looked at her sister and said, "Yes, I forgive you." They hugged each other and went to their mom to ask for a new toy car.

Tom and Lily went to the park with Mom. They saw a pond with many ducks and geese. Tom and Lily liked to feed them bread. Mom gave them some bread and said, "Be careful, some geese are mean. They can bite you."Tom and Lily threw some bread to the ducks and geese. The ducks were nice. They quacked and ate the bread. The geese were not nice. They hissed and chased Tom and Lily. One goose was very tall and had a big beak. He wanted all the bread.The tall goose ran after Tom. Tom was scared. He ran away and dropped his bread. The tall goose ate the bread and looked for more. He saw Lily. Lily had some bread in her hand. The tall goose ran after Lily.Lily was brave. She did not run away. She did not drop her bread. She said, "No, goose! This is my bread. You are mean. Go away!" She resisted the tall goose. She held her bread high and waved her other hand. She made a loud noise.The tall goose was surprised. He stopped and looked at Lily. He did not like her noise. He did not like her hand. He did not like her bread. He turned around and ran away. He looked for another child with bread.Tom and Lily were happy. They hugged each other and laughed. They fed the nice ducks and ignored the mean geese. Mom was proud of them. She said, "Well done, Tom and Lily. You are very brave and smart. I love you."

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the kitchen to get a drink of water. He saw the faucet and wanted to try to use it by himself. He was a big boy now and thought he could do it.Tim reached up and tried to turn the faucet, but the water sprayed everywhere! He was embarrassed because he made a big mess. His mom came in and saw the water all over the floor.Mom helped Tim clean up the water and showed him how to use the faucet the right way. Tim tried again and this time, the water went into the cup. He was very happy and proud that he learned how to use the faucet.

Once upon a time, there was a tall girl named Maddy. She loved to play outside and explore. One day, she saw a zipper and she was so excited that she ran up to it and tried to open it.Suddenly, Maddy heard a voice. It was her mom. "What are you doing, sweetheart?" her mom said.Maddy replied, "I was trying to open the zipper, mommy!"Her mom smiled and gave her a big kiss. Then she said, "That zipper is too hard for you to open. I'll help you."Maddy and her mom opened the zipper together and found lots of fun things inside. Maddy was so happy that she gave her mom a big kiss and thanked her.Special times like this make Maddy even more excited to be a tall girl!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, she went to the park with her mommy. She saw a big sandbox and wanted to play in the sand.Lily started to dig in the sand with her small shovel. Her mommy said, "What are you doing, Lily?" Lily said, "I want to discover something!" She dug and dug, and then she found a shiny rock. She was so happy and felt successful.Lily showed her mommy the shiny rock. Her mommy said, "Wow, that's a beautiful rock!" Lily smiled and said, "I discovered it in the sand!" They both laughed and played in the sand together. It was a fun day at the park.

Once upon a time there was a little boy. He had a silly idea one day and he wanted to explore the attic. He went to his mommy and asked, "Mommy, can I go to the attic please?" Mommy said yes and the little boy was so excited. He ran to the attic and he looked around. It was dark and dusty. He saw a bunch of silly things like old toys and boxes. He kept exploring until he couldn't explore anymore.After a while, the little boy got tired and he walked back downstairs. He was so happy with his adventure. He asked his mommy if he could please go to the attic again tomorrow and she said yes.The little boy smiled and he went to bed dreaming of all the silly things he would find in the attic the next day.

Once upon a time, there was a little plane. The plane had tight wings that could flap fast. It liked to fly up high in the sky.One day, the plane saw something glow. It was a big, shiny star. The plane wanted to see the star up close. So, it flew higher and higher. But the star was too far away.Then, the unexpected happened. The star began to glow even more! It grew bigger and bigger. The star was not a star at all. It was a big, friendly bird! The bird flew down and played with the plane. They had so much fun flying together in the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a small fish named Fifi. Fifi lived in a big tank with many other fish. One day, Fifi was upset because she lost her favorite toy.Fifi asked her friend, Bubbles, "Have you seen my toy?" Bubbles replied, "No, but let's look for it together." They swam all around the tank, looking behind rocks and plants.Finally, they found the toy near a big shell. Fifi was so happy! She said, "Thank you, Bubbles!" Bubbles replied, "You're welcome, Fifi!" From that day on, they were the best of friends and always helped each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Ann. She loved to play and be silly with her friends. One day, she found a secret box in her room. She was very excited and wanted to know what was inside.Ann showed the secret box to her friends. They tried to open it, but it was locked. Ann had an idea. She said, "Let's work together to find the key!" So, they searched high and low, looking for the key to the secret box.After a long day of working together, they found the key under a big rock. They were so happy! They opened the secret box and found silly hats inside. Ann and her friends laughed and played, wearing their silly hats all day long. And they learned that working together can be fun and rewarding.

A 3-year-old girl was getting ready to go trick-or-treating when her mom said to her, "Don't forget your costume!" The little girl ran to the closet, excited to find her costume. She was wearing a cute little princess dress. As she was about to go, her mom reminded her of the rules: "No eating the candy until we get home!"The little girl was very anxious, as she wanted to eat her candy sooner. She ran out the door and started trick-or-treating. Everywhere she went people gave her lots of candy, which made her even more anxious. Finally, she couldn't take the temptation anymore and grabbed a piece of candy from her bag. She quickly brought it to her mouth and started to eat it. Just then, her mom called from around the corner. "What are you doing? No eating the candy until we get home!" The little girl was so sad. She realized that she had disobeyed her mom and now she wouldn't get to go trick-or-treating anymore. She sadly put the piece of candy back in the bag and went home. The little girl learned her lesson the hard way and was very disappointed that she didn't get to enjoy any of the candy she worked so hard to get.

Lily and Ben were twins who liked to play in the garden. They enjoyed making up stories and pretending to be different animals. One day, they found a pale blue stone under a big tree. It was shiny and smooth, and they wondered what it was."Maybe it is magic," Lily said. "Maybe it can do things for us.""Like what?" Ben asked."Like make us fly, or turn us invisible, or give us candy," Lily said. She held the stone in her hand and closed her eyes. "I wish for candy," she said.Nothing happened. Ben laughed. "That is not magic, silly. It is just a stone. You can't get candy from a stone."Lily felt sad. She wanted the stone to be magic. She wanted to have fun with it. She did not like Ben laughing at her. She ran away with the stone, leaving Ben behind.Ben felt sorry. He did not mean to hurt Lily's feelings. He wanted to play with her and the stone. He followed her to the other side of the garden, where she was sitting on a bench. He sat next to her and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I was just joking. Can we share the stone and play together?"Lily looked at him. She saw that he was sorry. She smiled and said, "Okay, Ben. We can share the stone and play together. But we have to use our imagination. That is the real magic."Ben nodded. He took the stone and said, "I wish for a dragon." He pretended to see a big, green dragon in the sky. He made roaring noises and waved his arms. Lily joined him. She said, "I wish for a princess." She pretended to wear a beautiful dress and a crown. She made singing noises and danced around. They both laughed and had fun. They enjoyed using their imagination and the pale

Once upon a time, there was a smart cat named Sam. He lived in a big house with many stairs. Sam liked to help his family keep the house clean. One day, while Sam was cleaning the stairs, he heard a voice."Hello, Sam!" said the voice. Sam looked around and saw a talking bird. "I'm Bob, and I want to help you clean the stairs," said the bird. Sam was surprised, but he was happy to have help.As Sam and Bob cleaned the stairs together, they found a secret door. They opened the door and saw a big room filled with toys. Sam and Bob were very happy and played with the toys all day. The family was so surprised to find the secret room, and they all had fun playing together.

One day, a boy named Tim was playing in his garage. It was a boring day, and he could not find anything fun to do. He looked around and saw a big box. Tim opened the box and found a toy robot inside."Hello, I am Robo," said the robot. "Will you accept me as your friend?" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, Robo! Let's play together!"As they played, Robo started to do something unexpected. He began to dance and sing! Tim laughed and danced along with his new friend. The boring day turned into a fun one, all thanks to Robo the robot.

Once there was a little girl who wanted to go sliding. She carefully looked around and spotted a big pipe on the hill. The pipe was very nice, and the little girl thought it would be perfect to slide down.The little girl grabbed her toboggan, and put it at the top of the pipe. She hopped on the toboggan and started to slide. It felt so nice! She went faster and faster until she reached the bottom.At the bottom of the pipe, she stopped her toboggan and jumped off it. She smiled and waved goodbye to the nice pipe. Then she ran off to find her friends, so she could tell them all about her fun sliding adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to wear her velvet dress. It was red and soft. One day, she went for a walk in the park. The sun was high in the sky, and it was a bright day.As Sue walked, she met a big dog. The dog was friendly and wagged its tail. Sue and the dog played together. They ran and jumped in the park. The dog liked Sue's velvet dress too.After playing, Sue and the dog said goodbye. Sue went home with a big smile on her face. She was happy she met a new friend. She couldn't wait to wear her velvet dress and play with the dog again.

One day, a little ball went for a bounce. It loved to bounce high and low. As it bounced, it saw a screw on the ground. The ball wanted to play with the screw.The screw did not want to play. It was afraid of getting hurt. The ball said, "Don't worry, I will keep you safe. Let's bounce together." The screw thought for a moment and then agreed to play with the ball.As they bounced, the ball kept the screw safe. They had so much fun together. The screw was happy it had a new friend. The ball and the screw played all day long, and they were both very happy.

One day, a big tree and a little tree stood next to each other. The big tree had lots of leaves, so it made a lot of shade. The little tree had few leaves, so it made a little shade. The little tree was jealous of the big tree.One hot day, a girl came to play under the trees. She liked to clap her hands and dance. First, she went to the big tree. But the big tree's shade was too dark, and she could not see her hands to clap. So, she went to the little tree.Under the little tree, the girl could see her hands and clap. She danced and laughed. The big tree was sad and felt jealous of the little tree. The big tree learned that sometimes being little can be good too. The trees became friends, and the girl played under both trees every day.

Once upon a time, there was a dependable girl named Lily. She loved to walk on the road near her house. One day, while she was walking, she saw a little frog on the side of the road. The frog looked sad and lost.Lily remembered a story her mom told her about a frog turning into a prince after a girl gave it a kiss. So, she picked up the frog and gave it a big kiss. She hoped the frog would turn into a prince.But something unexpected happened! Instead of the frog turning into a prince, Lily turned into a frog too! Now, they were both frogs on the road. They became best friends and hopped happily ever after.

Tom and Sam are brothers. They like to play in the woods. They pretend to be hunters and look for animals. They have sticks for guns and hats for helmets.One day, they see a big deer in the grass. It has brown fur and long horns. Tom and Sam are very excited. They want to catch the deer. They kneel behind a tree and whisper to each other."Shh, be quiet. We have to sneak up on it," Tom says."OK, I will follow you. You are the leader," Sam says.They crawl on the ground and get closer to the deer. They raise their sticks and aim at the deer. They count to three and shout "Bang!"The deer hears them and runs away. Tom and Sam chase after it, but it is too fast. They lose sight of it in the bushes."Aw, we missed it," Tom says."Maybe next time we will get it," Sam says.They are not sad. They had fun playing hunters. They go back to their tree and have a snack. They share a sandwich and a juice box. They talk about their adventure and laugh. They love each other and the woods. They are happy.

Tom and Lily were twins who liked to explore. One day, they found a big jungle near their house. They wanted to see the animals and plants there. They asked their mom if they could go."Be careful, my loves," their mom said. "The jungle can be dangerous. Don't go too far and don't touch anything you don't know."Tom and Lily nodded and ran to the jungle. They saw many green trees and colorful flowers. They heard many loud noises and strange sounds. They were curious and excited.They saw a big brown monkey hanging from a branch. It had a long tail and a funny face. Tom wanted to play with it. He threw a stick at it and said, "Hey, monkey, come here!"The monkey was angry. It swung down and grabbed Tom's arm. It poked him with its sharp claws and teeth. It made a loud screech and ran away."Ow, ow, ow!" Tom cried. He had blood on his arm. He was scared and hurt.Lily ran to him and hugged him. She said, "Tom, you were naughty. You should not throw things at animals. They don't like it. They can hurt you."Tom was sorry. He said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I was silly. I wanted to have fun. I didn't mean to make the monkey mad."Lily said, "It's okay, Tom. I forgive you. But we should go back home now. Mom will help you. She is wise. She knows how to make you feel better."Tom and Lily held hands and walked back to their mom. They learned a lesson. They decided to be more careful and kind in the jungle. They still liked to explore, but they also respected the animals and plants there. They knew they were their friends, not their toys.

Once upon a time, there was a blue notebook. The blue notebook had a friend named Blink. Blink was a little light that would turn on and off very fast.One day, the blue notebook and Blink went to the park. They played on the swings, and they had so much fun. They were very happy together.As the sun went down, Blink started to blink faster and faster. The blue notebook watched and laughed. They played until it was time to go home. The blue notebook and Blink were the best of friends, and they had a great day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a huge lion named Leo. Leo was always hungry and loved to eat. One day, he found a big, shiny fork in the forest. He thought, "I can use this fork to eat my food."Leo met a little mouse named Mimi. Mimi saw the fork and asked, "What are you going to do with that fork, Leo?" Leo said, "I will use it to eat my food, Mimi." Mimi was scared, but she had an idea.Mimi said, "Leo, can I show you something? I know a place with lots of yummy food." Leo liked the sound of that. Mimi took Leo to a big tree with lots of fruits. Leo used the fork to eat the fruits. He found out that sharing food with friends was more fun than eating alone.From that day on, Leo and Mimi always ate together. They learned that sharing is caring and made them both happy. And the huge fork helped them enjoy their food even more.

Once upon a time, there was a furry cat. The cat liked to play with a ball. The cat was very happy.One day, the cat found a book. The book was called a novel. The cat did not know what a novel was, but it was fun to touch.The cat liked to rub the novel with its paws. The cat rubbed the novel every day. The cat and the novel became best friends. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a kind doctor named Tom. He had a big heart and loved to help people. One day, a little boy named Tim came to see him. Tim felt very dizzy and needed help.Doctor Tom knew just what to do. He said, "Tim, I think you need an operation to make you feel better." Tim was scared, but Doctor Tom held his hand and gave it a gentle squeeze. This made Tim feel safe and loved.The operation was a success, and Tim felt better right away. He learned that when you feel scared, a kind squeeze from a friend can help you feel brave. The moral of the story is to always be kind and loving to others, especially when they need it the most.

Once upon a time, there was a big room full of junk. Two friends, Tom and Sue, liked to play in this room. They would build towers, make forts, and have fun with all the junk.One day, Tom and Sue started to quarrel. Tom wanted to make a clean space in the room, but Sue wanted to keep playing with the junk. Tom said, "I want to clean this room." Sue said, "No, I like the junk."They quarreled for a long time. Then, they decided to make a clean space and keep the junk. They worked together and made a fun play area. Now, Tom and Sue play in the clean space and have fun with the junk. They don't quarrel anymore.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to bake with her mom. One sunny day, they decided to bake a yummy cake.Lucy's cat, Fluffy, wanted to help too. Fluffy put her paw on the table and tried to mix the cake. "No, Fluffy!" said Lucy. "Paws are not for baking. You can watch us bake."Lucy and her mom mixed the cake and put it in the oven. They waited and waited. The cake smelled so good. When the cake was ready, they took it out of the oven.Lucy said, "Now we can all eat the cake!" Fluffy was happy. She licked her paw and sat with Lucy and her mom. They all enjoyed the yummy cake together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily was playing outside with her ball. The ball was amazing and very colorful. Lily loved her ball very much.One day, while Lily was playing, the ball rolled far away. It went under a big tree. Lily tried to reach for the ball, but she was too small. She called out with her little voice, "Help! I can't reach my ball!"Her big brother, Sam, heard her voice. He came running to help her. Sam was tall and could reach the ball under the tree. He got the ball and gave it back to Lily.Lily was very happy. She thanked Sam with a big hug. They played together with the amazing ball for the rest of the day. And they both had so much fun.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to play with his toys. One day, he got a new toy. It was a fake bird. He wanted to give the bird a name.Tom asked his mom, "What should I name my bird?" His mom said, "You can pick any name you like, Tom." So Tom thought and thought. He picked the name "Sky" for his bird.The next day, Tom and Sky went outside to play. Suddenly, something unexpected happened. Sky started to move like a real bird! Tom was so surprised. "Wow, Sky, I didn't know you could fly!" Tom and Sky played together all day, and they were very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a human named Tim. Tim was a nice and harmless boy. He lived in a small house with his mom, dad, and dog.One day, Tim saw a sad girl named Sue. Sue was crying because she dropped her toy. Tim wanted to help Sue feel better. So, Tim offered his own toy to Sue.Sue stopped crying and smiled. She said "thank you" to Tim. Tim felt happy because he helped Sue. They became good friends and played together every day. The moral of the story is that offering help can make people happy and make new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a young bird named Tim. Tim lived with his family high up on a cliff. The cliff was very tall and had many rocks. Tim liked to play with his brothers and sisters near the edge of the cliff.One day, Tim and his friends were playing near the cliff. Tim's mom told them to be careful and not go too close to the edge. But Tim did not listen. He went too close to the edge and fell down. Tim was scared and cried for help.Tim's mom and dad heard him and came to save him. They were sad that Tim did not listen to them. Tim felt regret for not listening to his mom. After that day, Tim promised to always listen to his mom and dad. He never went too close to the cliff again. Tim and his family lived happily ever after.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a soft seat. It was round like a circle. She liked to sit on it because it was very comfy. Lily took the soft seat everywhere she went. She would sit on it to read, eat, and play.Lily brought her soft seat to the park. She met her friends there. They all sat in a big circle on the grass. They talked, laughed, and played games. Lily's friends liked her soft seat too. They took turns sitting on it and felt very happy.At the end of the day, Lily and her friends said goodbye. Lily took her soft seat home. She put it in her room. Every night, Lily would sit on her soft seat and read a bedtime story. She loved her soft, circle seat very much.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big, red box. Tim's mom said, "What's in the box, Tim?" Tim said, "I don't know, Mom. Let's open it!" Tim's mom said, "Okay, but first, let's play on the swings."Tim and his mom played on the swings for a while. They had so much fun. Tim's mom said, "Let's go see what's in the box now!" Tim said, "Yes, Mom! I'm so excited!" They walked to the big, red box.Tim opened the box and saw a big surprise! The box was filled with lots of rich, yummy cookies! Tim and his mom were so happy. They took the cookies home and shared them with their friends. Tim's mom said, "What a great day at the park, Tim!" Tim said, "Yes, Mom! I love surprises!"

Once upon a time, there was a king. He was looking for something special to decorate his castle. He wanted something spicy to make his castle look special.One day, the king was walking by a shop. He noticed they had decorations in all sorts of colors. He saw some that were even spicy! The king picked out some of the decorations that were extra spicy and brought them home with him.He took all the decorations and decorated the walls and windows of his castle. It soon became the most beautiful castle around! All the other kings and queens wanted to come and see the spicy decorations.The king was pleased with the results. He was happy that the decorations made the castle look extra special. He had found the perfect way to decorate it!

Once upon a time, there was a mitten. It was a very unknown mitten. It did not know where it came from. The mitten was lost in a big park.One day, a boy named Tim saw the mitten. He liked the mitten very much. Tim wanted to find the owner of the mitten. He thought, "I will call out loud to find the owner."Tim called out, "Who lost this mitten?" Many people came to see the mitten. But no one knew who it belonged to. Tim was sad, but he did not give up.Finally, a little girl named Sue came to the park. She saw the mitten and said, "That is my mitten!" Tim was very happy to give the mitten back to Sue. They became good friends and played in the park every day.

Lila was sad. Her doll had a big cut on her arm. She did not know how to heal it. She asked her mom for help."Mom, can you heal my doll? She is hurt and I love her very much."Mom looked at the doll and smiled. She took a brown cloth and some glue. She put the glue on the cut and covered it with the cloth. She pressed it gently and waited."There, now your doll has a bandage. She will heal soon, don't worry."Lila hugged her mom and thanked her. She looked at her doll and saw the brown bandage. She thought it was pretty. She gave her doll a kiss and said:"I hope you feel better, doll. You are very brave. Now let's play. Do you want to take a turn on the swing?"The doll did not answer, but Lila pretended she did. She took her doll to the swing and pushed her gently. She sang a song and smiled. She was happy again.

Lily and Max were playing in the park. They liked to dig in the sand and find rocks. Lily found a big, shiny rock. She was very happy."Look, Max, I found a pretty rock!" she said.Max looked at the rock. He wanted it too. He said, "Give me the rock, Lily. It is mine."Lily said, "No, Max, it is mine. I found it first."Max was angry. He said, "Give me the rock now, or I will hit you."Lily was scared. She said, "No, Max, you are being mean. You can't demand the rock. You have to share."Max did not listen. He tried to grab the rock from Lily. They both pulled and pushed. The rock fell on the ground. It broke into two pieces.Lily and Max both cried. They were sad and tired. They had lost their pretty rock.Mom came and saw them crying. She said, "What happened, Lily and Max?"Lily and Max told Mom what happened. Mom said, "I'm sorry, Lily and Max. You both made a mistake. You should not fight over a rock. You should be kind and gentle to each other. You are friends, not enemies."Lily and Max said, "We're sorry, Mom. We're sorry, Lily. We're sorry, Max."Mom said, "It's okay, Lily and Max. I forgive you. Do you forgive each other?"Lily and Max nodded. They hugged each other. They said, "We forgive you, Lily. We forgive you, Max."Mom said, "That's good, Lily and Max. Now, let's go home and have some juice and cookies. You must be thirsty and hungry."Lily and Max said, "Yes, Mom. We are thirsty and hungry. And we are tired too."Mom said, "Then let's go home and rest. You can play again tomorrow. Maybe you will find another pretty rock. Or something else."Lily and Max said, "Okay, Mom. Thank you, Mom."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a toy snake that looked real, but it was fake. Lucy liked to play with her toy snake in the garden.One day, Lucy found a bottle in the garden. The bottle had the word "poison" on it. She did not know what it meant, so she took it to her mom. Her mom said, "Oh no, this is poison! It can make you very sick. Thank you for showing me, Lucy."Lucy felt happy that she helped her mom. From that day on, she always showed her mom things she found in the garden. And they played with the fake snake together, laughing and having fun.

Once upon a time, there was a big, enormous tree. A little girl named Lily liked to play under the tree every day. One day, Lily found a folder under the tree. The folder was red and shiny. Lily was very happy with her new folder.Lily wanted to make a sign with the folder. She took her crayons and drew a pretty picture on the folder. She drew a sun, a house, and a cat. Lily was very proud of her sign. She showed it to her mom and dad. They loved the sign too.The next day, Lily went back to the enormous tree with her sign. She wanted to show her sign to her friends. But something unexpected happened! The wind blew very hard, and the sign flew away. Lily was sad. Suddenly, the wind stopped, and the sign flew back to Lily. It was like magic! Lily was very happy, and she played with her sign all day.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Mia. She was three years old. Mia was envious of the people around her and wanted to change something unique about herself. She saw a trumpet in the yard and wanted to give it a try. Mia's father noticed how eager she was to try the trumpet and agreed to help her. He showed Mia how to put her lips around the metal and how to blow into it. The noise that came out of the trumpet surprised Mia. She was amazed at how beautiful and loud the sound was! She immediately fell in love with the trumpet and wanted to learn how to play it better. Mia's father was proud of her and decided to sign her up for trumpet lessons. He said “Mia, you have worked so hard to get here and I know you will be great at it.” Mia nodded and smiled bigger than ever. She was so excited to start her trumpet lessons and dreamed of one day playing it on the big stage.Her dream eventually came true and Mia ended up becoming a very talented trumpet player. Everybody was envious of Mia and praised her for all the hard work. Mia changed herself for the better and will always be remembered for her beautiful trumpet music.

Once there was a little girl who wanted to explore. She stepped into the wood and started walking. It was getting harder and harder, so she decided to climb a big tree. While she was up in the tree, she saw a beautiful sunset. The little girl wanted to stay and enjoy the view, so she sat in the tree to watch.Soon, the sun started setting and it became darker and darker. The little girl was getting sleepy, it was too difficult to climb down. But she was so high up, she had to find away to get down. She tried her best, but it was still too hard. It got darker and darker, until finally it was dark. The little girl was still up at the very top of the tree, she had no way to get down. Then, the morning sun rose in the sky, but it was too late for the little girl. She had stayed in the tree all night and didn't make it home. The little girl had a bad ending, she always wanted to watch the sunset from the tree. But it was too difficult to get down, so she got stuck and no one ever knew.

One day, a little bunny named Bob was very tired. He had been hopping all day and needed a rest. He saw a big tree and thought it would be a nice place to sit. Under the tree, there was a big luggage. Bob was curious and wanted to see what was inside.Bob tried to open the luggage, but it was too heavy. He asked his friend, a bird named Sue, for help. "Sue, can you help me open this luggage?" Sue said, "Yes, I can help, but we have to be careful. We don't know what's inside." They worked together to open the luggage.When they opened the luggage, they found a spring inside. Bob and Sue looked at each other and smiled. They knew they could use the spring to have fun. They took turns jumping on the spring and went really high in the air. They laughed and played all day long. The tired feeling went away, and they were happy they found the luggage with the spring.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a healthy little puppy named Max. Max loved to play with his ball and run around in the yard. One day, Max saw a big tree with a lot of fruit on it.Max wanted to get the fruit, so he tried to jump up and grab it. But Max was too small to reach it. He tried and tried, but the tree would not yield the fruit. Max was sad, but he did not give up.Then, Max had an idea. He went to his friend, a tall giraffe named Lucy. Lucy was very tall and could reach the fruit easily. With her help, the tree yielded the fruit, and Max and Lucy shared it happily. They had a great day together, and Max learned that sometimes, you need a little help from your friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big kitchen where many animals cooked food. A big bear, named Ben, and a small mouse, named Max, were best friends. They liked to cook together. Ben was very strong and could weigh heavy things. Max was tiny, but he was fast and could reach small places.One day, Ben saw Max running fast and helping everyone in the kitchen. Ben felt jealous. He said, "I wish I could be as fast as Max." Max heard Ben and said, "But you are strong and can weigh things. We all need you, too."Later that day, a big pot fell from the shelf. It was too heavy for anyone to lift. Max tried, but he couldn't do it. Then, Ben came and used his strength to weigh the pot. He put it back on the shelf. Everyone clapped and thanked Ben. Max said, "See? You are important, too."Ben smiled and hugged Max. They learned that everyone is special in their own way. They worked together in the kitchen, and they were the best friends forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Kitty. Kitty was very adorable, but she hated noise. Every day, she would play in her quiet house with her toys.One day, while Kitty was playing, she heard a loud noise outside. She was scared and hid under her bed. The noise was coming from a little dog named Buddy, who was playing with his ball. Kitty did not like Buddy because he was always making noise.But then, something unexpected happened. Buddy saw that Kitty was scared and stopped making noise. He came over to Kitty and shared his ball with her. They started to play together, and Kitty learned that noise can be fun when shared with a friend. The moral of the story is that sometimes the things we hate can become enjoyable when we learn to share and make friends.

Once upon a time, in a big, green park, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy loved to dance. She would dance in the morning, dance in the afternoon, and dance at night. She was a very good dancer, and everyone loved to watch her dance.One day, it rained a lot. The park became wet, and there were puddles everywhere. Amy put on her rain boots and went outside to play. She saw the wet puddles and decided to dance in them. She jumped and splashed, making the water fly around her. It was so much fun!Amy's friends saw her dancing in the wet puddles and wanted to join her. They put on their rain boots too and started to dance with Amy. They all danced together, laughing and splashing in the wet puddles. It was a good day for dancing, and they all had a great time.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to examine the flowers, the bugs and the rocks. They pretended to be scientists and judges. They gave names and scores to everything they saw."Look, Lily, I found a red flower. It is very pretty and smells good. I give it ten points," Ben said, holding the flower to his nose."Wow, Ben, that is a nice flower. But I found something better. Look at this shiny rock. It is very smooth and sparkly. I give it eleven points," Lily said, showing off her rock.They laughed and ran to find more things to examine and judge. They were having so much fun.But then they saw something that made them stop. It was a big cake on a table. It had white frosting and colorful sprinkles. It looked very yummy."Wow, Lily, look at that cake. It is the best thing ever. I give it a hundred points," Ben said, licking his lips."Me too, Ben. It is so yummy. I want to taste it. Do you think we can have some?" Lily asked, her eyes wide.They looked around. They did not see anyone near the table. They did not see any signs or plates or forks. They did not see any reason why they could not have some cake.They walked slowly to the table. They reached out their hands. They were about to grab a piece of cake.But then they heard a loud voice."Hey, you two! What are you doing? That is my cake! I made it for my birthday party. You can't have any. Go away!" It was a boy, older and bigger than them. He looked very angry.Lily and Ben were scared. They dropped their hands. They ran away. They did not get any cake.They learned a lesson. They should not take things that are not theirs. They

Grandma was very sick. She was very old, a year older than Grandma had been last year. In the living room, everyone was very anxious. Even the little 3 year old was feeling sad - he had heard the grown ups talking about Grandma.The little 3 year old went to find Grandma in her bedroom. Grandma was in bed and had tears in her eyes.Grandma said to the little boy, "I'm so tired."The little boy wiped away his tears and asked, "Don't be sad, Grandma. What can I do to make you feel better?"Grandma said, "There's nothing you can do now. I'm very sick and I'm not going to get better this time." Grandma started to weep.The little boy hugged Grandma tightly. This was the last time he saw her. The next day Grandma died. The little boy was very sad, but he was also very brave. He was sad all that year, and anxious when he remembered Grandma.

One day, a little boy named Tim went outside to play. The sky was full of dark clouds, but Tim was not confused. He knew that rain was coming. He wanted to play before the rain could spoil his fun.As Tim played with his ball, he saw his friend, Tom. Tom was sad. Tim asked, "Why are you sad, Tom?" Tom said, "I don't want the rain to spoil our playtime."Tim and Tom played together, but the rain started to fall. They got wet and cold. They were confused because they thought they could play before the rain came. But the rain came too fast.Tim and Tom went back home, shivering and sad. The rain had spoiled their fun day. They wished they had stayed inside, but now they knew to listen to the sky when it looked like rain.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Daisy. Daisy had a friend named Tom. They liked to play and talk together. One day, they saw a big, pretty tree. They wanted to discuss what to do with the tree.Daisy had a foolish idea. She said, "Let's jump off the tree!" Tom looked at Daisy and said, "No, that's not safe. We can sit under the tree and look at the sky." Daisy thought about it and agreed with Tom.They sat under the tree and talked about fun things. They laughed and played games. The sun was shining, and they were happy. Daisy was glad that they didn't do the foolish thing. They had a great day under the tree.

Mike was a modest 3 year old boy who loved jelly. One morning his mom gave him a bowl of jelly for breakfast. He was so excited, he smiled and gave her a big hug.Mike ate his jelly and then he layed on the floor. He was so tired, he started to yawn. He yawned and yawned until he fell asleep.Mike slept until the afternoon. When he woke up, the jelly was gone. He sighed and looked around. Where had the jelly gone?Mike's mom smiled and said "Don't worry Mike, I saved the jelly for dessert. It's waiting for you in the kitchen". Mike smiled and ran off to the kitchen. He was so excited!When Mike saw his jelly he smiled and gave his mom another big hug. He ate the jelly and felt so happy. He was so modest and thankful for his mom and the delicious jelly!

One day, a curious little bug named Bob wanted to crawl to the big red box at the end of the street. The big red box was where people put their mail. Bob saw the people put mail in the box, and he wanted to see what was inside.As Bob crawled, he met a friendly cat named Max. Max asked, "Where are you going, Bob?" Bob said, "I am going to the big red box to see the mail." Max thought it sounded fun, so he decided to crawl with Bob.When they got to the big red box, Bob and Max looked inside. They saw lots of mail! They were very happy they crawled all the way there. After looking at the mail, they crawled back home together, excited to tell their friends about their adventure.

Once upon a time, in a lively little town, there lived a girl named Lily. Lily loved to wrap gifts for her friends. One day, she found a big box. She knew it was the perfect gift for her best friend, Tim.Lily went to Tim's house and said, "Tim, I have a gift for you!" Tim was very happy and excited. He opened the gift and inside the box was a book. Tim asked, "What is this, Lily?" Lily replied, "It's a story for us to read together!"They sat down and read the story. It was about a brave cat who saved a little bird. Lily and Tim laughed and smiled as they read the story. They had so much fun, and from that day on, they always read stories together.

One day, Tom went to camp. He was very excited. At camp, Tom had a lot of fun with his friends. They played games and sang songs. Tom was always alert and careful.One night, Tom and his friend Sue were sitting by the fire. "I want to complete a big puzzle," said Tom. "Me too," said Sue. So they started to work on the puzzle together. They put many pieces in the right place.Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. They looked up and saw a big, friendly bear. The bear wanted to help them with the puzzle. Tom and Sue were surprised but happy. With the bear's help, they completed the puzzle very fast. They all laughed and had a great time at camp.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy cat named Tom. Tom liked to watch what everyone was doing. One day, Tom saw a little girl named Sue. Sue was sad because she had spilled her juice all over the table.Tom went up to Sue and said, "I can help you wipe the table." Sue smiled and said, "Thank you, Tom." They wiped the table together, and soon it was all clean. But then, another cat named Max came along. Max was not happy that Tom was helping Sue.Max said, "I wanted to help Sue first." Tom said, "We can all help together." Max agreed, and they all helped to clean up the mess. After they finished, they all played together and had a great start to their day. From that day on, Tom, Max, and Sue became the best of friends.

Tom and Lily went to the farm with their mom and dad. They saw many animals, like cows, pigs, chickens and horses. They liked to pet them and feed them some hay."Look, mom, a baby horse!" Lily said, pointing to a small brown horse in a stable. "Can I touch it?""Sure, honey, but be gentle and quiet. The baby horse is shy and needs to rest with its mom," mom said, holding Lily's hand.Tom wanted to see the baby horse too, but he saw something else that caught his eye. He saw a bright star in the sky, shining above the farm."Wow, dad, a star!" Tom said, pointing to the sky. "What is it?""That's a very special star, son. It's called the North Star. It helps people find their way when it's dark," dad said, lifting Tom up."Can we follow it?" Tom asked."Maybe someday, when you're older. But for now, let's enjoy the farm and the animals. They are also very special," dad said, smiling.Tom and Lily nodded, and hugged their mom and dad. They were happy to be at the farm, and to see the baby horse and the bright star. They learned something new and had fun.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a gloomy cat named Tom. Tom was always sad because he had no friends to play with. One day, Tom decided to go outside and find a friend.Tom walked and walked until he found a big tree. Under the tree, he saw a little bug. Tom wanted to play with the bug, so he tried to pinch it with his paw. But the bug was too fast! It ran away and hid in a small hole.Feeling sad, Tom went back home. When he got there, he saw a small puddle of oil on the ground. Tom thought it looked fun, so he started to play with the oil. As he played, a happy little bird flew down and joined him. They played together and became best friends. From that day on, Tom was not a gloomy cat anymore.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to the park with her mom. Mia saw a harmless bug on a leaf. She was very happy and wanted to know more about the bug. So, she asked her mom about it. Her mom said she would give her a lecture about bugs later.They went home and Mia's mom started the lecture. She told Mia about many different bugs. Mia was very excited to learn. Then, something unexpected happened. A small bug flew into the room!Mia and her mom were surprised. They looked at the bug and saw it was the same harmless bug from the park. The bug wanted to listen to the lecture too! They all laughed and Mia's mom continued the lecture. The bug stayed and listened with them, and they all had a great time.

One day, a small boy named Jack went for a walk in the park. Jack was a very creative boy, and he loved to explore the outdoors. He began to wander away from his parents, and he got lost in the park. Suddenly, Jack spotted a stranger in the park. "Hello," he said to the stranger. The stranger seemed friendly, but he had a mischievous glint in his eyes. "Hello there, little boy," the stranger replied. Jack got a funny feeling in his stomach. He knew this stranger was up to something. The stranger waved his hands and asked, "Would you like to help me with something? It will be very creative!" Jack hesitated. He knew that he shouldn't talk to strangers, but the man seemed so nice. Just then, Jack's parents came to the park, calling his name. Jack said goodbye to the stranger, and ran back to his parents. But deep down, he was curious about what the stranger wanted. He knew that he would have to wander back to the park someday to find out.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Mark. Mark was a pale little boy who liked to play outside. One day, he went to the park with his mom. They saw a big tree with a swing.Mark's mom said, "Mark, do you want to play on the swing?" Mark was very happy and said, "Yes, please!" He played on the swing for a long time. The sun was shining and the birds were singing.After a while, Mark's mom mentioned, "Mark, it's time to go home now." Mark felt sad but he knew it was time to leave. They walked home together, holding hands. Mark couldn't wait to come back to the park and play on the swing again.

Once upon a time, in a large house, lived a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to watch cartoons on TV. His favorite cartoon was about a big, strong superhero who helped others.One day, Tim saw his mom cover a table with a tablecloth. "Mom, why do you cover the table?" he asked. She smiled and said, "I cover the table to keep it clean, Tim. We must take care of the things we have."Tim thought about the superhero in his favorite cartoon. He wanted to be like the superhero and take care of things too. So, he started to cover his toys when he was done playing. He even helped his mom cover the table.Soon, Tim's friends saw what he was doing and they started to help too. They learned that taking care of things was important, just like the superhero in the cartoon. The moral of the story is that we should always take care of the things we have and help others do the same.

One day, James was playing in the park with his best friend. As they were running around chasing each other, he saw a tall man standing in the corner. His friend screamed in surprise, but James felt a wave of sadness overtake him. He knew he had seen the man before, but he wasn't sure where.Then he heard a loud weeping coming from the corner. It was the tall man, and he was crying so much that James dared not approach him. His friend ran away, but James stayed. He watched as the man slowly walked forward, still weeping.James finally realized why the man was so sad. It was his father - the same dad who used to take him out for ice cream and play on the swings with him. Now James knew why the man was standing in the corner - he was crying for the memories.So, even though it was only James standing there, he reached out with a comforting hug to the tall man in the corner. He knew that no matter what, his dad would always be there for him.

Once upon a time, there was a clever cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to collect things. One day, Kitty decided to collect socks. She went around the house and found many socks. Some were big, some were small, some were red, and some were blue. Kitty was very happy with her sock collection.Kitty met her friend, Doggy, and said, "Look at my socks! I have so many!" Doggy looked at the socks and said, "Wow, that's a lot of socks! Can I help you collect more?" Kitty was happy to have help, so they both went around the house to find more socks.As Kitty and Doggy were collecting socks, they found a secret door. They opened the door and saw a big room full of toys. Kitty and Doggy were so surprised! They played with the toys and had lots of fun. Then, they went back to collecting socks and added them to Kitty's collection. They were very happy to have found the secret toy room and to have so many socks.

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing with his toy boat in the bathtub. He was very impatient because he wanted to make the boat go faster. He thought of an idea to make it speed up.Tim found a stick and thought, "I can strike the water with this stick to make waves!" So he hit the water with the stick, and the boat started to move faster. He was very happy and said, "Look, my boat is going so fast now!"But then, something unexpected happened. A little frog jumped into the bathtub from the window. The frog said, "Hello, can I play with you and your boat?" Tim was surprised but happy to have a new friend. They played together, and the frog helped make the boat go even faster.

One day, a boy named Tom was very tired. He wanted to rest, but he had to do his math. Tom did not like math, but he knew it was important. Tom's mom said, "You can rest after you finish your math."While Tom was doing his math, a big, impressive bird flew into the room. The bird looked at Tom and said, "I can help you with your math, but you have to help me find my way home." Tom was surprised, but he agreed to help the bird.Together, they finished the math quickly. Then, Tom helped the bird find its way home. In the end, Tom and the bird became good friends. Tom learned that even when things are hard, with a little help, anything is possible.

Once upon a time there was a little boy who had an aunt. He was a lucky boy. He spent his days playing with his aunt in the sunshine.One day his aunt decided they would go on an adventure. She took the little boy out of their town and they journeyed far away.The little boy came to a huge mountain and his aunt told him he had to climb. The little boy was scared, but he had to try. He slowly started to rise up the mountain.His aunt cheered him on and said he was doing very well. But then the little boy lost his footing and started to slide back down the mountain. The little boy and his aunt couldn't save him from his fall and sadly he tumbled down the mountain. He was very scared and he hurt his head. His aunt was so sad and worried about the little boy.The lucky little boy was taken away in an ambulance. His aunt was very sad and scared, but the little boy was okay. The little boy and his aunt had to say goodbye and the little boy never climbed a mountain again.

Once upon a time there were two friends called Bob and Lucy. They went out on a sunny day to find something fun to do. So they decided to go to the park. When they arrived, they saw lots of things they could do, like swing on the swing and roll down the slide. But Bob saw a rake and thought it would be fun to try it out. "Let's try it!" said Bob. He took the rake and Lucy held it. Then Bob tasted the handle. It was an ordinary taste, but Bob tasted it anyway. "That doesn't taste good!" said Bob. Lucy shook her head and said, "Bob, you shouldn't taste things that you're not sure about." But it was too late. Bob had already tasted it. Then he was feeling very sick.The moral of this story is to never taste things you are not sure about. Just because something looks ordinary doesn't mean that it is safe.

Once there was a little girl named Sophie. Sophie was very stubborn and liked to do things her own way. One day she was walking in the park and it started to rain. She looked around for shelter and she found a big tree with a few branches. She decided to take refuge under the tree and waited for the rain to stop.After the rain, Sophie was worried and wanted to get home. She looked around, but she couldn't find her way. She asked a bird, but it gave no answer. Then she asked a rabbit and it said that it didn't know the way home. Sophie was getting frustrated and she stamped her foot and said that she wanted to go home. Suddenly, she heard a loud and deep voice. She spun around and standing there was a huge and very old bear. The bear asked Sophie if she wanted help. Sophie didn't answer and just looked at the bear. The bear asked again and this time Sophie nodded. The bear took Sophie's hand and showed Sophie the way home.Sophie thanked the bear, but the bear replied that it was no problem. Sophie waved goodbye and noticed how stubborn the bear had been. She smiled and went home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a doll that she loved very much. The doll had wide eyes and a pretty dress. Sue and her doll were best friends.One day, Sue and her doll went to the park. They played on the swings and slides. Sue was very happy. While they were playing, something happened. Sue's doll fell on the ground and got dirty.Sue picked up her doll and said, "Oh no! You are dirty. Don't worry, I will clean you up." Sue took her doll home and washed her dress. She made sure her doll's wide eyes were clean too.Soon, the doll was clean and pretty again. Sue hugged her doll and said, "Now we can play again!" And they played happily ever after.

The sun was shining brightly in the sky one day. Two little kids, Lily and Ben, were playing outside in the garden. They were giggling and having a great time together.Suddenly, Ben had an idea. He said, "let's play a game. I'll tell a joke and you have to guess the answer!" Lily smiled and agreed. So Ben started to tell his joke: "why did the lily cross the road?".Lily thought for a moment then said, "I don't know!" Ben replied, "because it was intelligent!" and he started to laugh.When Lily heard him, she smiled too. She realised that it was important to be clever, to think things through and not just rush into something without thinking first."Wow, that was a good lesson," said Lily. "Yes it was," Ben agreed happily.The two of them smiled at each other, understanding that being intelligent makes a big difference in life.

Once upon a time a little girl called Alice wanted to watch the castle. She was so excited she could hardly wait. So she took a big deep breath and she walked through the gates. As soon as she walked in, the big door shut behind her. Alice was very scared. She shouted for help but nobody answered her. She started to cry and shout again and again, but still nobody came. This made Alice very sad. She looked around and didn't know what to do. Then she remembered her mum had said to always be brave. So she started to walk around the castle, but when she was almost at the other side, she heard a loud noise. She looked back and saw the big door had slammed shut. Alice started to cry and shouted for help again. But the door was too heavy and she couldn't open it. She was stuck in the castle and nobody knew. Alice was very sorry. And she had to watch the castle until someone came and saved her. That's the bad ending of Alice's story.

One day, a bird named Tim was flying high in the sky. He had a job to deliver a message to his friend, Sam the cat. The message was a big truth that everyone should know.As Tim flew, he saw Sam sitting under a tree. He landed next to him and said, "Hi Sam! I have a message for you." Sam looked at Tim and said, "What is it, Tim?"Tim told Sam the truth, "It is important to be nice to everyone." Sam thought about it and said, "You are right, Tim. We should all be nice."From that day on, Sam and Tim were always nice to everyone they met. They told their friends the truth, too. And all the animals lived happily together.

Once upon a time, there was a fierce lion. He wanted a waffle, so he went to the store. But the store was all out of waffles!The lion was sad. But then he noticed something else in the store. It was a big, fluffy blanket. The lion thought it would make a perfect waffle. So he wrapped it up with his big paws.Now the lion was happy. He had his waffle and he hugged and snuggled it all the way home. The lion enjoyed his warm, cozy and fierce waffle. And he never had to look for a waffle again. The end.

One day, a helpful frog named Fred lived near a pond. He liked to jump and play with his friends. The sun was shining, and they saw a pretty rainbow in the sky. They all wanted to touch the rainbow."Oh no!" said Fred. "We can't touch the rainbow. We must prevent it from going away." His friends did not understand. They still wanted to touch the rainbow.Fred tried to stop his friends. "Please, don't touch the rainbow," he said. But his friends did not listen. They jumped high to touch the rainbow. The rainbow started to fade away.Fred felt sad. He knew he had to do something. He asked his friends to help him. "Let's all jump and clap our hands to bring the rainbow back!" They all jumped and clapped together.The rainbow came back, and everyone was happy. Fred's friends thanked him for being helpful. They all learned that sometimes it's better to enjoy something from far away.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby dancer named Lily. She loved to dance and play with her friends. Every day, she would take her pink shoes and dance in the park.One sunny day, Lily went to the park to dance. She saw a big, round thing on the ground. She did not know what it was. She thought it was a ball. So, she kicked it and started to dance around it.But, the big round thing was not a ball! It was a big, sleepy cat! The cat woke up and saw Lily dancing. The cat liked her dance and started to dance too. Lily and the cat became best friends and danced together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted little girl named Lily. She had a pretty dress that she loved to wear. One day, she was playing in the park when she met a new friend named Tim.Tim said, "Hi, I like your dress!" Lily replied, "Thank you! Do you want to play with me?" Tim agreed, and they played together all day.Lily and Tim decided to unite their friends and have a big party. They played games, ate yummy food, and had a great time. At the end of the day, everyone was happy that Lily and Tim brought them together.

Once upon a time, there was a big green tree. It was in the middle of a park. The tree loved to supply food to all the little animals. It was a very nice tree.One day, a confused little squirrel came to the tree. The squirrel was looking for food. The tree wanted to help the squirrel. The tree shook its branches, and nuts fell down. The squirrel was happy.The next day, the squirrel came back. The squirrel brought all its friends. The tree shook its branches again, and more nuts fell down. All the animals were happy. The tree was happy too. The green tree and the little animals became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the snow. One day, it was very cold and harsh outside. Lily put on her warm coat and her mittens to keep her hands warm.Lily saw a big snowball in her yard. She wanted to lift it and make a snowman. With her mittens on, she tried to lift the snowball. It was very heavy, but she did not give up.Finally, Lily was able to lift the snowball. She made a big snowman with a smiley face. Lily was very happy and proud of her snowman. She played outside all day with her new snowman friend, and her mittens kept her hands warm.

One day, a boy named Tim found a candle. The candle was very big and had words on it. Tim wanted to read the words, but he was too small. He asked his mom, "Can you help me read the words on the candle?"His mom said, "Of course, Tim!" She read the words on the candle out loud. The words said, "When you light this candle, something disgusting will happen." Tim was very curious and wanted to see what would happen.Tim's mom lit the candle. Suddenly, the room filled with the smell of yummy cookies! Tim was confused because it was not disgusting at all. They both laughed and enjoyed the cookies that his mom baked. The candle was not telling the truth, and they had a fun day together.

Cindy was a happy three year old girl. She and her mom were camping in the big tent in the backyard. She was excited to be sleeping in the tent.The night was cool and dark outside the tent. Cindy was worried. "Mom, I'm scared," she said.Her mom smiled, "Don't be worried sweetheart. I'll remain here with you in the tent all night. It'll be okay."Cindy felt better knowing her mom was there with her. As the night wore on she remained in the tent with her mom. Soon she started to feel sleepy.But then she heard a strange noise outside the tent. She was scared again. Mom held her tighter and whispered, "It's okay, I'll remain here with you."Cindy was comforted and started to feel sleepy again. Soon she was fast asleep in the tent, safe in her mom's arms.

One day, a little cat named Tom went for a walk. He saw a lot of cars in the traffic. Tom felt a big yawn come out of his mouth because he was tired. He wanted to find a quiet place to take a nap.Tom saw an unusual big box near the road. He thought it would be a good place to sleep. Tom went inside the box and closed his eyes. He was ready to sleep when something unexpected happened.The big box began to move! Tom was scared at first, but then he saw that it was a big truck. The truck took Tom to a new place with lots of trees and grass. Tom was happy to find a quiet place to sleep and play. The big truck had given Tom a surprise adventure.

Once upon a time there was a successful prince. He just didn't seem to fit in with the other princes in the kingdom. Everywhere he went, people would point and laugh at him. The prince was very sad.But then one day, the prince found out there was a secret door in the castle. He decided to find the door and see what it was all about.When he opened the door, he discovered a whole new world inside! Everyone around him smiled and welcomed him. He started to feel happy and like he fit in.The prince started to make lots of friends and laugh a lot. He explored this new world and learned about the people and the culture. The prince was so successful. He soon became the leader of the group and everyone welcomed him with open arms.The prince was finally happy. For the first time in his life, he felt like he truly fit in.

Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named Spot. Spot loved his boy, Tim. They played together every day. Spot would run, and Tim would laugh. They were very happy.One day, Tim and Spot were playing in the park. They saw a little girl crying. "Why are you sad?" asked Tim. The little girl said, "I lost my toy. Can you help me find it?" Tim and Spot wanted to help the girl.Spot sniffed the ground and started to look for the toy. He did not quit until he found it under a big tree. The little girl was so happy. She hugged Spot and said, "Thank you, loyal dog!" Tim and Spot felt proud. They went home, knowing they had done a good thing.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a small plant in her garden. The plant was special because it was very flexible. Mia liked to watch the plant dance in the wind.Mia took care of the plant every day. She gave it water and made sure it had enough sun. One day, her friend Tom came over to play. Tom saw the flexible plant and wanted to touch it. Mia said, "Be careful, Tom. The plant is very special to me."Tom touched the plant and accidentally broke it. Mia was sad, but Tom had an idea. He said, "I'm sorry, Mia. Let's replace the plant with a new one." So, they went to the store and picked out a new flexible plant together.Mia and Tom planted the new plant in the garden. They took care of it together and watched it grow. The new plant was just as flexible and danced in the wind like the first one. Mia and Tom were happy, and they promised to always take care of their special plant together.

One day, a strong boy named Tim set out to go to the market. He wanted to buy some fruit for his mom. The sun was high and bright in the sky. Tim was very happy.On his way, he met a dog. The dog said, "Woof! I see you are going to the market. Can you buy me a bone?" Tim said, "Yes, I can do that!" He knew his mom would be happy to help the dog, too.At the market, Tim bought apples for his mom and a bone for the dog. He went back to the dog and gave him the bone. The dog was very happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!" Tim felt good that he could help his mom and the dog. The sun set, and Tim went home with a big smile on his face.

Tim and Mia liked to play on the sand. They made castles and tunnels and bridges. They had a big bucket and a small spade. They had fun.But one day, the tide came in. The water got closer and closer to their sand. Tim and Mia did not see it. They were busy with their castles. The water touched their bucket and spade.
