The water washed them away.Tim and Mia saw their bucket and spade go. They were scared. They ran to get them. But the water was too fast. The water was too deep. They could not reach them.Tim and Mia cried. They wanted their bucket and spade. They wanted to play on the sand. They did not like the water. They did not like the tide.A man saw them. He was kind. He had a big net. He tried to catch their bucket and spade. He threw the net into the water. He pulled the net back. He got their bucket and spade.Tim and Mia were happy. They thanked the man. They hugged their bucket and spade. They went back to the sand. They played with their castles. They watched the tide go out. They were not scared anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a big, round ball. The ball loved to play with his friend, a little girl named Sue. Sue was always careful when she played with the round ball. She did not want the ball to get hurt.One sunny day, Sue and the round ball went to the park. They played and laughed all day. The round ball liked to roll around in the grass. Sue would insist that the ball be careful near the road. She did not want the ball to roll too far away.As the sun went down, it was time for Sue and the round ball to go home. They said goodbye to the park and walked back home. Sue held the round ball tight in her arms, being careful not to drop it. They were both happy and tired after a fun day of play.

One day, a smart cat named Tom went for a walk. He wanted to see a nice view from the top of a hill. On his way, he met a friendly dog named Max. "Hi, Tom!" Max said with a wave. "Do you want to come with me to see the view?"Tom and Max walked up the hill together. They saw many pretty things like flowers, trees, and birds. When they reached the top, they looked out at the view. They saw a big, blue lake and lots of green grass. "Wow, this is so pretty!" said Tom.Just then, something unexpected happened. A big, colorful bird flew down and landed next to them. The bird waved its wings and said, "Hello, friends! I like the view too. Do you want to fly with me?" Tom and Max looked at each other and smiled. They never thought they would fly with a bird, but today they would!

One day, a girl named Sue went to play outside. She saw pretty, delicate leaves on the ground. It was fall. Sue wanted to scatter the leaves and jump in them. She called her friend Tim to come play too."Tim, come play with me. We can scatter leaves and jump in them," Sue said. Tim came running to play with Sue. They were both very happy.As they played, they found a big pile of leaves. They decided to scatter the leaves and jump in them together. But when they jumped, something unexpected happened. They fell into a deep hole that was hidden under the leaves. Sue and Tim were stuck and could not get out. They called for help, but no one could hear them. And so, Sue and Tim stayed in the hole with a bad ending to their day.

One day, a little bird named Tim wanted to sing. He flew to a big tree and saw many shapes. Tim saw a round shape, a square shape, and a star shape. He liked the star shape best. He sat on the star shape and started to sing.While Tim was singing, the star shape started to feel hot. Tim was surprised. He did not know why the star shape was hot. He kept singing, and the star shape got hotter and hotter. Tim was scared, but he did not want to stop singing.Suddenly, the star shape moved! Tim was very surprised. The hot star shape was not a shape at all! It was a big, friendly dragon. The dragon liked Tim's song so much that he woke up. Tim and the dragon became good friends, and they sang songs together every day.

Tim and Sam are friends. They like to play with blocks. They make a big castle with blocks. They put a flag on the castle. They are happy.But Ben is not happy. Ben is mean. He wants to play with the blocks too. He does not ask Tim and Sam. He just takes some blocks from the castle. He makes a small castle. He puts a hat on the castle. He says, "My castle is better than your castle. Your castle is stupid."Tim and Sam are sad. They do not like Ben. They say, "Ben, stop! Give us back our blocks. You are not nice. You are stupid."Ben does not listen. He takes more blocks from the big castle. He makes his small castle bigger. He says, "No, I will not give you back your blocks. I will take all your blocks. I will make the best castle ever. You are silly. You are stupid."Tim and Sam are angry. They do not want to play with Ben. They want to play with their big castle. They have an idea. They say, "Ben, look! There is a bird on your hat. It is a funny bird. It is a stupid bird."Ben looks up. He sees a bird on his hat. He says, "What? A bird on my hat? That is not funny. That is stupid. Go away, bird. Go away."But the bird does not go away. The bird pecks Ben's hat. The bird makes a hole in Ben's hat. Ben says, "Ow! Ow! Stop, bird. Stop. You are hurting me. You are stupid."Tim and Sam smile. They see a chance. They run to Ben's castle. They take back their blocks. They pass the blocks to each other. They make their big castle bigger. They put a new flag on the castle. They say, "Thank you, bird. You are smart. You are nice. You are not stupid."Ben is sad. He has no blocks. He has no castle. He has

Once upon a time, there was a little rat. The rat lived in a big house with a nice family. The rat was happy but sometimes he would complain. He wanted to play with the family, but they did not like rats.One day, the rat heard the family talking. The mom said, "I am ashamed that we have a rat in our house." The rat felt sad. He wanted to make the family happy, so he thought of a plan.The rat found a ball and rolled it to the family. The little girl saw the ball and laughed. She said, "Look, the rat wants to play!" The family was surprised, but they started to play with the rat. They were not ashamed anymore, and the rat never complained again. They all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a cheerful clock. The clock was on the wall of a big room where people would gather and celebrate. Every day, the clock would watch the people dance, sing, and play games.One day, a little boy named Tim came to the room with his mom. The boy looked at the cheerful clock and said, "Clock, why are you always so happy?" The clock replied, "I am happy because I see people celebrate and have fun every day. It makes me feel good to see them happy."Tim thought about what the clock said and decided to try it. He started to play with other kids and celebrate with them. Tim learned that being happy and kind to others made him feel good too. The moral of the story is that sharing happiness with others makes us feel cheerful and good about ourselves.

Once upon a time there was a man. He was brave and he liked to do daring things. One day he had an idea. He went into a shop and asked if he could buy a sandwich. The shopkeeper said they were too expensive. But the man said he wanted to do a dare. He said he would try to buy one for cheap.The shopkeeper thought it was a good idea and agreed. He gave the man the cheapest sandwich he could find. The man thanked him, paid for the sandwich and left the shop. He was very excited for his daring adventure.The man went to lots of different shops asking them if he could buy a sandwich for cheap. Everywhere he went he was successful. He ended up with a large pile of sandwiches. It was a huge success and the man was very happy.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a purple cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play and run around with his friends. One sunny day, Fluffy and his friends decided to have a race.They all lined up to start the race. Fluffy felt excited and ready to run. When the race began, Fluffy and his friends started to rush as fast as they could. They ran through the green grass and under the blue sky. Fluffy was running very fast, but so were his friends.As they got closer to the finish line, Fluffy tried even harder to go faster. With one big jump, Fluffy crossed the finish line first! All his friends cheered for him. Fluffy felt so happy and proud of his success. From that day on, Fluffy knew that if he tried his best, he could do anything.

Anna and Ben are twins. They like to play in the park. They see a big tree with many green needles. It is a pine tree."Look, Ben, a pine tree!" Anna says. "It smells good.""Yes, it does," Ben says. "Do you think we can climb it?"Anna thinks for a moment. She likes to climb, but the pine tree is very tall and the needles are sharp. She is a little scared."I don't know, Ben," she says. "It looks hard and ouchy."Ben thinks too. He is brave, but he does not want to hurt himself or Anna. He has an idea."Maybe we can make a nest under the pine tree," he says. "We can use the pine cones and the leaves and the sticks. It will be warm and cozy."Anna likes Ben's idea. She smiles and nods."OK, Ben, let's make a nest," she says. "It will be fun."They run to the pine tree and start to gather the things they need. They work together and make a nice nest. They crawl inside and snuggle. They feel warm and happy under the pine tree. They close their eyes and pretend they are birds. They chirp and sing. They have a good time.

Once upon a time, there was a big red bus. The bus would drive around town every day. The bus was not happy. The bus thought its job was boring.One day, the bus saw a big snowman. The snowman could freeze things with just a touch. The bus asked the snowman for help. The snowman touched the bus and the bus could now freeze things too.The bus was happy. It could now make fun ice slides for kids to play on. The bus was not boring anymore. The bus and the snowman were friends and they made the town a fun place to be.

Once there was a gentle panda named Timmy. He looked around and noticed the world around him. He was curious to explore and to try new things. One day Timmy decided to venture away from home and seek out new adventures. He was walking through the forest when he heard a sound. He stopped and listened carefully. He heard it again and quickly followed the sound. He could not believe his eyes when he stumbled across a family of pandas. He had never seen any others like him before. Timmy tentatively approached the group and said "Hi". The family of pandas stared at him in surprise. He spoke again and said "My name is Timmy". The pandas all replied with gentle coos and excitedly ran up to give Timmy kisses and cuddles. Timmy and the pandas spent the day playing together. From that day on, Timmy would visit the pandas regularly and they had become the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big red ball that she loved to play with. One day, while playing outside, her ball rolled away and got stuck in a tree.A tall boy named Tom saw Lily was sad. He wanted to help her. Tom offered to get the ball for her. He reached up high and got the ball out of the tree. Lily was so grateful to Tom for his help.After that, Lily and Tom became best friends. They played with the red ball every day. They were always happy and grateful to have each other. And they always remembered to help others when they could.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She had a unique sweater that her mom made for her. It was red and had a big, happy sun on it. Mia loved her sweater so much. She wore it every day.One day, Mia went to the park with her mom. She saw a little boy named Tim. Tim stared at Mia's sweater. He had never seen a sweater like that before. He said, "Wow, Mia! Your sweater is so nice!"Mia smiled and said, "Thank you, Tim. My mom made it for me. It is my favorite sweater." Tim wanted a unique sweater too. So, Mia and Tim went to Mia's mom and asked if she could make a sweater for Tim.Mia's mom was happy to make a sweater for Tim. She made him a blue sweater with a big, happy moon on it. Tim loved his new sweater. Now, Mia and Tim both had unique sweaters. They wore them every day and played together at the park. They were so happy to be friends with their special sweaters.

Once upon a time, there was a big factory. In the factory, they made juice. The juice was very yummy. The factory was loud and hard.One day, a little boy named Tim went to the factory. He saw a big machine. The machine was pouring juice into bottles. Tim was very happy. He wanted to try the juice.Tim asked a worker, "Can I try the juice, please?" The worker smiled and said, "Yes, you can." He gave Tim a cup and poured some juice into it.Tim drank the juice. It was very good. He said, "Thank you!" and went home. Tim told his friends about the factory and the yummy juice. They all wanted to go and try it too.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to play outside. One day, he went to the park with his mom. He saw a big tree and wanted to find something fun.Tim looked around and found a sword under the tree. He was very happy. He picked it up and showed it to his mom. "Look, Mom! I found a sword!" he said. His mom smiled and said, "That's great, Tim! Now you can play like a knight!"As Tim played, a rude boy came and tried to take his sword. Tim did not like that. He said, "No, this is my sword. I found it. You can't have it." The rude boy went away, and Tim kept playing with his sword. He had a lot of fun at the park that day.

Once upon a time, there was a small boy called Jack. He loved playing all day long and never wanted to sit still.One day, while playing, he noticed his mum wearing a new dress. It had a zipper in the front, and it looked very fit. She had to resist zipping it up because it was too tight."Mum, what's wrong?" Jack asked."It's too fit for me," she said. "I have to resist zipping it up."Jack wanted to help. He grabbed the zipper and tried to make it fit. He wriggled and pulled, but it still didn't fit.Mum smiled. "Thank you for trying, Jack. We'll have to find a bigger dress for me." Jack was happy he could help his mum and they went off to find a bigger dress. And they lived happily ever after.

John was very sad. He had just moved into a new home and was lying in his new crib. He had never been so lonely.John's mother could see the sadness in his eyes. She came in to check on him and asked, "What's wrong? Are you feeling lonely?"John nodded. His mother was so nice to him, she knew just what to do! She said, "I've got a surprise that will excite you. Just wait here, I'll come back soon."John was very curious as he waited in his crib. After a few minutes, his mom returned with a giant toy monkey! Its big eyes were smiling at him and John felt really excited.He got out of his crib and gave his mom a big hug! He was so happy to have this special toy that he barely put it down all night. He was no longer lonely and he was full of joy.

One day, a boy named Tim was playing outside. He saw a rake and leaves scattered all around. Tim thought it would be fun to scatter the leaves even more. He ran and kicked the leaves, laughing as they flew in the air.Tim's mom saw him playing and said, "Tim, don't be stupid. Use the rake to gather the leaves, not scatter them." Tim didn't listen and kept kicking the leaves. His mom shook her head and went back inside.Later, Tim's friends came over to play. They saw the mess of leaves and didn't want to play in the yard. Tim felt sad and realized he should have listened to his mom. He picked up the rake and started gathering the leaves. His friends saw him and helped. Soon, the yard was clean, and they all played happily together.The moral of the story is to listen to the advice of others and not be stubborn.

One day, a little mosquito named Mo was looking for a clean place to rest. He flew around and saw a nice, clean room. Mo flew into the room and saw a little girl named Lily."Hi, I'm Mo! Can I stay in your clean room?" asked Mo. Lily looked at Mo and thought for a moment. "Yes, you can stay, but you must be nice and not bite me," said Lily.Mo was happy and promised to be good. He and Lily became friends. They played together and had lots of fun. At night, Lily let Mo sleep next to her bed. Mo was so happy to have a clean place to stay and a new friend in Lily.

Anna and Ben were playing on the lawn with their ball. They liked to throw and catch and roll the ball. Sometimes the ball went too far and they had to run after it.One time, the ball went over the fence and into the street. Anna and Ben ran to the fence and looked for the ball. They saw a big car coming fast. The car hit the ball and made a loud noise. The ball popped and flew away.Anna and Ben were frightened. They cried and hugged each other. They wanted their mom and dad."Mom! Dad! Help!" they shouted.Mom and dad heard them and came out of the house. They saw Anna and Ben at the fence and ran to them."What happened, sweeties?" mom asked."The ball, the ball, the car, the car!" Anna and Ben said.Mom and dad looked at the street and saw the broken ball. They understood what happened. They comforted Anna and Ben."It's okay, it's okay, you are safe," mom said."We are sorry, we are sorry, we lost the ball," Ben said."It's not your fault, it's not your fault, it was an accident," dad said.Mom and dad hugged Anna and Ben and kissed them. They took them inside the house and gave them juice and cookies. They told them they loved them and they were proud of them. They said they would buy them a new ball.Anna and Ben felt better. They thanked mom and dad and smiled. They still liked to play on the lawn, but they were more careful with the ball.

Lily and Ben wanted to build a snowman in the yard. They put on their hats, coats, gloves and boots and went outside. The snow was soft and white and cold.They rolled a big ball of snow for the body and a smaller one for the head. They found a carrot for the nose, two rocks for the eyes and a stick for the mouth. They looked for something to make the arms, but they could not find any more sticks."Let's go inside and ask Mom for help," Lily said.They ran back to the house and opened the door. Mom was in the living room, decorating the Christmas tree. She had a box of shiny ornaments that sparkled in the light."Mom, can we have some ornaments for our snowman?" Ben asked."Sure, you can have some of these old ones that I don't use anymore," Mom said. She gave them a red scarf, a blue hat, a green button and a silver star."Thank you, Mom!" Lily and Ben said. They hugged Mom and went back outside.They wrapped the scarf around the snowman's neck, put the hat on his head, the button on his chest and the star on his hand. They stepped back and admired their work."Our snowman looks so pretty!" Lily said."And so calm!" Ben said.They smiled and played with their snowman until it was time for dinner. They had a lot of fun building their snowman with the ornaments.

Lily liked to sign with her hands. She learned sign from her mom, who was deaf. Lily could hear, but she loved to talk with her mom in sign. She also liked to teach sign to her friends at school.One day, a new boy came to her class. His name was Ben. He was very big and had a lot of weight. He looked mean and scary. He did not talk to anyone. He just sat in his seat and frowned.Lily wanted to be nice to Ben. She thought maybe he was lonely or sad. She walked up to him and smiled. She said hello with her voice and her hands. She asked him his name in sign.Ben looked at her and laughed. He said, "What are you doing with your hands? Are you crazy? That's not how you talk. You talk with your mouth, like this." He made a loud and rude noise with his mouth.Lily felt hurt and angry. She ran away and cried. She did not understand why Ben was so mean. She did not want to be his friend.The next day, Lily's mom came to her class. She wanted to show the kids how to sign. She said sign was a beautiful and fun way to communicate. She said sign was for everyone, not just for deaf people. She said sign was a gift that Lily shared with her.Lily was happy to see her mom. She hugged her and signed, "I love you, mom." She also saw Ben. He was sitting in his seat and frowning. He did not look happy.Lily's mom asked the kids if they wanted to learn some sign. All the kids raised their hands and said yes. Except for Ben. He said no. He said sign was stupid and silly. He said he did not want to learn it.Lily's mom looked at him and smiled. She said, "That's okay, Ben. You don't have to learn sign. But you should

Once there was a little girl who lived in a valley. Every day she would go to the same spot and look around. She loved what she saw.One day, while she was looking around, she saw a horse coming down the hill. It was a beautiful brown horse with a white mane. She watched as the horse slowly made its way down the hill and into the valley.The little girl became very excited and began to nod her head in agreement. The horse seemed very reliable. It seemed to know exactly where it was going.The little girl continued to nod her head as the horse walked across the valley and soon it disappeared out of sight. But the little girl knew, that every day, it would be back.

Lily and Ben are at the beach with Mom and Dad. They like to play in the sand and look for shells. Lily finds a big shell that is pink and shiny. She shows it to Ben."Look, Ben, I found a pretty shell!" Lily says."Wow, that is a nice shell, Lily. Can I see?" Ben asks.Lily gives the shell to Ben. He holds it to his ear and listens."I hear the sea!" Ben says.Lily wants to hear too. She takes the shell back and puts it to her ear."I hear it too!" Lily says.They smile and laugh. They put the shell in their bucket with other shells. They want to take them home and show Mom and Dad.But then they see something in the water. It is big and long and has a fin. It is a shark!"Look, Lily, a shark!" Ben says.Lily and Ben are scared. They drop the bucket and run to Mom and Dad."Mom, Dad, there is a shark in the water!" Lily and Ben say.Mom and Dad look at the water. They see the shark too. It is far away and does not come close to the shore."Don't worry, Lily and Ben, the shark is not going to hurt you. It is just swimming and looking for food. It is not interested in you or your shells," Mom says."Are you sure, Mom?" Lily asks."Yes, I am sure, Lily. Sharks are animals that live in the sea. They are not bad, they are just different. Sometimes they rise to the surface to breathe or to see what is around them. But they usually stay away from people," Dad says.Lily and Ben feel better. They go back to their bucket and pick up their shells. They still like the shells, but they also like to watch the shark. They think it is cool and amazing. They learn something new about the sea.

One day, Joanna and her dad went for a walk in the park. The sun was dry and Joanna looked up at the sky, happy to have a fun time. She saw a parrot in a tree and was very excited.Joanna asked her dad if she could get the parrot, but her dad disagreed. She pleaded, but he still said no. She was disappointed and said, "Maybe I can get it another time?"Joanna and her dad kept walking and as they approached the parrot again, Joanna noticed something strange. It was moving, slowly but surely, towards the edge of the tree. At first her dad didn't notice, but when he did he was quick to act. He grabbed the parrot before it could fly away. Joanna was so happy. Her dad put the parrot in her hands and said, "This time I didn't disagree". Joanna beamed with a big smile and cuddled the parrot in her arms. It was dry and gentle, a perfect companion for her walk. The parrot looked happy to be in her arms and enjoyed her company. From then on, Joanna was always known as the girl with the parrot.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a cheerful boy named Tim. He loved to play with his big red ball. Every day, he would go outside and kick the ball high in the sky.One sunny day, Tim was playing with his ball near a tall wall. He kicked the ball as hard as he could, but it hit the wall and fell down. Tim was sad, but he did not give up. He tried again and again to kick the ball over the wall.Finally, after many tries, Tim kicked the ball so high that it went over the wall. He was very happy and jumped with joy. His friends saw him and clapped their hands. They all played together, kicking the ball and having lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a smart barber named Tom. He had a little shop in the town. Tom loved to cut hair and make people look nice.One day, a boy named Tim came to Tom's shop. Tim was scared because he had never had a haircut before. He sat in the chair and said, "Please don't hurt me."Tom smiled and said, "Don't worry, Tim. I am a smart barber. I will be very gentle." Tom started to cut Tim's hair. At first, Tim was scared, but then he saw that it didn't hurt at all.Suddenly, a big bug flew into the shop. Tim saw the bug and let out a loud scream. "Aaaah! A bug!" Tom laughed and said, "Don't be scared, Tim. It's just a little bug." Tom gently shooed the bug away.When the haircut was done, Tim looked in the mirror and saw how nice his hair looked. He was very happy. Tim said, "Thank you, Tom. You are the best barber ever!" And from that day on, Tim was never scared to get a haircut again.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a tree named Mr. Tree. Mr. Tree was very jealous of his friend, Mr. River. Mr. River always had many fish and birds playing near him. Mr. Tree wanted to have friends too, but his leaves were not fun to play with.One day, Mr. Tree had an idea. He thought, "I can give the animals something they need. I can give them oxygen to breathe!" So, Mr. Tree started to make more oxygen for the animals. Soon, many animals came to play near Mr. Tree. They were happy and loved to breathe the fresh oxygen.But Mr. River was sad and felt left out. He didn't like that the animals played with Mr. Tree more than him. So, he decided to punish Mr. Tree by taking away some of his water. But, the animals didn't like this. They told Mr. River that they loved both Mr. Tree and Mr. River. They wanted to play with both of them. Mr. River felt bad and gave Mr. Tree his water back. From that day on, Mr. Tree and Mr. River shared their animals friends and were no longer jealous of each other.

Once upon a time, there was a big tree in the forest. The tree had many friends like birds, squirrels, and bugs. They all lived happily together in the tree.One day, a dangerous storm came. The wind blew very hard and the rain fell very fast. The tree and its friends were scared. The storm made a mark on the tree. The mark was long and deep.After the storm, the sun came out. The tree was still standing, and its friends were safe. They were happy that the tree was strong. The mark on the tree was a sign that it could face dangerous things and still keep its friends safe.

Once upon a time, there was a generous girl. Every day, she thanked her parents for all the good things they gave her. One day, the girl woke up feeling very excited. She thanked her parents for the wonderful surprise they had planned. But when the girl opened her eyes, she realized something was wrong. Her parents were gone and her room was empty. She felt so sad. The girl never thanked them for being so generous. She never got the chance to have a proper wake and say goodbye.

One day, a little girl named Amy found a fancy rug in her room. She did not know where it came from. She wanted to examine it. The rug was very pretty with many colors.Amy's mom came into the room. "Look, Mom! I found a fancy rug!" said Amy. Her mom looked at the rug and smiled. "Yes, it is very fancy. Do you like it?" asked Mom. "Yes, I like it a lot!" said Amy.Amy and her mom examined the fancy rug together. They saw many shapes and colors. They had fun looking at the rug. They put the rug on the floor and Amy played on it all day.

Once upon a time there was a nice neighbor who was always very friendly. He lived in a perfect house, and everybody liked him. One day, the neighbor was walking outside and saw a big puddle. He noticed that the water was very deep, so he decided to warn the other kids that were nearby.He said, “Be careful! That water is very deep, and you do not want to fall in!”The kids listened to him and stayed away from the puddle. They were so happy that their neighbor warned them.The neighbor was really nice, and he kept warning the kids about other things too, like not talking to strangers. His warnings were always perfect and the kids were very grateful for his help.

Once upon a time, there was a big man with a mustache. He lived in a small house near the park. The man liked to shrug when he did not know what to say. One day, he met a little dog with a mild smile. The dog was very cute and friendly.The man and the dog played together in the park. They ran and jumped, and the dog wagged its tail. The man would throw a ball, and the dog would bring it back. They had lots of fun. When they got tired, they sat under a big tree to rest.One day, the man could not find the dog. He looked everywhere in the park, but the dog was not there. The man felt sad and did not know what to do, so he shrugged. Then, he heard a bark from behind the tree. The little dog was there with its mild smile, and the man was very happy. They played together in the park, and the man with the mustache never lost his dog friend again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her friends at the park. One day, Lily and her friends were playing with a ball, and it went very far away. Lily ran to get the ball and saw a big tree. Under the tree, there was a cat taking a nap.Lily wanted to wake the cat up, so she said, "Hey, cat! Wake up!" The cat opened its eyes and looked at Lily. "Why did you wake me up?" the cat asked. "I want to know what number you are," Lily said. The cat thought for a moment and said, "I am number four."Lily was very happy to know the cat's number. She went back to her friends and told them about the cat. They all wanted to see the cat, so they ran to the tree. They were very loud, and the cat woke up again. The cat said, "Please be quiet. I need to nap."Lily and her friends learned that it is important to be quiet when someone is sleeping. They played far away from the tree, so the cat could nap in peace. And from that day on, they always remembered to be quiet when someone was taking a nap.

One day, Tom and his little sister, Sue, were playing in their room. They wanted to play a new game, so Tom had an idea. "Let's name each finger on our hands!" he said. Sue thought it was a fun idea, so they started.Tom said, "This is easy! My thumb is called 'Big Thumb', my first finger is called 'Pointer', my middle finger is called 'Tall Man', my ring finger is called 'Ringy', and my pinky is called 'Little Pinky'." Sue laughed and clapped her hands.Now it was Sue's turn. She looked at her fingers and thought for a moment. Then she said, "My thumb is called 'Yummy', my first finger is called 'Tickle', my middle finger is called 'Longy', my ring finger is called 'Ring-a-Ding', and my pinky is called 'Tiny'." Tom smiled and said, "Good job, Sue! That was easy and fun!"They kept playing and laughing, naming their fingers and making up stories about them. They had a great time together, and they learned that even simple games can be lots of fun.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a kind bunny named Bobo. Bobo loved to pass food to his friends, like apples and carrots. He had a big stomach because he loved to eat, but he was never selfish. He always shared his food with his friends.One day, a hungry squirrel named Squeaky came to the forest. Squeaky had a very small stomach and was always hungry. He saw Bobo pass some food to a bird and thought, "I want that food too!" But Squeaky was very selfish and did not want to share.Squeaky tried to take all the food for himself. He hid it in a big tree, but Bobo found out. Bobo told Squeaky, "Sharing is good, and being selfish is not nice." Squeaky felt sad and knew that Bobo was right.The next day, Squeaky decided to share his food with Bobo and the other animals. They all had a big party with lots of food to eat. Squeaky learned that sharing made him happy, and he was not selfish anymore. And from that day on, all the animals in the big green forest were friends and shared their food with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a young girl who loved to play in the mud. Every day, she would find a new spot in her garden to dig a hole in and have a good time making mud pies and castles.One day, a careless rabbit hopped across the garden and disturbed the mud. The girl became angry and shouted "go away rabbit, I won't let you break my mud!" But the rabbit didn't listen and continued to play in the mud. Suddenly, the ground shook and the mud hole started to break apart. The young girl quickly realised that the shaking was a small earthquake, and the rabbit was lucky to escape safely.The young girl learnt a valuable lesson that day - never be careless or angry with things that are not your own, because in an instant, everything can change.

Once upon a time, there was a graceful cat named Lucy. She loved to dance and play with her friends. Yesterday, she was playing with her best friend, a dog named Max.Max said, "I want to quit playing this game. Let's try something new!"Lucy agreed, and they started to play a new game. They were having fun, but then something unexpected happened. A big bird flew down from the sky and joined them.The big bird said, "I saw you two playing, and I want to play too!"Lucy and Max were surprised, but they let the big bird play with them. They all played together and had a great time. And from that day on, the three friends played together every day, and they never quit having fun.

Once there was a friendly brown bear named Bear. He had many friends in the port, including a fish named Fish. Each morning, Bear and Fish would go to the port to play. One day, Fish grabbed a stick and said, "Let's play catch!"Bear was so excited he could hardly contain himself. He shouted, "Yes!" and they began to play. As they threw the stick back and forth, Bear and Fish laughed and had so much fun.Soon it was time to go, so Fish threw the stick one last time. However, Bear's paws were so big that he missed it. Fish started to laugh."That's okay," Bear said. "Let's just keep playing tomorrow!" Bear and Fish said goodbye and each went their own way, but they were both thinking about how much fun they had in the port that day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was scared of the dark. One night, he saw a stair that went up to the attic. Tim had never been up there before.Tim took a deep breath and started to walk up the stair. He blinked his eyes to see better in the dark. With each step, he felt less scared. When he got to the top, he found a small light switch.Tim turned on the light and blinked again. He saw a big, soft teddy bear in the attic. Tim hugged the teddy bear and felt happy. He was not scared anymore. Tim took the teddy bear back to his room and slept with it every night.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw an ice cream truck, and Tim wanted an ice cream cone. His mom said, "Okay, let's get one!" Tim felt so happy, and he thought the ice cream cone was amazing.At the park, Tim saw a girl named Lucy. Lucy saw Tim's ice cream cone and wanted one too. But instead of asking nicely, she teased Tim. She said, "I bet I can eat my ice cream faster than you!" Tim felt sad, but he didn't want to fight.Tim's mom saw what happened and talked to Lucy. She said, "It's not nice to tease others. Let's all be friends and enjoy our ice cream together." Lucy said sorry to Tim, and they all ate their ice cream cones happily. They learned that being kind is better than teasing.

Once upon a time, there was a farm. On the farm, there were many animals. There was a big cow, a little pig, and a fragile bird. The bird had a hurt wing and could not fly.One day, the cow said to the pig, "Let's go play in the mud!" The pig was happy and said, "Yes, I want to join!" But the fragile bird could not join because of its hurt wing.The cow and the pig felt sad for the bird. They decided to help the bird. They found a soft nest for the bird to rest in. The bird was happy and said, "Thank you, friends!" The cow and the pig smiled. They were happy they could help their fragile friend.

Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named Ben. He loved to play with his little boy, Tim. They would run, jump, and pull toys all day long.One day, Tim and Ben found a big chest in the yard. They were very excited to see what was inside. Tim tried to open it, but it was too heavy. So, Ben used his strong teeth to pull the chest open.When the chest opened, out came many colorful balloons! They floated up into the sky. Tim and Ben were so surprised. They thought they would find toys or treasures, but the balloons were the best surprise of all. They laughed and played with the balloons all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play outside in the dirt. He liked to dig and make big holes in the earth. One day, Tim found a small, round rock. He did not know it was a magic rock. Tim was ignorant about the rock's power.Tim took the rock home and showed it to his mom. She told him to put it away. Tim put the rock on his shelf, but he did not know what would happen next. That night, Tim had a dream. In the dream, a big voice told him, "Shake the rock and see what happens."The next day, Tim remembered his dream. He thought it was just a silly dream, but he decided to try it. Tim picked up the rock and shook it. Suddenly, the earth outside began to shake too. Tim was scared, but then he realized it was the magic rock making the earth shake. He stopped shaking the rock, and the earth stopped shaking too.From that day on, Tim knew that the rock was magic. He learned that he could use the rock to help others. He was no longer ignorant about the rock's power. Tim and the magic rock became great friends, and they had many adventures together.

Once upon a time there was a young girl named Rachel. She always loved to play in the park near her house and so one day she ran out of the house and went to the park. Rachel was running around and around, when suddenly she fell down onto the cool grass. Rachel was really hurt and she could hardly move. Tears started to fill her eyes and her neck started to hurt. Rachel looked around, but no one was there to help her so she cried. Suddenly, she heard a voice. An old man with a kind face knelt down beside her and said, "What happened little one?" Rachel told him about her fall and how her neck hurt.The man looked carefully at Rachel's neck and said, "You probably pulled something, don't worry, I'm here to help. Let me take you home." Rachel was so thankful that the kind man had come to her rescue. When they arrived at Rachel's house, the man gave her a hug goodbye, then he realized that Rachel did not need his help anymore. He smiled, gave her one last wave and went on his way. Rachel went inside and hugged her mom - she was so relieved that the kind old man was there to help her.

One day, a little girl named Sue wanted to pack her toys. She put her dolls, cars, and blocks in a big bag. Sue was going on a trip to the beach with her family. She was very excited to play in the sand and swim in the water.When they got to the beach, Sue saw the waves in the water. She ran to the edge and watched the waves come and go. Some waves were big and fierce, and some were small and gentle. Sue liked the small waves best because they were fun to jump over.Sue's mom came to play with her in the water. "Be careful of the fierce waves," Mom said. "We should stay close to the shore." Sue and her mom played in the water, laughing and splashing each other. They had a great time at the beach, and Sue was happy she packed her toys for the trip.

One day, a little girl named Sue was playing with her toy car. She had a fun idea. "I will hold a race for all my toys!" she said. Sue got all her toys and put them in a line. She made sure they were all clean and ready to race."Ready, set, go!" Sue yelled. The toys started to race. The toy car was very fast, but the toy bear was slow. The toy bear had an idea. "I will ride on the toy car," said the bear. The toy car and the toy bear started to race together. They were very fast and happy.But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew all the toys away. The toy car and the toy bear held on tight to each other. The wind stopped and they landed far away. They looked around and saw a new world full of big, clean toys. The toy car and the toy bear smiled. "Let's have a big race here!" they said. And they did, with all their new friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a humble vendor. He sold toys to kids. Every day, he would say, "Come, kids! Buy my toys!"One day, a little girl came to the vendor. She asked, "Can I have a toy, please?" The vendor smiled and gave her a toy. She was very happy.The next day, the little girl came back. She said, "I want another toy, please." The vendor was surprised but gave her another toy. This happened again and again. Each day, the little girl would come and repeat, "I want another toy, please."The vendor started to think, "Why does she need so many toys?" One day, he decided to follow her. He saw the little girl give the toys to other kids who had none. The vendor was so happy to see her kindness. From that day on, he gave her a toy every day to share with others. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny called Jimmy. One day, he was taking a nap under a tree. Suddenly, he heard a noise coming from a hole nearby. When Jimmy looked closer, he saw a tiny creature poking its head out of the hole. It was wearing a hat and had a very unusual face. The creature smiled at Jimmy and said "Hi!".Jimmy was very curious and wanted to learn more about the creature. It smiled back at Jimmy, and displayed a tiny image of a rainbow-coloured house in its hands. The creature said "This is where I live!" Jimmy thought it was amazing and he kept looking at the beautiful picture with fascination.The creature then said "Would you like to visit me?" Jimmy replied "Yes!" and the creature smiled, hopping out of its hole and running away into a nearby field. Jimmy followed it, holding the creature's hand in his own.When they reached the rainbow house, Jimmy was amazed. He looked around and saw all kinds of unusual creatures running around and playing. Jimmy smiled and waved at them as he was guided into the house by the creature. Inside, the house was full of colourful lights, glitter and laughter. Jimmy beamed with excitement, happy to have found such a curious place.

Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named Max. Max lived with a girl named Lily. They loved to play outside every day. One day, Max and Lily went for a walk near a big cliff. Max saw something near the cliff and barked, "Woof, woof!"Lily looked at the cliff and saw a small flower that was about to bloom. "Look, Max! A flower is going to bloom soon!" she said. Max wagged his tail, happy to see the flower. They went back home, but Lily had a plan.The next day, Lily and Max went back to the cliff. This time, the flower had bloomed into a beautiful, big flower. "Wow, Max! The flower bloomed just like I thought it would!" Lily said with a big smile. Max barked happily, and they both enjoyed the view of the flower by the cliff. They promised to come back and visit the flower again.

Once upon a time, there was a little kid named Tim. Tim loved to act wild and play with his friends. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long.One day, Tim and his friends decided to act like wild animals. Tim acted like a lion, and his friend Sue acted like a monkey. They had so much fun pretending to be wild animals. They roared and jumped around in the park."Let's have a wild animal race!" said Tim. All the kids lined up and started to run. They acted like their favorite wild animals as they raced. Tim roared like a lion, and Sue chattered like a monkey.At the end of the race, everyone was tired but happy. They had so much fun acting wild and being kids. They all agreed to have more wild races in the future. And from that day on, Tim and his friends had many more wild adventures together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to find new things. One day, she went for a walk with her mom and dad. They walked and walked until they saw a big building. It was a university. Amy thought it was amazing.Inside the university, Amy saw many big kids. They were learning and playing. Amy wanted to learn and play too. But the big kids said, "You are too little, Amy. You cannot play with us." Amy was sad. She wanted to show them that she could play and learn too.Amy had an idea. She ran and found a big book. She opened the book and started to read. The big kids were surprised. They said, "Wow, Amy! You are amazing!" They let Amy play and learn with them. Amy was happy. She had new friends at the university.

One day, a little cat saw a big square toy. The cat wanted the square toy, but it was not hers. She saw the toy in a dog's yard. The little cat was sad because she wanted to play with the square toy.The little cat said to the dog, "Can I play with your square toy, please?" The dog said, "No, this is my toy. You can't play with it." The little cat was very sad and walked away.At night, the little cat went back to the dog's yard. She wanted to steal the square toy. She took it and ran away. The next day, the dog saw the little cat playing with the square toy. The dog was sad. The little cat felt bad and gave the toy back to the dog. They both decided to share the toy and play together.

Once upon a time, in a big park, there was a stubborn little boy named Tim. He loved to play with his friends every day. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long. One day, they decided to have a march. They lined up and began to walk, holding hands and singing songs.Tim's mom told him not to go too far away from her, but Tim did not listen. He was stubborn and kept marching with his friends. They marched far away from their moms and dads. This made Tim's mom and dad very worried.When Tim and his friends finally came back, his mom was not happy. She decided to punish Tim for not listening. Tim had to sit on a chair and think about what he did wrong. He felt sad, but he learned that he should always listen to his mom and dad. From that day on, Tim was not stubborn anymore and always stayed close to his mom and dad when they played in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a big red ball. It was on the tip of a hill. A little girl named Jane saw the ball. She wanted to play with it. Jane was envious of the ball because it was so big and red.One day, Jane tried to pull the ball down the hill. She pulled and pulled, but the ball did not move. Jane was sad. She did not know what to do.Then, a little boy named Tom came. He saw Jane and the big red ball. Tom had an idea. He said, "Let's both pull the ball!" Jane and Tom pulled together. Suddenly, the ball was not a ball. It was a big red balloon! They were surprised. Jane and Tom played with the balloon and became friends.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a big flame. The flame was very hot and bright. It was always burning and never stopped. The people in the village were sad because the flame made their houses very hot.One day, a little girl named Lily decided to try to stop the flame. She thought the flame was selfish because it did not care about the people in the village. Lily went to the flame and asked, "Please stop, flame. You are making our houses too hot."The flame did not want to stop. It said, "I like being big and bright. I don't want to stop." Lily was sad, but she did not give up. She went to the river and filled a bucket with water. She threw the water on the flame. The flame got smaller and smaller until it stopped.The people in the village were very happy. Their houses were not hot anymore. They thanked Lily for being brave and helping them. The flame learned that it was not good to be selfish. From that day on, the flame only burned when the people needed it to keep warm.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat yogurt. One day, he found a big cup of yogurt on the table. He was so happy!After eating the yogurt, Tim felt tired. He wanted to take a nap. So, he went to his room and lay down on his bed. Soon, he was fast asleep.While Tim was napping, he had a dream. In his dream, there was a big, scared dog. Tim wanted to help the dog. He gave the dog some yogurt, and the dog stopped being scared. Tim and the dog became friends. When Tim woke up from his nap, he felt happy and smiled.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tim. Tim lived in a high tree with his family. He loved to fly and play with his friends all day.One day, Tim saw a big jail near his tree. He was curious and wanted to see what was inside. Tim flew closer and saw a cat trapped in the jail. The cat was very sad and began to cry.Tim wanted to help the cat, so he flew back to his friends. Together, they found the key to open the jail. They set the cat free and everyone was happy. The cat stopped crying and became friends with Tim and his friends. They all played together and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a favorite shoe that he loved to wear every day. One day, while playing outside, Tim lost his shoe. He was very sad and did not know what to do.As Tim walked home, he saw a big cat. The cat was holding Tim's shoe in its mouth! The cat saw Tim and came closer. Then, the cat did something unexpected. It turned into a magic fairy! The fairy said, "I found your shoe, Tim. I will give it back to you if you promise to be grateful and help others."Tim was very happy and promised to be grateful and help others. The fairy gave Tim his shoe back and flew away. From that day on, Tim always remembered to be grateful and help others whenever he could.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lucy went to a show with her mom. They saw a huge stage with many kids. Lucy wanted to join them and have fun too.Lucy asked her mom, "Can I join the kids on the stage?" Her mom said, "Yes, you can." So Lucy went up to the stage and started to dance with the other kids. They all had big smiles on their faces.Suddenly, a big, funny dog came on the stage. The dog started to dance with the kids too! Everyone was surprised and laughed. The dog made the show even more fun. Lucy and her new friends had a great time dancing with the funny dog.

Once upon a time, there was a little island in the big sea. The island was very dizzy because it would spin around and around all day. One day, a little girl named Lily came to visit the island.Lily asked the island, "Why do you spin around all the time?" The island replied, "I want to become a big island, so I spin to grow bigger." Lily thought about it and said, "I don't think spinning will make you bigger. But I have an idea!"Lily asked her friends, the birds, to help her. The birds brought seeds from far away lands. They planted the seeds on the island. Soon, trees and flowers grew, and the island stopped spinning. It was not dizzy anymore."Look!" said Lily, "You have become a beautiful island now!" The island smiled and thanked Lily and her bird friends. From that day on, the island was very happy and became a home for many animals. And they all lived happily ever after.

Anna and Lily are sisters. They like to play with their mom's makeup. They think it is fun to put on lipstick, eyeshadow and blush. They pretend they are princesses or movie stars.One day, they hear the phone ring in the living room. They run to answer it, but mom says, "No, girls, that is for me. It might be an important call. Go back to your room and play quietly."Anna and Lily are sad. They want to talk on the phone too. They think it is more fun than playing with makeup. They go back to their room, but they do not play. They sit on the bed and wait.After a while, they hear mom say, "Bye, thank you for calling. Have a nice day." They hear her hang up the phone. They jump off the bed and run to the living room again."Mom, mom, can we talk on the phone now?" they ask. "Is the phone available?"Mom smiles and hugs them. "Yes, girls, the phone is available now. But who do you want to call?"Anna and Lily look at each other and giggle. They have an idea."We want to call grandma!" they say. "We want to tell her about our makeup and how pretty we are!"Mom laughs and dials grandma's number. She hands the phone to Anna and Lily. They take turns talking to grandma and telling her about their makeup. Grandma tells them they are very pretty and she loves them. Anna and Lily are happy. They love grandma and they love the phone. They thank mom for letting them use it.The end.

Sam likes to play with his guitar. He has a red guitar that makes loud sounds when he hits the strings. He likes to sing songs with his guitar and pretend he is a rock star.One day, Sam wants to play with his guitar outside. He sees that it is sunny and warm. He thinks it is a good day to play. He puts on his hat and his shoes and takes his guitar. He runs to the backyard and finds a spot under a tree.He starts to play his guitar and sing. He is having fun. He does not see the dark clouds in the sky. He does not hear the thunder. He does not feel the wind.Suddenly, it starts to rain. Big drops of water fall from the sky. They hit Sam and his guitar. They make Sam and his guitar wet. Sam is surprised. He stops playing and singing. He looks up at the sky. He wonders why it is raining.He sees his mom coming out of the house. She has an umbrella. She calls his name. She tells him to come inside. She says it is not safe to play outside when it is raining.Sam does not want to go inside. He likes to play with his guitar. He does not mind being wet. He thinks the rain is fun. He shrugs his shoulders. He says he is fine. He says he wants to stay.His mom shakes her head. She says he has to go inside. She says he can catch a cold if he stays wet. She says he can play with his guitar inside. She says he can play again outside when the rain stops.Sam is not happy. He does not want to catch a cold. He does not want to stop playing. He does not want to go inside. But he knows his mom is right. He knows his mom loves him. He knows his mom wants him to be safe.He picks up his guitar. He follows his mom. He

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lucy went for a walk in the dark forest. She had a pretty comb in her hair. She liked to walk and see the big trees and green grass.As she walked, she met a friendly bunny. The bunny said, "Hi, Lucy! What is that in your hair?" Lucy smiled and said, "It's my comb. It makes my hair look nice."They walked together, and something happened. Lucy's comb fell out of her hair! The bunny saw it and picked it up. He gave it back to Lucy. She said, "Thank you, bunny!" They kept walking and had a fun day in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was always ready to play with her friends. One day, she found a piece of paper on the ground. Sue had an idea to make a fun game with the paper.Sue and her friends played with the paper all day. They made it into a hat, then a boat, and even a plane. They all smiled and laughed as they played. But soon, the sky turned dark, and it was time to go home.Sue did not want to stop playing, so she frowned. She tried to keep the paper, but it got wet in the rain. The paper was not fun anymore. Sue was sad, and her friends went home. The day was over, and it was a bad ending.

Tom and Jen are friends. They like to play in the park. They see a big wheel. The wheel can spin very fast. They want to try it."Can we go on the wheel?" Tom asks Jen."Yes, let's go!" Jen says. They run to the wheel. They give some coins to the man. The man lets them sit on a seat. The seat has fur. It is soft and warm.The wheel starts to spin. Tom and Jen are happy. They see the trees and the sky. They feel the wind on their faces. They laugh and wave.But the wheel spins too fast. Tom and Jen feel sick. They want to stop. They cry and scream."Help! Help!" they shout. But the man does not hear them. He is busy with other kids. He does not see Tom and Jen.The wheel spins higher and higher. Tom and Jen are scared. They hold each other. They close their eyes.But then, something bad happens. The seat breaks. Tom and Jen fall. They hit the ground. They do not move. They do not breathe.The wheel stops. The man sees Tom and Jen. He is shocked. He calls for help. But it is too late. Tom and Jen are gone.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big garden where he liked to grow all kinds of plants. He wanted to grow healthy plants that made everyone happy. One day, he found a special seed and planted it in his garden.As the days went by, the seed started to grow. Tim was so excited! He talked to the plant every day. "Grow big and strong, little plant!" he said. The plant grew and grew, and soon, it was taller than Tim. It had a big, green leaf with an image of a happy face on it.One day, Tim's friend, Sue, came over to play. She saw the big, healthy plant and said, "Wow, Tim! Your plant is so big and happy!" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, it is! I talk to it every day and it grows bigger and bigger!" Sue and Tim played in the garden all day, and they were very happy to have such a special plant in their lives.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her blocks. She would stack them up high and be very proud of her tall towers. One day, her little brother, Tim, wanted to play with her blocks too.Lily did not want to allow Tim to play with her blocks. She was afraid he would knock down her towers. This made Tim very sad. He just wanted to play with his big sister and have fun too.Their mom saw the problem and had an idea. She gave Tim his own stack of blocks to play with. Lily and Tim both built their towers together. They were both proud of their stacks. Now, they could play together and be happy.

Once upon a time, there was a baby duck named Daisy. Daisy was very brave and wanted to make new friends. One day, she met a funny frog named Fred. He wanted to introduce Daisy to a place called Successville. Daisy was excited!Fred hopped off and Daisy decided to follow him. On the way, she was a bit scared. They had to cross a forest with lots of tall, dark trees. Daisy was nervous but she kept going.Finally, they arrived at Successville. It was filled with beautiful things - mountains, lakes and lots of animals. Daisy was so happy to be there! She quickly forgot about how scary the forest had been.When Daisy and Fred came back, Daisy thanked her friend for introducing her to Successville. She promised to never forget it. Daisy had a great time, and she was even more determined to be brave and make new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big factory. This factory made yummy treats for everyone. The factory workers stored the treats in boxes. They sent the boxes to stores so kids could buy them.One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the store with her mom. Lucy saw the yummy treats from the factory. She wanted one, but her mom said, "Not today, Lucy." Lucy felt sad but she listened to her mom.On their way home, they saw a man who had dropped his box of yummy treats. Lucy helped him pick them up. The man was so happy that he gave Lucy a treat from the factory. Lucy learned that helping others can bring good things to you.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to explore. One day, she found a strange dark spot on the ground. She was curious, so she reached out to touch it. It didn't feel like soil or wood; the texture was different. The little girl looked closer and she saw that it seemed to be a hole. She noticed a small, dark thing inside the hole. "What is that?" she said. She leaned in to take a closer look. Suddenly, a tiny mouse jumped out! The little girl quickly backed away, feeling scared.The mouse told her, "Don't be afraid; I'm just like you. I just wanted a place to hide from the sun." The little girl nodded and said she understood. The moral of the story is that it's important to understand that everyone is different and have different needs. We should always try to be understanding and compassionate.

Once upon a time, there was a kid named Tim. Tim liked to play outside. One day, he saw a big rock. The rock was rough. Tim wanted to move the rock."Hi, rock!" Tim said. "Can you please move?" But the rock did not move. Tim pushed the rock, but it was too heavy. Tim was sad.Tim's friend, Sue, came to help. "Let's move the rock together!" she said. Tim and Sue pushed the rock. The rock moved! They were happy. Now they could keep playing.

Once upon a time, there was an old fridge. It lived in a small house with a little girl and her mom. The old fridge had many yummy things inside like milk, fruit, and cake. The little girl loved to eat the cake from the fridge.One day, the old fridge stopped working. It was very sad and weep. The milk, fruit, and cake inside the fridge became bad. The little girl did not know what happened to the old fridge.The little girl tried to eat the cake, but it was not good anymore. She felt sad and started to weep too. Her mom told her that they could not fix the old fridge. They had to throw away the milk, fruit, and cake. The little girl and the old fridge were very sad and they cried together.

Lily was very happy. She got an invitation to Ben's birthday party. She liked Ben. He was her friend. He liked to play with cars and blocks. She wanted to give him a nice present.She asked her mom to help her wrap the present. Her mom gave her some paper and tape. Lily tried to fold the paper around the present. But the paper was too big. She tried to cut it with scissors. But the scissors were too sharp. She cut her finger. She cried.Her mom hugged her and put a band-aid on her finger. She said, "Don't worry, Lily. I'll help you wrap the present. You can make a card for Ben. That will make him happy."Lily nodded. She took a piece of paper and some crayons. She drew a picture of Ben and her. She wrote, "Happy birthday, Ben. I like you. From Lily." She smiled. She liked her card.She put the card in an envelope. She wrote Ben's name on it. She was ready to go to the party. She grabbed her present and her card. She ran to the door. She was very excited.But she did not see the cat. The cat was sleeping on the rug. Lily tripped over the cat. She fell down. She dropped her present and her card. The present broke. The card tore. The cat hissed. Lily cried.Her mom heard the noise. She came to the door. She saw Lily and the cat and the mess. She said, "Oh, Lily. What happened?"Lily sobbed. She said, "I'm sorry, mom. I ruined everything. Ben won't like me anymore. He won't want me at his party."Her mom hugged her and said, "No, Lily. That's not true. Ben will still like you. He will still want you at his party. Accidents happen. We can fix this. We can get a new present. We can make a new card. We c

One day, a yellow bird named Sunny was playing with his friend, a blue fish named Fin. They liked to play near the water. Sunny would fly up high and dive into the water. Fin would jump up from the water and try to touch the top of the water."Let's play a new game," said Sunny. "I will dive into the water, and you try to jump to the top at the same time.""Okay," said Fin, "I will try my best."Sunny flew up high and started to dive. Fin swam fast and jumped up. They both tried to reach the top of the water at the same time. They did it! They were so happy and laughed together.From that day on, Sunny and Fin played their new game every day. They always tried to reach the top of the water together. And they were the best of friends, always helping each other and having fun.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a kind boy named Tim. He had a special power. Tim could fill things with love and happiness. He loved to help people and animals.One day, Tim saw a sad dog. He went to the dog and used his power to fill the dog's heart with love. The dog became happy and wagged its tail. The dog's owner saw this and was very thankful to Tim.Tim's friends saw his power and wanted to be kind like him. They started helping others too. The whole village became a happy place. The moral of the story is that being kind can make the world a better place.

Once upon a time, there was a doctor. The doctor was very nice. He helped people when they were sick. One day, a naughty dog came to the doctor's place. The dog was making a big mess. The doctor was not happy.The doctor wanted to make the naughty dog nice. He gave the dog a yummy treat. The dog liked the treat. The doctor said, "You need to be nice, not naughty." The dog wagged its tail and stopped being naughty.Everyone saw the doctor help the naughty dog. They were very happy. They all clapped their hands. They said, "Yay! The doctor is so good!" The doctor and the dog smiled. They were happy too.

Once upon a time, two friends, Bob and Lisa, were sitting in Bob's living-room. They wanted something special to eat. "Let's make popcorn," Lisa said."Yes, let's," Bob agreed.They got a pot, filled it with oil and put the corn kernels in. Then they put the pot on the stove and waited.Soon, the corn was popping and making a loud sound. Bob and Lisa watched with excitement. When the sound stopped, they knew the popcorn was ready. They took it off the stove and spread it out. It was thick and smelled amazing. Bob and Lisa couldn't wait to dig in. So, they grabbed some bowls and printed the popcorn into them. "Yummy!" Bob said, popping a piece of popcorn into his mouth.Lisa smiled in agreement as she enjoyed the delicious popcorn. They ate it all up and had a wonderful time.

One day, a big dog and a little cat were playing near a door. The big dog said, "Let's play a game. I will shut the door and we will see who can open it."The little cat said, "Okay, but I am small. It may not be easy for me to open the door."The big dog shut the door and they both tried to open it. The big dog pushed hard, but the door would not open. The little cat tried too, but it was not easy for her. They both felt sad and sat on the ground.Then, a wise old bird saw them and asked, "Why are you both sad?"The big dog told the bird about their game. The wise old bird said, "You should help each other. If you work together, it will be easy."The big dog and the little cat listened to the wise old bird. They worked together and opened the door. They were happy and thanked the wise old bird. From that day, they always helped each other and learned that working together makes things easy.

Ben and Lily were playing in their room. They had many toys and books, but they wanted to try something new. They saw a big box in the closet. It was from Mom's new TV."Let's play with the box!" Ben said. "We can make a house or a car or a rocket!""OK!" Lily said. "But how do we get the box out? It is too big for the door."Ben had an idea. He found Mom's scissors and cut the box into smaller pieces. He gave some to Lily and kept some for himself. They taped the pieces together and made their own shapes."Look, I made a car!" Ben said. He put wheels and a steering wheel on his shape. He got inside and pretended to drive."Beep beep!""Look, I made a rocket!" Lily said. She put wings and a cone on her shape. She got inside and pretended to fly."Zoom zoom!"They had fun with their shapes. But then they heard Mom coming upstairs."Uh oh, we have to clean up!" Ben said. "Mom will be mad if she sees the mess."They tried to put the pieces back in the box, but they did not fit. They had cut them too much."What do we do?" Lily said. "We can't hide them under the bed or in the drawers. They are too big."Ben had another idea. He found Mom's hair dryer and plugged it in. He pointed it at the pieces and turned it on."Maybe this will shrink them!" he said.But it did not work. The pieces did not shrink. They only got hot and smelly."Stop, stop!" Lily said. "You are making it worse!"They turned off the hair dryer and looked at the pieces. They were brown and wrinkled and sticky.They heard Mom knock on the door."Ben, Lily, what are you doing in there?" Mom said.They did not know what to say. They looked at each

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play outside. They have a big box of chalk. They can make pictures on the sidewalk with chalk.One day, they find a big orange chalk. It is very bright and pretty. They want to draw a big sun with it. But the orange chalk is too heavy. They cannot lift it."Let's crawl with it," Lily says. "We can push it with our hands.""OK," Ben says. "But we have to be careful. We don't want to break it."They crawl on the sidewalk with the orange chalk. They push it slowly and gently. They make a long orange line. They are happy.They reach a big empty space. They can draw a big sun there. They stop crawling. They sit up."Wow, look at our line!" Lily says. "It is so long and orange. It looks like a snake.""It does," Ben says. "But we want a sun, not a snake. How can we make a sun?"They think for a moment. Then they have an idea."We can make a circle with the orange chalk," Lily says. "And then we can make rays with other colors.""Good idea," Ben says. "Let's do it."They use the orange chalk to make a big circle. Then they use other chalks to make rays. They use yellow, red, pink, purple, blue, and green. They make a beautiful sun.They look at their sun. They smile. They are proud.They hear a voice."Wow, what a nice sun!" It is Mom. She has come to pick them up."Thank you, Mom," Lily and Ben say. "We made it with chalk. We crawled with a big orange chalk. It was fun."Mom hugs them. She is proud too."Let's go home," she says. "You can show me your sun tomorrow. It will still be there."They nod. They take their box of chalk. They wave goodbye to their sun.They go home wi

Once upon a time, there lived two bad birds called Bob and Bea. Every day, they would fly up high and steal fuel. They had so much fuel that they did not know what to do with it, so they locked it away in a big and sour cave.One day, Bob and Bea flew over a peaceful town and thought they could try to steal something else. But when they landed, they heard a loud voice shouting: "Get away! Get away!" It was the sheriff. He knew Bob and Bea were up to no good, so he locked them up in a cage.The sheriff then took all the fuel that Bob and Bea had stolen and used it to make a feast for the town. Everyone in the town was so happy and thanked the sheriff for his kindness.Bob and Bea were very sad and vowed never to steal again. From then on, they would help the sheriff protect the town from bad birds, and they are still doing it today.

Once upon a time, there was a big family of animals. They all lived in a home in the woods. There were cats, dogs, birds, and mice. They loved to play together and have fun. But one day, they got lost and could not find their way back home.The animals were sad and impatient. They wanted to go back to their home. They missed their warm beds and yummy food. So, they decided to unite and work together to find their home. They knew they could do it if they helped each other.The cats climbed trees to look for their home. The dogs sniffed the ground to find the right path. The birds flew high in the sky to see the way. And the mice listened for sounds of their friends. They all worked together, and soon they found their home. They were so happy to be back, and they knew that when they unite, they could do anything.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his friends in the park. One day, Spot found a big book called a dictionary. He did not know what it was, but he liked how it looked.Spot wanted to make the dictionary look even better, so he decided to decorate it. He found some pretty stickers and put them on the cover. Then, he drew a picture of himself and his friends playing in the park.When he was done, Spot showed the decorated dictionary to his friends. They all liked how it looked, and they took turns looking at the big book. Spot was happy that he could make the dictionary pretty and share it with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a cat. The cat was very interesting. It could do tricks. One day, the cat went to a big show. Many people came to see the cat.At the show, the cat did many tricks. The people were happy and they applaud. But, there was a dog. The dog did not like the cat. The dog was mad that the cat was getting all the claps.The dog wanted to stop the cat. So, the dog made a plan. The dog put a big rock on the stage. The cat did not see the rock. The cat fell on the rock and got hurt. The people were sad. The cat could not do tricks anymore. The dog won, but nobody was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved the color blue. Everywhere she went, she wore blue. She even had a beautiful blue dress which made her feel so happy.One day, her mom took her to the store. The little girl was very excited because she wanted to pay for something special. She looked around for the perfect item and found something that made her even more excited - a little blue knife! It was perfect.The little girl proudly said to her mom, "Can I pay for this, please?" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, of course you can. Let's go pay now". So they went to the cash register and the little girl happily paid for her blue knife. Now she could play with it all the time and she was so happy. The end.

Lila and Ben were friends who liked to play in the valley. The valley had many flowers, trees and animals. Lila and Ben liked to make crowns with the flowers and pretend they were kings and queens.One day, they saw a shiny car parked near the valley. The car was red and had a big star on the front. Lila and Ben thought the car was very expensive and beautiful. They wanted to see it closer.They ran to the car and looked inside. They saw a bag on the seat. The bag had a zipper and a lock. Lila and Ben were curious. They wanted to know what was in the bag.They tried to open the zipper, but it was stuck. They tried to break the lock, but it was hard. They did not hear the footsteps behind them."Hey, what are you doing?" a voice shouted. It was the owner of the car. He was angry and scared. He thought Lila and Ben were trying to steal his bag.Lila and Ben were scared too. They dropped the bag and ran away. They did not want to steal. They just wanted to see.They ran back to the valley and hid behind a tree. They hugged each other and cried. They were sorry for what they did. They learned a lesson. They never touched things that did not belong to them again.

Once upon a time, there was a happy bird. She was playing in the sunshine, hopping around in the grass and singing her happy song. She looked up and smiled when she saw a little girl walking by. The little girl stopped and waved at the bird and the bird nodded back.The little girl then asked the bird: "Hi, birdy. What are you doing?"The bird smiled and said: "I am feeling happy and playing in the sunshine!"The little girl smiled back and the bird nodded.The bird then said, "I'm getting ready to fly up and touch the sunshine up in the sky."The little girl said with excitement, "You can do that?! I want to come with you and touch the sunshine too!" The bird nodded and said, "Yes! You can come with me! We can touch the sunshine together." This made the little girl very happy. So, the happy bird and the little girl both flew up and touched the sunshine. The sunshine made them both very happy, and they flew around together for the rest of the day.

Once there was a Mommy and a baby. The Mommy was very loving and kind to the baby. Every day she would feed him yummy food. One day the Mommy decided to throw a party. Everyone was so excited! There were balloons, streamers, and presents.Mommy wanted to make sure the party was perfect, so she was very strict. She was very harsh and didn't let anyone have too much fun. Some of the guests got angry with Mommy for being so harsh.But then, Mommy's friend Jazzy offered to help. She fed the guests delicious food and made sure everyone was having fun. Mommy smiled and thanked Jazzy for her help. The party ended with everyone laughing and smiling.

One day, a little girl named Sue found a birdcage in her room. It was old and dirty. Sue wanted to make it pretty again. She got a cloth and began to polish the birdcage. As she cleaned, she talked to herself, "I will make you beautiful!"Just then, a little bird flew into her room. The bird saw the birdcage and was ashamed. "Oh no," said the bird, "I don't want to live in a cage!" Sue heard the bird and felt sad. She didn't want the bird to be unhappy.But then, something unexpected happened. The birdcage started to change! It became a beautiful birdhouse instead. The little bird was so happy. "Thank you, Sue!" said the bird. Sue smiled and knew that she had made a new friend.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to the park. She saw a boy with a basket. The basket was unusual. It was big and blue with red dots. Sue wanted to try to play with the basket."Hi, can I try your basket?" Sue asked the boy. The boy said, "Yes, but be careful. It is not a normal basket." Sue picked up the basket and tried to put a ball in it. But when she did, something unexpected happened.The ball turned into a big, bouncy balloon! Sue and the boy were very surprised. They played with the balloon and the unusual basket all day. They had so much fun together. The boy said, "I am happy you tried my basket. Now we can be friends." Sue smiled and they played until the sun went down.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a sister named Emma. Lily and Emma liked to play together. They played with dolls, they played with blocks, and they played with a ball.One day, Lily and Emma were playing with a ball. They threw it back and forth to each other. But then, the ball went too far and landed in a tree. Lily and Emma tried to get the ball down, but they could not reach it.Lily said, "What if we surrender and ask Mom for help?" Emma agreed, and they went to find their mom. Mom came and helped them get the ball down from the tree. Lily and Emma were very proud of their mom.Then, Mom said, "It's okay to ask for help when you need it. That's how we learn and grow." Lily and Emma understood the lesson and thanked their mom. They knew that they should not be afraid to ask for help when they needed it.From that day on, Lily and Emma always asked for help when they needed it. They learned many new things and were very happy. They knew that asking for help was a good thing, and it made them feel proud.

Once upon a time, there was a big red truck. The truck was very original. It could do many things that other trucks could not do. The truck had a big smile and loved to play with the children in the park.One sunny day, the truck went to the park to perform a show. The children were very happy to see the truck. The truck could dance, sing, and even make funny faces. The children laughed and clapped their hands as they watched the truck's show.After the show, the children played with the truck.
