Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to observe the view from his window. Every day, he would look outside and see the big tree, the green grass, and the mild sun shining in the sky.One day, Tim saw a little bird sitting on the tree. The bird looked sad. Tim opened his window and asked, "Why are you sad, little bird?" The bird replied, "I am sad because I lost my home. The wind was too strong and blew it away."Tim wanted to help the little bird. He thought and thought, and then he had an idea. Tim decided to take the bird's home from another bird's tree. He thought that it would make the sad bird happy again. But when he took the other bird's home, that bird became sad too.In the end, both birds were sad, and Tim learned that taking something from someone else is not the right way to solve a problem. The moral value of the story is that we should always try to find a better way to help others without causing more sadness.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to climb trees. One day, he found a big stick under a tall tree. Tim wanted to climb the tree with the stick.As Tim climbed up the tree with the stick, he saw a bird. The bird said, "Hi, Tim! I have a spicy secret to tell you." Tim was very surprised. He did not know that birds could talk!The bird told Tim that the stick was magic. When Tim climbed down the tree with the magic stick, he found that it could make things spicy. He touched his food, and it became spicy. Tim and the bird became best friends, and they had many spicy adventures together.

Once upon a time there was a little fly. He liked to play.One day he was having lots of fun flying around. He flew over a meadow and saw a little rabbit playing in the grass. The fly wanted to play too, so he flew down and said hi.The rabbit was so excited! He showed the fly all the games he liked to play. They rolled around in the grass, chased each other around, and even tried to catch a few bubbles.When the sun went down, the fly said goodbye and flew off into the sky. He waved goodnight to the rabbit, who said goodbye and watched the fly fly away until he was out of sight. The little fly had had so much fun playing with his new friend, the rabbit!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved to eat pastry. One day, Mia saw a big pastry on the table. She was very happy and said, "Yummy! I want to eat this pastry."Mia's mom saw her and said, "Be careful, Mia! You need to tie your shoes first, or you might fall." Mia looked down and saw her shoes were untied. She tried to tie them, but it was hard. So, Mia's mom helped her tie her shoes.Now that Mia's shoes were tied, she could eat the pastry. She took a big bite and it was so tasty. Mia shared the pastry with her mom, and they both enjoyed it together. They were very happy and careful while eating the yummy pastry.

Once upon a time, there was a little green frog. He hopped around on a hot summer day and his nose started to tickle. He let out a big sneeze, "ACHOO!"A nearby butterfly heard the sneeze and asked the frog, "What's wrong?""My nose tickled," the frog replied."Why don't you take a nap in my net?" the butterfly said.The frog nodded and hopped into the net. It was comfy and the frog dozed off quickly. The butterfly watched over the frog and soon enough, the frog felt better. The frog thanked the butterfly and they both hopped off into the sunshine.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily was very restless. She loved to dance and sing all day long. One day, Lily heard that there would be a big show on the stage in the park. She wanted to be a part of it.Lily practiced her dance for the show. She was so excited. On the day of the show, Lily went to the stage. She saw a little bird stuck in a tree near the stage. The bird was scared and couldn't fly. Lily wanted to save the bird before her dance.Lily climbed the tree and saved the bird. The bird was so happy. Lily felt good about helping the bird. She then went on the stage and did her dance. Everyone clapped and cheered for her. Lily learned that it is important to help others and be kind. And that made her heart dance too.

Once upon a time, in a small farm, there lived a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat corn. One day, he saw a big, yellow corn in the field. He was very happy and wanted to eat it. But, he had to wait for his dad to pick it.Tim's friend, Sam, saw the big corn too. Sam was jealous because he wanted the corn for himself. He thought of a plan to get the corn. He said, "Tim, let's play a game. We can try to break the corn. If I break it, I get to keep it. If you break it, you get to keep it." Tim agreed to play the game.They both tried to break the corn. But, the corn was too strong. It did not break. Tim's dad saw them and said, "What are you doing, boys?" Tim and Sam told him about the game. Tim's dad laughed and said, "You can't break the corn like that. You have to wait for it to be ready. Then, we can all share it." Tim and Sam learned that being patient and sharing is better than being jealous and trying to break things. They waited for the corn to be ready, and when it was, they all enjoyed it together.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends. Their names were Sam and Max. Sam and Max did everything together. One day, Sam found an old, ugly machine. “Look at this weird machine" Sam said. “Let's see what it does!"Max laughed, “Let's try it!"So, Sam and Max set the machine up. They pushed the button and... it started to whir. Suddenly, a bright light shone from the machine. Sam and Max looked around and saw a bunch of colourful toys!“Wow! Look at all these toys!” Sam cheered.“The machine is so cool! Thank you for finding it, Sam.” Max smiled.The two friends played with the toys all day. What an amazing adventure!

Once upon a time, there was a noisy bird who loved to rock on a tree branch. He would rock back and forth all day long, singing loud songs. All the other animals in the forest would hear him and wonder what he was doing.One day, a big cat heard the noisy bird and wanted to catch him. The cat hid behind a bush and watched the bird rock on the tree branch. The cat thought to himself, "When the bird rocks closer, I will jump and catch him."The noisy bird saw the cat hiding and knew he had to escape. He thought of a plan. The next time he rocked towards the cat, he quickly flew up into the sky. The cat jumped, but the bird was already gone. The cat missed and fell into the bush.The noisy bird was safe and could rock on his tree branch again. The other animals in the forest were happy that their friend had escaped the big cat. They all cheered and celebrated the bird's smart thinking. From that day on, they all knew that the noisy bird was not just loud, but also very clever.

Once upon a time, there was a clown named Bobo. Bobo loved to make people laugh and smile. He had a big red nose, funny clothes, and big shoes. Bobo was a very good clown.One day, Bobo wanted to buy a toy for his friend, Timmy. Timmy was a little boy who lived in the town. Bobo went to the toy store and saw a dangerous toy. It was a toy with sharp edges that could hurt someone. Bobo knew that it was not safe for Timmy to play with.Instead, Bobo bought a soft, safe toy for Timmy. When he gave the toy to Timmy, they both played and laughed together. Everyone in the town was happy because Bobo made a good choice. The moral of the story is to always choose safe toys and think about the safety of others.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim went for a walk in the woods. He saw a big tree with sweet red apples on it. Tim wanted to eat the apples, but he was too short to reach them.Tim saw a tall man near the tree. He asked the man, "Can you help me get the apples?" The man said, "Yes, I will help you." The man picked some apples and gave them to Tim. Tim was very happy.But when Tim took a bite of the apple, it was not sweet at all. The apple was very bad and made Tim feel sick. Tim was sad and went home. The man was not a good helper after all.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Jane and Andrew. Andrew wanted to complete a project, so he asked Jane for help."Please Jane, can you help me to complete the project?" said Andrew.Jane replied, "Of course I can! What do you need?""I need some wine," said Andrew."I'm afraid I don't have any available," said Jane."No problem, I'll go and get some," said Andrew. He quickly ran to the store and bought some delicious wine. When he returned, he and Jane were able to complete their project. They worked together happily until the project was done. It was a great success! At the end of the day, Jane thanked Andrew for his help. She also gave him a gift of a bottle of wine to say thanks. "Thank you so much! I really appreciate your help," said Andrew. He and Jane shared a hug, and then went their separate ways, feeling proud of what they had accomplished.

Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named Zigzag. Zigzag loved to play with his best friend, a little boy named Tim. They would run and jump all day long.One day, Tim and Zigzag went to the park. They played hide and seek. Tim hid behind a big tree, and Zigzag tried to find him. Zigzag looked and looked, but he could not find Tim. Zigzag was sad.Zigzag heard a loud noise and ran to see what it was. He saw a big truck and barked at it. The truck driver asked, "Is this your home?" Zigzag did not know how to reply, so he just barked again. The truck driver took Zigzag away, and he never saw Tim again.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park to play. He saw a big black ball on the grass. Tim decided to roll the ball around the park. As he rolled the ball, he saw his friend, Sue."Look, Sue! I found a big black ball!" Tim said. Sue came closer to see the ball. "Wow, it's so big!" Sue said. They both played with the ball, rolling it back and forth to each other.After playing for a while, they found a shiny medal on the ground. The medal had a picture of a ball on it. Tim and Sue were very happy. They had so much fun playing with the big black ball and finding the special medal. They knew it was a day they would always remember.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. The sun was shining and it was a nice day. Tim saw a big tree with lots of leaves. He wanted to make a picture with the leaves.Tim picked up a leaf that was sharp. It hurt his hand a little. He found another leaf that was dull. This leaf did not hurt him. Tim was happy with the dull leaf.Tim took the leaves home and showed his mom. She helped him make a picture with the leaves. Tim liked the dull leaf more than the sharp leaf because it was safe. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He lived in a small house near a modern road. One day, Tim went for a walk with his mom. They saw a lot of cars on the road. Tim liked to watch the cars go by.While they were walking, Tim saw a small bug. He wanted to pick it up, but his mom said, "No, Tim. Don't pinch the bug. It will be sad." Tim looked at the bug and said, "Sorry, bug. I will not pinch you."As they walked back home, Tim saw his friend, Sam. Sam was playing with a toy car. Tim asked, "Can I play with you, Sam?" Sam said, "Yes, let's play together!" They played with the toy car and had lots of fun.At the end of the day, Tim learned that it is important to be kind to all living things, big or small. He also learned that playing with friends is more fun than pinching bugs. Tim's mom was happy that he learned this lesson, and they went home with a smile.

Once upon a time, there was a little insect named Izzy. Izzy liked to read books all day long. She had many books with big pictures and fun words.One sunny day, Izzy was reading a book under a big tree. She was very alert and looked at the pictures carefully. She saw a picture of a big, red ball and a happy dog playing with it.As Izzy read, a friendly bird flew by and saw her reading. The bird liked to read too, so they sat under the tree and read together. They looked at the pictures and said the words out loud.They read and read until the sun went down. Izzy and the bird became best friends. From that day on, they always read books together and had lots of fun.

One day, a little boy named Tim was very enthusiastic about his new toy. It was a big, red ball with a label on it. The label had a picture of a happy dog. Tim loved to play with his new ball in the yard.Tim's dog, Spot, saw the ball and wanted to play too. Spot ran up to the ball and said, "Woof! Can I play with you and your ball, Tim?" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, Spot! Let's play together!" They both played happily, throwing and catching the ball in the sun.But then, Spot got too excited and bit the ball. The ball popped, and the label flew off. Tim was sad and said, "Oh no, Spot! You bit my ball!" Spot felt sorry and said, "I'm sorry, Tim. I didn't mean to bite it." Tim hugged Spot and said, "It's okay, we can get a new ball and play together again!" And they continued to play in the yard, happy and full of fun.

One day, a cute little dog named Max went for a walk. He saw his friend, a small cat named Lily. Lily was looking at the dark sky. Max asked, "Why are you looking up, Lily?"Lily said, "I think rain is coming. I don't like rain." Max wanted to help Lily feel better. He said, "Let's join under that big tree. It will keep us dry."As they walked to the tree, something unexpected happened. The rain began to fall, but it was not normal rain. It was colorful rain! The rain was red, blue, yellow, and green. Max and Lily looked at each other and laughed. They played under the colorful rain and had a lot of fun. From that day on, Lily loved the rain, and they both hoped for more colorful rain days.

George and his mom were walking in the park.George asked his mom, "What do you see?"His mum smiled and said, "I see a big cross in the distance."George was excited. He asked—"Can we go see it?"His mom said, "Yes, we can go, but first let's have a picnic!"They spread out a blanket and sat down to eat. After they finished, they continued their walk. The closer they came to the cross, the more George wanted to run ahead, but his mom said, "Wait, there's a promise to keep."When they finally arrived at the cross, it was even bigger and more grand than they thought.George asked, "What is this, mom?"She said, "It's a monument. People built it to remind us to keep our promises."George said, "You said we'd come here, and we did. That was a great promise!" His mom smiled and replied, "Yes, it was."

Once there was a little boy called James who was very excited for an adventure. He grabbed his special blue jacket, put it on and skipped away. As he skipped around the corner, he heard someone call for help. It was an old man who had lost his way.James knew he had to help the old man, but he was also careful. He made sure to take a safe path so that he could help the old man and still stay safe. He skipped until he found the old man. Together they made their way back to the old man’s house and the old man thanked James for his help.The moral of this story is to be kind and helpful, but also to be careful when we help others. We should always remember to stay safe when we help people.

One day, a bright bird with many pretty feathers lived in a big tree. The bird loved to fly high in the sky and sing happy songs. The bird had many friends in the forest.A mean boy with a toy that could shoot lived near the forest. The boy liked to make the animals scared. One day, the boy saw the bright bird and wanted to shoot it with his toy. The bird was scared and did not want to lose its pretty feathers.The bird had an idea. It told all its friends in the forest about the mean boy. The animals made a plan to stop the boy from shooting. They hid the boy's toy when he was not looking. The boy was sad and could not shoot anymore. The bright bird and its friends were happy and safe again.

Once upon a time, there was an intelligent dog named Toby. He lived in a big house with his family. Toby loved to help his family with chores.One day, Toby saw his mom put dirty plates in the dishwasher. He wanted to help her. So, he learned how to get the dirty plates and put them in the dishwasher too.Toby's family was so happy that he could help. They gave him a big treat for being such a good and intelligent dog. From that day on, Toby always helped with the dishwasher, and his family loved him even more.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a curious little squirrel named Sam. Sam loved to perform tricks for his friends. He would jump from log to log and make everyone laugh.One day, Sam found a very big log. He was so excited to perform a new trick on it. But the log was not like the others. It moved a little when Sam jumped on it. His friends were scared and told Sam to stop, but Sam did not listen.As Sam kept performing, the big log suddenly opened its eyes! It was not a log at all, but a big sleeping snake! Sam was so surprised and jumped off quickly. The snake was not angry, but Sam learned to be more careful. The moral of the story is to always listen to your friends when they try to help you.

Daniel was a little boy who loved adventures. He especially loved the snow and one day he ventured out into the incredible blustery cold. His mitten kept him warm and cozy in the snow, but then something unexpected happened.Daniel found a bundle of something wrapped in a big bag. What could it be? He was excited and tried to open the bag, but it wouldn't budge. No matter how hard he tried, the bag wouldn't open.Daniel was stuck. Then he had an idea. He tried to wrap the mitten around the bag. He held it tight, and.... the bag popped open! Daniel was surprised with his success. He opened the bag and found something incredible: an exciting spiral slide!Daniel was overjoyed, and he couldn't wait to take a spin down the slide. His infinite curiosity and incredible mitten had solved the mystery of the wrapped bundle. He was so proud of himself and had a blast!

Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Tom. Tom liked to sleep all day and play all night. He lived in a small house with a girl named Lucy.One sunny day, Lucy wanted to make a cake. She asked Tom, "Will you help me make the cake?" Tom looked at her and said, "Okay, but only if I can sleep after." Lucy agreed and they started to make the cake.Lucy needed a teaspoon to measure the sugar. She looked everywhere but could not find it. She asked Tom, "Can you help me find the teaspoon?" Tom looked around and saw the teaspoon under the table. He said, "Here it is, Lucy!" They put the sugar in the cake and finished making it. Tom was happy to help and went back to sleep.

Once upon a time, there was a pink cat. The cat loved to deliver things to her friends. One day, the cat had a big box of spaghetti.The cat went to her friend's house. She knocked on the door. Her friend, a blue dog, opened the door. The pink cat gave the spaghetti to the blue dog. The blue dog was very happy.The pink cat and the blue dog sat down to eat the spaghetti. They laughed and talked. They had a fun time eating the spaghetti together. And from that day on, they were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, in a small garden, there lived a friendly spike. Spike was a reliable friend to all the plants and animals. He always helped them when they needed it.One day, two flowers got stuck together. They could not separate from each other. The flowers were sad and asked Spike for help. Spike knew just what to do. He used his pointy end to gently separate the flowers.The flowers were so happy that they could be apart again. They thanked Spike for being such a reliable friend. From that day on, all the plants and animals in the garden knew they could count on Spike to help them when they needed it. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a pirate named Tom. Tom was a dependable pirate. He always helped his friends. One day, Tom and his friends went on a big ship to find treasure.On the ship, Tom's friend Sam said, "I am tired. Let's sit and rest." So, Tom and Sam sat down. While they sat, they saw a map. The map showed where the treasure was. They knew they had to get the treasure.Tom, Sam, and their friends went to find the treasure. They followed the map. They knew they were close. Finally, they found the treasure chest. Tom said, "We did it! We found the treasure!" They were all very happy.

One day, a quiet girl named Sally was playing with her toy missile. She liked to act like it could fly through the sky. Her friend, Tim, saw her and wanted to play too."Can I play with you?" Tim asked. Sally said, "Yes, but we must be quiet. My baby sister is sleeping." They played with the toy missile, acting like it was flying high in the sky.As they played, the missile flew too high and hit a big tree. The tree shook and a bird's nest fell down. The baby birds were scared, but Sally and Tim helped them. They put the nest back in the tree and the birds were happy. Sally and Tim learned that being quiet and careful is important when playing near others.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to study a lot. She had a small notebook where she wrote everything she learned. Lily always held her notebook tight, so she would not lose it.One day, Lily was studying under a big tree. She put her notebook down for a moment to look at a pretty flower. When she looked back, her notebook was gone! Lily was very sad and did not know what to do.Then, a friendly squirrel came by with her notebook in its mouth. The squirrel had thought it was a nut! Lily was so happy to have her notebook back. She thanked the squirrel and they became best friends. From that day on, they studied together under the big tree.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big cross on the grass. It is wide and brown. They wonder what it is for.They run to the cross and touch it. It is hard and rough. They see some holes on it. They think they can put things in the holes. They look around and find some sticks and stones and flowers.They put the sticks and stones and flowers in the holes. They make a pattern. They are happy. They think the cross is pretty now. They smile and hug.But then, they hear a loud voice. It is the gardener. He is angry. He says the cross is his. He says he needs it for his work. He says they have to take out the things they put in the holes.Lily and Tom are scared. They say they are sorry. They take out the things they put in the holes. They give them back to the gardener. They say they will not do it again.The gardener is still angry. But he sees they are sorry. He says they can play in the park. But he says they have to be careful. He says they have to ask before they touch things. He says they have to respect his work.Lily and Tom say they understand. They say they will be careful. They say they will respect his work. They say thank you and goodbye. They run away from the cross. They look for another place to play. They hope they will not make the gardener angry again.

Once upon a time, there was a very special family. They were different from all the other families because they loved to play a very special game.The family gathered around the big table and Dad said, "Let's play a game! We'll use a bow and see who can get the highest score."Mum nodded and said, "You can use this spicy bow. You'll need to be really careful when you shoot."So the family began to play the game and everyone laughed and cheered as everyone tried their best. As the game progressed, Dad was sure that he had won, with a very high score.But suddenly, young Sarah who was just three years old, stepped up with her little bow. She took careful aim and let the arrow fly. The arrow missed the targets and instead wrapped around the top scoring target.Everyone was in shock and no one could believe what they had seen. With the top scoring target conquered, Sarah had taken first place. "Well done Sarah!" Dad said, giving her a big hug. The family was so proud of Sarah and knew that she would become a champion bow shooter.

Once upon a time, in a hot and sunny land, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to sail on the big blue sea. He had a small boat, and he would sail far away to find wonder in the world.One day, Tom met a girl named Lily. Lily also liked to sail. Tom asked Lily, "Do you want to sail with me? We can find wonder together." Lily said, "Yes, I would like that. Let's go sail and find wonder."So, Tom and Lily sailed together on the hot day. They saw big fish, pretty birds, and a beautiful island. They found wonder in the world and were happy. And from that day on, they always sailed together, finding more and more wonder in the big blue sea.

Once there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to store his toys in a big box. He had a toy car, a toy dog, and a toy ball. Tom was proud of his toys.One day, Tom's friend, Sam, came to play. They played a game. The winner would get a new toy. Tom wanted to win, so he tried very hard. He thought about how happy he would be with a new toy.But, Sam was very good at the game. Sam won the game and got the new toy. Tom was sad. He looked at his toys and knew he did not win. Tom's mom said, "It's okay, Tom. You can still be proud of the toys you have." But Tom was still sad because he did not win.

Once upon a time, in a big garden, there was a little herb. It was green and fragile. It lived with other plants and flowers. They were all happy and liked to play together.One day, a big flower said to the little herb, "You are too small and weak. You will never bloom like us." The little herb was sad but it did not give up. It tried very hard to grow big and strong.After some days, the little herb started to bloom. It had pretty flowers on it. All the other plants and flowers were surprised. They learned that even small and fragile things can grow and bloom if they try hard. The moral of the story is to never give up and always believe in yourself.

Once upon a time, there was a mop named Mimi. Mimi was very anxious because she wanted to be useful. She lived in a small house with a kind lady named Sue. Sue knew that Mimi was anxious, so she talked to her."Hi Mimi, don't be sad. I need your help to clean the floor," said Sue. Mimi was so happy that she could help. She cleaned the floor very well and made Sue happy too.That night, Mimi had a dream. In her dream, she was a superhero mop. She flew around the world, cleaning up dirt and messes everywhere. Mimi was not anxious anymore. She knew that she was important and helpful. The next day, Mimi told Sue about her dream. Sue laughed and said, "You are my superhero mop, Mimi. Thank you for keeping our home clean."From that day on, Mimi was never anxious again. She knew that she was a superhero mop in Sue's heart, and she was happy to help clean the house every day.

Once upon a time there lived a lonely spider. She lived in a dark corner of a small room and spun her cobwebs there every day. But no one ever visited her. Even the bugs and other spiders she spun webs to catch would hurry away as soon as they saw her. She was very lonely.One night she heard a whisper. It was coming from the corner of the room. She quickly spun a web over that corner, trapping whatever was there.The next morning she found a tiny mouse inside the web. She was so excited to have a friend that she couldn't help but whisper a thank you.The mouse was so happy to have found a friend, too. Every day the spider and mouse would chat together and play games together. The spider no longer felt lonely.The mouse soon showed its other friends the cobweb and they all came to play with the spider. Now the spider had lots of friends and was never lonely again.

Bob was feeling very sad. He was taking a walk in the park, looking at the flowers and trees, but nothing made him feel better. As he continued his walk, he saw a pond. In the pond he could see some fish happily swimming around, but he felt too quiet to talk to them. Suddenly, Bob saw something unusual: a small bird was sitting by the edge of the pond, just looking at him. He didn’t know what to do, but he stayed still and gave the bird some space.The bird then started to display its wings, flapping them up and down. Bob was amazed, he had never seen anything like it before. Suddenly he felt a bit less sad and he started smiling. The bird looked at Bob and said in a small voice, “Don’t be sad. You can be happy – just like me!” Bob thanked the bird and the two spent some time talking about their adventures. When it was time for the small bird to go, Bob said goodbye and waved, feeling much happier.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his football. He played with his friends every day. They were very competitive and wanted to win. But sometimes, Tim would worry if he could play well.One sunny day, Tim and his friends were playing with the football. They were having so much fun. Then, something unexpected happened. A big dog came and took the football away. The dog ran very fast. Tim and his friends were sad and worried.But then, the dog came back with the football. The dog wanted to play too! Tim and his friends were happy again. They all played together and had lots of fun. They did not worry about winning anymore. They just enjoyed playing with the football and their new friend, the big dog.

One day, a cat named Tom went to the shop. He wanted to choose a yummy thing to eat. He saw a big, red steak. Tom was very glad because he loved steak.Tom took the steak home. He put it on a plate and sat down to eat. But then, his friend, a dog named Max, came in. Max saw the steak and his eyes got big. He wanted to eat it too.Tom didn't want to be mean, so he cut the steak in two. He gave one part to Max and kept the other part for himself. They both ate the steak and were very happy. They were glad to share and be good friends.

Tom and Sue went to the park with Mom. They saw many animals there. They saw ducks, rabbits, squirrels and deer. Tom and Sue liked the deer best. They wanted to feed them some bread."Can we give them some bread, Mom?" Tom asked."No, you can't," Mom said. "The deer don't eat bread. It is bad for them. They eat grass and leaves. You can look at them, but don't touch them or feed them."Tom and Sue were sad. They wanted to be friends with the deer. They saw a deer with big horns. He looked smart and strong. He came close to the fence."Look, Mom, he wants some bread!" Sue said.She took a piece of bread from her bag and threw it to the deer. The deer sniffed the bread. He did not eat it. He refused it. He shook his head and walked away."Why did he do that?" Sue asked."He is a smart deer," Mom said. "He knows what is good for him and what is not. He does not want to eat something that can make him sick. He listens to his body and his instincts. He is a good example for us."Tom and Sue learned a lesson. They understood that they should not feed the animals what they like, but what they need. They also understood that they should listen to their mom and to their own bodies. They decided to be smart like the deer. They put the bread back in their bag and ate some fruits instead. They enjoyed watching the deer and the other animals. They had a fun and healthy day at the park.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the lake with his dad. They took a kayak to have fun. Tim was so happy. They put the kayak in the water and got in.Tim and his dad paddled the kayak. They saw a big fish. The fish jumped out of the water. "Wow, Dad! Look at the fish!" Tim said. His dad smiled and said, "Yes, it's a big one!"They went further into the lake. The wind blew strong. They started to struggle. Tim's dad said, "Let's use the useful paddle to go back." Tim and his dad paddled hard to go back to the shore.At the end of the day, Tim and his dad were tired but happy. They had a great time in the kayak. They went home and told mom all about their fun day at the lake.

Once upon a time, there was a weak little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy called Laser. Laser was a toy robot. Tim loved to play with Laser every day.One day, Tim and Laser were playing in the park. Laser could blink with its eyes. Tim said, "Laser, let's play hide and seek!" Laser blinked and said, "Okay, Tim!" So they played hide and seek together.While playing, Tim saw a girl who was sad. Tim and Laser went to her. Tim asked, "Why are you sad?" The girl said, "I lost my toy." Tim and Laser helped her find her toy. The girl was happy and said, "Thank you, Tim and Laser!" They all played together and had fun.Moral: Always help others when they need it.

Once upon a time, there lived a little boy called Tommy. Tommy was three years old and always wanted to find shells at the beach.One sunny day, Tommy went to the beach with his mommy. He looked around and saw lots of shells in the sand, so he started to pick them up. Tommy's mommy said, "Be careful, Tommy! You must only pick up shells that are available. If you don't I will have to punish you."Tommy nodded and tried to be careful. He picked up lots of different shells and put them in his bucket. But then, he noticed a really, really big shell and just had to pick it up. He knew his mommy wouldn't want him to do it, but he did it anyway.When he picked it up, he noticed it was stuck in the sand. He tried his best to loosen it, but it didn't come out.Tommy's mommy saw him and said, "Oh no, Tommy! You must listen when I tell you something. I said to pick up only shells that are available. Now I am afraid I will have to punish you."Tommy was very sorry and he promised himself that he would always listen to his mommy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Anna. Anna was very cute, with big beautiful eyes and an adorable smile. One day, her parents took her to the park to play. Everywhere she looked, Anna saw things that made her want to jump.She saw a big, fluffy tire and she wanted to jump into it like a bouncy castle. She asked her parents if she could jump into the tire, and they said she could if she promised to be careful.Anna was so excited that she jumped into the tire, but she jumped too high and landed on the ground. She hurt her ankle and started to cry.Anna's parents came running over to her and said, "See, Anna? We told you to be careful and now you hurt yourself. Next time, be more careful, OK?"Anna nodded and said, "Yes, I'll be careful. Jumping is fun, but it can be dangerous if we're not careful." All of Anna's parents were glad that she had learned an important lesson in being careful and they took her home. From then on, Anna always remembered to be careful every time she wanted to jump in the tireThe moral of the story is that it is important to be careful when playing and having fun, so that no one gets hurt.

Once there was a boy named Tim. He had a toy cooler. He loved to play with it. One day, he saw a girl named Sue. Sue was sad because she lost her toy. Tim thought it was stupid to cry over a toy.Tim wanted to help Sue, so he shared his cooler. They played together and had fun. Sue stopped crying and smiled. Tim felt happy too.In the end, Tim learned that being kind and sharing was better than being mean. He was glad that he helped Sue. Now, they were both happy and became good friends. The moral of the story is to always be kind and share with others.

Once upon a time there was a naughty mouse. He was always causing trouble in the house. One day, the mouse saw a bowl of spaghetti on the kitchen table. He reached for it, but the bowl was too high for him to get to.He ran to find a way to reach the spaghetti. He found a tall chair and tried to get on it. But he was too small! He tried to climb the table, but that didn't work either.Frustrated, the naughty mouse started to cry. Then he heard a noise. It was the kind voice of his mother. She said, “Don’t be naughty and always remember to behave. Then you’ll be able to reach the things you want.”The mouse thought about what his mother said and he felt better. He remembered that he needed to be nice and kind if he wanted to get what he wanted. And he remembered to never be naughty again.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went for a walk in the park. She saw a small, persistent ant trying to carry a big leaf. Lucy looked at the ant and said, "Wow, you are very hard-working!"As she walked, Lucy noticed a tiny door under a big tree. She opened the door and found a secret room. Inside the room were many toys and games. Lucy was so happy and said, "This is the best day ever!"Then, Lucy heard a voice. It was the ant from before. The ant said, "This is my secret room, but I will share it with you if you promise to be my friend." Lucy was surprised but agreed to be friends with the ant. They played together in the secret room and had a lot of fun.
